description:
Sweetie came into a Texas shelter as a stray. A volunteer immediately fell in love with her and knew this girl is really special. This is what she has to say about Sweetie: âSweetie absolutely radiates love. I started going to visit the shelter dogs in April of this year. In 8 months of visiting dogs on the weekend, I have never met one who has such an immediate calming effect. It is hard to put into words, but she immediately made me feel an overwhelming sense of peace and love. I am very determined to save this girl and believe she has very important work to do in this world. We will all be better off for helping this girl get out of the shelter, trust me.â

There was no way we could let a dog like Sweetie die! Sweetie loves everyone she meets and wants to be touching her person at all times. She quickly became a foster favorite as well. She is super easy, and she's house trained and crate trained. She is great with kids and other dogs. She likes to play with her ball . She knows how to use the doggy door. She had rather be with her person or as close as she can get! To know Sweetie is to love her !

Apply to adopt SWEETIE DAVIS LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!
name: Sweetie Davis Lonestar

description:
Meet Jimmy! He is a beautiful boy inside and out. This 3 year old bully mix is so fun and full of love! He is good dogs, cats, and kids! The only thing he lacks is basic obedience. He is a quick learner who loves to please his person. He is house broken and crate trained. Only chews on his bones  which he LOVES. If you would like to meet Jimmy, please fill out our online adoption application: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSftnYfej0sD5YBq6NfW_bV4VvpZh9StksaZPH4XkxxUTyySkg/viewform
RR231
#CALLMEBLEU
name: JImmy

description:
Buddy is looking for a new best friend to explore life with! Buddy is stressed inside the kennel, but in his foster home was a very well behaved boy; to see him at his best, please spend some time with him in our outside play area. Buddy was housebroken and got along with all people, but would prefer to be the only pet in his forever home!

The best way to find your perfect match is to visit the shelter and meet the dog in person and speak with one of our adoption counselors. Adoption applications are only processed after you've met the dog. The shelter is open Wednesday thru Friday from 1 to 7pm and Saturday from noon to 5pm. Please visit

www.faithfulfriends.us/
adoption-process
for more information. Email adoptadog@faithfulfriends.

us with any questions.
name: Buddy

description:
Friendly and a lot of puppy energy
We are still learning Maggie's behaviors, so we do not know if she is good with other dogs or cats.
She does appear to be good with children, but due to her high energy would not recommend for small children.
name: Maggie

description:
Rambo, always up for an adventure! This young handsome boy is high energy and packed full of action! The things he loves doing the most with his favorite people are running through the play yard and getting a little messy. He loves to play ball. He's the perfect fit for an active family with older children who can give him the play time and exercise he needs! Who knows will be more worn out, you or Rambo! Rambo is about two years old and came from the south. 

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***


Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Rambo

description:
Why should you love Angus?  Let us count the ways!  Gus is a 7-8yrs young oddball who's always happy to be going wherever he's going - wherever that may be!  He looooves to meet people along the way when he's not busy pouncing on leaves as they blow across the sidewalk.  Despite being a rickety old man, he has a playful pep in his step that inspires all his fans to narrate his every move in a dopey voice to match his silly energy -- and on the flip side, he can be determinedly lazy for 15 hrs straight while he practices his most inventive napping positions!  In his past life, Gus lived harmoniously with another dog, a cat, and children, and he has met some new dog friends since.  And to top it all off, he has an endless repertoire of googly-eyed facial expressions and choral stylings that will keep you laughing!  

Angus is house-trained and well behaved when left alone in the house.  He is neutered, microchipped, vaccinated, and ready to find his special someone!  If you love to snuggle and have a sense of humor to match his, email adopt@rescuzillanyc.org and prepare for a warm welcome!

For more video of Gus in action, check out his Youtube channel:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=beS2-C2AQIs&list=PLvi_CzHeP7MYhXctrFcuLXEQnSVKtF9jq
name: Angus (Gus the Greatest!)

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This handsome guy is Sandy. Sandy is a one year old mixed breed boy who comes into rescue from Texas. He has had a very rough start to life and when we got to him he was missing most of his hair, and was covered in dirt and ticks from being outside on his own trying to fend for himself for so long. Now he is safe and getting all the medical care he needs with our vet partner. Soon he will be ready to join a forever family that can show him what the good life is like! He is a shy and scared little boy right now but we are working on showing him that there is nothing to fear anymore and we know soon he will realize that he is safe and doesnât have to worry anymore. Could you be the one that can give sweet Sandy the life full of unconditional love and happiness that he deserves? He is good with people of all ages and other dogs and will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Sandy the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.og
name: Sandy

description: IT'S THE BOXCAR CHILDREN!! (Boxer children) 4 adorable boxer mix pups coming to NYC soon!!! Meet Henry, Jessy, Violet and Benny! These 4 siblings entertain themselves by playing hard all day and sleeping all night!!! Foster or adopt these awesome pups!!!
name: Violet

description: Saving ONE animal won't change the world. But it will change the world for me. Ruff House Rescue "Goes Big" so more pets have a chance to go home. This means we are rescuing in areas that we can make the biggest lifesaving impact. While we continue to help our local dogs and families in NY wanting to surrender their pets we are compelled to help the animals most in need from the highest kill rate shelters in the country and the highest statistic for strays. Hundreds and thousands of highly adoptable puppies and dogs are killed daily. Therefore the majority of our pets come from these areas. This means the cost of rescue is higher due to the high costs of vetting, boarding, and transport. Please note our adoption fees vary and are the most reliable source of revenue enabling us to continue our rescue efforts. Your adoption fees directly contribute to the rescue of these animals. Please see our website for information and an application to adopt or foster or volunteer for RHR. Adoption fees vary from $250 to $500 which includes a pets spay/neuter - Micro-chipping - current vaccinations - heartworm testing. We ask that adopters submit applications in advance to help facilitate the adoption process. Please note while you may not be sure what pet you are interested in if any your application will help us find you the perfect match. Applications at Ruffhouserescue.org - *Please only submit an application if you are available immediately to adopt. Have a rental agreement to have a pet and all family members are ready to adopt. Thank you for thinking Adoption First!
name: Pipsqueak

description: Meet Velour. Rescued from a hoarding case along with her sisters, Satin and Silk, Velour is looking for her loving forever home. She is very still very scared and shy. She will need a very patient family who will help her come out of her shell, learn to walk on a leash, and be the best dog she can be. Velour will do best in a home with a secure, fenced in backyard where she can learn to run and play. Interested in adopting Velour? Please visit www.huskyhouse.org today to fill out an application.
name: Velour

description: DIANA is a 10 month old female pup! DIANA LOVES other dogs! She is sweet, playful & friendly!! Diana would do well with children (12+)! DIANA needs a FOSTER or ADOPTER to save her!! For more info or to FOSTER or ADOPT, call or text message 908-892-8166 or email HunterdonSomersetARC@gmail.com
name: DIANA

description: Hi there! I'm Candie and I am currently interviewing people to be part of my forever family! This is a very special position because whoever I choose will reap the benefits of a sweet, loving dog who is loyal and will love you forever! This person must enjoy strolls through the park and playtime. Those who bring me yummy treats will be instantly placed on the list of people I love. Please ask a staff member today if we can take some time to get to know one another!
name: Candie

May need surgical debridement and attempted closure vs. ongoing medical management/bandage changes. description:
No one came for him and he was still waiting when we learned he was scheduled to be euthanized that morning.   He was never given a name and the person who was going to adopt him wanted to wait until he was home and then would be named.  That never happened.  When we learned he was headed to be put down we asked the lady who was picking up other shelter dogs for us to swing by and get him to.   

This sweet "unwanted" young boy is friendly, well mannered and playful.  He's been fully evaluated by our trainer and the written report can be found on his Facebook page at:
A rescue's journey- Meet Buddy

Buddy is around 1 and a half years old and weighs in at 41lbs.  He's been fully vetted, neutered, microchipped and is heart worm negative and one preventative.  He's been fully quarantined the two weeks since rescue and is ready to be transported to an approved adopter.

This handsome boy comes with a warranty as our adoption contract provides for a good fit with all our adoptions.   To fill out an online application for Buddy go to:
http://www.diamonddogsrescueinc.com/online-adoption-application.html
name: Buddy

description:
Patrick is currently in foster. If you would like to meet Patrick please contact us at foster@nyanimalrescue.org

Patrick is our 7 year old Maltese mix......Patrick is not a fan of new people and needs someone that will be willing to work slowly with him to gain his trust. Patrick will only be adopted out to an experienced dog owner who understands and will work with these issues. Patrick loves snuggling with his foster mom which showed us that he can trust and love with time and patience. He also loves going out for walks and playing on the beach. Patrick gets along with cats and other small dogs. 

Patrick is neutered, dewormed and is up to date with vaccinations. His adoption fee is $300.00, plus $8.50 for the dog license if you are a resident of NYC. He will get one free exam at our vet's office, one free month of pet health insurance and he is microchipped. 

If you'd like to meet Patrick please email us at foster@nyanimalrescue.org

Sean Casey Animal Rescue
153 E. 3 St.
Brooklyn, NY 11218 
www.nyanimalrescue.org
NYS Department of Agriculture and Markets Registration No. RR160
name: Patrick

description: If you're into big, mushy hugs , then look no further, Carter gives the best hugs. Rest assured, he means no harm when he runs and jumps on you. He is actually quite gentle and doing nothing other than expressing his love for you. At 2 years old, Carter was found as a stray, therefore we don't know much about his past. But we see a bright future ahead of him. Affectionate and well-behaved, this chilled out dude is quite mellow for his age. He's looking for a family that will give him as much love, maybe even more, as he's willing to give.
name: Carter

description:
Please note that the pups that you see in these pictures have been adopted. However we regularly rescue pups like these from India who are available for adoption in the US. We are looking for fosters or volunteers in New Jersey for our IN pups/dogs rescued from the streets of India. We need committed foster homes for our pups who will take care of them when they are in the U.S. till a forever home is found. We are also looking for volunteers who is willing to fly with the dogs. It is extremely expensive to fly the dogs solo from India to the U.S; however it is lot cheaper if you are flying with the dogs. If you are visiting Delhi (where we have foster homes) or surrounding cities in India and would like to help us rescue a pup or two from the streets by flying them with you back home to the U.S. please contact us. Please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com for more information. More Information: Desi (Local) or IN (Indian Native) or Pariah Dog is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. Its truly a pure breed whose origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years â older than any other breed 
We are very proud to be a Rescue without borders. So, what does it mean to be a rescue without borders? In the last 18 months we were able to rescue, rehabilitate and find homes for over 90 IN dogs in the U.S. and Canada. We rescue and adopt within the U.S. irrespective of state borders, but now you may be wondering, why India? Typically in India, dogs that are born on the streets are not kept as family pets. Most people cannot afford to keep a dog as a pet and those who do prefer a western breed as a status symbol. So these street dogs spend their entire lives on the streets in deplorable conditions. Most of the pups that are born on the streets will get killed by passing cars, or die of starvation or malnutrition. These dogs/ pups often become victims of cruelty as some people resort to cruel measures to get rid of them from their streets. The average life span of a dog living on the streets of India is 3 years during which time they continue to live starving miserable life full of abuse and suffering; however when these same dogs when given a chance to live in a home as family pets will live a healthy life of up to 16-18 years. That is why we rescue these dogs to give them an opportunity to be a part of a family and to live their life in a comfort and safety of a loving home. 
Please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com for more information.
Check out our Rescue's Face book page to see our IN Dogs adopted all over North America. http://www.facebook.com/RescueWithoutBorders
More Info on this breed --- Desi (Local) or IN (Indian Native) or Pariah Dog is a pure, ancient, indigenous dog of India that abounds the Indian streets. A long time ago, and thousands of years before the arrival of modern pure breeds, a race of dogs much like this one inhabited the Indian subcontinent. These were the very first domestic dogs and Man's earliest animal companions. It has evolved entirely through natural selection without human intervention of any kind resulting into a very hardy, extremely intelligent, alert and independent thinking dog. 
This is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. These dogs are found to be genetically healthy with no known genetic diseases and a very strong immune system. This is a natural breed of dog that is pure in a true sense and is how nature intended a dog to be; hence they are way superior to the artificially developed man made breeds that we call pure breeds today. Its origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years â older than any other breed. They are perfectly adapted for survival; a free-roaming life on the street for these dogs is always difficult and often hostile and hence requires high order of intelligence, quick and independent thinking to survive. On the streets it is the survival of the fittest, usually out of a litter some will get run over by cars while others will succumb to hunger and malnutrition. Only the most hardiest and intelligent ones will survive to produce off springs. When this survivor is adopted as a Pet, their owners are often awe struck with their beauty, grace, intelligence, loyalty and hardiness. 
They are highly adaptable, quick learners and versatile and are known to be even smarter and definitely calmer than the intelligent Border Collies. They are very agile and excel at many dog sports such as agility and also make great jogging/running companions and can be even faster than Grey Hounds. While active outdoors, they are usually very calm and quiet indoors. They have tremendous stamina and hence need an active family who will take them for a daily brisk walks or a run. 
INDogs dogs are sensitive by nature and do not respond well to harsh training methods and hence need an even tempered, gentle but firm and loving owner who knows how to calmly and consistently communicate the rules of the house.  These dogs love children and are known to have a calm and gentle demeanor around them. They bond strongly with their people and make an excellent family pet that is very loving, loyal and intelligent. These dogs do not bark much but are always alert; they are friendly yet wary of strangers and make good watch dogs. 
Desi dogs are low maintenance dog as they are generally very healthy and like to stay clean; they hardly shed and have virtually no doggy odor. Their smooth, fine short hair coat is easy to groom. They have an all weather coat that allows them to easily adapt to different weather conditions.  A well-looked after pet IN dog will rarely need to see a vet and may live a healthy life of up to the age of 12 â 16 years. This is a medium size dog with an average height of 20-25 inches (51-64 cms) at the shoulder and generally weight about 28-50 pounds (12 â 22 kgs). With pointed ears, a wedge-shaped head and a tail that curls over its back, an IN Dog is similar in appearance to other prehistoric dogs like the Australian dingo.
Please visit the following website to get more info on this breed- http://indog.co.in/ http://indianpariahdog.blogspot.in/search/label/aboriginal%20dogs http://www.dogbreedinfo.com/pariahdog.htm 
Â
name: Volunteers needed for dogs rescued from India

description: Athena is an enthusiastic friend and happy companion. She kisses quickly and wags her big ol' bootie to tell you how much she loves you. She prefers activities that would be considered sedentary.....knitting (you, not her!!) Athena can't knit, she doesn't have thumbs. She can be the cheerleader for all your knitting projects. Athena is a good walking companion. She truly excels at napping assistant. She will sleep on your feet so they never get cold!
name: Athena

description:
Meet "Ollie" a 1 year old male Hound mix. He is a sweetheart and adores the company of other dogs. He even gives kisses to his Arkansas siblings. He would do well with a family to give him exercise and a doggy sibling. He is good with cats and rides well in a car. "Ollie" is neutered and up to date with all vaccinations and micro-chipped. There is a $200 donation. Come meet "Ollie" on Saturdays from 12noon to 3PM at the Charleston Staten Island PETCO, 2752 Veterans Road West next to Home Depot. We do not ship animals. We only adopt out to the tri-state area. Please e-mail us at plutorescue@aol.com for more information.

 If interested in adopting "Ollie" you can download the pre-adoption application at the link below.

http://members.petfinder.com/â¦/pluto%20dog%20adoption%20appâ¦
name: Ollie

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Malibu, born in late 2012, is a lab/chow mix with a great personality, mild energy and enjoys being close. She is leash trained and does well with basic commands. Malibu absolutely loves people and is extremely friendly. She does well on leash with other dogs. Off leash she is a bit reserved at first, taking her cues from the other dog, but quickly sniffs and accepts interaction with friendly dogs. If her new home has other dogs, she would do best with a well socialized male or a small pack of dogs her size. She's not a fan of small dogs or cats. She would love to go on walks and play in the yard with a family of her own! Malibu is spayed and up to date on vaccines. f you are interested in fostering or adopting Malibu, please fill out an application: www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Malibu

description: Jaxon is a great dog.  He is very low energy and people oriented.   He weighs over a 100 pounds now; He is housebroken and does not misbehave when left alone; When Jax was first rescued he had little if any fur and was a skeleton. His prior owner rarely fed him and also decided he would try some home remedies for a health issue which  nearly killed him.; He is very attached to people and will lean on you if you stand still - and with his size - he can knock you over. If you are interested in meeting Jax email for an application to email to tristateshepherdrescue@gmail.com.
name: Jaxon

description:
MEET PETER QUILL!

Come and Get Your Love with Peter Quill! Pete was picked up as a stray and brought to Philly animal control, but managed to dance his way out of the shelter and into our hearts at City of Elderly Love!

According to his foster mom, you would never know this cool dude is estimated to be ten years old. Heâs the perfect mix of playful and obedient. Pete loves being active by going on walks to meet neighbors but also appreciates the simpler moments in life, like a good nap on his favorite pillow (hint: itâs all of them). He is funny and clever and will do anything to get his paws on his favorite KONG toys. He especially loves when theyâre filled with Honey Nut Cheerios and cream cheese!

PQ thrives on routine and has been doing a great job learning rules and boundaries since being in foster. He just wants to be included in whatever youâre doing. Pete is 100% trainable so heâs looking for someone who is able to put in time, attention, love to make him to be the best boy he can be!

Peter Quill is available for adoption through City of Elderly Love. He is neutered, vaccinated and microchipped. He is also heartworm and lymes disease negative. Interested in adopting him? Visit www.cityofelderlylove.org to complete an online adoption questionnaire or email us at info@cityofelderlylove.org!
name: PETER QUILL!

description:
Age: 4Â Years old
Story: Poor Kota has beenÂ through a lot recently. First, he lost his owner when they passed away. His owner's parents took him in, but their dog began to fight with him and they had to find a friend to take him in to foster him.Â 
?
He has bounced around a great deal recently, but is still a sweet and kind dog who loves people. He is a purebred German Shepherd.Â After being picked on in the previous home, he is anxious around dogs, but he was dogÂ friendly before and with some time and patience could get along well with dogs again.Â 
?
For now we are looking for a home for himÂ as an only pet where he can finally have some stability and know he is finally home.
name: Kota

description:
Shane is a very young dog who loves everyone. He is a big puppy and loves playing with his toys or running in the yard.
Shane has not been exposed to cats so he is not sure what to do with them but he is not aggressive and because he is so young he can be easily trained to live with them. He is great with other dogs, well behaved on the leash and super cute.
Someone cropped his ears way too short, but he is still adorable with a super sweet face expression.
name: SHANE

description: Foster update: Virgil is a super sweet, curious, and calm pup. When he isn't napping, he loves to play with his lamby. He is already doing very well with weewee pad training and knows to sit for his treats! Virgil is a 10-week-old shepherd mix who is likely to be 50-60lbs fully grown. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Virgil

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Attention Beagle lovers! We sure do have a treat for you! Meet Princess! Princess is 2 years old, weighs 30 pounds, and comes into rescue from Texas. Can you believe this darling girl was abandoned at Pet Smart after her grooming appointment?! So here is what happened...Owners bring Princess to Pet Smart for a grooming appointment, they give a fake phone number and contact info and owners are never heard from again. Now Pet Smart has no choice but to call animal control to pick her up. Luckily one of our volunteers happens to hear about Princessâs dilemma and called us and asked if we could help. We of course said YES!! She is such a sweet and wonderful girl and we canât wrap our heads around someone ever wanting to let her go! She is fantastic with older kids, other dogs, and even cats! She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you are looking for a precious beagle companion then Princess is the one for you! To adopt Princess please fill out an application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Princess

description: If interested please call Gizela at 201-655-5059 for more information. Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days so call to see if the particular pet you are interested in will be at one of our locations or another time may be able to be arranged. Adoption fees apply and range but includes: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative, micro-chipping & registration. Angels For Animals Network adopts to loving, indoor homes. We DO NOT adopt to anyone under 21 without parental consent. Please note that we DO NOT ship animals, and only adopt to the Tri-State area and some parts of Pennsylvania.  We prefer to keep our adoptions local, and strive to find the best homes for our rescued friends.  Once we review your application, we can better access if a specific animal is well-suited for your home environment and your lifestyle.   ***WE ALWAYS NEED FOSTER HOMES***
name: Gaia

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sweet Vinny is a 1.5 year old Terrier mix who weighs 15 pounds. He comes into rescue from Texas where he has only known a life of suffering and neglect so far. Vinny was looking and feeling terrible when we got to him. He was suffering from a bad case of non contagious mange and his hair was almost all gone, his skin so raw and infected. Vinny will get all the medical treatment he needs with our vet partner and very soon he will be ready to join a forever family that can finally show him the meaning of love. This cutie pie deserves so much more than the life he has endured so far and we canât wait to give it to him! He is such a good boy and is friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Vinny (TX) the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Vinny (TX)

description: Clair is very sweet and loves people.  She came from rural Georgia where she was found as a stray.  We think Claire is 6-8 years old.  She would make an excellent companion for a retired person or a senior citizen as she is a very calm and well behaved dog.  Claire is spayed, current on vaccinations and ready to start a new life in the North.  If you are interested in adopting Claire please contact Peggy Stern at pmpstern@yahoo.com
name: Claire

description:
This sweet boy Clyde was found roaming around in the woods in upstate NY. This handsome fellow has an awesome personality and loves being around people. He is great with selective dogs but proper introductions a must. Clyde loves playing with his toys and lots of excercise but is not fond of the little kitties or small dogs. We suggest children over 10 years old since he is still working on basic manners. 

All adoptions include, age appropriate vaccines, spay/neuter, lifetime registred microchip.. 

Adoption Fees: $295

Transport $50 if required.
name: Clyde

description:
Howdy yâall! My nameâs Texas, and besides the name, I ainât got much in common with the Lone Star State!
The only things really big about me are my happiness and affection! Iâm the perfect medium size, and people often mistake me for a puppy because of my boyish looks ?? 
I am a staff and volunteer favorite to walk, to talk to, and to get and receive love from. I really am such a good boy! Iâve done well with some pups Iâve met here, but if youâre planning on adding me to your pack, a dog meet would be required. You should also know that I prefer to be in a home without cats. 
Iâm tired of being a Lone Heart Pup, and am ready to meet my forever family! Stop by today and meet me! Or share this post so another family can fall in love ?????
name: Texas

description:
Marco came to NorthStar Pet Rescue in October 2017. He is currently our longest resident in foster and although he loves his foster home, a foster home is not a forever home.

Marco is a Chihuahua/Dachshund mix (often called a "Chiweenie") and is about 1.5 years old and weighs 12 pounds. He is playful, housetrained, and gets along with small dogs and cats.

This boy is very smart and eager to please his person.

Marco may take some time to warm up to strangers and large dogs, but given an opportunity to get to know them on his timeline, his confidence builds and ultimately he is fine. We have also discovered that he warms up more quickly to men than to women. Marcoâs perfect home would be with a single guy who is willing to work with him and his insecurities. Donât be deterred ladies, Marco is currently living with two women and adores them, but for some reason he really enjoys the company of men!

Marco has completed four weeks of a âboard and trainâ program and anyone who adopts him would have access to those trainers.

Could you be "The Person" that Marco is looking for? Please give this little guy with the big personality a chance. He'll win you over - Guaranteed !!

APARTMENT APPROPRIATE.

If you think Marco is "the one" for you, please fill out an application at https://northstarpets.org and be sure
to mention his name, MARCO TEXAS!
name: A Chiweenie Looking for Love

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Rowdy, born in March 2016, is a 60-lb. male pit bull mix. This handsome boy has a medium energy level and so much love to offer if you would only give him the chance. He exhibits some anxieties when inside the home and would prefer to live in a quieter area. Rowdy absolutely loves being outside or going for car rides. He would make the perfect companion for someone who likes to hike/walk, but would also be just as happy to have a fenced-in yard where he can lay in the sun and chew on his favorite stick. He can be very playful. Rowdy is house trained, knows basic commands and he also walks really well on a leash. He's a smart guy who can pick up on tricks quickly and is highly treat motivated - especially for peanut butter. He has such a big heart but his rough past has made him leery of strangers. He needs an experienced owner who is patient and willing to work at his pace. Once you earn his trust, he is the biggest love bug who enjoys cuddling in bed and following you around the house. He just wants to be by your side. He has been around small children (under the age of 5), but never unsupervised. He shows a lot of playful interest in other dogs but has only had supervised play because he's a rough and tumble kind of guy. He might benefit greatly from having another dog in the home. Cats unknown.

If you would like to foster or adopt Buddy, please apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Rowdy

description:
Kebehut, or Kebe as we fondly call her, was the goddess of freshness and purification, known as the "wandering goddess" or the "lost child.â  She has the most expressive face and ears!  She was found lying in filth in an abandoned lot, all skin and bones.  We don't have much info other than she's extremely sweet despite everything and she LOVES to play in a yard w/ other dogs.  She is a little afraid of the city so maybe a suburban home would be more to her liking.  Due to lack of good nutrition as a young pup, she is going to stay small (25lbs).  We want to find a super loving home to make up for her recent past.  Please apply, app on our site to copy paste back to us.

Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly event posted here)
Twitter: zanisff 
Instagram: zanisfurryfriends

Please fill out an application http://zanisfurryfriends.org/applications.html and return via email to: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Sundays, and sometimes on Saturdays--please ask which dogs will be there ahead of time by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application by Friday so that we can be sure to be there.  Please come! And if you can't adopt, you can always donate via paypal to: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org

Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, you can always donate!
name: Kebe Egyptian Skinny Miss

description: Watson is a 3-4 mo old pit mix pup.  He is good with other dogs and kids.  For more info and an application please contact kris at kobemnstr@hotmail.com

description: Mialette is about 4 yrs old.  Loves hiking and playing.  She loves treats and is patiently waiting for her forever home.
name: Mialette

description: Ellis is a very sweet even tempered guy. He is about 14 months old and 11 pounds. Ellis walks nicely on leash, knows how to use a doggie dog and is crate trained. Ellis likes to play with toys and is very good at fetch and brings the ball back and lays it at your feet. Ellis is good with other dogs, but please no cats. As you can see from the video, Ellis likes to run and romp in the yard with another little dog. Another little dog or some kids would be perfect for Ellis to keep him active. True to his breed cuddling and sitting on your lap at the end of the day to watch Netflix would be in order. To adopt Ellis please fill out an application at http://www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html To be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.

description: Emmy Lou Harris has the best ears in the game and that's reason enough to take her home. She's sweet and friendly but sometimes a little shy. She loves people and dogs. To foster or adopt, apply at badassbk.com.
name: Emmy Lou Harris

description:
Available for adoption: Around September 2018
Rhonda was abandoned on the side of the road in Arkansas, skinny, dirty, and heartworm positive (she will need to be treated). A nice couple brought her home and is fostering her for us.  She is doing well with other pets and people.  Rhonda is undergoing Heartworm treatment and will be available for adoption soon.
Interested in fostering? Fill out our volunteer application here: http:// www.pointerrescue.org/ helpus.html
TRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally, within 1500 miles)

Consider sponsoring a dog by making a donation to help with vetting costs. PRO is 501c3 non-profit and is fully funded by donations, your tax-deductible gift would be greatly appreciated! 
http:// www.pointerrescue.org/ donation.html

description:
Biggie is our 1 year old Labrador Retriever mix.....Stop by the shelter and spend time with him to see if he is the right match for you. 
Biggie will thrive in his forever home and be your faithful companion. He will be responsive to positive reinforcement training. Our experienced staff is available to talk with you, answer your questions and provide advice on how to transition him to your home. 
Biggie is neutered, dewormed, treated to prevent fleas & ticks and is up to date with vaccinations. His adoption fee is $300.00, plus $8.50 for the dog license if you are a resident of NYC, and he'll get one free exam at our vet's office, one free month of pet health insurance and a microchip. If you'd like to adopt him please call or visit...we are conveniently located in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn near the F train (Ft Hamilton Pkwy) and we are open daily from 11am to 7pm. 
Biggie can't wait to meet you!

Sean Casey Animal Rescue
153 E. 3 St. 
between Ft Hamilton Pkwy & Caton Ave
Brooklyn, NY 11218
718.436.5163
NYS Department of Agriculture and Markets Registration No. RR160
name: Biggie

description: Hi, Iâm Cupid! Iâm a five-month-old female hound mix looking for a home and some friends to play with. I love toys and running around outside. I rarely bark and am crate trained too! If you buy me a tennis ball Iâll be your best friends forever. I also like cats but if you don't thatâs cool. Iâm very affectionate and would love to show you some love too!
name: Cupid

description:
HOW IS THIS FANTASTIC DOG GROWING UP HOMELESS? A true Southern Gentleman, CALVIN is living hi sbest life with an awesome foster famliy in Pottstwon, PA, which inlcudes four other dogs he loves!  CALVIN has responded beautifully to training, consistency and structure, returning the favor with obedience, loyalty and love! It's not fair for CALVIN to be bonding with a family that isnât actually his...

Before he made his way to Mr. Bones & Co.'s rescue program in December 2016, CALVIN had been abandoned on the outskirts of Houston, TX and was living in a junk yard. Now 3 years old and 45lbs. CALVIN is all sorts of sweet, goofy, wiggly affection. He does well meeting new people and dogs and is house and crate trained. CALVIN is being fostered near Reading, PA and is available for meet and greets.

The ideal home for CALVIN will have a fenced in yard so he can get his ya-yas out, have active people who enjoy hiking, walking and being outdoors and who understand dogs need structure and consistency. He looks for a confident person on the other end of the leash and wants to take cues from his people!

We will consider a home for him in PA, NY, MD, DC, VA, WV, NJ, OH, DE so please help us make his holiday dreams come true. Apply online via www.mrbonesandco.org/adopt 

Questions? Email elli@mrbonesandco.org
name: Calvin

breeds: Labrador Retriever, Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler
description: Meet Duke B! Duke B is a big boy with a big heart who is looking for a new home. Duke B is around 45 lbs and 6 to 9 months old. Duke B was found as a stray, Duke B will sit for hours just to be scratched behind the ears and loved on. It's actually hard to get a picture of him without our hands on him because he wants to be petted if there are hands around! Duke B is playful and good with kids. He is still learning his manners (mainly not to jump up on you which just goes back to his desire for affection) and he is learning quickly and should be easily trained. Per the vet, he is a mix of lab, heeler, and pit. He does well with other dogs and pretty much ignores the cats. If you are interested in adopting Duke B, please go to our website at charliescrusaders.org and fill out an application for adoption!
name: Duke B

description:
Courtesy Post for Road to Home Rescue:

Lexi is beautiful, smart and fun loving!  She is a Boxer/American Staffordshire mix; 4 years old and completely housebroken. Lexi loves to play and go on walks and will make someone a wonderful companion!  She would love a strong handler who will give her structure, love and continue her training. Lexi's adoption comes with three fully paid training sessions.  Lexi needs to be the ONLY pet in the home, but her silly antics will fill your heart with love.  She is up-to-date on her shots and fully vetted.  

Currently Lexi is located in Lindenwold, NJ.  Please contact Road to Home Rescue at adopt@roadtohomerescue.org, or call the Voorhees Animal Orphanage at 856-627-9111 to set up a meet and greet.
name: Lexi

description:
Happy is a  6 year old Korean Jindo that was picked up as a stray in Brooklyn NY. The owner was located and did not want Happy back,  We learned that Happy like most Jindos was kept outside all her life. 

In the 9 month since Happy has been in foster care she has blossomed into a sweet and very social people oriented dog. the best way to describe Happy is a very Happy dog  who loves to be around people but  not so much other dogs...Happy is housebroken, walks on lead easy going girl who is very quiet.

The sad news is hen we pulled Happy her blood work indicated Kidney disease. We were hoping this was more of a diet issue,  Being Happy was severely emaciated that once she was put on a good diet that the blood work would improve, sadly it did not . However one would  never know by the way she acts. Kidney disease ca be managed to some extent and progression slowed down. We are hoping Happy will have many more years, and it should be in her own home not in foster care.  

Happy has steadily gained weight on a home made kidney diet that is less expensive then most commercial foods. We are seeking a family that wants a great dog that has more to give then what we can do in foster care for Happy.

If you think you can give this great girl a forever home please submit a adoption application that can be found on our website www.shibarescuenj.org
name: Happy

description:
Say hello to Buddy!

This little poodle is approximately 8 years old.Â  Please read his story:

Buddy was found tied to a tree in Juniper Park, Middle Village, and taken in by our group.Â  This is one of the worst cases of neglect and abuse we have ever seen.

Buddy couldn't be touched due to the severity of the matting of his coat. At first, his sex couldn't even be determined. The pain and suffering this poor little dog has had to endure is simply unimaginable.Â  He was rushed to the vet where he had to be anesthetized, shaved down, and bathed.Â  He received extensive blood work and a dental procedure during which multiple teeth were removed.

With the love and patience being shown to him by our staff and volunteers,Â  Buddy has begun to feel like a dog again. This innocent little dog hasn't had an easy life but has found a SAFE haven with us.Â  Buddy will need a very kind and patient adopter who is willing to work with him to continue building up his confidence and trust.Â  He really needs a good friend and forever home...

Buddy likes other dogs.Â  You can meet this awesome little boy at our Atlas location, 80-36 Cooper Ave., Glendale.

Buddy will be neutered, microchipped and up to date on all vaccines upon adoption.

Thank you for your interest in Buddy !
name: Buddy

description:
Percy comes to us from a puppy mill out in Southwest MO. This big handsome fellow, is just gorgeous in person. Percy can be aloof in typical Akita fashion, give him a little time and some sweet talk, and you will have won him over! Percy is great on leash, loves his walks, loves his toys and enjoys spending time with his people. Percy is a calm, nice boy, with good manners. We feel he would do best in a calm adult home that is breed experienced, 

Do you have the right home for this big sweetheart? Please go to www.bigeastakitarescue.org and put in an adoption application online for him.
name: Percy

description:
Daredevil (formerly named Cookie) is a hilarious and adorable senior!  He was abandoned at one of our local shelters, and was in pretty rough shape at the time.  Now in our care he is doing much better.  

We estimate Daredevil is 10 years old. He weighs 9lbs.  He is slightly hearing impaired, but otherwise in good health.  

He would do well in a home with another nice dog or two, or as an only dog as well. He is also fine with cats.  

Daredevil is a pint sized charming fella who would love to be yours!

Contact us today to meet him!
Phone: 917-864-2443
Email: fofdogrescue@yahoo.com

description:
Meet Riley! She's not had great luck with owners and is need of love and care. Rileyâs owner was videotaped throwing her down a flight of stairs. When Riley arrived at the YAS, she had major trust issues. Can you blame her? Despite this, she is doing much better with people and much better around other dogs. Currently she should be adopted as an only pet to an experienced owner. Teenagers would be okay. With some love, attention and patience, Riley will make a fantastic pet.

For more info on adopting Riley, please e-mail jjmjohnson27@aol.com or call (914) 376-7183. You can also message us here on Facebook.

description:
NYC Area -- Rescued from South Korea, Ever is a sweet Jindo/Terrier mix. At 6 years old and weighing approximately 15 pounds, Ever is currently being fostered in NYC and is looking for her forever home! Please consider adopting her!

You can meet Ever this SATURDAY or SUNDAY at our SANTA PAWS EVENTS
(If she is not adopted at Saturdayâs event, she will be there Sunday)

Saturday, Dec 22nd, 2018

BUSHWICK BARK
181 Irving Ave
Brooklyn, NY

12PM-4PM
-----------

Sunday, Dec 23rd, 2018

WESPAW PETS
44-05 Queens Blvd
Sunnyside, NY

12PM-4PM

PLEASE NOTE: You need to attend the OUTDOOR ADOPTION EVENT in order to meet this dog and bring your printed application. Please come to the event should you have any questions or email us at info@koreank9rescue.org. Thank you!
Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Ever

description: Kinchley is one of our special pups who needs just the right understanding home. Please email dogkennel@rbari.org to arrange for one of the people who he trusts to introduce you to him if you think he might be the dog for you. Kinchley is a short squishy-faced little bully boy with some boxer, bulldog, or Boston in him to give him that unique "smile". He was adopted from our shelter as a puppy to a home that ended up not being a good fit for him, and our staff is working hard to socialize him and get him used to new people and situation. He gets nervous in a lot of situations and takes time to form a bond, but once he decides you are his friend his silly playful side comes out. Kinchley needs a dog-savvy adult home willing to give him time and space...please email dogkennel@rbari.org if you would like to truly make a difference in the life of a dog who really needs a home Primary Color: Brown Secondary Color: White Weight: 27lbs Age: 2yrs 5mths 3wks Animal has been Neutered
name: Kinchley

description:
My name is LEGION and I'm a GORGEOUS HUNK of a 4 yr "American Bully" (Amstaff/Amer Bulldog X). I'm 70 lbs of PURE BULLY LOVE! I am being rehomed due to unforseen circumstances, but I am a GEM OF A DOG. I am SUPER FRIENDLY, LOVING and SUGAR SWEET to everyone I meet. I am good with kids and other dogs. I haven't met any cats so not sure about them..I am very EASY GOING, MEDIUM ENERGY... but I do get a little jumpy when I'm excited and pull a bit on the leash but nothing a bit of training won't fix. My only vice is that I have skin allergies and I'm on a prescription medication and a special diet. I need a home that not only understands, appreciates and knows my breed but will be willing to take care of my special needs. Other than that I'm the PERFECT FAMILY DOG & LOYAL COMPANION, an AMBASSADOR for MY BREED and a STUNNING HUNK O' LOVE!! Come meet/adopt me today!

For more info/app; pls send your ph# via email to: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Legion

description: Hazel is one of 4 dogs who is in need of a new home. Their owners suddenly passed away and now their sister is desperately trying to find them new homes. Hazel is a 7 year old golden / lab mix. She is great with other dogs.. In fact, her best friend is a chi mix named Taco listed on our website and pictured with her. She is a super sweet and cuddly girl. She was very happy living with her senior owners and does not require a ton of exercise. She does enjoy a walk or smelling around the yard. If you would like to meet her, fill out an online application at bcaaofnj.org
name: Hazel

description:
Doughnuts is about 2 to 3 years old, up to date on her shots, already spayed, heartworm tested and microchipped. She is a little shy and a nervous girl. Would not recommend a home with young children. Doughnuts would also prefer to be the only dog. With some time, patience, training and understanding Doughnuts has the potential of being a great dog. She is the sweetest dog ever!
For information on our adoption process and to fill out an online adoption application, please go to our website www.AHDRNJ.com click under why adopt from us. This page will explain our process and to find our online adoption application. Sorry, but we do not adopt out of state. We will be in contact after we receive your completed application. Thank you
name: DOUGHNUTS

description:
My name is Rosco and all I want is a chanceâ¦can you give me one? I used to have a home and a family but I ended up in the Elizabeth Shelter on death row, I donât know why. Then some volunteers from EHR came to the shelter because they didnât think my time should be cut short just because my family couldnât keep me. Now I living with my foster family until my forever home comes along.

I had to make a lot of adjustments but Iâve gotten used to it and I even made friends with some very special volunteers when I was still living at the kennel. You can see them in some of my photos. They were willing to take a chance on me and become my friend. Now, theyâre hoping someone else will do the same, someone will bring me home and love me.

Let me tell you a little bit about myself and you can decide if I might be the dog for you. I am a 6-year-old red-nose Pit Bull boy and my favorite thing to do is play soccer. I like to carry the ball around in my mouth or do the same with my water dish. I am even bilingual â âHablas Espanol?â

I walk great on a leash and enjoy a nice stroll through the park. But I need to go to a home that has Pit Bull or bully breed experience. I need a home that will give me the time I need to get used to my new surroundings. But I am trying so hard to be a good boy, to be someone you would want to take into your home.

I am housebroken, which is good because I don't like to be crated. I like to go for a ride in the car â see all the photos of me catching a ride with my kennel buddies? Iâm a good listener, too, and they say Iâm smart â I just want you to be happy with me, if youâll just give me a chance. If youâve got the patience and the love and the right kind of home for me, I would be so grateful to you for giving me the chance to love you back.

If you think we would be a good match, please complete an application at www.ehrdogs.org & be sure to mention my name â ROSCO PITTY PUP. Iâll be right here waitingâ¦
name: Rosco Pitty Pup

description:
28 Sept. 2018: 

Remember the story of Eggo? This little peanut was found at 5 weeks old, weighing 2 pounds and severely malnourished. Although the odds were stacked against her, our Eggo survived and she is now a 28 pound happy puppy.

Eggo is finally ready to move to the next phase of her life. Because of the neglect she endured at a very early age, Eggo has a few quirks and she will need an understanding home that will help her and work with her. Specifically, Eggo continues to struggle with potty training and seems to have blurry vision. She is a bit protective of her food but is easily redirected. She has a short attention span and easily distracted (all those shiny objects!!!!) Eggo also enjoys running up and down the driveway as if it were her own personal treadmill. 

All in all Eggo is a joyful, silly, loving pup. She loves being rocked to sleep at nights, something her caretakers started those early nights when she was so critical. Eggo is content wherever you put her whether outside in her pen or inside in her Xpen at night. She never barks or tries to escape. Sheâs a happy pup all the time. We are looking for the perfect home for our miracle girl. She needs a home that will be both loving and firmâa home that will work with her and cherish lifeâs little victories.

Please apply to foster or adopt at https://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/dog-app/
name: Eggo

description:
This handsome lover boy will stand on your chest and slowly reach out his paw until he bops you on the chin to get you to notice him. He is great with other dogs, very wiggle waggy and great with strangers. Charisma to spare and gorgeous as can be. Photos should be coming soon. Approx 5yrs old 6lbs. 
Eve's Sanctuary does not have a public location to visit, although we do weekly adoption events in public locations on the UWS. If you are interested in a specific animal, please email info@evessanctuary.com with the name of the animal you are interested in written on the subject line. Please remember that ESAR requires a full complete application, an interview, and a home visit prior to final approval and placement of adopted animals. It may seem daunting at first, but to find true love its worth it, right? They aren't products on a shelf to buy, we love them like our own, and only want the best possible home for each and every one...thus the "hoops." Also, please trust our recommendations, we are skilled human furry freind matchmakers with many years of experience that has given us a unique and solid perspective. For these reasons we prefer adopters to be in NYC or the immediate area accessible by public transportation so we can work with you individually and educate you face to face!
Additionally, please understand that we are all volunteers, no salaries are paid, we have families and pets of our own, and we have full time jobs in addition to doing rescue work - so we may be (at times) slow-ish to get back to you. We promise we are doing our best as its in everyones best interest to place these darlings quickly, so we can save more. If you would like to expedite the process, and make us extra happy, please download our application from our website at: http://www.evessanctuary.org/Adoption.html , fill it out, and return it with your initial email inquiry. Be patient, be persistent, be polite, and we promise all will be well! ;-)
All animals come up to date on annual combo vaccs, rabies vaccs, heartworm tested negative, microchipped, and of course...spayed or neutered!
name: Joey

description:
20 March 2018: Mireille is a seven year old Scottish Terrier mix who has endured years of abuse and neglect. When she first came into rescue, she was too weak to stand and could only move by dragging her back legs. She was severely malnourished, to the point that her ribs and hip bones jutted out. Because of the cruelty she lived through, she was very distrustful of people and didn't know how to accept love and human touch. Her fear of people would easily take over, causing her to react negatively. 

Mireille has been in foster now for 6 months, and she has finally learned to accept love and human touch. She follows her foster mom from room to room, snuggles in her lap, licks her nose and face, and lets her pick her up. She has gained eight pounds and is happy and healthy. She runs to greet her foster mom when she gets home. When her foster mom prepares her food, Mireille jumps into the air, unable to contain her excitement. This has earned her the nickname, "little jumping bean." It will be important for any prospective adopter to understand that Mireille will require punitive-free training and lots of patience. She will probably need time to decompress and have a safe space to which she can retreat. Her foster family leaves her play yard door open and she goes inside to her bed when she needs time alone. 

Mireille would do best with an experienced dog owner, who has time to take her for long walks or runs since she is much more relaxed and receptive to new experiences (such as haircuts and baths) after fresh air and exercise. She is still learning to love and to trust but with patience and time she will blossom. As her foster mom tells us, Mireille is a love.

Mireile presently lives with 3 other dogs and 3 humans. Please apply to adopt.
name: Mireille

description:
One of the first things people ask about Bentley is âWhat kind of dog is that?â given his unusual looks, followed by âWhat a dog!â given his incredibly bubbly personality. Such a unique dog must have an equally unique story and Bentley is no exception! Bentleyâs story starts with him landing in a municipal shelter where this active and friendly dog had no outlet for his energy. He was then transferred to our partner organization, Save Our Strays, that saw the potential and drive in Bentley and started working towards getting him into a board and train facility that would benefit him. Thatâs where Adopt-A-Dog and Ernesto at DOGS 360 came in; to train and work with Bentley until we could find him a home. This program had Bentley working with both Ernesto and other dogs daily to help work on his manners and also provide much-needed socialization. The greatest boon is that this program was in a home environment, so Bentley is getting a foster experience while also becoming the dog we knew he could be.

Due to his stay at DOGS 360, Bentley has made great strides in his socialization skills as well as his manners. We learned that Bentley is a tug master who has plenty of canine friends. He is the ideal companion for a family that likes to be outdoors (he LOVES going for bike runs) and would be by your side on a hike. Bentleyâs ideal future family would learn all the training he has learned and continue to give Bentley the structure and consistency he needs to flourish. For that reason, we would love to see Bentley in a home with older kids that could learn his training alongside him. He is a friendly and goofy dog that is waiting to become your next family member, so why not come and meet him today? You canât say no to a face like that!
name: Bentley

description:

Cedric and Douglas are learning how to be a part of a family & are using a doggy door to go out & potty. Cedric is a very sweet boy and is gently for a pup his age. He was around my 11 year old for photos yesterday & did extremely well. We are learning more about Cedric & will add more information soon. Cedric has one right front paw that is white and a bit less white on his chest/neck area that his brother, Douglas. I will add a photo of them together- unless you look very closely, they appear to be twins.

Thank you for considering adding CEDRIC LONESTAR to your family. Apply to adopt at WWW.EHRDOGS.ORG today!

Pearl is doing great and she still has 2 foster fur siblings keeping her company. She would make a great addition to your pack! Adopt Pearl!

description: Heâs got his tuxedo on and heâs ready to be seen.  Wrangler might be dressed in formal attire, but the guy is always ready for play.  Whether chasing big balls, tennis balls, squeak toys, or frisbees, he is loaded with get-up-and-go for fun times with you and the gang. description:
Meet Mr. Shiba (also affectionately called Mr. Mushface!) Mr. Shiba is a 2 year old Shiba Inu who was used to breed more puppies at a puppymill for his entire life. We recently rescued him, and now he is experiencing everything for the first time. Mr. Shiba was never held, loved, or walked on anything other than a cage floor. For these reasons, he is a bit shy and needs a patient adopter who can help him build up his confidence and learn that the world isn't so scary! 

His foster dad says he is extremely gentle and LOVES the resident dog! In fact, we think Mr. Shiba will really bloom in a forever family with another dog who can show him the ropes! He is making great strides in his foster home and we believe he is ready for his forever home! 

If a dog is listed here on Petfinder, they are still available. Please don't email just to ask if they're available - they are! We get so many emails a day, we may not be able to respond and you could end up missing out on a dog. ALL POSTED DOGS ARE AVAILABLE!!! 

Also, none of our dogs have health or behavioral problems that we don't list on here. If its not in the profile, it doesn't exist!

You may read our adoption policies and procedures for Puppy Mill Rescues on www.truenorthrescue.org. Please fill out a COMPLETE application if you would like to meet him - meet and greets are only scheduled with approved applicants and foster families. All our dogs are in private foster homes. Applications are processed in the order that they are received. You can email Jillian truenorthrescue@gmail.com for more information.

Think you could be his family? Apply on www.truenorthrescue.org.
name: Lennon

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

This 4-5 year old guy is just ridiculously adorable, with a smile that will brighten one lucky adopter's every day. He's an energetic, friendly fellow who's smart and will do well with training. He's dog social but prefers being the only dog in the house. Bandit enjoys the company of people and would like a home where someone is home more often than not. To learn more or to meet Bandit, e-mail shelter@spca914.org.

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Bandit - Foster me for the Holidays!

description:
Meet Lucy, she is around 6 years old and 30lbs. Lucy is a sweet girl looking for an active family who has time to continue her training and provide her with all the exercise she needs.

Lucy loves to run and would do well in a home with a yard for her to frolic in or someone who enjoys long walks, frequently goes hiking and on daily runs. She also enjoys swimming. She loves to play with toys, enjoys chewing on large branches and sunbathing.

Lucy would thrive in a home with experienced dog owners who have no other dogs, or only very submissive dogs. Lucy is an anxious young lady, and occasionally that leads her to make some bad decisions. However, Lucy is happy when she is on a good schedule, with a family who understands the importance of doggie rules. Lucy doesnât want to deal with the pressures of being leader of the pack, it makes her nervous, but if she has to take over, she will!

Lucy is house trained, has an incredible amount of love to give, and always has time for a cuddle. Lucy has more energy than the typical 6 year old pooch, and will need physical and mental exercise to keep her happy. Lucy currently takes medication to help with her anxiety. By consulting with your vet or taking her to see an animal behaviorist, you may be able to find other ways to help her control her anxious side. Lucy also has IBD (Irritable Bowel Disorder) which means she can only eat prescription dog food, and although she cannot have table scraps, she is a big fan of carrots and lettuce!

Lucyâs anxiety means she can be easily startled, especially when sleeping. Lucy was recently surprised by her baby brother which resulted in her snapping at him. Although the bite was superficial, we advise that Lucy not be around young children or children who can not be responsible around this little lady.

If you think you can give Lucy all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt.

https://petstablished.com/pets/public/341335

***This is a courtesy listing. Shelter Chic does not own Lucy and is not responsible for any claims made by her current owner or foster family.
name: Lucy (Courtesy Listing)

description:
Meet Donnie!

Donnie is a 2-year-old GORGEOUS fella who was found as a stray and brought to Philly ACCT. In the shelter he did not do well and would shake profusely in his kennel out of fear.Â 

Since coming in to foster care with Bella-Reed, his true personality has shone through! He gets alongÂ fantastic with the resident female pitty.Â Donnie is super sweet and is great around children! He currently lives with an 8Â year old boy and they do well together. He does not, however, do well around cats due to a prey drive like a lot of dogs his breed so a home without cats is a must. We would also recommend no small dogs.Â 

Donnie was sadly adopted and returned twice to no fault of his own. In BOTH instances they expected Donnie to get along immediately with their resident dogsÂ after bringing him home in to a new environment with strange people and animals - the first time he was bit on the neck by the resident dog, and the second time he was too playful and would obsessively drink from their pool in the yard. Both times he was returned the following day.Â Donnie needs a home with people who are understanding he needs TIME TO ADJUST. We will continue to look for Donnie's forever!Â 

Meanwhile, Bella-Reed received a grant from the Petco Foundation Holiday Wishes program and have decided to send Donnie to a 3 week board & train at K9 Connection in Buffalo, NY to help him become an even better version of himself! He will be gone from Jan 7-26. While we are taking applications on him now, he will need to wait until he's done his training to go to his forever.

Donnie is neutered, microchipped, up to date on vaccines, 4dx heartworm tested (negative), dewormed, and on monthly heartworm prevention.

For an adoption application, visit our website at bellareedpbr.com/adoption

For more photos on Donnie, visit his photo album on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/BRPBR
name: Donnie

Heâs also SO happy to be out of the shelter heâs working on some separation anxiety when humans leave but getting better every day because his awesome foster family is letting him know heâs safe and that scary shelter is his past and his future is a forever family that will cherish this hunk and all the happiness he brings. Elvis is a man's kinda man, and loves to hang with the guys; give him football, some basketball and popcorn---he's all IN. However, he has been known to entertain the ladies. Itâs clear to say this guy is loving life and can make you laugh just by looking at that amazing mug. Elvis is an incredibly happy 3 year old, 68 pound pit bull mix, formerly known as Snow. He is neutered, up to date on shots and chipped. He is a Velcro dog and loves his human. Currently he is getting individual training to Work on some resourcing guarding and correcting him getting mouthy when excited during playtime. 
He is very energetic. He has been in a few runs and is a good running partner. He needs someone to teach and reinforce âyesâ and ânoâ with positive reinforcement. He is a really handsome, affectionate and cool dog. He is housebroken and is getting more experience being crated when unsupervised. Has experience separation anxiety in former home. 

He would do best with slow introductions with people and other dogs and needs to be in a home with no cats or young children. He knows basic commands and requires an active owner dedicated to exercising him and reinforcing his current training. Whoever adopts him will be required to continue positive reinforcement training with a certified trainer.
