Honey Bunny H Wilson is vetted and vaccinated as age appropriate,including spay, and available for adoption through Wags Rescue and Referral.

 Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.comand click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Honey Bunny H Wilson- a sweet girl!

description: Dozer is a happy guy who walks perfectly on his leash!  His new forever family must be adult only and he likes to hog up all the attention so no other pets please.  He would make a great companion for an adult individual/couple looking for a new best friend!
name: Dozer

description:
This young red beauty is Clint, a 2 year old, bully boy.  Clint is friendly and so handsome. This boy is active and will need a family that can provide him with daily exercise. He will do best in his new home with teen children, perhaps another dog and no cats. Clint is housebroken and knows a few commands. He is attentive and eager to please his people.  He will settle into his new life easier with some basic training. He is a smart and loyal boy who promises to bring you years of happiness. If you are looking for your new best friend, please consider adopting Clint. He will be forever grateful. This house dog does not belong in the Orphanage for the holidays!

To fill out an adoption application, please go to our website, www.vaonj.org and click on  Adopt and then Adoption. Please complete the form and bring it with you when you visit our shelter, and don't forget to put the Orphanâs name on the form.  Thanks!  Our pets are spayed or neutered, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines prior to going to their new homes. For more information on our adoption procedures, please visit, www.vaonj.org.

NOT READY TO ADOPT, BUT WOULD LIKE TO HELP? Voorhees Animal Orphanage will continue to care for this pet until it is adopted. Help support this pet with a donation. Please go to www.vaonj.org, click on How to Help and then Donate.
ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

On behalf of the animals, we thank you!
name: Clint

description:
12/1/18


NOTE FROM FOSTER:
 Okay everyone this is my foster trip!! Heâs looking for his forever family. Heâs about 5 years old and a hound mix with three legs. He is the sweetest boy I have ever met! Perfect amount of energy and is always so loving! He is great with cats, people and pigs! Please message me if youâre looking for an amazing companion or family dog!

10/8/18

Hereâs Trip!!!! This good ole boy  is a 5 year old  hound mix with a pleasant and loving personality! Heâs had his share of ups and downs and is a special needs boy.   An old injury and infection resulted in a back leg amputation for Trip, but he's doing well post-op and is adjusting to his circumstances like a true warrior. He is a laid back 50 pounder who is content sleeping on the sofa, or on his dog bed if you insist. . He does well in a crate but manages well outside of it. Trip gets along with other nice dogs.  He enjoys having his ears rubbed and being talked to. He understands every word he hears, but is always careful not to repeat it because he doesnât want anyone to this heâs a gossip.  Trip is fully vetted, including neuter.  He has been treated for heartworms and is feels like heâs earned a medal of honor for beating those creepers.  Trip has had a tough couple of years, but hopes now that heâs gotten to feel the love of his foster and has received medical attention, his furever family is the very next step.  If you are interested in adopting Trip, visit www.wagsrescue.com and complete an application. Hisâs foster is happy to answer additional questions for an approved adopter.


Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Trip Society

description:
Spend some time with Nathan and youâll find yourself falling in love. While he can sometimes be scared of new people or places, he warms up quickly once he knows you are his friend. Heâll be bringing you one of his favorite toys to play with or trying to crawl into your lap for pets in no time. He does have a lot of energy and would enjoy a home who has time to play fetch with him or take him for long walks. He is also super smart and has learned many basic commands, is housebroken and really wants to please his people. He is treat and toy motivated and loves training. Nathan is also playful with other dogs but sometimes needs a slow intro. He is only two years old and has a high energy play style that some older or laid back dogs may not like. But generally once he is introduced properly, while he has lost of energy he also is very appropriate and play bows and rolls over on his back to make other dogs feel more comfortable.

Nathan came to us from a local shelter. He had been brought in by police after he was taken from his previous owner who kept him crated 24 hours a day with no food and water. He was underweight and understandably afraid of everything. Nathan has come such a long way showing how strong, forgiving and resilient he is. His ideal home would be in a quiet suburban or rural area as sometimes new things or loud noises still scare him. He would do best in a home with teens and up.

Nathan is neutered, vaccinated, microchipped and heartworm negative. He is around two years old.
name: Nathan

description: Coco is a super sweet, 1 to 2 year old, 52 lb girl. She is well mannered and pretty calm for such a young dog. Coco is affectionate and great with people and dogs, and we can cat test. All in all, just another wonderful dog in need of a forever home. So much prettier in person, this girl will steal your heart for sure. A must meet! (Fostered in PA) (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there is clearly something wrong with your email!) Dog's Best Friend Adoption Center utilizes an adoption application and screening process. We require personal and vet references and a home check made prior to adopting one of our dogs. All of our dogs are companion animals that must be kept inside the house with the rest of the family members. All of our dogs are temperament tested, well mannered, and know some basic commands ~ they are worked with daily, as someone is always here with them. All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats. Adoption donations range from $250 to $450, depending on breed, age, size, vetting, and training of the dog (some pure bred and tiny dog fees are higher). This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care. Dog's Best Friend dogs truly make wonderful family pets. Please  email us for an application. (If you email us and do not hear back from us within 24 hours, please try again, as we most likely did not receive your email!) (Also note that many of our dogs are fostered just across the border into PA)
name: Coco (Great Family Dog)

description:
Star was born in September 2017 to a rescued mom in Thailand.  He is now a little over a year old and has been patiently waiting for a home, so we're bringing him to NYC in December 2018.  He is very, very friendly and has an all-around lovely personality.  He gets along well with other dogs and is always a pleasure to be around. 

We will need a foster home or an adopter for Star when he arrives in NYC.  If interested in helping this boy out, please send us an email to FurRealNYC@gmail.com.  Thanks!
name: Star

description:
Hi, my name is Jazzy! Iâm an ~8-10 year old, 12 lb Dachshund mix. Iâm an easygoing dog looking to nestle into a forever home. Iâm good with dogs, tend to bark at cats (sorry, not sorry!) and older kids that would welcome my laidback temperament. I am already house trained, crate trained, and leash trained. Although Iâm well behaved and low-key, donât be totally fooled because I always get excited for a nice stroll outside. I tend to be apprehensive and shy when first meeting new people, but once I get to know you, Iâm super sweet and have a lot of love to give.

Want to adopt me? Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html

**Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.**

**PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.

Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.

All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.

Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!
name: Jazzy

description:
*** check out the video of Tommy ***

Tommy is an 8 months old, 26 pound, neutered male who has the biggest ears!

Our volunteer rescued him close to home, he was severely malnourished. He was so malnourished the day of his rescue he ate part of the plastic bowl where the food was being offered. His appetite helped him to recover quickly though! 

Tommy is a little shy but super attentive and oh so sweet!  Great with dogs and all people. Would make a great addition to any family.

Email Patricia at: patricia.strayfromtheheart@gmail.com
name: Tommy

description: This pretty girl is Mellie. Mellie is looking for her angel. She is a very special girl who is deserving of a very special home. She is a hurricane survivor who went into a North Carolina shelter and was in grave danger of being euthanized due to lack of space. BCAA saw her and could not let that happen, so we rescued her and placed her into a foster home. We do not know why, but she is very fearful of humans initially. She will need a home with people who are very patient and understand that they will need to take the necessary time to make her feel comfortable. Mellie has absolutely no aggression, but she does avoid uncomfortable situations but running away. She absolutely love playing with other dogs. She is a beautiful girl and we are sure that with a little love and attention she will come out of her shell and be the most grateful dog you could possibly save. She will do best in a home with other dogs and a fenced in yard. If you are interested in Mellie, please fill out our online application.
name: Mellie

description:
Davina is a sweet mush-faced 5-6 month old, 20-25 lbs. (and still growing), Beagle/Lab mix puppy rescued from a shelter in the South with her sister, Athena. Both girls are eager to find forever familes where they can explore and enjoy their new lives. Davina is good with other dogs, not sure about cats, and she gets along just fine with the rabbits in her current foster home. 

Apply now for precious Davina and let the fun begin!

Davina is available for adoption through in Our Hands Rescue. If interested in meeting her, please fill out an application on inourhandsrescue.org. Please DO NOT send an email through Petfinder, your application will be processed before the following Saturday's event.
name: Davina

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Comet is 1 year old and 45 pounds on intake to rescue. This very handsome brindle Pit Bull male will stun you with his looks! Comet came into rescue when we found him at the shelter injured â¦ he had been shot! Comet has been recovering with our veterinary partner and is soon ready to join us in the north. He is up to date on shots, has been altered, is great with people and does fine with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Comet, please put your application in here: http://rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Comet

description: DOB: Aug 12, 2018
name: Chewey (p)

description:
Silva and her sister Pinkel were surrendered to a shelter in Texas. They are 5-year-old Chihuahua/Terrier mix girls - Pinkel weighs about 20 pounds, while Silva is a bit smaller at 15.6 pounds. Pinkel will be treated in Texas for heartworm before making the trip to NJ to find a new home while sister Silva will arrive in the near future.
Silva gets along with other dogs but Pinkel would do best as an
only furchild in her new home.

If you are interested in meeting Silva, please fill out an application & be sure to ask for her by name - SILVA TEXAS!
name: Silva Texas

description:
Bailey loves to chase a Frisbee but is just as content to watch a movie with you. Of course she will encourage you to share the popcorn with her because who doesn't love popcorn and a movie? She knows some basic commands and responds well to firm but loving handling. It has been a great partnership so far. She has taught us to pick up our socks off the floor because, if you don't, there is nothing more fun in her eyes than stealing them. She is not good with strangers and would need a quieter home and someone who will take the time to earn her trust. She should have a fenced in yard and a home with no children

By being patient and spending time with her, we have discovered a wonderful, loyal, and sometimes comical friend. Bailey will be a blessing and a gift and your best friend if you just give her a chance. Sometimes when she is sitting there with a glint in her eye and a smile on her face, we laugh and say, Do you think she is thinking "I am faster than you... I am prettier than you... and I am smarter than you"? I for one am glad she doesn't play chess. I would hate for her to know that she is right.

Bailey is a fabulous dog and deserves a home of her very own. She is housebroken, crate trained, UTD on shots and spayed.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O9ckWPiGC5w&feature=youtu.be

12/18/18 12:59 AM
name: Bailey

description:
Cutie Pi is a 7 month old purebred female German Shepherd.  She came to us as a puppy and has special needs of Megaesohpagus.  She must sit upright to eat food and wait upright for 10-15 minutes afterward in order to digest properly.  Purchase of a Bailey Chair is the demand but thereafter she does well with any food.  This is a relatively common condition found in German Shepherds but she needs a dedicated owner who is committed to managing the condition.  It is for life.  
While Pieâs brother turned out extra large Pie is on the smaller size of about 45 pounds but is till growing and filling out.  Pie is very smart, crate trained and knows basic commands.  She does need leash training and would adore being part of her special family. She gets along with any other dog but can be pushy as part of wanting to play all the time.  She is tolerant of cats but tries to wrestle with them as if they are puppies and is better monitored when with them.  Pie is a GIFT to that special someone.  She bonds with humans intensely and loves to learn the right way to be.  If you have a big heart and a firm concept of the demands of a special needs dog, kindly email tristateshepherdrescue@gmail.com for an application.
name: Cutie Pi

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
Canyon is 10 months old and pretty well behaved for his age.
He is house trained, loves people and other dogs and he will be a medium size adult . He seems to be better interacting with men than women and he would be better with adults than kids.
Canyon is really gorgeous and he needs someone with time and some experience to help him grow into an awesome adult. Canyon needs a quiet home where he can learn to trust people and where he can follow the directions. Someone firm but gentle would be the ideal person for this puppy.
name: CANYON

description: Kronus is a gorgeous Chihuahua with a nice personality. He is about 8 years old, weighs about 8-9 pounds, and has a beautiful soft coat. He is very easy to care for and does not require a lot of exercise. He enjoys getting affection and taking walks outside.   He has previously lived with other dogs and cats. Kronus is already neutered and is up to date on his vaccinations. Kronus has much more to give and is looking forward to finding his new home.
name: Kronus

description: Leo is looking for an experienced owner without small children in the home. He gets very excited when he first comes out of his kennel but calms down once he is outside. Even though he is 56 pounds, he is not hard to walk on a leash.
name: Leo

description:
We'd like to introduce you to our dynamic duo, Precious and Tucker. These two cuties have been together at least 10 years. Their owner entered hospice care and all of his sweet dogs needed to be rehomed. Most of his dogs found forever homes but his two seniors weren't so lucky! Extended friends and family did not think that Tucker and Precious were bonded because they were in a home with many other dogs. For the first few weeks, we had them in different foster homes but Precious was not doing well. We decided to bring Tucker for a visit to see if it would lift her spirits and they have been reunited ever since! As the months have gone by, Precious has become more confident and much more independent of Tucker but she still does regularly check in with him though out the day.

We have been working hard to get them healthy enough for adoption. They both had dental surgeries (Tucker's was extremely extensive) and are now recovered and ready to find their forever homes!  Tucker is approximately 16 years old and is in fairly good health. He has some typical old man grumpiness and likes to spend most of his day napping. He has limited vision and hearing, but he still comes running when dinner is ready. Tucker is pee pad trained and seems pretty content with that set up. He also requires help with stairs. Precious is approximately 10 years old and is far more active and has no health issues.  She loves going outside and hanging out with the other dogs in her foster home. She enjoys sleeping in bed and loves to devour pup cups from Starbucks!  

Precious and Tucker would love to find a home where they can spend the rest of their days together! Could that home be yours? If interested in Precious and Tucker, please complete an application at www.seniordoghaven.org. Any questions can be sent to info@seniordoghaven.org.
name: Precious (and Tucker)

description: The Puppy Palooza continues! And we don't have any sell outs here. Introducing the woman who took the country music world by storm, Emmylou Harris, and her grammy-winning, newly-released single, Tulsa Queen. To foster or adopt, visit bit.ly/BadassApp
name: Tulsa Queen

description:
Polo is a 5-6 year old boy who is an absolute gentle giant.  Polo weighs in at 140 pounds.  He is a big baby with a gentle, loving personality.  Polo was surrendered by his owners after being kept in a small backyard that hadn't been cleaned in several months.  Terrible conditions.  Polo came in as a sad depressed dog but has blossomed into a happy, friendly, loving boy.  He acts like a puppy.  He play bows even when he sees another dog at a distance.  Polo deserves the best home we can find him to make up for the terrible conditions other humans allowed him to live in.  Pol's transition from a sad , shut down, depressed boy to the happy, loving dog he has come to be is simply amazing and has been so rewarding for the staff and volunteers.  Polo does well driving in the car as well as walking on his leash. 

Please stop in and meet Polo soon.  You will not be disappointed.
name: Polo

description: Introducing Tank! Donât let his name fool you- this guy is a total love bug. Who better to keep you warm this winter than a cutie pie like Tank? Be forewarned, heâs a bed hog. Tankâs forever home wish list consists of a new Pawrent that cannot possibly get enough of his cuddles, a warm bed, lots of toys, play fetch and a backyard that has a tall fence. Tank sometimes thinks heâs part kangaroo, he LOVES to jump and climb. Tank would probably be awesome at Agility as he is so athletic and loves to learn. Tank would love a fellow playful canine companion to romp around with, but heâs okay with being the only fur baby of the house. Come meet this loveable goofball, youâll be glad you did. Fill out an application today.
name: Tank

description:
A home for the holidays....

Adorable adoptable Taylor is a petite gal with a sweetheart personality. She enjoys car rides, takes treads like a lady and would make a wonderful companion for almost any home. She came all the way from Georgia with her nine puppies in hopes of finding a better life.

Her puppies are all old enough to be on their own and are currently in foster until they're ready to be adopted.

Taylor is at the shelter and we are really hoping to find a foster to adopt family who will take care of her while her milk dries up and she waits to be spayed. Since she is still waiting on her milk to dry up, she has not been tested with other animals yet. Taylor is approx 2 years old and weighs 35 lbs.

If you're interested in fostering to adopt her, please email Nicole@faithfulfriends.us. Or please stop by to meet her in person. The shelter is open Wednesday through Friday from 1 to 7pm and Saturday from noon to 5pm. If you have children in the family, please bring them to meet her -- it's the best way to see if she would be a good fit for your family!
name: Taylor

description:
Here is some information on Riley from the Humane Society of Ocean City:

âRiley is a male Shar-pei/Pittie mix, Brindle-coated, 2 yrs old, with a snoot soft and mushy like a marshmallow! Confident, playful, outgoing, and attentive, Riley is a wonderful companion pooch who is full of energy, love, and snuggles.

He loves running in the yard playing fetch and tug, walks around the neighborhood, and snuggling on the couch with you. Riley is intelligentâhe learns fastâhighly trainable and already has good domestic social skills, walks good on-leash, and even knows a few tricks!

Riley has been through a few homes in his short life, as those were folks who were unable to meet his needs. Too often he was left in a crate all day (8-10 hrs/day) and again through all the night; as a result he gets highly stressed when confined. He has NOT shown separation anxiety behaviorsâhe just hates being stuck in a crate away from everyone.

Riley is looking for a home where he can have plenty of attention, rarely to be left alone and stuck in a box. He needs good exercise/play time as he is young and energetic; he is an attention hound, and craves your company more than anythingâexcept perhaps nom-noms! A high-fenced (5â+) yard is required and/or appropriate confined areas to run and play in.

He should be fine with other dogs and kids teenaged and up, visit depending; doggie meet n greets are also required and are by appt. only. All our animals are S/N, UTD, & micro-chipped."
name: Riley

description:
Ralph is a senior chihuahua that we rescued from Hempstead Shelter. He and his sister Rita were found and brought into the shelter.  They were so sad while there and clearly needed TLC, having been neglected and we believe dumped in the street.

Ralph is a 7 lb loverboy, and he and his sister crave human attention.

They have been fully vetted and are now ready for their home.  They must go to the same forever home since they are bonded.

Ralph can remain a foster while Rita can be adopted.  Ralph is on heart medication which we will cover.  He also has bladder stones that may cause him to have urinary issues.  He is not a candidate for surgery.  We will cover his medical care for life.

Please open your heart and home for Ralph and Rita!

Phone: 917-864-2443
Email: fofdogrescue@yahoo.com
name: Ralph

description: Neo is a very sweet senior surrendered due to changes in his family's living situation. He is a happy lovable guy who still has some energy at 13 years old and likes going for walks, getting attention from volunteers and hanging out with his doggie friends. He has some medical issues and is on a special diet- we aren't sure exactly how long he has left but would love to find him a foster or home as soon as possible so he can enjoy whatever time he has left. Please stop by the shelter to meet him or submit a foster or adoption application from or website. Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Tan Age: 13yrs 3mths 2wks
name: Neo

description: Hi friends! My name is Kumiko, and I am originally from Puerto Rico. I was one of several hundred dogs flown over to the US after the hurricane. I have lots of energy, and I absolutely love to play. I'm a super happy girl and love people! I can't wait to learn new tricks, and meet my forever family! Come see me at St Hubert's in Madison NJ or call 973-377-2295. Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Black Weight: 55.4lbs Age: 3yrs 2mths 2wks Animal has been Spayed
name: Kumiko

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Will you make Wish's dream come true? Talk about a sweet, mellow, gentle, loving, 7 to 9 yrs. old guy who has had a hard life, Wish is that guy. If you are looking for a wonderful dog who just wants to love you and know that he is cared for and safe, then Wish is the dog for you! Wish is a smaller size Coonhound and a real gem. He is good with people, is dog-friendly, housebroken, good on a leash, takes toys, treats, and food gently and asks for very little in this world. He just wants a loving, forever home. He is a very good dog and a wonderful companion. Wish is best with older children. Please apply to adopt Wish in central N. J. at RescueRidge.com and text 732 546 8805 to meet him.
name: Wish

description: Echo was found as a stray in GA and traveled to NJ to join the J & Co family in December 2018. Please stay tuned for updates as she settles into foster care.
name: Echo

description:
This is Gabby! If you look at the picture, she's smiling at you from ear to ear. Many of the reasons she hasn't been adopted as of yet is due to kennel stress, so when you come to the shelter for a visit see her outside for true representation of her wonderful personality.

A home environment is what she needs, preferably an active household. She has told us that she would like to take up jogging......by chance do you jog? Regular exercise outside...maybe some power walking? Gabby would be perfect for you.
name: Gabby

description:
This fellow came to us as a stray, thin, with sparse hair. We named him Alfred.  Along with a horrible case  of alopecia, he was covered in fleas which, as you can imagine, is incredibly uncomfortable. Alfred was immediately bathed with a medicated shampoo and he actually seemed to enjoy the warm water running over his body! Alfred was reclaimed by his family and was reunited with the children who loved him so much, but he once again got loose and we received no word that the family wanted this sweet boy to come back home. So here he is with us! And we do love our Alfred!

Alfred is currently on medication for his skin, and still taking his medicated  baths, and we are seeing steady improvement in his condition. He unfortunately won't grow a lot of his hair back. He is just looking for someone to love him and see past his unique appearance. With his treatments in foster, he has had such a significant improvement, but will require regular medical care.

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***


Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Alfred

description:
12/10/18. Charlie got to meet Santa and said the one thing he would like this year is a forever home. Please come to a Wags event to meet Charlie and some of his hound friends looking for their forever homes. Event schedule posted on the website at www.wagsrescue.com under Events. 

11/22/18
Charlus aka Charlie has arrived to the PA area. He is currently in foster care with several other dogs and having a great time. He is crate trained, housebroken, and dog friendly. He is about 10-11 months old but doesnt have puppy energy anymore. He is very settled for his age. He likes kids. He walks OK on leash but better on harness. He is quiet in the house and doesnt bark or howl (Hounds are generally pretty quiet and thats a misconception people often have because they think hounds ae noisy).  He likes to snuggle, to be petted, and overall is a happy, friendly guy. He is about 40-45 lbs. He is full grown but could fill out a little bit. He would be fine with a smaller residential setting, townhouse, apartment, or condo. 

11/4/18

This is one absolutley stunning hound!  Charlus is a ten month old, forty pound, hound that was lucky enough to find his way into rescue!  Charlus is an absolute doll and is both house trained and crate trained.  Charlus enjoys snuggles on the couch, dinner time, and play time with his doggie friends.  He has gotten along well with every dog he has met and is quite a fan of human friends, too!  If you are looking for a hound dog to spend your time with, Charlus would love to keep you company!  Charlus is fully vetted including neuter and is ready to find his forever home!  His foster will be happy to answer any questions once an approved application is on file.  Complete an adoption application on our website at www.wagsrescue.com!

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Charlus Society- sweet little "Charlie"-ADOPTED

description:
Trinity - 2-3-year-old shepherd mix. Approx. 40lbs
Trinity also needs a foster home! 
https://www.louieslegacy.org/wp/get-involved/foster/

All of our animals come fully up to date on vaccinations, microchipped, heartworm tested negative, and dewormed, as well as neutered, and treated for any ailments found upon veterinary examination. The adoption fee covers a portion of these services, and makes it possible for us to continue rescuing animals.  For more information on the adoption fees and adoption process, please complete our adoption application here:

www.louieslegacy.org/adopt

Thanks so much for caring about a needy animal!
name: Trinity *needs foster*

description: Nena is a one and a half year-old  Terrier mix rescued from Puerto Rico. She is a sweet, gentle lapdog. If interested,  please call or text Gizela at 201-655-5059. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Nena

description:
Stop!  Do not judge Shadow by the big puppy-dog eyes and incredibly sad expression.....Shadow is an absolute barrel of laughs!  Shadow has the sad, pouty-face down pat but you simply must meet him outside to see the true sweetness and bubbly personality that Shadow is full of.  He's a little over a year old and this bright and bubbly boy came to us from our Newark facility when he was turned in by an owner that could no longer care for him.  Shadow's charm and lovely-ness exudes from his plain tan pittie body.  Please don't pass him up because he's just another pit bull.  What a darling boy he is.  He has excellent manners while eating, taking toys and treats, and going for walks, and he's calm and friendly while meeting dogs.  He just loves toys and turns into a real ham when you play with him.  Shadow will bring joy and happiness to your life if you welcome this loving goofball into your home.  File#28205  1/21/18

If you cannot adopt but would like to help care for the many available pets that we have awaiting their forever homes, text ResQ to 501501 to make a $10.00 donation, or click here to donate to our Res-Q Fund: https://www.ahscares.org/shop/item.asp?itemid=28&catid=5

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.
name: Shadow

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

If you are looking for a grown-up guy with a very engaging face that says âI can be loyal to youâ, Bowser is your man. He is about 7 years old, knows his commands, likes to go for fast walks, ( maybe a run), loves basketballs, soccer balls, etc., and has soulful eyes. Oh, did we mention he likes treats? Pizza is his favorite! Bowser gets along well with other dogs. To learn more about Bowser, please email shelter@spca914.org.

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs that require more than one visit prior to adoption. With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Bowser - Foster me for the Holidays!

description:
Mason is an amazing young dog. Friendly and well behaved he would be a perfect family dog. He was hit by a car and had a surgery on his leg but he is healed and can play, walk and run like everyone else.
He enjoys playing and walking as well as being on the couch next to you. Mason is easy going, gentle and his shiny coat of an amazing reddish black.
name: Mason

description: Diana is a lovely 6yr old, 60 lbs Bulldog who came to rescue when her baby making days were finished. She is sweet and a little silly. She is a big Bulldog and likes to climb and jump and prove that bullies can get anywhere they want to go. She will need a home with Bulldog experience and no young children or other dogs (at least until she has better social skills)
name: Diana

description:
Cassidy is a delightful little girl who vets estimate to be around a year or so old. She is absolutely gorgeous, friendly to everyone she meets and has been great with the other pups she's met since she joined us.
She currently weighs about 7 pounds. She's playful and jas puppy energy. Microchipped, up to date in vaccines and will be spayed prior to adoption.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Cassidy

description: Buddy is a  2 year old Great Dane. possibly mixed with lab, who was surrendered with his friend, Jake.  Jake has found a foster, but Buddy  is still in need.  He is a nice boy who seems to like everyone. He is a big boy, weighing about 120 pounds.  IF you can help him, please submit an application.   If you are interested in adopting, or for Last Chance Dogs, in helping by fostering, or fostering to adopt, please complete an application and send in ASAP. Click to download application  If you are unable to foster or adopt, but would like to help save a Last Chance Dog, please consider making a donation to Oreo's Fund , which provides emergency boarding care to dogs in danger of euthanasia. Donations are tax deductible.                  PLEASE NOTE: RAP adopts kid-friendly dogs to families with children under the age of 5, but we do not adopt puppies to families with children under the age of 5.    Why? Click here
name: Buddy

description: Niko came to us from a local shelter in Ocean County. He is a very typical German Shepherd. he can be intimidating to people that do not know him, but responds very well to people that are comfortable around shepherds. Niko had been chained to a tree for years before being rescued. He is a BIG boy and he prefers to be the only dog. He is being made available for adoption with the understanding that he will only go to someone that is able to properly handle him. He is very strong but knows basic commands. He is very easy to bathe (for some reason he really enjoys it) but can pull while on a leash unless made to walk properly. Niko has been with us for months while we try and figure out what is best for him. While he loves the people he knows, we would restrict his adoption to a home without children or other animals. We understand that he is not the easiest placement, but those of us that know him are willing to wait for the right placement. Steve Primary Color: Sable Age: 4yrs 5mths 0wks Animal has been Neutered
name: Niko

description: Papa is an adventurous dog he loves hiking Sports water. He loves everyone humans animals it doesn't matter. He's a big mush full of kisses and slobbery kisses and more kisses he can't get enough of loving everyone he meets
name: Papa

description:
12 Photos Â· Updated 3 years ago
Queens, NY - ****Update: 12/3/17**** Freddy is now staying at a vet hospital while we look for a foster home for him. Here is what his advocate and sponsor had to say about him : "I managed to arrive a couple of minutes before Mathew brought Frodo in. He immediately made himself at home: jumping at everybody and kissing everybody. He is extremely outgoing, friendly and sweet dog. He came with scratched nose and sides of lips. I could lift him, hold him, put ointment on the scratches. He is very young and has a lot of energy of course. Thus I had to steady him by holding his muzzle to put ointment on â no problem at all. His accommodations are very good: the hospital is very warm, he has separate room with huge crate (good enough for a Great Dane), I provided two comforters, two soft wide collers, two leashes, a sweater and a coat. There are other animals in the hospital overnight too. I walked him longer than an hour yesterday night and today morning. We will continue this schedule of walking. I am taking it easy: he learned âwaitâ quickly so I can pick his poop up and let cars and people pass (not so many in this area). Making him walk together with me will be of course harder job. I do not request for dogs to truly heal but they should not ever be in front or in back of me â we should walk together side by side with them sniffing and etc. I will have pictures taken during the week-end: too much going on now. There is a possibility of foster round the corner from me. But I am taking everything one step at a time. The hospital personnel is very compassionate and experienced with rescue. They loved him from the first sight. They will take good care of him for now. I think he will get a lot of attention and will be much happier there. He is very small and I think he is a pedigree: a true pit with stance and body type â just miniature. I have seen some like that: the owners told me that they are called âBulli pitsâ. I will check it out." Stay tuned for more on Freddy Frodo! A volunteer writes: Hello up there, new human friend! My nameâs Frodo, this is my chew toy, and weâre on the hunt for an adventureâ¦wanna come with me? Iâm a lot like that other Frodo you know, pint-sized, innocent and true of heart, I even have furry feet like him! My whole outlook on life is can-do and I donât have a beef with anyone. See how I meet passing people and dogs with tail wags and a wigglebutt? Thatâs just me being me, I am full of love! Iâm also full of energy and nothing makes me happier than getting my zoomie on in the yard, playing fetch or just running around with my peeps. I never guard my things, though I play a pretty good game of tug-o-war, and I always keep my mouth what they call âsoftâ so no one gets hurtânot even the toys! Cuddles are cool too and if you try to kiss me, guess what? Iâm gonna kiss you right back. So whaddya say? You, me, my chew toy and endless adventures full of snuggles and fun? I canât wait to have you as my new sidekick so please say yes. Pretty pretty please with dog treats on top? Freddy is about 2 years old and is a petite 43lbs.
name: FREDDY

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption at ACCT Philly !!! MILLIE - A40160916 Intake Type: Surrender Weight: 47lbs Medical Observation: (12/06) Hair Loss on Hind End Back Legs + Top of Head and Tail Poss Partum Pressure Sores Skin Issues Behavior Observation: Per Previous Owner - "Behavior 5. Describe behavior and personality in the home: Hyperactive, affectionate, playful 6. Interactions with children (ages): A little rough with small children 7. Interaction with large/small dogs and cats: None 8. Has this animal ever been boarded or crated (for how long): 5 hours a day" (vet staff 12/07) social but over threshold during exam, high pitched bark cries and trying to get out of exam room, but did engage with handlers, allowed brief restraint for quick assessment, easy to leash from kennel, placed blue dot on check in sticker to allow for walks This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Millie

description:
Tacoâs Woof-Facts

Male, Chihuahua, 2 years old, 7 lbs

Kisses and tail wags, oh boy â dame un beso!

Sweetie pie, enjoys being held, sitting on your lap and playtime

Gets along fabulously with other dogs, especially loves his dear canine friend, Daisy

Crate trained; good doggie manners, walks well on a leash

Quick Introduction to Taco

Hola! Iâm Taco, and my name has a story behind it: I was rescued on National Taco Day, and for me, that was the best day ever! Also, did you know that the Chihuahua
is the smallest breed of dog and is named after a state in Mexico? Therefore, youâll hear me say some words in Spanish as I tell you about myself. I promise, none of these things Iâve just mentioned have a
nything to do with the Chihuahua who starred in the Taco Bell commercials â we are not related (although, I have to admit, he is quite as adorable as I am). Iâm an active, little tyke â who loves to play, give kisses, be held, and find a spot right on your lap when weâre taking a siesta together. My tail is always wagging in an effort to show you how happy I am. Iâm crate-trained, and it only takes me a few minutes to settle in before I sleep right through the night like an angel. I get along great with all the other dogs, and I have an extra-special BFF named Daisy, who is my canine sibling (we are not blood related, but we are siblings in all other ways, through and through). I have good house manners, have gone through obedience training, and have learned how to make my little legs strut my stuff while walking on a leash with the grace of a salsa dancer. Iâm the kind of doggie who aims to please, so I make it a point to excel in all these areas. Please read on so you can learn more about me â your potential muchachito!

Tacoâs Background

About a year ago, somehow I became a stray and was on the streets all alone. I ended up walking into a hair salon of all places at an attempt to get off the streets and find help. It was a great strategy because thatâs when Rescue Haven was contacted, and I soon became a foster dog in their rescue group. I was quickly adopted and was living in a home with another doggie named Daisy (sheâs my bestie who I told you about). We thought all was going well, until, unbeknownst to us, something happened to our family structure. Then to our surprise, Daisy and I were returned to Rescue Haven â due to no fault of our own, I will emphasize â which leaves us looking for a new family. And this time, we want to make sure that we find our true âforeverâ family. And mark my words, Iâll look forward to celebrating National Taco Day each year with my forever family as well tell each other âYo Quiero Muchoâ!

Tacoâs Forever Home

After reading this, Iâm sure youâre just as excited about National Taco Day as I am, since now you understand why thatâs such an important milestone in my life! Iâll be great company for many types of people and households. I can sit on your lap while weâre watching TV, give you kisses, wag my tail, and, without a doubt, go with you on walks as I show you my smooth salsa moves. And if you are ready for double the fun, you can adopt my bestie Daisy too, so we can stay together forever. Then we can play, play; love, love, rest, rest play, play, love, love, rest, rest, and repeat, repeat!

Please fill out an adoption application with Rescue Haven and make sure to tell themâ¦ Yo Quiero Taco! And donât forget about my BFF, Daisy! I love her mucho!
name: Taco ~ Wags & Kisses! ~ Bonded with Daisy

description:
Hi! My name is Perfect Pup Pup and I am looking for a loving, forever home.  I was rescued from the side of the road in Puerto Rico where people drive too fast.  The road is at the edge of El Yunque and it's in the jungle where dogs are dumped, hit by cars and killed there all the time.  His rescuer fed him some food on the side of the road and he would not let go of his leg and stayed in the street til his rescuer took him. My rescuer loved and cared for me until I was ready to take my liberation flight.

My foster family in Bedford, New York says I am a SUPER sweet dog :). I love to run around in the backyard and I am super playful .  I also love to relax on the couch and cuddle after I am done playing :)).  I walk well on a leash too :)).

I am 2 years old, 60 lbs., neutered, fully vetted, vaccinated and microchipped.

If you are interested in learning more about me please email merylwright@aol.com.

Can't wait to meet you.  Love and Kisses Perfect Pup Pup :))
name: Pup Pup

description:
11/23/18

So I would love to share with you about this sweet boy.  Although he had a rough start, he truly has acclimated very well in his current foster home.  He truly thinks he belongs in our pack.  He is dog friendly, loves to play, and occasionally loves to carry around my shoes.  He truly makes me giggle.  He loves his dog bed, is house trained, enjoys taking walks and loves his toys.  He still has sparse hair on certain parts of his body, but after many vet appointments I believe this will be the best he will be.  

Although it will make me cry when he leaves, he is now ready to find a home that he can call his own and be spoiled and loved like he truly deserves.  


7/21/18

Alex was one of the 13 from a 911 call we got in early April.  He was found in deplorable conditions with many other dogs.
Alex has had shots and worming . He is heart worm positive and was treated 4/24 and 4/25.
He is doing  great .
He is a 5 yr old neutered terrier mix.
He loves attention and  gets along good with others.  He had a negative skin scrapping .Vet says seborrhea and the previous bad living conditions. He is looking better.

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Alex Talbot- a precious gem!

description:
Douglas Lonestar & His Brother, Cedric Lonestar were recently saved from an East Texas Shelter and are safe in a foster home. Cedric and Douglas are learning how to be a part of a family & are using a doggy door to go out & potty. Douglas is a very sweet boy and is gently for a pup his age. He was around my 11 year old for photos yesterday & did extremely well. We are learning more about Douglas & will add more information soon. Douglas has a bit more white on his chest- it comes up his neck- so beautiful. I will add a photo of them together- unless you look very closely, they appear to be twins.

Thank you for considering adding DOUGLAS LONESTAR to your family. Apply to adopt at WWW.EHRDOGS.ORG today!
