description:
Sweet Kickers is looking for a new foster or forever home!

Kickers is a sweet senior, approx 9 years old, who still has a lot of love to share. Faithful Friends saved her from a shelter partner when she was too upset and shut down in her kennel to show her friendly, happy side! Take a walk with Kicker and you'll be sure to fall in love! Looking for a co-pilot? Kickers enjoys car rides too! She's also ok with movie night and lots of comfy couch time. Cuddling is her favorite thing, and lots of petting, too!

Kickers is looking for a more relaxed home environment and would do best with older children, and as the only pet. She's learning how to be a family dog again, and is even learning to play fetch.

The best way to see if a dog is a good fit for your family is to visit the shelter and spend some time with them in person and speak with one of our adoption counselors. For more information, please email taylor@faithfulfriends.us or call 302-290-2180, today!
name: Kicker

description:
Our Yeti has yet to be noticed even though he is a handsome German Shepherd mix. His size may be big, but Yeti is a big mush at heart. Like his namesake, the Abominable Snowman, our handsome hunk is all white and always has a big grin on his face. He is super smart and already sits on command. Yeti just celebrated his third birthday and is looking forward to frolicking with you outdoors. He lives up to the phrase, âbigger is better.â  


You love animals, but canât adopt?  Come on down to the shelter and choose the cat or dog that you would like to sponsor.  For as little as $20 per month, you can sponsor a pet and help pay for the cost of their care while they stay at the shelter.
name: Yeti

description:
Meet Max! He is a ball-chasing, attention-loving, breathtakingly gorgeous boy. A perfect day for Max includes playing with some friends (2- or 4-legged), going for a jog, stopping by a training class, then snuggling up for a nap. Max prefers not to be overwhelmed by young kids so he asks that his forever siblings show respect for him so he can give it back.

If you like going on adventures and want a best friend to join in on the fun, from hiking to drive-in movies, you might be the perfect match for Maxie Man! Visit him online at ehrdogs.org and fill out an application today!

Check out his video below from when he was a younger pup!
name: Max SCAS

description: Teeny tiny little FRANK needs a FOSTER or ADOPTER to SAVE HIM!!  FRANK is a 5 year old neutered male & he is dog friendly! If you are interested in FOSTERING or ADOPTING please call / text message HSARC 908-892-8166 or email HunterdonSomersetARC@gmail.com
name: FRANK

description:
They donât come any cuter than our sweet boy, Scooby! This 4 year old Pit mix walks beautifully on leash and sometimes carries a ball in his mouth while doing so which makes him even more adorableâ¦.if thatâs possible!

Scooby was rescued from a situation where all he knew was life on a chain. Despite being let down by humans, he is an amazing dog who shows nothing but love. He did well with other dogs and cats in a foster home in Tennessee, but would do best in a home with older children.

Scooby is a volunteer favorite, and itâs time he starts a new life with a family that will love and respect him. He is up to date on vaccinations, neutered and microchipped. If youâd like to give Scooby his second chance, please fill out an application www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to mention his nameâ¦..SCOOBY STEELE!!!
name: Scooby Steele

description:
Jordan is an energetic 1 yr old Australian Cattle dog mix who weighs 29 lbs.  He is playful, gets along well with other dogs and loves to run around in the yard. He is loves his toys and going on long walks.  He would do well in active family. 

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.
name: Jordan

description:
Our rescue has a litter of 6 Lab Mix Pups who are 6-8 weeks old. Our rescue has several mix breed pups available for adoption. There utd with shots, dewormed and will be fixed when old enough. We will be working daily with them on housetraining, cratetraining and leashtraining. Each would enjoy a fenced in yard at their new home. They do well with other dogs, cats and gentle kids. They will make great family dogs and are typically easy to train. If interested in adopting a puppy from this litter please email us at all4thedogsrescue@verizon.net

Adoption Fee is $549. Which includes spay/neuter and a puppy vaccine package!
name: Cameron

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Britney was rescued from Fulton County Animal Control in Georgia with her 3 siblings and brought into the Rescue Dogs Rock NYC family. This little family came to rescue with demodex (non contagious type) mange and are currently with our veterinary partner receiving treatment. Britney will be up to date on shots (age appropriate) and spayed when medically released to do so and prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Britney, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Britney

description:
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance will transport within reasonable distance. Dahlia is being fostered in VA.
Dahlia was a stray in western Virginia and ended up in a shelter. The shelter contacted the Blind Dog Rescue, and Dahlia was brought to her Virginia BDRA foster home.

Dahlia (Dally) is an 8 pound apricot poodle. Because she was a stray, her age is unknown, so the vet took a guess, and said maybe she is as young as ten, maybe as old as fifteen. Dally has no teeth, and is blind, due to a cataract, in one eye. She has some vision in the other eye, where there is also a cataract. Currently she needs no eye medication. She can hear very very little. She had an ear infection when she first arrived but that was treated and her ears are better. She has tested positive for Lyme and was prescribed a month of Doxycycline. She has many little lumps and bumps on her body, as old poodles tend to have, and they are itchy to her. She has started on a trial of Apoquel to see if that helps her out. She also has a sinus arrhythmia. In addition, she has a fistula in her mouth, and it has likely been there for a long time. Currently that is being checked out, and decisions will be made soon about what to do; a fistula can cause food to go up into the sinus area, and that causes trouble. Dally likes to eat, but does a lot of sneezing and rubbing and scratching after she eats, indicating discomfort.

Dally arrived at her foster home seemingly unaware of what housetraining was all about. She has improved, although is still not reliable, so she wears a diaper at times in her foster home. She walks pretty well on a leash, and enjoys being outside. She gets along with the other dogs in the house, and loves attention from her foster parents. She is a good eater and settles into a crate at night to sleep.
As with all dogs, Dally needs close supervision if young children are around.

With most any rescue dog, the past history is unknown so the future cannot be predicted. What is known is Dahlia is very deserving of lots of love and care! Please consider adopting Dally once her medical hold is over! 
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.
name: Dahlia: on hold (VA)

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, Catahoula Leopard Dog
description: Catalina is one of the most gorgeous dogs, she has such unique coloring which makes this sweetheart even more appealing! She was rescued from the shelter when she was found as a stray. She was really skinny but she's been slowly gaining weight and then she will be spayed. She tested fine with other dogs but once she's all better we will do another dog test to confirm. She's good  in a crate, playful when she's outside, and would love a forever home to stay warm in and know she will never end up on the streets again. She will be microchipped and up to date on vaccines as well. Please email enb313@gmail.com for an application.
name: Catalina

description:
1-2 years old

Sparky is a cute, friendly, and sweet boy!  He is very calm and affectionate, and loves to play with toys!  Sparky seems to get along with everyone, and would do well in most homes!

**This dog is at the Ocean County Animal Facility North located at 615 Fremont Ave, Jackson NJ (off of Hope Chapel Rd). Adoption hours 1-4 p.m. 7 days a week & wed 1-6:30 p.m. Contact the facility at (732) 657-8086. All dogs are spayed/neutered, micro-chipped, and have age appropriate shots.**

To adopt our dogs you must come to the facility with your entire family, including dogs, to meet with our staff and the dog you are interested in.
name: Sparky

description: Roy is a beautiful 3 year old German Shepherd boy looking for his forever home. He came to us from Egypt with skin issues that exposed bones in his legs and paws. Our specialists have done everything in their power to heal his infections and he is now ready to be adopted. Roy is working with our trainer on basic commands and getting used to having other dogs around. He is a very sweet boy who loves to cuddle. He will make an amazing addition to any home.
name: Roy

description: Tyson is a four year-old Border Collie mix. He lived his life on the end of a chain until being rescued from Puerto Rico. He is just beginning to experience all of the good things in life. If interested,  please call or text Gizela at 201-655-5059. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Tyson

description: Sierra has an outgoing personality and would be great for the active family, but she would need to be the only pet.
name: Sierra

description:
Lion is a extra large adult Akita that comes to us from a Amish farm in PA.  He is easy going, crate trained, and social with all people. This big guy loves to ride in the car and go for walks, however he can be bouncy at times on leash so he would need a strong owner.  We feel Lion would do best in a home as a only pet, and would prefer a home with a secured fenced in back yard. This is a wonderful boy who is now looking for that wonderful home to call his own. 

Are you interested in meeting this big boy? Please go to www.bigeastakitarescue.org and fill out an online adoption application for him!
name: Lion

description:
Looking for a great family dog who loves children. Please take a look at sweet Nova who needs a new home. Here is what her owner says about her: Nova is kind and friendly to everyone she meets, dogs and people alike. She is housebroken, knows commands such as: Sit, paw, other paw, down. Nova currently lives in a house with a two year old and five year old and those are her best friends. Nova is a great dog but an even better friend - she loves cuddles and being talked to like a little baby.

Nova turned a year old on 10/5/2017. She's an energetic pup who loves nothing more than a good old squeaky ball. On summer days Nova enjoys playing with the hoses, going for a swim, nice long walks, playing with a frisbee, going to the park meeting new friends and getting the zoomies out. She'd love to be part of an active family with or without children - she sounds perfect for just about any household!

Nova is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping her owner to rehome her privately. If you would like to meet this special girl, please contact Donnei at 908-986-6524 or donnei0519@gmail.com
name: XP Nova - Elizabeth, NJ

description:
To apply:
1.  You must reside within our adoptable states: NY, NJ, CT, RI, MA, VT, NH, PA, DE, MD, VA 
2. AND you MUST submit our online application, please visit http://www.nyabandonedangels.com/adopt-or-foster-application

911! 911! PLEASE HELP US SAVE DONNIEâS LIFE!!! URGENT FOSTER HOME NEEDED!

We are desperately trying to save this nine year old male Cocker Spanielâs life! Donnie was brought to the Brooklyn Shelter as a stray, he was petrified and upon his medical intake exam, he bit a tech. He was put on a 10 day hold and now his hold is up. Because of the bite, regardless if he was frightened, he is not available for public adoption. Donnie is really a sweet boy and deserves a chance. Please HELP us SAVE HIS LIFE! We are in URGENT need of a place TODAY for Donnie to hang his leash and get some much need TLC. Please complete our online application at 
http://www.nyabandonedangels.com/adopt-or-foster-application. TIME IS OF THE ESSENCE!

SHELTER NOTES:

3/28/18: Don remains easy to handle during our sessions. He is easy to rope and bring out to the pens. He is soft and social during the interactions. He takes treats gently and shows a brief interest in tennis balls. He did balk at the rope but otherwise easily roped and returned to his kennel. -MC

3/26/18: Don was sitting at the front of his kennel when I approached. He stood up while I was unlocking the kennel door. Don was easily roped and lead into the SAFER room. Once in the room Don was easily leashed and unroped. Once off the rope Don immediately began exploring the room. Intermittently Don would approach me or my coworker and solicit attention by jumping onto our legs or giving kisses. Towards the end of the session Don was spending more and more time sitting or laying next to me and allowing me to pet his head and back. Don did not whine or shake the entire session. His body was loose and his mouth was mostly closed with a long lip. At the end of his session Don was easily unleashed, roped, and returned to his kennel. -JN

3/25/18: There is no significant changes with Don. In fact our session today was almost identical to yesterday's. He was less anxious and did not whine, but he did begin trembling at the very end of the session. I am conflicted if it was out of nervousness or if he was cold. I was petting him to the point where he was very relaxed and closing his eyes right before he began trembling, so I think it was most likely that he was just cold. This was also the only time he solicited attention from me during the session. Otherwise, he kept to himself and had a loose body and relaxed ears. He did at one point have his tail tucked, but very lightly. He also remained easy to re-rope, remove the drag, and return to his kennel.-MB

3/24/18: Don was sitting at the front of his kennel as I approached. He remains easy to rope, remove, and bring outside. He also gives no difficulty with attaching a drag leash. Once in the pens, as usual, he went straight to the last pen. He briefly sniffed around and then relived himself. He stayed in the 4th pen for the whole session, except to briefly step over the threshold. In the beginning he had a loose body and open mouth. After he relieved himself he began pacing in the pen, looking out towards the street. At this time a fellow employee was leaving the parking lot to walk a new arrival. Don went to the corner of the pen closest to where the other dog was. He then began whining and anxiously barking. Even after the other dog was out of view he sat down and stared at the street. I then noticed that he had begun trembling. I sat down next to him and began to pet him softly. He continued to tremble and would only stop briefly when startled by any noise. After a few minutes, he remained in the same position and continued trembling. I decided to end the session and began grabbing my rope, etc. At this point he walked over to me and I bent down and started petting him. He stood there and allowed me to pet him, while he closed his eyes and leaned into me. Since he seemed to enjoy it I continued for a bit. Then he got distracted and began going back to the corner of the 4th pen. I ended the session, and removed the drag, roped him, and brought him back with no problem.
name: Donnie

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Donât burst Hollyâs bubble by not coming to meet her.
Holly is an adorable, 4 1/2 yr old Bulldog mix. She Looks like a Beabull, which is a Beagle/ Bulldog mix.
Holly is housebroken, up to date on her shots and spayed.
This pretty little girl is friendly and is learning her manners.
This poor girl was found tied to a tree in a graveyard.
Great size for everyone.
Can be friendly with dogs but only tolerated them for short periods. Only fur baby would be best. Older kids. Please apply to adopt Holly in central N. J. at RescueRidge.com and text 732 546 8805 to meet her. Just look at that winning smile!
name: adopted

description:
Alona is a Belgian Malinois of 4 years old . Like all our other dogs , she also ended up in a high kill shelter .

She loves people and craves for attention . She is pleasant to have around you and likes to cuddle but is still a Malinois .

She notice everything and has a full fire in her .

Alona is ok with horses and did not really reacted on the cat but does not like other dogs near her .

To people she is an absolutely doll.

We only adopt our Malinois out when you are an experienced Malinois owner and understands the breed .

This breed are very high working dogs and need a owner who understands their needs .

As for a Malinois I have to say that Alona just only wants to please you and is an easy girl .

Alona is located in Huntington NY (Long Island)
name: Alona

description:
Meet Kaos!

Kaos is a beautiful shepherd and staffy mix who was rescued from a kill shelter in south Louisiana. She was a high heartworm positive but has completed treatment and is now ready to find her forever family!

Kaos has severe separation anxiety but is getting better. She CANNOT be crated but can be left in a room if needed. She has some resource guarding from life on the streets so would need to be fed separately. Treats and bones should probably also be given separately. 

Kaos is great with other dogs and cats and is very low key. She likes to spend time with her foster momma and is a bit of a Velcro dog. We think she would make a great therapy dog who could visit hospitals and nursing homes.

Applications can be found at www.snarranimalrescue.org
name: Kaos

description: Lovely, loving sweet senior girl.  Needs slow introductions to other animals     Diva gets better and better..    LIke fine wine .....   she gets better with time
name: DIVA

description:
Meet Farrah. What a special girl she is. Found emaciated, sick and pregnant, then nurtured back to health by her Foster Mom, Farrah delivered 11 puppies, but sadly none of them survived. As fate would have it, 8 little orphans desperately needed a Mom. They were put together and Farrah fed them, and loved them until they were old enough to be on their own. We are so looking forward to the forever that this girl so deserves.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Farrah

description:
Amarissa, skin over bones , left on the concrete floor in a noisy shelter with her 10 little puppies in a small children's swimming pool next to her .

Almost defeated, barely alive was she giving all her milk and the last energy she had in her frail body to her children .

Broken eyes were staring in the camera ....there was no second to loose and she became ours . Her puppies were fast adopted but as always the mothers are standing alone .

One by one she had to say goodbye to her darlings who all found a good home . The attention went now all to her . She had to gain weight . Her skin was dragging on the floor ...

We promised her that soon she would feel much better ...

Today Amarissa is blooming in the young lady she truly is .

This beauty is 3 years old and is an absolutely heartbreaker . She will lean against your legs and will make sure that she protects you . On the bench she lays on your lap . She is a complete picture perfect German shepherd .

She only does not like other dogs and cats .

We are looking for a family that will truly loves her and never will abandon her .

This girl suffered so much and it is time that she deserves the best in life .

Amarissa is located in Huntington NY .

If you would like to be her new family then please go to our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com and fill in the adoption application
name: Amarissa

description:
Sweet little Marilyn was surrendered to rescue by her owner because she had a high risk pregnancy & her owner could not care for her. But now Marilyn is ready to find a forever family of her own! She is about 7 months old & only weighs 10 pounds although we believe when full grown that she will be about 20 pounds. She gets along with other dogs & is crate trained, too.

If you'd like to meet this bundle of sweetness, please fill out an application & be sure to indicate that you'd like to meet MARILYN TEXAS!
name: Marilyn Texas

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hansel here! Waiting for you to adopted me. I have to tell you I am a little shy. If you take a chance on me and are patient I won't let you down. I am good with cats, dogs, people. I am good with adults but little people are a little much for my tiny self to handle. I am just hanging out waiting for you to go to allmuttsmatter.org and fill out my adoption application. See ya soon Hansel
name: Hansel

description:
Emerald, (Emmy for short), really is a jewel. She smiles and does a little dance when she sees you coming and sings a sad little song when you leave. Sheâs such a dear 4 to 5 year old Chihuahua!  Her favorite thing to do is to sit in your lap or lean against your chest and nap. She may be a bit shy at first, but she warms up quickly once she gets love, attention and yummy treats! She is fine with other dogs when introduced in a calm and friendly environment. Emerald would be perfect for an older couple or a home with older children who know how to treat her kindly. At a mere 14 pounds, Emmy may be a tiny jewel, but she outshines all the rest with fun and enthusiasm! (posted 10/24, RM)


**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**

As a Celebrate Home Dog, the total fee for Emerald, which includes adoption, microchip and transport, is only $225.00.  This isn't because sheâs worth less.  It's because sheâs worth more.  We want dogs like Emerald in your home as quickly as possible. She has been waiting too long, and she needs her own bed (or yours) in her own forever home.  More importantly, she needs your love.

Weight Scale:   Small =  less than 25
                       Medium = 26-60
                         Large =  61-100
                               XL = 100+
name: Emerald   Lower Fee!  A Real Gem!

description:
RESCUED, from under a bridge in a rural farming community in western NC.

HANDSOME purebred Beagles: BRISCOE(adopted), ANDY & BARNEY(adopted) had been seen/heard running in the woods, hunting and baying for well over a month. They had been taking shelter under a bridge and living off scraps the local folks were leaving out for them. Obviously, they had been abandoned/dumped by their past owner in the area. A bit skinny, skittish and tired, but otherwise in pretty good health. So, they must be decent 'pleasure hunters', but not good enough for past owner to want to keep feeding them. They are ALL very sweet and friendly, but hand-shy of humans, so this says a lot about their past owner/life. They want to trust, and are very happy to hang out with their person when they are certain that you/their human are trustworthy and mean them no harm/pain, ALL are outgoing, happy and have a sweet, gentle demeanor, & they LOVE to run & play!!!

ANDY: dob 08/22/13-10" tri-colored(tan and black with white), weighs 16lbs

Will make excellent pet for any single person or early retirees, or small families with respectful children and a secured fenced-in backyard. This pup is in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until their fur-ever person(s)/family have been approved. At which time, we require the full adoption fee via paypal.com and will arrange for your new fur-child's transport via Happy Dogs OR Lifesavers Rescued Pet Transport service to points along the eastern seaboard as far as Manchester, NH(they deliver to: VA, DC, MD, DE, NJ=NJTnpk>Vince Lombardi svc plaza, Long Island, RyeNY, JohnstonRI, ManchesterNH and AlbanyNY, as well as AllentownPA and then down the I-81S corridor>WythevilleVA).

Transport fees: $125 as far as NYC/Long Island & $140 to all points N of NYC/LI as far as ManchesterNH and AlbanyNY.

Adoption fee: $150(includes neuter, micro-chip, Parvo/Distemper/Lepto, 1yr Rabies and Bordatella vax, current on heart worm & flea/tick prevention, parasite-free, all medical paperwork including vet's surgery notes and current health certificate, Martingale collar and 6' leash, beef knee cap, 3lb bag of current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health' salmon & potato, 'RESCUED DOGS ROCK car magnet and 2 'pet alert' wallet cards.

To apply to adopt one of these handsome little gentleman, please complete the application provided at: www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ and send to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com, at your most earliest convenience. Gets along GREAT with other dogs of all sizes, ages and gender and RESPECTFUL children...will test with cats upon request. We will be happy to send more videos/pix of this awesome little man, upon request.
name: ANDY

description:
12/21/18
Amber did great with heartworm treatment and is now in her recovery period. She is attending events and her foster would be happy to answer any questions for preapproved adopters. Applications can be found at www.wagsrescue.com

12/10/18
Amber is scheduled for HW treatment this week. She is a 4 year old spayed female and she will be ready for adoption post HW treatment. She will need to take it easy for 30 days after treatment. She currently lives with other dogs as well as a cat. She is crate trained and housbroken in her current foster home (as long as she stays on her routine / schedule). She is very active but also loves to cuddle. She is good with older kids but no young children as she has a tendency to play bite. 


11/23/18

Amber is a 4 year old Boston Terrier mix from Georgia. She has the energy of a two year old and is very active with her foster parents and siblings. She loves to play and once she has tired her self out she is a big cuddle bug . Amber is crate trained and on a strict schedule does fairly well. After any long naps the must go out to avoid  an accident.  Otherwise she is good. Amber is up to date on her vaccines, spayed and ready to go to her forever home. 

She lives with a kitty that she will playful chase but corrects easy.

Weights 20 lbs!!

11/4/18

Amber came from McIntosh AC in GA. 
She is a 4 yr old spayed Boston mix. She has had shots and worming and is heart worm positive and will be treated in PA. She is friendly and gets along good with others.

Amber loves to run and play.  Her friend Chase (Has a separate posting ) was pulled by Wags too!!

Weights 19lbs!
 

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Amber Talbot-black beauty, the petite version!

description: Meet Scooby! Scooby is an adorable Shepherd mix that weighs around 62 lbs and is around a year old. Scooby is a smaller shepherd and had only days left in a high kill shelter when Charlie's rescued him from being euthanized. Scooby had a foster lined up that fell through and after being pulled he stayed in boarding in the South for 2 months. After getting a foster lined up in the north, Scooby's foster again fell through and he is now in boarding in the north. Scooby desperately needs a place to call home where he isn't getting bounced from place to place. Scooby just wants to be loved and has never had anyone in his life that has cared about him. Scooby needs a family that is patient with him and will love him with all their heart. Scooby loves people, is very affectionate, and absolutely loves belly rubs. Scooby gets along with dogs that are smaller than him and needs to have a slow introduction. Scooby is very much a shepherd and wants to have someone to be his and lead the way. We recommend a skilled adopter with experience with the breed. Scooby doesn't like cats and will bark at them. Scooby is great in the car and is learning quickly how to walk on a leash and he is very strong. Scooby did great getting a bath. Scooby would love to have a big fenced in yard where he could run and play as he is a very high energy puppy. Scooby needs an active family with that would give him lots of exercise and leadership. Scooby is a sweet, smart, silly boy hoping for his forever home. Scooby is fully vetted, up to date on all his shots and neutered. If you are interested in fostering or adopting Scooby please go to our website at charliescrusaders.org and fill out an application.
name: Scooby

description: If you are looking for a real head turner, then Diesel is your guy. He is a large black cur mouth mix who is about 4 and a half years old whose long legs make him stand out. Besides his friendly nature, Diesel is just an easy going guy who likes to hang out with his human buddies. Also Diesel likes other dogs and is house-trained. When it comes to walks, wearing a harness will help him walk beside you and stay focused on where he is headed. You can't go wrong with this handsome pup. Please come and visit him at the PSPCA and see if he is the pup who will bring you joy.
name: Diesel

description:
Fidget is a 1 1/2 year old Cattle Dog mix that is looking for a new family.
He will do best with a dog savvy owner that is experienced with active breeds and has no small children.
Stop by and visit him today.
We are open daily from 12 - 4 pm with extended hours until 7 pm on Weds.

To view more pets for adoption or make a donation, visit www.srasnj.org. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram @somersetregionalanimalshelter
name: Fidgit

description: Neko is a 4 month old male Shiba Inu mix who weighs 15 lbs. These adorable puppies were rescued after being an "unwanted" litter and we just don't know how someone could ever dump these babies. They are such sweet,wonderful puppies who would love to go to a forever home with another dog. These get along great with other dogs and love people too. It seems as though these pups have had little training so we are working on potty training as well as walking on a leash but they are learning so quickly. Please consider opening your heart and home to one or both of these pups. If you are interested in adopting, please submit an adoption application on our website www.justice-rescue.com
name: Neko

description: Pam Ewing is a sweet and beautiful girl. She loves hanging with her humans but also loves time playing with other dogs. Pam recently had a litter of puppies and they are all Brooklyn bound. To adopt or foster, visit badassbk.com.
name: Pam Ewing

description:
People loving (good with strangers) and well mannered 4-year-old American Stafford Mix looking for her FOREVER home to snuggle in front of the fire with you.   A true!!! cuddle bug.

This great dog has just been named the "Official Face of Dog Fighting Awareness" for the State of NJ.  We rescued her from a dog fighter using her for bait. She wouldn't fight back so they dumped her!

She is housebroken, crate trained, doesn't jump, dig or chew (except sticks).  Sweet Pea is very very low maintenance but because she is low and stocky with a powerful body like a bowling ball, she can be too much for toddlers and they could be knocked over.  

She enjoys water: REALLY ENJOYS SWIMMING!! in a lake or pool. 

If you are looking for a walking partner she is also excellent on leash. Also loves the car.
. 
Fenced yard required for adoption. No electric fences or "dog pens".  If you are a renter or part of an HOA, we require written permission from landlord and/or HOA to have a "pittie" type dog.

Knows basic commands, sit, down, paw, stay 

Learn more about her at www.njafa.org/sweet-pea/
Fully vaccinated, spayed & micro-chipped.
No kitty cats.
name: SweetPea

description:
Our very special 10 month old lab/Rottie mix Kelly was trapped  after spending her whole life outside as a "guard dog" and roaming the streets of a local inner city with her brother.  She was never touched or socialized- her only human contact has been her "owners" tossing dog food on the ground out the back door of the house and she would jump their fence and roam the streets daily.  When we heard their story we knew she and her brother were just the type of challenge we love to work with @ Second Chance Pet Adoption League and we agreed to take them in if and when the dedicated volunteers that brought their story to our attention could trap them.  Kelly was so hungry she went right in the trap as soon as it was set, and we are hoping her brother will be safe with us soon as well.  Kelly is scared and shut down and doesn't know how to bond to people at this point but is getting a little more comfortable each day with the help of her doggie friends in her foster home.  She LOVES to play with other dogs and comes alive in their presence and will need a multi-dog home. Kelly will be  looking for a very special person to prove themselves worthy of her trust- could it be you?  Email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested.  .We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East next to 5 Star Car Wash (formerly Boulder Car Wash) in Morris Plains (Denville on GPS).  To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Kelly- LOVES DOGS!

description:
Luna is a 2 year old female pitbull mix. She's very sweet and affectionate. She has been around children but would do well living with adults only. Should be the only pet! She loves and needs to run and play a lot!!!! 
To learn more about this dog, please email Petnanny2000@aol.com and complete this short adoption application. Someone will get back to you within 24 hours. Thanks!
name: Luna

description:
Say Hello to Parker!  Parker is an estimated 8 year old Poodle  or Poodle Mix, who came into Bichon Rescue because heâs little, white and has curly hair.  When he arrive at his foster home, his foster mom immediately recognized that little docked Poodle tail which didnât stop wagging, despite his deplorable condition.

Parker was found on the streets of Brooklyn as a stray.  He was filthy, horribly matted and his breath would knock you over.  Luckily for Parker, Bichon Rescue of NNJ was contacted by the NYC Animal Control to see if we could help him.  We instantly said, âYes!â  

Parker arrived in his foster home on December 3rd and he immediately got booked for a spa treatment.  After he was freshly groomed, he went to the vet for a check up, blood work and to schedule a dental and neuter.  He was cleared for surgery and had both procedures on December 10th.  Poor Parker lost quite a few teeth, but his breath is sweet again and his tail is still wagging.  He is also eating like a trouper, although seems to prefer chicken over dog food.

Parkerâs left eye has a cataract, but he can see just fine as his right eye is in excellent shape, but both should be monitored over the course of his life.  Itâs an easy eye test which can be done in minutes during his regular vet exam.

Parker is mostly a quiet dog who is friendly to both people and other dogs.  He is slightly shy, but quickly warms up once he knows heâs going to get petted or get treats.  He has been through a lot in the last month, so his house-training skills will need to be reinforced, but heâs doing very well at his foster home when taken out regularly.  Parker walks nicely on a leash and is also very good in the car.  Heâs patient while his foster mom runs errands and relaxes in his own special doggie car seat.  Parker is an all around easy going dog; affectionate, but not needy.  He would be fine as a single dog or a nice addition as a playmate.  Have an open lap and heart this Holiday Season? Ask for Parker!

If you are interested in adopting Parker please fill out an application at this link:  http://www.bichonrescuenj.com/bichon-frise-rescue-nnj-adoption-app.html

If you have already filled out OUR application, please message me with your email address and I will look it up.

You should be within 3 hours driving distance of Northern NJ or Poughkeepsie NY to adopt as we do not ship or fly dogs. Adoption will require application, home check and donation.
name: Parker

description: Ollie is a sweet and gentle soul. He loves to lounge but also loves to play! His goofy personality and unique voice will be sure to capture your heart. He can be a bit picky with who he chooses to be in his "space" at times, or somewhat guarding of his toys, so we would recommend a home with no children. Fill out an application today to meet Ollie! pawscrossedny.org
name: Ollie

description: Jitterbug is a whopper of a dog. She is sweet, gentle, loving , calm older girl who loves attention and affection. She came in as a stray and her body had quite a few lump, bumps and sores on it. She is healing though and is quickly becoming a shelter favorite. Jitterbug is extremely smart. While she seems to be crate trained and is calm in a crate she doesn't like her kennel. She figured out how to get her door open to get out of her kennel into her outside run so a home that has secure doors and either a fence or owner willing to walk her is needed. She has tested well with cats and dogs although she likes to be in charge. please consider giving this older girl a warm, loving home.For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt
name: Jitterbug

description:
CARAWAY is a great big goofy baby with a heart of sugar. This lovely hound mix is about 7 months old, 35 lbs, and a little bit of a nervous nelly in the city but charms the socks off of everyone she meets. Caraway is a super smart fast learner, excited to meet new friends at every turn, will probably be in the 40s weight wise full grown, and needs to be in an active home ideally with another dog to play with and to guide the way. Her foster mom says: âCaraway is a sweet energetic puppy. She was very nervous when she left her last foster parent, but she settled in immediately at our home. She befriended our big dog, Bronx, and they have been the best of buddies. She had some bad habits like counter surfing that we are working on, and she is about 90% potty trained. She has learned to sit, stay, come, and working on retrieving. She has learned to sit and wait for her breakfast and dinner. She will wait for food until released with the word 'free.' It has been helpful for her to learn by watching Bronx, as he is well trained. She is very curious around our cat, Lila. I hope to get a photo of the two of them soon. She has some separation issues at the moment but I think that with time she will feel more secure. She is crate trained at night to sleep. She loves to cuddle and will fall asleep almost immediately. She spent the Thanksgiving holidays with us and was affectionate with everyone who visited. She loves to be picked up for some reason and cuddled but I try not to make a habit of it. She is going to make a family really happy.â Interested in adopting? Submit an application at socialteesnyc.org! 

Get the latest Social Tees news by following us on Instagram (@socialteesnyc) or Facebook. Find more adoptable pets, FAQs, and info on ways to contribute to the rescue world at socialteesnyc.org.

This animal is not at the Social Tees office (325 East 5th Street) â all of our dogs and cats are in foster homes while they wait to find their forever families. :) If youâd like to apply to adopt this pet, please complete an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org.

PLEASE NOTE: Because we are a small team and receive hundreds of applications each week, we are unable to respond to every application and every inquiry email, but we do our best. Please have patience! If your application is approved, you will for sure hear from us. If you have questions, please take a look at the Adoption and Fostering FAQs etc. on our website as all common questions are answered there. Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we work to save these innocent lives!!

Adoption fees apply and cover spay/neuter surgery; up to date on vaccines at time of adoption; microchip; treated with defleaing, deworming, and demiting medication as necessary; and often more.
name: CARAWAY

description:
Meet â Clifford.. the Big Sweet Dog â I am 22 lbs of entertainment! I am approx. 12 week male Golden Retriever mix. My foster family loves how well I listen and get along with all the kids, cats ,dogs and visitors stopping by . I sleep all night in my crate but love my snuggles too! I will make a great family member! Applications available for me at http://puppiesandmorerescue.org/adopt/ 
Completed apps can be emailed to lisahatpuppiesandmore4@gmail.com

Adoption donation of $365 includes age appropriate vaccinations and spay/neuter when pup is approximately 5-6 months of age.  
Puppies and More Rescue is a registered 501c3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible.

*** Breed determination in most cases is often based on the limited history typically available for most rescued animals.  We try to be as accurate as possible with the information we have and the Rescue assessment of the pup.
name: Clifford

description:
Hi my name is Snoopy!  I am an energetic, playful, affectionate 6 year old, Shiba Inu /Blue Heeler/Lab mix.  I am neutered and up to date on vaccinations.  I love playing with my squeaky toys.  I am a bit nervous and need to be adopted by someone that will give me time to adjust to a new environment.   I really want someone to love me and spend a lot of time with me.     If you are interested in meeting me, please stop by the Animal Welfare Society located at 40 S. Rte. 47 in Cape May Court House, NJ 08210.  You can also email us at CMCAWS@Yahoo.com
You can either call the shelter at 609-465-3403 or call 609-408-8570

Email us at CMCAWS@Yahoo.com
name: Snoopy

description:
Meet Ember! This beautiful big eared baby is going to grow up to be a beautiful dog! She is currently 5-6 months and 30ish pounds, so she isn't going to be a big girl, probably 40-45 pounds when fully grown. We don't know what her breed is, but we can tell you she is one adorable little girl!

Ember is full of life and love, and she adores all of the foster dogs in her home. She also is scared of cats and doesn't chase them when she sees them on walks. Speaking of walks, Ember isn't great on a leash, but she is learning! She is also crate trained house broken, and non destructive with toys, which is good for a puppy her age. This adorable big eared, soft girl is currently in New Jersey and available for meet and greets! Ember is a precious girl who is ready to be adopted, and can't wait to find a family to call her own. If you are that family, please apply!
name: Ember

A home with older kids (age 13 yrs. +), an inescapable fenced in yard for family playtime (she shouldn't be left unattended) with dog experienced parents are on her " must have" wish list.

description:
12/13/18

Norlina is still searching for her forever home.  At approximately 5 Â½ years old, this cuddle bug is a perfect family dog- she is house trained and roams her foster home all day without being crated.  Norlina is not a fan of small dogs, cats, or other dogs that jump on her.  She enjoys the laid-back couch cuddling lifestyle with the occasional game of tug-o-war.  She is a little shy at first but opens up within the first few minutes.  She would make a great fit for a family with children of all ages because she NEVER jumps on anyone and likes to snuggle up on the couch.

Norlina would love to find her forever home for the new year J If you have any questions about this pretty pittie princess, her foster is happy to answer them.


11/27/18

Norlina here for another update!  My foster Mom says Iâm a total cuddle bug- but I donât understandâ¦ I thought I was a dog??  When we are inside I like to cuddle, play tug-o-war with my furry foster sister, and chew on my toys.  My foster Mom says I follow her around a lot, but thatâs just because Iâm really interested in whatâs going on and I like to be involved!  When we go outside I know that means I go potty and I recently learned that I like the snow!  My current neighbor has an outdoor cat and sometimes I try to chase him but thatâs just because I want to have more furry friendsâ¦  Hopefully my next home doesnât have any small dogs or cats.  I do LOVE small humans though!  My foster Mom always says Iâm a good girl indoors and outdoors, so she lets me stay out of my crate when she goes to work.  I like to greet everyone who comes in our door with my wiggle but and I NEVER jump on new guests.  Come meet me at an adoption event or contact WAGS rescue to set up a meet and greet!  Applicants must meet bully breed criteria (homeowner with a canine vet reference, bully breed experience preferred). 

11/21/18 

New pictures!!

NO LITTLE DOGS PLS!!  


10/15/18

Hi! Norlina here! Or as my foster mom calls me âperfect pittie princess!â  In normal pittie fashion- I like to be with the humans. Sometimes we cuddle, sometimes we play, and sometimes they take me for car rides.  I have fun with all the humans (big & small) and I like to play with other dogs. My foster Mom keeps reminding me that Iâm not suppose to chase the neighborâs outdoor cat, but it seems like a fun game to me! I get really excited when I see my leash because that means it time to go outside!  I really like it outside when itâs sunny; Iâm not a big fan of the rain though. I like to be inside too because that usually means cuddling!  Since Iâm house broken and so well behaved, Iâm allowed to stay out of the crate all day and night. I spend most of my day looking out the window keeping watch on the neighborhood and my night cuddling with my foster sister without getting up.



The cool ladies at the vet give me treats and say Iâm pretty.  They also said Iâm spayed, vetted and vaccinated as age appropriate and available for adoption through Wags Rescue and Referral but BULLY CRITERIA applies.

4/21/18
Norlina is a 5 year old spayed pittie mix that weighs about 55 pounds. Norlina came to wags after volunteers found her injured in a southern high kill shelter. The shelter was full and Norlina was out of time, the rescue got her to the vet and this beautiful girl was quickly on her road to recovery.  She has spent everyday since proving what a treasure she is. A happy girl who adores people, Norlina wants nothing more than to be close to her people. It doesnât matter to her if you want to go for a long walk, play outside or just hang out on the couch and watch TV she is ready to be your partner. She is great in a crate and with supervision she has been good in the House.  Norlina is dog friendly but will be perfectly happy to be your one and only too.  If you have any questions about this pretty pittie princess her foster is happy to answer them.

*Norlina has been heartworm treated

Norlina  is spayed, vetted and vaccinated as age appropriate and available for adoption through Wags Rescue and Referral

description:
Hi there!  My name is Lilly and I am a âsweet as sugarâ girl that needs to find a new home.  Penny Angels recently rescued me and my 3 siblings from a home in New Jersey.  Our previous living situation was not a happy one, but our lives changed when many wonderful people decided to work together to try to save our beagle âfamilyâ.  It took more than 1 month for our true âangelsâ to arrive, and now that we are with Penny Angels, we know that we are safe.

I am approx. 7-8 years old and weigh close to 19 lbs.  I am using the doggie door in Rescue and will work hard to learn the rules in your home.  I get along well with other dogs.  I love everyone that I meet!  I hope that I can be your very best friend!  I recently had a dental and now all I need is a home where I will be loved forever.  Do you have room for me in your heart and home this Holiday season?  I will be at PetSmart in Mays Landing, NJ on Saturday from 11- 3 pm.  Stop by & say âhelloâ!  If you are ready to share your life with me, please fill out an application and submit it to Penny Angels today.

An adoption application for Lilly can be obtained by visiting our web site at www.pennyangelsbeaglerescue.com. If you have any questions, please contact beagler534@comcast.net or emnase@aol.com, or call Penny Angels Beagle Rescue at 609-965-9476. Thank you!
name: LILLY

description:
Please help Donegal overcome his loss by giving him a good home. This little scruffmuffin is a black Irish Terrier, 7 years old, weighing 16 pounds. He lived with an older man who recently died of cancer. Donegal has been well taken care of and is up to date on vaccinations. He is also neutered.

Donegal is very playful and definitely a lapdog! He gets along fine with female dogs but not with my older male unneutered dog. He loves going to the groomer and the vet simply because he likes the attention. And of course the pet store is a favorite place to visit!

Donegal is housetrained, he has never had an accident in my house and you can put him in a crate for hours without any issues. He loves car rides and you can trust him in the car if you leave him to go on an errand in a store. He is very good and does not get into anything (although I would not trust him with food).

Donegal loves toys and it is fun to play with him with them. He is not possessive with his food bowl and you can take it away from him while he is eating. Leash is another story. He gets SO excited when he thinks he is going for a walk (we need some work there) but he is fine once you get out the door. He is like a bouncing ball when he knows he is going for a walk. He is full of energy and behaves like a puppy, he even walks like a puppy. But if you want to cuddle he is up for that too.

I'm not sure he has ever been around children. The best home for him would be with someone who can give him lots of attention & he will love them sooo much in return! Donegal is a sweet dog who deserves a good home. Anything you can do to help me find one will be appreciated.

Donegal is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but they are helping with the rehoming process. If anyone is interested, please contact Lorraine using the following email address: egordon0714@gmail.com or lvenes47@gmail.com. Donegal is currently located in Bernardsville, NJ.
name: XP Donegal - Bernardsville, NJ

Introducing Doobie!!!! Doobie is a 3 year old 47 lbs Boxer/Pit mix with a sweetheart of a personality! Like many others, he was a victim of Hurricane Florence but he is turning this into his personal victory story. . He is a high energy fellow who loves to run and play, but with adequate exercise, he settles nicely in his crate and is very well behaved. He is potty-trained, at least at his foster's house he has not experienced any accidents. He's not a chewer and sees to do well with the foster's other dogs. He is "intrigued" by anything that gets easily spooked and will attempt to chase squirrels or cats who are generally afraid of a dog. Doobie needs a little work with leash walking due to his impulsive nature so a handler with experience would be best suited for him. He  is fully vetted, including neuter. He has been treated for heartworms.  He promises to be a faithful companion to his new family and will roll over every chance he gets for a great belly rub.  If you are interested in adopting Doobie, visit www.wagsrescue.com and complete an application. Doobieâs foster is happy to answer additional questions for an approved adopter.

description:
Meet our little boy Jayden!

If you are looking for a ray of sunshine on these dark nights and cold morning well do we have the dog for you. Meet our little boy Jayden! All the way from Korea. Saved from the Korean meat trade and flown all the way here to N.J. for a new life with you. He is fully grown. Somewhere between one and two years old. He weighs in at a whole 7lbs! He loves everyone. Does well on a leash. Jayden is house trained and is good with cats kids and other dogs. And has the confidence of a lion not a lamb. He is crate and pen trained and we accepting applications. 

We work closely with a Korean based rescue called. Passion for Compassion. They kindly allow us to help them rescue these poor babies. These dogs are meat trade dogs. The bigger ones are used for meat and the small breed dogs are throw away dogs from the wealthy as a new breed becomes more fashionable to own. These little ones are boiled alive and made into an elixir which is believed to have health qualities. It is extremely expensive to bring the Korean dogs to safety with flights around 3 to 400 dollars alone. We then obviously have to spay or neuter and microchip and provide shots and health certifications. This all has a knock on effect to you when it comes to fees. We hope you understand. Any monies we raise go right back into making a difference and saving more lives.

If you think you are a perfect match for Jayden, please visit matchdogrescue.org and complete an application fully: https://www.petstablished.com/adoption_form/11415/generic

Jayden been fully vetted, is up to date on all vaccinations and on preventatives for heartworm, flea and tick. We cannot guarantee breed information. You will find the price guidelines for adoption at matchdogrescue.org and can read about the whole adoption process and what MatchDog Rescue provides with each dog.
name: Jayden

description:
dob: October 19, 2018..rescued, along with Mom, from a high-kill Animal Control facility in GA. Mom was spayed and went into our local New Leash on Life program. While her babies came to Howlin4Spirit CARes to complete their quarantine, receive 3 puppy boosters and de-wormings, and then will be available to go to their fur-ever homes after they have recovered from their spay/neutered surgery on SAT/JAN 19th.

Mom is a BoxerX(@42lbs) while it appears that their Daddy was a PointerX(possibly w/GrtDane).

Both Chopper & Clyde appear to have inherited their daddy's breedX more than Mom's. They will most likely mature around 70>75lbs. While Clover & Chutney will most likely take on their mama's breed size of ~42lbs, when matured. Then, there's Chucky and Cyrus who will most likely be in-between and will mature to about 58>65lbs as adults.

SWEETHEARTS, loving & very people-oriented, every one! And, SMART! With the proper puppy obedience training, they will exceed your expectations and be THE BEST pup you'll ever have! Excellent companions for any size family with a safe environment in which they can play their hearts out and receive the proper exercise all pups need to be contented and exhausted, rather than bored and into everything.

These pups are in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until they have received their 3rd booster and recovered from their speuter surgery scheduled for TH/JAN 10th, with delivery the next Saturday/JAN 19th.

Transport from western NC is available via Happy Dogs, Lifesavers or Save-Them-All Rescued Pet transport svcs. They travel the eastern seaboard as far as NH including Long Island and also through the eastern part of PA and upstate>Buffalo, NY. Fees are $125 as far as NYC/Long Island and $140 to all points N & W of NYC/LongIsland, as far as Manchester, NH, and Albany/ Buffalo, NY...to be paid by the adopter upon reservation request to transport service.

Adoption fee: $350(includes, spay/neuter, 3 of 4 puppy boosters, Bordatella and 1st yr Rabies vax, parasite-free, all medical paperwork from day#1 with H4S including all vet's surgical notations, current health certificate, Kong chew toy, Beef knee cap bone, new nylon Martingale collar & matching 6' leash, a copy of 'Super Puppy' -The Best Dog You'll Ever Have', 'Rescued Dogs Rock' car magnet, 2 'pet alert' wallet cards and 3lb bag of their current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health' salmon & potato).

To apply to adopt one of these little cutie-pies, please complete the application provided at: www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com, as soon as possible(to help your chances of being approved ahead of other interested applicants.

description: China is a doll with a sweet disposition and a deep DEEP love of napping. She's a gentle soul who does well with children and is a little shy with men. She warms up quickly, though, and wants nothing more than your love and attention! Doggie intros are required; China may never be a dog park kind of gal, but with the right match she'll be pleased as pie to have a canine sibling! China is 100% house trained and crate-trained, is well mannered and takes correction easily. China loves the great outdoors (except when it's raining), rolling on the floor to scratch her itchies, and stealing pillows for comfort (but not chewing them!). This silly sweet potato is ready for a home to call her own!

description:
Misty is a sweet Pit mix with American bull dog that has been living way to long in a kennel environment. She has been longing for a home of her own. She's been living in boarding for almost two years now. She just wants what all of the other dogs have, which is a human(s) of her own and her own home, toys, bed, and people. If you have a special place in your heart for Pits, please consider Misty. She was taken away from my previous owner as they were abusing her and was using her as bait dog. Very nice ladies rescued her but she canât give Misty a home. She contacted these ladies call themselves Angels Four Paws. Angels Four Paws are truly Misty earth angels, as they came to her rescue.
She have been spay and completely vetted, so she is ready to start her new life. She will lick your face and be your best friend â Misty is such a good girl â very willing to please and learn.
?The best home for Misty is one with no other pets and a fenced-in yard. She would be a great candidate for a dogie door. The rest is a breeze. She's just a huge sweetheart. If you are looking for a one-and-only pet that will cherish you as her one-and-only love.
Even thought she is in HOUSTON TEXAS it only take a few hours and she can be together with you furever.
For adoption information on Misty, please contact Celestine with Angel4Paws at wingsforpaws@gmail.com or 815-238-4529.  The adoption fee is $1100 which includes all vetting, a travel crate, Health Certificate and transportation on United Airlines to anywhere in the U.S.
name: MISTY

description:
Dexter is an adult male black and tan "Chiweenie" (Chihuahua &Â DachshundÂ mixed-breed) born 9/21/2008. He came to our rescue from a high kill shelter and was saved from being euthanized. He is a small dog and weighs about 18 pounds. Dexter looks more like a Dachshund, but has longer legs. He is current on vaccinations, neutered, on monthly flea/tick and preventative, and microchipped.Â 

Dexter is playful and affectionate with people he knows and trusts, but he is very fearful of strangers, particularly men. He can be very reactive when he sees people or other dogs he doesn't know while out on a walk. If he feels threatened he gets defensive. However, if allowed to meet new people on his own terms he is much more accepting. He probably didn't receive much socialization as a young dog and as a result is fearful of strangers - both human and canine. We feel he would do best as the only pet in the home.Â 

Dexter will need an experienced adopter that understands his special needs and is willing to continue working on socializing him while providing a stable environment. An adult-only home would be ideal. Prior experience with Dachshunds or Chihuahuas and their temperaments is preferred. 

He's an affectionate and playful dog that will require plenty of physical exercise and mental stimulation to give him positive outlets for all his energy. Being home alone in a crate all day would NOT be a suitable environment for Dexter. He is crate trained but needs frequent opportunities to go outside to potty during the day, although he is fine in his crate overnight.  Dexter is a very sweet boy that would be a very loyal and lovable companion for the right person.

IMPORTANT: Safe Hounds Beagle Rescue does not operate a shelter where the public can meet our dogs. All of our Beagles are cared for in a loving foster home. Prospective adopters must submit an adoption application and be pre-approved to adopt. Once an applicant is approved, weâll begin a matching processâthe right dog for the right home. Submitting an application does not guarantee that you will be approved. Please visit our web page: www.safehounds.com and click on "Adopting A Beagle" to learn more about the adoption process and to print our adoption application.

Unable to adopt? Please consider making a donation. By helping us we can continue to make a difference in the lives of these deserving dogs. We take in dogs with medical needs and behavioral problems that many other rescues turn away. We have lots of hungry hounds to feed and are always in need of financial support to help us meet the needs of the dogs in our care. Use the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of the page, or make an instant donation using PayPal by visiting our website: www.safehounds.com and clicking the "Donate" button.  All contributions are tax deductible.

This pet requires an application and $250 adoption fee.
name: Dexter

description:
Tapestry, aka Tappie, is a beautiful Brindle that came to us from a shelter in North Carolina. We believe she is a Mountain Cur/Catahoula/Terrier mix. She weighs about 45 pounds and is believed to be about 2 to 3 years old. Tappie is crate trained, house trained and has learned âsitâ and âdownâ.  She does well on a leash, we use an easy walk harness or she can be walked with an ez-walk nose band. Tappie loves her humans, big or small.  Tapestry is very picky about who her doggie playmates are. She seems to prefer females that are her size or a little smaller. Tappie is full of energy and rightfully so at her young age, so someone that likes going for long walks, hikes or jogs would be a great match for her. Tapestry must have a fenced in yard because of all of her energy, so she needs a place to run to get out all of her energy. Tapestry is spayed, micro chipped and up to date on all of her shots.
If you are interested in Tapestry please fill out our application which can be found on our web site http://ittakesavillageanimalrescue.com

He travels well and likes going for rides in cars. Lucas also loves going to the park because he's always down to explore!

Lucas loves every person he meets and also gets along with similarly sized dogs and cats. He is also great with kids! 

Heâs house trained and wee wee pad trained. Lucas is very affectionate, loves to cuddle, and is always right by his person's side.
