description:
~Trolley~

Trolley is Available Through our Pre- Adoption Program !

Trolley and siblings will be ready to go home soon !

8 week old Labrador Retriever/ Mini Aussie Mix

If you are Interested in Adopting this Sweet Baby please fill out the Online Adoption Application: https://ww04.elbowspace.com/secure/20130108185454530739
name: Trolley

description: Asia is a 5 year old, female, 68 lb Staffordshire terrier mix. This energetic gal is affectionate and very friendly when meeting strangers. Asia is easy to get in and out of her kennel. She does need leash training as she is eager and pulls when walked. Asia knows the "sit" command and interacts well with her handler. Be prepared to give her plenty of attention.
name: Rey aka Asia

description:
CROSS-POSTING ALERT -
**PLEASE NOTE - THESE ANIMALS ARE NOT LOCATED AT JERSEY SHORE ANIMAL CENTER!**

AFEW has not given up on Boomer, this guy has been looking for that special a family of his own since late 2014!! As of September 30, 2017, itâs been 1064 days of shelter/kennel living for this guy.In the time we have had Boomer we learned a lot about him. He is a smart dog that needs a job of some sort - a hiking companion, jogging buddy, or being one of the 'guys'. Boomer is respectful of his handler, he is healthy, strong, clean and playful. The fact that Boomer is part American Staffordshire Terrier makes it difficult for him and others like him. The restrictions are pretty clear: Boomer is a little too interested in cats and other dogs, so his new home should be feline and canine-free. And because heâs a young guy â about five â with lots of energy we are hoping to send him home with âa calm, experienced owner that can make his life predictable and keep him busy.' He needs a family with older children (teens) or just adults and no other 4 legged pets.In an effort to find that special someone, Boomer's good behavior at the vet, in the kennel and with his handler excels. He has the propensity for being ridiculously happy when heâs outside playing and burning his energy up. Remember a good dog is a tired dog!And if this post seems a little more hostage-like than the more cheerful adoption promos â well, itâs just one more effort to get one of AFEW's long-term residents his own family, at last. âHe has waited a long time and we would love to see him finally get his forever home. As anyone who works in rescue will tell you, it is never sad when our animals go home. It is only sad when week after week they patiently wait and seem invisible to adopters and come to think of their kennel as home.â*Per JSAC policy, puppies and kittens under 6 months will not be adopted to families with children under the age of 6 years.
name: Boomer **COURTESY POST"

description: Maize is an adorable 1 yr old Beagle mix. She has the characteristics of a Beagle but the markings of an Australian Cattle Dog. She is UTD on shots, spayed and ready for her furever home. Maize is very playful and likes the game of fetch. She will bring the ball back to you, plays with her toys and she sleeps thru the night. She is fully house trained and will go to the door and dance when she needs to go outside. She is crate trained and currently sleeps in it at night. She knows Sit, Leave it and Gentle. While she enjoys the company of dogs, cats are not her friend. She would be best in a home without cats. Maize is still learning her manners around children and would be best suited with kids over 5 years or older. She is a total love bug.  If you are interested in Maize, please call and leave a number at 484-323-1134, email for more information at pldpaws@gmail.com or fill out an application online at www.pldpaws.org.
name: Maize

description:
Gator is a male Blue-nose American Staffordshire Terrier who is ~2 years old. Weighing nearly 80 lbs he is a large fellow with a heart as big as he is! He was abandoned by his previous owner after they were evicted. He is a sweet boy who loves spending time with you, doing pretty much anything. He enjoys walking the neighborhood, playing in the yard --fetch, tug, & maybe even a dip in the kiddie pool! Gator also loves to snuggle up like a little guy, snoozing the afternoons away with you on the porch. He is an engaging and personable guy, who needs daily interaction (and belly-rubs).

Gator is looking for a home with energetic, active people who are experienced with dogs, even better if with his breed. He is not ideal for living with kids, Gator can play a bit rough and he is a large dog. Also he can be guarded about strangers coming to the house. He may be okay with other dogs, though meet and greet is required and by appointment only. Cats are unknown and not recommended. Gator is a smart fellow, already knowing sit, stay, down, and paw.

If you think your home is the place for Gator then please call or stop down to the HSOC today. We are open 7 days/week 11am-3pm, except major holidays. (609) 398-9500 ext. 1; All of our animals are S/N, UTD and micro-chipped.
name: Gator

description: Sweet, well trained, neutered and up to date on all shots, Moses recently lost his human Mommy who loved him dearly. There 81-year-old human Daddy is not physically able to care for him so he is in need of loving forever home. Moses is dog & cat-friendly
name: Moses

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Blake was returned to rescue because his adopter had to move and was not allowed to keep him. Blake was born in early 2016 and he is now about 50 pounds. He is neutered and up to date on shots.

RDR originally saved Blake from NYC ACC at 8 months old, when he was extremely emaciated, weighing only 19 pounds. He was terrified, poor baby. Blake requires patience because he can be fearful. He is good with other dogs, and in fact, having another calm dog in the home might help him adjust. If you would like to adopt Blake, apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Blake

description:
ADOPTION PENDING. You can see more of these beautiful dogs by going to  NGPR RESCUE DOGS at  https://nationalpyr.org/adoptable-dogs

NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

These two lovely Pyrs are Samson and Delilah, a truly bonded pair searching for a great home of their own and a family to love them. This adorable couple ended up dumped at an animal sanctuary who reached out to us for help finding them a great home together. They could not be any nicer! They are as gentle as can be and they adore each other. Samson and Delilah are young Pyrs and arrived painfully thin, so thin we have had to wait a couple of months to even be able to spay Delilah. Both dogs love people and get along great with everybody and every creature they meet. They do well with other dogs and cats, and they were gentle with all of the other critters at the sanctuary. They get very sad when they are separated from each other so they are a package deal and will be adopted together. They are currently in boarding waiting patiently for a home or foster home to take them in. These two are absolutely gorgeous dogs and just as sweet. We are not sure what their background was before they arrived to rescue, but these poor dogs were not in good shape. They are now healthy and ready to go to a family who will be very lucky enough to adopt a pair this sweet!
name: Samson & Delilah - adopted

description: This 2 year old Pit mix is Savannah.Â  Savannah is a happy, friendly, outgoing girl who would excel as part of an active household.Â  She is extremely people focused, leaning into her handler for extra attention.Â  Savannah sat on command for a treat, which she accepted softly from our fingers.Â  She willingly shared both her ball and squeaky toy whenever asked.Â  Savannah was comfortable with all handling as she ate from her food bowl.Â  She was relaxed and friendly with the male and female dogs she met outside.Â  Stop by and meet this amazing girl today.
name: SAVANNAH 33303

description:
Miss Piggy is 6 years old, weighing in about 50-60 pounds. She has been with us since January of 2012. She needs a very experienced owner because while she loves the person walking her, she can be temperamental with people she meets on her walks. We love her to pieces. She enjoys belly rubs and getting treats. 

Email harescue1@aol.com for more information.

The application can be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAAâ¦/AdoptionApplication/index.html
name: Miss Piggy

description:
Imelda is the last of our most recent puppy mill rescues who hasnât been adopted yet...she was the most skittish but is starting to warm up to people and play with toys even.  She is most comfortable around other dogs and needs a calmer adult home with at least one friendly little doggie friend to help her adjust to life in a real home.  She is a 1 year old Shih Tzu and has been spayed and updated on shots.  Email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested.

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Imelda-PUPPYMILL RESCUE

description:
Beautiful female Lab/Rottie mix looking for long term relationship.  
Bella is a lover at heart and is much more interested in spending quiet, 
quality time together than in toys or even treats!  Bella wants to be 
your one and only, and is seeking a mature adult relationship without 
other pets or children so you can enjoy one another's companionship to 
the fullest!
.

 ***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***

Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this. 

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Bella

description:
8/14/18

Meet Gluhwein! She is a catahoula leopard dog mix, that is stunning, inside and out. She is extremely people oriented. She loves everyone, and is especially fond of children. She has a sweet personality, and is always wagging her tail. She may look a bit intimidating, but her heart is as big as all outdoors! She has extremely good house manners, and is a true pleasure to have around. Winnie, as she is called, is dog selective. She gets along well with non reactive dogs, after a very slow introduction. She would do best as an only dog. She loves to run and play in our fenced in yard, and would like to have that at her forever home. She has been with us since mid December, and really needs a forever home to call her own. We would invite approved adopters to come and meet this wonderful girl at our home, because the stress of adoption events, masks her true inner beauty. Gluhwein is available thru Wags Rescue.

6/29/18

No kitties please!

Hi, my name is Gluhwein. It's pronounced kinda like glow-ween, but my foster family just call me Winnie! I'm a catahula mix and I'm about 2 years old. I'm a very good dog with tons of energy, and would prefer a fenced in yard! I get along with other dogs, after a slow introduction, but not cats. I love people, and I'm very good with children. I'm good in my crate, but Iâm not in there much. I am house trained and have very good manners. I sleep on my bed at night, (but like to sneak in bed with my foster parents occasionally)! If you would like to meet me, please apply through Wags Rescue, and my foster parents will be happy to set up a private get together, because Iâm really not fond of going to the adoption events. I am a very good dog, and will be a wonderful addition to any family!

4/26/18

Meet Gluhwein. This wonderful girl is about 1 1/2 years old and is absolutely beautiful, inside and out! âWinnieâ, as she is known at her foster home, is a great dog! She has very good house manners, loves people, adores children, and is fine with other dogs after a slow introduction. She is house trained, great in her crate,(but sheâs rarely in a crate), and sleeps soundly at night on her bed. She has a ton of energy, walks well on a leash, and loves to run in our yard, but is always ready to cuddle on the couch and watch a movie. Gluhwein is spayed, fully vetted, up to date on shots, and extremely healthy. She is a special girl that will be a perfect addition to any family. Her foster family welcome private meet and greets at their home, and will be happy to answer any questions about this sweet perfect girl.

2/12/18

Hi, my name is Gluhwein. It's pronounced kinda like glow-ween, but my foster family just call me Winnie! I'm a catahula mix and I'm about 1 1/2 years old. I was a stray that wound up pregnant and in a high kill shelter, where my odds of being adopted in time were very small. Luckily, Wags stepped in and saved me. I was sent to a foster in Pennsylvania where I had nine puppies that are grown enough for me to seek my forever home. I'm a very good dog with tons of energy! I love other dogs and people. I'm very good with children, and are around them daily. I'm good in my crate and am house trained. I sleep on my bed at night and have no issues. If you would like to adopt me, please apply through Wags Rescue, and I will be the best dog ever!

RESCUE WILL SPAY HER ONCE VET CLEARED!



Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Gluhwein H Wilson-stunning girl

breeds: German Shepherd Dog, Black Mouth Cur
description:
Baron was found wandering the streets and frightened.   He was desperate for food, but ran when approached.....until he found himself caught by animal control and facing death.

When his time was up and room was needed for more animals incoming to the shelter a volunteer reached out to ask us if we'd take him.  He had the sweetest face and eyes that looked soulful.  He was a good boy, but frightened in the shelter.  Once outside that environment he sought his person's approval and attention and looked for direction..

Baron has been brought current on all vaccines, microchipped and neutered.  He's been treated for heart worm and will be on restricted activity........but, that's means leash walking vs letting him run and over exert.  

He's a smaller size weighing in around 40-45lbs and is shy and uncertain until you show him love and attention.  He will make someone a great dog.

Applications for Baron can be found at:
http://www.diamonddogsrescueinc.com/online-adoption-application.html
name: Baron

description:
Tina was rescued from NC just before Hurricane Florence hit - she actually made it out just one day before the storm.  She's a sweet, middle aged girl of about 4 or 5 who loves people and wants nothing more than human companionship and attention.  She's medium sized and weighs about 50-55 lbs, is spayed and vaccinated,  housebroken and crate trained.  

Tina's issue is that,  sometime in her past, another dog or dogs weren't so nice to her and she is fearful.  Her defense is showing aggression towards other dogs.  She could successfully be walked on a leash in a park or neighborhood where there are other dogs,  and she walks very well on a leash,  but she will do best not having to closely interact with otter dogs.  She,  therefore,  needs to be an only dog,  and she will make her person or family very happy with the affection she has to offer.  She also loves belly rubs!! 

If you'd like to meet Tina and get an application to adopt her,  please send an email to jerseygirlsanimalrescue@gmail.com.
name: Tina

description: Jail and his sister Bird were picked up by a NY State Corrections facility. They are both very outgoing, sweet, extremely friendly dogs. Being part Hound though they were on the run following their little noses and it wasn't the 1st time. They make you laugh a lot and they can cheer the grumpiest person up (even the Grinch I bet) in an instant. So a home that will not let them run free is the ticket here. Fenced yard or leash walked is a must. So if you enjoy laughing and want to be cheered up come meet these two. They don't have to be adopted together but if you want double the fun.......... here are the dogs for the job.
name: Bird

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This precious girl is Teardrop. Born in April 2017, she is a 50-pound Hound/Spaniel mix who came into Rescue from South Carolina. Rescued from a shelter with mange and secondary skin infections, she is thriving in her foster home and her foster mom says she is very friendly, loves toys, is good with the foster's resident (smaller) dog, is very active and likes to jump around! With all that she has endured, Teardrop is still the sweetest soul. She will do best in quiet home in a rural or spacious suburban environment with land to run. She is a very smart girl. She already knows some basic commands. She is treat motivated and eager to learn! She is house trained, spayed and up to date on vaccines. Teardrop isn't a fan of cats, so her perfect home would be one without cats. If you would like to be the lucky family that gets to give Teardrop her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Teardrop

description:
Buddy is a sweet dog about three years old who showed up as a skinny stray dog three weeks ago. He likes other dogs and he likes people very much. He likes to give kisses and he just loves to eat. Itâs no wonder. Heâs filling out nicely and will probably be about 45 lbs.

Heâs very handsome and has ears like a Lab or a Beagle. 
He loves to zoom around the yard and he likes running back and forth with whoever is one the other side in the adjoining play yard
name: Buddy/Shadow

description: Brittany is the sweetest girl! We rescued her from a high kill shelter after she was dumped there by her owners. She was hit by a car 3 years ago and never received the surgery that she needed so her spine fused together and leaves her with a funny walk. She's in absolutely no pain but she looks like shes dancing when she walks. She loves her people and has the cutest underbite. She would do best in a home as the only pet. She's not even 30 lbs so she's a small framed fox terrier mix. She is the happiest little dog! She is spayed, current on vaccines, and microchipped. If you're interested in adopting her, please email enb313@gmail.com for an application!
name: Brittany

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Meet Yipper! His name came with him all the way from his home state of Texas where he was living in dirt, starving outside, and fending off predators and danger at every turn. He contracted distemper, but thanks to amazing vet care and proper monitoring, he is completely cured of the disease and a happy, healthy puppy! He is 10 months old, Fully house trained, sleeps all night in his crate and loves going for long walks.

He has a super sweet personality and loves car rides! he is very food motivated and picks up on commands quickly. He would do best in a home with a yard to run and play before he comes back inside to happily chew on a bone or play with a toy. He loves all humans, big and small, and is a loyal companion. He gets along well with other dogs but would do best in a home without cats. he will acclimate so well to your home and family that you won't be able to remember life without him! To adopt Yipper, apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Yipper

description: Simba is a 7 year old American Staffordshire Terrier/German Spitz Mix. His owner can no longer care for him. He is healthy and active and enjoys being outdoors as well as cuddling on a couch with his owner. He is very well behaved in a house and can be left alone uncrated. He gets along with people, children and just about everyone he meets. He needs a proper introduction with dogs but does well in dog parks and with other dogs, but does need a proper introduction. He completed a 6 week obedience course and earned his American Kennel Club Good Canine Certificate.
name: Simba

description:
Nilla is a very friendly Hound mix who is only 9 months of age. She dog-friendly, and should do wonderfully with cats and children too. She loves to explore and a fenced in yard where she can run around and "let her nose do the talking" will be wonderful for her. She is young and best for her will be a family willing to provide her some basic obedience upon adoption along with daily activity and exercise. Nilla is waiting to meet you, so stop by soon. 

To fill out an adoption application, please go to our website, www.vaonj.org and click on  Adopt and then Adoption. Please complete the form and bring it with you when you visit our shelter, and don't forget to put the Orphanâs name on the form.  Thanks!  Our pets are spayed or neutered, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines prior to going to their new homes. For more information on our adoption procedures, please visit, www.vaonj.org.

NOT READY TO ADOPT, BUT WOULD LIKE TO HELP? Voorhees Animal Orphanage will continue to care for this pet until it is adopted. Help support this pet with a donation. Please go to www.vaonj.org, click on How to Help and then Donate.
ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

On behalf of the animals, we thank you!
name: Nilla

description: Hi everyone, Not sure if you remember me...I am starting wonder what's up. I have been ready to move on out of my foster home. My kids got adopted, I'm much more confident and I'm already spayed (whatever that means my foster mom insisted I saw that ) I am super affectionate with the humans and fur friends alike. I tend more on the bossy side but a girls gotta do what a girls gotta do. I am fun size and fit easily in your lap, on your pillow and in your arms to go wherever you go. Please let your friends know I am holding out for the perfect match! Hugs and Kisses, Ryn
name: Ryn

description:
Roscoe has been in rescue for a long time.  He is a gorgeous, handsome, Tree Walker Hound and is approximately 9 years old, neutered, housebroken, weighs in at 70-75 pounds, and is utd with his vaccinations, and HW negative.  Roscoe is good on a leash and when riding in a car.

Before he came into rescue, he was skin and bones and was due to be killed in a  kill shelter in Roanoke Falls, NC.  Since coming into rescue, he has thrived.  He is now at his normal weight and gets along well with the other dogs.  He would be fine with respectful children.  Roscoe is one of the most laid back and sweet, loving boys that we have ever had. He loves to be with people and in the yard with the other dogs and likes to bite on hard bones and other toys.  He learned how to sit quickly and waits nicely for his food and treats.

Roscoe is so ready for his new home. This dog literally cheated death and is so sweet and deserving of a loving home where he can live out his life.  Please consider adopting him into your loving family.  

If you think he could be a good match for your family, please call Judi Burns at (908) 510-8721 or send me an application by pressing the Application Button on Petfinder under Save Us Dog Rescue in the town of Middlesex, NJ.  Please return application to fries3@aol.com
name: Roscoe

description:
Duchess rescued by rural shelter in North Carolina. When they found her Duchess had a severe, but very treatable, skin condition. We had Duchess tranferred to our shelter so she could get the treatment she needed. We have had Duchess for about 4  weeks and she is responding beautifully to her treatment. 
Duchess is a friendly happy puppy that needs daily exercise. She would do best in a home with older children gets too excited playing and jumping on smaller children.
You can meet this dog today! We are open seven days a week from 10 am to 4 pm and Thursdays from 2 pm to 8 pm!

For information about how to adopt, contact us or visit our website at www.HumaneSocietyofWestchester.org
name: Duchess

description: Meesha is a shy, but sweet, girl. She is dog social, and loves to play ball. Meesha will enjoy having an active family that can include her in outdoor activities.
name: Meesha

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Ashley! Ashley is a one year old Chihuahua mix who weighs 6.8 pounds and comes into rescue from Texas. Now that she is a Rescue Dogs Rock girl, she has her whole life ahead of her and we will make sure that we find this princess the most amazing new forever home...could that be with you?! She is such a precious little love bug and is wonderful around people of all ages and other dogs. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you are looking for the cutest little princess to add to your family, then Ashely is the one for you! To adopt Ashley, please fill out an application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Ashley

description:
Sassy is a beautiful 35 pound Pit Bull mix who is around 2 years old. She loves to play fetch with a tennis ball and is extremely loyal to her owners/family. She has nipped strangers though but has not hurt anyone.

We are heartbroken that we cannot keep her in a very busy household with many guests in and out each day. She would do best in a home where she has much room to run and frolic. She is a very loving & loyal dog to those who love her. As you can see in her photos, Sassy gets along with cats but can be picky about her doggy friends.

Sassy is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping her owners with the rehoming process. If you are interested in meeting Sassy, please contact Jennifer directly at jmburke112@gmail.com - she is currently located in Montclair, NJ.
name: XP Sassy - Montclair, NJ

description:
Beautiful Brooklyn is a 4 year old female Pointer/Beagle mix.  Gorgeous dog!


This dog is currently in a foster home. If you're interested in adopting please email us at volaux@yahoo.com for an adoption application. All dogs are UTD on shots and spayed/neutered prior to adoption. 

LIKE US ON FACEBOOK! www.facebook.com/volunteerauxiliary
name: Brooklyn

description:
Apple is a 2 year old female Jindo mix weighing 16lbs who was rescued from the Korean Meat Trade and brought to New York to find her forever home.  She gets along well with other dogs, and loves running around in the yard with them. She is shy when first meeting new people, but with time and patience she gets comfortable and cuddly.  

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.
name: Apple

description: Meet Sadie! Sadie is a hound mix and weighs 35-40 lbs. She has a lot of energy. She is about a year old or little less. She is very friendly and loves attention from her humans. She was taken in by a family who lives close to our local shelter, where she had likely been dumped after hours. She gets along with the other dog she is housed with, but she is the alpha dog. She will need an authoritative owner and an outlet for her energy. With training, she would likely make a great hunting dog. She is up to date on shots and will be spayed prior to adoption. If you're interested in adopting Sadie, please fill out an application on our website at www.charliescrusaders.org
name: Sadie

description:
Meet Zoro! Rescued from Barnwell, South Carolina, this beautiful boy is a 10-month-old Shepherd/Black Labrador Retriever mix. He has the most gorgeous hazel brown eyes that blend perfectly with his jet black coat. Zoro weighs 35 pounds and only has a little more growing to do. When fully grown he will be a great medium size. Zoro has a great playful, sweet, and silly personality. He is a great listener and is very motivated to learn new tricks and commands. He is also a very social boy and has never met someone he has not liked - kids, cats, and other dogs included. He is crate trained and getting better and better with his leash walking skills day by day. Zoro cannot wait to find his forever home for the holidays!

Zoro is neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped. 

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! 

In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.
name: Zoro

description: Dakota: petite retriever mix, thin, about 20-25 lbs, about 6 months old
name: Dakota

description:
Look at this big, beautiful, brindle boy! Meet Okami, a wonderful friendly fellow who never meets a stranger.  Okami knows some basic commands, is house broken, has good manners, and walks well on a leash. It is possible Okami can live with the right female after proper introductions. He rides well in the car and would make the right home a great family companion. 

Are you interested in this gorgeous boy? Please fill out an online adoption application on our website www.bigeastakitarescue.org and we will get back to you.
name: Okami

description: 18 Dec 2018: Porkchop was abandoned in a crate in the yard after his owner was hospitalized. This handsome guy is about 9 years old and is laid back and easy going. He is dog friendly but does not do well with kitties. He wlll be ready for a foster or adopter soon. Please apply.
name: Porkchop

description:
Jax is a Courtesy post for Ashley Tschudin, please contact her directly for more information on Jax

When Jax isnât chewing bones or stealing tomatoes out of his familyâs garden, he spends his days napping on the couch as close to his ownersâ laps as possible. He is an energetic dog whose only goal in life is to make people happy and feel loved. His skills include cuddling, kisses, crate training, basic command obedience, and professional fetching. His family loves Jax dearly and is heartbroken to have to rehome him because of an ongoing feud with his brother, a fellow Pitt. While they use to be best friends who slept side by side, maturity got between them and they now fight. For this reason, Jax now needs to find a home where he is the only pet and can get all the one on one attention and love he deserves.

 

The family is seeking a loving forever home for him with another family who will smother him with kisses. If possible, the family would love to receive photos of Jax in his new life and an update on his life. So, if you are looking to add the most loyal dog to your life to bring joy and energy into your âno other petsâ home, Jax is your good boy!

Jax is not located at Paws Crossed, if interested in meeting/adopting Jax please contact Ashley Tschudin at ashleytschudin@gmail.com
name: A courtesy post Jax

He makes everyone laugh with his goofy âyoga poseâ sleep positions!  Gordon is up-to-date on his shots, housebroken, and is learning some basic commands. description:
Aphrodite is a ridiculously adorable 4 month old, 20 lb pup from Texas whose mom was saved from euthanasia and gave birth to a litter of 8 pups, only to lose 6 to intestinal worms. Aphroditeâs sister Athena who survived with her, has already been adopted and this amazing girl is still looking for her forever home. She is sweet and very playful, she loves being with the kids in her foster house (4 kids ranging from 6-12 years old), and 3 other dogs. She loves to be carried and cuddled and doesnât nip. She plays non-stop with the other foster puppy in the house and gets along with the other 2 dogs as well but then looks for a lap to nap on but also happily naps in her crate too. Sheâs working on her house training and happily sleeps in her crate all night.  Aphrodite does have a congenital heart condition. She will need to be reassessed when she is older to better understand how this condition will impact her health.   This sweet girl will make the perfect addition to any family!

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.
name: Aphrodite

PLEASE NOTE: You need to attend the OUTDOOR ADOPTION EVENT in order to meet this dog and bring your printed application. Please come to the event should you have any questions or email us at info@koreank9rescue.org. Thank you!
Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Hanna

description:
Boyâs best friend!

This handsome pup was rescued with his siblings in Puerto Rico after their mom died and left them orphans. But he is now getting lots of love from his foster mom, her son, and their dogs. 

Pip loves to play with kids and other dogs, but is also a great smuggler and happy to chew on a bone when youâre busy. He is super smart and was potty trained in only one week. He would love a family of his own for the holidays!

Pip is about 6-8 months old and will be about 50 lbs full grown. He is fully vetted, vaccinated, neutered, and microchipped. If interested in adopting him, please submit an application here: https://www.thesatoproject.org/applicationform

description:
Roscoe found himself as a stray at the New York Care Centers back in July 2018.

The volunteers fell for his charm and easy going attitude.  He was scheduled for Euthanasia due to catching the dreaded cold.  A foster stepped up and brought him in as one of her own.

This is what she has to say:

Roscoe is such a joy! You can feel how happy this guy is just by the way he walks.  Roscoe gets along great with other dogs and loves to romp around and play with his foster siblings.  We believe he would do really well in a home with other dogs and/or active fur parents.  He also loves car rides and jumps in on his own as soon as the car door opens. He knows basic commands and always comes when he hears his name.  He is a gentleman on a leash and loves to say hi to anyone passing by and has been around children ages 2 and up. Roscoe is a happy, goofy, friendly, loving, smart boy that gets along great with everyone - he is the complete package!

Perfect home for Roscoe? :  A home where his humans would love to cuddle with him and let him run around.  He is such a happy dog who loves everyone! 

ETC:  Roscoe LOVES to cuddle.  When heâs not chewing on his toys or running around, heâll make himself comfortable right by the closest person.  Something quirky about him is that he makes a funny sound when he plays, unlike any other dog I know!

He has had no issues during his stay with us.
name: Roscoe

description:
Please note: We are NOT ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS on Pinky Lee at this time.

Pinky Lee was dumped at a very large, inner city shelter. Reason for being turned in was â could not stand, drinking excessive amounts of water, and urinating excessively.â Needless to say at approximately ten years old, this poor little girl had never been to a vet. She was in need of total grooming and veterinary care.
After several weeks at the shelter, the medical staff diagnosed Pinky Lee with diabetes. She is currently on insulin two times daily. We are working on getting her diabetes under control. She is unable to be spayed at this time due to her diabetes and has mammary gland tumors which could be benign.

At ten pounds and possibly ten years old, Pinky Lee is an adorable little girl. She just wants to be near her human while you watch your favorite tv show, read a book, or take a nap. She loves to be carried like a pampered pup but also loves going for a walk. She adores  going outside and is totally housebroken. Pinky Lee ignores the resident dog and cats in her foster home.
name: Pinky Lee

Looking for an active, spunky fellow?! Well halt your search and meet this handsome man Bandit! ( Don't worry the only things he steals is your heart!) Although, coming in from being seized through Cruelty and Neglect, Bandit has not let that stop him from being a sweet/loving dude. Bandit would need a family that can provide basic training, a steady regiment and tons of tennis balls to play fetch! Consider this happy boy to make your family complete, we know you'll love him.

description: Hi my name is Charlie! I'm house-trained, know sit, paw, touch, and watch me! I take treats gently from your hand and don't mind having my bowl touched while eating. I'm crate trained, but my foster mom allows me out of the crate when she's gone, because I'm such a good boy! I LOVE anything that has to do with water and being outdoors! If you let me, I would lay in the pool all day and splash around. I'm a super social pup as you can see from my pictures/videos, and love to shower you with kisses! You will love me; I guarantee it!
name: Charlie

description:
Meet Ziggy!  Ziggy is a 7 year young Chihuahua male who is ready for his new beginning.  He loves to sit on your lap and will follow you everywhere!  When he falls in love with you, he falls hard. :)  He LOVES to play with his squeeky toys and usually carries one everywhere.  He sleeps with his toys too!  Because of improper nutrition, Ziggy has had most of his front teeth removed but that doesn't stop him from enjoying his kibble!  Because he has had a tough little life, he would love a new home with Chihuahua experience! He been known to let out a growl at other dogs, but wakes you with a kiss in the morning.  He wouldn't mind being spoiled as an only dog, either!  Little Ziggy suffers from anxiety if crated, but he doesn't need a crate and prefers to sleep either under the covers or over your head on a pillow in the bed of his human.  Ziggy is neutered, housebroken, up to date on vaccines, and microchipped.  Ziggy requires a fully fenced backyard for his security and to allow him the freedom to run and explore! 
  Want to know more about this handsome guy? Email: amajamacay@comcast.net.   New Beginnings Pet Rescue desperatelyneeds and welcomes foster homes and volunteers. We also appreciate donations, both large and small, to help with the costs of providing veterinary care for our incoming dogs,puppies and long term fosters. Contact amajamacay@comcast.net if you would like to foster, volunteer or make a tax deductible donation to New Beginnings Pet Rescue.  Thank you!
name: Ziggy

name: Tara

description:
Jack spent his life as a hunting dog and now it's time for him to retire. Jack came to us with some medical issues that we have helped him work through.  He is now well settled into his foster home and enjoys time in the back yard and naps.  Unfortunately he also enjoys being on cat patrol!  They are managing things, but it would be great to find him a cat-free adoptive home soon or even transfer him to a foster home without a cat.
Want to learn more about one of the dogs we have up for adoption? Fill out our adoption application!!

If interested in adopting, you must attend one of our Adoption Events, listed on our Home Page and Facebook, in order to fill out an application.  Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.

description: Beau was quite nervous and unsure when he first arrived, but we didn't fault him for that. His family had no problem saying goodbye to him, but he did. We gave Beau time to settle in and settle down, and we eventually started to see him come out of his shell. Now, he can't get enough of his handlers. We feel he will most likely act similarly to this when he finds his forever home. Therefore, he's looking for a patient and loving home that will give him ample time to acclimate and come into his own. We are sure he will show his true colors in no time. Once he does, you will have no regrets. Beau is a very loving pooch and is simply looking for a family who won't be so quick to leave him behind.
name: Beau

description:
..Meet Minnie, a precious girl looking for a special home.
Minnie is a survivor in more ways than one. She was saved from a high kill shelter in New York after a life of abuse and neglect. This beautiful lady needs a quiet and patient home who understands her needs, as simple as they are. Minnie would like a forever home that just lets her âbeâ, and gives her the time and patient love to bring her out of the shell. Going from her horrible life, to scary shelter, to foster home has her confused as she was never shown a kind hand before coming to our rescue with her amazing foster. Minnie needs the time to learn that no one will hurt her anymore, she doesnât need to be scared. Minnie is not aggressive, just very timid and shy of human contact. Minnie wants a full belly, a warm bed, and to be safe forever. We feel Minnie would do best in a low stress home preferably an experienced with senior aged dogs or dogs that are survivors of abuse. Minnie is between 12 and 13 years old, as most of her teeth have been removed and she should be on soft food and would do best to wear diapers. Other senior aged or low speed dogs and cats are okay. Do you have a warm corner of your home for this sweet girl? Please fill out an application today.
name: Minnie

description: Si is a 2yr old male Corso/Pittie mix. He and his sister Precious are caught up in a divorce situation and need a new home. Both dogs are kid, cat, and dog friendly. Crate trained and house broken. They love humans of all ages.
name: Si

description:
This is Noah, and he is a 3-year-old Yellow Lab. Someone saw Noah being dumped in a local grocery parking lot. Since it was raining hard on that day, he was given the name of Noah. Noah had no idea what to do, so he kept trying to get into the store when the doors opened. The manager of the store called animal control, and they picked him up. They then took him back to their facility with his fate uncertain.

As you can see in one of his photos, the facility is a terrible place where dogs live in the dark in paint peeling cells. This is a rural mountain animal control, where IF a dog gets adopted, he could end up living his life on a chain. There is no place for the dogs to run at this facility so all day they just sit and wait, hoping someone will stop by their cell to pet them.

A person who knew a rescuer called and asked her to help Noah. She came to visit Noah, and found him shaking in his cell, partially due to his being shy, and partially due to the cold 38 degree temperatures in this facility. Noah is shy, but also very sweet. He loves to be petted and cuddled, and gets along with other dogs.

Noah is 63 pounds, and has been neutered and fully vetted. All Noah needs now is a home and a family that will love him. Please fill out an application on this great boy today since he will be arriving on January 24th. He would love to have a "forever" home waiting for him!
name: Noah SCAS

description:
Notes:  
Babar! is such a lovable, huggable fellow with a perky, funny sense of humour. 
Always "rearin' to go!" Always game. 
Always enthusiastic & happy!
If he finds you a little down, he notices quickly and rolls himself in a blanket with only his nose and eyes poking out, like a "pig in a blanket". 
He is delicious!
When trying to find the right mate to run free with, I was told (by behaviourist) that "Babar! likes bossy women".
Babar! is a charming rascal. He sure knows how to wangle his way into your heart. He makes himself irresistible. 
Tolerates small dogs. 
Does not like cats. 
Loves people!
Lived with a parrot at the veterinarian's. 
Blue nose. Silver great. 
Loves to be given a bully stick! He wags his whole body to give the hint. 

Babar began charming us the moment we had the privilege of meeting him at a high kill shelter, where even there he was filled with joy. How could we not rescue him from there and make sure he stayed safe until he could meet...you! "Happy, happy, happy!!!" says his foster, when asked to describe the adorable little boy. Babar wags his tail no matter what is happening, and that includes when the vet gives him shots. This is a dog in love with life and all that it holdsâand we mean all. His new best friend is a cat, and he has a great time playing with a neighboring pet parrot. Babar is a prince on the inside and outâdon't you want to be the one to give him the perfectly-timed kiss as it becomes so? 

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Babar

description: Bio coming soon!
name: Remy

She was thrown over the fence by her âownerâ as they drove away.  She has been spayed and is up to date on her vaccinations.  Sheâs currently living in a Foster Home in NJ.

I am a sweet girl who just wants to love you. Wait until you feel my soft, silky coat! You`ll just want to snuggle me, and I would like nothing more! description: We pulled Holly off death row at animal control. She had some wounds and was dirty as can be! We've gotten her cleaned up and checked out by the vet and now she is just chilling in her foster home getting the well needed love she deserves. As expected, we pulled a real gem. She's sweet and gentle and as loving as can be! Bring her home today!

description: Wilma is a 2 year old spayed female cattle dog who weighs about 35 lbs. This gorgeous girl is a little bit chunky and could drop a few pounds, but she is very food motivated. Wilma is about the sweetest dog you will ever meet and she loves to be pet and give you lots of kisses in return. She gets along well with other dogs, has met a couple of kids with no issues and she walks well on a leash. Wilma is fully crate trained and just needs a family that is willing to give her a second chance. If you are interested in adopting, please submit an adoption application on our website www.justice-rescue.com

description: domino is a large mixed breed possibly corso. She is an all around wonderful dog. She is not a fan of her kennel and is vocal about it but outside of it she is amazing.She is calm, sweet, loving, playful and enjoys being around people she loves. Once you gain her trust you have a friend for life. She has tested ok with cats and does well with other dogs. She has gone into our playgroups and is a rockstar although she prefers the company of calmer dogs. Domino is a larger girl and needs a few manners such as not jumping up but other than that she is an exceptionally great dog. She would make a great companion to most any homeFor more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
10 years old.

Thank you for your interest in adopting a rescued Basset Hound! We ask all potential adopters to complete our application and approval process first so we can discuss the dogs that fit your home. description:
Raymond was enjoying the warm weather at the lake. He greeted the boaters as they came in from fishing. He played with some kids at the playground and waited for his person to come back. Surely they were coming back for him? The next day it stormed, so he found a covered pavilion and laid down. He would only take short naps, because he didn't want to miss his owner when they came for him. Raymond just kept waiting...

Raymond is a handsome Lab/Mountain Cur mix who is a year old. He loves kids and adults and all dogs he meets. He has not been cat tested, but this can be arranged. He is up to date on all shots, on Heartworm and flea prevention and is neutered. He is house trained and has attended a few basic obedience classes. Raymond knows how to sit and is working on "stay," and "down." He was pulling on his leash a lot but walks well with an Easy Walker harness.

Initially, Raymond would cower when someone would lift a hand to pet his head. He now knows we are not going to swat him and no longer flinches. Raymond was scared of car rides at first but has decided they are pretty fun and he's not getting left behind anymore. He does well at adoption events and is just a happy boy.

Raymond
would love a family of his own with kids to play with or another dog to keep him company. Please consider making him a part of your family. This special guy is waiting for you!!

If you'd like to meet him, please fill out an application and be sure to ask for RAYMOND "RUSTY" TEXAS!
name: Raymond "Rusty" Texas

description:
This absolutely stunning, young man is Ignis! A 7 month old Catahoula Cur who is not only beautiful on the outside but inside as well. He is full of happy puppy energy and just loves everyone and everything he meets. Dog and cat friendly Ingis will fit into his new life with other animals. He is an active and fun dog who will bring his new family years of love and loyalty. We are sure Ignis will not be with us long, so hurry in to meet him! 

To fill out an adoption application, please go to our website, www.vaonj.org and click on  Adopt and then Adoption. Please complete the form and bring it with you when you visit our shelter, and don't forget to put the Orphanâs name on the form.  Thanks!  Our pets are spayed or neutered, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines prior to going to their new homes. For more information on our adoption procedures, please visit, www.vaonj.org.

NOT READY TO ADOPT, BUT WOULD LIKE TO HELP? Voorhees Animal Orphanage will continue to care for this pet until it is adopted. Help support this pet with a donation. Please go to www.vaonj.org, click on How to Help and then Donate.
ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

On behalf of the animals, we thank you!

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Humero! This beautiful boy is a Sato Rescue from Puerto Rico. He was found trying to survive on the streets all by himself. When he was about two months old he was put together with another pup Gustavo, and they have been inseparable ever since. Humero is the more shyer of the two. But he is just the sweetest, gentlest thing. We would love to get these two boys adopted together but know that may be impossible. But the only thing better than one Rescue dog, is two! If you would like to see Humero in person, he is located at our Rt 9 location.
name: Humero

description:
Age/Sex:  1 year 2 month old spayed female 
Details: Crate Trained, OK with dogs, needs fence
Location:  Garden City, NY

Contact: Wendy Boyce at wboyce95@optonline.net
Phone: (732) 617-1940

Online Adoption Application:  http://fs20.formsite.com/brittanyrescue/form10/index.html

Dog Story:
If youâre reading this, youâre looking for a canine companion and I fit the bill since Iâm a VERY, VERY ACTIVE PUPPY who needs human companionship. Just a short time ago I was caged most of the day. But luckily now Iâm in a foster home with 2 Brittanys to keep me company, a crate and bed of my own, toys and human companionship. The humans talk to me, teach me stuff, tell me NO sometimes (actually lots of times) and tell me Iâm a good girl when I follow the rules. They also provide good food and best of all they cuddle me and give me belly rubs. Life is GOOD!! Since the foster humans already have two Brittanys we hope that one of you will want to adopt me. 

My foster family says I came to them with âNO skillsâ. I have already learned to use the magnetic doggie door! Iâm not great on the leash so I need to practice that. Iâm NOT protective of my food bowl which is good. Iâve learned to play nicely with the resident Britts- 2 femaleâs ages 8 & 7. Iâm learning that toys are for chewing but human hands or shoes are not. My biggest problem is garbage picking, eating paper (I love tissues) and money (Mostly 10'S and 20'S) and counter/table surfing. Iâm learning that NO means I should stop doing what Iâm doing. Iâm learning that I should use the bathroom in the yard and not on a rug. Thereâs still a lot to learn but my foster family says Iâm smart and a fast learner. They say Iâm a youngster and that I turned 1 Year old in September. Iâm very good looking girl with light orange markings and very distinctive eyes. My tail is docked and my foster says they can see the beginnings of feathering on my butt and tail. I'm going to be a really beautiful adult. I like it here but I want a family to call my own, a family that will love me and cherish me and I can love, cherish, protect, and entertain in return. 

Now just a few thoughts from my foster mom and dad who say no and dispenses the foods and belly rubsâ¦As Kalli learns to trust, she is becoming sweeter and sweeter. Sheâs very active as befits her age and breed so she will need regular walks and a fenced in yard where he can run around and explore. She hasnât tried to climb over or dig under the fence (BUT HAS DUG HOLES). She adores playing with my 2 Brittanys , especially my alpha female (but Kalli can get to be too much sometimes) and it is allowing her to be properly socialized as they put her in her place when she gets too rough. She would enjoy all the attention an only dog gets but sheâd benefit from the companionship of another dog. She is jealous when others get attention. She will also benefit from having toys that are for strong chewers. When she gets nippy, weâve been able to distract her with toys. This is a behavior that they outgrow as they mature and have proper training. We have crate trained her and she doesnât seem to mind being crated, but really lets you know when she wants out. She also loves her treats. We are currently working on the sit command and sheâs making quick progress because she loves treats, even the healthy kind like cucumber slices. 

Obviously I (all of us at ABR) hope that our foster dogs find great homes but in this case my hope is really strong. We truly believe we have saved this pup. Sheâs not perfect but she wants to please and is visibly happy when she gets praised. 

You must be considerate enough to know Kalli would not be happy or thrive being crated for 8 hours a day, she does sleep in her crate but that is to keep the house in one piece overnight. The main reason why Kalli wouldnât be happy crated up is because she is very active and loves being around people. So Kalli really needs a home where she will be exercised every day, preferably taken for runs or long fast walks and she needs either a work from home situation or someone who only works away from home part-time. While she loves everyone, if youâve got children they need to be older, 10 yrs. and up, because when she gets excited she jumps and she would hate to hurt a child who canât deal with that. 

Also, having another dog to play with would be the best! Just make sure he/she is tolerant because, according to her foster sisters, she can be a real pest trying to get another dog to play with her. And she also will steal their toys, so he/she has got to be okay with that. Cats are NOT friends Kalli needs a home with NO cats. She also will need a good, strong, secure fence. She wonât jump it but will run up to it and smack it really hard when she sees a bird or squirrel that she wants. Please note she does like to dig so will need someone willing to watch her when she is in the yard. Beyond that she is a very attentive, affectionate, not too sensitive Brittany girl. 

She is spayed, crate trained, healthy and heartworm negative. She knows some basic commands but would benefit from an obedience class. She would be really good at agility so if you like working with dogs Kalliâs got the energy. And smarts for it! Just be sure to use positive reinforcement because Kalli thinks any other correction is playing. We think her former owner used a little strong negative corrections and she would just puppy laugh it off. Everything is play, fetch and run around with Kalli. If you are interested and would like to be considered for Kalli please to fill out the adoption application at www.americanbrittanyrescue.org or http://fs20.formsite.com/brittanyrescue/form10/index.html 

History:  
Kalli was an owner surrender, an older couple contacted ABR, after their family situation changed and realized they could not handle this WHIRLWIND Brittany Puppy.
name: KALLI

description:
Louie was picked up as a stray and was found to have a mast cell tumor on his rear leg which made it necessary to remove.  However, this has not slowed this tyke down at all and he still likes to go for his walks.  Louie is a typical Chi so we don't recommend he go to a home with young kids.  He can also be bossy with the other dogs and may be best as the only king of the castle.  But he does like to burrow under the blankets and snuggle with his human companions.  

Louie is 6-7 years old and has a big heart in a compact body.  In addition to the surgery on his leg, he also had his vaccines and has been neutered.  Louie will be microchipped prior to adoption.  

We keep our website current so if you see a pet listed here you can be pretty certain it is still available.  Send in an application located here and we will be in touch.  (www.allstarpetrescue.com)

description:
STELLA AND MAX

 COURTESY POST

 CHIHUAHUAS

 When looking for cuddling companions, two Chihuahuas are better than one! Stella and Max are twins, we think. Rescued from a person who kept them outside in the cold, they have bloomed into the loving and beloved duo they once were-happy to meet strangers, willing to snuggle up to men they just met and ready to kiss your nose in exchange for a treat. Stella is a bit blind in one eye but that doesn't slow her down. They race across the room, romping and chasing each other, sometimes ending in a wrestle on the sofa or with Stella standing on her hind legs with her paws dangling at her waist while looking around for her Max, like a prairie dog. 
   They are healthy, up to date with vaccines, and weewee pad trained. They weigh around five pounds- each half s lapfull. 
   In Their ideal home, they'd be the only two dogs. They are senior citizens, hoping they won't have to share the limelight, especially Max. Cats might be ok. I'm not sure. They're a perfect pair for people with time to laugh at their playful antics and to give them the love they missed. (Please, no kids under 13) Please apply to adopt Max and Stella at Rescueridge.com and your application will be forwarded to Little Dog Lifeboat. You can email: littledoglifeboat@gmail.com for more information.
name: Stella

description: Piper is a really good girl, a medium level of energy and does well in the house.  She is only about 35 pounds and smaller than her foster brothers.  She is nervous right now since she just lost her home and family (who lost their home) including 7 children of about every age imaginable.  She likes other dogs and gets along with people very well.  She misses her kids but bad economic times always take their toll.  Patience will let her come around and a family with kids to play with her and for her to protect would solve the issues.  If you are interested in adding Piper to your family please email tristateshepherdrescue@gmail.com for an application.

She will be ready to go to her furever home in mid-December. Submit an application for Chanel today at www.njshpetrescue.org

description:
My name is LOLI and I"m a lovely 3 yr F Wht/Red Cocker Spaniel. I'm 26 lbs of PURE SUGAR & SPICE. I was given up by my owner due to NO TIME. I am a sweet girl but am shy and guarded with strangers at first and I can be a little snarky with a typical cocker attitude but once I know you I'm sweet as sugar, loving and affectionate. I was raised as a solo dog and lived a pampered life indoors but I was frustrated and got into things and was a bit destructive. As a result I don't like to be left alone and have a bit of separation anxiety. I am good with other dogs and would love to be with another dog to give me more doggie confidence. I've not met any cats so not sure how I would be living with a cat but I don't think I would mind a cat that likes dogs. Because I can be snarky, it's best if I go with kids ages 10 yrs + but an adult only home would be best!  I need structured disciplined daily exercise and interactivity and prefer someone who knows, understands and appreciates my breed. I'm a jewel of a dog as long as I get the confidence and support I need. Pls come meet/ me today!!

For more info/app; pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERSESCUE.ORG
name: Loli

description:
Meet Bailey!  This unusual 9 year old longhair chihuahua came to us when his owners were unable to care for him any longer.  He is extremely overweight, weighing in at 18 pounds, which is about double what he should be!  Heâs a little nervous at first but warms up quickly and is looking for a calmer adult home with someone who will get him on the way to a longer healthier life with a diet and exercise program.  He has some hair loss which we suspect is color dilution alopecia, which is genetically linked to his markings and probably will remain bald but it just makes him extra interesting!  Email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested in meeting him.

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Bailey

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Handsome Simba is a 1.5 year old Chow mix who weighs 50 pounds. He comes into rescue from Texas. This sweet boy has only known a life of suffering and neglect until now and we are so happy that we have the opportunity to give him the amazing new life that he deserves! He really is a stunning boy with his fluffy coat and that cute black tongue that gives away the Chow in him! He spent some time with our vet partner getting all the medical care he needed and now heâs healthy, happy, and ready for a home to call his own. He can be shy and nervous when first getting to know him and requires a slow and patient approach while heâs trying to adjust to his surroundings. Because of this, Simba would benefit from an experienced owner and would do best in a home without small kids (under 10) at this time. After he feels comfortable and warms up he is an absolute joy to he around and gets along well with other dogs. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you are looking for a loyal companion to add to your family, then Simba is the one for you! If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Simba his happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

description:
Joey is a 5 year old Shih Tzu weighing 9 pounds.  He loves to play with his toys.  Joey gets along great with his furry foster sibling, with cats and is wonderful with kids. Joey is housebroken and sleeps through the night.  Joey needs to be with a family that is comfortable administering his daily eye medication, and would also love a family with another small dog to play with.

description:
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance will transport within reasonable distance. Sweet baby Glory is being fostered in GA. 

what we know about Glory:
*sweet happy puppy
*had an injury from another dog that left her skull slightly misshapen and with vision loss, but she does very well!
*making good puppy progress on housebreaking
*crates in xpen
*loves people and other dogs
*loves walks!

what Glory's foster mom has to say about baby Glory:
Glory is a great 4 month old pup who loves walks in the woods and loves to play.
She has enough vision right now to retrieve a Frisbee and chase balls.  Glory is doing well in her foster home.  She is healing from her surgery prior to rescue.  She walks well on a leash and is doing great with housebreaking, with an occasional urine accident on a pad in her expen overnight.  
The shelter said she was Chi mix but we do not see it.  We have heard numerous comments about her breed.  I will tell you she is a wonderful mix!    
Glory is a quick learner and loves to give kisses. She is extra cute with her little tongue that sticks out some from her injury.
Her little face is a little distorted from her injury. But all of this is improving with age and healing. Glory has a wonderful personality to have been through so much with her injury. Blind Dog Rescue Alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.
name: Glory: adoption pending!

name: Aurora

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

Handsome Hunter is a 3-4 year old golden/collie mix.  This spunky boy enjoys a good run and is ready to be your running partner!  Hunter is also a playful one who is awesome at fetch and will drop his ball at your feet for another throw.  He enjoys swimming, or should I say lounging, in our kiddie pools.  He is sweet and affectionate with people, but doesnât have much dog experience, so he would do best as the only dog for now. Email shelter@spca914.org for more information.

When to Come: (Unless different date stated above)
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the best match. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions, except in the case of dogs that require more than one visit prior to adoption. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the best match. Some dogs require all residents of your home and household dog(s) to be present for a meet and greet.  

We do not accept adoption fee deposits in advance, nor do we hold animals, unless it is an animal that requires more than one visit prior to adoption. In this case, an appointment can be scheduled with a senior staff member or trainer. Some dogs require all residents of your home and household dog(s) to be present for a meet and greet. If they are not present, we cannot hold the dog.   

Adoption Fees; Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated and dewormed (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. Pre-existing medical conditions are covered via our Simpson Clinic free of charge within the first 30 days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.

NYS Registration # RR056
name: Hunter - Foster me for the Holidays!

description: STAR - 9 years young, 55 lbs, Fire Island NY Words from Starâs foster mom: âStar is approximately 9 years old and 55 pounds. She is fine walking by dogs in the street, never had an issue with that. She has not been around any young kids only my nieces. I think she will be fine but she is âpawsyâ when requesting pets. She barks when she knows we are home (she is downstairs in the bedroom separate when this happens) and just wants to be with us. When we are not home she doesnât bark. We have a video camera and can hear whatâs going on. She is fine with strangers. She has shown some fear when meeting certain people and I realized that is when they stand over her and stare at her. But once they give her a pet sheâs their friend forever. She was outside when the mailman came and was fine and accepted pets from strangers in fire island. She was initially afraid of my dad, he gave her a treat and now they are best friends and he picks her up to go for rides. I leave her out in the morning and she has free range On the first floor of our house. She has never chewed on anything but her toys and will typically go lay on her bed after I leave.â Star is spayed, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you would like to meet this sweet girl, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414 or amsterdog@gmail.com.
name: STAR

He is learning to trust people when he meets them, therefore he needs time to warm up before showing off what an amazing dog he is. He knows basic commands and is eager to please. Of course he is eager to please, who wouldn't want treats every time they sit or stay!

If you are interested in giving this sweet faced boy a forever home, please go to rescueridge.com and then text 732 546 8805 to meet Jax. Your application will be forwarded to his rescue. This is a courtesy post on Rescue Ridge, helping a fellow rescue find a home for this handsome boy.

He is a Shepard/lab mix, approx 3 years old. He is very talkative. Warhammer is not a fan of cats! A meet & greet with others dogs would be needed as he isnât a fan of all dogs. He needs an experienced large dog owner. He will need training. A home with older children is best. Please come in and meet him!

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. Meet Levi! Levi is a 1.5 year old Chocolate Lab who weighs 50 pounds. He comes into rescue from Texas. Poor Levi has only known a life of suffering so far and when we got to him he was not in good shape. His fur missing and his skin so raw and scabbed. We got him immediately to our vet partner where he has been getting all the medical care that he needs. He is now doing amazing and is ready to start his new life! Levi is ready to meet the amazing person who can show him what it means to be truly loved and cared for. Could that person be you?! Levi has blossomed into the most handsome boy and on top of that he is the sweetest soul. He is going to make a great companion to the lucky one that gets to adopt him. Levi is very friendly with people of all ages and other dogs and will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to be the one that gets to give Levi his happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

Knows basic commands, house trained, spayed and up to date on shots.

Sadie went for a 2 week training course at Dan Gentile.

This is a courtesy post so please give us some time to contact the family.

Someone will contact you to set up a meet and greet.

description: Say hello to sweet Holly! Holly is a three year old brindle beauty who came to Bideawee with her sister Berry. Holly is the braver gal of the two, and loves to get out and explore the neighborhood. Everything is still a bit new to this southern girl, but she's embracing it all with a great attitude. Holly is a happy girl who loves people, playing and snuggling with her sister, and most of all she loves her treats. We think Holly will be great at learning all kinds of things if she gets a treat in return, as we've definitely found that this is her soft spot! Holly is sweet and gentle and will be a great best friend, so come meet her today!

Weight: 63 lbs. Medical Observation: Severe bilateral otitis with stenosis, mild generalized dermatologic disease with papules and excoriations, significant soft tissue swelling around ventral cervical region. Granulating wound under neck/front of chest. Personality: Prince is one meaty love. He was a bit stubborn on leash, using his body weight to careen after good tin cans he needed to sniff. description:
Meet independent, affectionate, athletic Jenny Jogger. Young Jenny has the most beautiful pumpkin and white colored fur. Her markings, like her personality, are unique and special. Jenny has cute spots â some look like freckles! And her personality is ever-engaging. She tries to talk to you. She can entertain herself home alone for 8 or 10 hours with her toys and her backyard access, but when you return she is so happy be with you. She loves walks, runs, hikes, playing fetch or tug of war, sitting while watching you cook or clean, watching TV herself (especially anything with a ball) and sleeping next to you when invited. She even likes her crate. From her crate she will watch you attentively and chew on a rawhide or other bone. 

Jenny has a super healthy stomach; she can eat anything. This medium sized, 40 pound young girl is incredibly fit and agile. Her trainer said that she would be great for agility training (a great bonding activity). She has been trained to walk well on a leash but still does best with experienced handlers as she is quite active and strong. We tested her DNA and she is Swiss shepherd (a herding dog), pit and Rottie, although she really doesnât look like any of those breeds. We recommend her as an only pet. But she is very good on a leash walking next to dogs that she likes. 

Jenny is fully housebroken, knows her basic commands, is spayed, up to date on all her shots and ready to be your loyal family pet! Recommended for kids over 12 or active adults. Jenny is a rare gem! To apply to adopt Jenny please fill out an adoption application at www.peace4paws.org.
name: Jenny Jogger

description:
Raven is a large Labrador/Hound mix who is equal parts sweet and sassy. Like many dogs (and people for that matter), sheâs a real foodie, and the way to her heart is definitely through her stomach! Sheâll do anything for a treat, and is always happy to perform behaviors and tricks she knows for her rewards. She could spend all day lying out in the sun, but is just as happy to be curled up at your feet at the end of a long day. 

To learn more about Raven or to set up a meet and greet, contact Mike Spiotta at mikes@animalleague.org.
name: Raven
