description:
12/8/18


My name is Rosalie. I was saved from death at Liberty Animal Control in GA months and months ago . I was covered in bruises and wounds ALL over my body. I was missing fur and took a while to heal. I have become what is known as the "tester dog". I am brought to animal control to interact with other dogs to help them get placed with rescue groups and go on to their new lives. TIme and time again I watch friends of mine that I made here at Carpathia Paws, all leave. I hear about their new forever homes and wonder what that would be like. Don't get me wrong, I am grateful I didn't die in animal control and I am glad I am helping so many others get a chance to leave alive.  I get sad when I have to say goodbye to my friends here at Carpathia . I wish someone would notice me and take me into a real home where I would be part of a family. 
Guess what Rosalie- your plea has been heard!  Thanks to our amazing rescue partners at WAGS. IT'S YOUR TURN NOW ROSALIE!! 

Rosalie was pulled from Liberty Animal Control a few months ago. She was covered in bruises and wounds all over her body that required quite some time to heal. Some spots have not grown back yet. She is a Rednose Pit Mix, about 3 1/2 years old and spayed. She tested positive for HW and will be treated as soon as the medication for treatment comes in. This girl is good with everybody and even grumpy dogs do not mind her! Loves kids, is house and crate trained and walks nice on a leash. 



This girl is looking for a forever home for Christmas! CAN YOU MAKE THIS GIRLS DREAM COME TRUE???


Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Rosalie Talbot-Looking for CHRISTMAS MIRACLE!!

description: Earl is a 3-1/2 month old mix that weighs 22 pounds. Earl is high energy and needs a lot of exercise. Earl's sister has been diagnosed with a condition called Mega Esophagus. We are closely monitoring the three siblings in hopes that the other 2 do not have it. Earl eats his food soaked in water in 3 smaller meals, but at this point he is unable to drink water from a bowl. He regurgitates it. Therefore, dog parks are a no-no for him. He must eat 3 meals during the day, so he is unable to spend a lot of hours alone. The vet thinks he will out grow this condition because it's very mild, but right now we are using every precaution to ensure he stays healthy. Earl needs a family that is home most of the day, he needs a fenced yard so that he can have the exercise he needs. We are also requiring the adoptive family to purchase doggie insurance on Earl in case of health issues in the future. If your family can handle his special needs, please fill out an application. Joe Joe's Place is not a shelter. We are a network of foster homes, therefore we only allow visits of our animals with an approved application. Please allow up to 72 hours for processing. We do use a first received, first reviewed application process. Due to our requirement of a first visit at the foster home and a follow up home visit at the potential adopters home, we only adopt within 1-1/2 hours of Medford, NJ. Our adoption fee is $300 per dog. That fee covers age appropriate vaccines, microchip and neuter.
name: Earl

description: Introducing Sammy's Hope's newest lap dog...Mo! Mo might be a little big to be a lap dog but he sure doesn't realize that! At about 3 and a half years old, this handsome boy is super cuddly and mushy, and will happily chill out on the couch all day long. Don't be fooled though...Mo also loves a good walk and romping around outside. Plus, have you seen that face? His soulful eyes and adorable smile are hard to resist! This mush truly is one of a kind and is ready to make some lucky family the happiest family in the world. Come on down and meet Mo...he's ready to steal your love and, of course, your lap.
name: MO.

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Didi is our latest "Cinderella" transformation. This 3-year-old PB Pyr girl and her pups were surrendered by a farmer who was not pleased that she jumped their little fence and mated with the neighbor's Anatolian Shepherd. Left outside, she was matted, emaciated and had wounds infested with maggots, and even the puppies had maggots attached as well. Didi has been sweet and thankful to be inside and cleaned up, and now she's become a beauty. Now that her pups have been adopted and she's been spayed and back to good health, she's ready for a furever home of her own. After her initial neglect, Didi takes time to warm up to new people, but once she does, she's a sweetie. She is a snuggle-bunny with people, is fine with cats, but can be defensive around other large dogs, so Didi will be placed as an only dog.
name: Didi in MO

description:
*****URGENT******

One of our own pups needs a new home ASAP!

We saved Lucas from the ACC of NYC: At-Risk Animals Urgent list last December.

He was fully trained by our good friends at Allied Dog Training and his new adopter will receive handling lessons and lifetime support from our trainers.

He has been living in harmony with the resident dog for many months until recently.

Lucas received veterinary care today for a bite to his neck and he will be ok.

His adopter has agreed to keep them separate while we frantically search for a foster or adopter.

Lucas is dog friendly but no cats for him.

Lucas is just under 2 years old. He can be fearful with strangers and needs time to trust.

A low traffic home with older kids would be best.

Lucas is super smart- likes to work- did agility while at the Farm.

Adopters should be able to come to the Farm in Southern Dutchess County for handling lessons so his training may be upheld.

Please, please share this boy- we need to find him a foster or adopter ASAP.

Applications:

www.townandcountryk9resq.com
 under contact us

Questions:

Christine Bruno Andersen our adoption coordinator 914-772-0649

THANK YOU!
name: Lucas

description:
Marty came to EHR back in 2012 & was adopted into the same family as Kelsey (who has already been readopted). Unfortunately, they are now returning to EHR and Marty is still looking for new home. Marty is sweet & loving dog, he gets along with other dogs and with people, young and old. He is well-mannered & we hope he will be back in a home soon.

If you would like to meet Marty, please fill out an application and ask for MARTY STEELE!
name: Marty Steele

description:
Old man Max has proven that he had the WILL live.  Love, the proper diet, CBD oil and a few medications he is doing much better with his liver condition. 

Our boy Max is 9 years old, weighs 41lbs and was left in the ACC shelter system when his owner ran out of time to Rehome him.   The owner has a history of absences in and out of max life and was never taken to the vet since he was a Puppy: A few of our members came together to save him. With how emaciated and stiff jointed he was! We thought for sure he was going to be a hospice case.  To all of our surprise Max is a crazy, lively, fun loving dude. He loves a good adventure and is an even better love bug/cuddler NOW that heâs feeling better. 

YES max still has a fatal liver condition BUT his last days are not any time soon! This little lover is living life to his fullest and would love a forever partner to go through life with him. 

Someone please step up to give him the best golden years a dog can ask for!! 

** if you foster OR adopt his monthly medicine expenses will be paid for **

He is on 2 medications indefinitely : Denamarin & Prednisone and Cosequin vitamins which all older adults/seniors should be on for joint and bone support.

We pray someone has a heart for his story the same way he stole everyone at ACCâs heart away and melted us with his dreamy eyes.

Please visit us at:
Victory4thevoiceless.com to fill out an application ?
name: Max

description: TUCKER is an owner surrender.  He is about 10 months old  and will be neutered before he is adopted out.  If you are interested in adopting Tucker, please contact Hollywood Dog Rescue to find out more information.  The Rescue can put you in touch with the owner.  845 744 2545.
name: TUCKER

description:
Meet Ruger!! Ruger is an American Bulldog mix, approximately13 months old, and weighing around 50 pounds.  Ruger was turned into a shelter when his family were forced to choose one of their two dogs to keep.  Ruger is such a sweet and loving. Ruger is a mellow fellow who did not react when another dog at the shelter went after him. All he wants to do is be a lover. Ruger is good with children and other dogs.

 Ruger is up to date on vaccinations, neutered, and micro chipped.

 If you are interested in meeting Ruger, go to EHRDOGS.ORG and submit an application. Don't forget to ask for RUGER HAVARD!!!
name: Ruger Havard

description:
Hey-Hey Y'all, my name is Leah! I am just under 2 years old and approx. 45 lbs.  I was found wandering the streets with my siblings looking for food. I was starving, very frightened and  I wasn't too sure of the people that came to get me. I was taken to the vet by animal control and luckily ended up in foster care.  My foster Mom says I have the most kind eyes she's ever seen. I am a really good girl...it might take me just a little time to get used to you, but I'm sure it's not anything a little time, some petting, patience and some love can't fix! My foster Mom says I am the most playful of my siblings.I love toys that make noise, running and playing.  I like other dogs and I'm used to letting small kids pet me. I am looking for a forever home, even though I really like this one. I'm looking for a place I can run and play, and show you what a great dog I can become! My rescuer is partnered with the Ohana Dog Rescue to find me a loving and stable home in the Northeast... Please think about me when you are filling out your application.  I can be loyal, funny, and loving! Thank you!

Please email OhanaRescueDogs@gmail.com to apply for or inquire further about me...:)
name: Leah Mia!

description: Zoey is a sweet but timid girl. She came from a home with many dogs and when her owner moved, she couldn`t come. Color:tan/white
name: Zoey

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Foster Update 1/20/2015'Rooney was returned for a second time as the home she was in just wasn't a good fit. Rooney is a fun, active, inquisitive, kind of quirky little girl. She at times is very outgoing, yet at other times seems almost shy. Rooney loves to play with toys and has recently learned to 'drop it' as she sometimes does not like to share. She can be a collector of items around the house, so its best to try to keep things you don't want her to get into put away. Rooney is a good eater, crates well, but at times still needs to be watched with her housebreaking. If you are looking for a little snuggle bug, Rooney is your girl.'
_____________________________________________________TB's Rooney is a beautiful, sleek, dainty girl. She has an adorable prance in her step. She's very friendly, gives kisses, chitters and likes to bury her head into you--how cute is she!! She enjoys attention but not in a pushy way. Rooney is 2 years old and cat tolerant with supervision.9/11/2014Rooney was returned after 3 days due to absolutely no fault of her own and she is in a foster home and waiting for her forever home.Foster Update 9/16/2014Rooney is a delightful two-year old girl (DOB 7/20/2012) and is perhaps the tiniest greyhound this experienced Greyhound lover has ever come across. I estimate her to be about 50 something pounds, though she is still gaining some needed weight. She is striking in both her dainty stature and shiny black coat. Her foster home includes three cats. She is curious about them, but is easily redirected from looking at them. We also have two resident greyhounds; she gets along with both and enjoys playing in our fenced-in yard with them. We also have two dog-friendly children, ages 9 and 13; she does well with the children and readily receives gentle pettings from them. Both adults in our home work full time. While we are at work, Rooney is crated. She goes in her crate easily and has had no issues with, or accidents in, the crate. At night, she sleeps on a dog bed next to our bed. She has mastered the stairs and our laminate/tile/wood flooring. She has made excellent progress in house living and manners and has learned that 'pottying' is done outside on walks or in the fenced-in yard. Rooney walks well on a leash and enjoys her jaunts about the neighborhood.Rooney is an affectionate girl who loves the company of people. She has a warm, endearing quality and will make a loving companion to her lucky adopter. 12/23/18 3:04 PM
name: Rooney

description:

I am a very playful puppy and I love playing with my toys.  I am independent but at the same time I want to be with my family and I will follow them around. I am about 12-14 weeks old. My foster family says I am very pretty!  I was resuced along with my brother Todd from a high kill shelter in NC and I am now enjoying a foster home in NJ.

description:
Get the latest Social Tees news by following us on Instagram (@socialteesnyc) or Facebook. Find more adoptable pets, FAQs, and info on ways to contribute to the rescue world at socialteesnyc.org.

BEANNY is a 13-month-old, 35 lbs stunningly gorgeous Hound/Beagle mix. She came to us via our sister organization and were rescued in DR. Very sweet, loving and more on the quiet side. There is no way to run and hide from those kisses and tail wags. She is mellow, sweet and gentle and would do best in a medium active home. Her foster says "Beanny is a very calm and loving dog and loves attention. She is rarely noisy besides a little whining here and there when youâre not petting her and I havenât heard a bark out of her once. I attached some pictures, please let me know if they are okay or if youâd like some more."

This animal is not at the Social Tees office (325 East 5TH Street) â all of our dogs and cats are in foster homes while they wait to find their forever families. :) If youâd like to apply to adopt this pet, please complete an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org.

PLEASE NOTE: Because we are a small team and receive hundreds of applications each week, we are unable to respond to every application and every inquiry email, but we do our best. Please have patience! If your application is approved, you will for sure hear from us. If you have questions, please take a look at the Adoption and Fostering FAQs etc. on our website as all common questions are answered there. Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we work to save these innocent lives!!

Adoption fees apply and cover spay/neuter surgery; up to date on vaccines at time of adoption; microchip; treated with defleaing, deworming, and demiting medication as necessary; and often more.
name: BEANNY

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Luna, a beautiful female pitbull born in early 2014, is looking for her forever home! Luna was brought into rescue when her previous owners had her spayed and her stitches burst open, allowing her intestines to come out. We immediately rushed her to our vet where she received the life saving treatment she needed. She adores people, cuddling and affection. Other dogs can scare Luna, so she would do best with calm, easy going dogs. This beauty really needs a family of her own! She sleeps with her foster mom every night and really likes that.... and she loves toys. Luna is house trained, and knows her basic commands. She is up to date on shots and has been spayed.
name: Luna

description: LINKS was left tied to a fence with an embedded chain in his neck. He was treated for the severe wounds on his neck and ears and was fully vetted. LINKS was more than likely a yard dog judging by his disposition and his body score. He was thin but friendly. LINKS cannot go to a family with kids as he is large and is still working on his manners. It appears LINKS was never really socialized with other dogs but is learning how to play appropriately. LINKS is actively seeking a home of his own as he has been in the shelter for a couple of months now. Please come visit the animals at EASEL Animal Rescue League, behind the Ewing Municipal Building at 4 Jake Garzio Drive, Ewing. Adoption hours are every day from 12-3.
name: Links

description:
Mel is a 4 year old beagle who was retired from a lab after caring for and raising her pups. Mel is a fun and friendly little girl who enjoys being with people and other calm, non-dominant dogs. She loves a cozy snuggle including a good ear rub of her long beagle ears. She is a cuddler for sure, so if you're not, she's not the girl for you!

Mel has been great with other dogs, cats, kittens, and older children. She is fine with younger children, but just might be a bit overwhelmed with active crying toddlers, so older children would be best. She is crate trained overnight and when left for short periods of time and is doing great with her house-training.  She will need experienced adopters willing to work on housetraining, and who have a schedule in which they can do so.  Mel MUST have a fenced in yard in her forever home (preferably with a concrete slab that is OK to void on!), as well as another young beagle to keep her company. She will make a fabulous addition to the right family...could it be yours? 

To review our adoption process and submit an application, please visit:
http://www.beaglerescueleague.org/adoption

For more information about our Lab to Leash Division, please visit: http://www.beaglerescueleague.org/lab-to-leash/questions-answers
name: Mel

description: Cute little love who will jump up on your lap and gives kisses! Plays well with other dogs and doesn't look at cats. Sits, stays, waits to eat. Black coat with brindle feet and a nicely curled up tail! Sweet dog!! Corgi/Shepard Mix; about 5 months old; Up to date on all vaccines and rabies; neutered; micro-chipped. Approximately 18 pounds. Mason is thankful for his foster home but would be grateful for a forever home!! Mason loves to play in the yard with his brothers and enjoys sitting in the sun on the patio or laying by the fireplace ! Essentially housebroken, an easy keeper who will make a great family dog!!
name: mason

description: Kayla is a very special girl that was rescued during the heat wave over the summer.  She was very pregnant and very dehydrated.  She received fluids and as much prenatal care that we could provide given the condition she was found in.  Kayla gave birth to 6 babies.  Three of the babies were stillborn and two more passed away within 48 hours of being born.  Kayla was not producing milk with enough nutrition to keep her babies thriving and as a result she was separated from her surviving baby.  (But donât be sad she has been reunited with her and knows she is thriving and doing well!)  Kayla is a senior girl that is probably in double digit years.  She would like nothing more than to live out her golden years on someoneâs couch and be a loyal companion.  Kayla is lazy and enjoys her naps.  She is not a fan of going for long walks and would rather relieve herself in the fenced-in yard and then go back inside.  When you first meet Kayla she is hard to read â she has a serious poker face!  But if you give her some time to settle in you will fall in love with her squishy face and low maintenance needs.  Kayla is housetrained but given her senior age she does have accidents occasionally.  She would do best in a low energy house that doesnât have stairs. Kayla is spayed and up to date her vaccinations.  Kayla is dog friendly but not good with cats.  Kayla is prone to watery eyes and ear infections due to her breed.  Her adopter will have to comfortable with cleaning her face.  If you are interested in Kayla please fill out a screening for at: http://theshelteranimalproject.com/forms/dog-adoption-screening-form/
name: Kayla

Boo has limited vision but gets around very well and is rather young spirited. He has been fully vetted and groomed. Boo is a happy little senior (about 14-15 years old) who deserves to spend Thanksgiving and every holiday going forward in a home. The poodles are not bonded and do not have to be adopted together . They are not dependent on one another whatsoever, they are just 8 lb poodles craving affection. Please apply to adopt!!

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Some dogs just pull at your heartstrings. Some dogs teach us what inner strength and courage are all about. Some dogs just want to play and stay in the moment, one sniff of fresh air, one listening to the sounds of people laughing, birds chirping, wind blowing. Martin just wants to enjoy his life. Saved by Rescue Ridge from a local, overcrowded, inner city shelter, Martin awaits your love and his forever home in a foster home. He loves people! Martin is very smart and alert. He enjoys
company
. He is dog-friendly with dogs who understand that, because he is visually impaired, he doesn't always understand social cues and is a bit clumsy. Martin is best in a home with older children because he probably can only see shadows. This impairment doesn't stop him from enjoying running around the play yard at his foster home or snuggling on the couch by your side. He is affectionate and very sweet. If you put a treat in front of his face, he will try his best to take it gently but does not always succeed. He can't help it. He tries. Martin is housebroken. He needs a fenced in yard and needs supervision in the yard because he will follow a scent and can escape. He is a wonderful boy, around 5 yrs. old.
Will
you take him home and show him that his life matters? Please apply to adopt Martin in central N. J. at Rescue Ridge at rescueridge.com and text 732 546 8805 to meet him. Here is Martin's video debut
https://youtu.be/GJOkvYeHdmM
name: Martin

description:
Diesel has made it to All Mutts Matter and he is slowly settling into living life as a inside house dog, eating good food, learning house manners and building his confidence.  We are certain that with some time and patience, Diesel will forget his past and move on to a brighter life.

Hi!  Thanks for stopping by.  My name is Diesel and I am going to tell you a bit about myself.  I was found in rural WV, stashed away in an outside cage with very little interaction with people.  My owner didn't want me or my 3 brothers and sister Lucy anymore because we wouldn't hunt.  So sadly, we were discarded away as if we didn't matter.  Well, some kind ladies caught wind of what was going on and they sprung into action.  They pulled all of us out of our dirty, cold and meager existence and brought us to a vet office to be examined and cared for.  A Beagle rescue in PA is taking 3 of our brothers and All Mutts Matter (AMMF) is taking in me and Lucy.  A HUGE Thanks to BREW for taking in our 3 brothers.  We know they will get the rehabilitation and love needed so that they can be adopted to loving homes.   Once Lucy and I get to AMMF, we too will go into foster homes where we will continue learn some more house manners and get prepared to start a new life with a kind family.  I am approximately 3 years old, neutered, up-to-date on shots, wormed, on flea/tick and heartworm preventatives, shy and learning to live in a house.  I am crate trained and working on my potty training.  Me and Lucy will be coming north very soon.  If you would like to have me join your family, please go to www.allmuttsmatter.org and fill out an adoption application.   Thanks so much for reading about me and I hope to hear from you soon. Luv, Diesel.

Our adoption process is below:

1. The application will be processed, evaluated and we will contact the vet and personal references;
2.  All other applications that have been submitted on Diesel will also be processed (best suited applicant is chosen, not first come first serve);
3. Schedule a home visit; and
4. Adoption finalized when the best-fitting home is found.  Our adoption fee for Diesel is $295.00.
name: Diesel

description:
This guy has perfected the art of getting whatever he wants with just one look... and what he wants is love! This 5 year old boy is a total mush; he adores people and just wants to be around them. His perfect home would be one where someone is home part time and with the companionship of children. Crosby is a smart, well-trained guy -- he's earned his PhD, the highest level you can achieve in our Canine Life and Social Skills training program! He's also house trained! To learn more about Crosby, e-mail shelter@spca914.org 

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Dr. Crosby, PhD in C.L.A.S.S.

description:
All Saved Me dogs and cats receive a wellness exam at our veterinarian and age-appropriate core vaccines. They are spayed or neutered before they go to their adoptive families.  Dogs over 7 months are tested for heartworm and all cats are tested for FeLV and FIV.

All animals are microchipped and are eligible for a complimentary 30-day pet health insurance policy from Shelter Care if you provide an e-mail address when you complete the adoption. 

We will ask you for a veterinary reference or three personal references,  proof that you are allowed to have pets where you live (lease or lease addendum or proof of home ownership),  and valid identification.  

Adoption fees are as follows: 
Puppies under seven months - $450.00
Dogs - $350.00
Senior dogs (8 years and over) - $225.00
Cats and Kittens - $75.00. 

You do not need an appointment to visit with our adoptable pets, but please call ahead or visit our automatically-updated website to confirm that the pet you want to meet is still available. 
215-240-1240
savedme.org/adopt
name: Russell

description:
Tucker is an absolutely stunning, large, 7 month old Newfie/Border Collie mix. This fluffy and soft guy is always full of happiness, romping around with his adorable, white tipped tail high in the air. He enjoys playing with the other dogs in his foster home and his many toys and especially likes trying to take branches and sticks into the house to add to his toy collection. He loves to toss his toys around, pouncing on, and rolling around with them.

Truly a joy to watch, Tucker flits from one fun activity to the next, enjoying every moment! True to his possible Newfie heritage, this guy does believe it is his duty to wipe his wet face on you, and itâs hard to be upset when he looks at you with those darling eyes and asks to be pet. Tucker is house and crate trained, walks well on a leash, and sleeps through the night. This guy would love to bring his positive energy to the lucky home that adopts him!

As sweet as he is, Tucker is a big, eager puppy and does not realize his size or strength, so he is not suitable for a home with young children or very small animals.  He needs a home with a fenced yard and another young dog to play with.  Please note: Tucker also has been diagnosed with hip displaysia in both of his rear legs; he would do best in a home that has experience with this in large breed dogs.


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (https://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (https://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Tucker

description:
When you meet this little cupcake you can only say what a cutie she is .

She looks like a fluffy teddybear mixed with a fox . Her eyes are staring at me and I know she stands frozen because she came out of a very high kill shelter in San Antonio . SHe is wandering if I would hurt her .. she clearly did not had an easy life .

I give her a soft rub behind her ear and slowly her tail starts wagging. I can even see a smile of relieve on her face . No , little sweetheart I'm your godmother and you are safe in my rescue and now it is time to find a nice mommy and daddy for you

Apricot is around 3 years , is good with dogs and cats and is just a sweetheart . Please keep in mind to give them time to bloom open

She is located in Middle Island NY .
 
To become her new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application
