description:
Sweet as sugar, our own little Cupcake. She is around 7-9 years old, and 15lbs. She is sweet little girl who loves to be cuddled, take lap naps or curl up on the couch to watch a movie with you. She can be a little shy at times and would not do well in a home with small children.

Tiny Cupcake was surrendered to the shelter in horrible condition. Her teeth had been terribly neglected, she had a nasty cold and her skin was flaky and itchy from poor nutrition. She seemed so scared and depressed at the city shelters, she wouldnât even lift her head.

Thankfully, after just a few day in her foster home, she has come out of her shell tremendously and is feeling so better. She is a quiet but curious girl and likes to explore the house on her own. She is being fostered with other dogs of various sizes and gets along well with them all. Cupcake is deaf and she relies on other dogs to guide and comfort her, therefore Cupcake MUST go to a home with one or more low energy, friendly dogs.

See more pictures and learn more about Cupcakeâs story on our instagram pages @shelterchic and @shelterchicanimals.

If you think you can give Cupcake all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. All of our animals are in foster homes. For the sake of our animals and foster families, you must have an approved application with references before you can meet them.

PLEASE DO NOT SEND INQUIRIES THROUGH ADOPTION WEBSITES, WE DO NOT RECEIVE THEM.

https://petstablished.com/pets/public/326371

***PLEASE do NOT email to ask if the animal you are interested in is still available. Just check Petstablished, if they are there, they are available! Please note that 3rd party adoption sites take 6-12 hours to refresh. Allpaws.com and petharbor.com are 4+ months out of date. We are not associated with Petcurious.com in anyway. Please do not apply for animals you see there without checking they are on the Petstablished website first.
name: Cupcake

description:
Adorable Trevor is 7 months old and 23 lbs of pure love. Heâs a charming lab mix pup. Heâs very social and lovable. He loves to play and cuddle. Does not jump up or chew on anything thatâs not his. He sleeps all night in his crate and is almost fully housebroken. He loves his foster family all people and other animals. If you are interested in meeting Trevor please fill out an application at http://puppiesandmorerescue.org/ and email it to jillefesta@gmail.com. Trevor is sure to make a wonderful addition to any family !???

Adoption donation of $365 includes age appropriate vaccinations and spay/neuter when pup is approximately 5-6 months of age.  
Puppies and More Rescue is a registered 501c3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible.

*** Breed determination in most cases is often based on the limited history typically available for most rescued animals.  We try to be as accurate as possible with the information we have and the Rescue assessment of the pup.
name: Trevor

description: This sweet dog gets overlooked as she is on the shy side.  Once you pay attention to her she is eager to have affection and to be with you.  She is moderately active and likes her walks but just as comfortable snuggling on the couch.  Wonderful companion dog.
name: Lillie

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Born November 4, 2018.

Thank you for your interest in adopting a rescued Basset Hound! We ask all potential adopters to complete our application and approval process first so we can discuss the dogs that fit your home. We usually have 25 - 35 dogs available and the ages range from less than year old to ten plus years old. Once we receive your application you'll be contacted by an adoption representative to complete the application process. We look forward to speaking with you about our wonderful hounds waiting for forever homes!!!
name: NALA

description:
If youâre looking for a totally rockinâ relationship of the four-legged variety, then look no further, Champâs your guy. This 11-year-old bundle of unbridled love is the sweetheart you need. Champ, a handsome, black and white pointer mix, will devote his whole heart and soul to his forever family. He is loyal, affectionate, fun, and playful â a winning combination, donât you think? Champ is an open-hearted boy that loves to love people â how great is that? Heâs a bright boy that would be happy to learn all kinds of new things with his best friend. He loves to sleep with his stuffed teddy bear, but heâd be happy to share his bear with you if you want a cuddler in bed. Speaking of cuddling, this active guy also appreciates the fine art of relaxation. He would be soooo happy to curl up on your lap with you to enjoy some sweet down time together. Donât be surprised when he reaches up to send a few kisses your way â¦ thatâs just his style. Being the free spirit that he is, Champ appreciates the freedom of moving around his environment at will. Champâs a winner. Why not make him your winner?

DOB June 23, 2007

Professional portraits by Mary Hunt Davis Photography www.maryhuntdavis.com
name: Champ

description:
Thank you, for considering adopting a rescued pup in need of love, respect and a warm, safe place to lay it's head.

Rescued as an 'unwanted litter' from a lady who 'inherited' the pregnant mama dog from an elderly uncle who could no longer care himself nor the up-coming new mama and her litter, so threatened to 'send her to the Pound'...when ice lady' stepped up and took her in.

dob: August 26, 2018...Mama is a small black --ChowChowX(~30lbs)...H4S CARes has paid for mama dog to be spayed. Their daddy was a neighbor's solid black with just a teeny bit of white on his chest/SpanielX(~25lbs), so this is why we have determined their adult size will be ~30lbs at the most.

Sweet, friendly, playful, outgoing and seekers of snuggles. The entire litter will be speutered & micro-chipped on Friday/ November 23rd and will be ready to go to their fur-ever families on SAT/Dec1st.

These pups are in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until they have recovered from their surgeries and their pre-approved adoptive family/home is approved.

Transport from western NC is available via Happy Dogs, Lifesavers or Save-Them-All Rescued Pet transport svcs. They travel the eastern seaboard as far as NH including Long Island and also through the eastern part of PA and upstate>Buffalo, NY. Fees are $125 as far as NYC/Long Island and $140 to all points N of NYC/LongIsland, as far as Manchester, NH, and Albany/ Buffalo, NY...to be paid by the adopter upon reservation request to transport service.

Adoption fee: $325(includes, spay/neuter, 3 of 4 puppy boosters, Bordatella and 1st yr Rabies vax, parasite-free, all medical paperwork from day#1 with H4S including all vet's surgical notations, current health certificate, Kong chew toy, Beef knee cap bone, new nylon Martingale collar & matching 6' leash, a copy of 'Super Puppy' -The Best Dog You'll Ever Have', 'Rescued Dogs Rock' car magnet, 2 'pet alert' wallet cards and 3lb bag of their current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health' salmon & potato).

To apply to adopt one of these little cutie-pies, please complete the application provided at: www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com, as soon as possible(to help your chances of being approved ahead of other interested applicants).
name: BREE

description:
12/24/18

"They got Charlie" just resonates in my mind over and over! The childrens parents were contacted about 6 times to pick Charlie up at the shelter.  They left him there to die!!


Poorly Charlie is about 2 yrs old loves kids and is good with other dogs, just an all around good dog. The Charlie is hw pos, And is currently being treated!  We are calling him a corgi doxie mix.

He is up to date on vaccines, neutered, hw treated and de-wormed!!!

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Charlie Talbot-loves kids!

description:
Kolten  is an extra large male Akita who would do best in a adult only home as an only pet. Kolton is good on leash, crate trained, and travels well in the car. He is an aloof fellow who will need a breed experienced owner that can give him time to bond. A home with a secured fenced in yard would work best for this boy.

Interested in Kolten? Please go to our website at www.bigeastakitarescue.org and fill out an online adoption application and we will get back to you shortly.
name: Kolten

description:
Hi, Iâm Georgie! (I also answer to Georgie Pickles and Georgie Porgie cause my foster mom says Iâm that. Stinkin. Cute!) I am a 6 year old Pit Bull/ American Bull Dog Mix and Iâm a very good boy who loves snuggling and blankets, but I get a little mouthy when Iâm trying to show my love. Weâre working on that so therefore a home with older kids is for the best.  Iâm house trained, I sit and stay, and lay down cause Iâm so smart!  I learn new things very quickly.  I am good with most dogs, but need a meet and greet and an experienced introduction, most likely with a female dog.  I am not cat tested.  My mom doesnât know my story, but she says the right family is out there waiting for me.

If you are interested in Georgie, please go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.
name: Georgie

description:
Meet Jess, a 1 year old, 12 pound, wonderful Chi mix. This endearing pup is soft, sweet, loving, and dog friendly. 

She enjoys attention and likes being pet. She is also fond of ear scratches any belly rubs. She is friendly toward people and yearns for human companionship. 

Given her likable personality, gentle heart, and great looks, this deserving dog would make a really wonderful pet. It doesn't take much to please her. All she needs is a warm happy home and a devoted best friend with whom to share the joys of life!

If you would like to adopt this dog, please visit email PupStarzRescue@gmail.com or visit www.pupstarzrescue.org for an application!

www.pupstarzrescue.org 
Please Follow us on Instagram: @pupstarzrescue
Like us on FaceBook! www.facebook.com/PupStarzRescue

*PupStarz Rescue cannot guarantee the breed of the dog
name: Jess

description: Meet the Beautiful Holly!  This sweet girl is a 3 year old female Lab mix.  She is super friendly and loves just about everyone and everything she meets.  She loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times. She still has lots of energy and she loves to romp and play. She never turns down a good belly rub.  Even though she is considered an adult, she still has lots of puppy energy! She loves to play ball and to run around the yard.  She would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle! She is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month. She can't wait to find her forever home!
name: Holly

description:
www.TheLastResortRescue.com PLEASE NOTE: IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING THIS PET THE FIRST STEP IS TO FILL OUT OUR ADOPTION APPLICATION AVAILABLE AT THELASTRESORTRESCUE.COM. If you have a question or inquiry please email us at tlrapplications@gmail.com
Hi! I'm Chloe! How did a cutie like me end up in rescue you ask? Well, my first human family did not think puppies needed supervision, or training so they surrendered me... but that's okay because TLR promised to find my FUREVER family!! Clearly I am cute as a button, 4 to 5 months old and about 30 pounds right now. I am a typical lab puppy with endless energy. I love adventures, water, toys, car rides, other dogs and all sorts of things! I'm just a happy go lucky kinda gal! I am super smart and love learning. I am crate trained, and am working super hard at house training. I know sit and I take treats super gentle. I think I would love kids too (under supervision of course!) Just remember I am still a puppy and I will need my family to teach me everything I need to know about growing up to be an awesome dog! I am so looking forward to having my very own family to take me on awesome adventures and to give them endless love... will you fill out an application for me today??

Adoption Application http://www.thelastresortrescue.com/adopt
name: Chloe

description: Bessie was rescued from a high kill Texas shelter just as her time was running out. We can't imagine a dog as sweet as Bessie being killed--she brings so much happiness to the world! Bessie is GREAT with other dogs. She lives in foster care with a dominant female dog and a much bigger playful male dog. Bessie is house and crate trained. Her foster mom says: "Bessie is quick to learn and aims to please. She's a big cuddle bug. She has never shown any human or dog aggression."Here are some commands Bessie knows: Sit, Off, Wait, No, and Hot (her foster mom drinks lots of coffee). Bessie will make a wonderful addition to almost any family, and she will be available for adoption mid-December. Apply to adopt BESSIE DAVIS LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.ORG!
name: Bessie Davis Lonestar

description:
When Julius, Octavius, and their mom Ophelia were abandoned by their owners, that may have been the best thing that ever happened to them. A concerned citizen picked up the little family and took them to the shelter in Lockhart, TX, where they were bathed, dewormed, and vaccinated. Their photos were posted on Facebook and volunteers stepped up to rescue, transport, and foster them.

We are guessing that the little family are Pyrenees mixes. At 10 weeks old (as of 8/4), Octavius weighs 19 lbs, and Julius weighs almost 17 lbs, so itâs reasonable to estimate their adult weight at something between 70 and 90 lbs. The whole family is enjoying life in Texas while they wait for their forever families to apply to adopt.

Mom Ophelia is about a year old & weighs 61 pounds. S
he is very sweet and affectionate -- she loves to cuddle on the sofa with her human. Since w
e can only imagine the horrors of her past, she is what we would deem a "flight risk" and must always be on leash, even in a fenced in yard as she can, will, and has jumped a 6 foot fence.

Ophelia does fine with the barn cats at her foster home, the friendliest of whom rubs up against Opheliaâs legs every time sheâs in the barn. We feel that cats shouldnât be a problem for her.

Playing with other young dogs is a big part of Opheliaâs life here. She doesnât discriminate based on size or gender â she will play with pretty much anyone, and she is usually the one who starts it.
Ophelia is fine left home alone with other dogs, as long as itâs not for too long. She would not be a good fit for someone who works outside the home for a normal 8-hour workday at this point, but we hope that as she matures she will be less likely to become bored & entertain herself in ways she shouldn't. :)

Ophelia has been spayed and microchipped, so she, too, is ready to start a new life.
name: Ophelia Texas

description:
Skully, formerly Annie is a Carolina Dog, estimated by vet to be 2yrs old. Corgi mix who  is fully housebroken, loves children and is well trained.  What's the catch you ask.... Skully is on leash reactive to other dogs but can be around them 

Scully will do best in a home with a yard, active or homebody family but one that is either willing to continue her training or understands that unless you know what you're doing.  If you're looking to ADOPT and fit this criteria then please consider Skully.  This sweet and loving redhead is an amazing family dog but she must be an only dog.  No cats, no other dogs. Her training has certainly improved her reactiveness towards other animal but the trigger is still there.  Aside from that she is perfect.  

http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html

*Homes in NY, NJ, CT and PA considered. Ask if you're on the border and unsure.
name: Skully aka Annie

description:
Meet Norbit.! Norbit is a Great Dane mix, and recently celebrated his first birthday.  He is fully grown at 85 pounds, but donât let his size fool you, he is very much a playful puppy!  Norbit loves to snuggle and can usually be found napping when he isnât up to his antics.  He loves to play fetch, and gets along well with everyone he meets! Because he's a big goofy guy, Norbit would do well in family with older children, and would prefer to be the only dog in the home.  He is primarily housebroken, knows some basic commands and is working on leash walking. Norbit can't wait to find his forever home! 

Norbit neutered, up to date with vaccinations and micro chipped.

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! 

In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue
name: Norbit

description:
Shane was a stray who found his way to 11th Hour Rescue. He is a senior guy but acts and looks like a kid. He does not enjoy the company of other dogs so he should be the only dog in the household. In his foster home he has been the perfect gentleman...no accidents in the house and great in the car and on the leash. He is nervous when he first meets new people so he would need a home where someone would understand this and be patient with him. He should not be in a home with young children because of this quirk. Once he trusts you he is your best bud. He is an easy dog in the home and is happy to sleep at the side of your bed or just play with his toys. He takes treats very gently and does not require a ton of attention. This guy really deserves a home of his very own with an experienced "dog mom or dad".

. If you've got the time and patience to help show him the way, please fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to mention his name - SHANE!
name: Shane

description:
*Happy Holidays!  Someone is so eager to help Max find his forever home, that they have chosen to sponsor his adoption fee!  This means that he can go home with his forever family for free!  Adopt Max today!*

"Hi!  Thank you for stopping by to read about me!  I'm Max!  I recently joined the adoptable doggy crew at Providence Animal Center's lifesaving facility and I am hoping you will stop by soon to meet me in person!  I am the package deal - I am up to date on my vaccines, I am neutered, and micro-chipped!  I got the chance to take a nice, long walk with one of the wonderful volunteers here and let me tell you, it was heaven!  I strolled along pleasantly and enjoyed the one on one time out of my kennel!  I didn't want to go back in!  I'm hoping my perfect family comes by soon and takes me away from kennel life forever!  The people here really are wonderful, but spending time with them just makes me more excited about the prospect of finding my own people!  Maybe, juuuust maybe that's you!  I sure do hope so! While I wait for the perfect people, I am spending time in foster care - to learn more about me and to arrange a visit, please contact the foster coordinator at foster@providenceac.org  I really don't take up too much space at only about 13 pounds, so all you need is a teensy bit of extra space in your home and some extra love to give!  I'll be waiting here for you to come scoop me up!  Love, Max"

Providence Animal Center is funded solely by adoption fees and donations. Adoption fees vary per animal, please call the Adoption Center and reference this animal's ID number in order to obtain accurate fee information. 

To adopt this dog please call Providence Animal Center at 610-566-1370 during adoption hours. You may also email adoptions@providenceac.org. Can't adopt? Donate to help our homeless pets, www.providenceac.org/donate. Cant' donate? Apply to temporarily foster this pet in your home!

About fostering: You can still guarantee the safety and well-being of any of our dogs or puppies by temporarily fostering one or more right in your own home. Visit our foster page to learn about the program. Then, email your application along with any questions to foster@providenceac.org for immediate review.
name: Max *Sponsored - Foster*

description:
This big guy (115 pounds) loves to play! Mel was left at a NJ shelter after his owner was moving. Mel will need a breed experienced owner, one that also has the physical strength to handle a big bouncy juvenile male. Mel knows some basic commands and is food motivated. Mel has been fully vetted and would do best in a large securely fenced in back yard where he can get plenty of exercise. While living at BEAR, Mel has made friends with two of our females! He is playful with both females however he will not tolerate a male dog in his space. It is best that he not be placed with small animals or small children, as he is big and bouncy and could knock over a small child or an older person. This is a big strong boy who clearly has no idea of his size and strength. 

Do you think you have what it takes to give this big happy guy a safe home? Please go to www.bigeastakitarescue.org and fill out an online adoption application for Mel-Man!
name: Mellow

description: Lucy! Isnât she just the cutest?! Lucy is about 4 years old and is just a total lover. She gives amazing hugs and the most gentle kisses! She loves car rides, trips to tractor supply, and TREATS!!! She has amazing manners and is an all around very well behaved girl. Lucy could be the perfect pup addition to your family. Come meet her and find out!
name: Lucy

description:
Pancho is a precious little male chihuahua.  He is 7 years old and weighs 8.06 pounds.   He is an affectionate little boy that loves attention. He gets along with other dogs.    He is up to date on his vaccines, including bordatella, distemper and rabies.  He is neutered, HW negative and microchipped.

If you are interested in adopting this gorgeous baby, please fill out an application on the following link: 

www.carenj.com/adoption-application
name: Pancho

description:
Fill ot our adoption application: http://oliversorphanoasis.org/Adoption-Application.html
Fill out our foster application: http://oliversorphanoasis.org/Foster-Care-Application.html
name: Bravo

description:
Background: Donna was brought to ACCT Philly in desperate need of care â thought to have possibly been hit by a car and unable to walk, good Samaritans found her and brought her in.  Unfortunately she was determined to have a pyometra, or infection of the uterus, and needed an immediate spay and medical attention provided by the veterinary team.  Over a week after her ordeal and Donna still wasnât standing out to adopters. Luckily we saw something in her worth giving her a chance and we were quickly rewarded with her sweet nature and willingness to play with everyone! 

Update: Donna is a real beauty inside and out! She has a soft glossy coat, deep eyes, and really just wants to spend time with her favorite people.  She is very calm and collected - as long as she gets some affection she is quite happy to cuddle on the couch or go for a walk. Donna is doing very well in training and has already begun to master her basic obedience - she will make an incredible family pet!

Update: "If I lay hereâ¦If I just lay hereâ¦would you lie with me and just forget the world?â  Donna really just wants to spend time with her favorite people.  Sheâs is a real beauty inside and out with her soft glossy coat and deep hazel eyes.  She is very calm and collected - as long as she gets some affection she is quite happy to cuddle on the couch or go for a walk.  She rides nicely in a car.  While in the New Leash on Life program in the Philadelphia prison, she mastered her basic obedience cues (sit, down, come, leave it, kennel up) along with a few cute tricks.  And she gets along with other dogs.  Donna is the perfect gal for a person with a laid back lifestyle.  Sheâs currently living in foster care and would love to meet you!

Check back for more updates as we get to know Donna!!
name: Donna

description:
What do you get when you mix a Jack Russell Terrier and a Chihuahua? A JackChi? A ChiRuss? Who knows, who cares. Ya know what you REALLY get? You get Daphne, the most darling, adorable, near-perfect dog you could ever imagine having. This 8-year young, 15-pound bundle of love excels in virtually every department.

Daphne is phenomenal with everyone. Old people, young people, big people, little people, cats, dogs, you name it. She adores them all and they all adore her. She walks like a lady on a leash and loves going for strolls. She is completely housebroken and sleeps soundly through the night. She is upbeat, peppy and spry, but always maintains a cool, calm, chill demeanor. 

If you would like to take your pooch on adventures, Daphne would make an ideal travel companion. She isnât a barker, she loves car rides, and sheâs small enough to tote around anywhere. And goodness gracious, sheâs just as sweet as can be! 

This girl is full of cuddles, snuggles, hugs and kisses. Her only real desire to is make her human(s) happy. And in return, all sheâll want from you is your love, your loyalty, and a never-ending supply of liver snaps! 

www.pupstarzrescue.org 
Please Follow us on Instagram: @pupstarzrescue
Like us on FaceBook! www.facebook.com/PupStarzRescue

*PupStarz Rescue cannot guarantee the breed of the dog

Photos by: @STYLEPUP
name: Daphne

description: 16 Dec 2018: Britches is beautiful hound mix, who gets along well with both dogs and cats. She is about 7 years old and weighs 40 pounds. She is currently in a foster home but still looking for her forever. Please apply to adopt.
name: Britches

description:
Pepper is a female pitbull/lab mix, approx. 2 years old and about 50lbs. Pepper was rescued from a high kill shelter in North Carolina. She is a high energy dog who loves a lot of attention. She loves the outdoors and needs a lot of exercise. 

Pepper is working on her housetraining, but she's not quite there yet. She likes to choose her doggie friends; some she gets along with better than others.  Pepper would love a home w/ a fenced in yard, and children over the age of 13. She knows some basic commands but will need more training. 

Pepper is spayed and up-to-date on vaccinations, and heartworm preventative treatment.

Pepper is still looking for her forever home and hopes she will find the right fit soon!!
name: Pepper

description: Hi potential family...I specialize in stealing hearts...can I try YOURS? Ruff House Rescue "Goes Big" so more pets have a chance to go home. This means we are rescuing in areas that we can make the biggest lifesaving impact. While we continue to help our local dogs and families in NY wanting to surrender their pets we are compelled to help the animals most in need from the highest kill rate shelters in the country and the highest statistic for strays. Hundreds and thousands of highly adoptable puppies and dogs are killed daily. Therefore the majority of our pets come from these areas. This means the cost of rescue is higher due to the high costs of vetting, boarding, and transport. Please note our adoption fees vary and are the most reliable source of revenue enabling us to continue our rescue efforts. Your adoption fees directly contribute to the rescue of these animals. Please see our website for information and an application to adopt or foster or volunteer for RHR. Adoption fees vary from $250 to $500 which includes a pets spay/neuter - Micro-chipping - current vaccinations - heartworm testing. We ask that adopters submit applications in advance to help facilitate the adoption process. Please note while you may not be sure what pet you are interested in if any your application will help us find you the perfect match. Applications at Ruffhouserescue.org - *Please only submit an application if you are available immediately to adopt. Have a rental agreement to have a pet and all family members are ready to adopt. Thank you for thinking Adoption First!
name: Leo

description:
Teresa is a 2-year old spayed female German Shepherd mix.  She is up-to-date on vaccines; is house-trained and crate-trained.  Teresa has typical Shepherd features, such as long legs and long snout, but coloring is brindle.  She doesn't growl at our other dogs when the puppies are with her, but she does get between them and the puppies.  Teresa is very gentle and loves to run and play.

1.  Navigate to our online Adoption Application at https://bridges2safety.wufoo.com/forms/bridges-to-safety-adoption-application/ .
2.  If you problems with the form or have questions, call Ellen at (732) 859-8915 or email us at bridgesdogsmail@gmail.com.
name: Teresa

description:
Meet Mae! (formerly Mea at Brandywine Valley SPCA)

Mae was dumped at 10 years old.... she had owners who attempted to surrender her at a shelter and when they were refused, they let her go near the shelter and refused to call the shelter back when they found her. We aren't sure why because she is absolutely amazing! We will let her tell you for herself.....

"Hi, everyone! My name is Mae! Not to brag or anything, but I have to be one of the most beloved dogs ever!! And knowing this, I really believe that one day my FOREVER family is going to walk through the door and bring me home with them!???

I am potty-trained and wait patiently wait for someone to take me outside. I will gently howl by the door to let you know that I have to go - I'm told it's super cute! I also love being with people, so sometimes they have to convince me to go in my crate when it's time for them to leave the house; but, I always go! What can I say? I want to spend all of my time being pet with my people! I am great with children and live with 2 in foster care, great on the leash, and know all of my basic commands, such as sit, lay down, and give paw.
 
While I'm treat-motivated (great for training), I never beg for food. I also always love to meet new people and I like to relax in my bed when nobody is available to snuggle. And listen, I also learned that I donât really love the stairs anymore... my hips arenât what they used to be, okay? I also will do best in a home environment with other calm dogs who understand that I can be somewhat hypersensitive to movement since I have some blind spots in my vision and donât want to play rough with my old lady hips! And lastly, I donât like cats... but who does?

I paw-mise that I am very sweet, and loyal, and lovable; and I want a family of my own now. So, what do you say? Are you going to give me a shot?â

Mae is spayed, up-to-date on vaccines, 4dx heartworm negative, on monthly prevention, microchipped, and dewormed. She will have senior panel bloodwork and urinalysis run prior to adoption and will be on allergy injections and Dasuquin for her age-related arthritis.

Mae is a 52 lbs cutie patootie elderbull looking for a new home that will not give up on her this time around! If that is you, visit our website for an application: www.bellareedpbr.com/adoption

For more photos of Mae, visit her photo album on our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/BRPBR
name: Mae

description: I am "   ". Visit me now, take me away, and cherish my unconditional love. For information, please call the Atlantic County Animal Shelter at (609) 485-2345. And, please tell the Shelter you found me on Petfinder.com. Thanks.
name: Elliot

description:
Cuddles is a great puppy who loves everyone! He is only 6.5 months old and 45 lbs and just the sweetest mush. Cuddles is friendly and social and loves other dogs, and we can cat test. He is well mannered and gentle and just great. We think he will be in the 60 lb range for his feet are not very big. He is truly a wonderful puppy in need of a wonderful home ASAP! A must meet, for he will steal your heart for sure.  (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there might be something wrong with your email!) 
Lovable Mutts Adoption Center is a private, in home, all breed rescue/adoption facility, specializing in all ages and sizes of dogs.  We exist only on the kindness of your donations and adoptions!  We pride ourselves on being an HOLISTIC center and feed only holistic grain free foods and give daily, various, vitamins and supplements to all of our dogs. 

Our dogs are well socialized, very friendly, well mannered, affectionate, and in wonderful health. While some might be timid or shy, we work with our adopters in any way we can, to help them to work with their new family member. We give training tips and behavioral tips and even board for a very reasonable fee. Our dogs are extremely well cared for - most even know how to use a dog door by the time they leave us, know basic commands, and are crate trained!  We stand by our pups/dogs, and give 10 days for a refund and almost always take our dogs back at any age of their lives (can sometimes depend on the dog)! 

Lovable Mutts Adoption Center has an application screening process.  All applicants are asked to provide vet references, personal references, and a home visit.  We pride ourselves in matching up the right dog with the right home.  Sometimes this happens quickly and sometimes it might take awhile.  We hope you understand and are willing to wait for the perfect pup for your situation. We reserve the right to turn applicants down and to change our mind about a suitable match, for we are only concerned about what is best for our dogs.  Also note that we arrange our visiting hours around your schedule, as this is a private, in home facility.  We respond to all inquiries promptly, so if you have any trouble sending us an email, or have not heard back from us within 24 hours, please, CONTACT US AGAIN and check your spam!  (We all know how emails can be at times!)

Our dogs are spayed or neutered (if old enough), up to date on vaccines, wormed, heartworm tested, and free of fleas and ticks.  We temperament test our  dogs and they are all suitable for many family situations. Our dogs are well mannered,  and are in our family/home situation at this time (not kept in kennels or crates), and are worked with daily.  All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats, and we can cat test. Adoption donations vary with age, breed, vetting, and training of the dog, and range from $250 to $500. This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care.  (We do not tend to place puppies or small dogs with kids under 6 and reserve the right to match who WE feel would be the best homes for our dogs.)  
Please, come adopt one of our Lovable Mutts - you will be so glad you did!

(IF YOU DO NOT GET A REPLY EMAIL WITHIN 24 HOURS, CHECK YOUR SPAM BOX - WE REPLY EVERY FEW HOURS TO EMAILS)
name: Cuddles (Great Family Pup)

description:
Lukas is a smart and handsome 1 year old 45 lb Australian Cattle Dog mix with soulful eyes and a big, sweet smile.  This charmer is a social dude who gets along beautifully with other dogs.  

His adorable nubby tail makes his whole butt wiggle with joy when he greets dogs and humans.  Lovely Lukas is looking to wiggle his way into a fun-loving forever home.


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (https://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (https://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Lukas

description: Mike is a sweet puppy! At 8-10 months old, Mike still has lots of puppy energy. He will do well with structure and consistency. Mike's former owners say he is good with cats and dogs. This guy will make a great family pet.
name: Mike

description:
When people talk about dogs.. wishing they could be more like a dog.. Poe is what we refer to.. he's had some rotten luck in life.. but he is such a happy, fully present, utterly content wounded wanderer! Po sustained an injury and now his hind legs move as one limb with two paws!  ITS AMAZING actually how well he moves along.. PLUS.. he's got an incredible attitude! Happy.. Poe is a happy happy sweet humble boy who's only got space for happy!

Poe thoroughly enjoys group plays with other get-along kinda dogs.. a challenging male dog will prove to be a bit threatening to Poe so we make sure to pair him up with wiggly, easy going, confident doggies. Pippy, Penny, Madeline, Leo to name a few of his buddies! As stated above, despite his previous injury, Poe sure does well sprinting around the yard with his buds. Once in a while, he might trip but he always gets right back up and continues play. Now.. Poe's most FAV game ever is FETCH.. he will chase a ball all day long! He even knows how to drop the ball on command (often in trade for a treat!!) so we can give it another throw. He'll often break away from the pack to join up in a nice ball game.  

Guaranteed you'll never meet another dog like Poe in your life. We're not quite sure how Poe became the way that he is but we are sure he doesn't skip a beat! Did we mention he loves to SWIM?! Check out the photos of Poe's doggy paddle skills! A long hike to the reservoir is another fav activity for Poe! 

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Poe

description:
Jada is a gorgeous girl, perfectly fine with other dogs, and adores every human she meets! All she wants is to snuggle, cuddle, and give love. She is truly an affectionate, sweet girl. Fill out our dog adoption application online at pawscrossedny.org

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.
name: Jada

description: 14 August 2018: Sweet Monday was pulled from an overcrowded southern shelter. This adorable girl had been in the shelter in May, with her two puppies, who have since been adopted. Monday is dog friendly and submissive but should not be in a home with cats. She is an absolute sweetheart and we are committed to finding her the perfect home. Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Monday

description:
Age: 3 years
Size: Medium/Large
Activity Level:  High
Good With Dogs: No
Good With Cats: No
Good with Children: Over 10


Meet Apollo!!!!  Apollo was pulled from a local shelter.  He was abandoned in a car lot with a bunch of other dogs.  Apollo has been in daily training for the past 6 months, and is doing great. Apollo knows sit, stay, lie down, fetch, and paw. He is a big, strong, and athletic boy who just wants to please and needs lots of exercise!  Apollo is a teddy bear who is great with strangers and friendly to people he meets.  Apollo walks in a heel on leash and does not pull. However, Apollo does NOT like other dogs and while he does not lunge or pull toward other dogs, he does need to keep a clear distance. Apollo would do best with a fenced in yard, but he will stay on your property if supervised off-leash. Apollo does not like thunderstorms or fireworks, but is fine if provided a quiet and safe space. Want to hit the beach? Apollo LOVES the water and will play fetch and swim. Apollo loves rides in the car, and is a good passenger, laying down in the back seat. Apollo is a gentleman when playing or taking treats, he is obedient, loyal, and very affectionate. If you are looking for a BFF to go everywhere with you, and be your companion on your adventures, please consider Apollo. He is the dog you will remember for a lifetime!  Prior GSD experience is highly recommended for this awesome dog. 

For more information about our adoption policies and to access our online application, please visit our website at www.gsgsr.org.  Please note:

GSGSR primary service area is New Jersey, Eastern PA, Delaware Valley and Manhattan.  We are not able to service Long Island at this time.  

The age requirement for adoption is 25 to 70 years old; If you are outside of this age range, please email us first.

We require all adopters attend professional training with their adopted dog.  Exceptions are made for adopters who are K-9 professionals or for senior dogs being adopted.

We are an all volunteer organization and every effort is made to proceed as efficiently as possible with an application. As with all rescues, we do require veterinary references if you have a pet, personal reference, a phone interview and home visit. This process has been created to insure that we match each applicant with the best possible dog.
name: Apollo

description: Shortie is a 4 year old spayed female pittie mix. She is a fabulous girl who is very smart, friendly with people, and doesn't mind cats. Shortie is a cuddle-bug and would be happiest being the only dog, and because of her size and energy level will do best in a forever family with older kids. Shortie knows some commands and absolutely loves fetching balls! Shortie loves to go for walks, she is energetic and loves to run with her ball. Shortie will make a loyal, loving companion in the right home. If you are interested in adopting her, please fill out an application at www.justice-rescue.com. For more information, email info@justice-rescue.com
name: Shortie

description: Scooter is a 5 lb one year old Chi mix. He is very sweet. He will do best in a home without small children as he is nervous around them. He will be a very loyal companion to his adopter. He is neutered, up to date on shots and is ready to go home! Scooter loves lap time and jumps all around with glee when I come home. He is shy and nervous but warms up to adults with a little time.
name: Scooter

description:
Eve's Sanctuary does not have a public location to visit, although we do weekly adoption events in public locations on the UWS. If you are interested in a specific animal, please email info@evessanctuary.com with the name of the animal you are interested in written on the subject line. Please remember that ESAR requires a full complete application, an interview, and a home visit prior to final approval and placement of adopted animals. It may seem daunting at first, but to find true love its worth it, right? They aren't products on a shelf to buy, we love them like our own, and only want the best possible home for each and every one...thus the "hoops." Also, please trust our recommendations, we are skilled human furry freind matchmakers with many years of experience that has given us a unique and solid perspective. For these reasons we prefer adopters to be in NYC or the immediate area accessible by public transportation so we can work with you individually and educate you face to face!
Additionally, please understand that we are all volunteers, no salaries are paid, we have families and pets of our own, and we have full time jobs in addition to doing rescue work - so we may be (at times) slow-ish to get back to you. We promise we are doing our best as its in everyones best interest to place these darlings quickly, so we can save more. If you would like to expedite the process, and make us extra happy, please download our application from our website at: http://www.evessanctuary.org/Adoption.html , fill it out, and return it with your initial email inquiry. Be patient, be persistent, be polite, and we promise all will be well! ;-)
All animals come up to date on annual combo vaccs, rabies vaccs, heartworm tested negative, microchipped, and of course...spayed or neutered!
name: Siberian Rachel

description:
NYC Area -- Rescued from South Korea, Jain is a sweet but shy Jindo/Shiba Inu mix pup. At 6 months old and weighing approximately 13 pounds, Jain is currently being fostered in NYC and is looking for her forever home! Please consider adopting her!

You can meet Jain this SATURDAY or SUNDAY at our SANTA PAWS EVENTS
(If she is not adopted at Saturdayâs event, she will be there Sunday)

Saturday, Dec 22nd, 2018

BUSHWICK BARK
181 Irving Ave
Brooklyn, NY

12PM-4PM
-----------

Sunday, Dec 23rd, 2018

WESPAW PETS
44-05 Queens Blvd
Sunnyside, NY

12PM-4PM

PLEASE NOTE: You need to attend the OUTDOOR ADOPTION EVENT in order to meet this dog and bring your printed application. Please come to the event should you have any questions or email us at info@koreank9rescue.org. Thank you!
Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Jain

description:
Ava was rescued from a kill shelter in NC on Valentine's Day,  the day ahe delivered her beautiful puppies.  This beautiful mama is sweet and ndependent Ava. A gentle nibble from her or long look into her soulful eyes and all seems right with the world. Practically a puppy herself, Ava is good-natured, playful and mischievous, she will steal your shoe as surely as she will steal your heart. She would do best in a home where she has room to run, or a running partner to help her expend all that good energy. She shows ZERO aggression to dogs and humans, and does well with children. However, she comes from hunting dogs and would not do well in a home with cats.

Ava is in a foster home in Roosevelt,  NJ 08555 - near Jackson)
name: Ava

description: Please help us welcome sweet little Berry to Bideawee! Berry and her sister Holly came all the way from down south to New York City to stay with us while they look for their forever homes. Berry is a sweet three year old girl with a beautiful brindle coat and big brown eyes. She's a bit shy and is especially nervous on her walks, but feels better when her sister is around to show her that the big city isn't so scary. Berry is a gentle and loving girl who will need a little time and help to boost her confidence, but it will be worth it to see this girl flourish and be such a special addition to your family. Come meet this adorable girl today!
name: Berry

description: Foster Update: I'm Goose, a Southern Belle acclimating very quickly to fun, adventuresome life in the city. A week ago I was sleeping on cold concrete in a shelter. I didn't understand stairs or the front door and I was scared of overpasses when I arrived. I got over that quickly. I learned how to run next to a bike in the park. I even learned that I am supposed to go to the bathroom outside in the cold rather than the nice warm comfort of inside (weird, but I learned quickly and now never get it wrong). I am super soft and affectionate and I love saying hi to everyone on the street. And they love me. I am gentle and I like kids and all dogs and am just thrilled to be alive. I am 10 months old and have all the silly adorable enthusiasm of a puppy without the bad habits. I'm told I will make a perfect dog, especially for someone who enjoys equally going for runs, hikes or bike rides as much as hanging at home stroking my soft silky fur. Come and meet me and you will fall in love with me. Goose is a 10-month-old hound and anatolian shepherd mix who is likely to be 60lbs fully grown. She is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Goose

description: Lolly is a very sweet 2 year old Shepherd mix girl! She is mama to two beautiful boys. She is currently with our vet partner in Georgia and will be fostered in the Valley Stream, NY area.
name: Lolly

description: Meet our big boy Si (pronounced sigh)! Si is an insanely handsome 5 year old Shepherd/Lab mix with talents as big as he is! Si is a master at all of his commands,housebroken,and brings the ball right to you for fetch! What more could you want? Although Si is big,he is a gentle giant,who is very nervous with strangers. It may require a couple meets to gain his full trust,but if you are willing to be patient,you will be rewarded with endless love and loyalty from Si! He would do best in a home with no kids or other animals,and a household that is calm,with not too many visitors. Si is a spectacular dog,and you won't want to miss your chance with him!
name: Si

description:
Jubilee has been at the shelter coming up on 3 years in January and we are not sure why! She has a great personality, is very playful and wants to please people. She knows all commands and is very food motivated (hence her size...she needs to lose a few pounds!). She keeps herself occupied with toys, walks nice on leash and is housebroken. Jubilee has energy but is also happy just cuddling and watching a movie. She would like to be the only dog in her home, as she never learned how to share with other dogs. Also, she is a bull in a china shop kind of gal, so no small kids for this babe. Maybe that is why she sits, year after year, waiting for her furever family. Jubilee really wants a family to spend the rest of her days and she deserves nothing but the best! Would you open your heart and home to this chunky gal?  


All pets at this shelter are up-to-date on shots and will be altered and micro-chipped upon adoption.  Please visit our shelter to meet the many adorable orphans that are available for adoption.  When inquiring about a specific animal you saw on this website, please include the ID number associated with the animal. We are open 7 days a week from 12pm-5: 30pm Monday thru Friday and 12pm-5:00 Saturday & Sunday. For information and/or directions call 732-922-0100 or email TintonFallsahs@aol.com. There is an adoption fee required.  The Society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, and cash.

                               IMPORTANT
 As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency.  Homeowners must show proof of ownership; a valid lease that states "pets ok" is required for renters before an adoption can be approved. If you do not have a lease with your landlord you will need a notarized letter.
name: Jubilee

description:
This sweet boy was rescued in San SebastiÃ¡n, Puerto Rico when his elderly owner could no longer care for him or the other dogs he lived with. 

Brownie is about 6 years old and 55 lbs with a gorgeous shaggy coat. He is really sweet, shy and mellow, and deserves a quiet home outside the city with a soft bed and a mom or dad to cuddle him for the holidays. 

He is great with other dogs, and we are looking for a home with another dog to keep him company because he seems sad and lonely alone. He is fine with kids but older is better because energetic little ones would probably be overwhelming for him. 

He arrives Dec 15 and will be fully vetted, vaccinated, neutered, and microchipped. If you would like to adopt Brownie, please submit an application here:
https://www.thesatoproject.org/applicationform
name: Brownie

description:
To adopt please fill out an adoption  http://www.happydogrescue.org/Application595.html

Luke is a 2yo male lab mix who was rescued as a stray in rural Mississippi.  Friendly, well-socialized, happy temperament.  Very active, would make a great running companion (typical young lab)! Good with other dogs and would do well with a dog buddy in his new home. Not recommended for cats because he likes to chase them. Loves kids and recommended for children 10 years and older due to his size and active nature. Luke is very active outside, but settles down quickly in the house. Quiet and well-mannered inside, housebroken and crate trained. Obeys basic commands.  Loves to be with his people.  Good on a leash, rides great in the car.  When he first came to us, Luke had heartworms, but he was treated without complications and cured and is now ready for adoption. Healthy and fully vetted, current on shots, neutered, weighs about 55 pounds.  AWESOME young lab mix will make a wonderful companion  for an active family who loves the breed.

To adopt please fill out an adoption  http://www.happydogrescue.org/Application595.html 

Contact us at reply@happydogrescue.org

Visit us at  http://www.happydogrescue.org
name: Luke

description: aggressive w/cats, dogs chickens and on a leash
name: Boe

description: The Puppy Palooza continues! And we don't have any sell outs here. Introducing the woman who took the country music world by storm, Emmylou Harris, and her grammy-winning, newly-released single, Wildflowers. To foster or adopt, visit bit.ly/BadassApp
name: Wildflowers

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Precious Nicki was born into rescue on 5/19/18, a pup to Maribeth. She is absolutely adorable and gives the sweetest puppy kisses and cuddles! Nicki canât wait to meet the special person that will love and cherish her forever. She will be up to date on shots (age appropriate) and spayed prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages, and with other dogs. If you are looking for a little angel that will bring so much joy and happiness into your life, then Nicki is the one for you! If you would like to make Nicki the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application for her here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Nicki

description:
Koda is a sweet 17 month old male mantle with natural ears.Â  He is a very energetic puppy who will require guidance, training, routine and reinforcement.Â  Koda sometimes responds to redirection if you can get his attention.Â  He is highly treat motivated which really helps to get his attention.Â  Koda does need to learn some manners.Â  He does not know what personal space is and he likes to jump when he is excited.Â  His foster home is working on his manners.Â Â Koda does well with the 2 male Danes and 1 female Dane in his foster home.Â  He can be a little over bearing sometimes with the other Danes.Â  He will bark at them and sometimes nudge them to try to get them to play.Â  Koda is very excited to meet new dogs and can be a little much for them right away.Â  He does have a high prey drive with small animals such as squirrels and cats.Â  He seems to fine with small dogs though.Â Â Koda is crate trained.Â  He will run for the crate if there is a treat involved.Â  Heâs doing much better on a leash, but does get very excited when he sees other dogs and people.Â  He is all puppy and so curious about anything new.Â  Training will be a condition of his adoption. Â 

Kodak came to MAGDRL in September of 2017. (3)

For more info on this dog and our adoption policies, visit NJ MAGDRLÂ at http://www.magdrl-nj.com/our-dogs/ .Â 

MAGDRL adopts Great Danes in NY, NJ, PA, MD, DE, DC, VA & WV.
name: Koda

description:
~Dylan~

Dylan is Available Through our Pre- Adoption Program

Dylan and siblings will be ready to go home soon !

8 week old super sweet lab/? Mix!

If you are Interested in Adopting this Sweet Baby please fill out the Online Adoption Application: https://ww04.elbowspace.com/secure/20130108185454530739
name: Dylan

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This beautiful girl is Gracie! Gracie is a 9 month-old Black Lab who comes into rescue from Texas with her 3 siblings. These poor babies havenât had a very good start to their lives and were not in good shape when we got to them. They spent some time with our vet partner getting all the medical care that they needed and are now back to healthy and happy! Gracie's coat may be black as night but this sweetheart is just a big ray of sunshine! She has so much love to give to the lucky one that gets to adopt her. She is extremely dog friendly and loves playing with other canine friends! She is very sweet and affectionate and she gives the best doggie kisses! She can be a little shy at first and sometimes it can take awhile for her to warm up to people, but when she does she is very loving. She would do great in a home thatâs not in a crowded city, as lots people and noise can be overwhelming for her. She is a smart girl who is house trained and crate trained. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to be the one that gets to give Gracie (TX) her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for her here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Gracie (TX)

description: How HANDSOME is Bobby?! He's a Boxer/Lab mix that is hoping to find his forever home! Bobby is a young boy thatâs totally housebroken, good in his crate and loves car rides. Bobby can bounce around playing fetch with his ball all day if you let him! He can be selective with other dogs, he's not aggressive, he just never really learned how to play. We'd prefer to place him as an only pet but it would really depend on the temperament of your current dog as well. He's a gentle guy that would love a snuggle buddy on cold nights and someone to enjoy walks with!! He's neutered, current on vaccines, and microchipped. Please email enb313@gmail.com for an application for this loving boy!
name: Bobby

description:
Update 1/16: Out shy Hillary is still hoping to find her very special forever home although she has made herself very comfy in her foster home in the meantime.  She sleeps cuddled in bed right next to her foster mom every night, and Ioves to play and wrestle with her doggie friends.  She is looking for a very special adult multi-dog home that will give her her space and time to adjust, and understand that she will always have her fears.  Hillary is a ~4 year old chihuahua mix rescued from a hoarding situation with 19 other chis who all lived in a pen outside with little human contact.  Hillary was the most terrified of the group and had obviously never been touched at all.  She has gone through the ASPCA's behavioral rehabilitation program to help work with her fearfulness and has come a LONG way in learning to bond to people.  She is still very skittish of strangers and loud noises, but starting to get playful and enjoy being petted by the few she has bonded to.  She LOVES other dogs and follows their lead, so she will be looking for a home with at least one friendlier dog to help her come out of her shell, and a very special person willing to give her time to be comfortable.  Please email us if you are interested in setting up an appointment to meet this special little girl...We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East next to 5 Star Car Wash (formerly Boulder Car Wash) in Morris Plains (Denville on GPS).  To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Hillary-SHY GIRL, LOVES DOGS!

description: 28 April 2018: Squirt may not realize it, but she lives up to her name!! This pretty girl is a petite pocket pittie!! She has been through training and has learned to walk nicely on leash and listen to her handler. She needs a family that will continue to provide her with structure. Squirt tends to do best with women but would be fine with any family as long as her owner takes a leadership role. This darling girl needs to be your one and only. She has so much love to give. Please apply to adopt today!!
name: Squirt

description:
MEET MUTLEY  - AVAILABLE - NO INQUIRIES WITHOUT APPLICATION (Link Below) - PLEASE READ ENTIRE AD - Fostered in the Indian Mills, NJ Area - WE DO NOT ADOPT OUT OF THE AREA THE DOG IS IN (50 mile radius)


COPY AND PASTE THIS LINK INTO YOUR BROWSER FOR OUR ONLINE APPLICATION:
http://www.emailmeform.com/builder/form/4L4rbUH08f75DP3v
Please specify which dog you are applying for in the space provided.


Mutley has come leaps and bounds since coming to our rescue. He loves his foster family but is still a little shy around newcomers. Mutley would be good for a home without small kids. He is crate trained and housebroken. He is getting used to being in a home as he was found running the streets alone and not being loved. He is sweet once he gets to know you, it will take time and patience. He is great for walking on a leash; no tripping hazard. Loves any kind of food  He would love a home of his own so he can be spoiled like he deserves.
Mutley is very smart and loves to play. He would probably do well with agility training if you are into that.


We believe he is about 4 years or perhaps younger. He is neutered and UTD on shots. 
Mutley deserves love and to be treasured for the rest of his life. 
Adoption Donation $295


COPY AND PASTE THIS LINK INTO YOUR BROWSER FOR OUR ONLINE APPLICATION:
http://www.emailmeform.com/builder/form/4L4rbUH08f75DP3v
Please specify which dog you are applying for in the space provided.



Breed and age stated is just a shelter/rescue/foster guess based on size, appearance and temperament. It is impossible for us to know for sure as most of our dogs are strays from high kill shelters

If you would like to be considered to adopt PLEASE FILL OUT AN APPLICATION

COPY AND PASTE THIS LINK INTO YOUR BROWSER FOR OUR ONLINE APPLICATION:
http://www.emailmeform.com/builder/form/4L4rbUH08f75DP3v
Please specify which dog you are applying for in the space provided.




Every life is precious and deserves to be loved, cared for, and respected. Please consider making a donation today to help us to continue providing second chances. We can't do it without you. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Our pups thank you too. Use this link: paypal.me/oodlesofdoodles

Breed stated is just a shelter/rescue/foster guess based on size, appearance and temperament. It is impossible for us to know for sure as most of our dogs are strays from high kill shelters.

THIS IS AN OODLES OF DOODLES, INC. ADOPTABLE PET. or RESCUE or OWNER ASSISTED REHOME PET. Please DO NOT confuse us with any other "Doodle Rescue." We are Independent Rescuers working as a "Collective," to save Poodle-mix pets from kill shelters and other situations. 
ALL Applications are sent to the Foster, Rescue or Family who has the pet and who checks references, does home visits and conducts interviews. Please DO NOT send inquiries. PLEASE, WE ARE ALL VOLUNTEERS and CANNOT ANSWER OTHER INQUIRIES without having an application on file. IF YOU ARE A MATCH FOR THE PET, YOU WILL BE CONTACTED. Thank you for understanding.
VISIT OUR WEBSITE at http://oodlesofdoodles.org. We have been Listing & Rescuing Oodles since 2008. After a reorganization in May, 2010 we have renewed focus and goals. We are a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit and your donation is tax deductible.
All Oodles of Doodles pets are located in foster or family homes across the North American Continent. We do not have a central location. THE LOCATION GIVEN IN THE PET'S NAME IS WHERE HE or SHE IS LOCATED. Unless otherwise stated, WE DO NOT ADOPT, SHIP OR TRANSPORT OUR PETS AWAY FROM THE AREA THEY ARE IN ** That means within a 50 mile radius **
WE DO NOT ADOPT TO URBAN/APARTMENT/RENTER ENVIRONMENTS. WE REQUIRE FENCED YARDS (an e-fence is not a secure fence). PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT MATCH WHAT WE ARE ASKING FOR. IT ONLY WASTES OUR VALUABLE TIME, AND YOURS.
If the listing is given as ADOPTABLE or AVAILABLE, then the right home has not been located yet and the pet is still available for adoption. Please fill out an application and not send inquiries.
Breed stated is just a shelter/rescue/foster guess based on size, appearance and temperament. It is impossible for us to know for sure as most of our pets are strays from high kill shelters.
