name: NJ - Mutley

description:
Gigi was found running loose with what we believe to be her sister Bea. Both girls were picked up and taken to the shelter and were never claimed.

When first meeting Gigi she will need a few minutes to warm up, but with a cookie or two and you have a new friend. We feel a quiet home would be best for Gigi, and she would do best in a home with the right male dog after a proper introduction. Gigi would love nothing more than spending time with her family, lying under a shady tree and just watching the day go by.

Are you interested in Gigi? Please go to our website at: www.bigeastakitarescue.org and fill out an online adoption application for this sweet and quiet girl.
name: Gigi

description:
Miss Maggie May! This southern puppy is a 5-month old, 13-pound Schnorkie (Schnauzer/Yorkie mix) that just arrived from Texas. She is playful and happy and sweet. More to come as shared by her foster mom. Maggie May has had one round of shots and needs to be spayed and microchipped.

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application on the CONTACT US page. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:

Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.com

Fosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.com

PLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked "Adoption Pending" have an approved adoption application on file and are awaiting final approval. Please check back in a few days to see if they are still available!

We understand you may have questions but the fastest way to get answers is to fill out the application and the foster parent can answer any questions you may have!

Waggytail Rescue CAN NOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you.
name: Maggie May!

description: Hi! I'm Melody and I'm a cheerful, affectionate and a playful mix who instantly takes to people. I love to play with my squeaky tennis Kong ball and go for walks, but also enjoy my down time too. You can often find me cozily curled up somewhere. I'm currently living with my foster family, but you can contact adoptnyc@bestfriends.org to set up a meet and greet!
name: Melody

description: Angels walk among us Sometimes they are unseen and have wings Sometimes they pant and lick your faces. Can I be your angel? Ruff House Rescue "Goes Big" so more pets have a chance to go home. This means we are rescuing in areas that we can make the biggest lifesaving impact. While we continue to help our local dogs and families in NY wanting to surrender their pets we are compelled to help the animals most in need from the highest kill rate shelters in the country and the highest statistic for strays. Hundreds and thousands of highly adoptable puppies and dogs are killed daily. Therefore the majority of our pets come from these areas. This means the cost of rescue is higher due to the high costs of vetting, boarding, and transport. Please note our adoption fees vary and are the most reliable source of revenue enabling us to continue our rescue efforts. Your adoption fees directly contribute to the rescue of these animals. Please see our website for information and an application to adopt or foster or volunteer for RHR. Adoption fees vary from $250 to $500 which includes a pets spay/neuter - Micro-chipping - current vaccinations - heartworm testing. We ask that adopters submit applications in advance to help facilitate the adoption process. Please note while you may not be sure what pet you are interested in if any your application will help us find you the perfect match. Applications at Ruffhouserescue.org - *Please only submit an application if you are available immediately to adopt. Have a rental agreement to have a pet and all family members are ready to adopt. Thank you for thinking Adoption First!
name: Leonard

description:
Meet Manny, a 7 week old, 6 pound (as of 12/21), adorable Boxer mix. This delightful puppy is soft, sweet, cuddly and super loving.  

He is dog friendly, cat friendly and is fabulous with all humans. He seeks out attention and affection, and responds with happiness and joy. He  is lively and active, but needs plenty of nap time too! Play, rest, repeat!

This tender-hearted darling has an engaging personality and is bursting with love. He is a great pup with a lot to offer. Affectionate, curious, spirited, and kind, all this little guy needs is a home to call his own and a devoted best friend for life. 

If you would like to adopt this Rockstar, please email PupstarzRescue@gmail.com or visit www.pupstarzrescue.org for an application!

**Puppies are hard work. If you are not ready for a 'new baby' please adopt an adult or senior who need you!  In addition, we cannot guarantee the breed, size, and age of a puppy.**
name: Manny

description: Phoebe is four years old and lost her home because of an eviction...she's about 70 lbs but needs to slim down to about 60... she was originally adopted from the shelter three years ago so she is used to being in a home...she loves people and playtime ,but she prefers to be the only pet in the home...she knows some basic commands like sit,paw and down.  Phoebe is very smart and will make a fine companion for a family with older children who would be happy with one loyal dog. A fenced in yard would be wonderful,however, that's not a requirement...
name: Phoebe

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Murphy! Murphy is an adorable Golden mix puppy who was born in October 2018. He comes into rescue from Texas and is now ready for a home to call his own! He is an amazing little guy...sweet, playful, and gives the best puppy kisses and cuddles! He is friendly with people of all ages and other dogs and will be neutered and up to date on vaccines (age appropriate) prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Murphy the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application for him here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Murphy

description: Louie is a sweet, senior dog, who deserves a chance at a quiet, loving home outside of the shelter.  He doesn't ask for much.. just a warm, soft bed to lay on and someone that will love him for the rest of his life.  He has spent enough time at the shelter.  He has lived with dogs in the past and doesn't seem to even notice the cats at the shelter.  If you are interested in adopting  Louie or would EVEN LIKE TO FOSTER HIM, please contact the Cape May County Animal Welfare Society @ 609-465-3403 or email us @ cmcaws@yahoo.com
name: Louie

description:
Sapphire will be joining us shortly here at BEAR. She is a very adoptable, friendly, and easy going female Akita who sadly lived her entire life inside of a puppy mill in MO. That was in the past, and she is now free and will be searching for her forever home.

Interested in Sapphire? Please go to our website at www.bigeastakitarescue.org and fill out an online adoption application. This girl won't be around for long!
name: Sapphire

description:
Meet pretty girl Rose. She is a sweet, laid back older gal, but still has some pep in her step! Rose was found wandering around on a back road, and a nice foster family has been caring for her while she waits for a forever home. Rose loves to run and play in the yard, enjoys playing with toys --jolly balls are her favorite. She also loves to snuggle, go for car rides, and even did well meeting other dogs. She is house and crate trained. Her foster mom says Rose is the best girl around, smart and great with her recall and heel position.

Rose is currently in a foster home. If you are interested in meeting Rose, please email adoptadog@faithfulfriends.us.
name: Rose

description:
Chai is a very handsome and sweet big boy. He loves people, is house trained, well behaved on the leash and around the house.
Chai gets along with most dogs, mostly females. He is a lover and can be a great family dog. 
Chai enjoys lonng walks, being outdoor and sharing his time with the people he loves. Whoever meets him is very impressed by his sweet personality and his playful joyful affection. The perfect companion for your summer, Chai is always ready to go with you on your next adventure.
name: CHAI

description:
Brownie is just as sugary sweet as his name suggests!  This 3 year old Shepherd/Chesapeake Bay Retriever mix turns heads with his striking markings.  At 54 lbs., he is the perfect size too!  Brownie was left behind when his former owner moved, and the man's elderly parents could not care for Brownie.  This quiet guy is a bit timid but does take some reassurance from his humans, and he likes being kissed and cuddled.  He is looking for a loving home that will help show him that he doesn't need to be afraid.  Brownie is great with other dogs and cats. 


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Brownie

description:
Annabelle is a darling, friendly long coated Akita that never meets a stranger. She is outgoing, playful, and would love nothing more than to play with her toys and take long walks. Annabelle will need to be a only pet, however, you will need no other. Annabelle knows some basic commands, has manners, and is very well behaved.

Are you interested in this girl? Please go to our website at www.bigeastakitarescue.org and put in a online adoption application for Annabelle.  She won't be around long!
name: Annabelle

description: This little beauty is Maeve!  She is a 6 month old female Chihuahua Miniature Pinscher mix.  She is expected to be under 25lbs when she is full grown. She is super friendly and is very social.  She loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times. She still has lots of puppy energy and loves to romp and play. She is such a little lover and she never turns down a good belly rub.   She would make the perfect lap dog! Although she is great with children, due to her small size we are not comfortable placing her in a home with children under the age of 7. She would make a great addition to just about any family! She is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month. She can't wait to find her forever home!
name: Maeve

description: Sweet older boy, just arrived after being found abandoned apt after owners eviction. He was tied to baseboard, left in 100 degrees.  He will be neutered and have his dental issues addressed, he seems to have some bad teeth.  At that time Otis will be ready for adoption.
name: Otis  (not available)

description:
Cody CoCo was an owner surrender. He is a super sweet, young red nose pit bull. He is good with other dogs and kids.

NO OUT OF STATE ADOPTIONS. 
Only Queens, the 5 boroughs and Long Island.
name: Cody CoCo

description:
How would I look under your tree? My name is Georgie. I am an 8 week old female beagle mix. I am looking for my forever home. I am black and have four white socks. I am adventurous and sweet and love to snuggle. I love kids and enjoy playing tug with my little sister. I get along really well with my four much bigger foster brothers and sisters, who are really curious about me!!

If you are interested in adopting me please contact Tara at WoofLoveTara@gmail.com.

Adoption donation of $335 includes age appropriate vaccinations and spay/neuter when pup is approximately 5-6 months of age. 
Woof Love Rescue is a registered 501c3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible. 

*** Breed determination in most cases is often based on the limited history typically available for most rescued animals. We try to be as accurate as possible with the information we have and the Rescue assessment of the pup.
name: Georgie

description:
Update: 1/16: Our special shy Gummy is still waiting her the right understanding forever home.  She loves playing with her doggie friends in her foster home and is looking for a calmer adult home with at least one other dog.  She's about 3 years old now although she has a forever puppy face:).  10/19/14:  Gummy has come a long way in learning to trust and make new friends and is graduating from the ASPCA's behavior rehabilitation center.   She is a cute funny girl looking for a calmer adult home that will continue her socialization and another doggie friend to play with.  5/8/14:  Gummy is going through a behavior rehabilitation program to help her learn to trust more people and hopefully acclimate more easily to a home... she is a sweetheart who is cute and playful once she bonds but has remained very nervous of strange people and situations.  Stay tuned for updates... she will hopefully be ready for adoption in 6-8 weeks and will be looking for a calmer adult home with another friendly doggie playmate for her to help her feel more comfortable. Gummy Bear and 8 of her siblings (all staffy/chihuahua! mixes believe it or not!) were living in filthy conditions in a yard in Yonkers and being given away for free on Craig's List when luckily the local shelter stepped in and took them all. She is only 14 months old and was never socialized outside her yard- she is the most terrified of the group and was clinging to the back of her cage in the shelter when we met her, so we knew we had to help her!   She will need a special calmer home that will be patient in socializing her and teaching her to trust- she is already warming up and wagging her tail at her foster mom.  She is only about 25lbs full grown and looks just like a shrunken pit bull:)  Please submit an application if you can give her the safe loving home she deserves to make up for a rough start in life....We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East next to 5 Star Car Wash (formerly Boulder Car Wash) in Morris Plains (Denville on GPS).  To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Gummy Bear-READY FOR A HOME!

description: Meet Milan (pink collar in pictures)......this young adult female has been with us in foster for about6 weeks. She is a great dog full of energy and spunk. Milan has a hysterical habit of knocking herdry food on the oor and pouncing on dierent pieces before she eats it. When she rst came ittook her a few days to warm up to us humans.......she was great with the dogs. Now she loves tobe with us and comes running for love and snuggles. She is a curious girl who loves the yard,squeaky toys and playing with her foster siblings (Big and small). She is crate trained and housebroken. Her crate is her safe spot and when she wants to rest or if a stranger comes over sheretreats to her crate until she is comfortable. It takes her a little time to warm up to you but onceshe does she is your best friend. She can be skittish, but will hide if she is not comfortable withthe situation.
name: Milan

description: Meet the handsome Ripper!  This sweet boy is a 1 year old male Australian Shepherd mix who weights approx 35lbs.  He is a little shy at first but warms up very quickly and once he does he loves just about everyone and everything he meets.  He loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times. He still has lots of energy and he loves to romp and play. He never turns down a good belly rub. .  Even though he is considered an adult, he still has lots of puppy energy!  He loves to play ball and to run around the yard.  He would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle! He is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month. He can't wait to find his forever home!
name: Ripper

description:
We are in need of foster homes. All of our rescue dogs are rescued from high-kill shelters. Our rescue gives them their extra time they need to find a home. The majority of our fosters find homes within a 2-3 week period. We are looking for short-term fosters to help with this.  All of our dogs/puppies are quarantined before going into foster care to ensure their healthy. They are also vetted with all their age appropriate shots. Wouldn't it be great to know that because of you a dog's life was saved? For more information on how to help us give a dog/puppy the gift of life  or to  to submit a foster application, please visit our website  http://www.oscaranimalrescue.org/oscar-1-foster.html 

If you would like to make a donation to help us rescue more animals please send donations to PO Box 248, Sparta, NJ 07871. Please make your check payable to O.S.C.A.R.  Thank you for helping us save as many lives as we can.
     
**THIS DOG IS NOT FOR ADOPTION. HE HAS BEEN ADOPTED AND IS LIVING A GREAT LIFE. WE RESCUE MANY LABS THOUGH SO PLEASE CHECK OUR SITE. THIS IS ONE OF THE MANY WE HAVE SAVED.
name: FOSTERS NEEDED!

description:
Meet Douglas, an adorable 8-week old Border Collie/Pittie mix baby ready to find his very own loving furrever home in the Big Apple. Douglas is perfect mix of puppy kisses and playful antics!

Apply now, he is ready to go home and snuggle, cuddle and wiggle-butt his way into your heart!

Douglas is available for adoption through in Our Hands Rescue. If interested in meeting him, please fill out an application on inourhandsrescue.org. Please DO NOT send an email through Petfinder, your application will be processed before the following Saturday's event.
name: Douglas

description:
Jimmie is a very young 6+ years, still loves playing with toys. Jimmie is a strong boy, who once out and about is just as sweet as can be. He does need an experienced owner, someone who can continue to teach him right from wrong... just like a child! They aren't perfect and will always need your guidance:) If you would like to meet this handsome boy, fill out our dog adoption application online at pawscrossedny.org

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.
name: Jimmie

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

My name is Bella and I am a young Pyrenees mixed possibly with Anatolian Shepherd. I get along great with my foster brothers and love to play and run with them. My foster mom went on vacation and left me with some other humans who have a small dog who doesnât get along with anybody. They were impressed as I won her over and had her playing in no time! My mom says I am content to be alone as I love to just play and play with toys, with or without those boys! It is pretty special when my people love on me and I LOVE to give lovens' back! I really think I would make a great lap dog despite what my people say about my size...as you see, I am already getting quite large for my age :) I like riding in cars and I will go to the door to let you know I need to go potty. My foster mommy is working on my leash training but I promise I will get that down. I love children and other dogs and while I would love a home with either or both, I would be just as happy with my people being around a lot. I can't wait to get my FUREVER home!! If you are looking for a big, fluffy loving companion, I am your girl!
name: Bella

description:
Hi friends! My name is Cooper and I'm a 10 week old lab mix looking for a forever home! I love exploring the backyard and playing with my squeaky toys. I'm definitely a cuddler and I love to be near my foster family all the time! To find out more about adopting me, email my foster mom at bmaurodesigns@gmail.com

Adoption donation of $365 includes age appropriate vaccinations and spay/neuter when pup is approximately 5-6 months of age.  
Puppies and More Rescue is a registered 501c3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible.

*** Breed determination in most cases is often based on the limited history typically available for most rescued animals.  We try to be as accurate as possible with the information we have and the Rescue assessment of the pup.
name: Cooper

description: Mugsy is a male Shih Tzu , approximately 10 years old. He is a very calm, friendly, sweet dog. He is good in the car, on walks, with other dogs and with people in general. He would make such a nice companion for a mature household. He loves attention and he loves tennis balls. Call Libby to make an apt to meet him. He is a real sweetie!!! (732) 671-3708
name: Mugsy

description:
ONLY ADOPTABLE IN NEW JERSEY!!!!

ADULT ONLY HOME!!!!

PREVIOUS DOG EXPERIENCE A MUST!!!!

Maisey is a 2 year old Chug who was rescued from a very bad situation.  She is extremely playful and loves to chase balls in the back yard, sheâs a master fetcher!
Maisey is very affectionate when she wants love but is also very sassy and strong willed.  She will definitely need a dog savvy owner to take the time to work with her.   Maisey was severely neglected and will need time and patience to flourish into a wonderful companion and therefore CANNOT be with children.  Although she 
is fine with other dogs, she tends to get a little jealous for attention.  It is understandable given her history.  This beautiful girl is spayed, vetted and microchipped.  

If you are interested in Maisey please go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.
name: Maisey

description: Meet Bruce!  This handsome man is an 8 month old male Boxer Lab mix.  He is super friendly and loves just about everyone and everything he meets.  He loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times.  He never turns down a good belly rub.  He loves to play and is full of puppy energy.  He would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle!  He is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month.  He can't wait to find his forever home!
name: Bruce

description:
*Courtesy Post* Lady is a 9 year old gal who is saddened that her owner abandoned her after having her for so many years. Old Dog New Tricks!

Meet Lady, a senior hound mix, 45lbs, 9 years old and fully vetted. Lady is best to a home with no dogs, no cats or other small animals in the home and no toddlers.  She is housebroken, crate trained, knows basic commands as and is above all very sweet and loving. She loves to have her belly rubbed and should you stop petting her she will use her paw to steer your hand back to where it belongs!  

Lady was just recently rescued from being keep outdoors in a yard, we don't really know her full story, but she is was not well socialized on a leash and will require training. In the home she's perfect, would do best with a family that has a yard and understands that this senior girl never really had much guidance and needs a human of her own to reach her that it's never too late for an old dog to learn new tricks!

Please contact Claudia at Schnauzer.tude@gmail.com
name: Lady

description: Introducing Razzle Dazzle!, Her close friends call her Razz :)  Razz was surrendered to a local shelter with a few mammary cysts, double hernias and was not spayed.  On top of that she came down with kennel cough then pneumonia before she was pulled into PLDP Rescue. Also along with her obvious ailments she has a heart murmur and some rotted teeth were discovered.   She sure had a long road ahead of her.  It took a couple months to get her well enough to under go surgery.  Razz did fantastic during surgery and was a long recovery, but she is finally available for adoption! Razz would do best in an adult only house because she can be a little mouthy whether its just playing, getting overly excited, or can be a tad bratty sometimes.  She really is such a happy-go-lucky girl!  She just needs that special home that is going to love and spoil her forever.  Razz also has luxating patellas so minimum stairs is most ideal, and pain medication or joint suppliment maybe needed. We were able to get her totally off the pain medications as of now and is doing well.   Razz doesn't like crates so a gate in the kitchen or spare room would be best for her when home alone for too long, or foster mom uses a pack & play and she doesn't escape.   She isn't house broken but taking her outside every hour or so she does do well.   Razz's biopsy did come back as precancerous. Razz can live with over mello dogs and cats.  Razz is a laid back girl and enjoys chewing bully sticks to pass the time.   Foster mom knows Razz is a special girl and is hoping that the right family sees her picture and happy video and will open their home and their heart to her. She is spayed, UTD, heart worm checked and negative, and ready to meet you
name: Razzle Dazzle

description:
Meet Deja!
NOTE: Deja's adoption fee is FULLY SPONSORED by friends of Bella-Reed!

"Hi, my name is Deja and I am around 7-8 yrs. old. I am looking for a forever home where I can be the one and only pet to live out my Golden Years! I was found as a stray by the Brandywine Valley SPCA where I quickly became theÂ shelter favorite. Everyone tells me I have a great disposition, and even though I'm not quite sure what that means, I do LOVE everyone. I also love to play, and I can still jump higher than any of those youngsters to catch a ball or one of my favorite toys.Â 

Bella-Reed was made aware of me when their branch Saving Elderbulls reached out to the shelter to see if they had any elderbulls to feature on their page. Our president fell in love with my face and found me a foster spot.

At my age it is nice to have a soft place to lay my head and a blanket to cuddle underneath. I have not done well with allÂ dogs andÂ I am a little too interested in cats, so a home without other pets would be best (see below). I love humans of all ages -Â I promise to keep any kidsÂ busy playing catch!Â I am move-in ready, I know my manners, and I know to always to potty outside. I don't mind saying it but I think I'm practically perfect in every way. So won't you please think about adding me to your family?Â 

Love, Deja"

***Â Deja does not do well with female dogs. She did, however, meet a low-key male while in foster and after her initial excitement she was fine around him. She does not react to dogs during walks.

Deja is fully vettedÂ including spay, microchip, vaccines, deworm, 4dx heartworm test (negative), monthly heartworm prevention, senior bloodwork, and urinalysis. She has a clean bill of health!

For an adoption application on Deja, visit our website at bellareedpbr.com/adoption

For more photos of Deja, visit her photo album under our PHOTOS section of our Facebook page: facebook.com/BRPBR
name: Deja

Ande is a sweet and loving girl, who would do best in a home with children 12 or older and no other animals as she loves to be the center of attention!

He is approx 1year old, was in foster in a family with kids and other dogs.
He is playful but not hyper and could be the best family dog. He is approx 50 lbs and full grown.

description: Foster Update: Leon is a funny sheep-looking guy! Although a little hard to read because of his adorable underbite and, sort of, serious expression, Leon is a fun little dog to hang out with. Whether you want someone to watch tv with or a friend to take a long stroll with, Leon is your guy. He's super quiet and loves to explore and sniff outside. His favorite activity is napping in the coziest corner of your couch or tucked away in his crate. In the warmer seasons, Leon would be the perfect buddy to sit on a park bench and people-watch for hours with. Leon is an 8-year-old poodle mix who is fully grown at 15lbs. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Leon

description:
Brains, brawn and a penchant for squeaky toys; all three of these make up the handsome Dozer. Like his name implies, Dozer has a way of "bulldozing" his way into your heart. He is an active and playful dog that has face wrinkles that could go on for days. Dozer loves the outdoors and would play in the yard for hours if we let him. Whether you have a toy or not, he is by your side, enjoying the fresh air!Â 

Dozer came to our shelter by unusual means: he was found in a local neighborhood by a Good Samaritan, and had no collar or other identification. Since the neighborhood was right next to the highway, we presumed that Dozer had been left by someone and luckily was found right away. The odd circumstances of Dozer's arrival have done nothing to detract from the warm, spirited dog that we have gotten to know. He is clearly a dog that has had his fair share of both good and bad luck, and we know that he can only have better luck from now on.

Being so handsome has its privileges, and one of them is that Dozer would love to be your one and only pet. We are seeing more and more of his personality and potential with other dogs, but he would love the limelight all to himself. Since Dozer is so versatile in his interests, he could easily fit in with any lifestyle. A family that loves to hike? He's got granola bars and wool socks already. A single person that likes to stay in and watch movies? If you don't mind popping a bowl of popcorn for Dozer, he'll be by your side. He is a truly special dog and we would love to see him find his family!



Have you been bulldozed by this Dozer? If so, please click on the online application below!




Please contact us at (914) 273-1674 or adoptions@adoptadog.org for more information.
name: Dozer

description:
14 Dec 2018: Meet 80lbs of sweetness. While Champ is a big boy, he is a sweet, gentle dog. He happily greets each morning with a wagging tail and big smile. Champ walks nicely on leash, and he ignores barking or excitable dogs on his walks. He does have a fair amount of energy and requires a minimum brisk daily walk of 2 miles to drain his excess energy. Having a fenced in yard would be a bonus, especially since Champ loves playing in the snow. Champ is crate trained and easily goes in his crate. He is house trained and travels well in the car. Champ gets along with cats and dogs. Champ has not been around small children -- but given his size he might accidentally knock over a small child.

Champ loves nothing more than to be with his people. Heâs a velcro dog, who follows you all around the house. When you sit, he sits next to you and loves nothing more than to get his belly rubbed. Champ takes treats gently from you. Overall, Champ is a good, sweet dog, who was dealt a bad hand. Champ was adopted as a puppy but unfortunately due to his family's change in living situation and a baby on the way, this sweet guy finds himself in need of a new home again. He is currently in a foster home and doing well. Please apply to adopt today.
name: Champ

description: 4 Dec 2018: Snow is a 7 month old pup who came into rescue as part of a cruelty case. He has received medical care and is now ready to find his forever home. this beautiful boy currenlty weighs about 35 pounds and estimated he will be 50 pounds when fully grown. Snow is dog friendly. Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Snow

description:
Wonât you please say hello to our sweeter than sugar, Domino. This big fellow may be 6 1/2 years old but he still has the soul of a puppy! He enjoys a good romp and play session. Sometimes he forgets he IS NOT A PUPPY and doesnât quite understand his own strength when walking. He would do best with someone who has experience with larger, stronger dogs. He is very obedient, but would just need someone who would be patient and consistent with him. He just needs someone to love him and someone he can love in return! Whether you think of the sugar, or the game or the singer â¦ you really wonât find a cooler, more awesome Domino than the one you will find at PCAR! His little freckles are pretty darn cute, but his big goofy smile is EVERYTHING!
Fill out our dog adoption application online at pawscrossedny.org and come on in to meet Domino soon!

Domino: Handsome, friendly, loves his long walks with the volunteers, greets everyone that passes with his big smile. He loves his back scratched too! Domino is truly a good boy. 

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.
name: Domino

description: Tommer is a simple man. If a home has a tennis ball, a tug toy or even some sticks to shake around, he could settle there furever. He asks for lots of play time with his people, his kids or a patient dog buddy. Tommer does well with kids of all ages and dogs of all sizes. He hopes that his good looks will distract you from his goofy personality and sometimes clumsy antics. Tommer is a dog that can happy anywhere, given he has opportunities to work off his energyâthis is a very enthusiastic and lively guy! Tommer is a year old, Staffie-German Shepherd-Chow mix. He is crate trained and has overcome his separation anxiety, given his crate is in a space in the home where he can hear or see his family. To send him some goodies, please shop his amazon wish list here - https://smile.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/2QW8UEVA4JDKN To adopt go to www.pmarinc.org

description:
MEET - YUKI - AVAILABLE - No Phone Calls. Please Email.
NO INQUIRIES WITHOUT APPLICATION (Link Below) 
- PLEASE READ ENTIRE AD 

Yuki is such a sweet little guy but the vet says he may have been abused and as a result may have some slight brain damage. He certainly has his quirks. 
Yuki is probably a Maltese/yorkie mix, about 4 yrs old and weighs 10lbs. 
Yuki will need lots of work on settling in into new situations.  He seems to be afraid of bowls and will only eat his food from the floor. He spins when he is excited and walks in circles when he is stressed. Yuki has his own language and gets frustrated when you don;t understand it. He LOVES to go for walks and walks really well on the leash. He would do best with a family that doesn't mind doing a work on gaining his trust. Yuki needs a quiet home where someone is home most of the time as he has some separation anxiety. 


Please, no children, Yuki needs a quiet home with people to love him for the rest of his life. 

Yuki would love to be someone's little buddy.

Yuki is neutered, microchipped and current on shots.

If you are a special person who thinks you may be a good fit for this boy please apply using link below

THIS IS AN OODLES OF DOODLES, INC. ADOPTABLE DOG. or RESCUE or OWNER ASSISTED REHOME DOG. Please DO NOT confuse us with any other Doodle Rescue." We are Independent Rescuers working as a Collective, to save Poodle-mix dogs from kill shelters and other situations. ALL Applications are sent to the Foster, Rescue or Family who has the dog and who checks references, does home visits and conducts interviews. Please DO NOT send inquiries. PLEASE, WE ARE ALL VOLUNTEERS and CANNOT ANSWER OTHER INQUIRIES without having an application on file. IF YOU ARE A MATCH FOR THE DOG, YOU WILL BE CONTACTED. Thank you for understanding.
VISIT OUR WEBSITE at http://oodlesofdoodles.org. We have been Listing & Rescuing Oodles since 2008. After a reorganization in May, 2010 we have renewed focus and goals. We are a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit and your donation is tax deductible.
All Oodles of Doodles dogs are located in foster or family homes across the North American Continent. We do not have a central location. THE LOCATION GIVEN IN THE DOG'S NAME IS WHERE HE or SHE IS LOCATED. Unless otherwise stated, WE DO NOT ADOPT, SHIP OR TRANSPORT OUR DOGS AWAY FROM THE AREA THEY ARE IN ** That means within a 50 mile radius WE DO NOT ADOPT TO URBAN/APARTMENT/RENTER ENVIRONMENTS. WE REQUIRE FENCED YARDS (an e-fence is not a secure fence). PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT MATCH WHAT WE ARE ASKING FOR. IT ONLY WASTES OUR VALUABLE TIME, AND YOURS.
If the listing is given as ADOPTABLE or AVAILABLE, then the right home has not been located yet and the dog is still available for adoption. Please fill out an application and not send inquiries.

This pretty girl has been hanging out with her canine foster sister, going to the dog park and familiarizing herself with the hustle and bustle of NYC. We think sheâs a little shy of being 1 year old, and is pretty much full grown at 48 pounds. She is great with cats, too!

Bella doesn't reserve her snuggles just for other dogs, she also loves to nuzzle up with her foster dad as often as possible. She has done great with kids and all around has an amazing temperament. He is a volunteer favorite at the shelter and loves going for walks, playing ball, and hanging out with his human and doggie friends. Foster has an autoimmune disease and chronic dry eye, but is asymptomatic on daily medication and eye drops (which he is very tolerant of!) Due to a medical grant we will be able to assist with his first year of medication when he is adopted! He will need some patience with housebreaking and frequent walks/confinement initially to get on a schedule in a new home.Foster is just one of many sweet seniors we have looking for homes...please stop by the shelter during our hours or send an application from our website www.rbari.org if you are interested in meeting them. description:
Nana is a young gal  about 3 years old with a free spirit. She was found tied to a boiler in the basement of a foreclosed house in Queens with no food or water in April of 2014. She is still young and has a lot of energy which need to be harnessed properly. Nana enjoys the outdoors whether it is going on long walks or running around in the yard, chasing the ball around. She vies for attention, and loves getting petted behind her ears. Once she knows and trusts you, she will jump straight info your arms to be carried like baby. She really needs to be in a single pet home with a someone experienced who can devote time to help train and socialize her so she can grow up to be the playful, happy dog she deserves to be. We believe she is worth the investment.
Email haar13@aol.com or harescue1@aol.com to inquire. To foster email 16paws@outlook.com

The application can be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html

Bella is a 2yo female GSD/lab mix who was surrendered in Memphis when her owner became homeless.  Sweet, well-socialized, affectionate, typical GSD temperament. A little timid at first with strangers but warms up quickly.  Great with other dogs but not yet cat tested. Recommended for children 6 years and older. Medium-high energy level outside, quiet and well-mannered in the house.  Crate trained and housebroken. Uses the doggie door. Obeys basic commands.  Loves to be with her people.  Good on a leash, rides great in the car.  When she first came to us, Bella had heartworms but she was treated and cured without complications and is now ready for adoption. Healthy and fully vetted, current on shots, spayed, weighs about 60 pounds.  AWESOME young shepherd mix will make a wonderful companion (and jogging partner!) for an active family.

This little cutie (40 pounds) is the perfect combination of play and chill. At approximately 5 years old, she's over the puppy stuff, and has eased into the role of being a grown up beautifully! She's housebroken and crate trained and also knows basic commands such as sit and stay. Wanna start your day off with a smile every morning? Then this girl is who you've been waiting for! description:
11/9/18

Sky - COURTESY POST 

Hi! My name is Sky. It was Smiley when I was at Animal Control in Philly. You can see why I had that name in my pictures. I'm one year old, about 44lb and not that tall. That is quite an improvement from when I was found weighing only 31lbs! See, I was found as a stray and had already had a litter before being one year old. I'm spayed now and have a tattoo to prove it. 

When I met my foster parents we all feel immediately in love. They have a backyard that I love to play in and a swimming pool that I have reluctantly swum in. They have two kids ages 13 & 9 and often have friends over. I win everyone's heart and I am sooo happy to meet and greet new people with kisses. I love kids because they like to run and play with me. I'm active at the right times because I am happy to sleep in my crate, yes, I love my crate. I never bark or get upset when I'm in it. I'm a big fan of family time on the couch. I love to snuggle with my foster family and I hear snore. I'm housetrained and I'm a fast learner, sit, come, etc. My foster family had planned on being my forever family but their other female dog and I don't get along. I'm fine with their 12-year-old male dog although he isn't really a fan of me because I like to play. He says he's too old for that. 

So basically I would do best as an only dog but I'd be happy to meet you and perhaps your male dog. I probably shouldn't be in a house with cats or other small creatures as I have a pretty strong prey drive. I know these character traits may not be appealing to some but I know there is the perfect forever home out there for me. I also know that my foster family will make sure I am placed with the best of the best. They want me and my new family to live happily ever after.
name: Sky - COURTESY POST

description:
Humphrey is an 8 year old, 9lb Bichon Frise.  He is a happy, healthy, friendly and loving dog who just wants to cuddle, play (note his video), and be with his person (note his napping photo!)

Humphrey likes treats and walks and cuddling with or following his person around. He eats a regular diet and is housebroken to the outside.  He will sometimes bark if he hears someone walking by the door, but is generally quiet. He will growl a little if another dog tries to take his food or toy from him but shows no signs of aggression at all.  

Humphrey is a happy and very affectionate dog jumping into laps, giving kisses and wanting belly rubs.  He will a wonderful, loving  companion.  What Humphrey really does NOT like is being in a city environment, so we are seeking a suburban or country home for him, where he will be comfortable..

If you think Humphrey could be YOUR loving companion, please submit an Adoption Application to Metropolitan Maltese Rescue.  The form can be found on our website.
name: Humphrey

description: Benny is a long haired chihuahua bought from the Amish unfortunately. He needs an experienced Chihuahua owner that understands the breed and can work with his dominant issues. He seems to be a one person dog and gets possessive of his owner. He is fine with other dogs but he gets jealous when other people are around his person and we are working with breaking that. He is only 8 months old, up to date on everything and neutered. He would do best in a one person home, or two, and no children. He is housebroken and also possessive of his crate so we have not been using a crate with him and he is doing great without one. He wants to be loved and wants to love everyone, he just hasn't learned how to trust everyone.
name: Benny

description:
Meeko is a 16 week old Chihuahua puppy. He is neutered, up to date on shots, and microchipped. To inquire about him, email bratrescue@yahoo.com.

description: Russet is a sweet, two year old hound/pit mix. He is a friendly young dog that just needs some socialization and confidence building. While Russett likes other dogs and has been in playgroups, He is leash reactive towards dogs when being walked so this is something his adoptive family would need to work with. Other than that Russett is a happy boy who likes attention. He loves to play, run and go for long walks. He needs some help with his manners but he is a smart boy who catches on fast. He plays well with other dogs but he likes to rule the group and he has done ok with cats. He would probably do best with older children.For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt
name: Russet

description: This big puppy LOVES hugs. He has no idea that he is about 40 lbs and all muscle. Toro is a bull in a china shop LOL he is a big goofball, super playful and sweet, a bit of a low-rider, and just an all around mush
name: Toro

description:
There's no one who doesn't love Malibu, and when it comes to love, this wonderful, warm boy is indiscriminate: He adores people, cats, and dogs. Recently rescued from a high kill shelter, the 2 year old is thriving in his foster home, where he has learned his basic commands in record time and impressed everyone with his perfect energy level--high enough to be filled with joy on a walk (he's great on a leash), but low enough to make him a wonderful companion to hang out with while you read (he's a superb snuggler). Malibu's an easy, great boy who is longing for a forever home. His needs are simple: Someone who will play with him, walk him, and love him. With a dog like this, it couldn't be easier!
Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Malibu

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

You donât meet dogs as sweet and well-mannered as Ellie Mae everyday! This Pyr/Anatolian Shepherd mix is loving life in her foster home and has already mastered housebreaking, made great progress on a leash, and is working on both âcomeâ and âsitâ. The best part of coming into foster has been getting to meet new people, especially children. Gentle Ellie Mae seems to understand that being a big girl she has to be extra careful with them, and she goes out of her way to do just that. She also gets along with other dogs and quickly figured out that while the senior dogs prefer naps, the dogs closer to her age enjoy playtime just as much as she does :) She loves them all so much that she even walks away from her food bowl if they want her to share. Ellie Mae isnât just a great personality; with her Pyr length coat and shepherd coloring this girl is a beauty. If you look closely, you might even notice her freckles. This girl is definitely the total package and is guaranteed to bring a lifetime of smiles to the lucky family she gets to call her own!
name: Ellie Mae

He was held for the mandatory stray hold and when no one came or called to claim him, he was evaluated and passed with flying colors! 

Jello is super friendly and wiggly with everyone he meets (hence how he got his name). He did amazing with dog meets and socials at the shelter and will be re-evaluated with dogs during his stay in foster care. No kitties for this guy! He was a little too interested when he met one during a walk.

Jello is neutered, microchipped, up to date on vaccines (distemper, bordatella, and rabies), dewormed, 4dx heartworm negative, and on monthly heartworm prevention.

description:
RESCUED(along with an older m, LabradorRtvr-rescued by another rescue) from a high-kill Animal Control in Laurens, SC when their owner went into a nursing home.

dob: January 1, 2014...weighs 17lbs

Miss Jenny is a COMPANION ANIMAL from morning til midnight. She is devoted and always seeks to please, friendly, gentle and genuinely sweet. Gets along great with all dog of all sexes, gender and age. Would do best with an active work-from-home person or early retired couple. With proper care, Ms Jenny will have another good 10yrs to share adventures with her people/person, so we will be seeking applicants who are currently no older than 65yo, & who do NOT live in an URBAN environment(suburb & rural=OK!). The more active you are, the better your chances will be of being approved to share UNconditional love and life's adventures with Ms Jenny.

Walks well on-leash, crate-trained, housebroken, rides well in the car, loves to snuggle.

This pup is in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until her fur-ever person/family is approved. Upon approval, transport is arranged, via HAPPY DOGS or LIFESAVERS RESCUED PET TRANSPORT SVCs, to points along the eastern seaboard(I-95>VA, DC, MD, DE, NJ(NJTnpk>Vince Lombardi svc plaza), Long Island, Rye & AlbanyNY, JohnstonRI, ManchesterNH, as well as AllentownPA and the I-81S corridor. Transport fee: $125 is to be paid by the adopter

Upon request, we will be HAPPY to send you more pix and videos of this sweet girl, showing her demeanor and how she gets along with her people and the other sanctuary pals.

Upon request, we will be happy to test her with cats.

Because of her past life with an elderly person, we feel certain that she would prefer a quiet environment with no children living in the home.

She has an 'old soul' who prefers an easy-going life, so we are here to help her find what we feel that she feels most comfortable with.

She requires 3 1/2>1mi walks a day, and/or a safe and secure fenced-in back yard. However, dog parks may be a bit overwhelming for this little girl.

To apply to adopt Ms Jenny, please complete the application provided at www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ and send asap to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com

We will acknowledge your application, & then will send a short questionnaire to 3 of your personal references. Please, be sure to ask your refs to respond quickly, and give your vet's office permission to release your pet's medical history to Howlin4Spirit(we will contact them within 2 business days).

Adoption fee: $125(includes spay, micro-chip, Parvo-Distemper
, Bordatella &1yr Rabies vax, all medical paperwork from day #1 at Howlin4Spirit(includes all vet's surgical notes), health certificate, 3lb bag of her current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health' salmon & potato), Kong OR Nylabone chew toy, new Martingale collar and matching 6' leash, beef knee cap bone, 'RESCUED DOGS ROCK' car magnet, 2 'pet alert' wallet cards).

Upon approval, we require payment of this pup's adoption fee via Paypal.com.

Upon receipt, we will email you the adoption contract & reserve her spot on the next Saturday's transport.

description:
Bupi is a Indian Pariah dog aka Indian Native/Desi dog who was rescued from the streets of India and flown to the U.S. for a chance at adoption. Please scroll at the bottom to get details on this breed.

Bupi is a happy and loving pup who was rescued from the streets as he was a sole survivor of his litter. He wouldn't have made it much longer on his own as he was living in a high traffic area. Luckily he was brought to the shelter before he got hurt. Bupi is now around 8 months old fully vaccinated, neutered and microchipped. He has a blood and stool test report and an International Health Certificate. 

Bupi is a very playful and sweet dog who craves for your love. He is a social dog who gets along well with other dogs. He is waiting to have family of his own where he will be loved. If you want to give Bupi a loving home please email Rescuewithoutborders@gmail.com. 

Information on the Indian Native Dog breed:
IN (Indian Native), Desi (Local) or Pariah Dog is a pure, ancient, indigenous dog of India that abounds the Indian streets. A long time ago, thousands of years before the arrival of modern pure breeds, a race of dogs much like this one inhabited the Indian subcontinent. These were the very first domesticated dogs and Man's earliest animal companions. It has evolved entirely through natural selection without human intervention of any kind resulting into a very hardy, extremely intelligent, alert and independent thinking dog.

This is a natural breed of dog that is pure in a true sense and how nature intended a dog to be; hence they are way superior to the artificially developed man made breeds that we call pure breeds today. Its origin dates back 12,000 to 15,000 years â older than any other breed. This is a natural primitive breed which is a direct descendant of the early domesticated dogs. These dogs are found to be genetically healthy with no known genetic diseases and a very strong immune system. They are perfectly adapted for survival; a free-roaming life on the street for these dogs is always difficult and often hostile and hence requires high order of intelligence, quick and independent thinking to survive. On the streets it is the survival of the fittest, usually out of a litter some will get run over by cars while others will succumb to hunger and malnutrition. Only the most hardiest and intelligent ones will survive to produce off springs. When this survivor is adopted as a Pet, their owners are often awe struck with their beauty, grace, intelligence, loyalty and hardiness.

They are highly adaptable, quick learners and versatile and are known to be even smarter and definitely calmer than the intelligent Border Collies. They are very agile and excel at many dog sports such as agility and also make great jogging/running companions and can be even faster than Grey Hounds. While active outdoors, they are usually very calm and quiet indoors. They have tremendous stamina and hence need an active family who will take them for a daily brisk walks or a run.
IN Dogs are sensitive by nature and do not respond well to harsh training methods and hence need an even tempered, gentle but firm and loving owner who knows how to calmly and consistently communicate the rules of the house.
These dogs love children and are known to have a calm and gentle demeanor around them. They bond strongly with their people and make an excellent family pet that is very loving, loyal and intelligent. These dogs do not bark much but are always alert; they are friendly yet wary of strangers and make good watch dogs.

IN Dogs are low maintenance dog as they are generally very healthy and like to stay clean; they hardly shed and have virtually no doggy odor. Their smooth, fine short hair coat is easy to groom. They have an all-weather coat that allows them to easily adapt to different weather conditions.
A well-looked after pet IN dog will rarely need to see a vet and may live a healthy life of up to the age of 12 â 18 years.

This is a medium size dog with an average height of 20-25 inches (51-64 cms) at the shoulder and generally weigh about 28-55 pounds (12 â 22 kgs).
They are found in all colors and variation with erect or floppy ears; however, a typical IN Dog usually will have erect ears, a wedge-shaped head and a tail that curls over its back. Most IN Dogs are similar in appearance to other prehistoric dogs like the Australian Dingos.

In the last few years, we have successfully rescued, rehabilitated and found homes over 500 pariah dogs throughout the Northeast United States and the West Coast.

Please visit our Face book page to see the IN dogs adopted through our rescue.
http://www.facebook.com/RescueWithoutBorders
name: Bupi

description:
Roarke comes to us from Illinois, where he was found as a very malnourished stray. He was terribly skinny and the shelter worked to get him feeling better and to put some meat back on his bones. Roarke was positive for heartworms, and he has been treated for them and will be ready for his FURever home in early December. Roarke is a DREAM on a leash and loves to go for walks, checking out his surroundings and taking in the scenery. He is also a big fan of car rides and loves to meet new friends.

Roarke is making big strides on his house manners, but sometimes he gets that "I'm a puppy in an adult body" sparkle in his eye and tries to instigate a game of catch me if you can! He may knock things over in these comical moments, but it isn't his fault if his tail or nicely rounded thighs topple knicknacks or thingamabobs. He likes to try to "help" fold laundry, especially towels but don't be surprised if he decides one is a flag to be waved!

Roarke is a VERY sweet boy who loves to give love. He likes to give hugs and can sometimes slobber in his exuberance to love people. Roarke is great with kitties and he is fine with most dogs, although dominant dogs are not something he'd like to encounter on a daily basis.
Interested in fostering? Fill out our volunteer application here: http:// www.pointerrescue.org/ helpus.html
TRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally, within 1500 miles)
Can't foster right now, but want to help?
Consider sponsoring a dog by making a donation to help with vetting costs. PRO is 501c3 non-profit and is fully funded by donations, your tax-deductible gift would be greatly appreciated! 
http:// www.pointerrescue.org/ donation.html

Dominic enjoys playing with toys, exploring in the yard and playing with our dog.  He will pick up his stuffed toy, carry it around and then he will fall asleep on it.  Itâs so cute!  Dominic already knows the commands âsitâ, ânoâ and he comes when called, he sleeps through the night without having accidents and he is house trained.  Dominic is very people oriented and enjoys being held and he will sit in our laps when we watch tv.  He is a big time cuddlier. When this sweet pup sees us getting his food ready, he gets so excited, he starts talking to us! haha!  Dominic is an easy going puppy and we adore his joyful personality!"

description:
www.TheLastResortRescue.com PLEASE NOTE: IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING THIS PET THE FIRST STEP IS TO FILL OUT OUR ADOPTION APPLICATION AVAILABLE AT THELASTRESORTRESCUE.COM. If you have a question or inquiry please email us at tlrapplications@gmail.com
Meet Lex and Luther! They are perhaps a cattle dog / border collie / heeler mix? We really don't know, just a best guess! Anyway, they were rescued from living under an abandoned house in GA after their 'owner' moved away and left them and their momma, Lucy there! They were born approximately April 11th, 2015, They are very sweet and good with other dogs! They and their momma will be arriving to NJ on 6/14/15.
Update from foster mom 06/17/15
Sweet times 3! Momma Lucy has a very sweet disposition, itâs like she has been with us for years! She easily warmed up to us. Lex â the smaller of the 2 pups, is a ball of fire, he feels he needs to defend himself from his stocky brother Luther. Both are absolutely adorable! Anyone who adopts any of the 3 will be extremely lucky! We have fostered 3 other dogs in the past & I must admit these 3 by far are the best!!!!
Update from foster mom 06/30/15
'LUTHER' This cutie is ready for his new come! Another great name would be MJ (Michael Jackson) because his paws look like Michael's gloves without the glitz. He loves to play outside, yet cuddles on the couch too! He was a little skiddish when he arrived to his foster home, but is coming around. Give this Little Guy the chance to grow up in a loving home
Update from foster mom 10/21/15
LUTHER â this 6 Â½ month old pup is looking for a new foster or forever home. He is quite the cutie. Fully housebroken, neutered and crate trained. He loves to play, cuddle & give kisses. He needs a little more training with cats that is why he needs a new fosterâ¦.the weather is getting cold and itâs time for the fosterâs cats to come in for the Winter months. He gets along terrifically with other dogs and loves to go for walks. Weighing about 25 pounds he is not a big dog. He is a mix (Mother was a Blue Heeler/Aust. Cattle Dog, father unknown) although he looks like he could be part Labrador. Open your arms to this absolutely loving pup!
Luther is now a year old as of 4/21/16. Update from foster mom
Luther is 1 yr old Australian Cattle Dog mix. He is truly a great buddy. He loves cuddling. He is crate trained as well as housebroken. He is ok with cats and small dogs but not very fond of larger dogs.Adoption Application http://www.thelastresortrescue.com/adopt
name: Luther

description:
Hmmm.  What could he be.  The mix that keeps going around is shepherd/terrier/retriever.... but this is a medium size dog (nowhere near shepherd or retriever size) with short fur.  Found the day after the July 4th fireworks we were sure someone would be looking.  So many dogs are frightened by the loud noise, and they bolt.  That means this handsome gent could be from anywhere.  We waited and waited, but no one came.  No one called.   Since kids can be very noisy and he was so very scared when he came in we're thinking an adult household might be best.  

The town vet was in and checked him out.  Now he has his rabies vaccination.

>>>>>>GREAT NEWS!  THIS DOG HAS BEEN ADOPTED!

......
name: MIXED BREED [cc#6555]

description:
COURTESY POST.

MEET SAMPSON!!

This gorgeous hound mix is actually a rescue from Antiqua! Now living in upper Manhattan, doing wonderfully.

He is a young, lovable, energetic pup seeking a new home. His ideal home would be in the country with lots of open fields to run in, but he actually  does very well in the city too as long as he gets his daily exercise. He LOVES long walks, hikes and playing fetch. 
Sampson is also very calm in the home, knows how to chill after his walk, enjoying cuddles and belly rubs. He is a total affectionate lovebug, an incredible canine who will make some one or family a wonderful companion for life!

Sampson is about a year old and weighs about 55 lbs. He is utd and neutered. 

HAVE QUESTIONS? WANT TO KNOW MORE? Please contact reboundhounds@gmail.com and we will connect you to his present guardian.

SAMPSON IS LOCATED IN NORTHERN MANHATTAN.
name: Sampson

description:
Miley is a small, female Beagle-mix. She is approximately 10 years old and weighs just 20 pounds. Miley is current on vaccinations, already spayed, heartworm neg. (on preventative), and microchipped. She is crate trained too.  Though she is very shy with strangers (and the camera), Miley is a super affectionate dog that enjoys attention and loves being fussed over and spoiled by people she trusts. She really likes to snuggle and enjoys lots of one-on-one time with her favorite people. 

She is afraid of and reactive toward dogs she doesn't know. As a result, she doesn't handle introductions very well. She would prefer to be an only dog so she wouldn't have to share her human's attention and could get all the lovin' she deserves. Miley has not been observed with cats so a home without kitties is recommended.

Miley is a sweet little girl that really likes being with the people she trusts and enjoys being pampered. She'd be a wonderful companion for an experienced adopter/dog owner that understood her needs.

IMPORTANT: Safe Hounds Beagle Rescue does not operate a shelter where the public can meet our dogs. All of our Beagles are cared for in a loving foster home. Prospective adopters MUST submit an adoption application and be pre-approved to adopt. Once an applicant is approved, weâll begin a matching processâthe right dog for the right home. Submitting an application does not guarantee that you will be approved. Please visit our web page: www.safehounds.com to learn more about the adoption process and to download our adoption application.

Unable to adopt? Please consider making a donation. By helping us we can continue to make a difference in the lives of these deserving dogs.  We have many hungry hounds to feed and are always in need of financial support to help us meet the needs of the dogs in our care. Make a donation with PayPal by visiting our website: www,safehounds.com and click the "Donate" button. Safe Hounds Beagle Rescue, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. All contributions are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

This pet requires an application and $250 adoption fee.
name: Miley

Our rescue has a litter of 7 Lab Mix Pups who are 6-8 weeks old. Our rescue has several mix breed pups available for adoption. There utd with shots, dewormed and will be fixed when old enough. We will be working daily with them on housetraining, cratetraining and leashtraining. Each would enjoy a fenced in yard at their new home. They do well with other dogs, cats and gentle kids. description:

description:
Toby is a senior malamute/shepherd mix who has found himself homeless after 12 years. His owner surrendered him, along with one of our other dogs, Teddy, and both dogs were very well-loved. Toby, though a senior, still has a good deal of energy and has even been known to be a great jogging partner.   He is calm, gentle and sweet. He is good with dogs and all people. He is the absolute perfect companion and will cause you not and ounce of trouble. Toby is a big boy at 90 lbs, all the better for cuddling. 

If you are interested in Toby, please complete our adoption application by accessing the following link: https://fs29.formsite.com/RDR1/AdoptionApp/index.html

If you have any questions about Toby, please email carol@realdogrescue.org. Please keep in mind that Real Dog Rescue is run solely by volunteers. We aim to process applications and respond to emails as quickly as possible, and we appreciate your patience.  Thank you.

description:
Hi, my name is Gracie Ann. I am good with kids, dogs, and cats. I am using wee wee pads at the moment and awesome at it. My crate training is going okay! My leash training is still in progress. I am shy, but very playful and sweet.

Want to adopt me? Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html

**Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.**

**PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.

Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.

All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.

Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!
name: Gracie Ann

description: Ursa- sweet, lovable klutz. She is a special needs puppy who is deaf, but she is working to learn signs that will help her be âthe good dog.â She is also working on knowing the appropriate places to âgoâ that are NOT in the house! Her accidents are becoming fewer and fewer. She loves playing with the HUGE dog that lives with her, and is very curious about the small dog and cat that occupy her foster home. The cat wants NOTHING to do with Ursa because of her high energy level. Because she is still a pup, Ursa will go and go and go (think energizer bunny) until the lights are turned down and then itâs time to snuggle and snore.
name: Ursa

description:
Meet handsome GIZMO!

GIZMO is an approximately 3 year old male, neutered Boxer mix who weighs approximately 41 lbs. 

This handsome boy is a gem and is very affectionate with people and great with other dogs!  We think he is fine with cats and will have more details shortly.

GIZMO is a beautiful merle color and a wonderful all around pup.   He would love a family of his own to snuggle with and he will make an excellent companion.

He has a moderate energy level and likes to stick close to his person.

We saved Gizmo at the very last minute from a high-kill shelter down South. 
If interested, please contact Christine at crisley1@prodigy.net
name: GIZMO

description:
Hi! My name is Truly Terrific Tito and I am looking for a loving, forever home.  I was rescued by our wonderful rescue partner from the streets of Puerto Rico where I was abandoned and left to fend for myself.  I was so excited and relieved to be rescued.  I knew things were about to get alot better for me :)).  The President of our rescue met Tito at our rescue partner's home when she was in Puerto Rico and committed to finding Tito a forever home as soon as we had a foster available.  My rescuer loved and cared for me until I was ready to take my liberation flight.  I have now arrived in New York :)).

My foster family in New York City says I am a SUPER sweet dog :).  I am a good combination of playful yet calm.  I LOVE other dogs and cuddling on the couch to give and receive lots of love and affection :)).  I also walk well on a leash.  I would really enjoy a forever home with another dog and a fenced in yard.

Truly Terrific Tito is 7 years old, 51 lbs., neutered, fully vetted and vaccinated

If you are interested in learning more about me please email merylwright@aol.com.

Can't wait to meet you.  Love and Kisses, Truly Terrific Tito:))
name: Truly Terrific Tito

description: Hazel is a pretty, two year old American Bull Dog mix. She is a friendly and confident girl that loves to play ball. She is smart, knows sit and takes treats nicely. She loves to hug and go for walks. She likes other dogs but she likes to be in charge so she would need a submissive canine friend. She can be a little stubborn sometimes so she would need a family who can let her know who is in charge. She is a sweet girl with beautiful eyes and an expressive face.She has been waiting for her forever home since JulyFor more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt

description:
5y Dev is the epitome of a sweet, affectionate with cats/dogs and adults (kids unknown as of now), good 3 legged doggie ! 
He was found roaming near the fire station with his amputated foot which was infected so badly that gangrene set in and he had to have the rest of his back leg amputated. He was skin and bones but is now fully recovered and doing splendidly--no health problems and gets around just fine.  Waiting for his flight to us from Kuwait, he's arriving Dec 28th and would love his new home for New Year's.  Please apply so he can help you celebrate!  

 https://drive.google.com/open?id=1-Rk4SEoZzt9zIlih8kp_xVnUjuL7nf3y

Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly event posted here)
Twitter: zanisff 
Instagram: zanisfurryfriends





Please fill out an application http://zanisfurryfriends.org/applications.html and return via email to: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Sundays, and sometimes on Saturdays--please ask which dogs will be there ahead of time by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application by Friday so that we can be sure to be there.  Please come! And if you can't adopt, you can always donate via paypal to: dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org

Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, you can always donate!

description: Ernie and his brother Roscoe are six month-old Hound mixes who came to us from Alabama. They are friendly and ready for anything.
