Danai is the perfect girl. She is extremely smart, very sweet, plays well with other dogs and gets along well with all people. She will do best in a home without cats and very small dogs. Born in late 2015, Danai is spayed and up to date on vaccines. If you would like to adopt Danai, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Danai

description:
Beautiful, sweet, loving, well behaved, gorgeous Buffy.  She is a white, female, pointer/shepherd mix dog with brown spots on her ears and very pale brown spots on her fur.  She is a very unique looking dog.  Buffy is 2 and a half years old, 50 pounds, housebroken, up to date on her vaccinations, spayed, micro-chipped and heartworm negative.  She also has the most gorgeous white eye lashes. She knows how to sit and will do so when asked.  She is a little shy but loves giving and getting love. She is so sweet and loving. 

Buffy came from a kill shelter in Georgia where her time was almost up.  Since coming into rescue she has shown no aggression but only sweetness.  She is a high energy dog who loves to play with her toys, including balls and hard bones which she loves to bite on.  She takes her treats very gently.  We believe that she would be great with children, but care should be taken with  young children who could be knocked over by accident through play.  

Buffy is fine and friendly with other dogs and enjoys running around and playing with them here.  A secure fenced yard would be a must for this dog so she could run safely free.  We don't know how she is with cats.  Buffy is so loving and sweet and is so deserving of a loving home. Please give her a chance. 

If u think Buffy might be a good match for your family,  please send me an application to Save Us Dog Rescue at fries3@aol.com   Buffy is so deserving of a forever, loving home. If u would like to talk to me about her, please call Judi at (908) 510-8721.
name: Buffy

description:
Hi, Iâm Peanut! Iâm an adorable 9 month, 6 lb, sweet Yorkie / Chihuahua mix. Just like all puppies, Iâm still learning new things every day and need to find a home that can provide lots of love, attention and patience to help me with my training. Iâve been learning to be potty-trained, need a little extra practice with leash-walks and am fine with crates (for a short amount of time). Iâm good with dogs and kids, but due to my tiny size, I should be adopted into a home with older kids only. Itâs unknown how I am around cats I havenât been introduced to them yet.

Want to adopt adorable Peanut?  Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html

**Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.**

**PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.

Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.

All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.

Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!
name: Peanut

description:
Charlie Bear looks so sad in his photos - life hasn't been kind to him but he's hoping someone, somewhere will want to give him something he hasn't had before now: a loving, caring, safe family home filled with people he can love.

Poor Charlie was a stray dog who showed up at the home of a family who lived out in the country. They let him stay there for a few years, mostly living outside, but now they don't have the money or the desire to care for Charlie any longer.

Hearing this story, EHR felt that Charlie deserved better - he deserved a second chance at a REAL life. We want to find him a wonderful home where he can actually live INSIDE a house & know how it feels to be really loved and cared for. He will be arriving at EHR on January 24th & we hope he will have a family waiting to meet him.

Charlie is a 4-5 year old Airedale Terrier mix who weighs about 50 pounds. He is friendly with dogs and all people, young & old, but we don't know if he's been exposed to cats.

Please give Charlie the one thing he has never had - a loving "forever home" where he can be a part of the family, knowing love & giving love in return. Just fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org & be sure to ask for CHARLIE BEAR SCAS! He'll be arriving on January 24th to find his new family!
name: Charlie Bear SCAS

Kikiâs spayed, vaccinated, HW negative and microchipped. She had a mammory tumor removed which was benign. Apply at www.tprescue.org Currently fostered in Bensalem, PA

"Hi! Thank you for stopping by to read about me! My name is Opal and aren't my eyes just so stunning!! I recently joined the adoptable doggy crew at Providence Animal Center's lifesaving facility all the way from Georgia and I am hoping you will stop by soon to meet me in person! I am the package deal - I am up to date on my vaccines, I am spayed, and micro-chipped! My ideal home would be quiet & calm. My friends here at Providence feel that a home with children 5 years or older would be ideal for me. I would prefer to live in a home without kitty cats. Providence's Adoption Center has scenic and serene grounds where you can walk me around, a large selection of animals for all types of homes, and an expert match-making staff who perform thorough behavior evaluations. EVERY adoption includes a pet's spay/neuter surgery, a microchip and necessary vaccinations. The staff would love to match you with your new best friend forever - and hopefully that's me! Please stop by today during adoption hours - no appointment is necessary!  XO"

Providence Animal Center is funded solely by adoption fees and donations. Adoption fees vary per animal, please call the Adoption Center and reference this animal's ID number in order to obtain accurate fee information. 

To adopt this dog please call Providence Animal Center at 610-566-1370 during adoption hours. You may also email adoptions@providenceac.org. Can't adopt? Donate to help our homeless pets, www.providenceac.org/donate. Cant' donate? Apply to temporarily foster this pet in your home!

About fostering: You can still guarantee the safety and well-being of any of our dogs or puppies by temporarily fostering one or more right in your own home. Visit our foster page to learn about the program. Then, email your application along with any questions to foster@providenceac.org for immediate review.

description:
These gorgeous gals are Cookie and Angel, a pair of 5 year old Great Dane friends that are hoping for a fabulous home where they can live out their lives together with a good family and with each other. The girls had a home since they were little puppies. Sadly, they were given up due to their family circumstances changing and their owners moving to different places. The girls have never been away from their home so shelter life was tough on them at first, but they are putting the past behind them and are focused on winning the hearts of a wonderful new family. They are very outgoing, well-socialized ladies that just adore people of all ages. They grew up with kids and are just fine with them. They will, however, need a home with no other dogs. They adore each other and need to stay together forever. They are well behaved, well trained, and still have plenty of spunk and playfulness about them. You will love these two gentle giants the moment you meet them. File#28170/71 5/15/18

If you cannot adopt but would like to help care for the many available pets that we have awaiting their forever homes, text ResQ to 501501 to make a $10.00 donation, or click here to donate to our Res-Q Fund:https://www.ahscares.org/ContentPage/2736

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.
name: Cookie & Angel

description:
Barney is a courtesy post for his human. For serious inquiries, please contact the owner whose information is below. Thank you

Barney is a neutered, energetic, 8 year old JRT. He is very handsome and smart. He started having seizures when he was about 2 years old and takes 15 mg phenobarbital twice a day. He has been seizure free since December 2016 and his phenobarbital levels are therapeutic. He is up to date on his vaccinations and is heart-worm negative. 

He loves going for walks and is great on a leash, and loves to play catch in the yard. He has had obedience training and knows how to sit, stay, place, come, leave it (toy) and we still work on lay. He is also crate trained, and house broken.

He has shown signs of dominance and corrects by nipping us and house guests. He has nipped (no blood drawn) everyone except our toddler (fortunately) but we have had too many close calls even though we try our best to keep them separated . He has nipped at houseguests despite us telling them not to pet him, since he doesnât like it. He does not shows signs of food aggression and when he nips, he has not broken skin and no blood. 

He would do best in a home with a strong leader and without young children or cats. 

Yajaira Suarez 
813-390-5171
imyajaira@gmail.com
11824 Frost Aster Dr 
Riverview FL 33579

You see, I am a quiet kind of guy, not like so many doxies I meet.  I am a deep thinker ;)  They asked me what kind of home I would like and really I would like to be with someone like me.  A soulful person filled with love to share.  Is that you? Well if I sound like the kind of guy that would complete your life, get that application in today. I hope to meet you real soon so we can start our own forever adventures together!

All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. description:
Flyer is for illustration purposes looking for temporary foster homes. 

So You Want to Fosterâ¦FAQ

*Financial Responsibility â The Rescue provides food, vet care, medications and equipment.  You may need a collar, leash and ID tag.  The financial cost to you, of fostering and saving lives, is often nothing and always minimal.  We provide the material needs, you provide the home and heart. 

*Commitment â The required time is 10-14 days based on the age of the pup(s) and vaccination records.  A typical foster period is usually 2-3 weeks, occasionally a little shorter or longer, depending on the needs of your pup.

*Frequency â There is a scheduled arrival of dogs and pups in need every month, with occasional needs at other times that cannot be anticipated. Your commitment is only ever for each foster period you volunteer for. 
 
*Adopting your Foster â If you are hoping to adopt, please be sure to speak with the Rescue and fill in an adoption application.  Often we have approved families waiting for pups, so knowing prior to fostering is very important and helps with placement.  

*Support â The Rescue provides support from start to finish.  We provide a foster packet, an adoption folder with documents for review, an adoption checklist, and a group of volunteers and fosters that help in a variety of ways.
 
*Household Dynamic â We always do our best to ensure a good foster experience for you and your family.  We of course hope that your experience will be SO good that you will want to volunteer to foster again!  One of the ways we do that is to learn a little about your home, family and pets.  This helps us place dogs and puppies that will be a good foster match in your home while we all work together to find their forever homes!

*Distance and Travel â You would be required to come to the Marlton, NJ area to meet an arrival transport to pick up your pup, visit the vet if needed.  Picking up additional supplies, if it became necessary may also be required.  Occasionally, a pup may need to get to a clinic, event, or a volunteer for vaccines.  Most of our foster homes are within an hour or so of the Collingswood area. 

*Foster Assignments â We do our best to match foster pups with foster families.  Final assignments are made within a few days of arrival, but can change even as close as the day before arrival if a dog cannot come on transport.  Sometimes we ask you to take a specific dog that we would like to rescue. Once you commit to a dog, the Rescue commits.  We can only take as many dogs as we have foster homes for. 

*First Step â If you have come this far, and are ready to move forward, then itâs time to fill out the Foster Application and submit it for approval.  References will be called, a vet check will be done, and you will receive a call for a foster interview. 

Please email WoofLoveTara@gmail.com for an application

Thank you for considering becoming part of the Woof Love Rescue family!
name: Foster Homes Needed*all ages/breeds *

description:
Update- Simba is looking and feeling so much better and is a sweetheart in his foster home!  He is on several medications, a prescription allergy diet and medicated baths, and is looking for a home where he will get the continued special care he needs.  He gets along with other dogs and is such a friendly little guy!


And another neglect case...this guy isnât even a senior although his condition makes him look like one:(.  3 year old Lhasa Simba was surrendered today because his owners realized his medical bills were going to be more than they could afford.  He was kept mostly outside, is emaciated, has untreated dry eye and an old injury to one of his eyes, severe ear infections and skin infections that caused half his hair to fall out.  This didnât happen overnight... heâs been quietly suffering for a long time.  Despite his discomfort he has been nothing but sweet with the vet and staff treating him and already looks, smells and feels so much better after an emergency medicated bath and some treatment.  Little Simba has a long road ahead of him, will need eye drops for life and continued medicated baths and ear treatment for a while... 
please email njwoof@cs.com to foster Simba during his recovery or adopt once he is ready.

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Simba

description:
My name is Bleu, I'm a 3-5 year old Shepard mix with more love to give than I know what to do with. I love playing outside in my own yard and just lying on the couch with my favorite person. I am housebroken and crate trained. My foster mom says I have a lot of personality, and with the right home I am going to be someone's best friend. I would do best in a house as the only dog, with a fenced in yard. I am eager to please you and hope you will consider adopting me!

Bleu is an alpha dog who is not good around other dogs. She needs a home with NO other animals, a backyard with a secure, 6-foot fence to keep her safely contained, and loving, but watchful adopters to keep her from other dogs and all to themselves. Bleu is under 30 pounds and would make a great companion for the right home. Bleu is spayed and up to date on all vaccinations. Her adoption also includes free in home training to her new family.

If you are interested in adopting from Castle-of-Dreams Animal rescue, please complete an ADOPTION APPLICATION. http://www.castle-of-dreams.com/index.php/adoption

You are saving a life by providing a loving home to our homeless pets that were rescued from High Kill Shelters. Millions of dogs and puppies die in area shelters every year! We are in desperate need of foster homes in the central NJ area. If you are interested in Volunteering for fostering or assisting at adoption days, please complete a VOLUNTEER APPLICATION. http://www.castle-of-dreams.com/index.php/volunteer

A healthy pet is a happy pet! Protect your pet's health with Healthy Paws Pet Insurance and save up to 90% on your vet bills. Visit www.healthypawspetinsurance.com for your free quote (use code CODAR for a special discount) and learn how your protected pet helps save more homeless pets!
name: Bleu

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

If you love Great Pyreness, you will most certainly love Jasper, a young boy believed to be a purebred Great Pyrenees. Jasper wears the Pyrenees' signature white, long fluffy coat like a king, and he absolutely loves it when his humans take the time to brush out any dirt or knots from his beautiful fur. He also takes his job as a guardian seriously; he is confident and he radiates an air of importance. Jasper feels that barking is a nuisance that should be kept to a minimum, so he doesn't feel the need to vocalize often. He is totally ready for his furever home...he walks very well on leash, is very respectful of fencing, and will even come when called! We believe this young boy will do well in a relatively quiet home either as an only dog, or with a female companion of similar size. Are you ready to give this handsome GP a great home of his own?
name: Jasper (B) - Needs Foster!

description:
Meet Cooper!

This is our handsome boy, Cooper. Cooper is special because he has just 3 legs but that does not phase him one bit! He still moves around just fine and loves to play and go for walks just like any other dog would. Cooper is a 35 lb Catahoula at just two years old. He has a beautiful spotted coat and piercing eyes. Catahoulas are known to be highly intelligent and they do not shed very much so no need to leave the vacuum out. Cooper is sure to be your loyal friend and companion, as it is natural for Catahoulas to protect their families. This handsome boy is ready to find his forever home. Apply today!

If you think you are a perfect match for Cooper, please visit matchdogrescue.org and complete an application fully: https://www.petstablished.com/adoption_form/11415/generic

Cooper has been fully vetted, is up to date on all vaccinations and on preventatives for heartworm, flea and tick. We cannot guarantee breed information. You will find the price guidelines for adoption at matchdogrescue.org and can read about the whole adoption process and what MatchDog Rescue provides with each dog.
name: Cooper

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Watson is an adorable 5 month old mixed breed male who comes to rescue with his sister from the Carolinas. When he came into rescue he was dangerously anemic with a heavy parasite infestation (worms). He has been treated with our veterinary partner and now he is looking and feeling so much better! Watson is doing great in his foster home but would really love a home to call his very own! His sister had a DNA test done and the results came back 50% American Staffordshire, 12.5% Boxer, 12.5% Italian Greyhound, and the last 25% and unknown mix of sighthound and companion breeds...what a delightful mix! All these breeds combined sure did make for one amazingly handsome and adorable pup! Watson would thrive in a home with another playful dog. He looks to his canine companions for guidance and confidence. He can be timid around people initially but once he warms up he is a sweet little love bug. He is a professional snuggler and loves attention! Heâs great in the car, not a barker, is crate trained, and is working on walking on leash. Watson is good around kids, is up to date on vaccines, and will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home. If you are looking for a perfect puppy companion and would like to adopt Watson, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Watson

description:
Oscar is a very sweet 9 month old terrier mix who weighs about 18lbs. He is a little shy at first, especially around adult men, but warms up with tasty treats and a nice lap to sit on. He gets along great with other dogs, loves running around the yard with his four legged friends and appears to be housebroken. He is a very nice boy who deserves a loving home, no small children given his shy nature. 

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.

Louise is up to date on shots, housebroken and has been spayed. She would do best in a home with another dog and a family that has experience with dogs and that has the time to devote to her.

description:

Bernie is good with people, kids and other dogs.  He is an affectionate puppy who loves to give everyone puppy kisses and snuggle.  He will even snuggle under a blanket!  He is just so darn cute.  Bernie is good with people, kids and other dogs.  

Bernie is about 12-14 weeks old. This handsome pup has a shinny black coat with white on his chest and paws.  Bernie and his brothers, Benny & Brady were rescued from a high kill shelter in NC.  They are now in foster homes in NJ enjoying food, toys, treats and comfy beds.

Bernie is a very cool puppy! And he wants to come home with you!

SPECIAL NEEDS FOSTER HOME NEEDED FOR A VERY SPECIAL BOY! 

Last week a very special boy named Kubo came into our rescue. Kubo is a very sweet, gentle 2 year old boy whose owner sadly could not keep. We were informed that he occasionally will drop little "presents" unknowingly.  Upon arrival to his temporary foster home, it was discovered that Kubo has little bowel control and some bladder leakage. We are in need of a special foster who is willing to  care for him while we address his medical needs. He will need a full medical work up and a consult with an neurologist for starters. His temporary foster mom reports that Kubo is a sweet, qentle, mild mannered house guest.  We hope that his wonderful personality and good looks will have fosters lining up! Please complete our online application at www.nyabandonedangels.com. to foster this very special loving boy!

description:
Macy, affectionately called "Tiny Momma" by her foster family, is truly a dream.  This poor girl came to us after she was surrendered to a SC kill shelter with her mother, father, and brother because their family was moving.  At only 9 months old, this girl was already pregnant with her first (and last!) litter.  Macy's mother is a 48 lb. Black Lab mix, and her father is a 12 lb. Doxie/Terrier mix.  At her normal weight (not pregnant or full of milk!), she will probably weigh about 25 lbs. and has the long and low Doxie build.

Darling Macy has been an amazing mother to her puppies, but it is now time to begin the search for her loving forever home.  Macy wormed her way into the hearts of her entire foster family very quickly, with her wagging tail and wiggles of joy.  She wants nothing more than to sit and cuddle with her humans on the couch and will even fall asleep on them.  Macy gets along beautifully with the other dogs in her foster home and has a blast playing with them.  She can even hold her own very well with the bigger dogs in her foster home (and isn't afraid to put a rude dog in their place).

Cutest of all, however, is when she takes every single toy out of the toy box to bring to her bed.  Macy is very content to lay on her bed and play with her toys there, and she redirects very well to toys when she is chewing on something she's not supposed to.  With her being a mother so young, it is easy for people to forget that this tiny momma is still a puppy herself; she is working on not jumping on people when she's excited or wants attention.  She adores her family (human and canine) and is the most delicious snuggler.  Macy brings so much joy to everyone she is with, whether she's giving you love or you're watching her toss a squeaky toy around with pure joy - she is amazing! 

Macy is house trained, knows "sit", comes when called, walks well on a leash, and sleeps through the night perfectly. 


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Macy

name: Sophy

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.**Be sure to watch Cori's videos below so you can see what she's really like**
Cori's Meet Your Match Designation is: Constant Companion Looking for an emotionally secure, mutually satisfying, low maintenance relationship? I am all you need. Let me sit at your feet, walk by your side, and Iâll be your devoted companion forever.
Please Note: Usually LnF requires experienced dog parents but occasionally we have a dog who is so well-mannered & easily trained that we could adopt Cori to someone who has never had a dog before an adult. You would be required to agree to attend dog training classes just to learn the basics.
Corrine (Cori) is about 2 Â½ years old and a purebred Basset hound but she is on petite for Basset since she is only 44 lbs & a true low rider! I know her photos show her looking for serious but watch her video's below so you can see how much fun she really is!
She is extremely sweet, gentle & very laid back & has a pure delight personality wise. Her coat is a lovely shade of red, extremely shiny & she is so soft when you pet her and those VELVET ears are so wonderful to touch! Hounds always have ears that feel like velvet.
She just loves kids & we hope that she is adopted in a family with kids or grandkids & maybe another dog around her age to play with. She does LOVE to play.
As a foster Mom, I'm not 'supposed' to have favorites but Cori does have my heart. She is SO loving, SO sweet, SO funny, has tons of personality & that tail of hers is constantly thumping with joy & she has a wiggle butt that just doesnât stop.
She is such a good girl that I let her sleep in bed with me. I don't do that for all the dogs, but she such a snuggle bunny, she just wants to inhale you. Once she settles in she stays put & thankfully she doesn't snore! She is what we call a true 'Constant Companion' as she just wants to be close to anyone who will pay attention to her.
Bassett have short legs, so you just canât stop smiling when you see her waddle when playing outside with her fostering siblings. When she comes in from outside she does another cute thing that I havenât seen before â she runs in & does a sort of baseball slide on the carpet!
Her favorite thing to do is find her way to the sofa, chair & what she loves best is being allowed to get in bed & snuggling. For her sake, I would only want to adopt her to a family that like me, allows dogs on the sofa & in bed â of course only as long as they are not wet or muddy.
Donât think by looking at her photos that sheâs sad â thatâs just how they look. There are several cute videos below so you can how pretty she is!
Cori had a pretty horrible start in love with abuse & neglect when she was in KY but she has come a long way to being the cutest adorable little girl. It took over a month for me to gain her trust & then I got to see the dog she was meant to be & she shows me the joy in her spirit. Yet, when meeting new people at first she remembers that her previous owner beat her so she still gets nervous, but she warms up very quickly as long I assure her everything is just fine. It was so sad being her foster mom because she used to just fall to the ground with fear --- but now she is so comfortable living in a home with a family that she sleeps on her back which proves she trusts me and now she can trust others. She is not a fear-biter, so you donât have to worry about that. Still, sheâll need an experienced family that will understand she has been through a lot in her short life.
Cori had been adopted but she had an 8-year old Beagle sister who did not want to play with her or even be on the same sofa with her & growled at her every day for about 6 months. One day they got into a fight & had to be separated. Iâve lived with over 550 dogs in my home, so I know them very well. I think what happened is just like a human, Cori got fed up with her sister growling all the time. Obviously, she had to be returned to me. She gets along with everyone here in my home, you can see that in the videos below. My feeling is that she can be adopted with another dog, but a dog who is submissive and around her age so it will want to play with her.
Cori did test positive for a tick-borne disease Ehrlichiosis which is like Lyme. She has never had any symptoms, just tested positive & is not sick. My Vet had her complete a 6-week course of antibiotics just to be cautious that she can remain symptom-free.
If she sounds like the kind of girl you would love to bring into your home, be sure to read our adoption requirements which are listed on the left side of our website. If you can meet or exceed you can apply online.
We accept or credit cards & PayPal for the adoption fee
~ All LnF pups/dogs have been temperament tested & live in a foster home. ~ All pups and dogs have been housebroken (puppies are paper trained) & crate-trained and have had basic training ~ All pups/dogs have been Microchipped ~ Tested for Heartworm, Ehrlichia & Lyme ~ Each dog is on Heartworm Medication & Flea/Tick year-round while in our care ~ Up to date with Rabies ~ Distemper, Parvo & Leptospirosis vaccines ~ de-wormed.

Our adoption fee includes (30) days of FREE pet insurance with an option to purchase -- but it's your choice. We strive to provide the BEST medical care available so that YOU are assured all our pups/dogs are healthy, up-to-date on all necessary shots, spayed or neutered by our rescue.

Adoption Requirements: *A minimum physical 4-foot high fence or is higher is always mandatory and must be installed. Some dogs may need a 6-foot wood or vinyl fence & if so it's noted on their profile. We will not consider any applications that does not have an installed fence. We do NOT accept any type of electric fence, no exceptions.

Click here to watch a video of Cori.
name: Cori

description:
Please note, this is a courtesy listing for our sister rescue group, the SPCA of Westchester. This dog is located at the SPCA at 590 North State Road in Briarcliff Manor, NY 10510 (www.spca914.org). Please apply with the SPCA if you are interested in this dog, please read the details below!

Cookie is truly a smart cookie -- she's aced her B.A. and M.A. level tests in our Canine Life and Social Skills training program; now she's working toward her PhD! Being a C.L.A.S.S. graduate means that Cookie gets a neat ribbon and YOU get a really well-trained pup!

Cookie is a 7 year old girl who's a big, happy goofball. Cookie loves her people friends -- loyalty is the name of the game with this girl, and she will make a terrific companion. Cookie's ideal home would be with a person or people who will continue her training (she enjoys challenging that big brain of hers), and where she'll get equal parts outdoor fun time and indoor cuddle time. Cookie loves being active and playful (she's on the SPCA Trail team and would make a terrific jogging partner), but she's also great at chilling out and relaxing by herself. She frequently has sleepovers in our trainer's office and is always a model tenant. Cookie is such an easygoing, good sport that she's our go-to gal for dressing up in costume, as you can see from some of her photos! Cookie is selective with her dog friends and would most likely like to live as an only dog (she also does not want to live with cats). 

Cookie is eligible for Critter Credit -- $250 to spend on sessions with a recommended trainer or for a gift card to Petco or Petsmart! Plus, her adoption fee has already been paid by a volunteer who adores her AND she will be going home with a massive goodie bag that includes a bed, her favorite treats and toys, a harness and collar, and a few coats and sweaters to get her wardrobe started!

When to Come:
Our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Meet Cookie - located at SPCA

description:
Roxy is a sweet 7 year old black natural eared female who was surrendered by her family because they did not have time to care for her any longer.  She came in to MAGDRL extremely emaciated and thin and with a terrible infection of her paws and pads.  She has been on steroids and antibiotics and her foster home is working hard with the vet to get her feet healed and healthy again.  We believe her foot infection may be allergy related so she was started on a grain free diet with salmon and sweet potato.  We may have to have her tested for allergies if we canât get her feet to heal.  She is slowly putting on some weight, she was only 87 lbs when she came in. She is in a foster home with a female lab mix and they get along well.  She is slowly coming out of her shell and getting more playful.  Roxy is pretty mellow and very affectionate.  She walks well on a leash.  Until we can get a handle on her paw issue, she will be on medical hold.  Roxy came to MAGDRL in January of 2018.

For more info on this dog and our adoption policies, visit NJ MAGDRLÂ at http://www.magdrl-nj.com/our-dogs/ .Â 

MAGDRL adopts Great Danes in NY, NJ, PA, MD, DE, DC, VA & WV.

Like us on Facebook.com/BTHAR2013
name: Portia

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sweet Lacey is a 1.5-2 year old Poodle who comes into rescue from Texas. She is a beautiful girl and is ready to start the new amazing life we promised her! Lacey is a good girl. She is sweet and friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. We canât wait to see this fluffy angel loved and adored In a home of her Very own. If you would like to adopt Lacey, please fill out an application for her here: http,://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Lacey

description:
Maia is a year old German Shepherd/ Siberian Husky/Wolf mix. Maia and her sister Mira had little socialization or training before coming to us, resulting in a shy, more aloof temperament with unfamiliar people. With people she knows, Maia is very playful, affectionate, and can be mischievous. She needs a lot of training to be indoors as, like most young dogs, she just wants to grab, chew, and investigate everything she comes across. She has limited experience indoors and would need a committed, patient owner willing to guide her through potty training. 

Maia does very well with other dogs of the opposite gender, often following their lead and would do best with an outgoing male companion dog to help socialize her to new people. She enjoys going for hikes and walks on the secluded trails on our property and does well on leash. She has not had much experience in the car and does get car sick. 

Maia requires at least a 6 foot wooden privacy or chain link fence. Please no small pets such as cats. She is part wolf and will only be adopted to areas where wolfdogs are legal to own. 

If you're interested in Maia, please read our adoption requirements first at; https://howlingwoods.org/wolf-dog-adoptions/

then submit an application at;
 https://howlingwoods.org/adoption-application/

or contact us by calling (732) 534-5745

Do not inquire about or apply for Maia if you live in any the following States: Delaware, Maryland, Pennsylvania, New York, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Maine.  Wolfdogs are illegal to possess in these States.
name: Maia

description: A volunteer brought MArcello to us from a high kill shelter where he was going to be put down. He is very sweet and loving and could be your best buddy!
name: Marcello

description:
Subject: Adorable Cocker Spaniel (mix?)
Age: 1/1.5
Name: CHECKERS
Sex: Male

APPLICATION:
http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html
name: Checkers

description:
Zayne is just over a year old weighing in at about 45 pounds. His coat is a bit shorter than a typical aussie, but he is still so soft. Zayne aims to please his humans and loves, loves, LOVES to cuddle and be pet. He is very responsive to commands and catches on quickly. He is a very powerful runner and enjoys fetching the ball for his human, inside and outside.

Zayne's behavior towards other dogs is hit-or-miss; He co-exists alongside his foster brother but doesn't show a lot of interest in playing with him. He growls at other dogs and has gone after them in a non-playing manner. He cannot be trusted to run free in dog parks because of his unpredictable behavior. Zayne has shown signs of improvement though so he may get to the point where he can be nice around other dogs consistently.

Zayne does great on the leash and rides nicely in the car. We are not sure how he does with cats, but he does like to chase squirrels now and then. Zayne loves to tear dog toys to shreds so he will need some heavy duty toys and bones. He is crate trained, although he may not enjoy being in the crate.

He can have a high energy level, but also settles down quickly and is happy to sit with you on the sofa. He will climb on to your lap, thinking he is a tiny lap dog.

Zayne is fostered in Philadelphia PA.
name: Zayne

description:
Zip-a-dee-doo-dah should be Lucie's theme song! This sweet little girl is happy as can be and has a major zest for life that is admirable.  She's got a big dog personality in a perfect mini pint size body. Based on Lucie's behavior, we believe someone was not kind to her in her life before she came to us. She'll cower at the quick movement of an arm and can be a bit wary of new people however her true, kind nature shines through after she gains a bit of trust. 

Super sweet Lucie has made some great doggie friends here, Finney and Snoop are two of her best buds. She does have a "tough cookie" kind of demeanor when it comes to meeting other dogs so we try to place her with dogs that are super easy and the go with the flow types!

Stay tuned for updates on Lucie and please visit our website for more info and photos of Lucie girl!!

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Lucie

description: Madison is a 4 year old, energetic silly girl who is always the life of the party. She was taken out of a Connecticut shelter where she was going to be put to sleep because she was there too long. She loves human attention, wants to lay in your lap and soak in all the love. Maddy would do best as an only pet. We would suggest her going to a home with older children since she is so full of spunk. Madison is currently at our facility in Orange County, NY. Please email rottnrescues@aol.com for an application and a chance to meet our Madison.
name: Madison

description: Meet the handsome Bosco!  This sweet boy is a 2.5 year old male German Shepherd.  He could be a full breed but without knowing his parents its hard to say.  He is super friendly and loves just about everyone and everything he meets.  He has a German Shepherd Temperament so we are looking for an adopter who has experience with German Shepherds and understands the breed.  He loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times. He still has lots of energy and he loves to romp and play. He never turns down a good belly rub. .  Even though he is considered an adult, he still has lots of puppy energy!  He loves to play ball and to run around the yard.  He would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle! He is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month. He can't wait to find his forever home!
name: Bosco

description:
Fernando is neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, and ready to become part of your family. He loves people, is good with other dogs, and is an overall happy boy. His age is estimated at 5 years.

He is well-bonded, and was surrendered with his housemate, Tanya. We would LOVE to keep this family together. Fernando is a companion dag and would do best in a home with a family who would be home more often.

If you're interested in adopting Fernando, please first read about our adoption process under the *ADOPT* tab at www.happypawsrescue.org. Then, complete an adoption application found under the same tab and email it to happypawsrescue@gmail.com. Fernando will be at our adoption day events on SUNDAYS from 12-3 p.m. at the Piscataway, NJ Petco. ***PLEASE NOTE: We will not be at Petco for the remainder of 2018, but will return in January. Happy holidays!*** Thank you for your interest in adopting!

***Let us introduce you toâ¦ the American Shelter Dog! When we look at dogs of unknown parentage, such as this beautiful pup, the best we can do is guess at their breed, and it turns out that even dog experts are usually wrong when doing so. Itâs been shown that nearly 90 percent of shelter dogs visually identified as a particular breed/mix are mislabeled. Please understand that it is impossible to reliably identify the breed(s) or predict the behavior of dogs solely on the basis of their appearance. Though we may not know their blend, we do know that the love of a rescued dog is without boundaries and touches all those in its reach, often transforming the rescuee into the rescuer!***

Thinking about adopting me? Hereâs how:
1. Fill out an application found at www.happypawsrescue.org under the *ADOPT* tab. 
2. Email it to happypawsrescue@gmail.com.
3. Please allow a few days for us to review and respond to your application. 
4. Approved applicants will be invited to come meet me at adoption day.
5. We generally adopt to families within a 1-hour radius of our home base in Piscataway, NJ but may consider farther distances in the tri-state region if volunteers are available. If you live beyond our geographical boundaries, we hope you will contact rescue organizations closer to your home.
6. If both you and the rescue agree that I'm a good fit for your home, you will fill out an adoption contract. The adoption fee is $300 for dogs. 
7. We have lots of fun together!
name: Fernando

description:
To adopt or to receive more information, please fill out an application on our website at www.libertyhumane.org/dogs. Please do NOT simply hit the Ask About button. 

Once you have filled out our application, we will be happy to contact you.
name: Luna Leroux

description: Kobe is one in a litter of  five month-old Labrador Retriever/Hound mix pups rescued from Puerto Rico. If interested in adopting, you must attend one of our Adoption Events, listed on our Home Page and Facebook, in order to fill out an application.  Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Kobe

description:
Taco is a 7 year old beagle/hound mix who is a curious guy that likes to explore his surroundings. Taco loves the outdoors and would enjoy hiking and long walks on the beach. He is a smart guy who is very trainable. Taco likes some dogs, but may not be the best with cats. To learn more about Taco, please email shelter@spca914.org.  

When to Come:
Our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Taco - In Foster

description:
Please share ladykiller ACHARNI ???????

Look at our boy ...he bloomed complete open. With his tail between his legs, shaking all over his body he came from transport . His head down .

He understands that he is safe now and is a very happy fellow .

Acharni was saved from a very high kill shelter in Texas .

This pretty boy is only 2 years old and dog friendly . He does not like cats.

He is very sweet and playful.

We would love to see coming him to a family who wants to take him in as a family member . Where he will be loved and has his daily exercise .

Acharni is located in Middle Island NY

To become his new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application . You can find it on www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we sent you one

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

Lily is a stunning pit mix, born in late 2015 and now weighing 48 pounds. She had a tough start in life overcoming severe malnutrition and a horrific case of Demodex mange. Lily has waited patiently for a home to call her own. She is shy with strangers and needs a quiet, calm home with no children and few visitors, in a rural setting with a big yard and other dogs to play with. Her foster mom says this about her: "

While Lily needs some time to get u
sed to strangers, once she trusts that you will not hurt her, she becomes the most lovable and loyal dog ever. She bonds closely to those she trusts and shows much affection through endless kisses and her happy wagging tail. She is great with other animals including dogs, horses, cats and chickens. She enjoys playing with her toys, going for walks and loves car rides. Lily is spayed, up to date on vaccinations and fully house trained." To adopt this beautiful girl, visit https://rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Lily

if You have lots of time to give a puppy, Cowboy is the one for you!  He will make the ultimate family dog and best friend!

Contact Carol at chocolatesss720@gmail.com for an application today!

description: Mimi is a one and a half year old Chiweenie. She is shy when first meeting her, but once she knows you she's a little lovebug. Mimi has a med activity level and loves to play with dogs that are on the same level as her. She loves her toys, nylabones and snuggling under blankets . She enjoys playing in the yard as well. She does NOT like to be crated and therefore shouldn't be. Mimi recently had surgery on her rear leg, due to an old injury she came into our rescue with. So she will need to be on daily glucosamine, as recommended by her vet. Mimi perfect home would be someone that is home more often than not. Another friendly dog and fenced yard. She is fantastic with cats as well. No children under the age of 10 as Mimi can be a bit mouthy when playing. She is UTD on shots, spayed, chipped, wee wee pad/housetrained . If interested in Mimi please fill out an application @ furfriendsinneed.com

description: Hey guys!  Did someone say TREATS?!  Just kidding (but I do love DOGGIE TREATS!)  Allow me to introduce myself.  My name is Paul and I have a REAL zest for life!!!  I have been told that am a total JOY to be around and that I am great with all dogs both large and small and also great with kids!  In fact, would you believe that I a am a bit of a stud these days since I am currently living with six (count 'em .. six!) female dogs and we get along fabulously!!!!  Iâm a bit on the smaller size for my breed and weigh in at about 45 pounds and, like I said before, I won't say no to treats so I might gain a few pounds once we start living together (don't judge me, it happens to a lot of us !).  I am only about one year old and I am a truly happy and playful boy who would definitely need a large, fenced in yard allowing me to have lots of fun at playtime!  C'mon down and let's get together .. I seriously can't wait to meet you!!!
name: Paul

description:
This dog is part of our shelter outreach program where we try to help out overcrowded shelters.
Harley is from a NJ shelter where she had not had one application on her in the months she has been there. Her story is a sad one and we are hoping a change in scenery will find her a new home. Shes a super sweet loving senior! Harley is 9 years old, 55 lbs. How truly sad to surrender a lifelong family pet...with no legitimate reason. She doesn't like other dogs so it has been more difficult find her.a home. She is a great dog with adults and kids over 10. Harley has plenty of spunk. She is strong girl and will pull on the leash but we are working on that. Please consider adopting sweet Harley, she deserves a family.

Pets for Patriots Eligible! https://petsforpatriots.org/*Per JSAC policy, puppies and kittens under 6 months will not be adopted to families with children under the age of 6 years.
name: Harley

description:
Please read the listing completely prior to filling out an application for Bella. Please note, we receive hundreds of applications each week for our rescues, and do our best to respond to everyone, but it is not always possible. The best way to be considered for adoption is to fill out an application, we do not contact references until after speaking with you.

To fill out an application, please visit:

www.popuppaws.com/pages/application

*Please also note, in instances when a dog has received an overwhelming amount of applications, we will share with applications similar dogs in foster care that are becoming available soon.

Details:
Age (estimated)- 1 year old
Sex: Female
Breed (estimated)- Yorkshire terrier mix
Color/Markings: Gold/Silver
Current weight (approximate): 12 pounds
Health summary: No known issues. Spayed. Up-to-date on distemper and rabies vaccinations. 
Adoption fee: $595 - Please note, animals that receive larger volume of applications have a higher adoption fee to offset the enormous cost of the many medically urgent animals in our care.

Description: Meet Bella. Bella has had a tough start - we believe she was used for breeding and surrendered when she didnât live up her ownerâs expectations. She was surrendered while in the throws of a miscarriage, after just recently having a litter, and has now been spayed. Bella can be shy when first meeting people, but once sheâs settled in, sheâs a very confident young dog. She uses both wee pads and goes to the bathroom outdoors, although still has occasional accidents, and will need continued housebreaking. She loves other dogs, and plays very well with them. Sheâs gentle around cats, and although she can get overexcited and chase them at times, she has never shown aggression and backs off once she realizes her playing is unwelcome. She is extremely social, and loves to stay by your side. She does well with children, and is very gentle and non-destructive. She is still very young at just a year old and loves to play. We donât know what her mix is. She appears the be mostly yorkie and does not shed, but we cannot know with certainty whether or not she is truly hypoallergenic. She is a sweetheart ready and deserving of her perfect forever home.
name: Bella

description:
Jasper's boarding mom tells us: 
Generally, I go for the tall, dark and handsomes, but there's something about this dreamboat that makes me want to cross over to the other side! 
Jasper is totally my kind of guy. Confident, strong, affectionate, playful, goofy, makes me laugh... what's not to love here? He narrowly escaped being euthanized at the Manhattan shelter in June, then came down with serious pneumonia and once again was in a fight for his life. But like a champ, this babe pulled through and he is ready to find the yin to his yang. 
While Jasper is all of those wonderful things I mentioned above, he is not for a first time dog owner. He needs a capable leader who will be present and continue to provide him with mental and physical stimulation. He's no pushover and though I do play with him, he knows I am in charge at all times. He's iffy with other dogs, some we pass and he play bows, others he gets stiff so he would either need to be an only dog or interactions must take place prior to him leaving. Cats unknown and teens over 15 would be best. 
Jasper came a long way from his stay at the shelter. He is urgently in need of a foster or adopter. Remember dogs who once were in danger are still sometimes in need. Jasper is about 4 years old, UTD and neutered. 
He is located in NYC, so ask to meet him today! Go to Nycsecondchancerescue.org #jasper #friendly #pitbulls #pitlife #pittielove #rescue #areyouready #getready #cute #loveme #lovers #secondchance #rescuedismyfavoritebreed
name: Jasper (Acc)

description: Handsome as ever, Viper is quite the good looking superstar. We simply can't take our eyes off this striking young man. At 2 years old, Viper was given to us because his family was moving and couldn't take him along. This charming fella is an active kangaroo. By kangaroo, we mean he definitely has some spring to his step and can jump pretty high. Fenced in yards don't mean a thing for this Pogo-stick, and he will need to be monitored in a yard. Although he is ready to explore the world, we don't want him to get loose and do it on his own. We're looking for an active household that can give him plenty of physical stimulation and wear him out by the end of the day. He has plenty of surprises in store and can't wait to share them with one lucky family.
name: Viper

description: Creed is still waiting for his forever home! He is a 3 year old boxer/lab mix. Creed is microchipped, up to date on vaccines and neutered . Creed is an 85 pound hunk of love. He is as goofy as they come, he loves loves loves to give kisses and snuggle. Creed will make an awesome companion dog, he is large but gentle as can be.
name: Creed

description:
Meet Butterscotch! This 12-pound female is around 5 years old, and just landed in NYC from LA. She is very sweet and cuddly but also super friendly and energetic. Butterscotch was so excited for her first walk in the city and was happily checking out everything, especially the new smells. She can apparently jump pretty high, too! Butterscotch runs and leaps into people's arms - pretty impressive trick! This overall happy girl walks great on a leash and loves sitting in her foster mom's lap. She is good with her foster fur-sibling and is a total lovebug! Butterscotch is micro-chipped, vaccinated, and spayed. 

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application on the CONTACT US page. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:

Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.com

Fosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.com

PLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked "Adoption Pending" have an approved adoption application on file and are awaiting final approval. Please check back in a few days to see if they are still available!

We understand you may have questions but the fastest way to get answers is to fill out the application and the foster parent can answer any questions you may have!

Waggytail Rescue CANNOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you.
name: Butterscotch!

description: Buddy, is a 9 year old  male 20 lb yorkie/ terrier mix.  He is a lovable dog, and loves to curl up on your lap.  Buddy does better with one owner, and he is not good with children, dogs or cats.  Buddy is paper trained, but still loves to go for walks.  We prefer him to be placed with a person who works at home or retired.  When emailing or calling, please give us a brief history of your experience with animals and when you last had an animal.  Email petsofstfrancis@aol.com or call 718-822-0043
name: BUDDY

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
3 years old.

Thank you for your interest in adopting a rescued Basset Hound! We ask all potential adopters to complete our application and approval process first so we can discuss the dogs that fit your home. We usually have 25 - 35 dogs available and the ages range from less than year old to ten plus years old. Once we receive your application you'll be contacted by an adoption representative to complete the application process. We look forward to speaking with you about our wonderful hounds waiting for forever homes!!!
name: TORIE - ADOPTION PENDING!

description:
Our rescue has 6 Pekingese Mixes who are 8 weeks old. There utd with shots, dewormed and will be fixed when old enough. We will be working daily with them on housetraining, cratetraining and leashtraining. Each would enjoy a fenced in yard at their new home. They do well with other dogs, cats and gentle kids. They will make great family dogs and are typically easy to train. If interested in adopting a puppy please email us at all4thedogsrescue@verizon.net

Adoption Fee is $595. Including Neuter and a full puppy vaccine package.
name: Pluto

description:
Atlas was adopted from us when he was 2 months old. He was just returned because they don't have the time to train him. Atlas seems like a very gentle dog who is now scared because he found himself back at a shelter. His adopters tell us that he is housetrained & crate trained plus he walks well on a leash. He is a goofy boy who loves to play with toys & a game of "Fetch" if you're up for it. He is smart & knows some basic commands including "Sit" & he'll even be your co-pilot if you're going for a ride in the car.

Atlas is almost a year old, so he is fully grown at 67 pounds. Because he is still basically a puppy, he's got a lot of energy so he would enjoy a new home with people who are active & who have the time to teach him the ropes! Can you be the one to show this big guy some manners and give him some guidance?
name: Atlas Maverick SCAS

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

Jaxx is short for Jack-in-the-box. This cute, tiny rat terrier can leap tall buildings - or agility equipment -  at a single bound, and is the soccer star of the big play yard.  He prances when he walks and loves to be out and about exploring by your side.  Though he is not a fan of other dogs or young children, he will be your best energy booster if you like to get up and out with an exercise buddy. To learn more email shelter@spca914.org. 

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $275-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Jaxx - Foster me for the Holidays!

description:
Mikey is a 2 year old 45lb ebony angel that just could not get a break in life. Before he was taken to the shelter, Mikey was found in deplorable conditions. In the shelter, he was heartbroken. Yet, he did not let his melancholy detract from his beautiful heart. Mikey won over the shelter staff and they rallied to his side. When we learned about him, we could not deny how special he is and decided to pull him. Now, Mikey is finishing a training program and awaits his foster or forever home. He is ready to show off his perfect report card and excellent skills! Once abused and filled with heart ache, Mikey now shines. His spirit was never ruined to deterred. He always believed in humans. 

Mikey is house broken, crate trained, and absolutely ADORES children! Gentle, sweet, and affectionate he would make the most loyal and perfect companion for any human- big or small! He also gets along well with other dogs. Given his past, we ask that if he has a canine sibling, that they be as loving and kind as he is! 

Mikey desperately needs a home. Please foster or adopt him today! 

If interested in fostering or adopting or fostering Mikey, please email us at twentypawsrescue@gmail.com or info@twentypawsrescue.com. **Due to a gmail glitch, we lose some emails. So if you do not hear back from us please follow up! We respond to all emails!**

description: Rascal was abandoned and tied up under the blazing sun. Local cops found him in a parking lot, looking defeated. He was so thin and frail that an officer lifted what should be a strong, majestic pit bull with one arm like a feather. They took him to The Veterinary Emergency and Referral Group, where he awaited transport to a high kill shelter. The employees at VERG knew his fate at the kill shelter, so they called us up and asked us to take the case. Remembering other pit bulls that we took care of like Norman and Lola, we knew that Rascal could have the same happy ending and we would be betraying our duty as rescuers to turn him away from that chance. We welcomed him to the AMA family and rushed him to our vets at Noah's Ark Veterinary Practice to see what was going on with this poor dog of just skin and bones. Based off of the medical exam we were able to tell that he had been through a lot of trauma, especially for his young age. He developed deep pressure wounds from being pressed against the walls of a small space for a long time and was also covered in dozens of other wounds that resembled bite marks. Weeks in medical boarding Rascal's playfulness started to come out. It was time for him to leave the clinic and go to a foster home. We were so excited to watch Rascal thrive and eventually getting adopted. But unfortunately, that wasn't his happily ever after. A year later his adopters returned him to us as they were no longer able to care for him. It was a very sad news, but we didn't give up Rascal then and we are not about to give up on him now. Rascal is healthy and happy with us,  and we know that his true forever family will show up any day now!
name: Rascal

He's a smart boy and has good manners and will sit pretty for food. He also understands what "no" means and tries his best to be the bestest boy. He can't wait to meet his forever family! She was rescued from a commercial breeder and will need a home with another dog that she can learn from and humans who have lots of love and patience to give. She is still fearful and will cower when you put on her leash for a walk, but once it is on she is ready and willing to go. Jolie sleeps on the big bed and is getting better with being picked up to be placed on it. She loves to be in the same room as you, but she is not a snuggle bug yet. Jolie likes to stay close to her foster siblings, but has shown no interest in playing with either them or toys yet. She is quick to learn and will sit up for her treat. She is almost fully house trained. Please visit our main site for more information or to apply to adopt.

description:
10/1/18

Hi everyone! Iâm Lyrical (rhymes with Miracle) at least that is what the Folks at Wags call me. I am about a year and a half old, a light weight 40 pounds (I know, I look bigger than that), but if you meet me you will say oh your a little girl. I am on the smaller side for my breed and one of the leaner ones. Some of the things that are typical of my breed- I am super sweet! I just want to meet every human and every dog I see. Also I like to be with my foster mom, everywhere she goes, I like to keep her company. Also I am a licker, I am not sure what exactly that means, but from what I understand some people will love it, and some people eh,not so much. Also I am a super duper snuggler, if snuggling were an Olympic sport, I would definitely get a medal in snuggling. I try to snuggle the resident dog, but he is very independent (I do not know what that means) I just know that when I try to lay by him he gets up and walks away. I know I sound like a really great dog, right? I am a young girl though so there are some things I am working on, one is I still have accidents in the house :( I donât mean to, by the time foster mom realizes I am giving her my signals she has to put a leash on me and take me out, she thinks if I had a fenced yard I would do much better with that. Also I am still a little mouthy, we are working on that and I am so much better than I was even a week ago! I am also getting a lot better on a leash. So, yea, I am not perfect, but if you think I am perfect for you, contact the folks at Wags Rescue. I look forward to meeting you!

9/10/18

Introducing Lyrical!  This one and a half year old, forty pound, pit mix found her name because she was in need of a miracle when we found her - and Lyrical rhymed with miracle!  She has will need an FHO surgery to repair her hip - possible damage from trauma or being hit by a car.  Many dogs are in need of this surgery and recover well.  We have no reason to believe she will not recover perfectly as well.  Since coming into rescue, she has been working on her house and leash training and has done well with both!  She loves to nap on the couch with her two or four legged friends.  She still has some puppy habits that sheâs working on breaking such as nibbling on toes and hands, but sheâs learning that she canât do that.  She would love to be in a home with older kids as she loves to play.  She rides well in the car and is learning house rules quickly.  She met a kitten recently and we learned that she is a little too interested in cats, so it would be best if she could find a feline free home!  Her foster mom says that Lyrical is a perfect name for her as she is a talker and will tell you what she thinks if sheâs not getting lots of attention and love!  She also enjoys watching TV and her favorite person is LL Cool J!  Every time he is on TV she sits right up by it and watches the TV.   Lyrical is fully vetted and has been spayed.  She is now in search of her forever family and would like to meet you!  If you are interested in adopting Lyrical, please fill out an application on our website at www.wagsrescue.com!  


Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

description:

Captain is a calm sweetheart who loves to cuddle, especially when he thinks you donât realize. He is very low maintenance and easy to take care of but can be wary of other dogs who arenât his sister and can be overwhelmed by small children. He is the sweetest boy who will love you and watch out for you forever. Raleigh is an energizer bunny who never stops moving. She loves to play and spend time with you, and will always try to smother you with kisses. She loves everyone and everything. description:
Max is a big mush of a dog that enjoys the attention of people and smiles from ear to ear when you talk to him. He loves going for a ride in the car and makes the best co-pilot, ever!! Max the Mush has been at the kennel for almost 7 years! His favorite volunteer friend cannot understand why. It is truly heartbreaking. Max is soo loving and loyal!! He is great in the car, loves walks, his toys, and is food motivated!

Max is approximately 9 years old, but he acts much younger. The high stress environment of the kennel is no place for him to live out the rest of his life. He has not had very many opportunities to interact with other dogs so he would likely do best in a single pet house unless we could find the perfect match of a doggie sibling. Max has met a volunteer's dog and did well with her; even showing signs of wanting to play.

The ideal home for Max would be quiet without many visitors. He would do best with older, respectful kids as he gives big, rough kisses that may startle or knock over a younger child. Max would also need someone who is willing to take it slowly with him and willing to meet him several times before bringing him home. He is such a gem that continuously gets overlooked. He has so much love to give, we promise you will not need anything else if you have Max. He always has the biggest smile on his face, too. Please consider Max!

If you're willing to take a chance on Max, you will be rewarded with a loyal & trusting friend. Please consider giving Max a home to live out his golden years!

Max won the heart of a family and they have very kindly sponsored Maxs adoption fee!!!
name: Max aka Maximus

description:
Sundae is not with the SPCA of Westchester. Please contact "For the Love of Dogs" Rescue for more information. www.fortheloveofdogsrescue.org

Sugary deliciously sweet like an ice cream sundae.. Sundae got her name because of how friendly and snuggly she is! Also because her beautiful coat looks like melted chocolate and vanilla ice cream swirled together. Sundaeâs unique coloring is caused from a cosmetic skin disorder called vitiligo. Vitiligo only affects the pigment of the skin and hair.. causing it to progressively turn white over time. Check out her photos and pigment of her nose... How cool!! She will have ever morphing markings. Even cooler.. Michael Jackson had the condition and so does our dog trainer Jamie!

Sundae seems like a real adventurer and to love the outdoors.. she would make a fabulous jogging or hiking partner! In turn, we have also come to observe that Sundae is a real sucker for a comfy couch! Her crate is located right next to the couch in the living room of the House area. Every time she passes that couch she pops right up and slides her head into the crease while she waits for some good ole belly rubs! Sundae is a real people dog. She LOVES the company of humans and thrives on affection. What a doll Sundae is!! 

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Z Courtesy Post-Sundae
