description:
Tabitha is a two and a half old and such a sweetheart. Tabitha loves the car and likes to play fetch. She is house and leash trained. Tabitha has a high prey drive and would do best as the only pet in a home. She is very strong and should only go home to an experienced handler.

Please consider giving this beautiful girl a loving home. If you'd like to meet her, just fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to ask for TABITHA/NUBIS HAVARD!
name: Tabitha Havard

description:
Hey there, Buddy here. Yes, I'm the one formally known as Gastly. I know, a truly Gastly name right? My family (the Tennessee 12? Tennessee 9) were all named after pokemon characters by the Tennessee shelter we found ourselves living at.  Then I moved to Minnesota and my foster mom started calling me Buddy while trying to come up with something better and eventually it just kind of stuck. Keep in mind I will never actually know my name as I am almost completely deaf. Its congenital deafness due to my white coloring. So foster mom has called me #dogwhowillneverknowhisname .
I am actually mostly white with some ticking. But I have a heart shaped liver spot behind my left eye.

I am a puppy, about a year old. So, I have a TON of puppy energy, think of Tigger, Pooh's friend. Boing, Boing, Boing!  I am housebroken which is a pretty great thing. Although sometimes when I want to go out I just sit by the door. and since I am as silent as a ghost you may not know. Sometimes, however, I just crash into the door!

I really like my crate, and am crate trained. It is just like having my own bedroom. My crate needs to be an open air wire type of crate.. I do not like enclosed crates. if you put me into an enclosed crate, I will destroy it. Doesn't matter if its plastic, or canvas etc... if its enclosed it will never function again after I am done with it. And because I consider it to be my bedroom if you leave the door open I will go in on my own when I am tired. If you need me to go in when I am not ready just throw a couple training treats in on my bed and I will go in, no problem.

I am very submissive to other dogs. But will also run and play to my hearts content after I get to know them a little bit. I am also a little submissive with some men for a short period. once they rub my belly I am golden. But I am spectacular with kids. My foster sister just turned 8. and she consistently has other kids over to play. Who also like to play with me. I'm not sure how I am around cats. but if they are anything like chickens I will probably want to play with them.

I am learning a few hand signs and am also learning how to walk on a leash, this is training in progress. Because I am super strong I would rather pull you through our walk then walk by your side.

I am still in my chew everything phase of life. Nothing is off limits. Card board boxes are a random favorite to shred if I don't have enough chew toys.

I also like to counter surf. So, if your really looking forward to that peanut butter sandwich or those fries from McDonalds.... don't leave them within 12 inches of the edge of the counter. Because I will DEFINITELY have them eaten in seconds. again, work in progress.

I definitely need a taller then 4 feet fence in the yard. I am long and I am also fast which makes me a great hurdler. It would probably be helpful to have a GPS collar for me. Im not really a flight risk. But if I get out of my yard, I wont respond to you "calling" me back. My foster mom was a bit nervous taking me to the off leash dog park the first time. But I just like to run and play and jump and run some more and then when I am done I just walk back to her.

I'm a bit on the skinny side at 44 pounds. The pretty lady vet said I need about 5 more pounds and I will be perfect. I'm really pretty healthy, up to date on my shots, I even got a 6 month shot of proheart , heartworm preventative (Heartworm Negative). And I am neutered to boot. That has not effected my energy level in the slightest. Plus I have a microchip.

Thanks for reading about me, I hope to meet you soon.


TRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally within 1500 miles)
Can't adopt right now, but want to help?

description: Roscoe likes to roll in the grass and enjoys being outside. Very well behaved and a great walker. A volunteer favorite. Come see him today.
name: Roscoe

description:
Jessie is a graceful, elegant extremely gentle and sweet girl.. we believe a mix between a whippet and a beagle..  As fearful as she can be, she just tries to disappear when faced with novelty! That could mean shrinking herself into the teeniest ball.. hiding under whatever she can find.. or is out on a walk .. attempting to flee. Shes going to be fine.. no... WAY more than fine.. as Jessie LOVES other dogs and seeks comfort from her canine friends and her new human friends... she wants very much to be a part of a pack.. 

When outdoors with trusted friends Jessie comes alive with all her doggie instincts.. she loves to run .. everything about her goes from timid to vibrant when she is free to run.. she has a busy nose is very visual and actually enjoys being stroked with a smooth and soothing hand! 

Jessie is being listed as adoptable and you're welcome to come out and meet this darling girl! But we are going to keep her with us for a little while longer while we help her gain the tools to live in the big world and be comfy in her own skin.

Visit our website fortheloveofdogsrescue.org for more photos, videos and info on Jessie!
name: Jessie

description:
7/13/18 

 We just found out that  Jacqueline has tested positive for heart worm.  Shr will be returning to North Carolina for treatment .   She will be available for adoption once Vet cleared!

2/15/18

Jacqueline Society: Has been in foster care with a family for the past 7 months. She is almost 2 years old. She resides with three Kids ranging from 6-14. She sleeps in bed with the 14 year old. She is house trained and walks nice on a leash. She is also in the house with 4 dogs and 1 cat. Dogs range from 9 mth puppy to 4 years. She has had very few problems with the dogs unless they are overly obnoxious towards her. Cat is older and Jaq is cat curious but never harms him. She runs up to him upon seeing but only sniffs for a bit then walks away. She is a good family dog and prefers to be with her human. She bonded very quickly with my 14 yo and loves to follow him around. If no one is home we find her sleeping on the bed waiting for my son to get home.


11.3.17
Foster Mom update...
Jacqueline is really wonderful with kids and most dogs as long as they don't start messing with her. She is cat curious but never harms them. 
Is potty trained and loves her leash walks. Jacqueline is a wonderful family dog!

10/4/17

Meet Jacqueline!  She is a one and a half year old, forty one pound, pitbull mix that was found roaming the streets with her daughter, Caroline.  When they first came into rescue, they were in bad shape and had demodex mange.  Luckily the condition was treatable, and they have both come such a long way in a short amount of time.  Jacqueline is crate trained and is working on her house training.  She walks well on a leash and enjoys the company of her human friends.  She loves to run and play in the back yard.  This dog is fully vetted, including spay and is heartworm negative. The foster is happy to answer any questions! Please visit www.wagsrescue.com for an application today!




Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

description:
Lilac and her friend were found tied to a fence in a local park. She is such a sweet dog and we can't understand how she could've been abandoned. Lilac is an approx 3 years old Bully Mix, is now UTD on vaccines, and will be spayed prior to adoption. She seems to like most dogs she meets, but can be shy at first. She doesn't seem to mind cats. Lilac will require an experienced owner familiar with the Bully Breeds. 

Meet her during daily adoption hours Mon-Fri 2pm-5pm, Wed 2pm-6pm, Sat-Sun 1pm-5pm.
name: Lilac

description:
Maizy was found as a stray and estimated to be 7-10 years old. She loves to go for walks with you, and play fetch. Pretty much anything you love to do she will love because she's with you. Poor Maizy had mammary masses removed in July and they turned out to be mass cell tumors. The vet believes he removed them all but we cannot be certain she is cancer free. Due to this she will be living out her life with her foster unless we find any extremely special adopter is willing to take her in knowing she may still have cancer and may need masses removed at some point. 

She is the sweetest girl. She is so happy to see you and be with you. She knows sit, down and stay. She is not good with other dogs but is good with her fosters cats.
name: Maizy

description:
Our girl Minnie. 
This 7-year-old sweetheart has a wonderful demeanor and is easygoing and low maintenance.  She didnât have much going for herself - she was a pregnant stray about to be euthanized.  We rescued Minnie so that she could have her babies in a safe environment and the whole family joined us here at Pound Dog. 
Minnie was an amazing momma to her babies, who were all adopted.  Her favorite pastime - squirrel patrol, walks, and being your sofa companion.  At 20 pounds sheâs a perfect small size!!  Did we mention she loves going on walks?  Do you?
Minnie would love to be an only dog so she can lap up all the attention for herself.  She can live with other dogs but they seem to stress her.  She loves people and makes herself comfortable with them and even welcomes strangers.  A fenced yard would be perfect for her - we want her to be able to go on "patrol"  in safe surroundings.
Minnie is house trained and crate trained, spayed and up to date with vaccinations.  She has had a recent dental cleaning to show off her beautiful smile!
Minnie has years of love and companionship to give and sheâs waiting for a family to call her own.  Please consider opening your heart to an older dog! Applications at www.pounddogfounddog.org or contact pdfdrescue@hotmail.com for more information.
name: Minnie

description:
Meet the marvelous Max! This little dude is just adorable and his personality matches his good looks. 
* we do not consider Max hypoallergenic as we donât truly know his breed mix * 
From his foster mom : â He is awesome! Heâs a little timid but is great with both of my dogs and my boys. Went up against Ellie with no problem! Loves to play and loves to cuddle. Heâs super smart and in my opinion would make a great pet for anyone! â
Max is about 5 months old and to be honest, we are completely stumped on what breed he is. Schnauzer ? Terrier ? Total mutt ? Whatever he is, he sure is CUTE. Max is UTD on vaccines. He will require a neuter chip contract through the rescue. This means you can get him neutered and chilpped at your own vet and upon proof, you are reimbursed $125 of your adoption fee, or you can use one of the rescueâs Locations at no charge. 

If a dog is listed on Petfinder, they are still available.  We do not go on a first come first serve basis, but on best fit for the family and most importantly, the puppy.  We are taking our best guess on breed and size when fully-grown, based on the puppy's physical appearance and what we might have learned about one or both parents depending on the situation. 

We are looking for adopters and fosters for their arrival. Please visit
 www.snarrnortheast.org
for the applications.  
Our puppy adoption fee is $495
name: Max

description:
Miltonâs Woof-Facts

Male, Yorkie-mix, senior, 7 lbs
Sees through the eyes of his soul; a precious blind boy who navigates well and continues to learn commands to enhance that skill
House and crate trained
Walks well on a leash and is learning to make his walks even longer
Gets along with other dogs yet not very interactive with them; prefers doing his own thing
Enjoys keeping his humans company, especially while they lounge on the couch in unity
His other companion: A cozy blanket for snuggling
In search of a home where his person will be around often and take proper precautions so this small wonder can explore his little world safely and loved

Quick Introduction to Milton

Hi, Iâm Milton! Iâm super-small in size and extra-large in sweetness. The first thing I ask of you is to read my story from start to finish â promise you wonât stop in between or even at the next sentence. You see, Iâm blind, and you may not have any experience in having a blind dog. Itâs amazing what blind dogs are capable ofâ¦ it may be beyond your comprehension right now, but itâs not beyond mine, because I am living proof! In humans, vision is their most well-developed sense, but in dogs, smell is the primary sense. I can assure you that my smelling capabilities are at the top of the charts (especially when my kibble or treats are on the agenda!). Yes, there are precautions, commands, and adaptations that need to be made when you have a blind dog. And once you understand what they are, we get into our groove, and I learn the navigation of the house (my safe place) and our routine, there may be some moments Iâm getting around so well that you actually forget Iâm blind. With the set-up Iâm provided in my foster home, I navigate very well, and they continue to teach me commands to help me navigate even better. When none of the humans are home, I stay in a large pen or have free roam of a gated area with my doggie companions. Sometimes I hang out with the other doggies; other times I do my own thing, like nap in my bed with a cuddly blanket. When my humans are home, I love being near them â whether itâs staying close by while theyâre doing household things or lounging on the couch while they watch TV (and I make sure to listen, so I know whatâs happening on our favorite shows). Besides my lack of vision, Iâm a low-maintenance guy. I promise to love my forever person with all of my heart, and Iâm looking for that special someone to be completely open to my embrace.

âBetter to be blind and see with your heart, than to have two good eyes and see nothing.â

Miltonâs Background

I sadly ended up at an inner-city shelter and was at risk of being euthanized. One of Rescue Havenâs volunteers heard about my urgent situation and brought me to safety â right into the arms, heart and home of their rescue group. Iâm completely grateful and beyond happy to feel safe and loved by this wonderful group of people. I was underweight when I was first rescued, but with my good appetite, Iâm eating well, and all 7 pounds of me have filled out nicely (wink)!

Miltonâs Typical Day in Foster Home

Did you ever hear the expression, âitâs raining cats and dogsâ? Well in my foster home, itâs definitely raining dogs! There are three dogs who live there permanently, there are three other dogs (fosters like me) who live there temporarily, and there are two human parents. Now that I think about it, itâs kind of like a 2017 animal-friendly version of the Brady Bunch (groovy)! All of us wake up before sunrise to start our day. Weâre taken outside to do potty, and when back inside, we sit down as a family to eat breakfast (giggle)! Actually, we each have our own eating spotsâ¦ mine is in a large pen which gives me my own safe space to consume my food and nutrients (breakfast of champions). I continue to hang out in my pen while my foster mom gets ready for work. After she leaves, my foster dad, who works from home (A.K.A., heâs home all day), brings me into his studio, and I keep him company. We go out for walks to explore the neighborhood and get some exercise, and before you know it, itâs time to eat dinner and for my foster mom to come home. We go for one more walk at night before itâs time to lounge on the couch with my humans and canine companions. When bedtime comes upon us, I have my own cozy bed in my foster parentâs room. Their bedroom is on the second floor so they make sure to have a gate at the top of the stairs so Iâm safe and sound while we get a good nightâs rest. I typically sleep like an angel, and if I need them for some reason, they know Iâll give a little bark as my sign (woof).

Living with Milton

As mentioned above, I live with other dogs, and I get along well with them. Iâm just not very interactive with other canines, but itâs nice to know theyâre around. I enjoy doing my own thing â like napping on my bed with my blankie. A quiet home would be best as I can start to bark a bit if there is a lot of stimulus around me. We feel Iâd do fine either being the only dog in the house or having other small doggie companions (Iâd definitely smell them and most likely follow them around with my nose). Iâll need someone who will care for me regarding my blindness. You can check out this website which provides useful information regarding blind dogs. Itâs one of those things that you donât really think about until itâs right under your nose (an appropriate metaphor), but youâll see that doing specific things can help a dog like me easily became part of your forever family http://www.blinddogs.net/tips_help.html

Miltonâs Medical

Some people may call me âspecial needsâ â we just think Iâm âspecialâ! Iâm 13 years old and have hypothyroidism which is being regulated through medication. I get eye drops 2 times a day, and when it comes to taking my medication, itâs easy-peasy for both me and my human (good boy)!

âKindness is a language that the deaf can hear and the blind can see.â

Miltonâs Ideal Forever Home

Is your heart full of kindness for a doggie like me? Iâll be able to feel your kindness every moment of every day from deep within my soul. And I will give you all of my heart. All I want is a human who will love me, protect me, and care for meâ¦ so I can live the rest of my life safely, in my own little world, with you by my side.
name: Milton ~ Small Wonder!

description:
It's a bird.. it's a plane.. it's super OREO! Oreo is pocket sized little dude, weighing in at only 14 lbs but he certainly brings the party with him everywhere he goes!  Zippity, sunny, upbeat energy surrounds Oreo.. it is impossible to have a bad day when you're around this bright spirit of a dog.  He adores people and dogs of all shapes and sizes. Oreo actively seeks out affection from all beings. 

?Oreo is incredibly agile; almost cat like in the way he moves. As you'll see in his pictures.. he pops up with full body twists and turns in mid air often landing on all four paws! Although sometimes his acrobatics land him in an awkward upside-down pose on the ground but you better believe Oreo is bouncing right back up to go again! Even though he's got all this fun, puppy like energy, he does have a "chill button" where he relaxes and will snuggle right in your lap for a snooze.

Our previous living situation was not a happy one, but our luck changed when many wonderful people decided to work together to try to save our beagle âfamilyâ.  The process of finding a Rescue that had room for us took over 1 month, but Penny Angels came through for us in the end!

I am approx. 7-8 years old and only weigh 18 lbs.  I am an adorable girl that loves everyone that I meet!  I get along well with other dogs.  Even though I am a little older, I still have some energy when I feel like playing.  I am using the doggie door in Rescue, but I know that I will have to learn new rules in your home.  I recently had a dental and can now start searching for my forever family.  Do you have room for me?  I will be at PetSmart in Mays Landing, NJ on Saturday from 11- 3 pm. description:
Toby is an one-year-old Basenji, Labrador Retriever and Formosan Mountain Dog Mix from the country of Taiwan.  He currently weighs 51.4 pounds (as of 12/22/2018) and is fully grown.  Toby has arrived in US on 7/28/2018 and has been living with our foster family in North Wilmington in Delaware since then.   

Tobyâs rescued story:

Toby has a rough start; he was rescued from a litter of puppies after their mom died from being poisoned.  

In past January in Central Taiwan after several severe cold waves and freezing rain, a young girl discovered a dead dog body in her family fruit orchard.  The dogâs breasts were swollen and was clearly still nursing; she seemed being dead for several days.  A couple of feet away under bushes from the dead dog, the girl found eight under 2 weeks old unweaned puppies that were cold and wet and barely breathing.  She soon contacted a local animal rescue group that was willing to take the entire litter.

At the age of 10 weeks old, Toby and his siblings, six boys and two girls were all adopted; however, Toby was returned two months later because some of adoptive family members were allergic to dog hair.     

Tobyâs completed medical information:

Toby is a healthy puppy, and he has passed the following medical tests before coming to the US:  distemper test, 4 Idexx (Heartworm, Lyme, Ehrlichia, Anaplasma Phagocytophilum), CBC, Biochemistry blood work, and a PCR test for diseases and infections transmitted by fleas or ticks.  He also has x-rays on hips that are healthy, and he does not have hip dysplasia. 
 
Toby is neutered, de-wormed, up to date on all vaccinations including rabies shot.  He is heartworm negative and on preventative treatment and is micro chipped.  All Toby's medical documents including the x-rays films on his hips will be given to his adopter when he is adopted. 

Tobyâs temperaments and personality:

Toby has been living with foster family with over ten dogs of different sizes; he gets along very well with every one of them.  He loves to play with dogs and often initiates play.  In Taiwan before coming, Toby had lived with a foster family that has three cats for three months, Toby did not show interesting in cats and usually stayed away from them.  He is fine with cats, but they need to be dog-friendly.  

Toby has the temperament of a Labrador Retriever that loves people and is submissive.  He is also smart and a quick learner; he has learned most of basic English commends after living in the US for a short period of time.  

Toby is super sweet and passionate to his caregiver, he loves to cuddle and sleeps next to his foster mom on the bed; therefore, he is very attached to his foster mom here and follows her everywhere.  Whenever she is doing laundry or using the bathroom, Toby always follows her or stays outside the bathroom waiting for her to come out.  However, Toby is more independent in the yard, he LOVES to run with other dogs and likes to try different toys and carry them around, but always immediately shows up whenever his foster mom calls him from far away.  

Toby is a very happy puppy that brings a lot of light to his foster family.  He is a little shy to strangers at first but warms up quickly especially with treats; he LOVES food that can make him to relax faster.  He is not nervous in a new environment or surrounded by many people.  He rarely barks and never started any trouble if he knows he is not allowed.  

Toby is 100% house broken.  He likes to urinate on the grass, and whenever he needs to go out for potty, he would let his foster mom know by sitting by the door to the yard.  At nights, Toby has been sleeping in the foster momâs room along with other five medium-large dogs; Toby can hold his pee all night about 8-9 hours and 4-5 hours during the day.

Toby is not afraid of thunder or lighting and does not have separation anxiety either.  Even though Toby can be crated, we prefer that he is not kept in a cage by his new owner but being confined in an area with providing many durable toys.  

Toby has been living with dogs since being rescued, so we think that he will do much better with a family that has other non-alpha dog with similar size and temperament as Toby. 

Toby is not food or toys aggression or possession toward both people and dogs.  He likes children, but due to his size, age and sometimes he is still too rough while playing, he will not do well with children under 7 years old and retired senior people either.  Toby does not walk well on the leash; he is exciting to go out and often pulls the leash.

Toby loves car rides and does very well in the car; he will be a great companion for traveling, hiking or socializing with any events.  He loves to go out to meet different people and visit places.  He is very playful but not energetic; however, he is still a puppy that needs daily physical exercise and mental stimulation and should not be left at home alone for a long period of time every day. 

Toby will do better with the family that has a physical fence in the yard.  We do not prefer to place him into an apartment setting or a place being shared with roommates.

We hope that Tobyâs new family can include him in your daily activities to take him for outings, one-day trips or vacations except for taking him for neighborhood walks or playing in the backyard only; we really want Toby to have opportunities to experience different parts in his new life.   

How to meet Toby?

Toby has been living in the North Wilmington in Delaware for a month.  If you are seriously thinking of giving Toby a loving permanent home, please email us for an application.  Because we do not have a shelter to show people our dogs and all our rescues are living with our foster family, we do not accept stop-by visits if you are interested in seeing our dogs.  Before meeting Toby, the prospective adopter needs to fill out the application and gets approved.

More videos of Toby are as below:

description:
This is Eli. He is a 12 week old Husky/spaniel mix. Right now he weighs about 16 pounds and will be a large dog when grown. Eli is a playful guy and very gentle. It took him awhile to come out of his shell but once he realized how great it is to be loved on..... it was all over. Heâs a darling boy with a winning personality. Heâs just waiting on his forever family. Itâs it yours?  HS

**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**

Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip,  and an Alabama State Health Certificate.

Transport, if needed :  $120.00    We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama.  We  make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

Weight Scale:   Small =  less than 25
                       Medium = 26-60
                         Large =  61-100
                               XL = 100+
name: Eli B

description:
Our dear Jack! This poor boy was picked up as a stray, found running down a road chained to another dog. It's clear they did not come from great circumstances or any sort of loving home, but even still this boy is all heart! He is one giant ball of love and sweetness. He would be a GREAT addition to any active home.

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***

Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Jack

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Kendall comes to rescue from a Georgia shelter with a severe case of demodex (non contagious) mange, secondary skin and eye infections, URI, emaciated and probably anemic as well. She collapsed as soon as she arrived at the vet, and was immediately rushed in for treatment. Kendall is only 6 months old. She didn't get this way overnight. Sadly, it seems most of her young life has been nothing but neglect and pain. We promise to change that for her. Kendall will be up to date on shots and spayed when medically appropriate to do so and prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages and with other dogs despite her condition. She is the sweetest girl and We cant wait to see her feeling better! If you are interested in adopting Kendall when she is ready, why not get your application in now and get the process started so that you can be part of her recovery plan and waiting for her when she is ready to join you! Apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Kendall

description: 1 Dec 2018: Enchilada is an adorable 8 year old Chi mix. He was found in a box near a train station. This sweetheart is currently in a foster home and doing well. He is dog friendly and would make a great addition to any family. Please apply to adopt today.
name: Enchilada

description:
Penny (35lbs.) is a 7 year old, GSD mix that was rescued from a tiny chicken wire cage en route to the infamous Yulin dog meat festival. At the time of her rescue, it was apparent that Penny was in need of immediate medical attention to remove a maggot filled lymphoma from her body. Fortunately, her surgery went well and she made an unremarkable recovery. After months of waiting in China, Penny was finally cleared to travel to the US to search for a second chance at life.

Despite everything she's been through, Penny remains gentle and affectionate. She yearns for human affection and attention, making her the perfect family or companion dog. Penny has been well-socialized with other dogs and would likely do well in a home with respectful children.

If you are interested in meeting and/or potentially adopting this rescue pet, please complete our online application at www.arrus.org. You will be notified via email of your application status prior to our next upcoming event. If you do not receive a response within this timeframe, please send a follow-up email to arrusadopt@gmail.com. 

Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet nâ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. 

HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. To make a secure donation, please visit www.arrus.org/donate . Alternatively, you may visit our Amazon Wishlist (http://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/C36VRV500R85) for a current list of needed supplies! All donations are tax-deductible and all are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support!
name: Penny

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
My name is SAVANNAH & I'm a beautiful 10 mo F White  Amstaff/Pit X. I'm a petite 55 lbs of PURE SUGAR. I'm a gorgeous girl with sky blue eyes... super sweet & friendly, lively and sociable. I'm just a puppy still so I need daily structured exercise and discipline. I know "sit" but need to learn more commands and still need help with leash training; but nothing that the proper leash/collar tools like a "gentle leader" harness won't fix. I'm currently living with 4 other dogs so I'm more or less good with dogs as long as I'm introduced properly. I would be best with a male and one that is active medium/high energy to keep up with me! I've never met a cat but I'm a bit too forward so I think I would probably chase it so preferably NO CATS for me. I've not been around young kids either so older kids ages 10 yrs+ would be best! I'm a sweet blue-eyed beauty and need someone who knows, appreciates and understands my breed! I will be your BFF.. come meet/adopt me today!

For more info/app - Pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Savannah

description:
Age: ~1.5 - 2 years old     
Weight: 45 lbs
Vet Record:  100% vaccinated, neutered, microchipped, male

Samy is a smart guy who would love to have his own place to run around and explore. He does not like being in a kennel and would really prefer to have more space of his own. Samy loves to walk on a leash and if you need some motivation to get out and exercise then Samy would love to be your handsome fitness partner. 

Samy is very affectionate, when you scratch his back, he will do his âSamy Danceâ where he hops around on his back legs and arches his back like a cat. This fun-loving, outgoing boy likes water and tries to catch it with his mouth if you spray him with the hose.

Volunteers Emily and Ann gave Samy a bath during their most recent visit and, while he didnât love it, he behaved very well and did not try to run away. 

Great with people as well as with dogs, Samy would be a perfect companion for someone with an active lifestyle â preferably someone who enjoys walking, playing and exploring new places on the weekend. 

More info: http://www.sochidogs.org/samy

description: This 2 year old American Bulldog mix is Gucci.Â  Gucci is strong on lead, eager to explore.Â  He sat on command for a treat, which he accepted softly from our fingers.Â  Gucci had no issues sharing both his toys and bone whenever asked.Â  He wasn't interested in eating during his evaluation, but we saw no tension while at the food bowl.Â  Gucci will need to be the only pet in the household as he was not comfortable with the dogs he met outside.Â  Do to his size and strength, we feel it best that he be adopted to an experienced home without small children.Â  Stop by and meet Gucci today.
name: GUCCI 30404

description:
Count is our special little guy.  His personality is fun, energetic, outgoing and loving.  However, Count is slow to warm up to strangers and needs to make sure he can trust you.  If you are interested in bringing Count into your home, Count would require you to come to the shelter and meet him several times so he can get to know you before you take him home.  Once Count knows and trusts you, he is just the best dog ever.  Count would do best in and adult only home that is quiet without a lot of strangers visiting.  Count does get along with other dogs too.  It seems he prefers dogs around his size.  

Please stop in and meet Count soon.
name: Count

description:
Velvet And Callie Sisters Looking For A Home Together

Velvet and Callie are a pair of German Shepherd sisters rescued from a hoarder in New Jersey.  Today these friendly 4 year old sisters are ready to begin the best part of the rest of their lives; finding a loving home.  Velvetâs floppy ears give her a playful look, which perfectly matches her personality.  Velvet is inquisitive, friendly and is a happy go lucky girl.  Once she is comfortable with a new friend, she will come right up to you and give you a wet sloppy kiss.

Callie, her sister, is the more serious of the girls, and feels it is her place to look out for Velvet.  Although her demeanor is a bit more reserved than Velvet, Callie will warm up fairly quickly to new people and new surroundings.  Callie has the classic German Shepherd ears.  Like her sister she also likes to give a sweet kiss to her new friends.

Having lived most of their lives in crates and cramped conditions, Velvet and Callie just love now to go out and romp around a yard and play.  After a few minutes on a walk, they will settle down and walk fairly nicely, though a training lesson or two wouldnât hurt.  Velvet and Callie are moderate sized German Shepherds, around 60 pounds each.   They are in relatively good health, though both need to be spayed and Callie could use to put on a few pounds.  Otherwise they are up to date on all their vaccinations, and ready to go to their new home.

You can read about their story and the sad case of a lack of justice for the hoarder.  As of this time Sedona Shepherd has taken in four of the German Shepherds, including Wren and Kolby.   Since little money was recovered by the municipality, Sedona Shepherd (and all the rescues that have helped) have had to cover all of the medical costs for these dogs.  We estimate the veterinary care to cover all four of these beautiful dogs to be $2,500.  In addition to paying for all of their shots and check-up, Velvet and Callie need to be spayed.  Kolby needed surgeries for neutering and a hernia and is on medication to help manage his dry eye syndrome.  Please help us by donating to Velvet and Callieâs medical bills.

Sedona would also like to thank Terrie Carr and the Rock Nâ Ruff crew at WDHA for their feature of Velvet and Callie.

Interested in finding out more about Velvet and Callie?  Shoot us a request for more information at contact@sedonashepherd.com or fill out an adoption application form.
Sedona
name: Velvet and Callie

description: Corky is a 4 month old hound mix. She will be spayed, and up to date on shots. Bio to come. Please email haar13@aol.com to inquire and get an application.
name: Corky

description: 11 Feb 2018: Mama Maize came to us very pregnant, and delivered 12 beautiful puppies. Her puppies are now old enough to be adopted and so we are looking for the very best home for our mama. She is very energetic, and would make a perfect jogging partner. She is house-trained, quiet, gentle, loving, and most of all, grateful. She loves everyone she meets. Please apply to at http://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/app-form/
name: Mama Maize

description: 24 Nov 2018: Elijah is a sweet 2 year old who came into rescue after having been attacked by another dog through his kennel. This guy has made a full recovery and is ready for a foster or forever home. While in the past Elijah got along well with other dogs, given his experience he is currently showing some reactivity and so he would need decompression and very slow introductions. Elijah was in playgroups with other dogs at the shelter and showed himsellf to be a bit bossy. He would likely be ok with another submissive female, or would be just as happy to be your one and only, but is not a good candidate for the dog park. Elijah loves all humans and enjoys getting affection. He is a strong boy, who can pull on the leash. He is good with other dogs and kids, but should not be in a home with cats. Elijah has a sweet and silly personality and we cannot wait to see this goofball in a loving home. Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Elijah

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Please contact Nancy (nestlee@comcast.net), (732) 477-4896 for more information about this pet.

Scroll down to see more pictures of this dog.

Booker is available for adoption. He is 8 years old and weighs 12 lbs. His adoption fee is $350.00. Meet Booker! This little guy was found wandering the streets of Philadelphia all by himself. After spending a few days at the animal control shelter, Save a Yorkie stepped in to help. Booker is approximately 8 years old and weighs 12 pounds. We don't know anything about his upbringing, but we do know he has a bright and sweet disposition in spite of the hardship he's endured. He is friendly and gently approaches adults, children and other dogs. He adapts to new people and environments very quickly. Booker enjoys playing with toys and going for walks, but most of all he loves lounging on the couch right next to his humans. He is very quiet and rarely barks. He walks nicely on a leash and knows how to sit. We are working on other commands. With the assistance of belly bands, he's learning to only mark his territory outside. Booker is neutered, microchipped and, thanks to his recent dental, has healthy and clean teeth! He had 8 teeth removed and is recovering from surgery like a champ. Booker is staying with Nancy in Brick, NJ.
name: Booker

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier
description:
Gummy Bear is a silly 2 year old pit/Chihuahua! (yes, really!) mix who has been waiting a while to find the right home. She was very timid and fearful when she came to us and still is shy with strangers and in new situations, but once she's comfortable she is a bouncy playful pup who loves attention and loves to play. She's great with other dogs and feels more comfortable as part of a "pack" so is looking for a calmer adult home with at least one other friendly dog to help her feel more secure. She is a graduate of the ASPCA's behavior rehabilitation center which has helped her warm up and make new friends much faster! She's only 25-30lbs full grown and an adorable pocket-sized pittie girl. Please email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested.
We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East next to 5 Star Car Wash (formerly Boulder Car Wash) in Morris Plains (Denville on GPS).  To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Gummy Bear- Shy silly pocket pittie

description:
Calling all stylish fans! Looking to add some splash to your life?

Momma Dog Olga has done her job, she raised beautifully stunning babies, and saw them off to their respective homes; and now sheâs itching to find her own new story. 

Sweet Olga is young herself, around 2 years old, and would love to find a best friend to explore the world with. She definitely needs some manners on a leash, as her favorite to-do includes walking around in circles until youâre light-headed, or having you follow her horizontally and mid-air, but can you blame her? Sheâs on a mission! And thatâs to find her way into your heart. 

She gets along with other dogs, mostly minding her own business, but does love to tear up the yard with zoomies once in a while. Sheâs crate trained, although she does think itâs beneath her. 
Sheâs current on vaccines, spayed and healthy. 

Https://reclaimeddignity.wixsite.com/rdas/apply
name: Olga

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Gorgeous Hallie is a one year old Pit mix who weighs 30 pounds. She comes into rescue from Texas. Hallie hasnât had the amazing life that every dog dreams of yet but now that she is safe with us we will make sure this girl finally has her fairy tale ending. She presented with some neurological symptoms. Hallie spent a few weeks at our San Antonio vet Partner and it was discovered that she was partially blind and deaf. She stumbled a lot and needed further diagnostic testing with a specialty hosp in NY. The specialist has determined that Hallie suffered from some type of trauma to the skull which is what is causing her issues. Sadly we think that she suffered this injury at the hands of humans or possibly suffered some type of brain infection that was never treated. Now we are dealing with her issues head on and she seems to be doing better. She has vision in one eye, and she stumbles less. She so wants to be a normal pup...running and playing with kids, cats, and dogs. Hallie is looking for that special someone who will care for her and her needs. Hallie is an absolutely beautiful girl who is very sweet and friendly. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you can give Hallie the happy ever after that she is so deserving of, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Hallie

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

If you would like to take me home please complete a Pet Adoption Application

female. 90 lbs. lots of energy! fenced in yard a must
This is Shana (or Shayna), our lovely LARGE still almost a puppy (approx a year old) who is just the most gorgeous thing! She weighs in at about 90lbs, we were told she is a lab mix.... but our instincts say mastiff mix- all those lovely wrinkles and goofy personality.

Shana is clumsy and growing into her body but does not understand how large she is, so we are thinking teen children and up.

She is pushy playing with dogs at Camp- she is so glad to be out, get to run, and be able to play that she overwhelms them a bit-again her goofiness and her size. Our instincts say that if there is another dog in the house, that dog needs to be tolerant of a big, goofy, high energy puppy-like doofus.

Fenced in yard is a must for this pup.

From Maria's Corner in September newsletter:

Shayna has been in at least 2 shelters, 1-2 rescues and who knows how many homes. It's time we find her the real deal.
She needs an adopter who will give her time to settle in.There's no set rule of "2 weeks" or "10 days," to adapt. It could take her much longer. I remember knowing a case where it took the dog a year to relax. They had an amazing adopter for sure!!! From my own personal experience, I once had a dog that took about 6 months to settle in. There's just no telling. Every dog is truly individual.
name: Shana

description:
Let's face it, if you were to look up "doofus" in the dictionary, Goober's picture would be alongside it. No, really... but he's an intelligent doofus. He takes training very seriously and it's seriously hysterical. Goober has perfected sit, down, and is able to play tug like a gentleman. He's obsessed with our new enrichment program because of all of the delicious peanut butter involved. 

This 1-2 year old Pit/Dane mix is a handful of fun, just like his namesake. He is also just as yummy (: Goober is dog & cat friendly. Meet & greet is required to ensure that he is the perfect fit for his fur siblings. 

If playful with a generous dash of droopy, sprinkled with a lot of laughs is your favorite recipe, Goober is the dog for you. Come meet him any day from 11-2 as this goofy guy is ready to be the comedian of your household that you couldn't picture life without.

description: We saved Rosie after being alerted that he was living in a vehicle with another dog named Rockie. Rose is a beautiful, petite, sweet Pitbull, estimated at 1.5 years old. She is currently in foster with a trainer where she is working on building confidence and socializing to reduce anxiety in new situations. Rosie gets along well with dogs, always wanting to play and socialize. She is crate and house trained and would make a great addition to a young and active family.
name: Rosie

description:
Happy go lucky girl Jennie just arrived to Love Dogs and boy is she a HOOT! This compact stocky lady is spunky, peppy and so welcoming.. she never meets a stranger. When greeting someone new, she'll totally jump up and pop her stubby front legs on your thigh as she tries desperately to reach you.. all the while her tail is wagging a mile a minute!  

Jennie is absolutely hilarious to watch and play with! She'll take a toy in her mouth and zip around in crazy circles while tossing the toy up in the air and then pouncing on it again! Everything we've seen out of Jennie so far is pure love, joy and FUN! 

She has made a few doggy friends but does seem to want to chase and catch little dogs that ensue her inner prey drive. Jennie is so well mannered, we brought her along to an event where she happily met a bunch of new people!

For more info and photos of Jennie be sure to visit our website fortheloveofdogsrescue.org
name: Jennie Girl

description: Want to meet me? Come down to our Port Washington, NY Adoption Center.
name: Sophie

description: Meet Maggie May, a 6 to 7 year old sweet and chubby 9 lb. Chihuahua. Sheâs very good natured and affectionate, and loves to sleep with her foster dad. Sheâs a smart little girl who is learning commands, and is usually a pretty relaxed pup. Sheâs wee-wee pad trained and housebroken. She doesnât bark much, except when someone comes to the door, and is very content just hanging out. Maggie May has had all her shots, is microchipped and tested negative for heartworm. Sheâs still dieting to lose her belly weight, but is a happy girl nonetheless. However, sheâd be happier to have a forever family to love.  Please note that we only adopt within the NY Tri-State area.
name: Maggie May

description:
Meet Handsome Jake, a 7 year old Saint Bernard/Shepherd mix weighing 75 pounds. Here is a note from his former family:

Handsome Jake is a wonderful family companion. During the day he likes to roam around the yard and chase squirrels and chipmunks; he likes to go on walks or tag along on car rides. At night, Jake loves nothing more than laying on his back and having his belly rubbed. If you could pet him 24/7, Jake would sit there and soak it up the entire time. He loves attention!!

Jake does have a tendency to be overprotective in his home. While he is amazing with the immediate family, he doesn't always love when visitors come by. Sometimes it's best to put him in a room when others are over and shut the door. He doesn't scratch or bark once he's put away.

Outside the home, he is usually well behaved. He has stayed for multiple days at the Pet Spa and has gotten great reviews for behavior.

Jake lived in a house with another dog and there have never been any issues. In addition to our own children, we had a few young relatives stay with us for a few weeks at a time (ages 3 & 2) and he was great with them (although we watched him closely).

Jake has been cat tested & seems to be okay with feline friends. He is up to date on vaccines, neutered, and microchipped.

If you're interested in meeting Handsome Jake go to EHRDOGS.ORG and submit an application. Don't forget to ask for HANDSOME JAKE LONESTAR!!!
name: Handsome Jake

description:
Whimsy is a sweet, handsome boy with a wonderful personality. He is almost 1 year old and weights approximately 45lbs. Whimsy is smart and playful, and he would be a wonderful addition to any family. Apply today and find your new best friend! Whimsy will be arriving at Beacon on Sunday, 08/26/18.

You can always fill out the on line application at: 
Online Application:  https://secure.jotform.us/beaconanimalrescue/adoptionapp
609.390.7946
MAKE ADOPTION YOUR FIRST OPTION

description:
Tessa, a pit bull terrier/lab mix weighing 60 pounds, is a enthusiasic dog who currently lives in a foster home.  She is playful, ougoing, and a little goofy sometimes but also likes to follow her person around and is content to lay at their side. What a snuggler!

Tessa is great with people but NOT great with other dogs or cats.  She is house trained, crate trained, knows basic commands such as 'sit', 'lay down' and 'spin' and is having a lot of fun learning others. She also walks well on a leash and requires a fully fenced yard.

We do local adoptions less than one hour from our central New Jersey location. See our ADOPTION APPLICATION on the main page of our website. We an also EMAIL our application to you. For questions, email AnimalAlly@gmail.com or call us at 609-737-2380.

Our dogs are spayed or neutered before adoption. They receive age-appropriate shots and worming, flea/tick preventative, and any other medical treatments that they require.  Dogs over the age of eight months are tested for heartworm and Lyme disease.  Negative dogs receive heartworm preventative; positive dogs are medically treated prior to adoption.  To read about how ANIMAL ALLIES conducts adoptions, please visit our home page at aa.petfinder.com.
name: Tessa

description:
Mae is a sweet Pittshepherd from the south. This girl loves to romp and play with the other dogs, and cuddle up in your lap- but her absolute favorite thing to do is swim!

If you are a water loving family and want a dog who will jump right in with you, Mae is the girl for you!

description: Miss Flossie is a very unique pup!  She is a 4-5 yr. old Shih Tzu/Terrier Mix who weighs 16 lbs.  She absolutely loves the outdoors, and will sit and watch squirrels for hours. She is house trained and knows basic manners.  She prefers a quiet home, as she can be stressed with too much activity.  Flossie does need to be the only dog, since she wants to receive and give all the hugs and kisses.  She loves to sit with her people and will give real hugs!  This lovable girl is fostering in the Mid-Atlantic Region.  Please visit our main site for more information or to apply to adopt.
name: Flossie

description:
Angelina is an adorable young girl looking for a true chihuahua lover!  Sheâs very nervous at first and can act ferocious until she trusts you, but once she bonds she is a loyal affectionate little girl who will protect you with her life.  Sheâs fine with other dogs, about 2 years old and 7lbs.  Email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!

description:
Congratulations to Natasha on passing her C.L.A.S.S. BA test! C.L.A.S.S. stands for Canine Life and Social Skills, and Natasha totally aced her test after training on things like loose leash walking, meet and greets, leave it, settling, and more. She's one smart, well-trained pup!

Velvet soft fur and an equally soft heart... that's Natasha. This 4 year old young girl came in pregnant and heartworm positive. Her puppy found a home, her heartworm is all gone, and she's ready to find her forever home and live happily ever after. Natasha recently passed her Canine Life and Social Skills test, showing off what a smart, well-trained girl she is. Learn all about her in the video above, and e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 x11 with any questions.

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption.
 
Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Natasha - C.L.A.S.S. Graduate w/B.A.

He will even play fetch! He loves his kong with peanut butter too. He will do best with a fenced in yard. He really needs to be shown what it is like to be part of a family and gets lots of love. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Medical HoldQuadrophenia (remembered from the rock group 'The Who') is one handsome boy. He's very affectionate and super happy. He's a leaner and just loves full body contact with the person next to him. He's calm, sturdy and solidly built. Quadrophenia walks well on leash. He's a curious boy but not pushy. He is 2 years old and although he loves people. no cats, please.
He sustained a broken leg which is healed but he needs to have his ligaments evaluated for any treatment that might be required, which GFNJ is taking care of.Quadrophenia will be ready for adoption soon as his leg is just about medically clearedPrison Inmate Handler Update: 'My dog has a wierd anme, so I call him Quad and he listens. He likes to be outside and he likes to eat. For the most part he is calm and when I walk him he stays at my side on his leash. I love Quad, he's the BEST....'

Beagle mix female 4 months

name: Nani

description:
Meet King. King is a big baby who just wants to love and be loved. In August of 2016, at just 3 years old, King was abandoned by his family.  Dropped at a high kill shelter, where owner surrenders can be immediately euthanized. We couldnât let that happen to this sweet young boy.  We saw his picture, this big dopey boy snuggled up at the shelter with a smaller pittie girl and we just had to save them both (see Pennyâs story too!) 
King was unsure of his new surroundings and a little nervous when he got to his foster home.  So many new sights and sounds and smells and where was his family?  Understandably, he was confused and had a tough time settling in. We donât know much about his history but we donât think Kingâs previous âfamilyâ was very nice to him.  He came to us with some quirks that led us to believe he was probably not treated very well, possibly even abused. 
King didnât really like to be crated, he wasnât great at sharing his toys, although he likes other dogs, and he was always nervous someone was going to take his food away.  As time went on and his foster mom worked with him, he came to like his crate, although he still would prefer you not stick your fingers in there and he doesnât like to be crated if he can hear that peope are home. He wants to come out and play! And he will make his typical pittie whining sounds that donât even sound like a dog. King has gotten much better at sharing toys, although he does sometimes need to be reminded to share nicely when he gets a brand new toy. What younginâ doesnât right?  King is learning, and getting better every day, at understanding that he doesnât need to worry about anything but being a dog anymore. He will sometimes still flinch when someone raises their voice or moves quickly or raises things above his head, but he is learning that nobody will hurt him anymore. 
This silly, funny, loving boy loves to play and run and be with his people.  At bedtime he happily curls up next to his foster mom and snuggles in for the night. Heâs a big snugglebug. Sometimes he forgets that heâs 100 lbs and tries to jump into your lap for some love.  He has no idea how big and powerful he really is. He walks beautifully on a leash and is not fazed by passing cars, people, or other dogs. He loves to play fetch, have his ears scratched, and play with anyone who is willing.
King is still working on building his confidence.  In the meantime, he can occasionaly (very infrequently) be nervous around new people. However, a proper intro by his foster mom quickly quells his nerves and heâs all lovebug. Heâs simply still learning that he doesnât need to be afraid anymore, that that part of his life is over. Once he sees someone he knows, King canât wait to greet them with love and kisses and hugs.  He is still learning not to jump to greet people, he just gets so excited to see his friends! He really just loves to be loved on. 
King would do best in a home with an experienced large dog owner who can play with him regularly.  He is still young and unaware of his size and still working to forget his past so a home without small children would be best. He does like other dogs but has not been around cats, but we think he would do fine with a cat given proper introduction .  His current foster home has rabbits that King regularly play bows to and canât figure out why his foster mom wonât let him play with.  (Itâs because he doesnât realize how big he is and could accidentally hurt them, but he doesnât understand that). 
If you are interested in this big boy please go to bfdaaa.com to complete an application.
name: King

description:
We Like Loso very much ?

And why wouldnât we ! Heâs a sweet gentle 8 year old dog who was surrendered to the shelter because of âallergies â. Now we wondered about that however perhaps the people were not his original owners. Perhaps they took him in and couldnât keep him.  
Heâs a little guy around 40 lbs. and easy to walk and handle.  
We never say a dog is house trained but we can surely say thereâs an excellent chance with Loso. 
Loso is fine around other dogs and basically ignores them. Heâs only been here two weeks and seems to be adjusting to the Yonkers Animal Shelter as well as can be expected. 
Heâs a very pretty shade off light brown, almost a dark tan.  He just likes a little affection and companionship.  
Loso is a low maintenance dog who will make a wonderful companion for someone.  
More at lesliem147@gmail.com or 201-981-3215

BRAT RESCUE INC., located in Far Rockaway, Queens is capable of ONLY adopting out to potential people that live in the Five (5) boroughs of NYC.

description:
My name is Mustang! My pack and I are from the south and were brought to Pets Alive. I am currently in a behavioral program here! This is helping me with manners, leash walking, playing with other dogs and people. I have amazing volunteers and staff who work with me towards improving my behavior and exploring my needs. My brothers and sisters have been worked with to be domesticated and have been successful with Pets Alive's adoptability program. I am a great candidate for a sponsorship to get me the help I need through our training program! 

To sponsor me, this is the link to learn more! http://petsalive.org/sponsor.html

description:
Lovey dogey Red is now around 2, and has been with us for about a year. While his sister went on to find a forever family, he's still waiting for his... he's a fun, active little man, and while he can play well with dogs, we would like him to go to an only-pet family, as he can get a little too excited, if not reminded to play nicely. He is neutered, current on vaccines and crate trained. He has fairly good recall, fairly good on a leash, and absolutely eager to learn and follow his humans. He's also a pro snuggler!


If you're interested in this handsome love, get in touch with us today!

description:
All Saved Me dogs and cats receive a wellness exam at our veterinarian and age-appropriate core vaccines. They are spayed or neutered before they go to their adoptive families.  Dogs over 7 months are tested for heartworm and all cats are tested for FeLV and FIV.

All animals are microchipped and are eligible for a complimentary 30-day pet health insurance policy from Shelter Care if you provide an e-mail address when you complete the adoption. 

We will ask you for a veterinary reference or three personal references,  proof that you are allowed to have pets where you live (lease or lease addendum or proof of home ownership),  and valid identification.  

Adoption fees are as follows: 
Puppies under seven months - $450.00
Dogs - $350.00
Senior dogs (8 years and over) - $225.00
Cats and Kittens - $75.00. 

You do not need an appointment to visit with our adoptable pets, but please call ahead or visit our automatically-updated website to confirm that the pet you want to meet is still available. 
215-240-1240
savedme.org/adopt
name: Makaveli - SPONSORED

description:
Kaytee is a sweet and stunning year and half old who turns heads whenever she goes on walks.  She is full of energy and loves her exercise, especially chasing tennis balls and sticks.  She knows all basic obedience commands â sit, stay, down, wait, come, heel (on and off leash), âstatâ (emergency recall) â and some extras, like âback-up,â and is trained on the Invisible Fence.  She loves car rides and tummy rubs and some of her favorite things are ice cubes, cucumbers, and cheese (string cheese being her training treat of choice).  She is very affectionate, but is dog selective and may do best with a male dog or as an only dog.

She currently weighs in at 84lbs, so not entirely sure on her breed but she's a big gorgeous fluffy Merle girl!

Please email barkingbackrescue@gmail.com for an app!
name: Kaytee

description:
Nonamee was surrendered to a local animal shelter when his owner could no longer afford to take care of him. He is a 6-7 year old Husky mix, weighing 65 pounds, with a wonderful temperament. He is gentle, kind, and very friendly.

Nonamee has weakness in his hips and back legs. We have been giving him cosequin supplements and he is sleeping on a bed on top of his Kuranda bed. It seems to be helping a bit. He appears to be housebroken & he gets along with other dogs, too.

Nonamee is a dog who would just be happy to lay by your side, providing companionship & quiet company. He needs a safe place to go now that he's out of the shelter. Do you have a loving forever home where Nonamee can spend the rest of his days?

If you would like to meet this sweet, gentle boy please
fill out an application at

https://northstarpets.org

and be sure to mention his name!
name: Nonamee KY

description: This big boy is Fynn. He is around 9 months old and still has plenty of growing left to do. He is a goofy boy and loves to play and get affection. He will need a home that is willing train him. He needs basic obedience, potty training and it is always a good idea to socialize young dogs with other dogs and strangers. He will be a big dog so training while he is still young will make his growing up alot more enjoyable and easier. If you are looking to provide a forever home to a sweet pup, come meet with Fynn.

Trixie will be a TERRIFIC family addition who will add lots of joy and love once she has a loving and caring family of her own!

ARF pups are all spayed/neutered, microchipped, current on vaccinations, and treated for internal and external parasites. description:
ADOPTION FEE:$100

Damon is a special dog who came from South Carolina to make room for Florence dogs.  He is a sweet large 65 pound dog with a fused rear leg.  We had our vet check it out.  He said he thinks that maybe as a young puppy Damon had a broken leg set for too long a time and his muscles and soft tissue atrophied so his leg is fused.  He did not recommend amputating it as Damon does use it for some support, and if removed, it might put too much strain on the other leg leading to more health issues.  If you want to rescue a super sweet special needs dog, Damon would be perfect.

description:
Barbie is a sweet 6 yr old female mixed breed pup, approx 50lbs.  She is a beautiful, petite girl who loves everyone she meets.  She would do best in a home with no small children she can be too rough for them.  Only pet or in a home with a larger male dog who loves to play best.  This girl is in boarding and desperately misses having a home.  Adoption fee is waived!  Foster or forever home neefed asap!  For more info please contact Kris at kobemnstr@hotmail.com
BARBIE'S STORY:
I sit and wait...... Life was never that easy for me, my people didn't seem to really want me around. They never took the time to take me to the vet or get me spayed so still being a pup myself I found myself caring for my own babies....and then it got worse. We ended up at a shelter)o; Thank goodness for some really nice, caring people who helped us to safety right away! I did the very best I could and all three pups are doing great!! They even found homes of their own! Now it's MY turn, I'm small.... only about 40lbs and really just want time to run and play and be a pup myself. I heard the vet say I was about 2 yrs old and that I will be getting spayed soon so I don't have to have any more babies. I have been vaccinated, dewormed and microchipped as well. All set for my forever family, so now it's time!! My temporary foster mom says I'm a sweetheart and anyone would be lucky to have me in their life. I am house broken and crate trained. I also LOVE my toys and bones(o; I adore children too! Please help me to find my forever family!! Although my foster mom loves me she is only able to keep me a short while longer so please spread the word!!! For more info about me please contact FurBabies Rescue "Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole." ~Roger Caras
name: Barbie

description:
Age: 8 months

Hello, Iâm Temo! I came from Mexico after being rescued by a nice person. I had been hit repeatedly with a stick, which broke my back, causing my back legs to be paralyzed. But I donât know the difference! Iâm the happiest, most joyful little puppy who still has a zest for life. Plus, I wear my diaper like a champ! Meet me today at Animal Haven â you wonât regret it!
name: Temo

description:
Have you ever seen a more cute, fluffy, and lovable face? Meet Keebler! He is an almost 1 1/2 year old Golden Retriever/Chow Chow mix, is fully grown and a great medium size. Keebler loves other dogs and would make as a great sibling. Keebler is crate trained, housebroken, and is great on a leash. He even knows some basic commands!  While Keebler is friendly and outgoing, he would do best in a home without small children. This beautiful boy cannot wait to find his forever home!

Keebler is neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped. 

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life!

 In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.
name: Keebler

description:
Sparky is a super sweet older gentleman (approx 12-14) who was surrendered to rescue when his owner no longer could take care of him.  He would make a great companion as he loves attention!  

Sparky's foster says that he loves to snuggle on soft things . . . be it a dog bed, a stuffed animal or an item of clothing found on the floor.  He would prefer a quieter home to spend his golden years.  Sparky is good with other dogs, kids, cats and even goats and chickens!  He is housebroken and stays right by you outside, and then walks back to you when he is ready to go in. Being an older gentleman, he does need to go out a bit more than the younger guys, but goes right to the door to let you know. He is pretty quiet, and has the cutest waddle you ever did see!

Sparky was checked out by the vet and other than a heart murmur and a benign cyst, the doctor gave him a clean bill of health :-) He just needs a retirement home where he can be loved and spoiled. 

Sparkyâs adoption fee is $250. Applications can be found at www.snarrnortheast.org
name: Sparky

description:
Oso is 3-year-old, only 10 lbs, and a total charmer. He's great with other dogs, chill in general but also playful, well mannered, and very smart and aware. He loves to bond with special humans and would do best in a medium active home. His foster mom has only had him 24 hours and says: "Oso has kind eyes that draw you in for a wet nose kiss! He is super quiet and enjoys being perched up on the window sill to people watch and get familiar with the New York sounds. When heâs not on watch, heâs curled by your side â still alert, half asleep just in case thereâs a new sound he hasnât heard before and he doesnât want to miss it! Heâs still getting the hang of dog toys and the comfort of a dog bed but a soft blanket on the couch will do the trick. He is great on a leash, will either trail by your feet or eagerly strut in front when itâs not crowded. Oso loves to meet new people, he is comfortable with men and women, heâll take all of the rubs he can get. He seems housebroken with only a few accidents so far, and he mostly holds it until we get outside." Interested in adopting? Submit an application at socialteesnyc.org!

This animal is not at the Social Tees office (325 East 5TH Street) â all of our dogs and cats are in foster homes while they wait to find their forever families. :) If youâd like to apply to adopt this pet, please complete an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org.

PLEASE NOTE: Because we are a small team and receive hundreds of applications each week, we are unable to respond to every application and every inquiry email, but we do our best. Please have patience! If your application is approved, you will for sure hear from us. If you have questions, please take a look at the Adoption and Fostering FAQs etc. on our website as all common questions are answered there. Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we work to save these innocent lives!!

Adoption fees apply and cover spay/neuter surgery; up to date on vaccines at time of adoption; microchip; treated with defleaing, deworming, and demiting medication as necessary; and often more.
name: Oso

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

This girlâs name is Spirit and she has a lot of it. She is young at around one year old, and loves to play. She is all about a âspiritedâ game of tug-of-war and will even play fetch and bring it back...most of the time :) If there is no one available to play with her, she will toss the toys around herself and pounce on them. The âPuppy Spiritâ is strong in this one. And if you havenât figured it out yet, she loves toys! A full toy box is a must for this girl; and a person who doesnât mind toys scattered around. Spirit is a firm believer that toys are meant to be played with and she will get them all out to amuse herself during a play session. But donât get the idea that this girl stays âspiritedâ all of the time. Oh, no. She has her moments of play and will tuck her butt and get the zoomies outside like all puppies but she has the typical energy of any one- year old Pyr. Spirit loves to snuggle and will bury her head in a personâs lap while being petted. If a person sits on the floor, she will immediately move in for a hug. If a person lays on the floor she will lay on top for more snuggles. But donât worry, she wonât squish anyone. Spirit is a Pyr on the smaller side at 75-80 lbs. This girl is smart and loves to please her people. She is treat-motivated, already knows âsitâ and is housetrained. The command âcomeâ is more challenging like it is with a lot of Pyrs but she doesnât like to be outside by herself so when everyone else goes in, she is at the door wanting to come inside also. Spirit is great with other dogs but not with cats. She has always lived in an urban setting and has no problem doing her business on a leash so will be fine in a leash only home as long as there is a place she can run and play with other dogs (a four-foot fence is enough to hold her). She is a beautiful little girl with a playful, sweet and loving âspiritâ!
name: Spirit

description:
Dewey arrived at EHR back in 2011 & was adopted into a family who renamed from Bear. He has now been returned to our care in the hopes that he can find a more suitable placement for him.

Dewey would be perfect for a quiet, low traffic home without much company, as he can be territorial and owner-protective with strangers. From his foster, he is sweet and affectionate, perfectly house-mannered, walks nicely on the leash, knows basic obedience commands, and rides well in the car. He also was friendly with other dogs in foster and used to attend doggie daycare, so he should be able to live with a doggie sibling after meeting to make sure it's a good match.

This little guy is a senior who should be in a home, not a kennel run. Please consider fostering or adopting him! If you think you've got the right home environment for Dewey, please fill out an application & be sure to ask for him by name.
name: Dewey (formerly Bear)

description: this is Mia, 1 year old BOXER/ LAB mix. She is dog friendly and has a great temperament. She is in foster and available. 12/18/18 9:15 AM
name: Mia

description:
Jersey is a 1 yr old male staffy mix.  He is currently in a foster home with teens and another dog.  He is crate trained and house broken.  Jersey also has gone to puppy training classes, loves walks on the beach and hanging out in the pool!  

For an application, visit www.fbrrny.com or email kobemnstr@hotmail.com 

More pics of our avaialble pups can be seen at  www.facebook.com/furbabiesrescueandreferralinc
