description:
Groot had a tough start. No one taught him manners or how to keep his arousal in check, so he needs a foster family who can continue to work on his impulse control. Here is what he needs:
- a family in the suburbs or rural area with a fenced, secured yard. Why? Groot can be sound sensitive, so walks are great for him but having a safe yard to play will be beneficial.
- home should have a social dog that likes to play. Groot thrives on having a canine friend. He has spent time in a home with another pup and enjoys playing!
- a family willing to help continue the great improvements he has made with manners and impulse control. He is a fabulous student! Training protocol will be provided by Bully Project.
Here is what you should know about this hunk of a dog: 
- super smart
- crate-trained
- loves belly rubs 
- fully vaccinated and neutered
- wins over every person he meets
name: Groot

description:
Key, the one year old Catahoula Leopard Dog, is still waiting for his Forever Home. In addition to being gorgeous, he is also sweet, social, happy, goofy, intelligent, well-mannered... and deaf. His deafness hasn't slowed him down or held him back one bit. With the exception of using hand signals instead of voice commands, we treat this boy just like every other dog we've ever had, and he goes with the flow no matter where we are or what we're doing. He is housebroken, crate trained, walks nicely on leash with a harness, loves people of ALL ages, and dogs of ALL sizes. I would even feel comfortable saying he would be fine with dog-savvy cats after proper intros, as he's successfully met and interacted with several. He is medium energy, equally happy chasing a ball around the yard, going for a jog, sleeping in on a Saturday, or binge watching Netflix on the couch with you. This pup's sole wish in life is to be your best friend, your constant companion, your snuggle buddy, your adventure partner, your welcome committee, your everything.

"Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see."  - Mark Twain

If you think you are a good match for me, FIRST fill out an adoption application here: https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/
Our Website www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the adoption process. If you still have questions, you can reach out to my matchmaker: corey@bigfluffydogs.com.

NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT ALWAYS RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION DUE TO THE SHEER NUMBER WE GET DAILY. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE MIGHT NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. 

* BEHAVIOR DISCLAIMER: We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. All dogs will require supervision with children, other dogs, and cats/other animals regardless of whether or not we have stated that the dog is friendly towards kids, cats, other dogs, etc. Slow introductions to other animals in the home, and allowing for them to have a separate space will make for better relationships in the future. Most dogs need an adjustment period when transitioning into a new home and there may be potty accidents, even if we have stated the dog is housebroken. All dogs should be somehow confined separately (crate or separate room) when left home alone until you can be sure the dog is trustworthy left loose. Separation anxiety can manifest if a dog is left alone more than it is used to in it's new home. This can be worked through and we are here to help. Please do not give up on your new dog without reaching out to us first!

* PUPPY DISCLAIMER: Adopters considering a puppy must be prepared for:
1. Flexible schedules for potty training. Puppies can only "hold it" for one hour per month of age (ex. a 4 month old puppy can only go 4 hours without a potty break).
2. Crate training until the puppy is at least one year old, to prevent chewing on inappropriate things when you can't supervise.
3. Socialization: The more positive and varying experiences a puppy has the better, both in and out of your home.
4. Puppy behavior and life stages are equivalent to a human toddler. It takes at least a full year to have a calmer, well adjusted dog. 

Please do not consider adopting a puppy if you have not thoroughly thought through the pros and cons of having one. So many people end up returning them after 3-5 months because they didn't realize the amount of work involved in raising a puppy. Patience, appropriate toys, socialization, and obedience training are all musts. All are time consuming, and can be expensive. Adopters that want to have good dogs must be prepared to put the time and effort into training a dog. Any dog requires work and effort, but a well trained, well socialized dog is more than worth the effort put in to get them there.
name: Key

breeds: Caucasian Sheepdog / Caucasian Ovtcharka, Labrador Retriever
description:
Meet Logan!
And he isn't a dog. He is a sexy beast!
He is this deep-tricolor of salt & pepper grey, midnight black, and chocolate brown. With polka dots. Don't forget those delicate scrumptious polka dots. He has the most fortune-cookie-like ears I'd ever did see. And u just know those big chunky paws smell just like a bowl of Fritos. He's like the Bradley Cooper of dog world.

U would never know it but this beautiful boy that u are looking at did not come to us this way. Far from it. He came to us completely and thoroughly broken. I'm talking the pancake-to-the-ground-frozen-in-fear broken. The night he arrived in foster, it took his foster parents over an hour just to get him into the house from the car. A span of several feet. He couldn't even do that. He collapsed in fear, frozen to the ground, literally unable to move. My God - what happened to him that was so horrific, that the simple act of moving brings about a fear that paralyzes? That isn't fear, though. That is terror. Whoever did these horrid acts certainly was good at their job. Because they left him drained of trust and shattered into pieces.

But in true doggie form, he came back. With tons of love, and yummy peanut butter treats, and comfy couches...he came back. So so quickly, may I add. The main reason we believe it was so quick was because of his doggie foster brothers. They literally transformed him. That is why he must go to a home with at least one other dog. So yes, this is Logan now. Full of joy, and a big rubbery nose, and Frito paws, and just the sweetest grin and huggable body. Logan is crazy smart, super affectionate, and is such  social butterfly.

He is around 10 months old and believed to be a lab/cattle dog mix. Adoption fee is $550 and includes health exam, deworming, up to date vaccines, microchip, bloodwork, neuter, and 30 days of free pet health insurance.  

Applications can be found on our website www.RDRanimalrescue.org!
name: Logan

description:
This gorgeous boy is Cooper (originally Sarge) who was adopted 4 years ago by a family who now must return him. He is about 4 1/2 years old & currently weighs 94 pounds. He is a friendly, social boy who is truly a gentle giant. He loves to snuggle & is really great with adults & older kids.

There are 2 young children (under 3 years old) in Cooper's current home & recently Cooper has been snappish with them because he seems to have some pain in his legs. As a result, his family had a basic work up done for him with their vet (he tested negative for Lyme disease, heartworms, and an x-ray showed that his hips are in good shape, but his hind knees may be a source of his pain). He is on a 7day course of anti-inflammatory and pain relief to see if it helps him.

Cooper is fully obedience trained, housebroken, and truly an absolutely wonderful boy. He would do great in a home with no kids, or older kids (who wouldn't startle him). He doesn't attack cats, but he does chase them (he was living with 2 cats, and they mostly avoided him). He would be fine with a smaller dog, but is threatened by larger dogs and wouldn't do well with them.

Do you have a place in your heart & home for this sweet gentle giant? If so, please fill out an application for him & be sure to mention his name, COOPER!
name: Cooper (SARGE)

description: Don't let the age fool you, Boots acts nothing like that number and is beyond eager to explore the world with one lucky family. At 10 years old, this vivacious senior is still very young at heart and has so much love and many years to give a loving household. Not only does Boots refuse to grow old, he cherishes every single moment he spends with staff and volunteers. Romping around, chasing sticks, taking it all in, Boots absolutely enjoys his one-on-one time. Speaking of sticks, Boots loves anything he can chew, so much so, he doesn't like to share or give them up. Adopters should practice safe trade outs so he learns how to be more polite with valuables. He is very receptive to training, so we are sure he will be a good student. Goofy and unforgettable, don't let a simple number deter you from meeting this charming older fella. Who knows what a simple meet and greet can bring? Maybe a new friend for the family.
name: Boots

description:
Hi! My name is Super Sweet Sherrie and I am looking for a loving, forever home.  I was rescued from the streets of Puerto Rico by the President of the rescue and her daughter where I was abandoned and left to fend for myself.  I was so excited and relieved to be rescued.  I knew things were about to get alot better for me :)).  My rescuer loved and cared for me until I was ready to take my liberation flight.

My foster family in Brooklyn, NY says I am a SUPER sweet dog :).  Here is what they say about me :).  Sherrie is super sweet and snuggly. She always wants to know what you're doing, and she feels it's important that everyone stay together in the same room at all times. If you get up for more than five seconds, she selflessly volunteers to keep your pillow warm. She loves toys and likes 
to make sure she has every last one of them with her before she lies 
down. While she's still adjusting to the bustle of the big city, she's 
good on a leash and enjoys walks, and she loves frolicking in the park.

I am 1 year and 2 months old, 12 lbs., spayed, fully vetted and vaccinated.

If you are interested in learning more about me please email merylwright@aol.com.

Can't wait to meet you.  Love and Kisses Super Sweet Sherrie :))
name: Super Sweet Sherrie

description:
Thunder is a handsome 4 year old German Shepherd/Malamute/Wolf mix. He can be aloof and standoffish with strangers, but very affection when he warms up, to the point of being a big goofball! Thunder is a quick learner and knows several commands including sit, down, and spin. He is a very high energy dog and would do best with an experienced, confident owner willing to participate in activities like walking, jogging, and hiking. 

Thunder can be food aggressive, especially over raw food, but is being professionally trained to correct this. He was not socialized to other dogs until he arrived at our rescue, and we have noticed he is awkward around other dogs and has problems communicating, but has not shown any real aggression. He requires a fenced in outdoor enclosure that is at least six feet in height. He was raised inside, but would not settle down or relax in the house. 

Please no small pets such as small dogs or cats. Thunder is part wolf and will only be adopted to areas where wolfdogs are legal to own. 

If you're interested in Thunder, please read our adoption requirements first at; http://www.howlingwoods.org/adopt_a_wolf_adoption_requirements.html

then submit an application at; http://www.howlingwoods.org/wolf_adoption_adopt_a_wolf_application.php

or contact us by calling (732) 534-5745

Do not inquire about or apply for Thunder if you live in any the following States: Delaware, Maryland, Pennsylvania, New York, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Maine.  Wolfdogs are illegal to possess in these States.
name: Thunder

description: 1 Nov 2018: This handsome hunk is Aiden, an easy-going, 3 year-old boy. Aiden looks to be a lab mix. He is dog friendly and amazing with all people. He even gets along well with cats!! Aiden walks nicely on leash and has good manners. He would make a great addition to just about any household. And did we mention how handsome he is??? Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Aiden

description:
My name is CLEO and I'm a petite 2y F Brown/Black Lab/Pit X. I'm 50 lbs of PURE MILK CHOCOLATE SWEETNESS.  I was surrendered by my owner due to "moving". I was living with a cat, a yorkie and a lizard. I'm a beautiful silly happy girl with great energy.  Always smiling, I'm very sociable and friendly to all. I'm still a puppy and need structured daily exercise. My owner kept me indoors alot so I'm still getting used to walking on a leash and almost housebroken, but I'm a very smart student so I'm quick to learn and eager to please.  I'm great with dogs big and small so I would LOVE to be with another dog my size so I could get all my ya ya's out and play play play! I love balls and will fetch all day but I'm fine entertaining myself tossing toys up in the air and catching them. I would love to be with someone/couple/family that are active and like to be outdoors running, biking, hiking. I'm just a GEM of a DOG and will be your LOYAL BFF!! Come meet/adopt me today!

For more info/app; pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Cleo

My  mom, a 20 year old working college student, loves me so much that she knows I need a new mom or dad that has the time to give me the mental and physical stimulation I need
 
I am very curious. I like going out in the backyard and taking long walks on a leash but do get a little distracted  Iâm trying to get the hang of the it. 
 
 I like to play and share my toys with other dogs but Iâm still learning to share my bones. I  like my belly rubbed and love to give lots of kisses

description:
Atka is a beautiful husky of only 2 years old . This sweetheart ended up as so many other huskies in the kill shelter . (Probably he has shepherd mix in him)

So many people want these dogs for their beauty of because they were used in populair Hollywood movies . Huskies are a wonderful breed but they are definitely NOT for beginners. They are very high energy , vocal and escape artist .

They need constant stimulation and their daily exercise.

we only adopt our huskies for this reason to husky experienced owners.

Atka is not really aggressive to other dogs but vocal , he does not like cats .

He is very playful, a lover and intelligent .

Atka is located in Middle Island NY

We would love to see this boy next to the Christmas table .

Are you an experienced husky owner and you would like to become his new family then please apply today by filling in the adoption application on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we will send you one
name: Atka

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Bing comes to rescue with rear leg injuries at 3-4 months old and 23 pounds. Sadly, his injuries were so horrible that one leg needed to be amputated. Bing is with our veterinary partners receiving treatments and recovering. Bing is up to date on shots (age appropriate) and will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home. He is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. Bing would do best in a home without stairs as he is a tripod and his other back leg required surgery as well. If you do have stairs, they should be very few. If you would like to adopt Bing and invite this special little boy to become a family member, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Bing

description:
Polo is a big guy in size and heart. He has done great on our staff squad walks with his furry friends. He can get a bit excited at times, and because of his size would need an owner who is able to walk him without an issue :) He's really just a big guy that sometimes doesn't know his size! Fill out our dog adoption application online at pawscrossedny.org 

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.

Having Brady by your side as your jogging and hiking pal will make for endless hours of happy trails.

DOB Dec 23, 2017

description:
CAN YOU MAKE ROOM IN YOUR HEART FOR ONE MORE? HOW ABOUT IN YOUR HOME?

URGENT, URGENT, WE NEED HELP! We need our village to come together and help us right away. We are in the midst of the holiday dumping season, a terrible time of year for animals, who find themselves alone. For some reason the season of holiday giving for certain owners means GIVING UP and throwing dogs out of their home. We have had a huge influx of dogs coming in (20 plus dogs since the Thanksgiving holiday), with many having no place to go. We are now on RED ALERT and need all available homes (whether foster or adoptive). There is surely always room for one more, around the tree or your table. Please take in at least one homeless dog and help to save a life! We need a Christmas Miracle ... we need that Miracle to be YOU. Please email us at rescue@nyabandonedangels.com or complete an online application at www.nyabandonedangels.com if you are able to help. We are at SITUATION CRITICAL now, this is a genuine RED ALERT!
name: FOSTER HOMES NEEDED

 He will be sporting a new leash and collar to his new furever home within our adoptable states: NY, NJ, CT, RI, MA, VT, NH, PA, DE, MD, VA

Hanna is a 9-10 month old, female, Pit Mix that weighs 45 lbs. She was pulled from a local shelter when she was out of time. This sweet baby is a ball of energy. She loves to play and cuddle and play and cuddle all over again! She has a head tilt that is to die for and her expressive ears melt your heart. She is good with other dogs but will do best in a home without cats unless the cats are used to energetic dogs.  Hanna is crate trained and house trained. She does need to continue to work on her leash training. She is just so eager to meet and see everyone! Hanna loves to play with her foster sisters and would do great in a home with another playful dog. Hanna is spayed, up to date with vaccinations, heartworm negative and microchipped.

If you would like to meet HANNA, or for more information, please email PetRescueOfMercer@gmail.com

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEB SITE to view our adoption policies and/or complete an online, non-binding adoption application. www.petrescueofmercer.org

description:
Diamond is a sweet and precious little female am staff mix. Her DOB is 12/3/16.

My crazy little brother tries to steal all the attention but I sit by your side like a gentleman and wait for my snuggles. You want to know how I feel about snuggles? Well letâs put it this way...I would choose snuggles over just about everything! (Even food!) I am what u would call a calmer puppy if they exist. I have 2 human foster sisters (4 and 7) and happily just sit in their laps in all my glory. I have a little spot on my nose but my foster mom is currently treating it and itâs already getting better. Okay then, line starts here! ? 
If interested in adopting me please send applications to Chrystal at Rescueme0116@gmail.com

description:
Meet Tango!  He is a beautiful 4 year old male GSP.   
 
Tango has had a lonely start to life.  He was owned by someone who kept him in a kennel for about 15 hours a day for the first 3.75 years of his life. Her Dad told a coworker about Tango but didn't give him a lot of information other than he was kenneled all day long and needed a new home. 
 
The coworker went and picked him up but was not prepared for the hyper, now not in a kennel pup. He has had Tango for just over a month now.  He tried to help and did the right thing to get him out of a kennel, but unfortunately given his job, and his wife about to have a baby, its not a right fit for them or Tango - he needs someone who can give him attention and training.
 
We had a volunteer meet him and we got all his vetting updated (except a neuter, which we will handle whether before adoption or at the time of adoption).
 
Tango likes to bark on a car road, it's an excited type of bark.  He hasn't gotten out much in his first 3.75 years, so now when he gets out he's a bit over stimulated, but we can't blame him!   
 
Tango is living with 2 dogs, a retriever and a lab.  Tango tries to mount them, we are hoping once he's neutered and settled into a routine he'll stop that behavior.  
 
He's good with kids and regularly is with a 7 year old boy. 
 
He does jump a bit but it's from excitement at first meeting.  He does settle down but he needs someone that can pay attention to him and give him some structure/stability, he's not getting nearly enough exercise that is needed for a young male GSP.
 
Tango likes to chew up his toys, but isn't destructive in the house.  
 
There was someone who took Tango out to try and hunt him and he did amazingly.  Has a great drive and not gun shy. Probably would make a great hunter with some training. 
 
He pulled on the leash A LOT but again he was pretty happy to be out and about. 
 
He is house trained and will tell you when he needs to go outside.
 
Overall, he's a handsome nice , friendly boy.  He just needs a home to give him the attention and exercise he needs, along with some basic structure/stability and he'll blossom into an awesome furry family member!
 
If you are interested in Tango, please complete our adoption application on our website:  www.gsprescuenj.com.
name: Tango*adoption pending*

description:
Pittie, needs a Home!
New Hartford, NY, Oneida County

DARLIN' - A name, a term of endearmentâ¦.so deserved for this sweet 62 lb, 5 year old girl. Surrendered to our care when her person lost their home, Darlin' lost everything too â her person, her home, her safety. Sheâs an amazing dog who is not only housetrained, she heads to the edge of the sidewalk to take care of her business. 

Her leash manners are good; she pulls only when there is a new scent that canât wait to be investigated. Darlin comes with rockstar comments from her former person: sheâs friendly to all people, loves kids, loves baths and will jump into the tub on her own, loves dogs of both genders but prefers males to females, is not a fan of kitties, sleeps on her own bed but will sometimes sneak onto her personâs bed in the middle of the night, loves to jump and give kisses, loves belly rubs, and knows sit (âput it downâ). 

"I loved my time with this sweetheart â she is everything her former owner said and more. Sheâs gorgeous, sweet, playful, snuggly, takes treats gently, has a great smile and gorgeous eyes, is beautifully groomed, loved playing with a plush toy, posed for photos like a pro. Seriously, if you are still reading this and not rushing over to meet her you are missing out on a gem. Darlin' â her name and a very deserved term of endearment, but donât just take my word for itâ¦..see for yourself."

Darlin is spayed, up to date on shots, and microchipped. This happy, healthy, darling girl DARLIN is ready to meet you! ?

--------------------------------------------------------------
To learn more about Darlin', please contact AmsterDog at amsterdog@gmail.com, or fill out our online application at http://amsterdog.org/adoptionfoster-application/ .

Thank you for caring about a pet in need!
name: Darlin'

description:
Looking for a wonderful family pet? Please check out this pup with the wagging tail, he'd be so happy to make your acquaintance!

Zeus was adopted as a young pup and renamed Tayto. Unfortunately, he has now been returned to EHR as his family can no longer care for him. He is an energetic boy who would love to have a fenced-in yard. Tayto would benefit from a person who likes to walk or hike - he'd be great with an active owner or family!

Tayto lived with children and is great with them. He isn't around other dogs often but his owners say that he is fine when he sees them and has been to the dog park. Tayto loves to play fetch and is playful and fun to be with.

Please consider adopting Tayto - he is already house and crate trained so he's in "move in" condition! Be sure to mention his name when you fill out your adoption application - TAYTO/ZEUS!
name: Tayto Zeus

description:
Buddy is a lab/pit mix and is approximately seven months old (as of 9/7/18).  Buddy is a victim of an irresponsible âbackyard breederâ who thought he could make money by breeding his dogs and selling the puppies.  As usual things didnât work out as planned and Buddy, mom, dad and several of his siblings found themselves abandoned.  
Because Buddy was never socialized properly during his formative months everything is new and scary for him.  He will need a quiet and patient home with a family that has the time to commit to working with him to help him gain confidence.  He has been at his foster home for a full month now and has made tremendous strides.  Buddy loves other dogs and a home with another playful dog would be great.  He is also wonderful with the resident cat.  At already 50 pounds Buddy will be a larger dog but that does not stop him from curling up in your lap.  âSweetâ seems to be the common word to describe Buddy anytime someone new meets him.  
If you are interested in filling out an application on Buddy please complete a dog/puppy application by copying and pasting this URL http://companioncritters.homestead.com/Dog_Adopt_App.html
name: Buddy

description:
Miss Rico is one lucky lady! She is a 3 year old Shar Pei mix who was rescued in the nick of time from a kill shelter in North Carolina. Currently, Miss Rico is working on coming out of her shell as she adjusts to life in her foster home. She is very shy and needs some time to warm up to people, but once she does, the affection is endless. On Miss Rico's first day with her foster family she was so skittish â even a blowing leaf startled her. Once she became comfortable in her foster home her playful nature came out! She plays very well with other dogs and would do best in a home with another dog - Miss Rico finds confidence from being part of a pack.

Miss Rico is learning and growing more confident each day! She is highly trainable and is motivated to learn. Miss Rico is fully crate trained - she will go in quickly when asked and will often hang out in there with the door open if she wants some quiet time.

Miss Rico also is a cuddlebug who loves snuggling with blankets and playing with toys. She also loves romping around the yard with other dogs! She is a very sweet pup who just needs someone with the patience to help her get adjusted to her new forever home!

Check out Miss Ricoâs adventures on Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/ricosroadtorescue/ and ask her any questions in the comments section of her photos or message her on the Instagram app!
name: Miss Rico Bladen

description:
A shelter favorite!  Bandit is a shy, sweet dog that just adores other dogs.  He is timid with new people but once he knows you, he will be right by your side.  He gets excited with other dogs and looks forward to playing with them.  He would do best in a home with an outgoing dog and a family willing to be patient until he is comfortable in his new surroundings.  Bandit came to us at 80 pounds but is slimming down and is currently at 68 pounds, with another 15 or so to go.  Due to Bandit being a flight risk when he is scared, a physical fenced yard is required to keep him safe.  

Bandit is currently only available at our Ringwood location at 260 Margaret King Avenue.  Please email us for a convenient time or stop by 8-9 am/pm or 3-5 weekdays.  With a little TLC, this is a wonderful dog.

She has had this tumor for over a year and we are in awe that this poor girl has been suffering with this condition for so long. She is with our vet partner and will now get the long overdue medical treatment that she desperately needs. Despite the awful pain she has endured, Lindsay is the most precious and loving girl. We canât wait to find her an amazing forever family where she can be loved and pampered from here on out. Lindsay is wonderful with people of all ages and other dogs! Only 2 years old and suffering horribly with a rectal prolapse and a prolapsed uterus. We welcomed Jade to rescue and rushed her to our 24/7 emergency specialists for care and treatment. She has gotten surgery to fix her condition and is doing wonderful! Despite the pain and neglect she has endured she remains such a sweet and loving girl. Jade will be up to date on shots and spayed when medically appropriate and stable to do so. She is friendly with all people including kids, and other dogs! She is a beautiful and amazing dog, and we hope to find her a forever home where she will be loved for the rest of her life! description:
A very pregnant dog was found and brought to a vet's office where she gave birth to 8 beautiful puppies.  Their Mom is Sadie Grace who is also available for adoption.  They have all had excellent care and now it is time for everyone to leave the vet's office and find their new families.  There are 4 males (Bombay, Jameson, Marlin & Skittles)  and 4 females (Dahlia, Marigold, Noelle & Tulip).  They are all either black and tan or all black.  These siblings are just about 8 weeks old and 10-12 pounds.  Please help Marigole find the loving home she deserves.

***You must provide a current vet reference***

If you are interested in adopting, we encourage you to please submit an application on our website today so that we can try and process and pre-approve any potential adopters prior to our next adoption event.

PLEASE USE THIS LINK TO SUBMIT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION. WE ONLY ACCEPT ADOPTION APPLICATIONS THROUGH OUR WEBSITE. ANY OTHERS WILL NOT BE PROCESSED.
Application link here: http://www.oscaranimalrescue.org/oscar-1-application.html

Adoption Process:
1.Fill out an application
2.Meet & Greet
3.Adoption contract & adoption fee
Marigold's adoption fee is $400 each. For puppies that have not been fixed (due to being too young) we charge $400 with the condition that when they are fixed $50 is refunded. This covers all age-appropriate shots, vetting & microchipping.

**If you are coming to an adoption event to see a certain dog/cat, please email ahead of time to make sure that dog/cat will be there that day. Please email 1-2 days before the event, as some animals are placed during the week and our list is constantly changing.
For a list of upcoming pet adoption events go to: www.OscarAnimalRescue.org

One Step Closer Animal Rescue is a 501c3 non-profit organization. Donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE to the extent allowed by law. If you would like to make a donation to help us rescue more animals please send donations to PO Box 248, Sparta, NJ 07871. Please make your check payable to O.S.C.A.R.. Thank you for helping us save as many lives as we can.

Don't forget to "Like Us" on Facebook

Miro's adopter needs to be willing to work with one of our rehab trainers to help him work through this aggression and set up structure and boundaries for him).

However, if you are unable to attend the event, please email infor@koreank9rescue.org to schedule a private interview and meeting with the dog. Thank you!

Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org

He loves human attention and affection, making him the perfect family or companion dog. Cole has been well-socialized with other small dogs and has been doing well with paper training. Cole would love a home with breed experience and a fenced yard.

Additional information and/or medical records for this rescue pet are available and will be reviewed in person should we choose to move forward in scheduling a meet nâ greet. In the meantime, please feel free to follow us on follow us on Instagram (animal_rescue_r_us) and visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/arrusadopt for more pictures and posts from his/her foster family. 

HELP US, HELP THEM! Animal Rescue R Us is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. We do not receive county, state or federal funding and rely solely on donations. These donations help offset the cost of routine veterinary care, medical expenses, and other necessities while the rescue animal is in our care. description: Gaze upon the lovely Liam! He is a handsome 3 year old Pit Mix. He and his sister were found abandoned in a basement left in crates. They were severely malnourished, covered in their own excrement, and eager for a second chance at life. Liam's sister has already found her forever home and now, it is his turn. He is spunky, fun-loving, energetic, and affectionate. Liam needs a home with someone who is patient,kind,and home all the time to help him cope with his separation anxiety. Liam is a gentle soul,who is looking for his person. He loves to go for walks,and go exploring. Will you be Liam's second chance?
name: Liam

description: Echo is a handsome boy who is about 5 years old.  He knows several commands, rides well in the car, and enjoys hiking. Be sure to watch his video!
name: Ecko

description:
Don't let the mean-mug fool you!  Beaver is a really nice boy!  He's super friendly and affectionate, and well-behaved.  He was found as a weeks-old baby in a garbage bin in Thailand last December 2017.  He is now a beautiful 11-month old boy, very affectionate and friendly to humans and other dogs, and all around, a great boy. Beaver weighs around 40 lbs.   

Beaver just arrived in NYC at the end of November 2018.  He has been a little bit depressed since arriving.  He had an adopter who unfortunately had to bail out at the last minute, so he has been at a paid sitter.  He has been feeling kind of lonely and is not being stimulated the way he needs to be.  He LOVES other dogs so much, all sizes, all personalities, so, if you have a dog or have neighbors and friends with dogs and live in a dog-friendly area, Beaver would thrive with you.  We took him to a dog run in Brooklyn this past weekend and he had the time of his life and recovered temporarily from his depression.  

He's a good boy--easy to love and easy to care for, never aggressive, always gentle and friendly.  Please consider either fostering or adopting this sweet young boy. 

Please contact FurRealNYC@gmail.com for more information.
name: Beaver

Eric is our 5 year old Labrador Retriever mix.....Eric is currently in foster, if you'd like to meet him please email foster@nyanimalrescue.org

Eric is adjusting well to life in his new foster home! His foster mom writes: He's learning new commands and is a GREAT walker and easy to put into his crate. He loves treats and is starting to understand that Kongs with peanut butter in them are pretty great too. He's incredibly smart and learns quickly.

Eric is neutered, dewormed, treated to prevent fleas & ticks and is up to date with vaccinations. His adoption fee is $300.00, plus $8.50 for the dog license if you are a resident of NYC, and he'll get one free exam at our vet's office, one free month of pet health insurance and a microchip. Eric is currently in foster, if you'd like to meet him please email foster@nyanimalrescue.org

Sean Casey Animal Rescue

between Ft Hamilton Pkwy & Caton Ave
Brooklyn, NY 11218
718.436.5163

description: This little sweetie is Beena. She is a special needs baby. Beena is blind & partially deaf. She came in as a stray. She is very sweet & gets around well. She is approx 5-6 years old, she loves going for walks, she likes dogs & cats & actually likes to play with cats! She is good with kids. Beena is very playful at times! Come meet her! She is a very special girl.
name: Beena

description: Put your hand on my paw, I will never let you go Put your trust in me, I will never, never leave you Put your heart in my heart I will forever give you love Put my paw in your hand I will always keep you from harm All I ask for is love
name: Hennessey

description:
Astra , our sweet little lady pulled from a high kill shelter in the deep South of Texas . Skinny and no fur ... we had to wait before we could make pictures of her .

Astra needed some time to become the beauty back she was and today she is shining like a little star .

This baby is 2 years old and gets along with dogs (a meet and greet is required) she does not like cats .

Astra is an absolutely love doll and wants to be with you all the time. Be prepared for many gentile kisses .

She is a picture perfect lady and I can only brag about her .

We hope to find soon a great family who will love her even more then we already do .

Astra deserves a new life with wonderful people who will spoil her and love her .

She is located in Middle Island NY .

To become her new family please apply today by filling in the application on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com
name: Astra

description: He's a solid large bluish gray mush who loves walks, playing with water and cozy bedtime.  He will be a loyal, loving guy to his person.
name: Greco

description:
Meet Eclipse, a handsome Black Lab who is very sweet and gentle. Unfortunately, Eclipse has not had the best life in his 5 years. He was picked up as a stray by a rural animal control and taken back to their facility. One picture shows Eclipse in this enclosure - the dog bed is broken and upside down, the dogs are never taken out of their runs to be walked and the runs are even washed with the dogs still inside them! It is not a good place for a dog to land.

When a rescuer saw this dog shaking in the corner of the enclosure, they knew this dog's only chance was to help him get out of there. Eclipse was microchipped but the owner did not want the dog back, and it was later discovered that the owner had been charged with abuse. One can only imagine the life that Eclipse endured.

At first Eclipse is shy, but when he is shown kindness and love, his true personality comes out. Eclipse needs to learn how to trust again, and he desperately wants to be loved, he will warm up more quickly to a woman than a man. He is not aggressive at all, just scared, but he will keep his tail between his legs until he feels more comfortable.

Eclipse will need to be walked on a leash because the rescuers have discovered that he can jump over six foot fences so he cannot be left outside without supervision. With a little patience Eclipse will make a wonderful companion. Eclipse is a big boy at around 70 pounds, and appears to be a purebred black Lab.

Eclipse was tested with other dogs and even a puppy and he did great. After all that Eclipse probably has gone through there is no aggression in this big boy, just shyness.

Eclipse has been neutered and fully vetted, and just needs a family that will love and appreciate the great dog he is. A quieter home without young children would probably be best for Eclipse. Please give this handsome boy a chance, and fill out an application on him today. Be sure to mention his name, ECLIPSE SCAS!
name: Eclipse SCAS

description:
With a face like that , how could we say no. Yes another one who landed up on the kill list .

Begging eyes ...who are saying please get me out of here ... !!!!

And that's what we did. Aranelle is safe under our wings and is ready to meet her new family .

This sweet, adorable lady of 1.5 year old is good with cats and dogs .

Aranella needs a home where she feels loved , a family that will never betray her again . A place where she never have to be afraid to end up in a kill shelter again .

She is located in Middle Island NY
name: Aranella

description:
MEET SPICE!

As sweet as pumpkin pie with a hint of cinnamon - meet Spice! This beautiful 10.5 year old pit bull mix was surrendered to Philadelphia's animal control shelter because her former owners didn't have the appropriate space for a dog. She lucked out though and caught the eye of a City of Elderly Love foster family before her timestamp for euthanasia was up. She's now happily settled into foster care and ready to find her true forever family!

Spice is just as sweet as her name implies. She loves to curl up at your feet while watching TV, will snuggle up under a blanket if you let her, and while loves a good walk around the block, is also happy to romp in the yard and curl back up inside. She lived with kids and cats in her previous home and is currently living with a Chocolate Lab in foster care. She gets along with him wonderfully and loves snuggling with her foster brother on the couch, floor, really anywhere he curls up.. she'll scoot on over to be next to him. She'd do well in a home with another easy-going dog but would also be happy to get all of your attention! Spice has only met one cat at an adoption event since coming to the rescue and was very interested in him so may do best in a home without cats or with dog-savvy cats with a slow introduction. Spice also previously lived with kids in her former home who reported her to have always loved kids. Plus she has met kids at our events - she's sweet, appropriate and just lays down and enjoys the attention! Spice sure knows how to attract a crowd. Perhaps is her amazing pittie smile or just the natural warmth of her personality. Whatever it is, she's quick to make friends everywhere she goes! Spice is crate trained and housebroken too!

Spice has been evaluated by our vet after leaving the shelter. Besides being treated for a UTI and needing a couple rounds of dewormer, she's proven to be a healthy girl. She's scheduled to be spayed and have a mammary mass removed soon. Spice may be older, but looks and acts like a younger dog. She's healthy and ready to be your baby! 

Spice is available for adoption through City of Elderly Love. She is vaccinated, microchipped and will be spayed prior to going to her forever home. She is also heartworm and lymes disease negative. Interested in adopting her? Visit www.cityofelderlylove.org to complete an online adoption questionnaire or email us at info@cityofelderlylove.org!
name: SPICE!

description: Welcome to a Badass Puppy Palooza, yâall! Meet sweet Spiced Peaches! Here's the backstory: when we saved Available Pam Ewingâs life on our #bigasstxrescue we also saved 7 more! Congrats to proud mama Pam Ewing !Take in the southern dessert potluck pups who are ALL available for adoption. To adopt one of these pups or Available Pam Ewing visit Bit.ly/BadassApp
name: Spiced Peaches

description:
Bella and her siblings Belle, Buddy, Annabell, Thompson, and
Jake

all
found
themselves at a kill shelter just before Hurricane Florence was about to hit. This shelter had outside dog kennels and they needed to be moved. Some of the siblings also had hip issues and needed immediate surgery to relieve their pain.

Since coming to NJ, Bella has been living with a foster family and is really doing great. She is great with kids and other dogs, though we are not sure how she'd be with cats. She loves to cuddle and is especially snuggly at night, preferring to sleep on the bed with you. She is recovering well from her first surgery hip and has the second scheduled very soon. A very sweet pup, she loves to play and is eager to please, but is not happy away from her humans and so would do better in a home where she is not alone for very long during the day.

If you are interested in giving this sweet girl a home, please apply now and mention BELLA BLADEN!
name: Bella Bladen

description:
This little pixie is just waiting to be spoiled.  I think her most favorite pastime is cuddling.  Rae is a five pound four year old chihuahua who arrived recently and sheâs hoping not to be let down by humans again.  A dainty little girl, sheâs fine with other dogs and with kids but we would place her in a home with adults or older children respectful of her size.  We see Rae in a home where someone is home a good part of the day and who can give her to attention she so deserves.  Rae is spayed and up to date with vaccinations.  Good things really do come in small packages!
If you think Rae would be a good match for you, please complete our online application at www.pounddogfounddog.org or contact Peggy_Kinahan@msn.com for more information.
name: Rae *Adopted!

description:
Diamond is a nice bluenose 4.5 years old who wound up at the shelter because of an eviction.  Sheâs a quiet well mannered dog who likes people and other dogs. She loves walks and is good on leash.  She is not a barker and has very nice kennel manners.  
She did live with children however we do not know if they were young. 
She weighs 50 lbs and will make some lucky person a wonderful companion
name: Diamond

description:
Bambi is an adorable girl looking for a special forever home.  We believe she is a cross between a Chihuahua and a Whippet, and that she is between 2-3 years old.  She weights in at a just-right 15 pounds.  Bambi was dumped at a high kill shelter with her two tiny newborn puppies, and was a very good mom.  Her foster mom reports that she loves food, sunbathing and walks.  She also loves other dogs, and it is required that she go to a home where she will have a well-balanced canine companion.  Since Bambi has a high flight instinct, she will need a fenced yard to play in.

Bambi will do best in a quieter household without young children.  She is very sweet, but is shy at first with people.  For the right patient and gentle owner, she is very affectionate once she opens up.  

Bambi is UTD on vaccines and is spayed.  Her adoption fee is $375.  Adoption applications can be found at https://snarrnortheast.org/adopt-app/.

If a dog is  listed on Petfinder, they are still available. We do not go on a first come-first serve basis, but on the best fit for the family and most importantly, the dog. We are taking our best guess on breed based on physical appearance.
name: Bambi

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi my name is Clairice and my sister, brother and I are looking for our forever homes. We are your typical fun loving puppies. We will be available soon and will be vetted for our age and also come with a spay/neuter contract. You can apply for us at www.allmuttsmatter.org!!
name: Clairice

description:
Delilah must have champagne bubbles streaming through her veins and arteries.. she is that bubbly & effusively joyous! She arrived that way... we didn't have to work any magic to coax Delilah out of her shell!! She burst onto the scene greeting everyone like beloved family members.. she was at home here the moment she set her first paw on the ground.. Her glistening sleek coat with beautiful white makings was all kinds of shimmery housing that wonderfully wiggly body of hers.. Delilah has amazingly bright, clear, soft, light brown eyes..  because her warm heart and kind nature shine through them!

Delilah loves toys like no other! She takes her job as The Head of Toy Destroying Department very seriously and will not allow one un-destroyed plush toy pass by. She'll reach into the toy basket, take each toy out one by one and bring them over to her bed to pull apart. In the yard, Delilah's ultimate fav toy goes to the swirly shaped football. She will chance this thing all day! She loves fetch, especially with that big rubber orange chuck it ball. She will bring the ball right back and drop it at your feet.

This stunning and yet goofy girl is sweet like she'd been nothing but loved & treasured every day of her young life...Delilah is a loyal doggie and will always stick by your side. She absolutely adores going on adventures with her person! Delilah wins our ADELE award for being so organically kind and happy! 

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Delilah

description: Will was found as a stray and ended up in an overcrowded Texas shelter. He LOVES to be cuddled and carried. He loves everyone he meets, and he's good with other dogs. He needs a home where he can be with his people ALOT--a stay at home mom would be great! He will be a fun little buddy to have around! Apply to adopt WILL LONESTAR at www.EHRDOGS.org!
name: Will Lonestar

description:
12/15/18

Meet Bruno! About a one year old male (neutered and up to date on shots), who is full of life. Bruno found himself in a high kill shelter with only a day to get out. A network of rescuers bound together to help free this boy. He has so much love to give. He know his basic commands and is use to routine. He lives with many dogs and cats (but he like to chase the cats) but gets along well.  He also lives with a family with kids. Bruno can get excited and forget his manners but this boy learns quick! Although he seems like a knuckle head, if youâre offering food heâs listening. Bruno is only looking for a family to love and a yard to run in!



11/12/18

Meet Bruno!

Stay tuned for information



Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Bruno Rocky H Wilson - a dapper guy!

description:
This handsome 1 year old pup with beautiful blue eyes had been working on learning some new tricks! He could use some more work with housebreaking, as he lived his puppyhood mostly in a crate. He now knows âsit,â âstay,â and âwatch me.â He likes to play with other dogs his size. Come meet Webster and see if heâs a perfect fit for your family! 

For more information, please call the Pike County Humane Society at  (570)296-7654 or send Email to pikecountyhs@gmail.com.Please Note: Petfinder listings may not always be up to date! Please call the shelter to make sure this dog is still available. All dogs and cats are micro-chipped for their protection.
name: Webster

description:
This happy dog is Ruby, and she is so photogenic. I love taking pictures of her because she has such an aura about her. She was rescued from an abandoned house in Far Rockaway with another dog during Hurricane Sandy by fellow rescuer Christine D. Ruby is a sweetie who has a playful side to her. She is about 5 years old now, and weighing in about 40lbs. She is always happy to see you and will shower you with affection, giving kisses all over your face. Ruby has a lot of energy and could probably win an Olympic sprint! So she would make a great running or exercise partner. She is a pocket pittie and not too big so she would be perfect for any home situation. Ruby needs some training as she can be a little mouthy during play or getting too excited. She would do best as the only pet but that is even better because you'll get to spend that quality one on one time with her. Let's find Ruby a home!

Email harescue1@aol.com or haar13@aol.com/harescue1@aol.com or 16paws@outlook.com to foster.

The application can be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAAâ¦/AdoptionApplication/index.html
name: Ruby

breeds: American Staffordshire Terrier, Pit Bull Terrier
description: Meet Ms. Promise - this active gal is 3 years old and looking for a home where she can go on hikes and car rides.  Promise is dog social but she should be the only pet.  She knows all her manners and will be a great snuggle buddy - she is also a great kisser! To meet Promise please email adopt@pi4w.com
name: Promise

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.12 week old Shepherd Mix good with all
name: Star

description:
Hi! My name is Lovable Lacey and I am looking for a loving, forever home.  I was rescued from the streets of Puerto Rico where I was abandoned and left to fend for myself.  I was so excited and relieved to be rescued.  I knew things were about to get alot better for me :)).  My rescuer loved and cared for me until I was ready to take my liberation flight.

My foster family says I am a SUPER sweet dog :)  I am very loving to everyone I meet. I am a perfect combination of playful yet calm.  Once I am done playing I love cuddling on the couch to give and receive lots of love and affection :)).  

Lovable Lacey is 2 years old, 45 lbs., spayed, fully vetted and vaccinated.

If you are interested in learning more about me please email merylwright@aol.com.

Can't wait to meet you.  Love and Kisses, Lovable Lacey:))
name: Lovable Lacey

description:
Looking for the perfect family addition for the new year? Meet Jingle! Heâs a 6 week old bulldog mix. Heâs a sweet little guy that loves to explore and heâs a champion snuggler as well. Think you could love him forever? Email WoofLoveBeth@gmail.com for an application.


Adoption donation of $335 includes age appropriate vaccinations and spay/neuter when pup is approximately 5-6 months of age. 
Woof Love Rescue is a registered 501c3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible. 

*** Breed determination in most cases is often based on the limited history typically available for most rescued animals. We try to be as accurate as possible with the information we have and the Rescue assessment of the pup.
name: Jingle

description:
Look at this happy boy! Shaggy's a bright and energetic guy with a cute underbite, approximately 4-6 years young, and he'd love to share some of his happy energy with you! He'd love a home that can keep him active and entertained and mentally stimulated- and can help him learn some tricks and commands! He's fairly food-motivated, and super eager to please. Shaggy could live with kids and other dogs who can handle his enthusiastic energy, although we're not sure how he feels about cats, just yet. He came to PAWS fully matted and had to be completely shaved down to give his fur a clean slate to regrow, so we can confirm his fur will need daily brushing and regular grooming or it will be prone to matting again.

Age: 4-6 years
How I Came to PAWS: found stray
Animal ID#: A40152825_____________________________________
To adopt a cat, complete the application at phillypaws.org/catapp.To adopt a dog, complete the application at phillypaws.org/dogapp.
Please reference this animal's ID NUMBER when inquiring.
Learn more about PAWS' adoption process, locations, and more at: phillypaws.org/adopt/info.
__________________________________________Adoption fees include age-appropriate vaccinations, spay/neuter, and microchip. Adoption fees are as follows, plus tax: $150 for large adult dogs (older than 1 year); $250 for small dogs (under 25 lbs) and all puppies (under 1 year); $60 for adult cats (over 6 months of age), and $100 for kittens (under 6 months of age). When you adopt a pair of kittens together, the total adoption fee is $150.
PAWS, the Philadelphia Animal Welfare Society, is a 501(c)3 non-profit animal rescue organization dedicated to saving Philadelphia's homeless and at-risk animals. PAWS is the city's largest rescue partner and provider of low-cost, basic veterinary care. Through our adoption locations, special events, and network of foster homes, PAWS finds loving homes for thousands of animals every year. PAWS is working to make Philadelphia a no-kill city where every healthy and treatable pet is guaranteed a home. Please visit www.phillypaws.org for more information on adopting, fostering, volunteering, or donating.
name: Shaggy

description:
This handsome boy is 6-month old Cordero, a mix of Mastiff and Hound.  Heâs a big boy already, and heâll mature to 90 pounds!  All full of love, of course!  Corderoâs short coat is brown and red.  Add his gorgeous eyes to that and you have a very good-looking pooch!  A lover of toys, he keeps his eyes on them when you toss them, and then he looks up at you as if to say, âOkay!  Letâs play!â  As we said, this is a loving and gentle boy, but because of his size, he will need training so that he becomes an awesome adult!  (posted 10/29/18, ME) (revised 12/16/18)

**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**

Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.

Transport, if needed :  $120.00    We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama.  We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

Weight Scale:   Small =  less than 25
                       Medium = 26-60
                         Large =  61-100
                               XL = 100+
name: Cordero    OK!  Let's Play!

description:
They just don't make em' any more spunky and fun than Joker.  If you're looking for a happy little companion, Joker's your guy!  He's a little over a year old and has such a goofy and sweet personality.  He was said to be a stray, but a little detective work revealed that his owners didn't want him any longer and claimed he was a stray.  It was likely a good thing that he came in when he did, as poor Joker had a terrible skin infection that needed immediate treatment.  He was under medical care for several weeks and now he is all healed up and healthy!  Joker is lots of puppy fun that just loves everyone he meets.  He has zero shyness about him and is your best friend from the moment he lays eyes on you.  He's well behaved and very sweet.  He seems just fine with other dogs and would love a home with a nice yard to romp and roam in, and a great family to love him.  File#27882  12/29/17

If you cannot adopt but would like to help care for the many available pets that we have awaiting their forever homes, text ResQ to 501501 to make a $10.00 donation, or click here to donate to our Res-Q Fund: https://www.ahscares.org/shop/item.asp?itemid=28&catid=5

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.
name: Joker

description:
Link is our 11 month old Siberian Husky mix.....Stop by the shelter and spend time with him to see if he is the right match for you. 
Link will thrive in his forever home and be your faithful companion. He will be responsive to positive reinforcement training. Our experienced staff is available to talk with you, answer your questions and provide advice on how to transition him to your home. 
Linnk is neutered, dewormed, treated to prevent fleas & ticks and is up to date with vaccinations. His adoption fee is $300.00, plus $8.50 for the dog license if you are a resident of NYC, and he'll get one free exam at our vet's office, one free month of pet health insurance and a microchip. If you'd like to adopt him please call or visit...we are conveniently located in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn near the F train (Ft Hamilton Pkwy) and we are open daily from 11am to 7pm. 
Link can't wait to meet you!

Sean Casey Animal Rescue
153 E. 3 St. 
between Ft Hamilton Pkwy & Caton Ave
Brooklyn, NY 11218
718.436.5163
NYS Department of Agriculture and Markets Registration No. RR160
name: Link

description: Pete is about 2yrs old. He was turned into a shelter as a stray. Pete is a bi eyed mix. He is very smart and full of energy. Pete must have a very active family who has a lot of time to devote to exercising and training him. Pete is house trained, crate trained and likes to go for car rides. Pete must have a fenced yard, at least 5ft. He cannot be placed with cats, small animals, or young children, teenagers 15 yrs and older would be ok. Pete needs a pet parent that has dog handling experience.
name: Pete

description:
Woof, Woof, Bentley here! I was rescued by Human Law Enforcement in October of 2016. I am glad I was rescued but transitioning into the shelter was scary for me.  While I may look big and tough, Iâm a big baby at heart.  I can be easily frightened, whether it be by a knock on the door or a person dressed up in a way Iâm not familiar with, but I really mean no harm.  The Behavior Team liked something about me â it must have been my rugged good looks! â and invited me to stay with them in their office.  It was an offer I just couldnât pass up!  Iâm really starting to come out of my shell.  And, the secretâs outâ¦ my tail wags!  How cool is that!!  I know âsitâ, âpawâ, and am very treat motivated, mostly because they help me keep my jolly figure.  I can be playful at times, but also enjoy peaceful naps and.  And what can I sayâ¦ Iâm a belly rub connoisseur!  Because I am so big and can get scared, I would do best in an adult household.

You can meet me at the shelter any time but I also have a very special volunteer buddy who takes care of me so if you want more information or want to set up a time to come meet me with her and get to play with me contact her - she will be happy to hear from you and will answer right away. Contact kpspca.orgdorney@

This dog is available at the Pennsylvania SPCA located at 350 E. Erie Avenue Philadelphia, PA 19134.  If you are interested in learning more about this dog contact us at 215-426-6304 ext 244 or email adoptions@pspca.org.  Adoption Center hours are 1PM-8PM Monday through Friday and 12AM-6PM Saturday & Sunday.
name: Bentley

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Meet Atticus! Atticus is a sweet and VERY playful 9 month old, 45lbs boy, who loves older (9years+) kids and other high energy, or very tolerant dogs. He is housebroken, crate trained, walks on a leash, he knows some basic commands, and will sit and wait for his food! He has no food aggression, and does not seem to be dominant when it comes to other dogs. Atticus has been living in a wonderful, loving foster home with two other dogs and a few cats. He DOES NOT get along with the cats at all. When he sees a cat he fixates and will not redirect at this time in his life; because of this he must be in a home WITHOUT cats. Atticus will do best in a home where he can have access to a high energy playmate! His ideal dog sibling will be a dog who either matches his level of excitement, or a dog that will tolerate his excitement. His current housemates are older dogs who donât always appreciate his playfulness and Atticus does not pick up on these clues. He doesnât understand that they donât want to play. This wonderful energy could be stressful to an older or less tolerant dog. Atticus embodies all of the qualities we look for in a puppy, heâs happy, loving, sweet, loves to give kisses, eager to learn, and heâs coming to know that cuddling is one of lifeâs many pleasures. He will brighten up any home with his beautiful spirit. If you are interested in adopting Atticus please go to:
http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org and apply.
name: Atticus

description: Put your hand on my paw, I will never let you go Put your trust in me, I will never, never leave you Put your heart in my heart I will forever give you love Put my paw in your hand I will always keep you from harm All I ask for is love
name: Carmelo

description: Here's Amanda! She loves making friends, and playing even, but it takes her a while to come out of her shell. Amanda is only one year old, and she still gets a bit nervous around new things and new places. She's made some other dog friends here, and even snuggles and naps with one of them. Once Amanda trusts you, she shows her true self; a playful, happy, tail-wagging, kiss-giving, loving gal! When things get stressful she'll turn to her human for support. So if you can hide under the blankets together during thunderstorms, or you won't make her walk past that terrifying construction site, and you're looking for a best friend for life just like she is, then come meet Amanda!
name: Amanda

description:
Declan is a sweetheart of a guy estimated to be about 2 years old. He is currently being fostered in a home with children and interacts well with them, albeit he is a little shy at first. Declan weighs about 14 pounds.
Microchipped, up to date in vaccines and will be neutered prior to adoption.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Declan

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Basil is a 6 week old female Catahoula blend puppy who comes into rescue from Oconee SC with an injured leg. She is currently with our veterinary partners receiving treatment. Basil is up to date on shots (age appropriate) and will be spayed when medically appropriate and prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people and other dogs. If you would like to adopt Basil and invite her to become a permanent member of your family when she is ready, get your applications in now and get the process started! http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Basil

description:
Trini is a female red nose pit bull / boxer mix. She is about 55lbs and good with other dogs. She was rescued when her owner was just going to cut her loose. She is good with other dogs and an all around sweet girl.

NO OUT OF STATE ADOPTIONS. 
Only Queens, the 5 boroughs and Long Island.
name: Trini

description:
**Tuleah is down to a much healthier 32#!!!
Tuleah is a chubby 5 year old, 40# Beagle/English Bulldog (Beabull) who came to us from a breeding farm. She is very shy but will come sit in your lap if you sit and talk to her. She knows nothing about houses, leashes, or manners but is very smart and picking up crate training quickly. She would do best in a quiet home with a very laid back male dog to hang out with and learn from. Physical fence required.
name: Tuleah

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.SAMMY
American Staffordshire Terrier
male. neutered.

Dog Selective

Sammy is a stunning, sweet, 3 to 5 yr. old, Staffie boy who was saved from a local, N. J. shelter. This angel LOVES people, takes toys, treats, and food gently, amuses himself with footballs, balls, ropes, you name it! He loves to play with you, too, and settles down very, very nicely for belly rubs and watching the world go by. Best in a home with older children because sometimes Sammy does not like to share his toys. Sammy likes some dogs and not others so if you have one, let's see if it's a good match. Sammy is waiting for you in his kennel at RescueRidge.com Please text 732 546 8805 to meet this pin-up, photogenic sweetheart Here is Sammy's video debut: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oDjB-ymRvBc
name: Sammy

description:
Reilly is a five month-old pup rescued from Puerto Rico along with his  Mom and siblings. His Mother is a Golden Retriever mix  and we believe Dad is a Hound 
mix.  If interested, please call or text Gizela at 201-655-5059. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Reilly

description: Meet Gracie!  This Pretty girl is a 2 year old female Lab mix. She is on the smaller side, weighting in at only 35lbs. She is super friendly and loves just about everyone and everything she meets.  Although she loves people and does well with submissive dogs, we feel she would do best as the only animal in the home.  She loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times.  She never turns down a good belly rub. She loves to play fetch and to play with her toys and she also loves to go hiking and on long walks.  She loves to play and is still full of puppy energy.  She would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle! She is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. She can't wait to find her forever home!
name: Gracie

description:
"Hi everyone, My name is Riley! Iâm a big boy with an even bigger heart looking for a forever home. Despite my size I am still just a pup; Iâm a 2 year old, neutered, Black-Mouth Cur mix. I am in great health and up to date on my shots. Iâm full of energy and I love to go on walks and play play play. I do tend to pull on my leash when I see other dogs but only because I love to make new dog friends. Did I mention that I am also a dancer? Whether I know you or we just met I have a habit of jumping up and trying to do a little tango. When Iâm not trying to bust a move I love to cuddle and lay around the house. Like all dogs, Iâm a cutie, but Iâm not perfect. I must admit that I am possessive over my toys and sometimes I take things that are not mine. I have been experiencing some growing pains recently, and Iâve outgrown my current home. Iâm looking for a new owner who has some experience training a high-energy pup like myself.

My dream forever home would be with someone or with a couple, preferably without small children, who can dedicate themselves to working with me and guiding me to become the best boy I can possibly be.  From the tips of my buttery soft ears all the way down to my big doofy paws I know I am good boy and I can be an even better boy in time. It would mean the world to me if you could contact my dear friend Caryn about adopting me! Sheâs very friendly and willing to answer any questions you may have about me. You can call or text her at 845-372-8534 or email her at cbyllott@gmail.com.

I hope to hear from you soon! Have a pawsome day!"



* NOTE: This is a COURTESY POST. All information is provided by the contact. Mighty Mutts is not responsible for accuracy.
name: Riley

description:
Frankie is a mushy dog who loves people and wants to please. 
He is a happy and friendly fellow with a big head and a big heart. He loves kids and has been around them playing very gently.
Frankie is awesome around most dogs and can ignore a cat very easily. He is fully house trained and would love a fenced area to run around in. He walks well on a leash and loves riding in the car. Frankie would be a great companion, affectionate, loyal and super cute. He is a bit nervous around new people and e would do better in a quiet home where he doesn't have to meet to many new faces.
name: Frankie

description:
Mocha is a beautiful Pit Bull pup, looking for her furever home. She is a true doll, and is great with all. She is fully vaccinated, microchipped, and spayed. Sheâd make the perfect addition to any loving family. 

Please fill out an applicantion if youârs interested in adopting this beauty. We can schedule a meet and greet upon request. 

NO OUT OF STATE ADOPTIONS
Only Queens, the 5 Boroughs and Long Island
name: Mocha

description:
Reese was adopted as a puppy and then returned to us after spending almost 2 years in a home. His family had a new baby and Reese became very protective of her. He really is a great family dog but will need a quieter living situation.

According to his former owners, Reese needs time to warm up to strangers and other dogs. He has been warm and friendly to all the staff and volunteers he has met so far at the kennel. He lived with another dog and seems to enjoy the company of most dogs that he has met at the kennel. He goes on weekly pack walks with other dogs and has a blast playing in our kennel play yards. Reese loves to run and play!

Reese knows basic obedience commands like sit, watch me, paw, and down. He is a dog who would be great as a walking or hiking partner as he loves to be active and outside. He even enjoys swimming!

Reese will need a handler who will give him the confidence and socialization that he needs. He will be a wonderful family member and would love to be a part of your family!!

If you would like to meet Reese, please fill out an application and be sure to mention his name, REESE STEELE!
name: Reese Steele

description:
Ginger is a beautiful pittie and lab mix.  She is about 3-4 years old and has low key personality and is a big snugglier.Â Â  She loves to be by her human side and cuddle up next to them all day.  She does best with dogs her size or bigger.   She is not good in a home with cats or small dogs. 
Ginger is heartworm positive but the rescue will be picking up the cost of her treatment, she is taking her meds now.   Ginger will be adopted out with a spay contract and can have her spay after she finises her heartworm treatment.
Ginger adoption fee is $250.00 which includes her transport here,  her vaccinations and heartworm treatment.  For an application to adopt Ginger please visit snarrnortheast.org
name: Ginger

breeds: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler, Golden Retriever
description:
Our Circles gives the impression of shyness at first, but warms quickly to a gentle touch. He must have quite the tale to tell, after having paid his dues as a big city stray. Circles came to us via our contacts at NYCACC, where he was passed over for adoption during his short window of opportunity. Nonetheless he made friends and admirers of Shelter and Vet staff.

Circles appears to be a handsome mix of Australian Cattle Dog and yellow Labrador Retriever. He has the physique and color of a yellow Lab, and the speckled markings of the Cattle Dog. Weighing 57 pounds, Circles has a solid, muscular build, and yet is easy to handle on lead. As a combination herder and retriever, Circles loves the outdoors, and has a hardwired work ethic that needs to be channeled through exercise and obedience work. 

Circles sometimes seems unsure of his place in the world, and needs to join a home with a strong pack leader, willing to provide the necessary structure that he needs to thrive.Â He seems subdued, and intimidated at times, and is not a good candidate for a home with small children, or a busy home with a lot of strangers coming and going. 

Circles would thrive in an adult home, with patient folks were willing to troubleshoot some stranger danger issues. He would be the ideal walking or running companion for an active single or couple. He loves the outdoors, and is greatly suited to a slow-paced country lifestyle.Â He can keep brisk pace on a hike, and longs to make a one-to-one connection with a strong human personality.Â Circles could easily join a multi-dog home with another well-trained, calm dog, but cats are a definite no-go.

Circles has progressed nicely in his basic obedience training. We've worked with him for quite a while on food and resource guarding, and he has improved greatly. Still, it's best to leave Circles alone while eating, and to feed him separately from any other dogs. The obedience work serves him as a job, he takes pride in it, and performs the commands beautifully, either for praise or treats.Â Obedience training is key to the providing the working breeds with the purpose and focus that they need to live happily in a domestic lifestyle.

Circles has good house manners and is house trained and crate trained. Adopters should have appropriate patience, and expect to troubleshoot the occasional accident that will inevitably occur during Circles' transition to a new home. He is in excellent health, and is at an ideal lean body weight. He has been neutered, and has been vaccinated for Rabies, DHLPPC (distemper, hepatitis, leptosporosis, parvo, parainfluenza, coronavirus), and Canine Flu. He has been boostered as needed, and has had the 4dx test: negative for heartworm, lyme, earlichia and anaplasmosis. He has been dewormed, and microchipped. If you are interested in Circles, please write to Denise@eskiesonline.com or call Denise at 860-908-9738 for more info.
name: Circles

description: Hey there! My name is Jax and I am big ole Black Mouth Cur mix looking for a loving home. Playing with toys, taking walks and spending time with you are three of my favorite things. I am a bit goofy and still I have a lot to learn. I would do best in a home with kids 10 and up because I sometimes I am protective of my food. Would you like to make me a part of your family? Please ask the staff how you can take me home today!
name: Jax

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
Hello there, my name is Petey :) Clearly you can see that I am just a handsome boy! I was taken into Eleventh Hour when my recent owners could no longer care for me. Since coming to EHR I have met many wonderful people. My foster who takes me home says I am housebroken, know all my basic commands (and a few bonus extras)

UPDATE FROM CURRENT HOME:

In the time we have had him Petey has improved his understanding of basic commands (sit, stay, down) as well as learned some new ones. We have been working on "Leave it" and "Drop it" and he has been responding well. We also are able to get him to wait for his food until we give the "OK" and are able to stop him eating with "leave it." We have not noticed any type of food aggression with him, he takes treats very nicely and won't take a treat until we say "OK".

Petey is very good in the crate. When we first got him we tried to leave him in the house all day and he had an accident on the carpet EVERY day.
