We tried baby gates and barriers and he always jumped them. We figured it was a separation anxiety reaction from him. Since we started using the crate he has not had one accident and comes and goes from it on his own when the door is open. It definitely keeps him calm when we are out of the house. We do have him sleep in it at night as well, but he of course would love to just be in bed with us all night if he could. He is such a snuggler, still very affectionate and just wanting to be by us all the time.

We definitely feel like he needs to be an only dog in a family with no children and who wouldn't have him interact with small animals or children. He definitely needs a lot of attention and love. We think he would love to run around and play in a high fenced yard.
He also now responds to the name Dexter.
name: Petey (ROMAN)

description:
Charlie is a very handsome boy who hasn't had the easiest life so far. Charlie was brought up to PA from a high kill shelter in the south but was overlooked for adoption so he was kenneled for about 8 months until he came to Spay and Save. He is a sweet boy who is working on his manners and loves to herd the other dogs in his foster home so he would be better as an only dog even though he loves other dogs. Charlie would benefit from attending an obedience class as he is a quick learner and likes to please his foster mom. For more information on Charlie please visit our WEBSITE at www.spayandsave.org to fill out an online application.  ****SPAY AND SAVE ADOPTS TO FAMILIES LIVING IN BUCKS, MONTGOMERY AND PARTS OF CHESTER COUNTIES IN PA ONLY*****
spayandsavedogs@comcast.net
610-279-9714 press 2
name: Charlie

description: Cami is a 6 month old female pit bull terrier mix. She is active and is looking for a home that is willing to continue the typical structure and training a puppy needs. She gets along well with other dogs. Email lostnfoundpets@gmail.com with any inquiries
name: Cami

description: King is a volunteer favorite! He knows the "sit" command and walks well on his leash with only some pulling. Although he has been curious and polite around other dogs at the shelter, previous owners reported that he does not get along with other animals in the home. Attention to his diet is needed as King has food allergies. To succeed, King needs to be the only pet living in his castle with no children and an experienced handler. He is 4 years old and weighs about 90 pounds. King will make a great exercise partner for the right owner! His adoption fee has already been paid by a generous donation to the Friends of the Burlington County Animal Shelter (FOBCAS) by an anonymous person.
name: King

description:
12/13/17...Sandy is a beautiful senior girl who would love to sit on the couch and enjoy TV with you. Sandy is a senior so she does go out to the bathroom often. She loves to be outside in the yard and soak up the sun, she enjoys her walks too. Sandy is looking for someone she can enjoy her golden years with, someone who can just love her, cuddle her, and make her feel like a princess. 

22 Jan 2017: Sandy is a 9 year old lab-shepherd mix. She is a well-behaved girl who would love to spend her golden years as a cherished family member. Instead, though, she landed in a kill shelter and now sits in boarding (where she has been for far too long), just hoping that someone will make her a part of their family. Sandy is a big girl, weighing about 90 lbs! And as you can see, she is a beauty. Sandy would do best in a home where there are no other dogs or a very submissive dog that is about her size. She would be an ideal match for a couple, maybe even an older couple who understand what itâs like to be aging. 

Sandy has been posted and marketed a lot but seems to keep getting passed over. It is so very sad. Wonât someone give her a chance? Sandy is located in New Windsor, NY (not too far from Poughkeepsie). Why not visit her and see if thereâs a love match? If you have another dog, you will need to bring him/her along. 

Sandy is spayed, up-to-date on all vaccinations, and is microchipped. Fill out an application at http://nycsecondchancerescue.org/app-form/
name: SANDY

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Our girl Houdina is a 2 year old Shepherd mix who weighs 50 pounds. She comes into rescue from Texas where she hasnât had the best life so far. Houdina is suffering from an old elbow injury that wonât allow it to bend. Because this injury has gone untreated for so long, her shoulder and wrist are now affected also and she will require amputation of this limb. She will get all the medical care she needs with our vet partner. We have no doubt after what she has already endured that she will bounce back after surgery and do great learning to navigate the world as a tripod. Everyone that meets Houdina raves about what a sweet and beautiful girl she is! She is so loving and friendly to people of all ages and other dogs. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to be the very lucky one that gets to give this precious girl the wonderful life full of love and happiness that she is so deserving of, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Houdina

description:
Meet Dar!

This little guy came to us as a matted mess.  He had to be shaved down so we can address his skin infections.  He will adorable once again once his hair grows back!

He is a sweet small little guy.  He is around 1-2 years old.  Our best guess, he is a Maltese mix.  He is neutered, vaccinated, heartworm negative and vaccinated.

He will be ready to meet his forever family in the next week or so! 


Potential adopters must be over the age of 21 and live within a 60 mile radius of Allendale, NJ. Other locations will be considered on a case-by-case basis depending on the availability of a home visit. 

Information on our adoption process including fees: http://houndsinpounds.com/process/ 

Link to our application: http://houndsinpounds.com/application/
name: Dar

description: Edna is 8 years old. She's overweight at 109lbs, and will benefit from a healthy diet and some daily exercise. Edna has a thyroid condition that will need monitoring. She is great on the leash! Edna will prefer a home with older children and no other pets.
name: Edna

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Hi, my name is Denali, and I am as beautiful and majestic as the Alaskan mountain for which I am named! As a female Great Pyrenees, I have lovely snowy white fur and double dew claws. I love being outside and exploring nature, but now I am looking for my furever home. You see, I was found wandering in the road and taken to the local animal shelter before I was rescued and placed with my foster mom. She says that I can be a little shy at first, but I can tell you that I warm up quickly despite my snowy name! Iâm a gentle girl, and I am getting along well with my foster brother. Iâm house trained, and I do well in my kennel and my crate. Please know that I am still a young lady, so I have boundless energy. Speaking of boundless, I need to tell you that I can jump a four foot fence when I want to get to my foster mom on the other side :) So my furever home should have a tall, sturdy fence, since having a mountain for my namesake, Iâm good at scaling heights! I was very thin when I was found, so I think Iâll fill out now that Iâm in a good place, and I am doing well with leash training. I have not been around children yet, but I have been gentle with my new human adult friends. I also havenât met any cats, but I donât pay attention to the birds at the barn. Iâve been out in the cold for too long, and I want to cuddle and warm up with you!
name: Denali

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
3 years old.

Thank you for your interest in adopting a rescued Basset Hound! We ask all potential adopters to complete our application and approval process first so we can discuss the dogs that fit your home. We usually have 25 - 35 dogs available and the ages range from less than year old to ten plus years old. Once we receive your application you'll be contacted by an adoption representative to complete the application process. We look forward to speaking with you about our wonderful hounds waiting for forever homes!!!
name: CASSIE

description:
"Courtesy Post"
Contact Bridget at 973-931-9181 for more details 
Chaos needs a new home and a new name ? 
Chaos is a very sweet 3 1/2 year old 70lbs American Bull dog , who has spent the last 3 years outside in the yard. He deserves to become part of a family.   He is extremely affectionate and loves people. 
No one , except the neighbor , pays attention to poor Chaos.
The neighbor said he actually cries trying to get someoneâs attention. 
The owners say, that they have no time for him and are willing to surrender. 
He will be neutered and is now up to date on shots. 
He will need someone willing to help him to make an adjustment to life as a family member.   He has no experience of things and life outside the yard. He is the dog in the plastic bubble and will need someone who is willing to spend time with him and expose him to things and show him what it is like to be part of a family. 
He has not been socialized with dogs.  He hasnât been with cats 
No small children due to his size. 
For now heâs probably better as a single dog. 
Upon adoption, he will be provided with all the Free Dog Training necessary. 
Please adopt and share your life with this great guy.
Heâs desperate for it ??
name: Chaos

description:
This sweet girl is one of 9! We think they are husky/cattledog mix. All of these pups are playful and love to be loved on. Their sibling who has previously been placed loves to watch television! 

Bring one of these pups home today!
name: Jewels

description:
Adorable Megara is looking for a home of her own!  She LOVES children and can be a bit shy at first but opens up very quickly. She is very eager to please and smart. She loves attention!!! Megara is very playful with female dogs, but seems to have conflict when introduced to male dogs; therefore we will only adopt her to a home with another female or as an only dog. Megara is a 1 year-old lab mix, and weighs 45 pounds (and she may continue to grow a bit more!).  She is spayed, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccinations. 

Megara's adoption fee is $495, which includes transport from the South.

If a dog is listed on Petfinder, he/she is still available. We do not go on a first come first serve basis, but on best fit for the family and most importantly, the dog(s). Please keep in mind that we are taking our best guess on breed and age based on the dogs physical appearance.

Please visit www.snarrnortheast.org for a foster or adoption application.
name: Megara

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Zander, born in 2014, came into a GA shelter in very rough shape. Emaciated, with sores on his ears, pale gums and elevated liver values. He
no doubt lived his life outside, neglected & forgotten. He received the medical care he so desperately needed from our veterinary partner in the south. He is now healthy, neutered and up to date on shots. Zander is a Boxer mix who is about 6 years old and weighs 55 pounds. He is good with all people, other dogs, and even gets along with feline friends! His
foster mom raves about what a sweet and smart boy he is!
He can be a little shy when first meeting new people but warms up quickly. He loves car rides, walks (does not pull), and is a professional cuddler. Medically he does have 2 conditions which are easily managed with medication. First is chronic dry eye which he gets eye drops daily and he also has pancreatic Insufficiency that requires medication in his food twice a day. He is housebroken, never had an accident, and he has completed basic 8 week training course. Zander is a handsome, easy going companion who would fit great into any home!
If you would like to adopt Zander, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Zander

description:
Abdul is a 3 year old Rothweiller who was saved from San Antonio's highest kill shelter . 

Abdul came in with his brother and sister after a forced owner surrender by law . 

It was a severe cruelty case . Skin over bones and completely starved . 

The sister was adopted in the shelter and we took the both brothers . His brother is adopted but sweet Abdul is still waiting a rottie lover who knows the breed . 

Abdul is very sweet but he does not like other dogs or cats . He leans right away against your leg and shows his tummy . Yes he loves his belly rubs . 

This sweetheart is looking for a forever home where they will love him forever . 

Abdul is located in Huntington , Long island NY 

To become his new family please apply the adoption application to find on www.a-teameliterescue dogs or send us an email and ask one
name: Abdul

description:
MEET Caramel! Caramel is a Pitbull Terrier Mix, who is traveling to EHR all the way from Puerto Rico! Caramel has not had a very good start to life - she was a stray trying to survive in the streets of Puerto Rico.

She gets along with other dogs - she is also good with people of all ages! She is a sweet girl. Caramel is crate trained, leash trained, and up to date on all of her vaccines!

If you are interested in meeting her, please be sure to mention her name when applying at EHRDOGS.ORG !
name: Caramel Rico

description: Before you ask about Vinny please read the full description.  Vinny is NOT your typical easy  going sweet beagle.  I know the photo is misleading however he can be quite the charmer with MEN.  Vinny is a self-conscious type of dog and is very suspicious of human motives when approached.  We attribute this to unpleasant early life experiences.  Vinny will do well in a home with just one man or a couple with dog experience.  Although good a on leash we just don't trust his behavior if a child were to run up to him or a person wanting to prove all dogs love them bends over his head.  He'd be OK in a  fenced yard and walks taken where there is limited exposure to encountering others.  Nose to the ground in the country he's probably a great candidate as a hunting dog.  He's more of that type of beagle than a docile house pet.    His guesstimated age is about three years of age and he was rescued from a Newark, NJ shelter. He weighs in the range of 25 pounds.   He enthusiastically runs to you when called,  sits politely for food, guarding a bone is another matter so no long lasting treats for Vinny.  He goes to his bed/crate when asked,  He opts to hide under a flannel blanket curled up so tight that you don't even know he's inside the blanket so of course he feels a little vulnerable when you wake him. He's a late sleeper and he grumbles when he doesn't want to get up but we all know someone like this! He's a very clean dog too that takes his business outdoors. Vinny likes car rides.   He's is OK with cats and great with other usually bigger dogs. Bottom line if you're a single male in a more suburban or country location, don't have kids; like to hike for long periods of time Vinny could really make a turn around  in his behavior.  I believe the key to his success is sufficient exercise to relieve his tension coupled with a protocol for rehabilitating his unwanted quirks.  To meet Vincent in Blairstown e:mail auntmarysdoghouse@yahoo.com or call 908-362-1333
name: Vinny

description: Becky is 5 years old and is a super high energy dog and would be great for people who like to hike or take long walks.  She is a very affectionate dog and would be very loyal to her family.  She will need some basic leash training.
name: Becky

description:
Meet Ivy!
Ivy is a sweet and friendly baby girl who was born on April 6th. 
She is an adorable mix of Australian Shepherd and Catahoula Leopard Dog, and is as sweet as she is cute!! She is fostered with other dogs and absolutely LOVES them! She is also great with cats!
If you are interested in this little cutie, we are accepting applications now at this link: https://www.newlifeanimalrescue.org/dog-application. 
Her adoption fee is $275 and includes a thorough veterinary exam, up to date vaccines and preventatives, deworming, spay, microchip, and 30 days of free pet insurance.
Please note: We do try to limit adoptions to within one hour of our southern NJ area so that we can conduct our own home visits and follow-up.
Thank you for considering adoption of a rescued pet!
***IMPORTANT - PLEASE NOTE***
PetFinder has been having issues with getting email inquiries to us.
If you are interested in adopting, 
*** PLEASE CONTACT US DIRECTLY at
NewLifeAnimalRescue@gmail.com  ***
Thank you!
name: Ivy

description:
When to Come: (Unless different date stated above)
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the best match. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions, except in the case of dogs that require more than one visit prior to adoption. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the best match. Some dogs require all residents of your home and household dog(s) to be present for a meet and greet.  

We do not accept adoption fee deposits in advance, nor do we hold animals, unless it is an animal that requires more than one visit prior to adoption. In this case, an appointment can be scheduled with a senior staff member or trainer. Some dogs require all residents of your home and household dog(s) to be present for a meet and greet. If they are not present, we cannot hold the dog.   

Adoption Fees; Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated and dewormed (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. Pre-existing medical conditions are covered via our Simpson Clinic free of charge within the first 30 days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.

NYS Registration # RR056
name: Dash

description:
Hi.  My name is Maggie and I am a young and pretty female beagle that is looking for a new home.  I am approx. 2 years old and weigh 26 lbs.  I used to live in a rabbit hutch in New Jersey with my other beagle âsiblingsâ.  Penny Angels recently rescued me (and my brother, Peanut) from that sad situation.  I am a shy girl when I first meet people, but I do slowly warm up to them.  I am coming around, but it will take a little time.  I wasnât socialized in my previous home, so everything is new to me.  I learned how to use the doggie door in Rescue and that is a good thing.  I would do best in a quiet home without small or active young children.  I would like to have a doggie friend in my new home, though I think that I would be okay on my own, too.  I will need some help with leash-walking but if you have a secure fenced-in yard, that would be fine with me.  Please make sure that I canât escape from your yard; if I get out, you will have a difficult time trying to get me back.

My new owner should either have some experience in dealing with shy dogs OR be willing to spend extra time working with me.  I want to learn to be your loyal and loving companion, so I hope that you will be patient with me.  I was recently spayed and microchipped.  I will be at PetSmart in Mays Landing, NJ on Saturday from 11- 3 pm.  Please fill out an application and submit it to Penny Angels TODAY if you are ready to make a lifetime commitment to me.

An adoption application for Maggie can be obtained by visiting our web site at www.pennyangelsbeaglerescue.com. If you have any questions, please contact beagler534@comcast.net or emnase@aol.com, or call Penny Angels Beagle Rescue at 609-965-9476. Thank you!
name: MAGGIE

description:
PLEASE DO NOT HIT "ASK ABOUT" BEFORE FILLING OUT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION

If you are interested in adopting Johnny, please fill out an application here: www.wiseanimalrescue.org/adoption-application

Meet Johnny! He is a 6-month-old Black Lab puppy ready to find his forever home!

He is an easygoing dog who LOVES to cuddle anytime and anywhere. He wants everyone he meets to hold him and give him lots of pets. In return, he will cover your face in kisses to show how much he loves you! While he is still a puppy, he is not rambunctious but enjoys a good romp in the yard.

A note from Johnny's foster mom: "Johnny is one of the sweetest foster puppies we have ever had! All he wants is for you to love him. Whenever you sit down, he is ready to curl up on your lap. He will usually rest his head on my chest or shoulder.  He will usually lay in his dog bed or on the couch when he is not playing outdoors or with his toys. He loves tennis balls and squeaky toys! He always aims to please and is a great listener."

Johnny is working on learning his basic commands and has mastered "sit", "paw", "down", "come" and "crate". He is very food motivated and eager to learn. He sleeps through the night in his crate and is doing great with his potty training! Johnny walks great on a leash and enjoys going on walks! He would do wonderfully in a home with another dog and can also live with children 10 and up. 

If you're looking for a loving, sweet puppy, adopt Johnny!

Follow Us on Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/wiseanimalrescue
Like Us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/wiseanimalrescue/
name: Johnny

description: Minnie is an adoptable Pit Bull Terrier, and she is absolutely one of the most gorgeous girls you will ever meet! Mina is approximately 10-11 years old, and she weighs about 75 pounds. Her blue coat is so unique; words just cannot describe how beautiful she is. She is also well-behaved and very loving. She is also already house-trained! Mina has a moderate energy level; she loves to channel her inner puppy by running and playing, but she will also settle down nicely for a good nap (cuddles included!). Mina is super-soft, so she is even better for snuggling than a cotton blanket, memory-foam pillow, and childhood teddy bear all wrapped into one!  Mina is just waiting for her forever family (thatâs you!) to come and get her so she can show you all the love she has to give! And really, who couldnât use some good old-fashioned unconditional love from a big blue dog? Mina would not do well in a home with cats, and if we were to pair her with a dog it would be male as she can selective. Email harescue1@aol.com or haar13@aol.com for an application to foster or to adopt
name: Mina aka Minnie

description: This handsome boys eyes go right into his soul to his heart. He is sweet and loving. Ryder is a terrier mix and is quite the well mannered gentleman. He is new to the shelter and we will keep you updated with his age but, we would guess 5 or 6 years old. He is absolutely stunning and will be the best companion ever. Hurry to come see this dapper guy.
name: Ryder

description: Jack is a sweet dog and suffers from Obsessive Compulsive Disorder(OCD) and is more focused on playing with his toys than he is with people.    He needs someone that is patient. kind and knowledgeable of this condition and willing to work with Jack and give him the love and devotion he needs.  If you are interested in meeting Jack, call the Cape May County Animal Welfare Society at 609-465-3403, email us at cmcaws@yahoo.com or fill out an adoption application at https://www.cmcanimalwelfaresociety.org
name: Jack

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
My name is ICEBERG and I'm a sweet 5/6y Blue/White M Amstaff/Pitbull X. I'm 60 lbs of PURE COOLNESS. I was given up by my owner due to NO TIME. I was crated most of my life due to my owner's crazy work schedule and he finally realized I was not having the quality of life I should have and surrendered me. Even though I wasn't around other dogs alot,  I'm fine with big and small dogs and cats!! I'm a sweet chill easy going medium energy dog. I just need someone who is willing to give me the TLC that I never got. I am friendly to everyone big and small and just love attention! I'm a big boy but I've got short legs so I kinda walk like a duck. It's quite ADORABULL & ENDEARING!! I'm just a BIG LOVERBOY!.  If you give me a chance I'll be your LOYAL BFF!! Pls come meet/adopt me today!

For more info/app; pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Iceberg

description:
Meet Ollie! This one- year old Shorkie Poo (Shihtzu, Yorkie, Poodle!) was recently rescued from life as a breeding dog from a puppy mill! He is now experiencing everything wonderful for the first time in his foster home in NYC (like a good grooming! see his before and after pic :) )

Ollie is ready for a home for the holidays! 

He is scheduled for a neuter next month.  He can be adopted out before this time but the appointment must be kept!

If a dog is listed here on Petfinder, they are still available. Please don't email just to ask if they're available - they are! We get so many emails a day, we may not be able to respond and you could end up missing out on a dog. ALL POSTED DOGS ARE AVAILABLE!!! 

Also, none of our dogs have health or behavioral problems that we don't list on here. If its not in the profile, it doesn't exist!

You may read our adoption policies and procedures for Puppy Mill Rescues on www.truenorthrescue.org. Please fill out a COMPLETE application if you would like to meet him - meet and greets are only scheduled with approved applicants and foster families. All our dogs are in private foster homes. Applications are processed in the order that they are received. You can email Jillian truenorthrescue@gmail.com for more information.

Please apply on our website - www.truenorthrescue.org 

All dogs are in foster homes - we do not have a physical shelter.
name: Ollie

description:
Oh how pretty Ms.Lily! 

As many of you may know Lily was one of our severe mange cases, rescued back in the beginning of October. This girl literally never had a home before. She grew up on the streets with her brother since birth, and were only given a second chance because a few kind hearted people saw their deteriorating condition. Lily was a bit worse off than her brother Lance. She had developed a cyst the size of a grapefruit along her neck due to infection and underwent 3 surgeries to have it removed. Today as you can see this girl is a beauty, and doing normal puppy stuff like dragging her toys all over the house and wresting around with her canine friends. Lily is only about 6 months old and she would truly love having a forever to call her own for the first time in her life. If you think you can give this lovely lady a home email Jonesm4318@gmail.com today!
name: Lily

description:
Lotus has a remarkable story! Lotus is blind and was fighting for survival on the streets of Thailand as a stray. She was taken in by a woman who had too many dogs and was put back on the street and could not be located for weeks. Once she was found, a Thai rescue organization sent out an urgent plea for a foster in the United States. Lotus' foster mom accepted and the organization flew her by plane to the United States after shots and quarantine. 

This young adult shepherd mix with fabulous ears is very smart and figured out a doggie door in just 2 days. She loves squeaky toys and any toy at all, since she never had any. She wags her tail and body whenever she hears her foster mom's voice. She loves affection and laying with humans. 

Lotus is very protective of her food when other dogs are near. A survival instinct she learned on the streets of Thailand. Because of this, we feel she would do best in a home with no other dogs.

She was examined by an ophthalmologist and it was concluded that she does see shadows.  

For more information on this beautiful survivor who has so much love to give please contact Michelle at:   cabweirich2284@comcast.net
name: LOTUS FROM THAILAND

description: DOB 1 Sept 2018
name: Mr. Ed (p) (Mama Jaimie litter)

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

Elliot is 2 year old boy who spent some time in a foster home and did great! He was house trained and really enjoyed the company of his people and dog friends (not a fan of cats, though!) Elliot is initially timid but warms up nicely; he's a blast to play with in the yard! For the full scoop on Elliot, e-mail shelter@spca914.org. 

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Elliot - Foster me for the Holidays!

description:
Miss Kahlua is awesome!!!! She is eight years younger and she is happy and social and so eager for love and attention. She is a recent owner surrender. She goes potty outside and loves to go for walks and she is playful and very cuddly! 
Come by and meet this pretty girl soon!!!!!!


All pets at this shelter are up-to-date on shots and will be altered and micro-chipped upon adoption.  Please visit our shelter to meet the many adorable orphans that are available for adoption.  When inquiring about a specific animal you saw on this website, please include the ID number associated with the animal. We are open 7 days a week from 12pm-5: 30pm Monday thru Friday and 12pm-5:00 Saturday & Sunday. For information and/or directions call 732-922-0100 or email TintonFallsahs@aol.com. There is an adoption fee required.  The Society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, and cash.

                               IMPORTANT
 As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency.  Homeowners must show proof of ownership; a valid lease that states "pets ok" is required for renters before an adoption can be approved. If you do not have a lease with your landlord you will need a notarized letter.
name: Kahlua

description:
Mya was surrendered when her family lost their home and could not take her where they were going.  Mya is very sweet and affectionate.  She is loves to run in the play yard and likes treats.  She finds comfort in her favorite toy, a stuffed bunny that she was surrendered with.  Mya did test positive for 2 common tick borne diseases, Lyme and Anaplasmosis, but has completed her course of antibiotics.  She is feeling great and playful.    She can be picky about her friends and would do best in a home where there are no other dog or cats or children under 12.  Mya is 7 years old and about 46 pounds.  Please help Mya find the loving home she deserves.

If you are interested in adopting, we encourage you to please submit an application on our website today so that we can try and process and pre-approve any potential adopters prior to our next adoption event.

PLEASE USE THIS LINK TO SUBMIT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION. WE ONLY ACCEPT ADOPTION APPLICATIONS THROUGH OUR WEBSITE. ANY OTHERS WILL NOT BE PROCESSED.
Application link here: http://www.oscaranimalrescue.org/oscar-1-application.html

Adoption Process:
1.Fill out an application
2.Meet & Greet
3.Adoption contract & adoption fee
Mya adoption fee is $100. This covers all age-appropriate shots, vetting & microchipping.

**If you are coming to an adoption event to see a certain dog/cat, please email ahead of time to make sure that dog/cat will be there that day. Please email 1-2 days before the event, as some animals are placed during the week and our list is constantly changing.
For a list of upcoming pet adoption events go to: www.OscarAnimalRescue.org

One Step Closer Animal Rescue is a 501c3 non-profit organization. Donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE to the extent allowed by law. If you would like to make a donation to help us rescue more animals please send donations to PO Box 248, Sparta, NJ 07871. Please make your check payable to O.S.C.A.R.. Thank you for helping us save as many lives as we can.

Don't forget to "Like Us" on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/pages/One-Step-Closer-Animal-Rescue-OSCAR/462492563811538
name: Mya

description: Curio is a seven month-old Terrier mix rescued from Georgia. If interested in adopting, you must attend one of our Adoption Events, listed on our Home Page and Facebook, in order to fill out an application.  Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Curio

description:
Handsome Freedom is the proud dad to 7 adorable beagle puppies.  He was surrendered, along with his kids, because he does not hunt,  We can definitely see why, Freedom is the sweetest, most even tempered and non-aggressive beagle guy ever!  He is a wonderful daddy to his pups and loves every human he meets.

Freedom is just a baby himself, at just over a year old.  Freedom weighs about 32lbs and has received all of his vaccines and has been neutered, microchipped, dewormed, and treated with flea/tick/hw preventative.  Freedom's adoption fee is $325.00

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING, PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS:

Do not use the Petfinder links to ask us about our adoptable dog listings - we do not always receive these messages! 

Instead, please visit our website at www.roadtriprescues.com to inquire about an adoptable pet, and to complete our online adoption application! You can also find us on Facebook (Road Trip Rescues) and send us a message!

PLEASE NOTE THAT ONLY APPROVED ADOPTERS WILL BE PERMITTED TO MEET OUR RESCUES - WE ARE A FOSTER BASED RESCUE AND ALL OF OUR DOGS LIVE WITH US AS FAMILY. 

Thanks for considering a rescue pup!
name: Freedom-ADOPTED!!!

description:
Please help Luca find a new home - her family will be moving at the end of August & they cannot take Luca with them. This sweet gal is an 8 year old Pointer mix who has lived with her family for the past 5 years.

Luca lives with a 3-year-old and they get along great so she would be a wonderful addition to almost any family! She loves attention but also doesn't mind sleeping most of the day away. She absolutely loves attention and loves to pretend she is a lap dog!

Luca is fine with other big dogs. She may growl at smaller ones however she did live with a small dog for about 3 years and for the most part they were fine! She is fine on a leash as well as a crate. She is also housetrained & is a real sweetheart!

Luca is not with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping her owners with the rehoming process. If you can help Luca out, please contact her owner directly by emailing Ashley at aetesta221@outlook.com - Luca is currently located in Lafayette, NJ.
name: XP Luca - Lafayette, NJ

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Vance! This irresistible cutie is a one year old Terrier mix, rescued with brothers Vinny & Victor in Texas, after their owner surrendered them. The 3 brothers are bonded and will be adopted together. Only the best for this sweet boy from now on! We canât wait to find Vance, Vinny and Victor an amazing forever family who can shower them with all the unconditional love and happiness they deserve! Vance is great with people of all ages and other dogs He is a little prince who is just an absolute joy! All three will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in their forever home.To make Vance, Vinny & Victor the newest members of your family, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Vance

description: Put your hand on my paw, I will never let you go Put your trust in me, I will never, never leave you Put your heart in my heart I will forever give you love Put my paw in your hand I will always keep you from harm All I ask for is love
name: Sparky

description:
If you love labs, you are going to fall for Dusty!  This striking 11 month old 58 lb yellow lab mix adores everyone he meets (human and dog) and he will melt your heart with his beautiful amber eyes.  Dusty is a happy-go-lucky guy who is full of energy and loves to play; he still is a puppy after all!  He is very outgoing- always happy and excited to meet new people. 

He is great in his crate (sleeps through the night) and is housetrained.  Dusty is affectionate, smart and definitely trainable- he is extremely eager to please and will do anything for food!  Dusty is making progress learning boundaries, but is a very bouncy boy so would do best in a home with children over 10. This sweetheart is looking forward to finding his forever home where he can share all the love his big lab heart has to give!


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Dusty

description:
Brolly has come into our rescue after being left at a rural North Carolina shelter by his owner. His owner never so much as gave a reason as to why he left his best friend at the pound. Since Brolly has been with us, we have gotten to know him and have found he is a playful and energetic guy, who at first takes a little time to warm up. Once he does he is affectionate and polite. Brolly would love to have a big fenced in yard so he can run and play, and boy, does he love play time! He rides well in the car and enjoys long hikes, and will need to go to a breed experienced home as an only pet. This is a happy boy who is looking for an active home to give him that second chance that he so deserves.

Are you interested in Brolly Bear? Please go to www.bigeastakitarescue.org and put in a adoption application online for this handsome boy!
name: Brolly Bear

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hello all, Betty Lou here and I am looking for my forever home!! I am one of three and don't tell my sister, but I am the cutest girl! We are approximately around 8-9 weeks old and have been vetted for our age. We are working on crate training, and we love to have fun. We are your normal happy fun loving puppies who would love a forever home for Christmas. Please go to www.allmuttsmatter.org to apply for me Betty Lou!!
name: Betty Lou

description:
Sunshine is a darling, six year old lab. She gets along well with other dogs and is just a pleasure to be around!
This pet is currently in a foster home, not at the shelter. If you are interested in adopting this pet please complete an adoption questionnaire. Once your questionnaire is processed, the foster home will be in touch with you to discuss the personality of this pet as well as setting up a chance to meet with the pet in person.For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt
name: Sunshine

description:
This 6 year old, 35lb, Lab/Beagle sweetheart is Squeaker. Her life turned upside down recently after her prior owners did not want her anymore and dropped her off at the local kill shelter, where she was very scared and confused. Squeaker was moved into foster so she could heal her broken heart after being abandoned. In her foster home, Squeaker was quickly accepted by the 4 other resident dogs. She eats, sleeps and walks the fenced yard with them in harmony, like she has always belonged. The quick acceptance is most likely credited to her gentle and low key personality. Squeaker is calm in the house, has not had one accident inside, has not shown any interest in chewing household items, and is a nice leash walker. She goes in her crate with the help of a good treat or bone and waits patiently for your return.
While Squeaker gets along with all of the other dogs, her preferred, favorite spot is always beside her person. She is a very loyal and loving girl, who will no doubt be a wonderful companion!
Squeaker may not have had the best life in her previous home. She has a torn ear, which has completely healed now, and quick movements make her a little nervous; we feel homes without young children would be more suitable. Despite her past, this little lady is ready to start the next chapter and find out how good the second half of her life can be!

It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

description:
Strong, active, affectionate female looking for the same qualities in a 
life partner.  Loves running, playing, tennis balls and jolly balls,  
While Kit Kat isn't very particular about her toys, she knows exactly 
what she's looking for in love.  A partner with active lifestyle, who 
will return her love and loyalty would be a perfect match for her! If you have any questions about KitKat, please-mail adoptions@petsalive.org

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***


Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Kit Kat

description:
Hi, my name is Buddy True Blue. I'm 4 years young and I'm told that I'm a very handsome guy. Those who know me and love me say that I'm terrific in every way! Not only do I have my rugged good looks and manly physique going for me but underneath it all, I'm just a silly and loving boy at heart! My ultimate plan is to make some special superhero (or superheros) a trusty sidekick. I've been working SO hard with my trainer and my handler to refine my manners, both can tell you that I have become quite a gentleman! I'm doing so great at following directions that recently, I was even invited to a friendâs house for an afternoon! They said I was a âperfect yard guestâ and I was proud to hear that. It was soooo nice there, I even got some duck treatsâ¦yum! You really should come meet me and see all the commands that I know now. My foster parents constantly hug me and tell me what a smart boy I am. I really like people, I find them so exciting! Oh, and did I mention that I could also make an excellent running partner for any of you runners out there?!


This dog is currently in a foster home. If you're interested in adopting please email us at volaux@yahoo.com for an adoption application. All dogs are UTD on shots and spayed/neutered prior to adoption. 

LIKE US ON FACEBOOK! www.facebook.com/volunteerauxiliary
name: Buddy True Blue

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier
description: Introducing Samantha! She came into a local shelter with her companion- Miranda.  Samantha is approximately 5-6 years young and is extremely affectionate. She loves dogs big and small, has been cat tested and has no interest- is very easy going about food, toys, and LOVE people! Fill out an application to meet this girl today.
name: Samantha

description:
Meet Lando!

Lando is a one-in-a-million dog. He is stunning and has the personality to back up the good looks! He unfortunately has not be treated as he deserves for most of his young life. He ended up as a stray and was brought to a city shelter where he stayed for way too long of a time. His time in that shelter led to bad habits and him having a difficult time connecting with new people.

Since arriving at Adopt-A-Dog, we have seen a nice change in Lando's personality and sociability with new people. He now is always ready to give a kiss and get a hug! 

For more information visit our website at adoptadog.org or to submit an application please click here: goo.gl/VEjhLX
name: Lando

description:
Reena is a 5-6 year old chi mix surrendered when her owner was injured and couldn't care for her.  She's very nervous and defensive at first with strangers and, like many chis, can get protective of those she loves but is sweet and loyal once she bonds and gets along with other dogs.  She is looking for a calmer adult home without too many people coming and going where she will feel safe. Email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested.

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East next to 5 Star Car Wash (formerly Boulder Car Wash) in Morris Plains (Denville on GPS).  To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Reena

description:
www.TheLastResortRescue.com PLEASE NOTE: IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING THIS PET THE FIRST STEP IS TO FILL OUT OUR ADOPTION APPLICATION AVAILABLE AT THELASTRESORTRESCUE.COM. If you have a question or inquiry please email us at tlrapplications@gmail.com
Oh Miss Bea... if only you could tell us your story...

Miss Bea comes to us from a rural VA shelter where she was found roaming with Barney (we believe Barney is her son). Her teeth show signs of wear from chewing on wire, or rocks, or who knows what which makes guessing her age difficult. We will just say that she is no spring chicken. Miss Bea loves to "beagle" in her fosters back yard and thinks tracking is a blast. She's still got some get up and go, at least enough to follow that beagle nose so we would love for her to go to a home with a fenced yard. Besides that Bea is just looking for a place to rest her head. She has had multiple liters and her body shows it. She is a good girl, good with other dogs, fine with cats, great with people. She like Barney is figuring out what a "home" is all about. Miss Bea deserves a nice place to rest her head.Adoption Application http://www.thelastresortrescue.com/adopt
name: Miss Bea

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sweet Jerry is a 2 year old Lab/Collie mix who comes into rescue from Texas. This poor boy was hit by a car and left on the side of the road severely injured. He laid in the bushes fighting for his life, crying out in pain until he was finally spotted. As soon as we heard about Jerry we stepped in immediately to help. He is with our vet partner getting all the life saving medical care he needs. X-rays were taken and Jerry has sustained a punctured lung and a broken ulna which is by his elbow requiring expensive orthopedic surgery to repair. We have made him comfortable and will do everything we can to repair the damage that this innocent boy has suffered at the hands of humans. He is a brave warrior with a fierce will to live and the ER Staff says he continues to wag his tail each time he sees them. We canât wait to get this handsome guy all fixed up and see him living the good life with the loving forever family that he is so deserving of...could that be you?! Jerry will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give this very special boy his happy ever after, please fill out an application for Jerry here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Jerry

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Vegas is a sweet, 8 yrs. old, spayed, vaccinated, female English Bulldog. She prefers to be your only pet and is best in an adult home or one with teenagers. She is very protective of her house and family.
rescueridge.com
text 732 546 8805 to meet her.
Please adopt Lester and Vegas together. They are mother and son. â
name: Vegas

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***

Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

name: Fudge

description:
Hi! I'm Dirks! I think I am a shepherd/collie mix and about 9 or 10 years olds. I have a few health issues (a skin infection, an ear infection, a fatty tumor, and arthritis) that are currently being treated by my favorite vet and am ready to start looking for my forever family!

I get along wonderfully with other dogs, and cats are okay too! My foster mom is making sure I have lots of experiences, and so far, the only thing I don't have a lot of interest in are small children. They are just too busy for an old man like me!

Again, I do not think my perfect house comes with small children. I would prefer a quieter home where I can curl up on the sofa and take long naps!

If you think I am your perfect dog, please fill out an application at grrde.org! Be sure to list my name, Dirks, so they know which old boy you want!!!
name: Dierks

description:
Max is looking for the Best forever home a dog could find :
Max is a Whippet / Pittie mix ,He is Great with dogs and cats he is fully vaccinated and he is fixed. 
Max weighs 32 lbs he is 2 yo and is just the Greatest dog that loves life and going on adventures .Max just wants to be part of the family and make as many animal friends as he can . This is Max's Time to find his very own family who will love him forever and give him the greatest home .

Max found himself adopted as a cute little puppy then dumped at Brooklyn acc when his family didnt have time for him anymore .That was so hard on Max he didnt understand the change and why he lost everything he loved .
We have made max happy again and enjoying life the CT Team and his Rescue group Heavenly Angels Animal Rescue picked up the pieces to his Broken Heart and showed him life is good and it will be ok .

Max is taking private training class with Coaching 4 Paws and  He is doing so great in Training he loves to work in Class and just beat every task his coaches throw his way . Max is a super Smart Dog that loves to please his leader  and Max loves challenges and learning new things 
We are looking for a very specific family to Adopt Max  

Max would love to find a home with a nice yard and another happy playful dog (Max loves his doggie friends and he loves to play )

Max is great in a house and he is potty trained he is also crate trained but he is so good in a house a crate is not needed . 

Max loves car rides and walks and trails he has great energy and would love an active owner who likes to go out exploring or just nice walks 

Max has some great Training and he would love someone to adopt him that would keep this up and jump into training to keep his brain active and focused he is getting so good on a treadmill its unbelievable just how fast he picks things up and he loves doing training and just working

Max would do best with a  leader ( he loves to follow his leader and take direction) an adult owner someone who just loves there dogs and wants there dogs to live life with them 
Max would prefer a home with adults only 

Max is something real special ask anyone that knows Max how amazing this dog is and he needs that owner that is just as special 

Max here with us is labeled a helper dog because he has such a gift for helping other dogs its amazing to watch him as new rescues come in and he just makes them feel ok Max is the reason 6 other dogs have found amazing homes in the past 7 months ( Thank you Max )  When will it be his turn  toorver  find his own family that will love him for life 

Please help us Share Max for an amazing forever home he is the best dog ever and would love some networking help so we can find him a family he deserves 

for more information on max call (347 )722 -5939 or email haar13@aol.com
Application:
http://fs30.formsite.com/HAAâ¦/AdoptionApplication/index.html
Foster or adopt save a life
#HAAR #adoptdontshop
name: Maxwell

description: Chile is a gorgeous Chihuahua with a nice personality. She is about 9 years old, weighs about 6-8 pounds, and has a beautiful soft coat. She has a very lovable personality and just wants to be with you. She loves getting affection. She has a very nice temperament and does not require a lot of exercise. She has previously lived with dogs. Chile is already spayed and is up to date on her vaccinations. Chile has much more to give and is looking forward to finding her new home.  Thank you.
name: Chile

description:
Michaâs a 12yo 8lb chihuahua looking for her people to give and get love from. Sheâs dog and kid friendly! Sheâs housebroken, enjoys a fenced in yard along with taking walks. She affectionate and likes spending cuddle time with her people. Sheâs low maintenance, a total ham and loves to be pet. She came to Tiny Paws when her mommy had to go into a nursing home.

Michaâs spayed, vaccinated, HW negative and Microchipped. Apply at www.tprescue.org Currently Fostered in Mount Laurel, NJ
name: Micha

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

If you would like to take me home please complete a Pet Adoption Application
