name: Tanner

description:
Bruno is part of a litter that was born to a rescued mom in Thailand last September 2017.  He is a very loving boy and loves to share the bed with his caretakers.  He's very friendly, active, and affectionate. 

We are planning on bringing Bruno to NYC from Thailand in December 2018.  As we do not have a shelter, we rely upon foster homes to help us to save these little lives.  If anyone is interested in fostering Bruno upon his arrival, we'd really appreciate the help, and if you'd like to adopt him, please do contact us at FurRealNYC@gmail.com and we'd be happy to send you an application.
name: Bruno

description: Success...that is what Nala means and we desperately hope that Nala will finally have success in finding a family that won't consider her an inconvenience once a baby is welcomed into the household . Nala is about 3 years and a healthy 50 lbs. When she first came to SCR, she was underweight - skin & bones - but with a little bit of from her foster family and she's blossoming . She walks great on a leash, is crate-trained, housebroken and would do best in a home with a fur-brother. She is great with kids but can be a bit rambunctious. When meeting other dogs, she would do best with slow intros but once she's warmed up, she's an absolute doll. She's as sweet as a triple chocolate cake. She is friendly but a resounding NO when it comes to cats ....sorry, she's not into felines. The perfect home for her would have a fur-brother and an active pet-family â. After all, Miss Nala is only 3 years old and has energy to burn. If this sounds like your home....are you ready to help me get my success story? To adopt Nala, please fill out an application at www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/
name: Nala (Flushing)

description:
Meet the cutest little puppies ever! Noel, Bell, and Joy are tiny and adorable 2-month-old Dachshund mixes. They each weigh about 3 pounds and will be small dogs when fully grown. They came from a high-kill shelter in Kings Tree, South Carolina. The big world can be a little frightening at first for these tiny pups, but they quickly warm up and are ready to take on the world one paw at a time. These pups are all very energetic and love to play. Their motto is "eat, sleep, cuddle, repeat!" They are working hard on their crate training, leash walking, and housebreaking skills. Will you be the lucky one to take one of these pups home?

They are all spayed, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped. 

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! 

In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.
name: Joy

description:
Our little spicy Pepper is looking for a family to give her lots of love and good care while teaching her to be more comfortable with handling. She is curious about everything especially when she is with you: walking on a leash, running in a yard or the park, or concentrating on getting treats for the tricks you teach her. Her sunny funny personality shines full blast when sheâs got your attention and isnât that just what you want in a forever friend? Pepper is a lovely little lady who will brighten your day as soon as you open your heart to he





This animal is available for adoption at the Pennsylvania SPCA located at 350 E. Erie Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19134.  Adoption Center hours are 1PM-8PM Monday through Friday and 10AM-5PM Saturday & Sunday. For more information, please contact us using the information below:

website: www.pspca.org
phone: 215.426.6300 ext. 234, 251, 244
email: adoptions@pspca.org

(Because we receive a very high call volume, you may experience a long hold time.  The best way to contact us is through email or by coming into the shelter.  We apologize for the inconvenience)
name: Pepper

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Candy is 5 years old and 25 pounds, and was suffering horribly with mange when we found her in Alabama. She spent some time with our veterinary partners receiving treatment and she is now doing great! She is the most adorable Beagle mix and has been doing wonderful in her foster home, but canât wait to find a home to call her very own. She is still working on growing her hair back and She will be up to date on shots and spayed prior to placement in her forever home. She is very sweet, gentle, and grateful for even the smallest gesture of kindness. Candy is very friendly with people and other dogs but needs to find a home without cats. She is a calm and loving girl And one lucky family is going to hit the jackpot with this sweetheart! If you would like to adopt Candy, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Candy

description:
Hi my name is Duke and I am the pet of the week. I was recently surrendered to a local animal shelter when my owner passed away. I was scared in the shelter and luckily PLDP stopped by and scooped me up. A little about myself. I am a nine year old distinguished guy. Adorably distinguished of course! I am house-trained. I am currently living with a twelve year old boy, and two others dogs. I am not sure how I feel about cats yet but I can be tested with them if needed. I have a lot of energy and keep up with the three year old dog where I live now.  My vision and hearing is not the best these days so I do better with bigger dogs and especially like the ladies.  I have a habit of whining sometimes when a car goes by because I cannot always see it or hear it, but I feel the vibration and it makes me bark sometimes.  But other than that, I am a real catch!  I really like to be with my person, and would do better in a home where I am not alone a lot. I love to be pet, cuddle and I am also quite fond of giving kisses. I enjoy romping around outside, and taking walks and snuggling with my owner at night.   I am neutered, micro-chipped, up-to-date on vaccines and heartworm negative. Sound like I could be the perfect guy for you? Please stop by PLDPâs site www.pldpaws.org, email pldpaws@gmail.com or call (484)323-1134.

This dog is available for adoption through Peace, Love & Doggie Paws Rescue.  If you are interested in meeting this dog, or if you have any questions, please contact us at pldpaws@gmail.com.  You can also receive further information on our website www.pldpaws.org.
name: Duke

description: Meet the Beautiful Peppa!  This sweet girl is a 2 year old female English Bulldog Pit Bull mix.  She is super friendly and loves just about everyone and everything she meets.  She loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times. She still has lots of energy and she loves to romp and play. She never turns down a good belly rub.  Even though she is considered an adult, she still has lots of puppy energy! She loves to play ball and to run around the yard.  She would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle! She is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month. She can't wait to find her forever home!
name: Peppa

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

This adorable young boy is Goose, a total sweetheart who just loves everybody! Goose loves dogs, is fine with cats, and adores kids and people of all ages. Goose came in to rescue on a very crowded week from an Animal Control. He only made it out because we had a wonderful foster who made room for one more. Goose is a Hound/Great Pyrenees mix, young and silly, but super sweet. He was abandoned and on his own for some time, starved for both food and affection. He is very thin but getting great care now in his foster home. This is one very sweet boy! Goose is housebroken and knows basic commands. He would just love a great home and family of his own to spoil him so he will never have to be lonely and abandoned again. He is currently being fed separately from all of the other dogs in his foster home so he can gain some much needed weight. He is currently 80 pounds so he will be a large boy once he fills out. Unfortunately you can see and feel every bone in his body now, but he is so happy to be safe in rescue. Hounds are a dime a dozen in the southern states (in many places so are Pyrenees) but this is one great combo. We are so thankful Goose is safe in rescue and cannot wait till he finds his furever home. Goose would love a doggie companion or two and he is especially great with children of all ages. Just a lovely mix of two great breeds looking for an amazing home!
name: Goose

description: Dora was running out of time at a kill shelter when FOWA was contacted to help. Of course once Dora came bouncing out giving kissing with a tail that didn't stop wagging we knew she had to come to FOWA . Dora is currently undergoing surgery to remove mammary tumors that could of been avoided if she had been spayed, Dora  is doing great in her foster home .. Well behaved,  good with the kids and adults and so far has been  the perfect lady.. But give her a toy and watch that playful side come out .. She will flip it , squeak it,  roll with it , and finally work to get that squeaky out ... She is very silly to watch and very easy to fall in love with . We haven't tested her with dogs or cats yet because she is still recovering from surgeries but we have no doubt of her love for people .. Remember age is a number not a disease so think about bringing this sweetie home ... Let her steal your heart ,Applications can be found at www.fowarescue.com
name: Dora

description:
Bambiâs name suits her as she is gentle and loving as well as awesome with people and other dogs.  A 6-month-old mix of Catahoula Leopard Dog and Shepherd, her blue merle coat, her bright eyes, and her indecisive ears (going up? going sideways?) will capture the heart of everyone she meets.  Right now, Bambi weighs 32 pounds, her mature weight being 60 pounds.  All the more to love for you!  All the more love she can give you!  A great dog!  (posted 12/28/18, ME)

**It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**

Adoption: $325 which covers quarantine, shots, worming, food, medical records, spaying/neutering, microchip and an Alabama State Health Certificate.

Transport, if needed :  $120.00    We consider the transport to be of great importance and, as such, take particular care of the dogs during the trip from Alabama.  We make every effort to arrive with healthy and minimally stressed dogs.

Weight Scale:   Small =  less than 25
                       Medium = 26-60
                         Large =  61-100
                               XL = 100+
name: Bambi

description: Oreo is a very nice, nine year old large mixed breed. He spent many years in a loving home but had to be released to the shelter when his owner became too ill to care for him. Oreo is house broken and was trained to an ubderground electric fence. He is good with cats and with other dogs. Oreo is about the size of a large lab but has the gorgeous coat of a Landseer Newfoundland. This big guy is sad and a little confused at having landed in an animal shelter but a he will do fine in a home that has some patience and some love to give.For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt
name: Oreo

description:
Looking for a happy, silly, sweet & funny pup to join your family? Please check out Ashes as she is all these and more! Ashes would love to find herself a home where she can run and play and be part of a family. Because Ashes does best with a canine companion, we are looking to place her into a home with another friendly dog (or dogs) where she can thrive. She is a very active, happy girl. She even gets along with cats. Our volunteers love her because she is so sweet & she has made some doggie friends at the kennel while she waits for her forever home.

Ashes is a beautiful young Labrador Retriever mix who weighs about 55 pounds & who walks well on a leash. She will make a wonderful pet for any family looking for an active pup - she's young and has the energy you normally find a in a younger dog. She'd be a great buddy for someone who enjoys spending time outdoors.

Ashes is currently in a foster home with a wonderful German Shepherd friend & they get along so very well together. As you can see in her video, she & her foster sister love to go swimming! There are alpacas at her foster home & in one photo, you can see Ashes checking out these strange creatures, not quite sure what to make of them! :)

If you've got a home for Ashes, please fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to ask for ASHES SCAS!
name: Ashes SCAS

description: Joey is a sweet, timid girl who deserves a morning walk and comfy couch to relax on all day!  It appears that her life has not been the best so far, so let's change that with a new forever home to call her own!
name: Joey

description:
Artemis is small shepherd mix around 2.5 years old . 
This sweet baby her owner died and she was very scared like her sisters .

They clearly did not receive much love or any medical care .

Artemis came with her siblings under us and went straight to our vet where they received all the medical care .

Slowly Artemis was blooming open and became even best friends with Amona who does not like any other dogs .

Artemis needs a family who will shower her with love and patience . She is very sweet but needs some time to understand who you are .

This baby is located in Huntington NY

To become her new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and ask one
name: Artemis

description: Jail and his sister Bird were picked up by a NY State Corrections facility. They are both very outgoing, sweet, extremely friendly dogs. Being part Hound though they were on the run following their little noses and it wasn't the 1st time. They make you laugh a lot and they can cheer the grumpiest person up (even the Grinch I bet) in an instant. So a home that will not let them run free is the ticket here. Fenced yard or leash walked is a must. So if you enjoy laughing and want to be cheered up come meet these two. They don't have to be adopted together but if you want double the fun.......... here are the dogs for the job.
name: Jailor

description:
Please share gorgeous ASCARI ?????

Unfortunately we do not have that much info on Ascari .

Ascari was under another rescue but unfortunately the rescuer passed away.

A bunch of dogs were all by themselves so local volunteers shared the dogs with several other rescue groups . We took 3 dogs over from them.

They were not vetted and one the 3 shepherds died of kidney failure .

Ascari received the needed medical care at our vet and after his treatments he went on transport to NY . He is now located in Middle Island NY .

Ascari is around 3 years old and wants to pet only . We can not blame him. It is clear that he did not had an easy life and now he deserves all the attention on him .

He is a very sweet and smart dog .

Who will open his heart and home for this baby ? Who will give him as a Christmas present his forever home?

If you are that family then please apply today by filling in the adoption application on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we will send you one
name: Ascari

description:
Lana is a 10-month-old (as of July 10, 2018) Pit bull mix. Very friendly with everyone she meets, a lot of puppy energy, just an overall sweet love bug. 

Prospective Adopter, please complete an adoption application available on our website nbanimalrescue.org and email it to adopt@nbanimalrescue.org. Upon receipt, an Adoption Specialist will contact you to schedule an appointment. We are a volunteer organization, so an appointment to visit the rescue is a necessity.
name: Lana

description: Lela is four years old.  She is shy initially but once she warms up she is a delight.  She is good with some dogs and with older kids.  She has a very sweet and loving personality.  Good Family dog.
name: Lela

description: This is Killian, a 45ish lb, 3 year old, heinz 57 hunk. He comes to us from NC and was transported safely to us before Hurricane Florence hit his hometown and he is a true southern gentleman with just the most perfect manners. He is dog friendly, cat friendly, kid friendly, the perfect hat trick!! And yes, your eyes are NOT deceiving you. This handsome boy has 2 different color eyes!! He came to us heartworm positive and has been treated! He will be retested in 6 months just to make sure he's negative! Interested in adopting this handsome hunk?
name: Killian

description: This rambunctious youngster is yearning to leave his kennel for good and find an experienced and loving family. Full of energy and life, this 1 year old cut Pittie is ready to explore and share all the wonders of the world with one lucky household. Ricky is truly the life the party and be the center of attention, no doubt. He'll need plenty of physical and mental stimulation so he can sleep soundly, so if you're in the market for a lively pooch who would absolutely love car rides, hikes, extra playtime, etc, then rowdy Ricky is your man.
name: Ricky

description: Sampson is a good boy, he loves to be pet, but not picked up, which is why he was surrendered. Are you willing to give this cutie a good home?
name: Sampson

description: For more information, please call the Pike County Humane Society at  (570)296-7654 or send Email to pikecountyhs@gmail.com.Please Note: Petfinder listings may not always be up to date! Please call the shelter to make sure this dog is still available. All dogs and cats are micro-chipped for their protection.
name: Buddy

description: How can you say no to this face? All Biggie wants is to be by your side and enjoy every minute with his family. Unfortunately, his last family let Biggie rule the roost and allowed him to get away with some naughty behaviors without the proper training. Now, we are looking for a household that will be able to give Biggie a stable routine and some stern guidance. He's been nothing but a joy to handle and play with, and has been very receptive to training since he's been back. We see a bright future for this amazing social butterfly. All he needs is a patient and loving home that will provide him with the necessary guidance and love to flourish and grow.
name: Biggie

description:
Hi I am majesty, I am a 4 year old lab, pit great Dane mix. I am spayed up to date on shots. I live with a cat and am good with most other dogs. It is unknown what happened to me before a kind women found me. Sadly while I was at a clinic someone thought it funny to took a glove and snapped it in my face I was so scared! I started shaking and growling. Iâm so scared when I pass that building I shake! Because of a 
Human I have some anxieties. I have been in the same foster home for 2 years a behaviorist was out to see me and my rescuers have been looking for the perfect home. I used to have a dog with me but since he is Sadly gone I have separation anxiety. I cut my mouth and paws up. I need a urgent new foster home! My foster mom is gone 12 hours a day and I canât be alone. If she was home she would keep me. I need a dog savvy owner. With proper introductions I am a sweet playful girl. A human did this to me and know Iâm losing the only home who ever loved me, I need a kind understanding human who can help undo what another did to me. Is that you? Please fill out a foster or adoption application at www.affrescue.com any questions call kim 215-676-3318. I only have until Monday December 3 to find a place my res he has been paying a dog sitter to sit with me all day but canât afford it past Monday.
name: Urgent majesty

description: The Puppy Palooza continues! And we don't have any sell outs here. Introducing the woman who took the country music world by storm, Emmylou Harris, and her grammy-winning, newly-released single, Green Pastures. To foster or adopt, visit bit.ly/BadassApp
name: Green Pastures

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Luna! This beautiful girl is a 3 year old Shepherd mix who weighs 27 pounds. She found herself alone and scared with her 8 week old puppies in a Texas shelter. We pulled this precious family to safety and now they are ready to start their new lives! Luna is such a good girl. She is sweet and friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. She has been spayed and is up to date on vaccines. Her foster mom says "she likes to be with her people. Luna enjoys going for walks and playing in the yard and she loves belly rubs! Luna is sweet and affectionate. She is great with a crate and one of her favorite activities involves her Kong, filled with treats. Luna is leash trained, but still pulls a little on the leash. I think she would love to have a fur sister or brother to play with!" If you would like to be the one that gets to give Luna her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Luna (TX)

description:
Hey Everyone! My name is Jeda and I am a super snuggler! I love my people and I love all the attention and belly rubs you will give me. I like to take time to get to know my fur friends so I would like to 'find my furever home with folks that will let me get to know new pups slowly. I enjoy taking nice walks and playing a little but the big deal for me is snuggles. Do you have extra to spare? 

Thanks to The Bissell Pet Foundation's Clear the Shelter Event, my adoption fee is waived for this weekend. Apply now!

All of our animals come fully up to date on vaccinations, microchipped, heartworm tested negative, and dewormed, as well as neutered, and treated for any ailments found upon veterinary examination. The adoption fee covers a portion of these services, and makes it possible for us to continue rescuing animals.  For more information on the adoption fees and adoption process, please complete our adoption application here:

www.louieslegacy.org/adopt

Thanks so much for caring about a needy animal!
name: Jeda

description:
Arielle her owner passed away and she became homeless with 4 other dogs on the property . 

This girl is very skittish and scared . She is around 2 year and is a golden retriever /lab/shepherd mix maybe even collie in it . 

Arielle needs time to open up . She is lost without her owner . She is doing ok with other dogs but is not a fan of cats . 

Arielle needs a family who has a lot of patience to gain her trust again. Patience and love are the keywords here . She is not used to walk on a leash but we are training her for it. 

She is located in Middle Island NY
name: Arielle

description:
Dixie is approximately 4 months old and arrived at the shelter as a stray. She is very affectionate and active. She loves to run in the yard and is learning basic leash manners. 

Dixie is a puppy that will require attention and training. She is very food motivated and receptive to training. An active family would be her best match.
name: Dixie

description:
Available for adoption: Around 10/9/18
Zooey found herself at the shelter and was very afraid of what was next.  We got her on a freedom ride and she is now settling in to foster care.  She is pretty shy and it's going to take some time for her to adjust.  We will provide an update after we have had time to work with her more so check back for an update soon.  She was originally known as Speckles.

description: This long coated gorgeous girl is new with us.  Please check back soon!
name: Nikki

description:
Constantine originally came from North Carolina as an 8 week old pup. He was adopted, but unfortunately they found out their 3 year old boy is very allergic to him and brought him back to our rescue.
Constantine is about 6 months old and a typical puppy.  He is a Boxer/ Staffy mixed with some other breeds,  weighs about  40 pounds and is all legs. Guessing he will be the size of a Boxer when all grown up.  Constantine is well on his way with potty training. He had a few accidents the first few days being back at rescue, but has not had an accident since and runs right to the door to go out. Constantine is crate trained and does pretty on a leash. He LOVES other dogs and children and Adults. He is an all around happy go lucky guy.
Constantine is neutered, microchipped and up to date on all of his vaccines. If you are interested in Constantine, please fill out an application at www.itavar.com
name: Constantine

description:
Chip is a beautiful 8 year old girl who is  very friendly with people.Chip loves toys and is extremely playful. She knows sit and give paw on command which is the cutest thing. She likes going outside and loves to sniff and roll around on the ground...especially in a big pile of leaves! Chip has been a shelter dog too long! Although she is a love bug with everyone she meets, she does not like other animals but she loves people and kids. Just look into those soulful loving eyes and give Chip a chance! 

.The application can  be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html
name: Chip the Chipper Gal

description:
Sparkles is a special needs 7 year old female Beagle mix who was recently rescued from a high kill shelter in North Carolina. She was found as a stray and dropped off at the shelter. Sparkles is blind in her left eye from glaucoma, and it's possible that she may lose sight in her right eye as well. This is common in Beagles. 

Sparkles is spayed, up to date on vaccinations and housebroken! She is a very sweet girl and would love to find a home where she can enjoy her golden years with a family that will love and cuddle with her and preferably a home with no other dogs.

Sparkles hopes to find this special home in time for the Holidays!

Come visit me!
Pet Supplies Plus
391 Broadway 
Hillsdale New Jersey.
Saturday and Sunday 2 p.m.-6 p.m.

PLEASE NOTE THE FOLLOWING:
*We encourage you to stop by for a meet & greet with all of your family members and any other dogs you may have.
 
*We  DO NOT do same day adoptions. 

*If you complete an application online, please print a hard copy of it and bring it to the store with you.
name: Sparkles

description:
ADOPTION PENDING. You can see more of these beautiful dogs by going to  NGPR RESCUE DOGS at  https://nationalpyr.org/adoptable-dogs

NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Belly-rub experience needed! Looking for a relaxed, affectionate companion? Ivy is another example of the happy transformations we love to see in rescue. Found as a stray, she was dropped off at the foster's house on a Christmas Eve, huddled under the legs of her rescuer in the front seat of a truck. After being treated for ehrlichia, going through heartworm treatment and being spayed, she's become one of those big, sweet girls who wants to get along with everyone and everything. She's "pyrfect" in that she is submissive and playful with male dogs; tiptoes gently in between the gaggle of cats there at feeding time (and ignores the ones who swat at her), and has sauntered calmly among a couple of goats and donkeys. Ivy is a "people pleaser" who would love to accompany you on leash walks, and so far, not a big barker at all. She's pretty much unflappable (except that she wasn't too pleased with her summer "haircut", which will grow back!) and doesn't seem to have issues with anyone or anything, just happy to have attention and be as close to you as possible. Ivy is waiting patiently for a family to love and give her the belly rubs that always make her smile :)
name: Ivy in MO - pending

description:
Hi, I'm Zeke. I'm a 3 year old English Pointer that is looking for a forever home. If you dont know much about my breed let me fill you in. We are hard driving, processing stamina, courage and always wanting to go on adventures. Though dignified and sweet-natured, we are packed with energy and we should be with a family who will give us the running exercise we need to feel satisfied. Our breed gets bored easily, that's when we start to look for something to do on our own. With strangers, most English Pointers are slightly reserved, but not me. I love everyone and will make sure you know it!
The English Pointer can be a bit stubborn and that is why the rescue quickly trained me all my basic manners. Since I'm very sensitive like most pointers, I respond well to patience and  positive training that includes food rewards and praise . My new family will also have to help remind me to demonstrate impulse control when I get excited.
I'm ready for my new home, if you are an active family with dog experience that can give me the exercise I need please come meet me. You will fall in love with me and wonder how you ever lived without me. 
If you would like more info on this dog and our adoption process, please contact info@jaxslabrescue.org  
You can also visit our website at www.jlrrescue.org  for additional information
about our process and our coverage areas.
name: Zeke

description: Meet Rocky. This handsome Anatolian Shepherd boy was rescued from a very abusive situation. He will need a loving, patient family who will help him come out of his shell. He is good with other dogs. Rocky is very vocal and loves to bark. Due to this, he would not do well in an apartment or townhouse. Interested in adopting Rocky? Visit www.huskyhouse.org today to fill out an application.
name: Rocky

description: Meet Lucy! Sheâs 11 years old and a purebred long haired dachshund. Sheâs about 13 pounds, spayed and vaccinated. Sheâs super cute with her short little legs! Sheâs dog friendly, cat friendly and kid friendly. Sheâs easy going and would make a great family pet.
name: Lucy

description: Hector is a 7-year-old long hair Chihuahua. He is sweet as sugar. He is house trained. He is also crate trained. He is the perfect little man. He loves going for car rides. He did very well with his first bath and did not mind the hair dryer. To be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.

description: Foster update: Meet Jenny! She's the cutest, sweetest, happiest little girl! She plays gently with her foster brother, and LOVES snuggling with humans/dogs. She has stunning gorgeous green/gray eyes and smiley pouty lips :) She is super affectionate and really enjoys curling up next to you and giving puppy kisses! Jenny is a 7-week-old boxer/lab mix who is likely to be 45-55lbs fully grown. She is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!

description:
Age: 9 years

Hello, Iâm Sierra! I was found wandering the streets, a little confused. But luckily some nice people came to my rescue, and now Iâm at Animal Haven! I move a bit slower than the youngsters, and my skin is a little bit itchy. But Iâm just the sweetest girl. My friends at the shelter are still getting to know me, and you can too! Come visit me at Animal Haven!
name: Sierra

description:
Watts is one incredibly special little guy... reserved with the most joyful, endearing inner spirit that comes out in the form of wiggles and thumping tail wags! 

You'll see in his videos on our website fortheloveofdogsrescue.org, Watts has some places where he has become super comfortable (that shows with high happy tail, head held high, loose body and relaxed eyes) and other, new areas on the property that cause him to shrink into his shell like a turtle. Like we do with all of our dogs, as soon as they arrive here they are put in a very predictable and simple routine with handlers that complement what the dogs needs at that time.  Watts got comfy within his routine in a short period of time. in the meantime he quickly began to trust and adore his handlers and trainer. 

Watts loves other dogs and thrives in playgroup with his buddies Finney, Jessie and Orly. He is absolutely his happiest out there.. you'll see his tail whipping in huge circles, mouth WIDE open with a huge smile and wiggles all over the map. He runs up to his human friends and does a sweet lean looking for affection. 

Watts has only been with us for two weeks so we are still getting to know him and his true personality under his guarded layers. he really is a dog that once you meet him, you will understand just how special he is! Stay tuned for updates but in the meantime, come out to meet this gentle soul!  

Visit our website at fortheloveofdogsrescue.org for more info, photos and videos!
name: Watts

description:
KC is a good dog who needs a second chance at a good life. He was found in an abandoned house with another dog in Far Rockaway by fellow rescuer Christine D. back in December of 2012. He was left for dead after they probably had no more use for him. He is about 5 years old now, and needs a very experienced owner. He is super motivated by treats, and also loves his yard time to get the zoomies out. KC enjoys his walks, and looks forward to putting his nose to the ground to catch a scent of some wild life. Due to his past, KC MUST be the only pet in the home, with no children at all.

Email harescue1@aol.com.

The application can be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAAâ¦/AdoptionApplication/index.html

(please copy entire link and paste into search engine)
name: KC

We are your typical fun loving puppies. We will be available soon and will be vetted for our age and also come with a spay/neuter contract. You can apply for us at www.allmuttsmatter.org!!

description: Hudson was abandoned in Goshen, NY.  Timid when he first arrived in late September he is now loving all the attention.  Loves to play catch and just the fact that people are spending time with him.  We believe that whomever dumped him didnât spend time with him.  Great dog for a family.  Needs experience owner and someone whoâll spend time working with him
name: Hudson

description:
Wynter is pure sweet, has a gentle heart and has one amazing personality! She is a very sweet well-behaved girl that would make anybody a wonderful companion! She is about 7 months old but not unusually energetic ... she's just perfect all around!  She is also a very nice size at 44 pounds. 
Wynter is just of a perfectly charming girl

If you would like to meet Wynter please call 201-797-8861 or email startkayne@gmail.com

description:
Jett is a 5-year-old Lab mix boy weighing about 61 pounds. Jett is a sweet and gentle boy would would make a great family pet. He is good with people and other dogs, so much so that he needs to be in a home with another dog. He is NOT good with cats.   

   From his foster mom....  Jett is great with other dogs. He is great with humans both big and small. He walks great on a leash--nice and gentle and does not pull although he does have a prey drive for small critters. He does not sleep on the couch or bed despite seeing the other dogs do it. He has no food aggression and takes treats nicely. He knows basic commands like sit, down, stay and is housetrained. He even sits nicely in the shower for bath. He loves being outside. And stays close by to the humans and dogs of the house. He is overall a great dog. Jett must go to a home with another dog to show him how to relax   

   If you're interested in meeting Jett, go to EHRDOGS.ORG and submit an application. Don't forget to mention his name: JETT STEELE!!!!
name: Jett Steele

description:
Please note, this is a courtesy listing for our sister rescue group, the SPCA of Westchester. This dog is located at the SPCA at 590 North State Road in Briarcliff Manor, NY 10510 (www.spca914.org). Please apply with the SPCA if you are interested in this dog and read the details below!

I'm eligible for critter credit!! With my adoption, you will receive a $1,000 credit toward a select trainer or a gift card to Petco or Petsmart!! 
Critter Credit cannot be used towards adoption fee. 

We are so proud of Sadie -- and from that smile on her face, she's pretty proud of herself, too! She just passed her C.L.A.S.S. B.A. and M.A. test! C.L.A.S.S. stands for Canine Life and Social Skills, and by earning her B.A. and her M.A., Sadie has shown that she's mastered things like meet and greets, loose leash walking, stay, settle, leave it, and more. In other words, she's one smart, well trained pup! It's time for our star student to go home

Sadie is around 10 years old and she's a real brindle beauty! She may have a little grey in her muzzle, but she's got a lot of pep in her step. She's active, playful, and very friendly. Sadie loves spending time with people. She's not a fan of other dogs or cats. She's a mature girl who's well-mannered and will make a great companion, adventure buddy, and best friend. If you'd like to spend your days playing fetch or going for long walks, and your nights snuggling with a furry best friend, Sadie might just be the girl for you! 

When to Come:
Our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.

SPCA of Westchester
Briarcliff Manor, NY

Location Address

590 North State Road
Briarcliff Manor, NY 10510
Get directions
shelter@spca914.org
914-941-2896
name: Sadie - located at SPCA

description: Cool guy looking for a cool family to call his own. He enjoys the outdoors, summer barbecues, fall hikes, and snowy romps in the yard. We don't know if he likes to swim, too cold to try that out right now! Come in, adopt Logan, and rediscover the simple pleasures.

Otto's parents have made the difficult decision to return him and we think it best he be placed in a home without another dog. Otto is a one-year old hound mix. He weighs 58 pounds. He is house trained and crate trained. He has not been around children or cats. This handsome hound is extremely loving and we are commited to finding him his perfect home. Please apply to adopt.

description: Foster update: Mindy is a one-woman show! She's full of energy, excitement, and most importantly, love. Her absolute favorite thing in the world is wrestling with her brother, but she'll also settle for a squeaky toy -- or your shoelaces! When she's not showing off her pouncing skills, she's showering you with affection and sloppy kisses. She's got an independent streak too -- when she's sleepy, she'll find herself a comfy spot and nod off in seconds. Mindy has gorgeous classic Rottweiler coloring and soulful brown eyes. If you're looking for a nonstop playmate, Mindy is the girl for you. Mindy is a 9-week-old rottweiler mix who is likely to be 50-60lbs fully grown. She is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Mindy

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Nelda! Nelda is an almost 7 month old Lab mix puppy who comes into rescue from Texas. Nelda is thankfully safe with us now after wandering into a car wash where she remained until we had her picked up and transported to our Houston Vet Partner. Nelda is just a baby, and already has been suffering and neglected. She had a terrible skin infection, was very malnourished, and anemic from her skin being so bad. She has gotten all of the medical care that she needs and is now looking and feeling so much better! She has been doing wonderful in her foster home but is ready for a home to call her very own! This little princess deserves only the best from here on out...are you the one that can give this to her?! She is such a sweet and loving pup who is friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. She is spayed and up to date on vaccines. If you would like to be the lucky one that gets to give Nelda her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Nelda

description:
This dog is a courtesy post on the Mid-Atlantic Jack site. This dog is not in our rescue but the owner wishes to have the dog placed in a loving forever home. If you are interested in this dog please contact Kaitlyn for more information. 


This is Bella: a 3 year old jack russell in need of a loving home - preferably a home with NO small children or other animals. She comes from a home where they did not have the time for her, and loud/wild children that made her very uncomfortable and stressed. She loves to run around outside no matter what the weather , eat snacks and cuddle on the couch. She is smart and energetic, and needs a family to invest the time and effort to properly train and socialize her. She learns best in a calm environment. Enjoys fuzzy sweaters and fuzzy blankets. She takes a while to get comfortable with you and to trust you, but once she does she is the sweetest girl youâll ever meet.  

Please contact Kaitlyn at 717-701-2501 (text or call) for more information.
name: Bella

description:
This super handsome guy is Buuddy! He is approx 5 years old. He likes other dogs/cats. He is a super silly, goofy guy! He likes going for rides and just sitting in the car! 
Anyone interested in adopting Buuddy would have to come meet him a couple times so he feels comfortable with them. It takes Buuddy a little while to feel comfy
when he meets new people. Come by and meet this guy! His picture doesnt due him justice.
name: Buuddy

description:
Alfredo is an adult but it seems like he is still a puppy because he is so sweet and playful. He loves other dogs and  people, but he is a little bit shy when he first meets someone.
Alfredo loves running and walking.  He loves being close to people and spending time with company, he adores being in a car for a ride. He is completely house broken, right now living in foster with cats and dogs.
Alfredo would be perfect for someone who loves outdoor activities and wants a companion to take around.
name: ALFREDO

description:
Tina Ino was surrendered by her owner to a high kill shelter. She was lovingly cared for and returned with her pretty blue harness. She is good with children and other dogs, is energetic and loves to play fetch, entertains herself with her toys and is quite a cuddler, just as sweet as can be.

She is a small Plott hound mix, super smart/quick learner, already house trained, crate trained and takes treats nicely. She is ready to be a part of your family. Tina Ino was brought to the shelter because they said she was allergic to chicken. We think that is easy enough to handle and our veterinarian will provide info.

If you are interested in Tina please fill out an application on our website at www.njshpetrescue.org - the best way to reach us is via email at njshpetrescue@gmail.com

We are located in New Jersey- please do not call our parent rescue in Pennslyvania
name: Ino/Tina

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website. **Be sure to watch Greta's training, sleepy morning & playtime with foster siblings video's below!**
NO Kitties for Greta **
Greta's Meet Your Match Designation is: Wallflower - Shy yet charming canine searching for patient owner with relaxed lifestyle. Looking for gentle guidance to help me come out of my shell. Treat me sweet and kind and Iâll blossom
I know Greta's photo looks like an adult dog but when you see her in person & on the videos below, you can see just how young & this little girl is! At least youâll be able to see what she will look like as a stunning adult GSD!
Greta & her sister Ingrid are 6-month old puppies (Ingrid has an adoption pending) and found themselves in a very crowded shelter in KY when their owners simply said they didnât want them anymore. They are clearly purebred German Shepherds, but on the petite side for GSD'S. I believe they will be between 50-60 lbs full grown.
Both of the girls were abused & they need someone who has experience with abused dogs in the past. They have already come so far just in the last few weeks living in my home. My sincere hope is that someday they will forget their past & just live for today where there are lots of nice people. She'll heal mentally but she needs a quiet home & lots of love & patience.
They are SUPER intelligent. Both girls have extremely soft & gentle dispositions & they are so affectionate, they really crave attention! They put their paws (gently) on your thighs & all they are trying to do is to get hugs. Usually, we discourage putting their paws on us --- but Iâm letting them do it since they need to feel loved & safe. I have found that when the KY pups & dogs arrive, they have seldom been pets the way they are to us. Most of the dogs live outside their whole life, usually chained up & they have never had a chance to BE puppies! Even adult dogs have to learn how to play with toys because theyâve never had any toys in their previous life.

GSDâs are known for being very intelligent which is why they are often used by the police & military & I can attest to their intelligence because when I'm watching these girls behavior I can SEE them thinking! So, that means they must be adopted by experienced pet parents & their new parents will have to be at least as smart as they are so you can keep us with them!

There is a video below showing what I see every morning when we all get up for the day. Of all the pups & dogs here in my home, Greta likes to âsleep in.â While all the other dogs run outside to potty she just keeps rolling around & doesnât seem the least bit in a hurry to get up. So, if you like to sleep in too, maybe sheâll be the perfect girl for you. Greta has just started doing the cutest thing â she has started to âsmileâ at me, it is so cute!

Both girls are perfectly healthy, do not have Heartworms & have a clean bill of health from my Vet. They have had all their shots, have been spayed & microchipped. They are in the process of professional dog training (see video below) and they are learning leash manners so they wonât drag you down the streets, and basic commands. Of course, they are both excelling in their training.

If Greta sounds like the kind of girl you would love to bring into your home & life, be sure to read our adoption requirements which are listed on the left side of our website. If you can meet or exceed you can apply online.

We accept or credit cards & PayPal for the adoption fee

~ All LnF pups/dog s have been temperament tested & live in a foster home. ~ All pups and dogs have been housebroken (puppies are paper trained) & crate-trained and have had basic training ~ All pups/dogs have been Microchipped ~ Tested for Heartworm, Ehrlichia & Lyme ~ Each dog is on Heartworm Medication & Flea/Tick year-round while in our care ~ Up to date with Rabies ~ Distemper, Parvo & Leptospirosis vaccines ~ de-wormed.

Our adoption fee includes (30) days of FREE pet insurance with an option to purchase -- but it's your choice. We strive to provide the BEST medical care available so that YOU are assured all our pups/dogs are healthy, up-to-date on all necessary shots, spayed or neutered by our rescue.

Adoption Requirements: *A minimum physical 4-foot high fence or is higher is always mandatory and must be installed. Some dogs may need a 6-foot wood or vinyl fence & if so it's noted on their profile. We will not consider any applications that does not have an installed fence. We do NOT accept any type of electric fence, no exceptions

Click here to watch a video of Greta.
name: Greta

description:
Please share puppy ASLINA ??????

Aslina was born at our vet 2 months ago. Her mother was kicked on the streets as a pregnant dog . She was brought by animal control in a high kill shelter . There was no minute to loose to save her and her unborn puppies .

Unfortunately 7 puppies of the litter of 10 died right away when distemper hit them . Only 3 survived . Aslina and her 2 brothers .

Her mother is Aslani who is an ANATOLIAN Shepherd . We do not know who the father is .

They will arrive this Saturday at our vet in Huntington.

We are looking for a new forever home for this little cupcake .

We do not keep puppies in reserve and these will be the last puppies of the year .

Aslina is treated for distemper but will be still 2 months more contagious what means you have to stay away from public places and your dog had to be up to date on their shots . It is not contagious for cats .

To become their new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and we send you one.
name: Aslina

description:
I am the oldest dog in our shelter and I have been here half of my life. Sprocket is my name and I am the best boy in the world. I have been patiently waiting for a chance to prove it to my forever family. I have had some pretty rough experiences. These are the parts of my life that I have chosen to forget, but people see them all over my body. Good fortune came my way when Eleventh Hour Rescue saved me from the streets of Jersey City. They cleaned me up and made sure I was fully recovered.

I am easy to take care of with a very short coat that needs occasional brushing mostly because I love it. I don't like to walk very far, but exercise is as important for my mind as it is for my body. I like to walk for about 15 minutes. I am built for comfort not for speed. I like to play with a jolly ball and to spend time outside sniffing around. I love to sit on a bench with a kissable human. I am a little shy with new people and I don't like loud noises. I will let you know I am unhappy about it by heading back indoors.

A greeting from me means hoisting my "low to the ground" little body up as close as I can get and giving lots of kisses. When it is time for you to go I will head for my comfy bed and settle in with a toy and a Nylabone to chew. I learned to sleep in my crate, too. I may need a little time to get used to sleeping in a crate again after having a kennel run for a while, but I am a smart boy!

Here are some obedience things I know: sit, down, stay, walking nicely on a leash with very little pulling.

If you think we could be friends, even if you want to foster rather than adopt me, please fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org & ask for me by name - SPROCKET!
name: Sprocket

description:
Kenna is an adorable 1 year old lab mix weighing 19 lbs. She is shy at first in new surroundings, but with a little patience she soon becomes a happy and energetic pup who loves playing with toys and other dogs. For this reason, we suggest an experienced owner who will allow her time to decompress from kennel living. Kids over 10 preferred. She is lovable, sweet and is looking for her forever family to cuddle up with and give her the stability that this pup so desperately needs. 

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.
name: Kenna

description: Meet our sweet boy Jude! Heâs a 9 years young, 8 lb. Yorkie found as a stray and brought to the NYC shelter.  He jumps with excitement when his leash is taken out and loves walks and outdoor adventures. Jude loves other dogs and meeting new people, but we think heâll do best in an adult home.  He is housebroken and wee wee pad trained, loves treats and likes to curl up with his foster mom on the couch. He is somewhat hard of hearing and also seeing impaired in one eye because of dry eye and will require daily eye drops. He is otherwise healthy, vaccinated, microchipped, recently neutered and has had dental work. We are taking applications now on our website:  www.woofdogrescue.com.  Is Jude your new best friend?  Please note that we only adopt within the NY Tri-State area.
name: Jude

description:
NYC Area - Gary was chained up outside of his former owner's house in South Korea. His owner wanted to give him away to the dog meat trade because he no longer wanted him. We rescued him with the help of local activists and brought him to NYC for a second chance at a better life. Gary is very friendly and loves affection. He has a gentle nature, but can become grumpy and possessive of toys, treats and food. Therefore Gary would do best with an adopter experienced in working with reactive dogs and continue working with our trainer after adoption for a few more months. Gary is 3-4 years old, neutered and has all his shots and vetting. Please consider adopting Gary and making him part of your family!

Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
** If this dog is listed here that means he is STILL available**

We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions in NYC only. Out-of-state/non-local adoptions are rare and are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of NYC. We also do not do same-day adoptions NOR do we select adopters on a âfirst-come, first-servedâ basis. We thoroughly review all applications/check references after each event and THEN determine which adopters are the best match for each dog. After selecting who we feel is the best fit, we notify you by phone/email to arrange for a time to conduct a home visit and finalize the adoption. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience.

Follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram @koreank9rescue
www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Gary

I love to play with toys and other dogs. I am a true love bug who loves to cuddle. It takes me some time to warm up to new people but once I do I am like Velcro. I am nervous in new situations so my new parents should be understanding and patient. If you are interested in giving me a loving home, please fill out an application.

description:
This is Buffett, a 5 year old 1/2 boxer/ 1/2 Great Pyrenees clocking in at 80 pounds. He pretty much has a Boxer personality, and is goofy and silly.

Buffett is a very good boy. He is good with people, and will enjoy a home with kids older than 10.  This handsome boy has impeccable house manners, and we know he  came to us from a place where he was well-cared for and he has been a happy house pet for some time.

These are Buffett's needs:

1. People who get boxers. Boxers are dorks. He just happens to be 1/2 Great Pyrenees which mellows out the boxer some.
2. A fenced yard to play in or someone who will give him the exercise he needs.
3. Dog friends are cool. Unless they jump on his head.  Despite being a bit of a dork, the Pyr in this boy shines true here.  He will do best with other non-bouncy dogs.
4. Like most Boxers, Buffett thinks cats are for chasing.. Kind of like squirrels and small woodland creatures.  Buffett can live with cats, but only dog savvy ones. 
5. Snacks. This dog is food-motivated and will do just about anything for a cookie.
7. An extra plus couch of a super comfy dog bed. He's kind of the princess and he would definitely notice a lentil under 10 layers of mattresses.

Just like his namesake, all he wants to do is drink margaritas and eat cheeseburgers in paradise.

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please FIRST apply online, at https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/, then email Corey@bigfluffydogs.com

Our Website www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the adoption process. 

NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT ALWAYS RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION DUE TO THE SHEER NUMBER WE GET DAILY. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE MIGHT NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. 

* BEHAVIOR DISCLAIMER: We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. All dogs will require supervision with children, other dogs, and cats/other animals regardless of whether or not we have stated that the dog is friendly towards kids, cats, other dogs, etc. Slow introductions to other animals in the home, and allowing for them to have a separate space will make for better relationships in the future. Most dogs need an adjustment period when transitioning into a new home and there may be potty accidents, even if we have stated the dog is housebroken. All dogs should be somehow confined separately (crate or separate room) when left home alone until you can be sure the dog is trustworthy left loose. Separation anxiety can manifest if a dog is left alone more than it is used to in it's new home. This can be worked through and we are here to help. Please do not give up on your new dog without reaching out to us first!
name: Buffett

description: Charlie was found running through traffic in Passaic, NJ. Thankfully a vet tech from our Veterinarians office was able to pull him to safety. we brought Charlie UTD on shots and neutered him. His foster mom groomed him and is getting him back in shape. We are hopeful that with good nutrition and a loving home he will be as good as new. Charlie loves everyone and gets along well with his foster brother.
name: Charlie/Fluffy

description:
Award-winning Hunter Hayes just wants to be âWanted,â and any loving family would be lucky to have him!

Handsome Hunter is a 6-month-old hound mix who weighs about 23 lbs. This sweet soul is far from âInvisibleâ -- he wears his unique markings proudly and loves that he stands out in a crowd. And Hunterâs looks are nothing compared to his wonderful disposition; just gaze into those gorgeous eyes and your heart will melt. Hunter is both dog and cat friendly.  Come meet Hunter Hayes today: When he starts crooning, youâll be swooning!

Hunter is neutered, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines. Email seespotrescued@gmail.com for an adoption application or fill it out online at seespotrescued.org. Check out more photos on Facebook.com/seespotrescued of all our adoptable pups!

description:
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance will transport within reasonable distance. Charlotte is being fostered in PA.

what we know about Charlotte:
*vision impaired with cataracts, prescription creme helps
*smart girl!
*loves to snuggle

What Charlotte's foster mom says about Charlotte:
Charlotte is a very lovable girl. She was picked up as a stray shortly before arriving with BDRA. Her foster home consists of seven dogs and she has growled at all of them at one time or another. She has also snapped at three of them. After being with them a couple months she has settled in and now will play with most of the other dogs. She is food aggressive and that may be due to what she endured while living on the street. She is housebroken and we are working on leash training. 

Charlotte is diabetic and it is under control with the least expensive insulin. She likes to snuggle and be under the blankets. She would make a very good companion for a person or couple with one or no other pets. She is good with younger children. She has taught herself how to climb up and down stairs and is a very bright girl! Her favorite thing to do is lay in your arms like a baby and have her belly rubbed, she could do that for hours! Blind Dog Rescue Alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.
name: Charlotte: snuggles! (PA)

She has been in a foster home for over a year, and her foster mom has been working with her to develop her confidence. She has been through training and has done well, but is still timid. Chyna takes time to warm up to new people, but when she does she enjoys receiving love and affection. Chyna would do best in a home with ans experienced savvy owner

description:
MEET ASHTON! Ashton was adopted at 3 months old and has been returned to us at 3 years old. His family loves him very much, but he is no longer a fit for their home. When first meeting new people Ashton can be a little shy, but once he gets to know you he is very affectionate and sweet!! Although Ashton likes dogs, we believe he should be the only dog in a home. He just wants his family all to him self :)

Ashton loves to go on long walks and hikes. He is a big snuggler too:) But playing fetch just might be Ashtons favorite thing in the whole world! Ashton is housebroken, crate trained, leash trained and ready to live in a home! Please consider making this handsome boy a part of your family.
name: Ashton Steele

description:
This handsome boy is Nate. 
Nate is approx 2 to 3yrs old.
He is a very sweet boy who doesn't seem to mind other dogs, but Nate is not a fan of cats. Nate needs a home WITHOUT CATS. 
Nate was picked up as a stray and no one has claimed him. He would really love a family of his own. Come meet this gorgeous boy! He is even more handsome in person! Come check out his 2 different colored eyes!
name: Nate

description:
This cutie patootie is Ares. Ares is a little shy at first but is a fun loving, affectionate guy once he gets to know you. He can be a cuddler as well but gets a little scared if people come at him too quickly, so while he has an amazing temperament, we recommend a home with no small children. Ares is estimated to be about 2 to 3 years old by our vet, just had his teeth cleaned and his urinalysis came back perfect. So this handsome guy is looking for his Furever home.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Ares

description: Cindy Lou is a corso mix and has many traits of a corso. She doesn't seem to have had an easy life. She was very scared upon coming into the shelter and It looks as though she was recently bred although she came in without any puppies. She was unsure and not very trusting but after a few days she is quickly warming up to our staff. Once she trust you she is a sweet girl who will look to you for attention and head rubs. She has tested ok with dogs but she lacks confidence. She would do best in a patient, calm home with people who have some corso experience.For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt
name: Cindy Lou

description: Ticket #24167.  Meet Luigi, the silly, happy, full of energy , 2 year old boy. Luigi does not realize how strong he is, he is too busy trying to show just how goofy he is. He is 2 years old, HOUSETRAINED and weighs about 62 pounds. Luigi is animal friendly and super, super affectionate. He will need basic training to learn his doggie manners. Luigi is definitely good for loads of laughs. Please stop by to see him soon.
name: LUIGI

description:
Isabelle is a lovely 8 month old yellow lab mix.  She has pretty white markings on her face, feet and chest.  She is very friendly and well-behaved.   Isabelle gets along well with other dogs.

Isabelle is currently at our Ringwood location at 260 Margaret King Avenue where she is available from 3-5 weekdays and 8-9 am and pm.

Skywalker would love someone who understands him, and has some experience as a dog owner. He really just wants to have a person he can call his own. Fill out our dog adoption application online at pawscrossedny.org

description: Color:white/black
