description: This 1 year old Pit mix is Tanner.Â  Tanner is a happy, friendly pup who would excel in an active home willing to burn off his puppy energy.Â  This handsome boy loves to play, willing sharing his toys whenever asked.Â  Tanner had no issues sharing his bone and was relaxed with all handling at his food bowl.Â  Tanner was playful and bouncy with other dogs.Â  Stop by and meet Tanner today.
name: TANNER 32113

description:
DAISY!

Daisy is sooo sweet! She is near perfection!

Wonderful temperament, mature at 6 yrs old, great in the home. 

Ideal home for Daisy is one that is quiet, one where someone is home a lot and with at least one other dog as company (a dog that matches Daisy's mellow temperament, in the same age range). She LOVES her walks, her down time, her humans and her doggie friends. 

Daisy is house trained. Good in the home. She is about 6 years old and weighs about 45 lbs. She is utd on her shots and is spayed.

WANT TO KNOW MORE? ARRANGE A VISIT? Please contact reboundhounds@gmail.com and her rescue will get right back to you, thanks!

DAISY IS IN FOSTER IN PISCATAWAY, NJ
name: Daisy

description:
She lost her ears to a butcher and then was left tied to a fence in Whispering Hills, Chester, NY.  After mutilating her, abandoning her ended up being in her best interest.  
Now she can look forward to a much safer, brighter future.  Despite her despicable beginning, she is the happiest pup who only wants to hug you and never let go. 
Obviously, she has a lot to learn having never been taught the basics.  She will need a devoted family (single, couple, etc) to show her the ropes of house training, leash walking etc.  She will get started on that here, but here is not a home.  She would best placed with older kids who can handle her exuberance.  

Friendly to all to the point of not being able to contain herself, she is desperate for love and attention.  We only hope she doesn't end up growing up here.
name: Pebbles

description:
If you are interested in adopting (or fostering) an Italian Greyhound, please contact Italian Greyhound Place!

Please note: Photographs with this listing are representative of the breed and are not Italian Greyhounds currently available for adoption.
name: Italian Greyhound Place

description:
Our amazing Ace has captured the hearts and souls of everyone who knows him.  It has been rough going for him for the last year and he is so grateful to his foster dad for loving him.  After being in a large, crowded shelter for a very long time, he was transferred to another facility because his time was up and everyone wanted him to have another chance. 
    
Sadly without the staff and volunteers that he knew so well and feeling alone and isolated, he became depressed and shut down. He was not going to make it out :( Until we rescued him because we knew his beautiful spirit would shine once he knew he was not abandoned by his friends. And that is exactly what happened! 

He is getting a little older but still has that puppy enthusiasm for life. All he wants is someone to tell him he's a good boy and to come home to him at night,  and he will  let you know that he is overflowing with joy to see you home :)   He loves to explore the outdoors with his person and is up for any activity that is planned for him. He is good natured when meeting new friends, understanding of active little dogs that want to play with him and think they are as big as he is, and is learning beautiful manners so that he is a wonderful ambassador for his breed. He will make his family proud and will be your  most devoted companion.
name: Ace

description: Katore s a very loving dog, who was confiscated from a home who was using her as a breeder dog, she came from a very neglected home, and was emaciated and had severe skin problems when she first came in, she has since been nursed back to health, has gained perfect weright and beautiful healthy skin and in foster home, but they cant keep her much longer, so hoping to find her forever home soon so I dont have to put her in a boarding kennel, she is under 4 years of age, very sweet with people, she is fine with male dogs but does not care for female dogs, and all around nice red nose pitbull!!!   pitbull experience required, please email for more info
name: Katore

description: Meet Romeo! Romeo is around 3 years old and is around 55 pounds. Romeo was pulled from a high kill shelter in Tennessee with just hours to spare before being euthanized. Romeo is currently undergoing heart worm treatment and will be available around December. Romeo is a sweet boy and just wants to be loved. If you are interested in adopting or fostering Romeo, please go to our website at charliescrusaders.org and fill out our adoption or foster application!
name: Romeo

description:
12/22/18

Buffy is owner surrender, she is a 15  month old spayed golden mx. She has had shots and worming and she is heart worm negative. She is friendly and gets along good with all. Owner surrender because people don't have fenced yard. 



Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Buffy Talbot-active Young lab

description:
Ruthie is a joyful and loving 6 year old black lab with a sleek, shiny coat and deep amber eyes. This beautiful 75 lb love bug ADORES people of all ages and thrives on attention; she nuzzles right up and loves being petted.   

Ruthieâs such a happy girl that her list of favorite things is already quite long! In no particular order: Snuggles, chew toys, fetch, tug-of-war, treats, butt scratches, bones, squeaky toys, walks, dinner, humans of any size and anything that involves being with them.

Ruthieâs house and leash manners are excellent and she ignores cats. Oh- and she is the best road trip buddy -she loves car rides! This loyal big-hearted girl is hoping to ride on home to a lucky forever family soon.


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (https://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (https://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Ruthie

description:
Meet Benson. Benson has recently come back to Husky House and is in need of a special family. He suffers from pulmonary bullae, which are sacs or blisters on the inside of his lungs.
It is a chronic medical condition that he will have throughout his whole life. Due to chronic lung issues, Benson will need restricted exercise and often have to go on antibiotics as he will be more susceptible to pneumonia.This condition is considered terminal but Benson has no idea and heâs happy and in zero pain. He loves to play with stuffy toys, walk in the woods, going to random new places and adventures! Interested in adopting Benson? Please visit www.huskyhouse.org today to fill out an application.
name: Benson

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
10 years old.

Thank you for your interest in adopting a rescued Basset Hound! We ask all potential adopters to complete our application and approval process first so we can discuss the dogs that fit your home. We usually have 25 - 35 dogs available and the ages range from less than year old to ten plus years old. Once we receive your application you'll be contacted by an adoption representative to complete the application process. We look forward to speaking with you about our wonderful hounds waiting for forever homes!!!
name: MOLLY

description: 20 Nov. 2018: Athena is an ACC survivor who was adopted into a loving family. Unfortunately, due to no fault of her own, she finds herself in need of a home again. Athena is between 3 and 4 years old and extremely loving. Despite all she has been through, all she wants to do is hang with people and give kisses. She currently weighs about 80 pounds but needs to lose weight. While at the ACC, she was noted as being social with other dogs and able to adapt her play style. We are re-assessing her needs but expect she could fit in nicely in a home with another active, friendly, and similarly sized dog. She would make a great weight loss buddy!! Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Athena (Acc)

description:
Galileo is a big fun boy who loves people and other dogs. He is not aggressive or mean in any way but he thinks he is still a puppy and his manners need some more training.
Galileo would love a family who does outdoor activities, he loves the woods and the water. He is really sweet and easy to train, smart and attentive, he just need your time and love.
Galileo is really handsome, a big stunning dog that bonds to people very well and all he really needs is love.
name: GALILEO

description:
All Saved Me dogs and cats receive a wellness exam at our veterinarian and age-appropriate core vaccines. They are spayed or neutered before they go to their adoptive families.  Dogs over 7 months are tested for heartworm and all cats are tested for FeLV and FIV.

All animals are microchipped and are eligible for a complimentary 30-day pet health insurance policy from Shelter Care if you provide an e-mail address when you complete the adoption. 

We will ask you for a veterinary reference or three personal references,  proof that you are allowed to have pets where you live (lease or lease addendum or proof of home ownership),  and valid identification.  

Adoption fees are as follows: 
Puppies under seven months - $450.00
Dogs - $350.00
Senior dogs (8 years and over) - $225.00
Cats and Kittens - $75.00. 

You do not need an appointment to visit with our adoptable pets, but please call ahead or visit our automatically-updated website to confirm that the pet you want to meet is still available. 
215-240-1240
savedme.org/adopt
name: Aubie

description: Bonded pair with Biggie, must be adopted together
name: Bear

description: Meet Lyle!This sweet, happy, handsome guy is move in ready. If you love wiggle hineys and kisses, Lyle is your boy! He is perfect in his crate, walks beautifully on leash, is housebroken, knows many basic commands such as sit, place, down, and heel. He's a dog that yearns to please his people. He has tested well with other dogs, but politely requests a home with no kitties. He also would enjoy a home with older children (10 and up is a good average) due to his youthful exuberance. Please consider Lyle if you're looking for the perfect mix of play and chill personalities.He loves going for walks, but also loves sleeping. Lyle is approximately 2 years old and is about 50 pounds. He was rescued from a local open intake shelter after being brought in as a stray. One man's trash is another man's treasure - and what a GEM of a boy Lyle is.To be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.
name: Lyle

description:
Pupdate for 10/20/18

This is Sennyâs foster dad here, and I want to tell you all about Senny and thereâs a lot to say, so hopefully you have a minute to read through!

Senny is a very special dog who is looking for a special family who are willing to give her the love, patience and training she needs to help her overcome her nervousness around people. She has the sweetest disposition but whatever happened in her past we can assume that she was not treated nicely and doesnât realize that humans can help keep her safe and give her all of the love and spoiling she deserves. She shows no aggression toward strangers, but she will tuck her tail and hang very close to her person when she is nervous, checking back in for reassurance when needed. 

Sheâs estimated to be a little more than 1 year old, but no crazy puppy antics from her. She is playful with other dogs but not rambunctious, and is housebroken in her current foster home and of course loves her crate, which is her safe space. If she is overwhelmed or needs a break she will go into her crate to gather her thoughts and then come back out to join the fun! She sleeps in her crate at night quietly and comfortably. 

She just changed foster homes a week ago because we wanted to see how she would manage a transition. Once she has a âpersonâ she is able to attach and use that person to check in and get reassurance, and offer hugs and come over to get some snuggles. She is settling in great and we are taking small adventures (to the pet store, on walks in busier areas, etc) so she has the chance to check out people at a comfortable distance and get closer if she wants to. 

She is making remarkable progress in a short time, especially with the help of two confident dogs who are in the home permanently, one of them who is a senior and the other is a 16 month old puppy. She gets along swimmingly with both. I know that with time and consistent training and opportunities to feel safe she will blossom and thrive. You could not ask for a sweeter dog than Senny. She is a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly. 

She is a typical hound (probably coonhound or foxhound is best guess) who loves being outside and following her nose on walks. She is improving her leash manners and walks better with a no-pull harness. She feels more confident when she has a dog buddy walking with her. Because right now she can still be overwhelmed in places with lots of people and noises, she would ideally love to have a fenced yard to explore in addition to leash walks, but she brightens up and gets so excited when she sees and hears you pull out her harness for walks! 

Senny does not have much of a prey drive, which maybe is why she was found as a stray if she didnât do a good job for a hunter. She is currently residing with a 14 year old cat who rules the roost, and if the cat doesnât want to be around and gives a hiss, Senny immediately leaves the situation. She has encountered deer, rabbits, groundhogs and of course birds and squirrels in walks through the neighborhood and is happy to observe them but pretty much just keeps on walking. Of course for any resident animals in the house, slow intro is recommended so she can learn the ropes of her forever digs. 

Senny is a gorgeous hound who is admired by many, but people see how nervous she is and can be looked over because of that. But I know an amazing family is out there who will help her become the best darn hound that she can be. 

Senny has her very own Instagram that chronicles her adventures in foster care and the great progress she is making. If youâd like to check it out, you can find her at www.instagram.com/senny_wise_and_hound_foolish

Her foster (thatâs me!) is happy to answer questions for approved adopters. The other basics for her: she was heartworm positive but completed her treatment with flying colors in August, she is up to date on vaccines, and she is spayed. 

Thanks for reading all the way through! I know there is a wonderful
family out there who sees the same sweetness, gentle spirit and bright future for this shy girl who is learning to trust. I might be biased as her foster, but I believe she is absolutely worth the time and effort it takes to help a dog reach their full potential! As long as she is in foster care we will continue to work with her on overcoming her fears and nervousness. 

8/4/18

Hereâs Senny!  Not sure what happened in Sennyâs past as sheâs not telling Dr. Phil much about it.   We are certain that it would land her on his talk show, if she could talk.  (She canât, sheâs a dog!)  She was designed to be a hunting dog, but she empathizes so much with the hunted that she just couldnât wrap her mind around going after someone smaller than her.  Senny is extremely shy and prefers her crate more than most.  She finds it her safe haven.  She is a beautiful one year old walker hound who weighs 46 lbs.  She has done well with house training, tolerates a leash, but hunkers down flat when her human makes eye contact.  She is gentle and gracious, but she is still trying to trust.  Senny will need a compassionate human who will be patient as she comes out of her shell.  She wants to be loved, she just doesnât realize how much she deserves it.  Senny is fully vetted and has been spayed.  She tested positive for heartworms but is wrapping up her treatment and will be ready to find her new home soon.  If your heart is big enough to love an animal who never knew what love was, Senny is the girl who needs it.  Visit www.wagsrescue.com and complete an application.  Her foster is happy to answer questions for an approved adopter.  


Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: SENNY SOCIETY

description: Meet Squirrel he is a 4 year old rat terrier mix he is house, leash and crate trained, he can be a little hesitant but he will warm up once you offer him a tasty treat he can be protective of territory but thats only because he can be a little scared at first. he would make the perfect addition to any family. Squirrel is fully vaccinated, microchipped and neutered.

description: Wiley is another of our special survivors looking for the perfect responsible forever home. He survived on his own for over a year after being dumped by his owners, and even made friends and was seen playing and hanging out with a pack of coyotes before finally being trapped by our incredible friends at Buddha Dog Rescue and Recovery. Wiley can be nervous and reserved with new people and easily startled, but is a big goofy playful mush with his friends and gets along with most large female dogs. Please email dogkennel@rbari.org to meet him Primary Color: White Age: 5yrs 1mths 1wks Animal has been Neutered
name: Wiley

description:
GENTLE BEN is a very sweet male possibly staffie bully hound mix. 

We think that Ben is around 3 to 4 years old and he weighs 60 lbs.

BEN is great with people, kids and other dogs.   Because of his size and his exuberant personality he should be a home with somewhat bigger dogs and older children.   BEN has not shown any aggression at all, he just is big and bouncy!   BEN thinks he is a lap dog and is very affectionate.

We have not yet had a chance to cat test BEN but he did live with 4 small chihuahaus so he might be find with the kitties.

BEN is playful and snuggly and will make some lucky family a great companion!  

Please contact Christine at crisley1@prodigy.net if interested.
name: GENTLE BEN

description: This beautiful girl is Cleopatra, she is 6 years old. Cleo can be a bit shy at first but sheâs super sweet when she gets to know you. Cleopatra would do best in a home with older, calmer children. She doesnât seem to mind cats, Cleo gets along better with male dogs as she can be a bit dominate with other female dogs. She can be very playful & she loves belly rubs! Come meet her! She would love a forever family!
name: Cleopatra

description:
Meet Chanel Lonestar! Chanel is a sweet girl that found herself in a not so sweet situation at an East Texas Shelter. Thanks to rescue & a foster that stepped up for her, Chanel is safe in a home and getting ready for transport to New Jersey! Here is what Chanel's foster family has to say about her:

Chanel is a people pleaser. She is a very good dog and will make someone a good companion. She likes to run and play and she is quite agile. She practically jumps in a sideways loop when she plays! Chanel has not tried to jump a fence, nor dig. She seems content and easy going. Her foster does have cows and noted that Chanel will bark at the cows, so if you have livestock, this is a behavior she would need to work on. She gets along with the foster's cats and her young dog, a 40 pound Staffordshire Terrier. The foster also has two young boys and Chanel is very good with them as well.

Apply to adopt CHANEL LONESTAR at WWW.EHRDOGS.ORG
name: Chanel Davis Lonestar

description:
Woo-hoo!  I am Oscar and I just got the all clear to look for a new home.  I am soooo excited.  The Adoption Team here at DRBC has promised me that it will be someone fun ,that understands that my indestructible ball is critical when I play and that will love me and feed me and wants to have fun with me always.  Wow!  Is that you?  Well, here I am....come get me and let's start the rest of our lives together!  Just fill in the application and then let's set that meet and greet date.  I can hard wait.  See you soon :)!
 
Oscar is an 15 month old neutered tan male doxie mix who is current on vaccinations, heartworm negative and on preventative and has been placed on the DRBC long life diet. If you are seriously interested in participating in DRBC's Adoption Program, visit our webpage: www.doxierescue.com to learn more. The DRBC Website will help you can learn more about our adoption process and complete the application.

NOTE: DRBC only adopts to the NJ, NY, DE, MD and Eastern PA areas to adults aged 21 yrs and older. This 'think global, act local' approach helps us provide the best in supportive medical care and behavioral guidance across the life of our placements.

description: Lucy is a 6 month old spayed female beagle. She was rescued along with her brother after being found and were taken in by a nice family. These two are so adorable and super submissive. They do love each other but could be separated as long as they are going to a home with at least one other dog. They love dogs of all sizes, people and will be sure to make wonderful family additions. They have already to learn how to walk on a leash and seem to be crate trained. If you are interested in adopting, please submit an adoption application on our website www.justice-rescue.com.
name: Lucy

description:
dob: October 19, 2018..rescued, along with Mom, from a high-kill Animal Control facility in GA. Mom was spayed and went into our local New Leash on Life program. While her babies came to Howlin4Spirit CARes to complete their quarantine, receive 3 puppy boosters and de-wormings, and then will be available to go to their fur-ever homes after they have recovered from their spay/neutered surgery on SAT/JAN 19th.

Mom is a BoxerX(@42lbs) while it appears that their Daddy was a PointerX(possibly w/GrtDane).

Both Chopper & Clyde appear to have inherited their daddy's breedX more than Mom's. They will most likely mature around 70>75lbs. While Clover & Chutney will most likely take on their mama's breed size of ~42lbs, when matured. Then, there's Chucky and Cyrus who will most likely be in-between and will mature to about 58>65lbs as adults.

SWEETHEARTS, loving & very people-oriented, every one! And, SMART! With the proper puppy obedience training, they will exceed your expectations and be THE BEST pup you'll ever have! Excellent companions for any size family with a safe environment in which they can play their hearts out and receive the proper exercise all pups need to be contented and exhausted, rather than bored and into everything.

These pups are in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until they have received their 3rd booster and recovered from their speuter surgery scheduled for TH/JAN 10th, with delivery the next Saturday/JAN 19th.

Transport from western NC is available via Happy Dogs, Lifesavers or Save-Them-All Rescued Pet transport svcs. They travel the eastern seaboard as far as NH including Long Island and also through the eastern part of PA and upstate>Buffalo, NY. Fees are $125 as far as NYC/Long Island and $140 to all points N & W of NYC/LongIsland, as far as Manchester, NH, and Albany/ Buffalo, NY...to be paid by the adopter upon reservation request to transport service.

Adoption fee: $350(includes, spay/neuter, 3 of 4 puppy boosters, Bordatella and 1st yr Rabies vax, parasite-free, all medical paperwork from day#1 with H4S including all vet's surgical notations, current health certificate, Kong chew toy, Beef knee cap bone, new nylon Martingale collar & matching 6' leash, a copy of 'Super Puppy' -The Best Dog You'll Ever Have', 'Rescued Dogs Rock' car magnet, 2 'pet alert' wallet cards and 3lb bag of their current dry food(Tractor Supply Store's '4health' salmon & potato).

To apply to adopt one of these little cutie-pies, please complete the application provided at: www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/ to: howlin4spirit@gmail.com, as soon as possible(to help your chances of being approved ahead of other interested applicants.
name: CHOPPER

description:
Meet STANLEY!  Stanley is a beautiful brindle-coated 4 year old who appears to be primarily Plott Hound. We do not know his exact genetic makeup but he if he is mixed our best guess would be with a little lab.  He weighs about 45 pounds, is up-to-date on his basic vaccinations, heart-worm negative, neutered and micro-chipped.

He knows his basic commands and is crate-trained and house-broken.  STANLEY loves having a job- like walking, jogging, hiking with his human, you know, to keep them in shape!  He'd also like to hang out and watch t.v. Whatever, he's up for it!  Stanley prefers to be an only dog.  He may be ok with cats but hasn't been officially cat-tested yet.  Stanley's ideal home would be with a single person or couple.  

If you think you're the right match for Stanley, contact Ann at acecrumb@verizon.netfor an application today!
name: STANLEY

description:
Vanna and her friend Cuddles
were rescued together. If we can find a home for them together we would love to, although they are independent and could do well on their own. Both are 2-3 years old and the girls love to play. Spayed, up to date on vaccines and waiting for the right one(s) to come along.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws

description: Georgie is here with Gracie his housemate. Someone tied them up in Yonkers and left them. They are two wonderful dogs. Georgie is about two years old and 52  lbs or so.  They both love to play together and run around. Hopefully, we can keep them together
name: George n Gracie

description:
Tank is a 4 yr old male chihuahua who was surrounded to us along with several other dogs.   He is very sweet and loves all people and especially kids.  He is crate trained and up to date with all his shots.  Please come and meet this great dog.


BRAT RESCUE INC., located in Far Rockaway, Queens is capable of ONLY adopting out to potential people that live in the Five (5) boroughs of NYC. 

BRAT RESCUE INC
Far Rockaway, NY
Www.bratrescue.org

BRAT RESCUE INC., is a 501c3 tax exempt organization that rescues dog's and feeds feral animals in Far Rockaway and neighboring towns in Queens and the five boroughs of NYC.
name: Tank

description:
When Ollie first arrived to us about 2 years ago he came along with his best buddy Gumdrop. They would play all day long! Gumdrop quickly got adopted to a wonderful family and because of some of his insecurities, Ollie stayed. Ollie is a ridiculous wiggly, snuggly, affectionate and active long legged tiny dog! He is  svelte and silky  soft, he feels like he has a little extra skin everywhere , like he never fully grew into it. His coat is incredibly luxurious! He also has the most adorable webbed feet that spread out every step he takes, we call him our little pterodactyl dog! 

It didn't take long for Ollie to get comfortable here. He immediately bonded with the staff and volunteers and has always loved his walks, activities.. even Nosework, agility and doggy treadmill! It also didn't take long for us to get to know Ollie and his quirks. He is a wonderful communicator.. his dog body language signals are super clear! Upon first meet, Ollie shows himself as a sensitive and shy dog. He doesn't trust all humans right away and I'm sure he has good reasons for that. It doesn't take long for Ollie to get to know a new person though and once he does, he'll show his adorably goofy side! 

Ollie also likes to make sure his bones stay his bones and his food stays his food! Maybe he had to compete for food in his first home before was dropped at a shelter..? Ollie will absolutely tell you not to grab his possessions.. mostly with a high value bone like a bully stick or a meal (usually in his food dispensing tricky treat ball!). Although he loves to share his toys for a good game of fetch and will drop them on command! 

Ollie is a hoot and hilarious when he plays! He will jump for a ball almost 4 feet in the air for his ball or freshly cut grass trimmings! Be sure to check out some of his videos! He bounces around with the ball in his mouth and then he'll drop it right in your hand!!! sometimes he teases a bit and pretends a few times ... hes such a smarty pants!. His temperament is effervescent. He is SUCH a LOVE. After a good game of fetch, Ollie loves to be picked up and held in our arms! He will lounge all day long like that! 

Ollie-Ollie will make you crack up with with all of his adorable antics and hilarious pranks, body contortions, expressions .. ideas & sleeping positions!

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Ollie

description: Muffin was picked up by animal control in Texas after she was seen wandering as a stray. Her owners were never located. Muffin is great with older kids and other dogs. She is house trained and crate trained, though she really doesn't need to be crated. Muffin is in great health, and she loves being a part of a family. Apply to adopt Muffin Davis Lonestar at www.EHRDOGS.org!
name: Muffin Davis Lonestar

description:

She is up to date on shots, and will be spayed when medically appropriate and prior to placement in her forever home. Suzy is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. Her foster mom says that
She always bounces around excitedly to get your attention. She is working on full house training but in the meantime is potty pad trained. She is energetic and LOVES to give kisses! She loves her bed but has mentioned she'd like at least one lap of her own in her new home! If you would like to adopt Suzy, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

 CHAMPAGNE

description:
Awicca is a stunning black beauty of only 1.5 year old .

Code red , we had to hurry . This poor baby was in a high kill shelter and there were only a few seconds left between life and death.

Fortunately we were in time and she came safe under our wings.

Awicca is now waiting for her forever home where she will be loved . A nice ear and belly rubs and she is a happy girl.

She is very sweet and gets along with other dogs but not with cats .

She is located in Middle Island NY

If you are an active family and would love this baby as your new family member then please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and ask one

description:
He's a brute in size and strength with a big heart who loves to smooch and plays awesome fetch. He doesn't act his age (9 years), needs leash manners and howls on command. Only pet.
OK with kids 13  years and older.
Special needs: Needs a fenced in yard
name: Brutus

description:
Meet the oh-so-well behaved and lovable Anya! This beauty is a 1.5-year-old Terrier mix who was rescued from Myrtle Beach, South Carolina. She weighs just 18 pounds full grown making her the perfect petite size. Anya is the most loving, sweet, and playful pup you will ever meet. She absolutely adores socializing with other animals and you can always find her with a tail wagging a mile a minute. She is very well behaved in her crate and sleeps through the night without a peep. She is working very hard on her house and leash training in her foster home and is doing really well. Anya is also a great listener which makes training a breeze. This wonderful munchkin cannot wait to find a forever family of her very own.

Anya is spayed, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped. 

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! 

In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.
name: Anya

description:
Our rescue has 6 Pekingese Mixes who are 8 weeks old. There utd with shots, dewormed and will be fixed when old enough. We will be working daily with them on housetraining, cratetraining and leashtraining. Each would enjoy a fenced in yard at their new home. They do well with other dogs, cats and gentle kids. They will make great family dogs and are typically easy to train. If interested in adopting a puppy please email us at all4thedogsrescue@verizon.net

Adoption Fee is $595. Including Neuter and a full puppy vaccine package.
name: Donald Duck

description:
Donnie is a super handsome boy who is 5  years old.  He is very affectionate with the people he knows and loves and always ready for a pet when his favorite volunteers or staff come up to his run. Donnie has already learned  to sit  on command and is ready to learn more!  He has the cutest face and markings and eyes that will melt your heart. Donnie is very playful and his dream would be to find a single person who would love to spend time together with him, take him for long walks and play fetch. Donnie is not a fan of a large family, he bonds with one person and wants all the time to himself! 

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***


Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Donnie

description: Phoebe, our sweet senior girl. So deserving of a place to lay her head and call home. Phoebe enjoys the humans she knows well, and will take just a few meetings with anyone new, then you are good to go! She is no trouble to have around at all, just wants a warm bed to sleep in, a human touch for love and comfort, and a place in her golden years to call her own. Please fill out our dog adoption application and come meet Phoebe. pawscrossedny.org
name: Phoebe

description: Available Smash Williams may be a Texas boy, but he's adjusted to the city life like a pro. Just look at that lack of NYC street cellar door fear. Smash is a 4-year-old lab basset star on the Badass roster and can play a variety of positions. Office dog? Done. Play time extraordinaire? He's got it. A+ cuddler? This is your dude. Really, his only issue is that he has permanent blurry tail. To foster or adopt, visit: bit.ly/BadassApp
name: Smash Williams

description: Meet Foxy. An owner surrender, Foxy is looking for her loving forever home. Foxy is very shy at first and needs patient, slow introductions to new friends, both people and other dogs. She will also need a family who will help her with her resource guarding issues. Prior husky experience a must for adoption. Please no homes with small/young children, cats or small animals. Interested in adopting Foxy? Please visit www.huskyhouse.org today to fill out an application.
name: Foxy

description:
Meet our special needs little Doxie mix Honeysuckle!  She was found abandoned and brought to a local shelter in rough shape- mostly hairless due to flea infestation and secondary skin infections, very scared, and suffering from neurological issues that made her even more confused.  Her coat is much better, she had a dental and a benign tumor removed, and her neuro issues are stable but likely a longterm condition she has had a while an adapted to.  She eats, wags her tail, just gets wobbly and unsteady especially when stressed or excited.  We arenât exactly sure if it is a congenital issue she was born with or a result of some type of virus or brain disease but sheâs happy and just needs someone to love her unconditionally.  Honeysuckle is probably at least 8 years old and 20-25lbs, about the size of a standard Doxie.  Email njwoof@cs.com to meet her

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Honeysuckle

description:
Twiggy is two years old and is housebroken and crate trained.
She is spayed, microchipped and up-to-date on all vaccinations. 
This includes a one year rabies, distemper combo and bordetella.
She is heartworm negative and receives monthly preventative.
She has been wormed and is parasite free inside and out.
Twiggy weighs 13.2#.
She is not a big barker.
Twiggy is very friendly and grateful for attention but also able to amuse herself.
Twiggy can find plenty to keep her occupied.
She is very trim and fit.
Her main diet is high quality dry dog food.
No wet food is served.
She appreciates any treats she is given and occasionally nibbles on American rawhide.
Twiggy has beautiful teeth.
Since she arrived at the shelter she has been a perfect guest and has displayed a very pleasant, joyful personality.
Twiggy is a very cool dog.
She is meticulously neat in both her crate and around the shelter.
She respects her stuffed toys and does not destroy them.
A visible, secure, fenced yard is required.
ADOPTION FEE: $300.00
INFO UPDATED: 12-28-18

ONLINE.

description:

Meet Toni! This stunning, 2.5 yr. old, spayed, vaccinated, Mountain Cur/ Staffordshire Terrier mix was saved just in time from a local, N. J. shelter by another local, N. J. rescue. She is now a Rescue Ridge dog! Toni is not just a pretty face! Her brindle fur glistens in the sun, her deep brown eyes tell a tale of sorrow in her previous life but her resilient and loving nature helped her to over
come her past. Now, she awaits your love and her forever home in a kennel in central New Jersey. Toni is a lover, a snuggler, a kisser. She is active one moment and settles down nicely for some quiet time. She loves to play fetch, knows some commands, takes toys, treats, and food gently, enjoys long walks, and would really like an active home that will enjoy playing with her in a fenced in yard and take her for walks or runs. Toni likes to pick her doggie friends so if you have one, letâs do a meet and greet. She seems to prefer the easy going but friendly male dogs so letâs see if you have a good match! Toni is best in a home with older children, we would not want her to knock the little ones down. Oh, donât forget to take Toni along on car rides. She would really like that too! We could go on and on about how wonderful and beautiful Toni is but why donât you see for yourself? Please fill out an adoption application at rescueridge.com. You can text us at 732 546 8805 to let us know that you would like to meet Toni. Here is Toni's latest video:

https://youtu.be/KibanWClaGcÃ¢ÂÂ
name: Toni

description:
Noelle shows us that the shelter isn't all that bad. She enjoys every minute and she can entertain herself so beautifully! She's weighs 23 lbs. and is approx. 2-3 yrs. old and just has the sweetest, purest personality. 

If you would like to meet Noelle please call 201-797-8861 or email startkayne@gmail.com
name: Noelle

description:
Carter is a 9 year old/10 pound Maltese who was surrendered by owners who no longer had time for him, though he'd been with them from puppyhood. 

Carter is very attentive and likes to be with his person as much as possible.  He also gets along well with other dogs - in fact, he is currently living with 4 other Maltese dogs in his foster home.  Carter blends smoothly right into his foster home's dog pack, and is even respectful to the blind, growly, curmudgeonly dog in that group who is not very respectful to him.

Carter LOVES his walks and LOVES running and playing in the yard.  He also LOVES to play with stuffed toys - they are his very favorite thing.  If you ask him where his toy is, he will race off and joyfully bring one back to you - it is so cute!

Carter also LOVES to cuddle, and hopes for a home where cuddling is on the daily activity agenda.

In his foster home, Carter has an adorable habit when his foster mom comes home - he greets her happily at the door, and then races to a footstool and jumps up on it, just sitting and posing.  We don't know why he does this, but it is a consistent habit and it is really endearing.

As cute and appealing as Carter can be, he also has some quirks, probably originating from former abuse.   Carter is head-shy so is not a huge fan of having his harness placed over his head, and he can be afraid of being pet by new people - though this is NOT always the case - at other times he is just fine with new people petting him.  Carter is also a challenge to groom, as he is very fearful of the brush though he is great about taking baths.  Slow, reward-based acclimation to grooming tools will need to be worked on.  Carter does have silky, thick hair, but he doesn't mat easily, so that helps avoid the frequency of needed brushing.

Carter is trained to do his business both outdoors and on a weewee pad, but like many dogs might need re-enforcement when he is uprooted into his forever home.

If you are a dog owner who likes to play and cuddle while helping their dog reach attainable milestones, maybe Carter is the dog for you!  Please submit an adoption application, found on Metropolitan Maltese Rescue's website, and make sure you let us know that you are interested in Carter!

Carter is best homed in a country or suburban setting (he loves to run in the yard!), sans children.  He may work well in a city setting as well, if he has good access to dog parks.
name: Carter

description:
JP is a 5 year old, 15 pound Poodle mixed with Doxie. This is our best guess because if you met JP when we rescued him, there was no way of knowing what breed he was. We usually spare adopters the gory details of the condition of the dogs we rescue, but not to know JP's story would do him a disservice.

JP was grotesquely matted, severely overweight and had a mouth full of rotten teeth. It has taken months of care to get JP to where he is at (both emotionally and physically) today.

A little bit about JP: he has eyes that melt your heart. He's the kindest dog that is so, so grateful. He knows he's been rescued and he is thankful for this second chance at life. JP craves love and attention and will do well with someone who works from home often and has time to shower him with affection. He loves to go everywhere and now walks perfectly on the leash. At first, he had no idea what a leash was. And given his past bout with obesity, he loves food.

JP is fine with other other dogs (big and small) as well as cats. JP likes to sleep part of  the night on the bed and will sometimes jump off to lay down on the floor beside the bed. 

Given that we think JP spent years in a cage while eating, sleeping and going to the bathroom, his one downfall is that he is not housebroken. From time to time he will go on wee wee pads. His foster mom has tried very hard to housebreak him but he has not gotten it down yet. So a home with a yard where JP can learn that the grass is his safe place, would be ideal for him. 

JP is up-to-date on shots, neutered and microchipped. To meet him please go to our website and fill out an application: www.beastlyrescue.org/application
name: JP

description:
IDA

Midnight will thrive in his forever home and be your faithful companion. He will be responsive to positive reinforcement training. Our experienced staff is available to talk with you, answer your questions and provide advice on how to transition him to your home. 
Midnight is neutered, dewormed, treated to prevent fleas & ticks and is up to date with vaccinations. His adoption fee is $300.00, plus $8.50 for the dog license if you are a resident of NYC, and he'll get one free exam at our vet's office, one free month of pet health insurance and a microchip. If you'd like to adopt him please call or visit...we are conveniently located in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn near the F train (Ft Hamilton Pkwy) and we are open daily from 11am to 7pm.

description:
*** check out the video of Lion! ***

Lion is a 5 months old male dog who's 32 pounds and recently neutered.  He was rescued from a rubbish dump during one of our volunteer's trips to visit family.  For a puppy, Lion is an incredibly nice, well mannered dog.  He's kind, playful, good with other dogs. and all people.  

Email Patricia at: patricia.strayfromtheheart@gmail.com

description: Ticket #24909.  Poor Apollo, he has had a very rough start at life, he cowers when you raise your hand and is very stressed being in the shelter. He is 3 years old, and is dog friendly. description:
Oreo is 17LBs and does not shed. He has a tiny under-bite which makes him super cute! He is adorable fluffy and also very handsome with a short cut (like he is now). He estimated to be between 2-3 years old. He was surrendered by his owners 10/26 and transferred to foster parents 10/31. He is currently being fostered by Betty: https://www.facebook.com/mushi.lam (please message her with any questions regarding Ores's temperament and personality). As to "not good with kids" - that's still to be determined.  

Word from foster mommy: Oreo was surrendered at the shelter due to aggression issues. Since fostering him, I think he is a very sweet and loves to kiss, play and nap. He enjoys walks and his biggest motivator are treats!  Oreo's energy level usually matches mine (active and nonactive), sometimes we just watch TV and other times we'd go for walks and chase birds & squirrels. 

Word from foster daddy: He was understandably nervous when we first met. It took a couple of days for him to warm up to me. But now, we watch TV, take naps and short walks together. Oreo enjoys meeting new people and is friendly with the neighborhood dogs.  

Oreo is neutered and 90% fully vaccinated. He has not completed his full set of booster shots yet. Next set of shot is due in November and the last one in December.
name: Oreo

description: 30 Oct 2018: Alpine is a sweet 7 year old guy, who we pulled from a local shelter. We were told that he has lived with a small dog and with kids. He is a sweet guy who just wants to be loved. He's even good with cats!! Please apply to foster or adopt.

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
This is the handsome face of a survivor named Bruno! Bruno is a 1.5 year old Pit mix who weighs 45 pounds. This poor boy had been surrendered to a high kill shelter by his owner after having been attacked by another dog.
Because of the severity of the Brunos injuries, he needed to be rescued by the end of the day, or he was to be euthanized. We were not about to let this be Brunoâs fate and we pulled him immediately to safety and got him to our vet partner.
Brunoâs condition was serious...there was a deep hole above his mouth and his poor face full of cuts and wounds. After receiving a bunch of TLC and expert care,
Bruno is healing extremely well and his adorable face is on the mend. He remains a sweet and loving boy despite what he has been through! He is calm and easy going, a well behaved and friendly boy! He would make the best companion...he is so appreciative to be safe and loved. Bruno is great with kids and other dogs and will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Bruno the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Bruno

description: This angel has come such a long way since her stay with us. She came in as a stray, therefore we don't know anything about her past. Sadly, Brooke came in scared of her own shadow. With lots of work and TLC, our staff and amazing volunteers helped Brooke shine. Now, she can't get enough of us. She has transformed into this magnificent ball of love and can't contain herself when she sees people she is familiar with. Although she is quite social butterfly, it may take her a bit of time to warm up to new people and places, so we are looking for an experienced, loving home that will give her time to acclimate and help her show her true colors. Brooke is an exceptional young lady, who is waiting for a household that can't wait to give her all the love in the world.
name: Brooke

description:
Coco arrived at the shelter May of 2017. She is a 9-year-old lab-mix. She sits quietly inside her kennel, waiting for her daily walks and kisses from volunteers and staff, but she deserves so much more. She deserves a family to dote on her and a place to truly call home. She has energy, loves walks (great on leash!), but is also very content sunbathing and receiving affection from her human friends. She can be selective with her doggie friends (tends to prefer larger dogs) and would prefer a home without cats. Maybe that is why she waits for her furever family? She keeps her kennel clean, is laid-back and is overall a wonderful dog. Coco deserves to truly enjoy her golden years in a home. Would you please open your heart and home to Coco?


All pets at this shelter are up-to-date on shots and will be altered and micro-chipped upon adoption.  Please visit our shelter to meet the many adorable orphans that are available for adoption.  When inquiring about a specific animal you saw on this website, please include the ID number associated with the animal. We are open 7 days a week from 12pm-5: 30pm Monday thru Friday and 12pm-5:00 Saturday & Sunday. For information and/or directions call 732-922-0100 or email TintonFallsahs@aol.com. There is an adoption fee required.  The Society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, and cash.

                               IMPORTANT
 As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency.  Homeowners must show proof of ownership; a valid lease that states "pets ok" is required for renters before an adoption can be approved. If you do not have a lease with your landlord you will need a notarized letter.
name: Coco

description:
NYC Area -- Rescued from South Korea, Jennin is a friendly, sweet Jindo/Shiba Inu mix pup. At 5 months old and weighing approximately 12 pounds, Jennin is currently being fostered in NYC and is looking for her forever home! Please consider adopting her!

You can meet Jennin this SATURDAY or SUNDAY at our SANTA PAWS EVENTS
(If she is not adopted at Saturdayâs event, she will be there Sunday)

Saturday, Dec 22nd, 2018

BUSHWICK BARK
181 Irving Ave
Brooklyn, NY

12PM-4PM
-----------

Sunday, Dec 23rd, 2018

WESPAW PETS
44-05 Queens Blvd
Sunnyside, NY

12PM-4PM

PLEASE NOTE: You need to attend the OUTDOOR ADOPTION EVENT in order to meet this dog and bring your printed application. Please come to the event should you have any questions or email us at info@koreank9rescue.org. Thank you!
Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Jennin

description: Meet Nema - Nema is a gorgeous, friendly 1 year old 50 lb. Rotty/shepherd mix.  Her mother was a purebred German Shepherd, the father was a purebred Rottweiler.  This funny, friendly girl gets along great with all people, dogs, and cats.  She can jump a four foot fence so she needs a taller fence than that to keep her from coming around to your front door or car to say hello or ask to go for a car ride.  She is adorable.  Her ears stick straight up all the time.  She is very cute.  She is up to date on all her shots.  She is not spayed yet because she is currently in a private foster who is very loving but doesn't have the cash flow yet to get her spayed.  To apply for Nema please visit www.peace4paws.org to fill out an adoption application. Thank you !!!
name: Nema

description: This 11 month old Pit mix is Crystal (34891).  Crystal was found as a stray and came to us with her skin in horrible condition.  She is receiving treatment from our medical department and gets regular medicated baths from our groomer.  Crystal is an affectionate, cuddle bug who won us over immediately with her friendly, gentle demeanor.  She sat on command for a treat, which she accepted gently from our fingers.  Crystal willingly shared both her toys and bone whenever asked.  She was relaxed with all handling as she ate from her food bowl and got along well with the dogs she met outside.  Stop by to meet this amazing girl.
name: CRYSTAL 34891

description:
Petey is a spry and soulful senior (8 years old) that we saved from our city's municipal shelter.  He was set to be put down because of overcrowding (and kennel cough that he got at the shelter) and we could not let that happen!  Just look at the love and warmth in his eyes!  He has many years of joy and fun to share with some very lucky people.  Petey loves toys and he loves to play.  He is good with other dogs and has a wonderful temperament. This boy is really one of a kind.
Phone: 917-864-2443
Email: fofdogrescue@yahoo.com
name: Petey

description:
This is the cutest pup! She will need a home at the first of the year, when she is 8 weeks old. All but the white faced one have short little stubby tails and they are all so sweet and friendly. Momma Jenny is a BC mix and just a wonderful young dog. This pup has shorter legs and a rounder face than mom and we think she will be in the 40 to 50 lb range, full grow (but are never sure). Just a wonderful pup in need of a wonderful home. (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there might be something wrong with your email!) 
Lovable Mutts Adoption Center is a private, in home, all breed rescue/adoption facility, specializing in all ages and sizes of dogs.  We exist only on the kindness of your donations and adoptions!  We pride ourselves on being an HOLISTIC center and feed only holistic grain free foods and give daily, various, vitamins and supplements to all of our dogs. 

Our dogs are well socialized, very friendly, well mannered, affectionate, and in wonderful health. While some might be timid or shy, we work with our adopters in any way we can, to help them to work with their new family member. We give training tips and behavioral tips and even board for a very reasonable fee. Our dogs are extremely well cared for - most even know how to use a dog door by the time they leave us, know basic commands, and are crate trained!  We stand by our pups/dogs, and give 10 days for a refund and almost always take our dogs back at any age of their lives (can sometimes depend on the dog)! 

Lovable Mutts Adoption Center has an application screening process.  All applicants are asked to provide vet references, personal references, and a home visit.  We pride ourselves in matching up the right dog with the right home.  Sometimes this happens quickly and sometimes it might take awhile.  We hope you understand and are willing to wait for the perfect pup for your situation. We reserve the right to turn applicants down and to change our mind about a suitable match, for we are only concerned about what is best for our dogs.  Also note that we arrange our visiting hours around your schedule, as this is a private, in home facility.  We respond to all inquiries promptly, so if you have any trouble sending us an email, or have not heard back from us within 24 hours, please, CONTACT US AGAIN and check your spam!  (We all know how emails can be at times!)

Our dogs are spayed or neutered (if old enough), up to date on vaccines, wormed, heartworm tested, and free of fleas and ticks.  We temperament test our  dogs and they are all suitable for many family situations. Our dogs are well mannered,  and are in our family/home situation at this time (not kept in kennels or crates), and are worked with daily.  All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats, and we can cat test. Adoption donations vary with age, breed, vetting, and training of the dog, and range from $250 to $500. This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care.  (We do not tend to place puppies or small dogs with kids under 6 and reserve the right to match who WE feel would be the best homes for our dogs.)  
Please, come adopt one of our Lovable Mutts - you will be so glad you did!

(IF YOU DO NOT GET A REPLY EMAIL WITHIN 24 HOURS, CHECK YOUR SPAM BOX - WE REPLY EVERY FEW HOURS TO EMAILS)
name: Jenny's Girl

description: !!! Located at ACCT Philly, 111 W Hunting Park Avenue, Philadelphia PA !!! This animal may be available through ACCT Phillys Adoption Program. As this pet goes through the shelter processes, medical and behavior information are updated here! They may become specially promoted for Events or our Adoptions Programs, or may require transfer through our Love Local Program as more information is known. We are the Animal Control facility for Philadelphia, and we are open for adoption, foster and rescue placement Monday through Friday from 1pm to 7pm, Weekends and Holidays from 10 am to 5pm. To view our list of adoptable animals, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/. To learn more about our Love Local Program, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/programs/lovelocal/. Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Kobe

description:
Lucy is a beautiful little Boxer girl who loves going for walks and playing outdoors. Sheâs had a fair amount of training and knows her basic commands, but as with any dog, she could use an owner who will keep up her training.

Lucy is cautious upon meeting new people but loving towards those that she trusts. She has a strong personality that requires an experienced dog owner, and she would do best as the only dog in the house.

If youâd be interested in meeting Lucy, please fill out an application and be sure to mention her name!
name: Lucy Ross

description:
If you are looking for a sweet companion who would be just as content to sit by your side on a lazy afternoon as to go for a jaunt around the lake, Dinky is your girl. Her name might seem âsmallâ but she is a medium size Lab/Shepherd mix looking for a forever home. Once you are Dinkyâs friend, she will shower you with kisses and then sit politely for treats. Dinky prefers her canine companions to be male. To learn more emails shelter@spca914.org.

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Dinky - Foster to Adopt

description:
8/6/17
Bailey Belle is one of the sweetest, prettiest, courageous, and most loyal dogs you'll ever meet. At 1.5yrs old, she's crate and house trained and knows basic commands. Bailey had a tough start in life and has come along way over the last year in foster, dealing with her anxiety of being left in a swamp. She just needs someone to give her a chance. Bailey's tough exterior hides a heart of gold. She's loving, protective, and playful. Bailey would do best in a home with a large fenced yard and no cats. She's part cattle dog so sometimes she tries to herd but is very obedient when corrected. Because of her herding tendencies, we don't recommend a home with small children. Bailey is good with all the foster dogs that have come through her house, but it takes time to see how awesome she is with other dogs-she needs slow introductions, so she needs a family that is willing to take the time to let her be comfortable. 
Bailey Belle is vetted and vaccinated, including spay. If you'd like to make Bailey Belle a member of your family, please visit our website for an application today www.wagsrescue.org

7/31/17
Note from foster:
Bailey belle is doing a lot better with a large yard to run and play in. My mother's house also has family coming and going and she's doing great. Still wouldn't recommend children under 12 but she's a total love bug. Oh! Definitely a fenced yard bc she loves to run.

Fetch is what she lives to do!!!
4.30.17
Update from foster Mom...

Bailey belle
Bailey belle is one of the sweetest, prettiest, courageous, and most loyal dogs you'll ever meet. She's crate and house trained and knows basic commands. Bailey had a tough start in life and has come along way dealing with her anxiety of being left in a swamp. She just needs someone to give her a chance. Bailey's tough exterior hides a heart of gold. She's loving, protective, and playful. Bailey would do best in a home with a large fenced yard and no cats. She's part cattle dog so sometimes she tries to herd but is very obedient when corrected.  Bailey is good with all the foster dogs in her house but it takes time to see how awesome she is with other dogs ---most people want it to happen overnight so we are recommending that she be adopted into a home with no other pets.  That way she can have lots of attention.



04/06/17

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: BAILEY BELLE SOCIETY "Super Sweet, petite, dog friendly"

breeds: Black Labrador Retriever, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
My name is ZOLA and I'm a 1.5 yr F Black Lab/Amstaff/Pit X. I'm 60 lbs of PURE BLACK BEAUTY. I was surrendered by my owner due to NO TIME and since I'm a youngster I have energy and do need daily structured exercise and interactivity. I know basic commands and am housebroken;  but I'm very strong and could use some leash and manners training. I'm a sweet lovebug and I'm ok with dogs in passing but since I've been in foster care with no other dogs, I have become a bit isolated and need further socialization with other dogs. I was ok with a cat until the cat went after me and now I'm a bit wary of cats but with a nice mellow cat I think I could learn to coexist with one. Since I'm strong and wiggly happy, it's best if I go with older kids ages 10yrs+. I need someone who is experienced with my breed and is active and wants a dog to be active with. I would love a big fenced in yard to play fetch in as well. I'm a DIAMOND in the RUFF and need that special someone/family to polish me up!! cuz I'm a GEM of A DOG and will be your loyal companion and BFF! Please come meet/adopt me today!!

For more info/app; please email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Zola *URGT* IMMED FOSTER HOME NEEDED

description:
Ava is looking for her fur-ever family.. This sweet baby was rescued fromÂ Â down south.. They stole her babies then dropped her at a high kill shelter.. She was so frightened and broken when she first came into foster but now with a little TLC and lots of kisses she has blossomed into a beautiful, loving little girl.. Ava loves everyone and everything.. She greets everyone with a tail wag and a sweet little kiss..This poor baby suffered some trauma in her life but that doesn't stop her from being an active, happy, loving little girl..Ava is a 2 yr old Australian Cattle dog mix with the most beautiful coloring...she is UTD on all her shots and spayed..If you are interested in meeting this sweet girl please email jeannine329@optonline.net

Ava's adoption fee is $375
name: Ava

description:
Petuniaâs Woof-Facts:

Urgently in need of foster home
Preferably adult-only home due to her high-energy level
Recommend dog-savvy person to continue her training
Female, mixed breed, two-three years old, 56 lbs
Gets excited when meeting new people, responding to the notion that taking introductions slowly and politely reaps great rewards (including treats!)
As her BFF, kisses and belly rubs are a must! And playtime with her toys!
Crate-trained; thrives on having a routine; already knows some commands, and her yearn-to-learn attitude will assist in learning more
Discovering how to strut her stuff on a leash with more finesse

Quick Introduction to Petunia

Iâm Petunia â an exuberant flower girl whoâs urgently searching for a foster home and also seeking a forever home. Deep inside, Iâm addicted to love, but I get uneasy when I first meet new people and dogs. Iâm just not the type of girl whoâll jump right into the arms of anyone. I need to take it slow, as I want to make sure these newbies are friendly before I pledge my love to them. I can get scared and bark at first, but weâve found that when yummy treats are part of the program, it makes the getting-to-know-you process smoother. So please be patient with me, and after a while, Iâll flop right on my back, begging ever so sweetly for my favorite thing of all â BELLY RUBS! A close-and-running second to belly rubs are KISSES. Note: Kisses wonât happen as quickly, but donât fret, once Iâve fallen for you, they are required (both giving and receiving) and will be part of the relationship. Abundance of energy, abundance of love, searching for my abundant life.

Petuniaâs Background

I had a family once, and they gave me up â brought me to an inner-city shelter when they found out they were having a baby. I was scared and nervous during this transition, yet remained a sweet girl. I started to bloom again when a volunteer from Rescue Haven Foundation saw my photo and story, and I was brought under the wings of their organization.

Living with Petunia

The recommendation is for me to be in a foster and/or forever home with a dog-savvy person or with someone who is excited to work with one of Rescue Havenâs awesome trainers â this way, my learning can be continued. We feel Iâd do well in home as the only dog. Iâll need regular exercise each day due to my high energy level so hopefully youâll be up for that.

Petuniaâs Forever Home

Have you heard the expression, âWork hard. Play hard.â? My twist on it is âWork hard. Play hard. Love hard.â And thatâs pretty self-explanatory. My foster family will need to continue my training so I can bloom into the bestest Petunia in the garden â thatâs our âworkâ. Weâll need daily âplayâ for exercise and stimulation. And for the greatest gift of all, âloveâ â ours will include belly rubs and kisses, for sure â Iâll just need you to be patient with me as I warm up to new things. If you want some flower power in your life, please fill out a foster application with Rescue Haven, and make a shout out that you âPick Petunia!â
name: Petunia ~ Flower Power! URGENT FOSTER NEEDED!

description: Hello! My name is Akia and I'm a fun-loving, 2-year-old Whippet Mix. I have a need for speed and I'm super fast. I love meeting new people and will zoom into your heart with my sweet, happy-go-lucky personality. If you adopt me, I promise you lots of love, laughs and adventure in return.

Rico  is affectionate, a bit still like a puppy but very mellow for his young ageand he would do great with a family because he loves playing and being around people.
Rico has not aggression toward anything but he loves chasing squirrels and being on alert for little critters. He is crate trained although he doesnât love it, very food motivated and easy to train.

description: Help us welcome sweet and silly Lacey! At almost seven months old, Lacey is just under thirty pounds and is the perfect sized dog to run and play with. She is a loving and carefree girl, who has enjoyed making friends with everyone here at Bideawee! Lacey loves her toys and is especially fond of her mini hedgehog, and while every other toy got joyfully tossed around the playroom, Mr. Hedgehog was sweetly placed on a blanket and given a bath. Aside from her fondness of hedgehogs, Lacey sets herself apart by donning a pair of distinct sphinx-like ears, which will help her detect squirrels from three to four miles away. Lacey is loving, playful, and loves bellyrubs. Come meet this great gal at Bideawee today! Lacey will be available for adoption at a mobile adoption event on Saturday 12/1/2018 from 11am to 3pm. Bideawee's adoption van will be located at the PetSmart location near Madison Square Park. Stop by and meet her at 1107 Broadway, New York NY 10010.
name: Lacey

description:
Queenie is a work in progress...She's only about 18 months old and seems to have had little socialization with other dogs  before she wound up at the shelter a couple of months ago...Dedicated volunteers are working with her on her leash manners as well as her social skills...Queenie is very smart and wants to learn new things and please her person
Queenie would not do well in an urban area with lots of dogs... She needs the house in suburbia with a yard and the occasional neighborhood dog. She is very affectionate but she is also a powerhouse, I would say kids over 12 and an experienced owner



Please contact Leslie, our volunteer adoption 
coordinator, at 201- 981-3215 or email her at 
Lesliem147@gmail.com or come visit us at the shelter. 
 All pets are spayed/neutered before leaving shelter
name: Queenie

description:
Banks is a lovely 8 year old Shih Tzi  who will come up and solicit affection from most people.  If he knows you, he will climb in your lap, roll over on his back and invites belly rubs and turn into a cuddle bug. He's good with other dogs and loves going on walks where you will see his jaunty gait.

He can be a bit predictably defensive in certain situations:, He needs a slow approach and when in a confined space or when an unfamiliar person reaches for his collar or harness he might nip, But, on a day to day basis Banks is an easy dog.  All of our kennel staff can easily leash him up and have a nice walk with him.  He really is lovely dog who just needs an experienced home.
name: Banks

description:
Holden is a big mushy lug.. Hes 99.9% Lover and adores his friends with a passion.. hes got a bunch of doggie play pals and is a super great boy on the leash. Holden or Handsome Holdy as we call him is a perfect LOVE DOGS doggie.. He is awesome in so many ways and has a quirk that makes him a special dog for a special home. Hes just a tad more protective of his clan than we want! Holdy is in a training program and is doing really really well .. we are training him to pay more mind to what is asked of him and not decide for himself! 

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Holden

description:
This Southern Belle has traveled all the way from South Carolina to find her forever home here in New Jersey. When you meet Lady it is obvious that she did at one time have a home where someone taught her the commands that she knows and how to play her favorite game of âfetchâ.

Lady has been in foster since 1/7/18. She has been a perfect houseguest, is completely house and crate trained. She goes right into her crate every morning when I leave for work and is sleeping when I get home. Lady loves her person, loves cuddling and to be pet. She is a calm dog that loves her toys and a good nap on the couch. On walks she doesn't pay attention to other dogs and walks calmly next to them when on pack walks. We do not know much about Ladyâs past, but she does scare easily, so she would do best in a calm household with older, respectful children, and not much traffic in and out of the house. She takes a while to warm up to new people but once she does she loves you. Lady is a very special girl that deserves a loving home of her own. She is silly, full of personality and one the sweetest dogs I've ever had the pleasure of fostering. She is so easy to love and will make a wonderful addition to the right household.

If you want to meet Lady go to EHRDOGS.ORG and submit an application. Don't forget to ask for LADY BEAUFORT - she is waiting so patiently at the kennel for someone to fall in love with her and bring her home. Could that someone be you?
name: Lady Beaufort
