name: sani

description:
Meet Chester he just loves his toys, other dogs and cats. NOT for households with small children, He is a 10 year old Shih Tzu. He is learning to trust people again and loves his Foster family.  No off lease walking, needs a fenced in yard. This old boy needs a quiet home.
Chester has done very well on house training and now whines by the door when he wants to go out, 
We require vet references, home visit,  few meet and greets and our pre adoption form needs to be filled out and submitted, 

PLEASE READ OUR ADOPTION PROCESS BEFORE YOU APPLY FOR THIS DOG. It is located on our homepage at : http://www.waggintailsrescue.com/PreAdoption.html. This is so you know what to expect when applying for one of our pets. We do not adopt dogs to be outside pets - no exceptions..
name: Chester

description: Nala is 2 years old.  She is nervous when first meeting people but a nice walk together and she relaxes.  She is very sweet and tends to be shy but does bond.  She would be better in a household with older children and a household that is on the quiet side.  This girl will be a very loyal companion. She does get along with some dogs and if there is a dog in the household there would have to be a meet and greet.
name: Nala

description:
This handsome guy and his siblings were rescued as strays from a local schoolyard.  It wasn't easy to rescue them, it took a couple of days and a lot of hard, calculated work, but our volunteer partner persevered and finally brought them indoors to get them ready for their forever homes!

The babies are doing well.  They're typical puppies, enjoying playing and eating and sleeping.  They're a little shy, but really sweet, and ready for a loving family to call their own.

Felix is 16 weeks old and 19 pounds, we expect him to be a medium to medium/large size dog as an adult.  If you'd like to apply to adopt, kindly fill out our online adoption application on our website.

Email inquiries to: patricia.strayfromtheheart@gmail.com
name: Felix

description:
Pepper is an incredibly special dog. This sweet little Greyhound mix was found in Puerto Rico by our partner Soul of Satos, and they just fell in love with him! Despite his tough past, he loved all humans, all dogs, and just wanted to be loved! So he made the long journey to NYC to find the most incredible forever home! 

He just arrived here in New York and he is settling into his foster home extremely well! His foster mom says he is super sweet, loves to sit in your lap and is housetrained!  All he wants is to be held and cuddled. He is also fully vetted and neutered! 

If a dog is listed here on Petfinder, they are still available. Please don't email just to ask if they're available - they are! We get so many emails a day, we may not be able to respond and you could end up missing out on a dog. ALL POSTED DOGS ARE AVAILABLE!!! 

Also, none of our dogs have health or behavioral problems that we don't list on here. If its not in the profile, it doesn't exist!

You may read our adoption policies and procedures  on www.truenorthrescue.org. Please fill out a COMPLETE application if you would like to meet him - meet and greets are only scheduled with approved applicants and foster families. All our dogs are in private foster homes. Applications are processed in the order that they are received. You can email Jillian truenorthrescue@gmail.com for more information.

If interested in being Pepper's forever family, please complete an adoption application at www.truenorthrescue.com
name: Pepper

description: Whisper is a sweet young boy. He gets along well and loves to play with other dogs. Whisper also gets along with cats. He is curious about them and a bit playful but doesn't hurt them or chase them. He is easily redirected. Whisper will make a great family dog. He is crate trained, quiet, clean, well behaved on the leash and he is eager to learn.
name: Whisper

description: Forrest is a happy friendly 3 year old rescued from a life of breeding and neglect...he came with a large wound on his head that looked like someone hit him with a hard object and some skin infections. He is a very friendly social guy despite his rough past and is looking for a home where he will be a cherished family member. Forrest is going into foster care so please submit an application from our website www.rbari.org to meet him! Primary Color: Brown Secondary Color: White Weight: 54lbs Age: 3yrs 1mths 2wks Animal has been Neutered
name: Forrest Gump

description: Affectionate, loyal & very sweet! Loves to be around kids & adults. She likes to be the queen of her castle & yours only so no other pets recommended. She almost 3 & has medium energy & enjoys daily walks. She's a happy go lucky girl & would make a great family addition!
name: Kayla

description: 18 Dec 2018: Billy is a sweet 2 year old mixed breed dog, who looks to be part lab and part pibble. Our country boy seems a bit intimidated by the sounds of the big city and takes time to warm up to people. He is a beautiful chocolate coloring and at 40-45 pounds is very easy to handle. Billy has been fine with dogs his size, but does not do well with smaller pups. He is kid friendly and very easy going. He even got along with the cats at his previous foster home!! Billy is an extremely sweet boy, and we would love to place him in a foster or better yet, a furever home, where he can settle in and gain some confidence
name: Billy

description: Get ready for some warm snuggles because I am your boy. My name is Boomer (also known as the One-Eyed Wonder!) and I am six years young (age is but a number, friends!). I LOVE toys and will put on a show for you running around trying to catch them. My ideal home would be one where I have a nice comfy bed (I'll even snuggle with you on yours) where I have access to episodes of Clifford the Big Red Dog and a few peanut butter stuffed kongs. A boy can dream, right? I'm missing one eye, but don't worry, the story behind it is pretty wild! I was running around Philly with the wind blowing through my fur when a sorcerer suddenly appeared. He told me that he would give me all the toys in the world if I gave him the sight in my one eye. What pup would say no to that? Wellllll...he ended up being the Ursula type who doesn't always follow through with his promises and I ended up at this noisy place called ACCT Philly. Sadly, there aren't as many toys, so I need an escape quickly!!! Come on down to visit me and we can have a nice long chat around the toy bin and talk about me coming home with you. Cannot wait to meet and make my escape soon!!!! Lots of kisses and snuggles!!!!!
name: Boomer

description:
Cayden is a little guy with a lot to say. Despite his age, heâs full of spunk and can keep up on long walks with you around the neighborhood. He loves to play with toys, though he doesnât always like to share. Cayden is equally happy however just lounging around the house and getting belly rubs. He prefers to be the center of attention, and would do best as an only pet. 

To learn more about Cayden or to set up a meet and greet, contact Mike Spiotta at mikes@animalleague.org.
name: Cayden

description:
To apply:
1.  You must reside within our adoptable states: NY, NJ, CT, RI, MA, VT, NH, PA, DE, MD, VA 
2. AND you MUST submit our online application, please visit http://www.nyabandonedangels.com/adopt-or-foster-application

URGENT HELP NEEDED!!! ITâS RAINING COCKER SPANIELS!!! (Hallelujah!)

Calling all Cocker Spaniel lovers! We've just rescued TEN Cocker Spaniels!! Theyâre heading our way from the Mid-West. They will be arriving in New York in the next several days. Upon arrival, they'll head directly to our veterinarian. We are in URGENT need of temporary FOSTER HOMES and DONATIONS to help us with this LIFE SAVING RESCUE MISSION. These Cockers are all young, between 1-3 years old, 2 males and 8 females. They are all gentle, and sweet, but can be timid. We were told they are DOG FRIENDLY. A FENCED IN YARD is PREFERRED (but not mandatory).

If you are able to HELP please complete our ONLINE APPLICATION at www.nyabandonedangels.com/adopt-or-foster-application. Unfortunately, we can NOT respond to anyone without a completed application. You must have a Vet reference, and a Home Visit is required for all. They WILL be vaccinated and HW tested prior to fostering, with pending dates for their neuter/spay prior to adoption. We are able to place dogs in the following states: NY, NJ, CT, MA, RI, VT, NH, PA, DE, MD.

Stay tuned for more photos from our transport team as they head our way, as well as complete bios. Please consider being a part of our VALUABLE FOSTER FAMILY!!! We can not accomplish our lifesaving work without our village of friends and supporters. We thank you in advance for your help.
(Here are a few transport pics)
name: It's raining Cocker Spaniels!

description: My name is Otis I am a young chi mix about 18 pounds of total sweetness. I am great with other dogs and love to play with the other dogs I am living with. I am looking for my forever family if you would like to meet me please fill out your application at Ruffhouserescue.org by the way I am housebroken and I sleep thru the night
name: Otis

description: 9 Feb 2018: Sweet Lola is still looking for a home. She is a sweet, energetic girl that craves affection. Prior to coming to us, she spent the majority of her life in a crate. She has been to training and we want to ensure we find her the best home possible. Given her size and energy, we recommend a home without small children. No cats or small dogs. Slow introductions will be needed for other dogs. Please apply to foster or adopt at http://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/app-form/
name: Lola

description: Opal plays tough, but  she is a real softie. In her kennel she is all bark and bounce. Getting her outside, in the field and away from the hectic environment, you see her sweet personality immediately. Her smile emerged and she showed off some training. She is great on the leash and gentle with her mouth. She tried to delay her return to the kennel by rolling in the grass and laying in the shade.
name: Opal

description:
Animal Sanctuary Society, Inc.
PO Box 24
Mt. Laurel, NJ 08054856-642-0004http://www.animalsanctuarysociety.org/BEAUTIFUL PYRENEES size 100 lbs. handsome, fluffy thick ,stunning coat.
Bear is a big boy. He is housetrained, walks well on a leash, gets along with kids and other dogs. He is such a handsome boy . Bear loves attention. He is a lovable big teddy bear.Please fill out an application to meet him at www.animalsactuarysociety.org

name: Big Bear

description:
I have a Jack Russell/Chihuahua mix who's in need of a good home. Louie. Highly recommended to have a fenced yard. If not, he loves going on trails and being outside. Being a jack Russell, he has a lot of energy, all the time. He could play fetch all day. He loves staring out the windows and going on car rides! He's 10 lbs, brown and white short coat. He gets along well with dogs his size, larger than him are more of a challenge. 

He would be best suited in a home with a single owner. He gets very attached to that person, extremely protective. Can open up to other animals, but not instantly. He does know simple commands (sit, down, jump, come here, go lay down, lets go outside), but he is in need of training. He is not a people person. On walks, he has always shown aggression towards people and other animals. Louie is very loving, but he needs someone willing to REALLY work with him to get him to open up with more people.

I got him from a rescue about 3 years ago, where he was fostered at a home with farm animals. He originally came with the name Louie, so I decided not to change it since he was already 2 years old. With adoption, I will be providing his cage, blanket, and favorite toys and sweaters.

Louie is a courtesy post and is not with Mid-Atlantic Jack Rescue. Please contact his owner, Kim for more information or /and to adopt Kilynn.Fuhrman@gmail.com
name: Louie

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

description:
Lovable Lucas is one of our favorite foster dogs. He is Beagle through and through, right down to his beautiful singing voice. One year old, Lucas joined us a few months ago from NYCACC, after his owner surrendered him to an uncertain fate. Owner surrendered dogs often have a tough time losing their cushy homes and adapting to a harsh shelter environment that breeds stress and fear. 

Lucas did not fare well in the shelter. He became unglued and extremely fearful. His behavior deteriorated quickly, and we were asked to step in before he hit the euthanasia list. We were tickled pink to add another Beagle to our chorus. Lucas contributes the falsetto voice that we were missing.

Lucas appears to be a picture perfect Beagle in appearance and demeanor, and has all the classic traits of a tenacious Scent Hound. He has a sinewy, athletic physique, with trademark glorious, floppy ears! He has the classic Beagle low mainenance, tri-color coat, and is at an ideal lean body weight of 26 pounds. Lucas is true to his Beagle Scent Hound roots. He is easy to entertain with a simple leash walk. Lucas loves the outdoors and savors all of the scents that nature has to offer. He needs two to three brisk leash walks a day to engage his mind and meet his energy needs.

Lucas is this an extremely lovable guy, and generally good-natured, unless you're at the vet. He becomes quite testy at the vet, and we opted to muzzle him for precaution. We recommend that adopters choose a Vet experienced with rescue dogs, and that they be prepared to use the muzzle to get in and out without a lot of drama.

Lucas is generally friendly, but can be suspicious of some strangers at first. He quickly warms to gentle human touch. He likes to engage with his people on his own terms, but is more than willing to follow pack rules when it comes to house manners and obedience training. Lucas would be the ideal companion for an active single or couple, who enjoy outdoor activities. We'd like to steer clear of children in Lucas's home since they may not respect his boundaries, when it comes to his food and toys. 

Lucas will bond quickly and love his family, and will want to be the center of attention. If he is relegated to a fenced-in yard or a separate room in an apartment, he will get fussy and bark for attention. Lucas certainly could be alone for an 8 hour work day, as long as he has toys and chewies to amuse himself, but he is not a fan of isolation. When his folks are home he likes to be in the thick of things. He has a vibrant, intense personality, that will thrill Beagle people. He's very typical of the breed.

Lucas loves to play with other dogs, and has been one of the Superstars of our Big Dog play group. He holds his own with a pack of large Coonhounds and random Rottie-Shepherd mixes. Lucas would be a great fit for folks who have another young dog that likes to play. As an older puppy, Lucas did not have the benefit of much obedience work in his former home. He has begun to master the basics, but his adopter should be prepared to provide additional training, discipline and structure, and continue him on the path to Canine Good Citizenship.

Lucas is in excellent health and has been neutered. He has been vaccinated for Rabies, DHLPPC (distemper, hepatitis, leptospirosis, parvo, parainfluenza and coronavirus), He has been boostered as needed. He has had the 4dx test: negative for heartworm, lyme, earlichia and anaplasmosis. If you are interested in Lucas, please write to Denise@eskiesonline.com or call Denise at 860-908-9738 for more info.

About us: We are an active multi-breed dog rescue local to New England, situated in Canterbury, Connecticut. Our 21 year history is reflected in our website EskiesOnline.com, and on our Facebook page: Eskies Online.
name: Lucas

Well look at him today ...he is an absolutely fluffy and stunning beauty .

This boy would like to have a family where he will be loved . He is playful and young . He listens well and likes to please you .

He is located in Huntington NY

description: Hello my name is Fritz, I'm a 6 year old Hound mix. I was found as a stray out of North Carolina, but I am hoping I can find my forever home here in Delaware. I am, a sweet guy who enjoys taking walks and time in the yard. I will need some house and obedience training, since I was found as a stray I will need to learn how to adjust to home life. I'm fully vaccinated, and microchipped as well as neutered. If you think I would be the right companion for you, come on in and lets meet!
name: Fritz

description:
My name is Barrett & I'm 6 years old & a big boy who weighs 95 lbs right now. I am a special boy as I am deaf. My previous owners dropped me off at the shelter and never looked back. It is believed that I lived outside due to the number of fly bites on my ears.

I am quite the gentleman and have great manners. I walk calmly on a leash, I am house trained, and love a good car ride. I get along with dogs. But I do have a tendency to guard my toys & food sometimes. If I need to go out I will let you know by letting out a little whine.

Because I cannot hear, I would be best placed in a home without children as I should not be startled awake when sleeping. Also the doors leading outside should always be closed - if I were to get loose I could not hear you calling my name.

I would love a fenced in yard to play with new my family, humans and canines alike! I haven't stopped smiling since I was given a second chance. I am just loving life! Check out my videos below! EHR feels that I would do best with an experienced dog owner, so if you're looking for that "special dog", please check me out! I may have a few "quirks", but I will do my best to be a good boy for you!!

If you are interested in meeting me, please fill out an application and be sure to mention my name... Barrett!
name: Barrett

Jock gets along with creatures of all shapes and sizes, loves playing around outside, and would be the perfect addition to your family holiday card. To foster or adopt, visit bit.ly/BadassApp

description: PLAY WITH ME!! You can see it in my eyes, right? Hey there-this isÂ Max thanking you for checking me out. If you can't already tell from my photos and video that I am a fun loving guy, let me just assure you that I LOVE to play. Some things happened in my owner's life that made it hard to keep a dog around, so now I have a big yard to play with some of my dog buddies at the All About Labs ranch. IÂ was born in 2008 and even though I am super playful, I am crate trained too (but would need some outdoor time for playfulness);  get along with people large or small as long as they are loving and want to play, but I would probably do better in a home without really small children because they might not be able to keep up with my energy. If you are looking for a canine buddy and want somebody who loves to play, contact the AAL folks for some more information at  at  info@allaboutlabs.org

This sweet little girl is an absolute pleasure and her foster mom loves her very much. She looks very nice in sweaters, and loves to play and cuddle with the resident dog. description: Goodwin is a very sweet, five year old pit mix that looks like he has some shar pei in his background as well. He was a little shy and confused when he first entered the shelter but has since come around and is now a friendly and affectionate boy that loves attention. This sweet boy has had a rough beginning but he does not hold it against the world. He just needs some tender loving care and a patient owner who can gently teach him doggy manners. He loves other dogs, especially the girls but not a fan of cats. He is a smart boy who will need a patient owner who is willing to work with him on basic obedience. He truly is a great dog who will do fantastic with an owner who is willing to give him a chance.For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt

description:
BoJack is a glorious Great Dane of about 5 years old that would positively love a great home of his own.  This happy brindle boy came to us from our Newark facility as a stray that surprisingly enough, no one ever came looking for.  BoJack is a bit on the thin side, at just 85 lbs., but he's got a huge heart and personality.  He takes instantly to new friends and his ridiculously long tail doesn't stop wagging the entire time he is taking a walk with you.  He's strong, but well behaved on a leash.  He's a bit snatchy with treats, likely because he's been hungry for a while on the streets, but he is well mannered and is a real gentleman.  He's a big leaner when you give him some attention and he doesn't seem to mind other dogs either.  He will make a wonderful addition to a good family that welcomes him home.  File#28587  10/28/18

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.
name: BoJack

description: Vincent is  two years old. He is warm and affectionate with people he loves.  He tends to be protective of his family and has to be introduced to new people slowly and needs an owner familiar with the  breed.  He likes children but due to his size we recommend older children only.

description: Lovely, sweet, 7-year-old Claire is now entering her senior years. This elegant gal is yearning for her forever home where she can get the love and care she deserves during her senior years. Claire loves to go for walks and also really enjoys a fenced backyard where she can roll in the grass and snooze in the sun. Claire would prefer to be the only dog in the household so she can get lots of love and attention. She has, however, been in a foster home with other dogs and is good with submissive female dogs. Claire would not be good in a home with small children. Claire is housebroken, crate trained, up to date on vaccinations, and in good health. Claire is a Treeing Walker Coonhound; she weighs 58 pounds. To adopt Claire, please go to the Peace4Paws website and submit and adoption application for her: http://www.peace4paws.org
name: Claire Extraordinaire

description:
Meet  Cola.  This beautiful brindle boy is as sweet and bubbly as his name implies.  Cola loves to play fetch.  Itâs his favorite thing to do in the entire universe.  If he canât play fetch, heâll challenge himself to pick up as many tennis balls as he can.  Weâve seen him fit 3 in his mouth at once!  Cola is smart as a whip and has learned how to sit and wait patiently until his volunteer friend throws his ball.  Heâs also fast as the wind.  Heâs back and drops it at your feet before you know it.  After a good game, Cola loves to lie down next to his volunteer and chill. 
Shelter life is hard for an active boy like Cola.  He gets out for about 20 minutes most days , The rest of his time is spent in his run where he waits for his next brief chance of freedom.  Cola would thrive in an environment with an active family or person.  A fenced in yard would be perfect, so he can get his daily exercise.  Kids 12 and up as his size and athleticism would not be ideal around younger children.

Cola will be a fairly low maintenance dog for the person who adopts him. He never seems to bark, he only jumps if you come to his kennel with a leash in hand. He never even react s to his neighbors antics and he takes treats gently. 
At this time, weâve labeled Cola as an only pet, but that could change once heâs out of the stressful shelter environment.  Cola is about 4 years old and 82 pounds.please contact our adoption coordinator, at 201- 981-3215 or email her at 
Lesliem147@gmail.com or come visit us at the shelter. 
 All pets are spayed/neutered before leaving shelter
name: Cola

description:
I am a very friendly, spayed girl who is as loyal as they come. I am house trained and an exquisite listener!! I love going for walks, car rides, and will kiss and hug you back when you cuddle me. I am happy watching TV by your feet or taking long walks by your side.  I've had all my shots and behaved very well during my vet. appt., bath, and am already crate trained.  I came to a shelter as a stray in July, but sadly, my owners never picked me up. I am about 4 years young and know "sit, paw, lay down", etc. and enjoy being playful with you.  If you can love me, as I am sure I can love you since I love all people, please fill out an application or ask about me and my great house manners-I even take treats nicely!  Thank you so much, Jazzy!!!

PS I prefer a home without cats because they are too fun not to chase. If you are interested in adopting, or for Last Chance Dogs, in helping by fostering, or fostering to adopt, please complete an application and send in ASAP. Click to download application  If you are unable to foster or adopt, but would like to help save a Last Chance Dog, please consider making a donation to Oreo's Fund , which provides emergency boarding care to dogs in danger of euthanasia. Donations are tax deductible.                           PLEASE NOTE: RAP adopts kid-friendly dogs to families with children under the age of 5, but we do not adopt puppies to families with children under the age of 5.    Why? Click here

description:
Sponsor Me:
Fospice Care
Hey guys, my name is Pattycakes, but you can call me Patty !!!  I am girl on the smaller side but don't let my under 40 lb stature fool ya - I have the energy of a bigger pointer!
I wasn't properly taken care of in my previous life, in fact I lived my entire life chained outside where I had litter after litter. I didn't get regular vet visits or dental care so I am not as drop dead gorgeous as others but my beauty still shines !     I had pretty bad flea bite dermatitis and a sunburn, as well as heartworms.  I have been treated for heartworms and I'm almost ready for my next stage in life - a FUREVER family. I love snuggling on the couch helping my foster mom watch scary movies, with or without my Kitty friends and my a few of my calm foster Buddies. Because I wasn't treated very nicely in the past and had no way to defend myself against unwanted suiters, I prefer calmer dogs to hyper ones. I love leash walks, and I love Adventures and meeting people. I thought about applying for a position to be a Walmart greeter, but they are open 24 hours and I need my couch time. Do you have room in your heart for a gal who can't wait to be pampered?

We recently discovered that Patty has inoperable cancer and she will be living out her remaining days in one of our foster homes.
If you would like to contribute to help Pointer Rescue care for Patty and other "Fospice" dogs like her (Fospice = Foster + Hospice), tax deductible donations are gratefully accepted here:  Support Pointer Rescue
name: *Sponsor Me* Patty (FL)

description:
Meet the River Litter! This group of pups all named after Rivers are ready to find their forever homes here in New Jersey. They are 3-month-old Boston Terrier/Shepherd mixes. Some of this litter look more on the Boston Terrier side whereas others resemble Shepherds. These pups are as sweet as they come. They enjoy playing with each other, chewing on squeaky toys 3 times their size, and running around in their foster's backyard. They are working super hard on becoming house, leash, and crate trained. They are all getting better and better day by day. This wonderful group of puppies cannot wait to find individual forever families of their very own. 

The River Litter is spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped. 

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! 

In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.
name: Yukon

Brandy - Female - Pit mix - 8 months

 We rescued Brandy from a local shelter that was out of space. Brandy is only 8 months old and dog friendly. She's 40 lbs of puppy! We're looking for a foster or forever home where her new family will continue her training.

description:
Sweet Gussie needs a reason to smile. Something tells me she hasnât had a lot of reasons to smile in her life. She was found as a stray on a Texas highway and taken to the local shelter. She melted the hearts of the shelter staff who wanted this girl to have a chance at a better life.

The Black Mouth Cur breed is a âdime a dozenâ in East Texas. Most are used to hunt hogs. As you can see by Gussieâs front leg, she was not a hunter. This is such a wonderful breed! Please take the time to read about them. Gussie is a year old and is very shy initially but warms up easily. She is crate trained and housetrained. She really likes dog toys and has been very happy to lay on her TX foster momâs patio in the warm sun. She resides with older dogs in her TX Foster Home. We feel she would do fine in a home with or without dogs.

She has not been cat tested.

We believe Gussieâs front leg is a birth defect. The veterinarian felt it would be much harder on Gussie to have it removed and she manages very well with it. Gussie weighs 30 lbs and is current on all vaccinations, spayed, microchipped and heartworm negative. She is on a monthly preventative for heartworms/fleas/ticks.

Gussie needs a reason to smile, are you her reason?
name: Gussie Texas

description:
Stella and Zoey are 2 year old Rottweiler/Shepherd Mixes.  They are sisters that were found as strays and taken to a local shelter. They were separated and very scared and withdrawn.  When brought back together, they both lit up with happiness and became playful once again!  We would love to have these two sweet sisters stay together forever!  Both are spayed, up to date with vaccinations,approx. 50 lbs,  heartworm negative and house trained.  They have both been with children and other dogs and do well with them.  They are very sweet and mellow ladies that made their way back to each other, now they just need to find a home.
If you would like to meet STELLA AND ZOEY or for more information, please email  petrescueofmercer@gmail.com

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEB SITE to view our adoption policies and/or complete an online, non-binding adoption application. www.petrescueofmercer.org
name: STELLA AND ZOEY

description:
Say Hi to Miller!

This handsome pup was rescued from a high kill shelter in NC and he is now living in a foster home in NJ.  Miller is about 6 -7  months old, about 20-23 pounds and he is very sweet.  Miller has a gorgeous chocolate brown coat, with green eyes and the cuties fluffy ears.

Millerâs foster family saysâ¦..âMiller is super cute!  He is a happy fellow who loves to chase balls, run around the yard and play tug of war with our dog.  He is friendly with everyone one he meets.  Miller understands the commands âsit,â, âgoâ, âlay downâ, ânoâ and comes when you call his name. He walks nicely on the leash and he is house trained, he know to run to the door when he needs to go out. When he wakes up in the morning he charges down the stairs, all 4 legs flying and sometimes falls down 2-3 steps at a time, jumps right back up and runs in a circle, then lets me open the door so he can go out to pee.  Itâs so funny!! Miller also likes following us around and if you pet him, he will just melt.  We love Miller!"

If you are looking for a friendly, fun pup, Miller is for you!

Please note we do not adopt puppies/dogs to homes where they will be alone all day. 

The breed and age of this pet is listed as is our best guess. We have no background info on who the mom and dad are. 

If you have a furever home for this pet, please e-mail Furever Home Dog Rescue at FureverHomeDogRescue@gmail.com and request an adoption application. 

We do not have a shelter facility you can visit.  Our volunteers foster the dogs and pups in their homes once they have been vetted and transported here to NJ.

Please read our homepage www.fhdr.petfinder.com to read how the adoption process works. And, please visit Furever Home Dog Rescue's homepage www.FureverHomeDogRescue.com to see some of our many reviews.  Thank you!
name: Miller-Adopted

description:
Diesel is a beautiful full grown 5 year old male pitbull. He belongs to a client who can no longer take care of him. He is a bit of a baby, meaning easily scared, but that makes you love him more. His owner reports that he gets along with various people and other dogs. This boy enjoys his long walks in Prospect Park. Great companion for physically active owners. He is scared of the cats at our clinic so should be fine with them in a home setting. He does have allergies which will require medication and/or investigation.

There is no adoption fee for Diesel, but we are willing to offer low cost neutering if the adopter is interested but not required. Contact us to meet him!
name: Diesel

description: 11 Dec 2018: We pulled Mama Sandpiper from a southern shelter to give her a safe place in which ot bring her babies. Sandpiper is a sweetheart who gets along well with dogs, cats, and kids!!! She will make the perfect addition to any family once she is done with child-minding duties. Please apply now as this doll won't last long!!

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption at ACCT Philly!!!* *with behavior waiver DIESEL - A39921110 Diesel is the absolute king of tennis balls! The second he gets out to the play yard he grabs a tennis ball and wants to play. His current record is three tennis balls in his mouth at once, but he's always trying for more! As much as he loves running around and playing, you can stop him in his tracks with a good back scratch. Intake Type: Surrender; Moving Weight: 70lbs Medical Observation: (vet note 11/30) -visual exam, bleeding noted all over kennel floor, was lunging at vet nurse at front of kennel but readily calmed for treats offered, able to see RF paw 3rd digit has split nail Behavior Observation: Okay to be adopted with Behavior Waiver. Concerning behavior has only been related to in kennel/shelter setting. No notes once Diesel is outside, no concerning notes from previous owner. Diesel's Photo Album! https://flickr.com/photos/138664788@N08/sets/72157698087001240 Dog Meet: https://youtu.be/pyqydJJKrL8 This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Diesel

description:
Rosy is currently in foster. If you would like to meet Rosy please contact foster@nyanimalrescue.org

Rosy is our 2 year old Shepherd mix. Rosy is very skittish of new people and needs some time to warm up but once she does she is a total sweetheart. Rosy would do best in a home with another dog that would help her come out of her shell. Rosy loves spending hours at the dog park running around with all her doggie friends. 

Rosy is spayed, dewormed, treated to prevent fleas & ticks and is up to date with vaccinations. Her adoption fee is $300.00, plus $8.50 for the dog license if you are a resident of NYC, and she'll get one free exam at our vet's office, one free month of pet health insurance and a microchip. If you'd like to adopt her please email foster@nyanimalrescue.org
Rosy can't wait to meet you!

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description: Paddy is a lovable, affectionate 8 month old puppy.  He has been well socialized, He knows some commands and of course loves to give big puppy kisses.  Paddy is a courtesy post and his caregiver feels Paddy would prefer a fenced yard to run and play with another dog, or room to play with his owner, or kids. Paddy loves everyone, any age!  Paddy needs a forever home where they will continue to reinforce the positive training he has been receiving since rescued a few months ago.  He was placed by his rescuer in mid March but that persons family situation changed suddenly and dramatically so it was agreed they could not care for a puppy, even a good boy like Paddy Cakes so the rescuer has asked us for placement help and we are happy to do that.  Paddy seems to reflect all of the wonderful traits of the breed.  Adoption Fee:  $225.00  Please go to our website to find and application    pennylaneadopt.com  Paddy is neutered, Vaccinated, Heartworm, Lyme tested neg. He will be chipped shortly.  He is 57 lbs. at 8 months old.
name: Paddy

description: RJ JR is a sweet guy. He is 4 years old and enjoys the company of others, he assumes the play postition when approaching other dogs here in our shelter. Rj came to us from a rescue out of North Carolina and is currently looking for his forever home. RJ is fully vaccinated, microchipped and neutered. if he is the perfect fir for you come on in and meet with him!
name: Rj

description: SLADE - 2 years old, 41 lbs Manhattan *** Sweet Gentle affection seeking Slade arrived at the shelter with blunt force trauma wounds all over his poor little body. Slade is a little guy that seems to have hit a rough patch, but even though he's a little banged up he is as cute and sweet as can be! He is very friendly, frequently props his paws up for attention, and wags his tail when you talk to him. He is house-trained, likes treats, but most importantly likes to spend his time next to you. He's looking for a place to heal and a family to love... From his foster mom: "A bouncy compact bundle of joy whos tail has not stopped wagging since the minute he walked in our door. Despite the fact of the obvious cruelty, there is not a mean bone in this little guy's body. When you see the injuries on his sweet face and that vulnerable small stature it makes you wonder how someone could be so heartless. Just to watch him can warm the coldest of heartsâ¦ He is so spectacular that in only hours he has taken our lives by storm! Yet after A full day of bouncing, kissing, making the world a better place, he hits his bed hard and floats off to dreamland! This boy loves to sleep! And sleep he does! Once it's lights out, he means it. Considering he weighs only 41 pounds, I can assure you that 40 pounds of it is all heart! He deserves the best Home in the world! He's taken our breath away and deserves nothing less than perfection. Whoever would be lucky and blessed enough to have this kind hearted sweet face gentle lamb in their life has certainly won the lottery." Slade is neutered, microchipped and up to date on shots. If you would like to meet this love bug, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414
name: SLADE

description: Meyers is a quirky little guy who will make a great companion for someone with a quiet lifestyle. He is house broken, and lets you know when he needs or wants to go outside. He loves to ride in the car; just ask him if he wants to go for a ride and he is at the door in record time! Myers loves to cuddle up close with his people, but is a bit protective of them if an unfamiliar footstep approaches. He gets a long well with the resident dogs, (well, except for the 4 month old puppy who IS quite annoyng!) and ignores the two resident cats. Myers will need that special someone to learn about his quirkiness, as his talking can sound like growling; but his ears are perked up and tail wagging! He is crate trained and enters it himself when he is tired or has had enough of the puppy.
name: Myers

description:
Meet Blue Boy!

This big friendly goofy good-natured guy was rescued from a local overcrowded shelter thanks to a foster stepping up to save his life!  Itâs always hardest for us to find fosters for larger dogs so we (and especially Blue Boy!) are so appreciative.  

This young man has a great personality and just wants to kiss and play with everyone he meets!  He loves the ladies and so far gets along well with his 2 doggie foster sisters.  We think he is about 2-3 years old and still acts very much like a puppy.   

He has been neutered and updated on -shots, is being crate-trained in his foster home and is hoping to find a forever home soon... when you adopt from us you actually are helping 2 dogs- giving a dog a loving home while freeing up foster space for us to help another.  Please email njwoof@cs.com to be part of this life-saving process!

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East, Morris Plains, NJ.  Please email njwoof@cs.com for the fastest response to make sure the dog you are interested in will be there.
To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the Sponsor Me button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!
name: Blue Boy- BIG MUSH!

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
LOCATION:  POCONOS    (Cresco/Tobyhanna PA)

Whoa TANNER....a handsome sweetheart, owner surrender from NYC, residing in the Poconos and needs a home.  Energetic, playful, attentive.  Crate-trained, house-trained.  His former owner had him around all sorts of dogs; cats are a maybe.  He's been with 9 and 12 year olds.     Tanner has been professionally trained and is currently residing with his trainer in Monroe County. 

Interested in  TANNER in the Poconos?  Fill out the application at www.thepolishedpitbull.com  Click on Adopt a Dog.  Adoption fee is 150.00
name: TANNER

description:
What a cutie!  We're guessing Trixie is a Shih Tzu Mix.  Saying she's a small dog would be an understatement.  She weighs only 9.5 lbs.  She's sweet and loves being with people.  In the cage she barks begging us to take her. She loves attention and there's not a peep out of her when she's with a person.  We can understand.  The animal shelter can be a scarey place for a tiny little dog that is use to being with her person.  She's extremely affectionate, likes sitting on your lap and would be the perfect companion for someone home alone all day. 

Trixie has been to the vet.  Her Heartworm and Lyme disease tests were negative.  Fecal/Giardia tests were also negative.  She was given her Distemper and Rabies Vaccinations, bathed and groomed (to make her beautiful again).  Now she's ready for a new home.

>>>>>>Trixie is available for adoption at the townships Alex Caprio Animal Control Facility, 311 Watchung Avenue, West Orange.  Open for adoptions Monday through Friday (except holidays) 4:30-5:30PM.  No appointment necessary.

â¦â¦
name: TRIXIE [cc#6584]

description:
Very sweet, gentle, kissy, foodie, loyal, super submissive chi girl. Wouldnât mind traveling around with you in a handbag, but not a great leash walker as she is very timid in loud and unfamiliar environments. Likes dog park time if there are other chis, plays well with other small dogs and could care less about cats. Wouldnât mind being a house dog if you are a stay at home pet parent as she is needy and likes lazy lap and kissy time more than daily walks. Peeped pad trained, but fostered without rugs jic. Would prefer to follow the lead of a city savvy dog, and would languish alone at home so prefer homes with another gentle small dog or a work from home parent. She is a loyal companion for life and will stare lovingly into your eyes until your heart breaks into a million pieces, sooooo sweet. 

Eve's Sanctuary does not have a public location to visit, although we do weekly adoption events in public locations on the UWS. If you are interested in a specific animal, please email info@evessanctuary.com with the name of the animal you are interested in written on the subject line. Please remember that ESAR requires a full complete application, an interview, and a home visit prior to final approval and placement of adopted animals so for faster processing please include a complete application as well. It may seem daunting at first, but to find true love its worth it, right? They aren't products on a shelf to buy, we love them like our own, and only want the best possible home for each and every one...thus the "hoops." Also, please trust our recommendations, we are skilled human furry freind matchmakers with many years of experience that has given us a unique and solid perspective. For these reasons we prefer adopters to be in NYC or the immediate area accessible by public transportation so we can work with you individually and educate you face to face!
Additionally, please understand that we are all volunteers, no salaries are paid, we have families and pets of our own, and we have full time jobs in addition to doing rescue work - so we may be (at times) slow-ish to get back to you. We promise we are doing our best as its in everyones best interest to place these darlings quickly, so we can save more. If you would like to expedite the process, and make us extra happy, please download our application from our website at: http://www.evessanctuary.org/Adoption.html , fill it out, and return it with your initial email inquiry. Be patient, be persistent, be polite, and we promise all will be well! ;-)
All animals come up to date on annual combo vaccs, rabies vaccs, heartworm tested negative, microchipped, and of course...spayed or neutered!
name: Mooshu

description:
Hi my name is Rosie. I'm about 8 weeks old, 9 lbs, lab/hound mix. I love playing with my foster brothers and foster kids, snuggling up, giving kisses, enjoy baths. I like chewy toys, playing fetch, running outside. My foster mom says I'm smart I am doing great with potty training. I would love a forever family with kids and/or other dogs to play with. Please visit Puppiesandmorerescue.org for an application and email your completed application to getinout2@yahoo.com

Adoption donation of $365 includes age appropriate vaccinations and spay/neuter when pup is approximately 5-6 months of age.  
Puppies and More Rescue is a registered 501c3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible.

*** Breed determination in most cases is often based on the limited history typically available for most rescued animals.  We try to be as accurate as possible with the information we have and the Rescue assessment of the pup.
name: Rosie

Next adoption Sunday, November 25, 2018 at the Petco on Hooper Ave. in Toms River from 12-3.

description:
This sweet brindle boy with the crooked smile is Whopper. He's such a good boy - playful, calm, goofy, affectionate, walks well on leash, crate and house trained. Whopper was adopted almost immediately when he arrived in early 2017 but then he became ill. He was returned to EHR but he is much better now and is ready to start anew. Can you imagine being a puppy and never knowing the comfort of a home and a loving family? That's Whopper's story - how sad for him.

Whopper needs someone to change his life!! He is eager to please and will learn quickly. Please consider making Whopper a part of your family. If you can't adopt, please consider fostering Whopper so that he can enjoy the comforts of a home once again. Please fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org and mention his name, WHOPPER BAILEY!
name: Whopper Bailey

description: Color:fawn

description: We didn't think anything could be cuter than Orion's ears, that is, until we got to know his personality! Meet Orion, an approximately 1 and a half year old bundle of fun. He's sweet, he's charming, and he's as friendly as it gets. Orion loves running around outside and chasing a ball, or just hanging out inside cuddling. Playful and cuddly...he truly is the best of both worlds! Don't just take our word for it though, come and meet Orion today! But hurry, he's sure to steal someone's heart sooner rather than later!

description:
FOSTERED IN MISSISSIPPI; I was surrendered to a rural animal shelter as unwanted. I am very smart and playful. I love children, people, and other dogs. I want a home I will have a place to run and play. I am 10 wks old. I will grow to be 50-60 lbs.

I will travel to a stop near you after my adoption is completed. We do not have a facility in NJ to meet before adoption. We ask that you visit your local shelters/rescues first..

My adoption fee is $450.00 and includes the transport fees, up to date vaccines, spayed/neutered, de wormed, Micro Chip and on flea and heart worm prevention.

To apply to adopt go to http://app.form2pay.com/publish/publish_form/127823

Like us on Facebook.com/BTHAR2013

description: Meet Vega!  This beautiful little girl is a 6 month old Female Lab Basenji Mystery Mix.  She is a little shy at first but she warms up quickly and once she does she loves just about everyone and everything she meets.  She loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times.  She never turns down a good belly rub.  She loves to play and is full of puppy energy.  She would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle!  She is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month.  She can't wait to find her forever home!

Isabel found herself in an over crowded inner city shelter and her time was upÂ due to space. We couldn't let that happen! She is a sweet, wiggly, happy little low rider who craves affection and love. She is currently in a foster home with two fursiblings and a bird. She is calm in the house and enjoys her walks and playtime outside. She is about 40lbs, UTD shots and spayed and estimated to be around 2yrs old. She will make a great addition to any family!

?

?
name: Isabel

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
Hera is a truly as gentle a soul you will ever meet. All this 5-year-old pup wants to do is be at her human's side. She's been through a lot in her life but clearly loves the comfort of a loving humans. While at the city shelter, while other dogs were running around the pen, Hera was sitting on the laps of the volunteers watching the action. 

When she arrived at her foster home, after taking a minute to check out her new surroundings, she parked herself by her foster dad's side in a most adorable fashion. And she will never say no to a good snuggle session just chilling out on the couch next to you. And she just loves to lay her head in your lap.  Oh, and she is a serious kisser!

She's got the most adorable face and short little legs, she is just the cutest thing. If you are looking for a loyal companion will give far more love than she asks for, the Hera is your girl. How about opening your home to this deserving girl?
name: Hera The Gentle Soul

He is territorial and has some food aggression.  Tyler is very intelligent and really wants to please because he loves being with people so he should train fairly easily.  We want to adopt locally so we can continue to support the new owners as Tyler adjusts to a new home.
name: Tyler

description: Sky came to us from a shelter and we were told he was OS due to homelessness and then we were told he was a stray so we are unsure. He is a wooly husky and is super sweet and friendly to everyone he meets. He is house broken and loves his doggie bed. I have not crated him but he is trust worthy in the house alone. He has had some medical issues to over come since coming here. He has been neutered, had a complete dental and a liver biopsy. What the biopsy showed is that he has a bacterial infection that has settled in his liver treatable with a 6 week course of antibiotics. Hopefully when this is done he will be good as new! Please don't hesitate to meet this gorgeous boy, he will not disappoint you. He will not hesitate to provide endless cuddles and kisses! He is dog friendly and kid friendly!
name: Skylar Blue

description: Louise is a ball of energy! She loves to run around and play with toys, other dogs, and human companions. She is highly motivated by treats, making her a quick learner! Louise would love to find a foster family with a get-up-and-go attitude! She would prefer a house with another active dog to run and play with her. Faithful Friends would perform a meet and greet to ensure that the two dogs would be a good match. Please email us at laurie@faithfulfriends.us if you or someone you know can help.
name: Louise

description: !!! ONLY Available to Love Local Partners with ACCT Philly !!! Harriet - A#40161824 $250 PLEDGED FOR RESCUE CARE! This little lady loves getting pets from EVERYONE - especially back scratches! She walks well on a leash, is perfectly polite on car rides (or just falls asleep...), doesn't jump on on people, and already knows "sit"! Harriet is genuinely up for any low-key adventure, whether it's strolling along the sidewalk and sniffing the trees or just chilling on the couch. Invite Harriet into your family and she'll make sure you never forget to slow down a bit and enjoy life - and maybe make time for a few extra naps. Intake Type: Stray. Medical Observation: Slightly favoring right hind leg and paw appears to be placed more medially than normal allows extension of hips and knees but very stiff and growling but seems due to behavior and not painful fairly well muscled hind end. Redness on ears/dirty ears. Behavior Observation: Relaxed until leash muzzled for palpation of hind legs but growled when muzzled. Personality: Harriet was easy to get out in the yard, but a little restless once we got out there. She was very environmentally tuned and we gave her space to explore the environment. Eventually she allowed some butt scratches and then we learned -- she really loves butt scratches!!! She got very silly asking for them. She became a little over-aroused at one point and low growled, so we ceased the interaction, but after that she went back to being an easily handled, goofy eyed pup. Harriet and Anton: https://youtu.be/RLrlIs2El8I Harriet meets other dogs: https://youtu.be/-tqt3fpYuK4 This animal is not available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs, due to serious concerns with observed medical and/or behavioral issues. This animal is in need of transfer to a partnering animal welfare organization through ACCT Phillys Love Local Program. If you are interested in learning more about our Love Local Program, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/programs/lovelocal/. If you are interested in viewing our selection of adoptable animals, please visit http://acctphilly/org/adopt/ Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Harriet

description: Meet Alex Mcqueen she is an 11 month old APBT mix from Forsyth County she is the sweetest girl you will ever meet she will need some training since she is so young still. Alex enjoys treats and spending time in the yard. she is very loving desires a home where she can finally feel loved back. Alex is fully vaccinated, microchipped and spayed. if she is the right fir for you come in and meet her.
name: Alex Mcqueen

description:
DeeDee came in as a shy little stray pup. Though initially cautious of staff, DeeDee's warm and spunky nature came out after a few walks with some of our Pets Alive members. Just a few treats, just little bit of patience, and Deedee will give you her heart. She is still very timid and easily startled by loud noises, but will settle in nicely after some adjustment time. Interested in learning more about Deedee or possibly meeting her? E-mail adoptions@petsalive.org!

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***


Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: DeeDee

description:
Meet sweetheart Amber. Our shy and quiet nugget is 1 year old and a tiny 7.5 lbs. Due to her timid personality,  she can ONLY be adopted into a home that has other dog(s). Also, because of her tiny size, she would prefer a household with adults or adult children, younger kids are not a good fit. Amber needs time to warm up to her humans, but once you gain her trust, she'll be the sweetest cuddle lovebug. Our smart girl is potty pad trained, crate trained and does well on leash

Want to adopt Amber? Please fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html

**Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.**

**PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.

Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.

All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.

Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!
name: Amber

description: Well we didn't name this dog Starr for no reason! When she first got here Starr was pretty nervous, and she still is when she meets new people. She's just five months old so she's still learning a lot about the big city and strangers, but she's starting to really get excited about everything. Once Starr knows you're her friend, which doesn't take too long at all, she is a nuzzly kissy huggy lovebug. She loves to be pet and to spend time with people. She likes to play also, especially with another dog. Going outside is still a little scary for her, and she's much more comfortable walking with a doggy friend. Starr would love to go home and settle in with a loving human who will give her the stability she needs, and she'd really love to have a doggy sibling. Come meet her at Bideawee if you think you could be a match!
name: Starr

description:
Murray is a 2 year old mix, found on the streets of Texas and set to die.  We couldn't let that happen to this sweet, silly soul who stole us with his handsome stare, and then our hearts with his loyalty and devotion, despite a badly scarred face.

Murray was obviously homeless a long time, his face scarred from countless dog fights, bad weather, no food and no home.   Murray quickly bonded to the hand that fed him and a special relationship was born.  

Murray is looking for someone REALLY special to call his furever human, so it can't just be anyone off the street, you know.  It has to be someone kind and caring, patient, warm and understanding.  Someone who can look past his imperfect face, wiggly butt and powerful tail... and see the most beautiful, devoted soul - I have had the honor of being blessed with.

So, if you think you are good enough for Murray - set up a date !

description:
Let us introduce you to SHANE LONESTAR. Shane is a very smart, very alert, very fast and very energetic boy. We are looking for a family to match his energy & have loads of fun with him! Shane is a combination of two breeds: Border Collie and Mudi- both require an active lifestyle. Shane would be a joy to train for agility trials or basic skills and would thrive with the attention required in training. Shane knows basic commands and follows them: Sit, Stay, Come when called.

Shane is good with children, other dogs, and tends to ignore cats. Shane is an aggressive hunter of any fowl....chickens, ducks, geese, etc. and they cannot be a part of his new family.

Shane will need a short period of adjustment with a new family after which he will be a devoted, loyal, affectionate, loving and lifelong companion. Shane deserves a wonderful life with a loving family that will help him become the spectacular dog he is meant to be!

Apply to adopt SHANE LONESTAR at WWW.EHRDOGS.ORG today.

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue

description:
Cinnamon is a super sweet girl of about 8 years old that really had a rough life.  She deserved so much better than being neglected and having litters and litters of puppies throughout her life.  It's likely a good thing that her owners gave her up recently and now, she'll have the chance to have a great home where she is loved and cared for like the little princess that she is.  Despite the lousy condition she was in when she arrived, her tail wagged with every person she has met and it hasn't stopped wagging since.  She is such a happy girl that makes friends with people instantly!  She's even pretty okay with dogs her size though she's not a fan of cats.  Don't be deterred by her age.....she has so much spunk and can chase after balls with the best of them!  She's strong on a leash, but so well behaved, and housebroken too.  She would love to meet you and become a part of your family.  File#28629  12/6/18

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Who could be cuter than Chloe? She is a teeny tiny long haired Chihuahua mix born in Texas in February, 2018. She wasn't born into luxury, but rather anything but and when we took her into rescue her back legs were clearly failing her, her hind end was quite weak. Chloe was having a really difficult time walking and once we were able to transport her to our New York veterinary specialist, we learned that Chloe's spine was literally bent in half. How this happened? We don't know, but we believe physical trauma. Chloe had a CT Scan to see if there were any type of surgery could be performed to repair and straighten the spine but unfortunately there is nothing that can be done. Chloe does quite well and has learned to compensate and is quite mobile. She loves to run and play and just be a playful pup!! She may have special needs but to us, she perfect just the way she is. Chloe is searching for a home of her own with a yard to run and move around in and to get plenty of exercise to keep the mobility she has gained. She needs nothing more than a family to love her and another "little" pup or two to run around and play with. Chloe is SO sweet and loving...a little princess who is friendly with everyone she meets! She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to make Chloe (TX) the newest member of your family and love of your life, please fill out an adoption application for her here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Chloe (TX)

description:
Are you a fan of the 1950 movie by the same name? Then this loveable boy with the big brown eyes will soon become your constant companion. A chocolate Lab/Retriever mix, Harvey is seven-years-young.

description:
This sweet, southern âBelleâ will melt your heart! 

Belle is a playful, girl with plenty of puppy energy and spunk!  She also has a love of getting into mischief and will need an experienced owner ready and willing to provide her with the proper structure and training to become a well adjusted dog.  Belle will thrive in an active home that can help her burn off some of that mischievous energy both mentally and physically.  And structure, did we mention structure??  We cannot stress how important this will be for Belle.  While Belle is generally happy and playful, she can sometimes demonstrate a bit of a fearful side.  Helping Belle to build her confidence through proper channels (training) and providing her with plenty of opportunities for socialization will also be a key to Belle's success.

If interested in having Belle join you on your next adventure,  consider filling out an application! 

P.S.  After having watched Belle in action a bit, we believe her rambunctious behavior may be a bit too much for smaller children.  She is best placed in a home where all family members can provide her with some consistency and direction.  Children 12+ may be a possibility. 

Applications can be submitted by visiting www.realdogrescue.org or by accessing the following link:

https://fs29.formsite.com/RDR1/AdoptionApp/index.html

Real Dog Rescue welcomes the opportunity to help you find your new best friend.  Adopting a dog is a wonderful chance to save a life, and we understand that by beginning your search for your new canine companion, you are preparing to make a big commitment.  We are ready to help you get started in the right direction.  Our staff is knowledgeable in dog behavior and breed traits and can assist you in determining the right fit for your home and your needs. 

All of our dogs and puppies available for adoption have been examined by a veterinarian, vaccinated with age appropriate vaccinations, de-wormed and micro-chipped, and will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption.
name: Belle

description:
Diamond is a gem of a girl. She is a gorgeous female lab mix. Initially a bit shy and tentative when she first meets you, she soon warms up and turns into the most affectionate love bug around. She walks like a dream on a leash, and is very responsive to her handler. She knows âsitâ, âstayâ and âgive paw". Diamond is very treat-motivated, smart, attentive and eager to please so she is very easy to train. She craves human interaction and loves to give and get hugs and kisses. Belly rubs are a favorite, too. When she sees her people, she does not bark but whines and whimpers with joy to greet you.  Diamond will definitely add a sparkle to your life!

The application can also be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html
