description:
This beautiful Greyhound mix is Hoot. She is under two years old and looking for her family. She is dog friendly but will do best with medium and large dogs her size. Hoot is quiet, calm, well mannered and very intelligent. She can be reserved with strangers but is eager to please the one she loves. Hoot will require a large fenced yard to run and play. Keep in mind she will chase small animals so if you have beloved squirrels or outside cats, Hoot may not be a good fit for you. She is sensitive and can be slightly timid with some situations. Hoot will surely bring her new family daily laughter with her silly personality. If you are interested in this friendly Greyhound, please stop in soon and ask about Hoot at the Voorhees Animal Orphanage!

To fill out an adoption application, please go to our website, www.vaonj.org and click on  Adopt and then Adoption. Please complete the form and bring it with you when you visit our shelter, and don't forget to put the Orphanâs name on the form.  Thanks!  Our pets are spayed or neutered, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines prior to going to their new homes. For more information on our adoption procedures, please visit, www.vaonj.org.

NOT READY TO ADOPT, BUT WOULD LIKE TO HELP? Voorhees Animal Orphanage will continue to care for this pet until it is adopted. Help support this pet with a donation. Please go to www.vaonj.org, click on How to Help and then Donate.
ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

On behalf of the animals, we thank you!
name: Hoot

description:
âHi everyone!! My name is Princess. I was locked away not at a castle, but at a crowded inner-city shelter, and Iâm still decompressing from a stressful shelter life. I can't wait to show off just how much of a good girl I am!  I have been waiting so patiently to meet you. My foster mommy says Iâm house-trained and crate-trained and ready for my forever family. 

I love to cuddle and be near my person, although I can also sleep nicely in my own bed. Some of my favorite activites are: playing with my toys, hanging out on the couch staring lovingly at my family, riding in the car, and having nice long walks. I have been working very hard on my manners, and want so much to please foster mom that I am learning very fast!  My foster mommy says I am really smart and have mastered basic commands and would like to learn so much more :)  

Can you pretty please be my new family? All I want is to make you happy, give you hugs and hear you tell me that you love me and I'm your girl."
name: Princess

description: Blythe is a wonderful spirit.  A calm and loving personality she would be an ideal dog for any living situation.  She has such a great demeanor- is great with both dogs and cats.  She lived for many years outside on thr streets of Tijuana.  At some point she was hit by a car and her back leg had to have surgery.  She limps a little some times but it does not slow her down!
name: Blythe

description: Petey came to EHR along with his brother Wagner when they were puppies. Both were adopted but now Petey has been returned to EHR's care. Being back at the kennel has been very stressful for Petey, but he has some great volunteer friends who have nothing but good things to say about him. He has lost his confidence and can be nervous with new places & things, but gives you unconditional love once he trusts. He looks to his people for direction and confidence, so he would benefit from experienced owners who can help him with this. He has gone through obedience training and is a fun loving boy. He absolutely loves going for car rides, too! Petey gets along with other dogs, but we think he would do best in a home without children right now. Can you help Petey get his second chance at finding a true forever home? If so, please fill out an application at EHRDOGS.ORG and be sure to ask for him by name! You will not be sorry you did!
name: Petey Ward Steele

description: Dianna came into NYC kill shelters extremely emaciated and in terrible condition. Dianna is currently getting better in a foster home, and is looking for her forever home. Please contact us to meet this amazing, resilent, sweet, loving girl!
name: Dianna

description: Dante is a 10-week-old shepherd mix who is likely to be 50-60lbs fully grown. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Dante

description:
Max Massimo came to us from a high kill shelter simply as "Max," but as our love has grown for this 1 year-old Great Dane mix (and how could it not?), so has his name. This incredibly sweet boy loves to play with everyone--people, dogs--and his caretakers describe him as "not having one mean bone in his body." And let us add how adorable that body is! He is compliant, he is kind, and while he is currently being professionally trained, occasionally his exuberance still gets the best of him with a jump for joy. He'll do great in the city, he'll do great in the country, he'll do great with dogs of all sizes and humans with hearts almost as big as his, if only because it's hard to imagine anyone's whose heart is this giant!

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Max

description:
Get the latest Social Tees news by following us on Instagram (@socialteesnyc) or Facebook. Find more adoptable pets, FAQs, and info on ways to contribute to the rescue world at socialteesnyc.org.

Timberland and the rest of the litter are super cute and sweet 10 week old Lab mixes weighing 8-10lbs. They are very well socialized with other dogs, will grow to be about 50-55lbs fully grown and would do best in a medium actvie home. These guys are playful, happy and always ready to play for a crazy 20mins and then pass out for three hours AND repeat ;-) They have a great dispositons and will make a great additon and furever companion. They are super cute, learning how to use the bathroom outside and now are ready to find a home to call their own

This animal is not at the Social Tees office (325 East 5TH Street) â all of our dogs and cats are in foster homes while they wait to find their forever families. :) If youâd like to apply to adopt this pet, please complete an adoption application at socialteesnyc.org.

PLEASE NOTE: Because we are a small team and receive hundreds of applications each week, we are unable to respond to every application and every inquiry email, but we do our best. Please have patience! If your application is approved, you will for sure hear from us. If you have questions, please take a look at the Adoption and Fostering FAQs etc. on our website as all common questions are answered there. Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we work to save these innocent lives!!

Adoption fees apply and cover spay/neuter surgery; up to date on vaccines at time of adoption; microchip; treated with defleaing, deworming, and demiting medication as necessary; and often more.
name: TIMBERLAND

description:
He has lived with small children! He gets along happily with other dogs! We all know it's difficult to check off these boxes off when adopting a rescue dog, so may we introduce you to the check-all-the-boxes-off wonder that is JD, a gorgeous, 3 year old Lab/Pit mix who is just waiting for a dog, kid-filled home to call his own! Rescued from a high-kill shelter he is living with a foster who has such faith in him that he is already in training to surpass his basic commands, because this dog is going to go out there into the world and be a diplomat for all rescue dogs. Not to mention all sentient beings, given his ability to love 'em all. Please, won't you give him a chance to show off his tricks? The most important one being his generous loving with everyone and everything he meets. There could be no better way to start or end the day than snuggles from JD.

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: JD

description:
Meet Reese!

This 4 and 1/2 month old cutie born June 23rd was listed as an owner surrender on Craigslist. We were able to get her in time before she fell in the wrong hands!

Reese is now in foster care learning the ropes of socialization, training, and love. Her foster parents report how easy she is and what a total lovebug she is to them as well as their children and other dogs.

Reese is fully vetted - she is vaccinated, spayed, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly heartworm prevention.

 For an application on Reese, visit our website at bellareedpbr.com/adoption

For more photos of Reese, visit her photo album on our Facebook page: facebook.com/BRPBR
name: Reese

description:
***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***

Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Zoey

description:
Livingston! He may have  a fancy name, but he doesn't require anything elaborate. He just needs a home that will show him the unconditional love he deserves. Livingston was originally picked up as a stray, and can be a little nervous with newcomers, but once he loves you you've got a friend for life!

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***

Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Livingston

description:
Meet Bubba, a 1 year old, 42 pound, wonderful Pit Bull mix. This endearing pup is soft, sweet, loving, and dog friendly. 

He enjoys attention and likes being pet. He is also fond of ear scratches any belly rubs. He is friendly toward people and yearns for human companionship. 

Given his likable personality, gentle heart, and great looks, this deserving dog would make a really wonderful pet. It doesn't take much to please him. All he needs is a warm happy home and a devoted best friend with whom to share the joys of life!

If you would like to adopt this dog, please visit email PupStarzRescue@gmail.com or visit www.pupstarzrescue.org for an application!

www.pupstarzrescue.org 
Please Follow us on Instagram: @pupstarzrescue
Like us on FaceBook! www.facebook.com/PupStarzRescue

*PupStarz Rescue cannot guarantee the breed of the dog
name: Bubba

description:
Harrison-Do blondes really have more fun? If you're Harrison you sure do! 
We have never seen a more brindlelicious babe! He's handsome, playful, loyal, and strong. Just how we like our guys! Harrison was rescued along with two other dogs exactly a year ago from a dilapidated home filled with trash. They were abandoned for almost two weeks with no food or water, and Harrison was chained to a radiator, barely able to even lay down. His housemates have long been adopted, but this guy is still homeless, in boarding, and waiting. 
Harrison is about 3 years old, and he is a very active, energetic dog. He is strong and needs an active home where he can be kept mentally stimulated. He can live with other dogs if he is introduced properly, but it has to be the right dog. Harrison will be best in a home with older teens or adults only, definitely no cats for this blonde beauty. 

Let's share Harrison or as he's known around these parts, Handsome Harry. He needs a foster or adopter, one year is too long for any dog to be without a stable loving home. 

Nycsecondchancerescue.org
name: Harrison

description:
Joss is a very gentle 4 year old 13lb sweetheart.  At first she is very shy but warms up quickly.  She enjoys the company of other dogs and is particular to the laps of her foster parents. Joss absolutely loves to have her chin scratched and giving lots of kisses.  She is fine with cats and all children but definitely prefers a quieter home.  She seems housebroken, shares her toys, is great in a car and is learning to walk on a leash. Joss enjoys exploring the yard with her friends.  Joss is waiting for her very own family who will lavish her with love.

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.
name: Joss

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Little miss Lidia is a 3 year old Terrier mix who weighs 9 pounds and comes into rescue from Texas. Poor Lidia has not had a very good life so far and she was in terrible shape when we got to her. She was missing almost all her hair and her skin raw and infected from being left in this condition for so long. She will get all the medical care that she needs with our vet partner and soon she will be ready to start the new amazing life that we promised her. Lidia is absolutely precious and despite the neglect she has endured she remains a sweet and friendly girl. She is great around people of all ages and other dogs. Are you the lucky one that can give this cutie pie the happy ever after that she deserves?! She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to adopt this little angel, please fill out an adoption application for Lidia here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Lidia

description:
Melody arrived at the shelter September of 2017. She is a 4.5-year-old terrier-mix who is very AFFECTIONATE. Melody is a snuggle bug and loves attention from humans. She knows many commands and loves to show off her skills for treats! She is dog selective and probably would do best in a home without cats. Melody barks and jumps in her kennel for attention and we think maybe that is why people walk right past her. Either way, she is more than ready to show you how incredible she is! Come meet Melody today and see what the fuss is all about!



All pets at this shelter are up-to-date on shots and will be altered and micro-chipped upon adoption.  Please visit our shelter to meet the many adorable orphans that are available for adoption.  When inquiring about a specific animal you saw on this website, please include the ID number associated with the animal. We are open 7 days a week from 12pm-5: 30pm Monday thru Friday and 12pm-5:00 Saturday & Sunday. For information and/or directions call 732-922-0100 or email TintonFallsahs@aol.com. There is an adoption fee required.  The Society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, and cash.

                               IMPORTANT
 As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency.  Homeowners must show proof of ownership; a valid lease that states "pets ok" is required for renters before an adoption can be approved. If you do not have a lease with your landlord you will need a notarized letter.
name: Melody

description:
My name is Chloe aka Cloelicious or Mushy Girl.
I'm a 4-year-old female Lab/Pointer/Pit mix whose got a lot of love to give. I love to be loved. I can love on my people 24/7. I was dumped like garbage after giving birth. I was starving and emaciated with sores all over my body. I was terrified at the kill shelter curling myself up in a tiny ball so no one would notice me.
A lovely young college student came to visit the shelter one day and decided to foster me knowing I didn't stand much of a chance of getting out of this  High Risk Kill shelter. She was my last chance. Here's what she has to say about me:

Fast forward 2 months and Chloe is thriving in with her foster mom and is looking for her forever home. Chloe LOVES to cuddle and be around people. She is great with kids. She's friendly and loves to give kisses. Chloe is house trained and knows simple commands. Chloe is working with a trainer to help with her leash skills and  not being reactive to other dogs when she sees them. She is currently working with a trainer to help with some behavior modifications with other dogs. Something happened in Chloe' past that makes her extremely reactive to other dogs. At this time Chloe should be a single dog or go to someone who is  highly experienced and can separate while in training. Chloe is a lovable force of nature. Although she has great energy she also loves to hang out  and watch good movies. Chloe is excellent in the car and loves to Rock Shades while her person is driving. She plays fetch and loves toys. This sweet gal would make a great companion for someone whoâs looking for a dog that gives a lot of affection. Chloe is spayed, vaccinated, dewormed, and flea-treated. Chloe is now approximately 70 lbs of pure love. 
If you're interested in adopting Chloe please contact randanew@aol.com
name: Chloe

description:
MEET CECE!

This 15 year old beauty queen is named CeCe! She came to City of Elderly Love with a number of other dogs due to their owner's declining health. She's the oldest of the pack but in great health. She's happily settled into her foster home where she is living with other dogs and cats and she's now ready to land her forever home!

CeCe is a sweet, sometimes shy girl who really opens up once she knows she's in good company. She loves to sleep (who doesn't), eat (again, who doesn't), and chew on jerky treats! This gentle girl also loves to cuddle, be pet, and have her luscious mane groomed. CeCe is mostly housebroken and getting better each day with a regular routine. She comes from a home with many other dogs and a cat and is currently living with both large and small dogs and a couple cats. She's likely do well in a home with older, respectful kids. Really, she'd be a great addition to just about any family who will give her a little time to settle in before showing her fun, affectionate personality.

CeCe received a veterinary workup upon coming to the rescue. She has a slight heart murmur that requires no additional care at this time. She has otherwise proved to be a healthy girl!

CeCe is available for adoption through City of Elderly Love. She is spayed, vaccinated and microchipped. Interested in adopting her? Visit www.cityofelderlylove.org to complete an online adoption questionnaire or email us at info@cityofelderlylove.org!

**Please note: City of Elderly Love only has the ability to adopt out within the tri-state area.**
name: CECE!

description: Diesel is a "lowrider" pitbull mix that was pulled from ACCT Philly (open intake shelter) in September 2018. We will update you on him once he settles into his foster home.
name: Diesel

description: Blitz was found on someone's front lawn, in a very rural part of AL. He went right up to the children and was playing with them. The family fed him on their front porch, but wouldn't take him inside, as they had other dogs, and didn't want any more dogs. So, Blitz would run around all day, coming back onto their porch for breakfast and dinner. Not the safest situation, and when the neighbor threatened to shoot him, they knew he meant business, so they tied him on the porch. This was in Nov, and as the weather was starting to get cold, this was not the right situation for this dog. My friend texted me and asked if I could take him, so we got Blitz fully vetted, neutered, microchipped and up to NY. He came to us the week before Christmas, hence the name BLITZ, short for Blitzen. Blitz is about 4 yrs old, weighs 30 lbs, is housebroken, and sits on command. He loves adults, children, dogs and cats. He is a very sweet, funny, loving dog that is looking for his forever home. If you are interested in Blitz, please call Sindee, 914-299-3700.
name: Blitz

description: I'm just one of the many adoptable puppies waiting to meet you at our Port Washington, NY Adoption Center. Come visit me and all my friends!
name: Junior

description: Meet Danielle Brooks! This 4-year old Pit Bull mix is basically the dog equivalent of us this Thanksgiving because we have SO MUCH to be thankful for! This Badass ship couldnât run without the support of our amazing donors and partners, and fosters, both in the south and up here in the city. For your never-ending love, belief, and hard work, the whole Badass family and all the pups that youâve helped in the past, present, and future would like to thank you for your life-saving support. To foster or adopt, apply at badassbk.com.
name: Danielle Brooks

description:
12/20/18
Sassy is a 12 week old female puppy. She loves to be held and likes to cuddle. She will sit and loves people. She is good w other dogs.  She is working on potty training and she sleeps in the crate at night. Applications can be found at www.wagsrescue.com 


11/16/18
Sassy Taffy is an 8 week old pointer mix looking for her forever home.


Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Sassy Taffy Talbot-a Taffy Pup

description:
ADOPTION FEE:$100

Riley is a pug mix who has been with a rescue group for several years. He would like to go to a quiet home with no children where he can be loved.


THIS IS THE LINK TO THE APPLICATION WORD DOCUMENT OR PDF THAT CAN BE EMAILED TO RAWHIDERESCUE@HOTMAIL.COM:
 http://members.petfinder.com/~NJ235/Forms/RawhideDogApplication.doc
 http://rawhiderescue.com/RawhideDogApplication.pdf

OUR HOME PAGE:
 http://www.rawhiderescue.org
name: Riley Adoption Pending

description:
My name is Gemma and I was just rescued from a kill shelter in Texas. I'm a hound/lab mix, approximately 1-2 years old, and about 30 pounds. I like people and get along with other dogs. You can see my smile in all the pictures because I'm happy to know I'll be getting a new family.

I'm now in a foster home in Texas and as they learn more about me they'll help me update this page. I like people and I get along with other dogs. If you trust my face, go to www.northstarpets.org and submit an application. I'll give you a kiss when I meet you.
name: Gemma Texas

description:
Three year old Quincey is the favorite among all volunteers and staff at the shelter. He arrived in February 2016 as a stray. He was thin, scared, and he did not have good manners. Quincey has learned to politely greet people and walk nicely on his leash. He loves to run in the yard and to fetch a ball. He never returns to his kennel without a prized toy or ball in his mouth. 

Quincey is very affectionate and would be a loyal companion. He sits quietly and patiently in his kennel while he waits for just the right human to find him. 

When Quincey visits the homes of volunteers, he is thrilled with the car ride and a complete gentleman during his visit.
name: Quincy

description: Photos: https://flic.kr/s/aHsmxgPBkb
name: Lola

description: If youâre looking for the perfect companion and would like to open your heart to an older dog, Ginger would be the perfect match. Living in a home for the last 11 years, and then being surrendered to a municipal shelter has not been easy for her. At 12 years old, this golden girl is looking for a calm and quiet household, to start a new life and find a new family to love her, and give her the care that she deserves.
name: Ginger

description: Hello! My name is Security but don`t expect me to be your security as I love every stranger I meet!! I was recently brought to the shelter but I don`t let that bring me down! I am a low energy lovebug who loves to cuddle and play. I do well with children and other dogs and am currently looking for my new forever family! Color:white/gray
name: Security

description:
Meet Phantom, a Bulldog/Dalmatian mix, born 8/15/2016. He came to Eleventh Hour Rescue with his siblings and mom. He was adopted but unfortunately it was not working out and Phantom is back with Eleventh Hour Rescue.

Phantom is energetic and a little shy and would do best in a home with older children. He would love to find a home with an active family who will walk and play and spend time with him. Phantom is housetrained and crate trained, too.

If you want to meet with Phantom, be sure to go to our website, EHRDOGS.ORG, and submit an application. Be sure to mention his name, Aliyah's Phantom SCAS!!
name: Aliyah's Phantom SCAS

description:
Meet JoJo,

This 3-year-old boy loves and adores his family, but has to be the only dog. He just wants to run and play, he's a little clown-like when he plays, Jo Jo is very cute. He also does not trust strangers right off the bat, takes a little time, so we know this is a difficult adoption. He will be very faithful to his family. He would do best in a house with a fenced in yard. He also would love to be your running or hiking buddy.

Please contact nypeticare@aol.com
name: JoJo

description:
Flurry is a Westie mix who came to us from the Camden Shelter. She is approximately 5 years old, current on her vaccines and spayed. Flurry loves the attention of her people. She is crate trained and house trained.

The first step toward meeting Flurry is to go to petresqinc.org to fill out an adoption application.
name: Flurry

description: JRT enthusiasts meet our boy Lenny:) This spry guy is Lenny around 12 lbs - a JRT X. He is searching for a new home with just one rule. He needs a home with no small children as he is best with adults. He is a pint sized free spirit kid who is medium energy and already housebroken and enjoys his meals and fun time in the outdoors, He does very well with adults and listens well to their commands such as sit and stay because he is very smart of course, Lenny goes to doggy daycare but mostly he likes humans the most, go figure, RHR needs to send this pup home for the holidays and we are waiving his adoption fee to the right adopter who is looking for a new best friend. He is currently with his family who does have small children and if you would submit an application to foster or to adopt Lenny or share this post for him we can find him the perfect fit.
name: Lenny

description:
Meet our handsome boy Oliver Daniel, an 8-year-old male Pekingese! Oliver is
neutered, up-to-date on vaccines, heartworm-negative, and is current on
heartworm prevention as well as flea & tick prevention. It takes him a bit to warm up to new people, but when he does, he is very sweet! He really loves his belly-rubs and going for rides in the car! He is very playful, and loves throwing around his favorite Mickey Mouse toy. PLEASE CLICK ON THE FUZZY BLANK  "photo" to play a cute VIDEO of Oliver playing with his foster mom!

He gets along great with other dogs and cats. Oliver's ideal home would be a patient, mature single or couple with previous dog experience who can give him the time he needs to adjust and bond. Please no children. Oliver will make a great, loyal companion. His adoption fee is $500.
-----------------------------------------------
Hurry and submit our adoption application found at the the top of our home page (COPY/PASTE URL BELOW INTO YOUR BROWSER). 
http://www.pekerescue.petfinder.com
---------------------------------------------------
A completed application, checkable references including a veterinarian, a home visit, and adoption donation are required. 
--------------------------------------------------------
If you have not heard from us within 3 days please email us at:

codoan     at     aol  .   com

Many Pekes have been neglected and need expensive vet care when first rescued. Please help us by buying our beautiful 
Peke-decorated Calendars, Cards, Hoodies, Ornaments, and More  Securely Online Or by Phone at:

http://cafepress.com/prni
name: Oliver Daniel (ADOPTION PENDING)

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Harmony is 2 years old and about 55 pounds. She is a Hound blended female, and the cutest girl! Harmony is up to date on shots and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. If you are looking for a loyal companion that you can spoil and love forever, Harmony is also looking for you! Apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Harmony

description:
Like his namesake, the fifth Roman emperor, our Nero is both sensitive and handsome. An Australian/Shepherd mix, Nero sports a thick brown & black coat and penetrating eyes that seem to understand just what you are thinking.  Nero will make a loyal and affectionate companion. He just celebrated his fifth birthday.  

You love animals, but canât adopt?  Come on down to the shelter and choose the cat or dog that you would like to sponsor.  For as little as $20 per month, you can sponsor a pet and help pay for the cost of their care while they stay at the shelter.
name: Nero

description: Linus is a 6 month old neutered male beagle. He was rescued along with his sister after being found and were taken in by a nice family. These two are so adorable and super submissive. They do love each other but could be separated as long as they are going to a home with at least one other dog. They love dogs of all sizes, people and will be sure to make wonderful family additions. They have already to learn how to walk on a leash and seem to be crate trained. If you are interested in adopting, please submit an adoption application on our website www.justice-rescue.com.
name: Linus

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Ali is a small hippo...topping out at 165lbs. Don't let his size fool you, he's a happy gentle giant. Good with quiet, calm dogs, adults and older children. He's a senior guy (11+ years) just looking to retire. Ali loves to play in a tub of water and cruise around the yard. Ali has great leash manners and does well home alone and does not need to be crated.
name: Ali

description:
I was found as a stray in Georgia and thanks to PRO made a road trip to Ohio earlier this year to begin my heartworm treatment.  I also was just recently spayed and had a couple benign masses removed. As much as I love it here in my current home, my foster mom says there is a great family or individual out there who will love and keep me forever.
No one is absolutely certain of my age, so let's say I'm a very active younger girl of about 5 or 6 years.  I'm a gal that likes to be on the go. Not to say I won't relax in the house but I prefer to be running or exploring with you. Did I say I like to run? Not marathons, but I have a high prey drive so if I see birds, rabbits or squirrels I get a bit obsessed! 
I am not cat friendly for that reason.
My foster home has other Pointers and we get along great. When a new one arrives for foster, I try and ask them to play. 
I spent a lot of time on crate rest during my treatment and I'm over it! I am okay crated for meals, when my foster mom is away, or it's my bedtime.
Sometimes though if I am not taken outside for long periods when loose in the house, I still will have an occasional accident. I never probably lived in a home before so you just need to be mindful. 
Garnet is a smaller size female, loveable, super silly and seems to socialize easily with people and other dogs. She can be a picky eater preferring canned food over dry kibble.
When it's time to put her walking gear on, she does a hilarious back roll. 
Garnet is spayed, current on vaccinations, heartworm negative and is being given heartworm and flea prevention monthly.
Her foster mom can answer further questions to approved applicants.
Want to learn more about one of the dogs we have up for adoption? Fill out our adoption application!!
http://www.pointerrescue.org/adopt.html
TRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally within 1500 miles)
Can't adopt right now, but want to help?
Consider sponsoring a dog by making a donation to help with vetting costs. PRO is 501c3 non-profit and fully funded by donations, your tax deductible gift would be greatly appreciated! 
http://www.pointerrescue.org/donation.html
name: Garnet (OH)

description:
Meet Chocolate Frosted Donut, a 5 year old Pomeranian/Chihuahua mix that was saved from a local shelter. He ended up at the shelter as a stray and was never reclaimed. Now he is safe with Eleventh Hour Rescue and waiting for his forever home. He is a super sweet dude that is easy going and gets along with other dogs.

If you would like to meet with him, be sure to go to our website, EHRDOGS.ORG, and submit an application. Don't forget to mention his name, CHOCOLATE FROSTED DONUT!!
name: Chocolate Frosted Donut

description:
Hi my name is Abby. I'm a 5 year old blue/brindle pit bull mix. I was surrendered to the shelter by my former owner, along with my sister. My sister was quickly adopted, but I sat in the shelter for 3 months. I was getting so stressed with all the barking and commotion. I even tried chewing through my kennel door to get out. Finally one day, this guy  stopped by the shelter to see me. I also met his dog. I liked his dog because he was a friendly and nice boy. We played for a bit in the yard.

 Two days later, I met up with this guy again. This time he took me into his rescue. I liked it there because there were kids and other dogs.

 I would really like my own home now. I am not fond of cats or small animals but with proper introduction I do like to play with bigger dogs. I know basic commands, such as sit, and come. Im learning Paw and down.  I love people and love to snuggle. I especially like curling up on someones lap and going to sleep. If you would like to meet me, please fill out an adoption application on www.sammisvoicepbr.com and someone will reach out to you to set up a meet. My adoption fee has been sponsored to help me find a home, but a reference and home check is required.
I wont let you down!!!
name: Abby

description:
Lily is a sweet, energetic, loving, and affectionate 1 year old pit bull terrier mix who weighs 39lbs. She loves people, she loves to kiss you, and she loves to learn new tricks; like sit and paw. Lily can be super happy just cuddling up on the couch with you, or she can be active and run around outside, or inside with her favorite toys!  She is so quiet, housebroken, crate trained (loves her crate), and great on a leash. She is an all around extremely well behaved dog, with so much love to give! Give this sweet girl a chance and you will be forever happy to have her a part of your home and family!

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.
name: Lily

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Faith comes to rescue with her 4 siblings. These Georgia babies were all alone until Rescue Dogs Rock NYC stepped up to rescue them! Faith is 8 weeks old and 5.6 pounds on intake to our veterinary partner. She is up to date on shots (age appropriate) and will be spayed prior to placement in her forever home. Faith is also good with people of all ages, and with other dogs. This beautiful little girl deserves to live her life in a loving, happy home, and we promise to find that home for her! If you would like to adopt Faith, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Faith

description: : Iâm a sucker for a sad hound dog face, and Shyloâs is near-perfect: handsome and winsome in equal measure. This gorgeous guy could break your heart and make your day with just one look! Iâm the very first stranger that day to walk him at the Care Center, and while shy in his kennel, he gradually relaxes as we stroll along. By the time weâve reach the park, his tail is softly wagging, his fly-away ears are all perked up and heâs ready to leap onto the first bench he sees. A big fan of The Three Pâs (petting, praise and Pupperoni) Shylo is all about settling down and spending some quality quiet time together, and Iâm shocked to see one of the reasons given for his surrender as âtoo strong and hyperâ. Perhaps heâs hiding an energetic puppy somewhere behind his wise old soul exterior, but I suspect the truth is that Shylo just needed more time and attention than his former owner was able to provide. He lived and played gently with a 7 year old and is said to get along well with dogs he meets on the street (as well as in our playgroups), and heâs happy to share his toys, food and space with anyone who cares to join him. Already knowledgeable in sit, stay and come commands, he walks well, seems quite house trained, and weâre told he liked to sleep with his owner and little sibling at nightâcan I get an awwww? No surprise then that sweet Shylo received high praise on his behavior assessment and is recommended for almost any homeâthe more people to love him, the better. Bring Shylo home with you today and put a smile on everyones faceâ¦including his.
name: Shylo (Acc)

description:
Our best guess on this litter is JRT and lab mix, although some have short legs, so maybe corgi?  Whatever they are is absolutely adorable!

The pups are about 11 weeks old and weigh from 12-14lbs.  We expect them to be in the 40lb range as adults - and that's a guess too!

The pups are up to date on vaccines, and have been microchipped and treated with flea/tick/heartworm preventative.

Shyest of the bunch but sweet as pie!

Our puppy adoption fee is $350, which includes a $50 spay/neuter deposit to be refunded upon proof of procedure by 6 months of age.

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING, PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS:

Do not use the Petfinder links to ask us about our adoptable dog listings - we do not always receive these messages! 

Instead, please visit our website at www.roadtriprescues.com to inquire about an adoptable pet, and to complete our online adoption application! You can also find us on Facebook (Road Trip Rescues) and send us a message!

PLEASE NOTE THAT ONLY APPROVED ADOPTERS WILL BE PERMITTED TO MEET OUR RESCUES - WE ARE A FOSTER BASED RESCUE AND ALL OF OUR DOGS LIVE WITH US AS FAMILY. 

Thanks for considering a rescue pup!
name: Janey

description: I'm just one of the many adoptable puppies waiting to meet you at our Port Washington, NY Adoption Center. Come visit me and all my friends!
name: Piglet

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet our adorable addition to the Rescue Ridge Family.

Benson is between 5/6 yrs old. A little love muffin.

Ok with dogs but not really interested in playing, ok with kids but a little rough sometimes so older ones preferred.

Not a fan of the feline persuasion.

Neutered and up to date on shots.

Please give this guy a look at you won't be sorry.

Text 732-546-8805 to set up a meet and greet after you fill out application on rescueridge.com

description:
To adopt please fill out an adoption  http://www.happydogrescue.org/Application595.html

Bogie is a 2yo male boxer/shepherd mix who was surrendered by his family in Memphis who no longer had time for him. AWESOME young dog! Friendly, well-socialized, happy temperament. Good with other dogs but not cat tested. This gentle giant loves kids and is very gentle with the two young boys in his family.  Medium energy level outside, quiet and well-mannered in the house. Crate trained and housebroken. Obeys basic commands.  Loves to be with his people.  Good on a leash, rides great in the car.  Healthy and fully vetted, current on shots, neutered, weighs about 80 pounds.  AWESOME young dog will make a wonderful companion  for an active family with kids. Be sure to watch his video!

Very sweet and friendly five year old who was surrendered when her family could no longer care for her.  
Star is laid back and easy to handle. She likes other dogs and especially liked Buddy. She has beautiful hazel eyes and is an unusual gray brown reverse Brindle.  Come and meet this lovely lady.

description:
Our rescue has a litter of Lab/Blue Pit/Husky Mix Pups who are 6-8 weeks old. Our rescue has several mix breed pups available for adoption. There utd with shots, dewormed and will be fixed when old enough. We will be working daily with them on housetraining, cratetraining and leashtraining. Each would enjoy a fenced in yard at their new home. They do well with other dogs, cats and gentle kids. They will make great family dogs and are typically easy to train. If interested in adopting a puppy from this litter please email us at all4thedogsrescue@verizon.net

Adoption Fee is $549. Which includes spay/neuter and a puppy vaccine package!
name: Amari

description:
Luna - female, born 9/29/18, fostered in South Carolina
Luna is our littlest puppy. When she was a baby she was a bit shy, but she has really come out of her shell and she is now outgoing and playful. She is very smart and a fast learner, and is always right up there with the top of the class when it comes to learning new things.
We heard about a Pointer named Kelsea giving birth in a shelter so we acted quickly to get the little family into foster care. They are flourishing and will be ready to be adopted soon.
Luna is a sweet little girl who is mostly white and is starting to get orange markings.

She's also still working on her manners - will you be her teacher? description:
Stella is two years old.
When she arrived at the shelter she had six young puppies with her.
She is now spayed and microchipped.
Stella is still a puppy in a sixty pound dog's body.
She is a terrific dog.
She is very strong and needs
someone who appreciates her very pleasant demeanor
but is willing to put effort into her training.
Stella plays very well with all the other dogs and is careful not to trample the little ones.
Stella is smart, obedient and lots of fun to be with.
She is housebroken, crate trained, leash trained and thinks 
rides in the car are the best thing ever.
Like most Labs she loves to chew and American made rawhide will help satisfy this urge.
Stella is heartworm negative and is on monthly preventative.
She is up-to-date on all vaccinations: distemper combo, rabies and bordetella. 
Stella has been wormed.
Her main diet is high quality, dry, dog food.
She will never turn down a treat and gets plenty of them.
A secure, fenced yard is required.
INFO UPDATED: 12-28-18
ADOPTION FEE: $275.00
www.apawpets.org
PLEASE NOTE: TO CONTACT THE SHELTER CALL 609-799-1263.
THERE IS NO E-MAIL, MESSAGING OR APPLICATION ON LINE.
name: Stella

description: The daisy flower means âloyal loveâ and you will not find a more loyal love than that of Halfway Hound Daisy. At nearly 2 1/2 years old, Daisy is a sweet, shy soul who needs a little time before she opens up and trusts those around her. Once she is comfortable, Daisy becomes the most affectionate, happy-to-please dog around. She is a low- to medium-energy girl who walks very well on a leash. While is not a high-energy pup, Daisy is still happy to participate in all types of active fun such as hiking, walking, running and playing fetch. Daisy is dog friendly and enjoys the companionship of good friend. She is anxious around cats and we would recommend she not be in a home with any feline friends. She also becomes anxious and nervous around young children, so we recommend her for a home with older children. Daisy is very well behaved inside and outside the home. She is crate trained, house trained and up-to-date on all of her vaccinations. Daisy really just needs a loving home that can provide her with the routine and dependability she needs to thrive. She is more than ready for her forever family to find her.
name: Daisy

description:
This beautiful girl is Harley, a 5 year old Lab mix who was returned to EHR after being in a home for 2 years because she was protecting her family from people who entered their house. Harley walks well on leash, likes car rides and is very affectionate with people she trusts. She knows basic commands and would do best in a quiet home with few visitors. She gets along with calmer dogs and cats. Harley needs time to warm up to men. Harley just needs an adopter who understands her. She is up to date on vaccinations, spayed, and microchipped.

If you are interested in meeting Harley and giving her a second chance to find her forever home, please go to EHRDOGS.ORG and ask for Harley STEELE!!!
name: Harley Steele

description:
Meet Jack, yup, Just Jack.  He's an 8 1/2 year old Shepherd/Rottweiler mix who at one time had a home.  

He was very overweight when he came in and it was affecting his legs.  He's been on a diet and has been exercising daily and doing great.  Since the weight is coming off, he has become more active and happier.

He can be protective which comes with the Shepherd and Rottweiler breeds.  We would ideally like to see him in an all adult home with no children or other pets.  He is very affectionate once he gets to know you and will be happy just laying by your feet. 

All of our shelter dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, microchipped and up to date on their vaccinations prior to adoption. 

If you are interested in adopting this pet, please visit us at the EDISON ANIMAL SHELTER, 125 Municipal Blvd., Edison, NJ 08817.  Our phone number is 732-248-7278.
 
Public Hours: We are open 7 days a week from 12pm-4pm.

For our shelter updates, check out Friends of the Edison Animal Shelter facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/edisonanimalshelter
name: JACK

description:
Felix is a big, handsome boy who is under 2 years old. He is looking for a home where he can be your one and only love. Felix is not sure what to make of the shelter environment and is a bit insecure as he lived in the same home since puppy-hood. Felix was surrendered to us because he was not getting along with the family's other dog. He will do best in his new home with adults that have some large breed experience. He likes being outside and would love a big yard of his own. He will make a great walking companion for an active person or couple. Felix is going to be a loyal companion to someone willing to give him a loving home. Please ask about Felix at the Voorhees Animal Orphanage. 

To fill out an adoption application, please go to our website, www.vaonj.org and click on  Adopt and then Adoption. Please complete the form and bring it with you when you visit our shelter, and don't forget to put the Orphanâs name on the form.  Thanks!  Our pets are spayed or neutered, microchipped and up-to-date on vaccines prior to going to their new homes. For more information on our adoption procedures, please visit, www.vaonj.org.

NOT READY TO ADOPT, BUT WOULD LIKE TO HELP? Voorhees Animal Orphanage will continue to care for this pet until it is adopted. Help support this pet with a donation. Please go to www.vaonj.org, click on How to Help and then Donate.
ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

On behalf of the animals, we thank you!
name: Felix

description:
This pretty little girl is EmaLyn and she hails from Kentucky where she was found as a stray. She's about 8 months old & weighs 16 pounds but will be a medium sized dog when she's finished growing.

EmaLyn is sweet as can be and she gets along with other dogs as well as with people. If you'd like to meet her, please fill out an application and be sure to say you'd like to meet EMALYN KY!

Meet adorable "Rascal" he was left tied and abandoned.   He appears to be around 3 years old.  Loves to play and likes other dogs.

Call us and come and meet Rascal he is sure to steal your heart

(914) 376-7183  or  jjmjohnson27@aol.com

I love to play with toys and have a lot of energy. I do still have my puppy teeth and don't understand what is a toy and what is not so I need some work with my manners. I am ready to leave 2018 behind me and start the new year with my forever family! Ask to meet me today!
name: Gisele

description: Amelia is an adorable 40 lbs pit mix in search of her forever home! She was rescued from a high kill shelter when she was scheduled to be euthanized. She's a real sweetheart and deserves to find a forever family. We think she's about 3 years old. Sheâs not good with other dogs and cats. She is spayed, current on vaccines, and microchipped. Please email enb313@gmail.com for an application for this cutie!
name: Amelia

description:
Bull came in with his Mom, Daffy.  He is about a year old, house broken and crate trained.  Mom looks to be all Shar-pei but her son Bull is lab/Shar-pei.
He would probably do better with older children as he does like to nip at ankles for attention.   He is very playful and loves to give hugs.

Bull and his Mom are currently at our Ringwood location at 260 Margaret King Avenue where he is available 3-5 weekdays and 8-9 am and pm.  He is expected to be at Petco Kinnelon weekends from 1-4 but please confirm by email is you are coming just to see him as space is limited.

description: Sheldon is a lovable senior with a smile a mile wide. His seven years of life have yet to slow him down, and hes still got plenty of kisses left to give. Sheldon is friendly with other dogs and folks of all ages, and hes hoping for a family that likes going for walks as much as he does.
name: Sheldon

description: !!!Not Currently Available for Adoption!!! Ronny B - A#40368254 Intake Type: Stray Weight: 48 lbs. Medical Observation: Ears, Eyes, Nose, Throat: increased waxy discharge and canals/inner pinna surfaces hyperkeratotic and pigmented, moderately inflamed but not ulcerated, no ocular/nasal discharge, no cough during exam. Skin/PLN: hyperemia mild ulcerative dermatitis between toes and on tarsal surfaces, hyperkeratosis on ventrum as well. Assessment: likely food allergies (vs other allergies) affecting ears and general skin, also visually consistent with yeast overgrowth, at risk of skin declining in moist kennel environment. Behavior Observation: Slightly nervous in kennel but nurse able to leash and walk readily. In exam room more worried about surroundings than people, whining and seeking exit, but took meatballs and allowed handling for exam -- no muzzle needed, including assessing teeth. Personality: Ronny B was a bit of a nervous, zigzag-y boy, but overall remained easy to handle during our hang. He wasn't much interested in our treats or toys and chose instead to follow his nose around all the close and far corners of the yard. We'd love to see his stay at the shelter remain short and for him to get on out into an environment where he can truly relax! This animal has only recently entered the shelter and is not yet available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. Pending medical exam and behavioral assessment, this animal may be available through our Adoptions Program or may require transfer through our Love Local Program. To view our list of adoptable animals, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/. To learn more about our Love Local Program, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/programs/lovelocal/. Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Ronny B

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Alice, born in mid-2016, is a stunning Lab mix who loves all people she knows!!
Sweet as sugar.... she will make your heart melt like butter on a hot skillet! This young lady is shy at first but once she has warmed up to you, her little personality just blossoms! High energy at play yet calm and assertive when itâs time to relax and enjoy. She walks well on a leash and loves to ride in the car! She knows her basic commands and listens very well. She is eager to please. Very well mannered and enjoys running errands and loves to go shopping at Loweâs where she has become a favorite!! Everyone falls in love at first sight with Alice ... canât tell if itâs her beautiful big eyes, her gentle nature or simply her loving expressions. She does well with others in the playgroups and prefers dogs with a similar demeanor.
High energy dogs need to go slow but she will warm up in a week or two and be best friends with them.
She enjoys the company of others and is just a pleasure to be with!
Alice really loves to be near her humans and does have some separation anxiety so in her new dream home it would be best if she isnât left alone for long periods of time. She would thrive in a quieter home that doesnât have a lot of people coming and going. She is highly food motivated and loves to learn new tricks. She is dog, cat, rabbit friendly, and completely house trained!
If you would like to adopt this beautiful and loving girl, please fill out an application for Alice here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Alice

description:
Gracie Lee came to us from a shelter in Long Island, she was very scared in there and would not let anyone go near her except one volunteer named Linda. Linda contacted us by email and begged for Gracie's life. We took a trip to meet her and said this girl does not deserve to die, so yes we took her and Linda drove her out to us. When Gracie got here she was scared, we let her decompress for a day then started working with her, what a lovely girl indeed. Gracie takes some time to warm up but she eventually does and has a heart of gold. She is good with other dogs, we have not tested with cats yet but that can be done if required. We also would suggest older children since they would understand on how to go slow with Gracie Lee. She so deserves a family of her own and she is patiently waiting.
Gracie is being fostered in Orange County NY 
If interested please email us at rottnrescues@aol.com
name: Gracie Lee

description:
We saved Dahlia and two other dogs from living on Chains in Tennessee. Despite years of neglect, these girls are all super sweet and looking for love. Dahlia is guessed to be about 8-10 years old and sheâs about 25lbs. She is absolutely adorable and is quickly learning how nice it is to live life as a spoiled, indoor dog. She also has quickly learned that she loves belly rubs !!! 
 We are not sure what she is mixed with but we know she sure is cute !  
Are you the one to open your heart to foster or adopt this sweet girl ? 
Dahlia is fully vetted and her adoption fee is $250. 
Applications can be found at www.snarrnortheast.org
name: Dahlia

description: These 3 puppies are absolutely gorgeous Daddy was a Labrador Mommy was a Great Pyrnese..they get along with their foster Mommys dog, kids..super loving!
name: Labrador/pyrn mix 3 boys

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Rainey is a gorgeous Pyrenees senior girl that adores people and loves attention, affection, kind words and gentle pets from her humans. She is so very sweet despite having been so neglected. Rainey came in to rescue from a hoarding situation with multiple neglected dogs. She was part of a large cruelty seizure from neglectful owners and ended up at an already full rural Animal Control. At 8-9 years old, this gorgeous senior girl didn't stand a chance of making it out alive without rescue to help. She is a very sweet girl who adores her people and gets along great with male dogs so she would do great with a male companion. Rainey does terrific with cats as well. She does not need to run any marathons or need a ton of huge walks, but a nice back yard to play in and a comfy bed would keep her very happy! Rainy is a beautiful girl who came into rescue in very tough shape but she is doing great now. She got a wonderful grooming, got her nails done and she is looking gorgeous! Surely there is a caring adopter out there for a mature girl who would absolutely love a home of her own. Where she came from, they did not care for her well at all and she was clearly neglected and starved. Rainy would do well with a tall secure fenced yard, a soft bed to lay on and a male dog for company (she would also do fine on her own). We are hoping for a much better life for Rainey now that she is safe in rescue!
name: Rainey - Needs Foster!

description: 11 Dec 2018: Bethany came to us from a shelter in Georgia. She is both dog and cat friendly. Bethany looks to be a black mouth cur mix. She is as sweet as can be. Bethany is currently in a foster home and doing very well. Her foster mom tell us she is an absolute pleasure to be around!! Please apply to adopt this sweet, silly girl!!
name: Bethany

description: Belle's name appropriately reflects her quiet beauty. Belle is a 2 - 3 year old terrier mix. Belle is quite gentle with her people once she gets to know you. She is a bit scared and shy at first but, when she gets comfortable gives endless affection. Give this little beauty a chance. To get to know more about Belle, please visit Hi Tor Animal Care Center.
name: Belle

description: Miss Kitty is a very sweet, well-behaved, loving senior Italian Greyhound. She is around 9 years old. She came in with her buddy Matt.  Matt and Miss Kitty are very bonded, so they MUST BE PLACED TOGETHER AS A PAIR. Please give this pair a chance at a forever home. They are so full of love!
name: Miss Kitty

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Ginny is 8 years old and 12 pounds. She came into rescue with a tumor on her back/side, and she had surgery to remove it. The biopsy was sent out, and it was determined to be a cancerous tumor that was removed. However, our veterinary partner feels confident that the margins were clean and wide, and is hopeful she will not experience this again. There is no guarantee, but there is no guarantee to anything life metes out! We are ecstatic that she will live a normal happy life! Ginny is up to date on shots and will be altered prior to placement in her forever home. She is great with people of all ages, and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Ginny and give her the Happy Forever After that she deserves, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Ginny

description: Geno was rescued with his siblings from a sad situation. They were not taken care of, they had nolights and not enough food. We took them in and they are thriving. Geno loves other dogs, he is asnuggler. He prefers to be in your lap and is very content to sleep with his head tucked into yourside. He's simply delicious.
name: Geno

description:
This is a sweetie. Sheâs around 5 years old and 40 lbs. Black lab mix with pretty white markings and gorgeous eyes.  Good with other dogs.  

Sabrina will be at Petco Kinnelon weekends from 1-4 starting December 8, after which she will reside at our Ringwood location at 260 Margaret King Avenue where she will be available from 3-5 weekdays and 8-9 am and pm.
Please stop by to meet this pretty girl.
name: Sabrina

description:
Available for adoption on the 12/7
The adoption fee for unaltered animals is $350 + plus $75 spay/neuter deposit. 
The adoption fee for altered animals is $425. 

Please note that we do have transportation available for most of our adoptable pets between NJ and PA locations. In most cases if you are interested in a dog listed in another location we are able to transport the puppy to a closer foster home. 

Adoption Process: 
Send an email to info@therileyrescue.com requesting an adoption application. 
Complete the adoption application and submit it via email. 
Once approved an appointment will be set to meet the puppy/dog. 
If all goes well at the meeting your new pet will go home with you that same day. 

All dogs and puppies have been seen at least once by a licensed veterinarian, have had age appropriate vaccinations and have been deemed healthy for adoption.
name: Charm

description:
Hi everyone! My name is Claude!
I am an 8 month old baby Australian Shepherd / Labrador Retriever mix  who loves other dogs and people! I was surrendered along with my littermates and some other furry family members when my former people could no longer care for us.
My rescue friends say it would be best if I was adopted by a family who has another dog who would love me and play with me, and help build my confidence because I am a little bit shy!
I am already neutered, up to date on my vaccines and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm preventatives, microchipped, dewormed, and I even have 30 days of free pet insurance!
I am currently available and my rescue friends are reviewing / accepting applications for me... 
We are a rescue organization made up of a network of foster homes, so we donât have a public facility to visit, but you can get started with our process. 
If you are interested in adopting me, the first step is to complete our application by clicking on the link HERE: http://www.newlifeanimalrescue.org/adoptionfoster-app/ 
My rescue friends will review your application and check your references. If everything looks good, they will be in touch to schedule a home visit so you can meet me! 
My adoption fee is $275, which includes all up-to-date vaccinations and flea/tick and heart worm preventatives, neuter, deworming, microchip, full vet exam and treatment of any known medical issues, and 30 days of free pet insurance!
We do limit adoptions to within one hour of the Marlton, NJ area. 
Thank you for considering adoption of a rescued pet like me!
name: Claude

description:
RESCUED, from high-kill Laurens Co, SC Animal Control. Brought in, along with her 6 pups, as an 'unwanted mama and probably her first(&, definitely last) litter'.

dob: ~April 1, 2017(she has pearlie-white teeth)..looks to be Carolina Dog & BeagleX.

SWEET girl, friendly, outgoing, gets along well with other dogs and kids of all ages. Will test with cats, upon request. Sticks close to her babies, and we're not wanting to stress her out so will allow her to take her own time getting to used to life among those who actually care about her, & having enough food so that she doesn't need to forage, near and far. She acclimated quickly to all the other rescues at Howlin4Spirit's compound. She's happy to learn that life can be better, now that she is wanted and loved. You can see the trust in her eyes, now.

She walks well on-leash, but we have not been able to test her indoors. It is our belief that she was not a dog-lot dog but most likely was an outside dog, allowed to roam. However, as much as she appears to want to please her human, we feel strongly that she is housebroken with a refresher course(e.i., regular visits outdoors and proper exercise).

In just a little over 2 weeks time, her coat has gone from dry & bristly to smooth & soft, with the proper nutrition and medical attention. She looks better and you can tell she's much happier.

Adoption fee: $150(includes spay, micro-chip, all 4-1st yr puppy boosters/2Lepto, 1Bordatella & 1yr Rabies vax, monthly heart worm and flea/tick prevention, parasite-free, health certificate, all medical records from day#1 with H4S CARes including vet's surgical notations, 1/2 gallon bag of current dry food-Tractor Supply Store's '4health'-salmon & potato, beef knee cap bone, 'Rescued Dogs Rock' car magnet, 2 pet alert wallet cards, new nylon Martingale collar and matching 6' leash).

This pup is in and will remain in foster care in Rutherfordton, NC until her fur-ever home is approved. Tess will be ready to go to her fur-ever home on SAT/NOV 3rd.

Transport to all states along the eastern seaboard via Happy Dogs or Lifesavers Rescued Pet Transport svcs.

Transport fee: $125 from western NC to points as far as NYC, and $140 to all points N of NYC as far as Manchester, NH.

To apply to adopt TESS, please copy & paste the adoption application provided at: www.howlin4spirit.org/adoption-application/, complete all questions

thoroughly & email it to us at: howlin4spirit@gmail.com .

For more information and/or pix & videos of this pup, please feel free to email us. We'll be happy to help this pup

find the RIGHT matching situation/person/home in any way we can.
name: TESS

description: 21 Oct 2018: Buster and Lexi are brother & sister pure bred Chihuahuas that are in need of a new home. They are incredibly affectionate, loving and full of personality. At 12 years old, their owners are no longer capable of caring for them due to medical reasons. Buster and Lexi have been together their whole lives and, ideally, we would like them to stay together. They have no history of interacting with cats or kids, they have always been with their owners. However, they have interacted with two larger dogs (80+ lb labradors) and got along just fine with their larger furry friends. Please help us get Buster and Lexi new home where they will be cared for and loved!

description:
Woof! Hello! My name is Toby, and I am a six year old hound / pittie mix who weighs just over 75 lbs (I'm a husky boy!). I am friendly, affectionate, silly, and an all-around good boy ... if I do say so myself! :-)

I was recently brought to the shelter after spending over five years in a home. I've adjusted well to my new circumstances and sit quietly in my cage. Don't let that fool you, though ... I am a playful, active, fun-loving boy!

I love to be out and about and walk great on my leash in a harness. I easily pass doggies, runners, and other distractions. I sometimes grab my leash, but I correct easily. I also do a great "sit" on command and have a gentle mouth for taking treats.

I love, love, LOVE to play with toys -- ropes, balls, squeakies -- and will happily chase down anything you'd like to throw my way. I can get easily overstimulated, but, again, I respond well to corrections. I'll easily trade my toy for a yummy treat. I'm a good boy!

When I'm excited, I can jump up or get a little nibbly. I don't mean anything bad by this ... I just never got over this silly puppy behavior. For this reason, I would do best in a home with older kids and, of course, adults.

Do you have a doggie at home? I am great with other dogs! I am both playful and submissive with other pups, and I'd absolutely thrive in a multi-dog household. I recently went to a big adoption event and did great being surrounded by other pups. Please bring your doggie along with you when you come to visit me.

One of my human friends said these nice words about me:

"Toby is the best! Through no fault of his own, he's back at the shelter, and he's the same sweetheart he's always been. Toby is absolutely adorable -- no dog has a cuter snaggletooth! -- and he's super social and absolutely loves being around people. He acts like a puppy sometimes, but he's very innocent. He's a fun dog!"

Thank you. And thank you for reading all about me. If you're looking for a playful boy with the best smile around, I'm the dog for you. I can't wait to meet you.!

Love, Toby xoxo

PS ~ I'm also good with cats!

To adopt or to receive more information, please fill out an application on our website at www.libertyhumane.org/dogs. Please do NOT simply hit the Ask About button. 

Once you have filled out our application, we will be happy to contact you. Thank you!
name: Toby (Sweet  & Silly Boy, Playful with Dogs & Good with Cats)

description:
Hi everyone, my name is Alfredo and I am looking for a nice retirement home. I would love a home of my own to be king of the castle, yes, I think King Alfredo has a nice ring to it.  I am petite 10 year old, I weigh about 7 pounds. My perfect home would have no small children, they do not understand that quick movements can scare me. I get along with other dogs but don't necessarily want to share my castle. I'm not much of a cuddly dude, I prefer to be on my own, I'll hang out with you but none of that huggy, kissy stuff... yuck! I love to go on walks and if you want exercise, I'm your man. No need to stop and smell the flowers, let's go, go, go. 
If you believe you are the right person to share a sweet life with me please complete the adoption application @ www.papadopters.com My foster mom will contact you to see if we would be a good match.

At the shelter, staff, volunteers and visitors know Walnut for his crazy (Wal)Nut ways... he's all about the extra... extra energetic, extra bouncy, extra mouthy, etc.

In his foster home, Walnut has become a totally different dog almost immediately. Heâs super polite, walks like a dream on a harness and is actually a bit of a couch potato. Walnut still has somethings to work on,
but heâs been a doggie rockstar so far!

If you are interested in adopting Walnut and would like more information or to schedule a time to meet him, please email adoptadog@faithfulfriends.us.

Todd is good with children, other dogs and cats. He has a fabulous, good natured temperament!  

Todd is about 12-14 weeks old. He has a unique brown & white coat and is very handsome.  Todd was resuced along with his sister Teagan from a high kill shelter in NC and he is now enjoying a foster home in NJ.

AK/Baby is a puppy in a big dog's body.  He hasn't been taught to much in his life, so he needs someone with lots of patience.

He is not a big barker and knows how to push open a door.

We feel he would be ok with larger kids as he jumps and he's a big dog.  He's very food motivated, so training with treats is the way to go with this guy.

If you'd like to meet your next best friend, please don't hesitate with this hunk!

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

Carmine is around 5-6 years old and he's a friendly, smart, mellow kind of guy. He is ridiculously cute, and he knows it's fashionable to never leave home without a spit bubble hanging from your mouth. Carmine gets along with most dogs but can be selective with his friends. He was absent the day they taught sharing in puppy kindergarten, so he's learning how not to hog toys and treats around other dogs.  E-mail shelter@spca914.org to see if you're a good fit for this great boy!

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs that require more than one visit prior to adoption. With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.

NYS Registration # RR056
name: Carmine - Foster me for the Holidays!

description:
Amona is a gorgeous , big female around 6 years old . 

She was left behind by her owner in a high kill shelter . 

She was clearly abused and was extremely afraid of men . Over the months we worked with her and she opened up the male staff members . 

Still Amona can act scared if you see her for the first time. She has to trust you first or will try to hide in a corner . 

She is not that great with other dogs but became best friend with a smaller female shepherd . She does not like cats . 

Amona is a sweetheart who we would love to see coming home . 

A person who has patience and lots of love to give . 

Amona is located in Huntington NY 

To become her new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and ask one
name: Amona

name: Missy

description:
Bella is not with the SPCA of Westchester. Please contact "For the Love of Dogs" Rescue for more information. www.fortheloveofdogsrescue.org

BellaB is a FABULOUS mix of German shepherd and Rhodesian ridgeback.. super friendly and eager to please, she is an absolute blast to work with! Bella is a big girl weighing in at about 95 lbs.. luckily she naturally never jumps up on you and instead when greeting she loves to sweep in and lean her side into your legs while she looks up lovingly into your eyes.. She has such a soulful, engaging gaze. 

When she first came to us she wasn't exactly leash trained.. she pulled a whole lot and used all of her 95 lbs to pull to where ever it was that she wanted to pull to. After getting some much needed leash training and obedience skills (that she EXCELLED in by the way!!) BellaB is an absolute pleasure to walk. She listens to a number of commands on and off leash.. sit, down, stay, heel, with me, look, leave it, easy, come, paw, walk through the legs trick.. She is SO SMART!! 

BellaB has an extremely calm side to her which surprised us given her excitability outside. When hanging in her kennel she can always been seen sleeping all splayed out on her side.. even during thunder storms or barking commotions she'll be snoozing right through it all! BellaB is a dream for any active household.. she will make a wonderful, loyal and devoted companion!!

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***
name: Z Courtesy Post-Bella

description:
Boss - Male - Pit mix - 4 years

We pulled Boss from a local shelter when they were full. He was starting to get depressed after being there for a couple months. Boss is 4 years old and loves every person he meets. He's also 100% housebroken and is looking for a foster or forever home! Boss is good with dogs & kids! Apply at pittiesandpals.com
