description:
What a handsome devil! Say hello to Chewy, a sweet, petite, 12-year old, 16-pound Chihuahua/Jack Russell Terrier mix. 

Donât worry - - Chewy wonât be chewing up any of your stuff! As a more mature man, Chewy knows a thing or two about proper behavior. He is fully housebroken, he will go into his crate when directed to do so, he walks like a champ on a leash, and he hardly ever barks. He is extremely bright and obedient, and he knows a whole host of of commands, including sit, wait, come, ok, and crate. 

Chewy is excellent with people and loves being pet. He is a snuggly sort of fellow, and will happily sit on the couch with you while you watch TV or surf the Internet.

It takes a little while for Chewy to warm up to other pooches, so the best situation for this cute little bugger would be a home with another laid back, mellow-ish, respectful dog! 

Chewy enjoys his food, loves all treats, and will never steal food off of the coffee table. At home with his humans, Chewy is pretty much a perfect dog: Calm, cuddly, caring, kind, and oh-so-sweet!

If you would like to adopt this Rockstar, please email PupStarzRescue@gmail.com or visit www.pupstarzrescue.orgfor an application!

www.pupstarzrescue.org 
Please Follow us on Instagram: @pupstarzrescue
Like us on FaceBook! www.facebook.com/PupStarzRescue

*PupStarz Rescue cannot guarantee the breed of the dog
name: Chewy

description:
Bailey is a stunning, 4-5 year old Golden Retriever/Irish Setter mix.  Post Hurricane Florence, this poor baby found herself in a kill shelter in SC after her owner left her behind with family and didn't want her back.  She is afraid of cats and is good with other dogs but does prefer dogs who aren't very jumpy and in her face.  This easygoing sweetheart has done well with kids 9 year old and up but has not been around younger children.  Bailey is just waiting for the right family to love her forever.


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.

Moonshine loves to go for car rides and walks, and play with other dogs too.

description:
ADOPTION PENDING. You can see more of these beautiful dogs by going to  NGPR RESCUE DOGS at  https://nationalpyr.org/adoptable-dogs

NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Marshall is a big beautiful boy with gorgeous grey and black markings and dark ears, and big brown eyes that will melt your heart! He is such a nice looking boy he turns heads wherever he goes. Marshall is one of those big sweet boys with a quiet calm demeanor. He is just 2 years old, but an old soul. He is a happy pup, just a big calm and mellow Pyr, and an all-around nice boy. He gets along well with the other dogs in boarding and has even done well with the cat. Marshall came to rescue from a very crowded shelter. We do not know what circumstances he came from, but he was really thin and not in great shape, so unfortunately his gorgeous coat had to be shaved down as he was so matted - but no worries, that will all grow back in soon! Marshall is adorable, and such a sweetheart, we canât wait to see this nice boy find a great home of his own.
name: Marshall - adopted

description:
Timber is two and half years old and is looking for a family to share the rest of his life with. We arenât really sure what his breed is. Maybe shepherd, maybe lab, maybe part bear?. But here is what we do know about Timber: He loves going for walks, running around the back yard, being brushed (he likes to look his best!), being pet, and relaxing on the deck or porch with his family. He also enjoys treats. And we mean all kinds of treats. He will sit and wait patiently for anything from hot dogs to cantaloupe. There are no bad treats according to Timber. As easy going as he is, he does have some dislikes we should tell you about. He would prefer if his new home was free of hair dryers, blenders, and fireworks. He is willing to compromise and accept more treats however if a home without these things cannot be negotiated.

Timber is housebroken and knows many basic commands such as sit, down, stay, drop it, leave it. Timber would do best in a home with older kids or adults. If you would like to make Timber a part of your family, please contact us to set up a meet!
name: Timber

description: Moo is a beautiful adventurous soul. She loves to hike, splash, and explore. She is about 4 years old and a tall, leggy girl. She is sweet and cuddly with humans. She will need to be the only pet in her new home.

She does need some remedial housetraining.

description:
Darling Dory is a beautiful 3 year old 40 lb flat-coated retriever mix with a silky black coat and a gentle disposition.

This sweet girl was neglected and left in a yard at the beginning of her life, so she is initially cautious with new people. She is quickly learning that people are kind and they carry treats! Her fellow foster dog and other dog friends are teaching her a lot about how great people are, so Dory will do best in a home with another dog as a mentor.

Dory is a fun-loving playful girl who has  dog friends of all shapes and sizes. She likes to explore, so would do well in a home with a fenced-in yard. This gentle girl is very clever; she figured out housetraining in just a couple of days, and unlike her namesake from âFinding Nemoâ, she has a great attention span!

After just a few days in her foster home, Dory knew she was in good hands, wagging her tail in excitement to see her foster mom and asking to be petted. Dory is making great progress in learning to trust, and is ready to find an openhearted forever home to settle into.

Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org).  We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org.  Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://www.anewchancear.org/adoption_process.php) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://www.anewchancear.org/adoption_application.html)or we won't be able to process it.

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://www.anewchancear.org/faq.php) and resources for.  We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs.  Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care.  All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you.  We do not receive funding from  private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://www.anewchancear.org/donate.php).  It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are  "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance."  (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Dory

description:
Oh beautiful, sweet, puppy-boy Ralphie!! He's such a good boy! When we heard about Ralphie in the shelter he was described to us as a possible therapy dog.. he got along with everyone.. greeted new people like old friends.. seemed to possess a calm confidence and really knew how to CHILL OUT! Ralphie is all that and in need of a bit of training.. just basic manners.. humans aren't puppy play mates kind of thing! 

Once outside his brain is fully awake and he's ready for play ..when he first arrived he would have chosen to jump on his handler, grab shoes and pretty much anything hanging within his reach! It was pretty cute and entertaining and hard not to laugh BUT clearly behavior a polite LOVE DOGS Pit Bull ought NOT be doing...  SO ...we've put him in a bit of a....  FINISHING SCHOOL. He loves it! To Ralphie its all a game and the more interaction the better. He soaks up praise and works for more! 

?We are posting Ralphie for adoption but we want to hang on to him for a while and figure out more of who he is and wants to become!! Ralphie is a GEM.. one of those YAY LIFE dogs that you'll never forget! And that soft loose muzzle is the BEST!!

For more information and photos of Ralphie, be sure to visit our website at fortheloveofdogsrescue.org!!
name: Ralphie

description:
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance will transport within reasonable distance. Sweet Lex is being fostered in York Pa. 

What we know about Lex:
*housebroken
*deaf and blind
*good with dogs
*loves to cuddle!
*diabetic 
*likes to explore the yard

What Lex's foster mom has to say about Lex:
Lex is a super sweet (and cute) 13 year old Pug. He is of the old-style Pugs where he has longer legs and a bit larger. He just loves to cuddle next to someone and be held like a baby. Lex is blind, deaf, and diabetic but it doesn't stop him from enjoying walking around and cuddling on the couch. His diabetes is under control with the help of a good diet and insulin shots 2-times a day, and is very good at taking his shots. He is house broken and will let you know when he needs to go out. He has never been crated in his foster home, instead gated in the kitchen area with his bed and has done great. We are working on getting him used to wearing an Optivizor to protect his face while wondering around. He is doing OK with it.

Lex has attended a few events so far and has not been startled when people come to meet him or when other dogs meet him. He engages with people and other dogs happily. If held in your arms like a baby, he quickly relaxes and goes to sleep. Lex would love to have a home where he can cuddle with you and spend the day dreaming away. 
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.
name: Lex: adorable older guy! (PA)

She has had her dental which has helped her to feel better, but Amy Rose is more of an 'independent girl', meaning that she will seek attention, but when she is done, she just wants to be left alone, and doesn't really like to have her head, ears and eyes played with. Because of this, we recommend a home with no small children. Amy Rose is up to date on shots and has been spayed. She is fine with other dogs. description:
We can pretty much all agree that miso soup is warm, soothing and delicious...right? Well, so is Miso the dog! This 3-year old, 42-pound Pit Bull Terrier mix isn't served up with a soup spoon, but sheâs a pile of mush and youâll still wanna eat her up!

Miso is a gorgeous girl with a fabulous fawn-colored coat, and toes that look like they were dipped in white paint. She is usually laid back and mellow, but once you get her going, her spirited, playful side emerges. A fan of fresh air, Miso also enjoys romping around outside, she loves going for walks, and she struts her stuff like a runway model!

Miso can peacefully co-exist with other canines and is friendly, respectful, and affectionate to all humans. A well-behaved poochie, she knows the commands sit and come, and will go in her crate when directed to do so. Miso is one of those dogs who is super sweet and snuggly, without being jumpy, drooly or invasive. Nice!!!

It wonât take much to make this girl happy. All sheâs looking for is kindness, caring and cuddles...plus maybe a prime spot on the couch...and for that, sheâll give you her undying loyalty and eternal love. 

If you would like to adopt this Rockstar, please email PupStarzRescue@gmail.com or visit www.pupstarzrescue.org for an application! 

www.pupstarzrescue.org 
Please Follow us on Instagram: @pupstarzrescue
Like us on FaceBook! www.facebook.com/PupStarzRescue

*PupStarz Rescue cannot guarantee the breed of the dog

description:
Meet Gemma (aka "Arethra"), one of our hoarding case dogs.  This poor soul was trapped in a home with 55 other dogs. Never allowed outside, never allowed to run and play and be a dog. Our rescue was asked to help and we saved 12 precious lives. All of these dogs are now looking for a new beginning and a chance to know what real love is.  We think Gemma is approximately 3 years old and a lab/hound mix, although it is a little tough to age her properly because she was in such poor condition when we rescued her.  Gemma was treated for a skin infection, parasites and heartworm tested.  Because Gemma was not properly socialized and treated as a dog should be, she will require a patient adopter willing to give her the time and the space to adjust. 

Gemma was adopted through our rescue this summer, but needs to find a new home.  Her current owner says that Gemma loves going to work with her at a boarding kennel, and especially loves the older doggy play group.  She also loves going to the dog beach.  Gemma thinks rolling in the dirt and stealing socks are the best thing ever!

Gemma's current owner also tells us that Gemma is dog, cat and older-child friendly, but that she doesn't like to be around a high level of energy.  She would do best in a home with older dogs.  Gemma has never shown any aggression towards cats, but she does chase them.  Gemma likes the children in her current home when they are sitting calmly, but avoids them when they are running around and playing.  Gemma also has a history of snapping and/or growling if a person or another animal touches her when she is sleeping (Beauty Queens need their rest!).  For these reasons, she would do best in a home with adults and older children/teenagers that can be calm around her, and that will understand to not disturb her when she is sleeping.  Gemma's owners feel she would be happier in a home with less commotion than she currently lives with.

Gemma is spayed, up-to-date on vaccinations and microchipped. Her adoption fee is $375.

If a dog is listed on Petfinder, he/she is still available. We do not go on a first come first serve basis, but on best fit for the family and most importantly, the dog. Please keep in mind that we are taking our best guess on breed and age based on the dogs physical appearance. 

Please visit snarrnortheast.org for an adoption application.
name: Gemma, aka "Arethra"

description:
Enrique is a super loving 3 year old, 35 pound golden retriever mix who came to us from a hoarding case in a very rural area. He didn't have the greatest start to life, but since coming to rescue, his personality is really shining though and he is turning into a wonderful dog.  

Enrique comes across as  a quiet, shy dog, but is as sweet and loving as the day is long.   He definitely needs a quieter home without lots of loud noises.  Definitely people who have bands in their homes need not apply.  Enriques is a perfect gentleman with people, with dogs and cats, but due to his shy nature, he'd prefer a home with kids past the screaming years. A fenced yard is a definite must for our boy.. 

Enrique is housebroken and well-mannered and with a little time and patience, this dog will become the perfect companion for anyone who is looking for a younger dog to be their bestie.   

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please apply online, at http: https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/ and then email corey@bigfluffydogs.com. 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please apply online, at http: https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/. Our main website, www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the rescue process. NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE DO NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. All known information about an individual dog is provided in it's listing. We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. Homes considering adopting a puppy must be prepared for:1.) Flexible schedules for potty training. Puppies can only "hold it" for one hour per month of age (ex. a 4 month old puppy can only go 4 hours without a potty break).2.) Crate training until the puppy is at least one year old, to prevent chewing on inappropriate things when you can't supervise.3.) Socialization: The more positive and varying experiences as a puppy the better, both in and out of your home.4.) Puppy behavior and life stages are equivalent to a human toddler. It takes at least a full year to have a calmer, well adjusted dog. Patience is required and when your dog's behavior is a positive experience for you and those around you, your patience will be rewarded tenfold, for years to come.Please do not consider adopting a puppy if you have not thoroughly thought through the pros and cons of having one. So many people end up returning them after 3-5 months because they didn't realize the amount of work involved in raising a puppy.Patience, appropriate toys, socialization, and obedience training are all musts. All are time consuming, and can be expensive.All Dogs Require:Supervision with children and obedience training. Adopters that want to have good dogs must be prepared to put the time and effort into training a dog. Any dog requires work and effort, but a well trained, well socialized dog is more than worth the effort put in to get them there.
name: Enrique

description:
THIS IS A COURTESY POST. IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN MEETING ANNIE, PLEASE CONTACT PEGGY OVER AT POUND DOG, FOUND DOG RESCUE LOCATED IN BARNEGAT, NJ. SHE CAN BE REACHED AT PDFDrescue@hotmail.com

Minnie is going to make someone very happy! 
This 7 year old sweetheart has a wonderful demeanor and is easygoing and low maintenance. She didnât have much going for herself -  black coat, nondescript older dog who found herself in a kill shelter. Despite that, she hasnât spent one minute feeling sorry for herself.  She thrives in foster care, simply loving life. Her favorite pastime - squirrel patrol and being your sofa companion. At 18 pounds sheâs a perfect small dog size and wonât take up much room in the bed! 
Minnie would love to be an only dog so she can lap up all the attention for herself. She loves people and makes herself comfortable with them. A fenced yard would be perfect for her - we want her to be able to explore her world in safe surroundings. 
Minnie is house trained and crate trained, spayed and up to date with vaccinations. And she has just had a dental cleaning to show off her beautiful smile! Did we say she loves to take walks?  Do you? 
We love rescuing dogs like Minnie. Black dogs are so often overlooked in shelters, and 7 year olds are sometimes thought of as too old. Minnieâs only giveaway is her grey muzzle but she shows no signs of slowing down. She has years of love and companionship to give and sheâs waiting for a family to call her own. 
Please consider opening your heart to an older dog! Applications at www.pounddogfounddog.org or contact Pdfdrescue@hotmail.com for more information.
name: MINNIE

description:
Sweet loving Mama to her two little pups, Bonnie is all love. She is gentle, loving, friendly, and we could go on and on about her, but you should come in and see for yourself. Fill out an adoption application at www.pawscrossedny.org

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.
name: Bonnie

description:
Introducing Shane! This 5-year old, 12-pound, long legged love bug was picked up by the ACC as a stray. He was very scared, but seems to be unwinding nicely in the safety of his foster home. Shane is very affectionate and good with other dogs, and doesnât bark much at all. He is healthy, vaccinated, and neutered.

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application on the CONTACT US page. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:

Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.com

Fosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.com

PLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked "Adoption Pending" have an approved adoption application on file and are awaiting final approval. Please check back in a few days to see if they are still available!

We understand you may have questions but the fastest way to get answers is to fill out the application and the foster parent can answer any questions you may have!

Waggytail Rescue CAN NOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you.
name: Shane!

description:
Shay is a 7 yr old sweetheart in foster. Shay and the local mailmen are in competition with each other when it comes to achieving their goals in the rain, hail sleet or snow! Shay's drive to play in any type of weather shows her zest for life and fun! This pint size little girl has a quart size personality! Shay would do great in an adult family. 

Shay does need to be the only animal in the household. 

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html  . We will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible!

*** Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Shay

description:
Riely was saved off the NYACC Euthansia List back in August 2018.  He was a stray so much wasn't know about his past.

He is approx. 3 year old Pit bull mix.  Beautiful Brindle and White coat.  He's approx 60 lbs.

He's been in foster home ever since and has come out of his shell and now a really good dog.

He does need slow introductions to new people and other dogs.  He's very protective over his family.

This is what his foster family says about him:

While we have fostered numerous dogs, Riley is the most loving and happy to snuggle dog we have ever come across.  He eyes are truly the window to his soul, and his soul is full of love and trust once he is familiar with you.  Although he is approximately 60lbs, he still likes to pretend he is a âlap dogâ and loves to bury his heavy head in your lap.  He is calm when alone, and after an excited âhelloâ, he will gladly sit and watch hours of television with you.  When outside, he is an excellent leash walker.  He loves to run and play when possible, but will also be happy chewing a bone for a few minutes in the house.  He is house broken, enjoys his meals, and just needs someone to share his love with. There is no doubt; he is ready and willing to be a life-long âbest friendâ!
name: Riley

description:
Available: Ellie is currently on medical hold, we are graciously accepting donations to help cover her medical bills: http://www.pointerrescue.org/donation.html
Meet Ellie, the senior Pointer girl. Ellie came to us a short time ago in very poor condition. She was found as a stray. She got the veterinary care that she needed through PRO and has blossomed in foster care. She is believed to be 10+ years old. She is a gentle soul who loves to shadow her person. She likes other dogs and does love to play with toys too. She has been spayed and microchipped, wormed and vaccinated, she is on Heartworm preventative. Ellie deserves warmth and love and the best of care in her senior years. She is the sweetest of girls. 
Want to learn more about one of the dogs we have up for adoption? Fill out our adoption application!!
http://www.pointerrescue.org/adopt.html
TRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally within 1500 miles)
Can't adopt right now, but want to help?
Consider sponsoring a dog by making a donation to help with vetting costs. PRO is 501c3 non-profit and fully funded by donations, your tax deductible gift would be greatly appreciated! 
http://www.pointerrescue.org/donation.html
name: Ellie (ME)

description:
Meet Cutie Lucy Lu Lu

I am a young 3 years 6 months old, weigh 36 lbs, possible dachshund Labrador mix.

I have all age appropriate vaccinations, heart worm negative , spayed,and microchipped 

I love hugs, playing for my doggy and kid friends. Also, perfectly contented snuggling.with my foster mom.

I forgot the best part ....crate and house trained, very happy girl and the perfect size dog 

Contact Carol at chocolatesss720@gmail.com
name: Lucy LuLu

description: Cyrus was found as a stray and pulled from a local shelter. He is 2 years old and a friendly energetic boy who would excel in a moderately active household. He is great with dogs and everyone he meets and is neutered ready for his forever home- fill out an application to meet him today!
name: Cyrus

description: Dakota White Cloud is a sweet, gentle, loving, laid back 10yr old boy. Dakota gets along very well with other dogs. Dakota is house trained and good loose in the house when no one is home.  Dakota walks very nicely on leash. He has allergies but they can be managed with inexpensive medication. Due to the medication he takes to manage his allergies he needs to urinate frequently (every four hours during the day) Dakota cannot be placed with young children. Dakota is good with a 4ft fence. Dakota White Cloud came into rescue due to one of his ownerâs passing away. This dreamy white boy is very easy going and a joy to share time with making long lasting, wonderful memories.
name: Dakota White Cloud

description:
Rocky is so sweet and gets along with everyone. He is about 3 years old and 58 lbs and just as handsome as they come. Smart and eager to please, Rocky will do well in most any situation, if given a chance. He is very calm and gentle and a real easy going dog, although it takes him a minute to warm up to a stranger. Loves other dogs and cats. A must meet, for you will fall in love, for sure. So much more handsome in person! (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there might be something wrong with your email!) 
Lovable Mutts Adoption Center is a private, in home, all breed rescue/adoption facility, specializing in all ages and sizes of dogs.  We exist only on the kindness of your donations and adoptions!  We pride ourselves on being an HOLISTIC center and feed only holistic grain free foods and give daily, various, vitamins and supplements to all of our dogs. 

Our dogs are well socialized, very friendly, well mannered, affectionate, and in wonderful health. While some might be timid or shy, we work with our adopters in any way we can, to help them to work with their new family member. We give training tips and behavioral tips and even board for a very reasonable fee. Our dogs are extremely well cared for - most even know how to use a dog door by the time they leave us, know basic commands, and are crate trained!  We stand by our pups/dogs, and give 10 days for a refund and almost always take our dogs back at any age of their lives (can sometimes depend on the dog)! 

Lovable Mutts Adoption Center has an application screening process.  All applicants are asked to provide vet references, personal references, and a home visit.  We pride ourselves in matching up the right dog with the right home.  Sometimes this happens quickly and sometimes it might take awhile.  We hope you understand and are willing to wait for the perfect pup for your situation. We reserve the right to turn applicants down and to change our mind about a suitable match, for we are only concerned about what is best for our dogs.  Also note that we arrange our visiting hours around your schedule, as this is a private, in home facility.  We respond to all inquiries promptly, so if you have any trouble sending us an email, or have not heard back from us within 24 hours, please, CONTACT US AGAIN and check your spam!  (We all know how emails can be at times!)

Our dogs are spayed or neutered (if old enough), up to date on vaccines, wormed, heartworm tested, and free of fleas and ticks.  We temperament test our  dogs and they are all suitable for many family situations. Our dogs are well mannered,  and are in our family/home situation at this time (not kept in kennels or crates), and are worked with daily.  All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats, and we can cat test. Adoption donations vary with age, breed, vetting, and training of the dog, and range from $250 to $500. This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care.  (We do not tend to place puppies or small dogs with kids under 6 and reserve the right to match who WE feel would be the best homes for our dogs.)  
Please, come adopt one of our Lovable Mutts - you will be so glad you did!

(IF YOU DO NOT GET A REPLY EMAIL WITHIN 24 HOURS, CHECK YOUR SPAM BOX - WE REPLY EVERY FEW HOURS TO EMAILS)
name: Rocky (Wonderful and Sweet)

description: Stacie is ready to head off to her new home. Please email us at doggiedogrescue@aol.com with any questions.
name: Stacie

description:
Teagan is a handsome boy. He is a bit shy so he will need patience some TLC.  
He is a sweet guy!
name: Teagan

description:
Handsome Westley is a sleek 1 1/2 year old 55 lb Coonhound/Rhodesian Ridgeback mix who is so eager to please he'll do his whole repertoire of tricks before you even have the treat ready!  This droopy-eared chatty charmer thrives on structure and affection, and is devoted to the people who provide it.  Smart and silly Westley LOVES his toys, and when he's not playing outside he can be found lounging on his bed with a tennis ball or a bone in his mouth.  He's got the hang of the first part of the "fetch" game...he's still working on the bringing it back part because he just has so much fun running around after the ball.  Westley loves to chase, and due to his innate prey drive he should not be in a home with cats or other small critters. 

Snuggling is one of his favorite things, but this fit fellow is no couch potato.  Coonhounds and Ridgebacks benefit from mental and physical activity in order to be happy, and Westley is no exception.  He loves hiking where there are plenty of new and exciting smells, and dreams of finding an active forever home who will engage with him and continue to teach him and take him on new adventures...followed by excellent happy snoozes at the feet of his humans. 


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (https://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (https://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Westley

description:
Age: 14 months old
Size: Medium
Activity Level:  Medium (Puppy energy!)
Good With Dogs: Yes, has lived with other dogs
Good With Cats: No
Good with Children: Teenagers

Adele is such a smart puppy!
Adele is originally from Shanghai, China. Adele was being trained for police work and she flunked out. Placed in a dog crate in the alley outside the police department she waited for days without food or water to be rescued! Fortunately Shanghai Animal Rescue heard about her plight and they found her, provided the care and safety Adele needed, until she left on her flight to the USA to her new adoptive family and arrived on July 4th.

But poor Adele, her new family loved her, but their cats did NOT ?  Adele enjoyed chasing the poor kitties, and unfortunately terrified them. A trainer was brought in, and Adele tried, but the kitties were just too tempting to chase, and the kitties got too traumatized, so Adeleâs family turned to GSGSR for help.  Adele has traveled halfway around the globe in search of her sanctuary, her forever home. Adele is still a puppy in body and spirit, she loves to play with other dogs, she is housebroken, loves her crate, walks well on a leash, enjoys riding in the car, and LOVES, LOVES to play ball!

Adele is the complete GSD package, beauty, brains, and FUN!
If you have the time and patience to complete training with Adele, you will have an amazing BFF!
name: Adele

description:
"Hey there!  I'm Amos and I'm pleased to meet you!  I came to Providence Animal Center all the way from Kentucky in the hopes of finding my perfect home and I can tell that it's right around the corner!  I've been spending some time with a wonderful foster family and have shown them just how much of a sweetie I can be!  I may be a little older than the average pup, but that doesn't mean I've run out of love!  I'm a polite and loving boy when I'm around the right people and for me, all people are the right people!  I even get along well with the other dogs in my foster home. When I met a kitty cat at the Adoption Center, they really didn't bother me. I think I could live comfortably with a kitty cat as long as I know the cats are about and they don't sneak up on me!  Like I said, I'm no spring chicken so I like to know what's going on, ya know?  I have a laid-back nature and enjoy time to myself as much as I enjoy hanging out with a loving human friend - I just can't wait to find those loving humans so we can spend forever together!  Although I'm having fun with my foster family, what I want more than anything in the world is to find a family of my own!  Hopefully forever can start today!  If you think I could be your guy, all you need to do is email my foster mom at kmorgan@providenceac.org! She can tell you all about why you need a sweet guy like me in your life! I'll be waiting! Love, Amos"

P.S. One of my new friends is so eager to help me find my forever family that they have sponsored my adoption fee!  That means I can go home with you today for free!  Wahoo!

Providence Animal Center is funded solely by adoption fees and donations. Adoption fees vary per animal, please call the Adoption Center and reference this animal's ID number in order to obtain accurate fee information. 

To adopt this dog please call Providence Animal Center at 610-566-1370 during adoption hours. You may also email adoptions@providenceac.org. Can't adopt? Donate to help our homeless pets, www.providenceac.org/donate. Cant' donate? Apply to temporarily foster this pet in your home!

About fostering: You can still guarantee the safety and well-being of any of our dogs or puppies by temporarily fostering one or more right in your own home. Visit our foster page to learn about the program. Then, email your application along with any questions to foster@providenceac.org for immediate review.
name: Amos * Foster * Sponsored *

description:
NYC Area -- Rescued from South Korea, Jeremy is a playful, sweet Jindo/Terrier mix pup. At 5 months old and weighing approximately 12 pounds, Jeremy is currently being fostered in NYC and is looking for her forever home! Please consider adopting her!

You can meet Jeremy this SATURDAY or SUNDAY at our SANTA PAWS EVENTS
(If she is not adopted at Saturdayâs event, she will be there Sunday)

Saturday, Dec 22nd, 2018

BUSHWICK BARK
181 Irving Ave
Brooklyn, NY

12PM-4PM
-----------

Sunday, Dec 23rd, 2018

WESPAW PETS
44-05 Queens Blvd
Sunnyside, NY

12PM-4PM

PLEASE NOTE: You need to attend the OUTDOOR ADOPTION EVENT in order to meet this dog and bring your printed application. Please come to the event should you have any questions or email us at info@koreank9rescue.org. Thank you!
Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Jeremy

breeds: American Staffordshire Terrier, Pit Bull Terrier
description: Carly is the cutest little 5 month old pit mix. Look at that patch on her eye! Carly came to us as an owner surrender and she is just SO cute. Her foster mama says sheâs fearless and spicy; just how we like em! Sheâs super dog friendly and ready for her forever home!
name: Carly

description: This is Ginger, her name matches her perfectly because she is a beautfiul Ginger color. Do not let her intimidate you or discourage you she is just trying to get to know you. Once you spend a couple minutes with her she is the most loving and friendly dog. Once she gets to know you she is very loyal and you will create a strong bond with her. She is on the larger side and for that reason we would not like her to go to a house with small children. She will need a home that can understand her personal space but knows exactly when she wants belly rubs. She has an amazing personailty that will shine through if you take her into our play room. Ginger is around 5 years old and is looking for another chance at a forever home. She has lots of energy and will climb in your lab as she wiggles. Her previous owners say that she is good with other dogs but a meet and greet is always encouraged to insure that she is a good match with your family. She isn't a fan of the vet and has axiety about it but she will grow to learn that the vet is a good place that will keep her healthy. She is already spayed and up-to-date on all of her vaccines. If you think Ginger would be a great addition to your life please do not hesitate to ask any questions or meet with her outside of her kennel.
name: Ginger

description:
Sweet Stewart is the most adorable playful 7 month old hound mix. This little guy is incredibly loving; if you are averse to doggie kisses, he is not for you!  He loves kisses, snuggling and playing- and at 20 lbs he is perfectly snuggle-sized.  He has fun puppy energy but he also likes to laze on a comfy bed in the sun, looking out of a window, watching people, squirrels and birds go by. Stewart loves his toys and likes to carry them from room to room.  He does his business outside and looks forward to walks.  He is an all-around great guy!   


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible, organization. We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org. Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/) or we won't be able to process it. We are a foster-based rescue and do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. Please do not contact us requesting a meeting with a dog because we are an all-volunteer organization, and these requests tie up our volunteers who could instead be checking applications. 

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs. Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care. All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you. We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance." (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Stewart

description:
Meet Miss Hikari! This little peanut of a girl was found wandering the streets of Brooklyn and wound up at the shelter. During her stay there, she was described by a volunteer as very sweet, calm, and good on walks. Life on the streets wasn't easy for Hikari. She arrived at the shelter emaciated and missing hair on her back from malnourishment. Hikari became very sick during her stay at the shelter. Fortunately, Ready for Rescue was able to pull her to safety where she was able to receive the medical attention she so desperately needed.

Fast forward to now, where she has put on a few pounds, and has happily settled in to her new foster home. She has a new-found energy and zest for life! She loves going on long  walks with her foster dad. She is very friendly and eager to meet people out on the street.  When she's at home, she's right there willing to snuggle and cuddle with her favorite people.

Hikari is currently working on leash manners when encountering other dogs, since she tends to become excitable when she sees them.  When left home alone, Hikari is quiet and well-behaved,  She is crate trained and is well behaved when her humans are away.

Hikari would love to find her forever home and promises to make a great companion if given the chance! Please inquire about her today!!
name: Hikari

description: Meet happy-go-lucky Nando, a friendly male Boxer/Terrier Mix who is around three years old and weighs only 40 pounds. He is a great dog with a wonderful disposition that gets along well with all and just wants to be your friend. Nando would make a nice pet to anyone who adopts him so why not see if this sweet boy can make your family complete! If interested please text Gizela at 201-655-5059. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Nando

description:
Hunter is a 2 month old male Yellow Labrador/Border Collie mix puppy.  He has fluffier fur at this point, more like a Border Collie than a Labrador.  He is a shy puppy, but comes to greet the foster caretaker when the crate door opens.  He enjoys play fighting with his siblings (2 other males, 2 females).  He was found as a stray in the South.  His mom, who was only 9 months old, had 8 puppies.  Two died.  They were born in a rocky area where there were copperheads, so it is unknown if they died because the mom left, they were compromised in some basic way, or if a snake bit them.  If interested in Hunter, call 212 685-3858.  

People seriously interested in adopting Hunter or one of his brothers or sisters should submit the following information by email or by calling.  Name, address and phone number of where you live.  Do you rent, own or have some other living arrangement?  Names of all adults and children in the household and ages of any children.  Name, address, phone and occupation of all working adults in the household.  Whether you have applied to adopt before and, if so, where.  Name, address and phone number of a personal reference, a friend or relative who does not live with you.   Other animals in the household, breed or breed mix, age, and whether spayed or neutered.  Will the dog you adopt live indoors, outdoors, or both?  Have you had a pet die recently?  If so, what were the circumstances.  Do you agree to have the dog you adopt spayed or neutered?  If you have had an animal in the last three years, name, address, and phone number of your vet.  Why do you want to adopt a dog?

Our online application no longer works.  Hence, the information requested above.  We apologize for any inconvenience.
name: Hunter

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Jax Sweet Tart is a beautiful little girl. She is happy, friendly and calm. She is quiet and walks nicely on leash. Sweet Tart loves people but no cats, please. She also would do best as an only dog. If you are looking for a striking girl to call your own, Sweet Tart might be it. She turned 2 years old in August.
name: Sweet Tart

description:
Bronson maintains his big smile in spite of saying good bye to his family when they moved and could not keep him. He was clearly loved by his family which included a small child who hugged him very tightly before he went to his kennel in the shelter.  Bronson had some training and will continue to learn new skills at the shelter to help him transition to a new family. For example, he is learning to walk on leash without pulling. 

Bronson loves to chase toys in the yard and to run. He is very excited to cool off on a hot day by flopping into the kiddie pool. Bronson is three years old and weighs about 60 pounds. He lived peacefully with another dog and is house trained.

Although Bronson lived with a small child, the stress of his life at the shelter makes him very excitable when he meets new people and has the opportunity to exercise.  Therefore, we feel that he would be best matched to an adult family or one with older children.
name: Bronson

description:
When to Come: (Unless different date stated above)
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the best match. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions, except in the case of dogs that require more than one visit prior to adoption. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the best match. Some dogs require all residents of your home and household dog(s) to be present for a meet and greet.  

We do not accept adoption fee deposits in advance, nor do we hold animals, unless it is an animal that requires more than one visit prior to adoption. In this case, an appointment can be scheduled with a senior staff member or trainer. Some dogs require all residents of your home and household dog(s) to be present for a meet and greet. If they are not present, we cannot hold the dog.   

Adoption Fees; Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated and dewormed (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. Pre-existing medical conditions are covered via our Simpson Clinic free of charge within the first 30 days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.

NYS Registration # RR056
name: Xavier

I still hate baseball caps; I think I always will; yup, I am pretty definite on that one.  So if you are patient and have lots of love to give, don't own any baseball hats and are willing to give a little guy like me a try, then today is your luck y day.  Let hook up!

Howie is an 2 year old neutered red neutered male chiweenie who is current on vaccinations, heartworm negative and on preventative and has been  placed on the DRBC long life diet. The DRBC Website will help you can learn more about our  adoption process and complete the application.

description:
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance will transport within reasonable distance. Marvin is being fostered in PA.

What we know about Marvin:
*smart boy. learns cues easily
*food motivated
*loves toys
*not good with small animals, including cats
*would not be a good candidate for children

This is what Marvin's foster mom has to say about Marvin:
Marvin has shown significant positive changes as he developed trust in his foster mom.  Where he was once fear aggressive, he now realizes that his foster mom may talk in a firm voice to him at times but there is nothing to be fearful of.  This improvement is too significant to capture in words.  
He comes to his foster mom to seek out pets and attention and will follow her from room to room but still does not, and probably never will, like to be held for more than it takes to exchange quick kisses and to receive a few scratches.  He will often come to his foster mom and look up at her, which means, âPet me Momâ.  He will stand on the floor for several minutes enjoying the attention. 
Marvinâs possessiveness when eating and getting treats has also improved significantly.  He waits patiently to get a treat.  He is often last to get his and he is fine with that.  There are several other dogs in the house with Marvin and during mealtime, although he gets very excited and wants to make sure heâs not forgotten about, food can be placed on the floor for other dogs in the house but Marvin does not even show interest in getting into other bowls.  He knows where he eats and will only eat food that is placed in that spot.  Marvin is very protective of chewy treats and toys and needs to be kept away from other dogs when he has one of these.
Marvin has many endearing qualities and is a good potential pet for someone who appreciates truly seeing him for who he is and does not compare him to any other dog.   He shows love in his own way.  It has been an interesting several months with Marvin and itâs wonderful to see him being so trusting, watching him break down the wall of fear that he had for the first several months he was in his foster home.  He has taught his foster mom more than any book ever could about fear, learning to trust and showing love from a distance.  
This little guy is absolutely precious, with a big personality.  If you have an all-adult home, can appreciate uniqueness, have another dog or two who will not get in Marvinâs space, do NOT have other species of pets inside OR outside, then Marvin is the one for you!
His foster mom will speak to you directly to answer any questions you may have about Marvin.   
Blind Dog Rescue Alliance has voted against the use of electric fencing effective immediately.
name: Marvin: on hold

description:
Yummy, joyful, kind of a roly-poly slice and bake cookie roll dough boy on stumpy legs.. HUGO is FANTASTIC..  Itâs impossible not to laugh when you see him bouncing and bobbing his way around, low rider style, as he playfully frolics around in the yards... his big exuberant smile spread from ear to ear!!

He walks beautifully alongside you on the leash, almost never pulling and whenever he gets the chance he hops up and showers you with kisses! He is curious and eager to explore and tunes in wonderfully!!

Hugo also loves to play with his canine friends. He and his companion, possible sister..? Hopey are great friends ..dogs who love people, love dogs and love fun! He never seems to be wary of a new dog or human friend approaching. He just canât wait to say hello and get to playing!  

Hugo is a smarty pants, and loves to work for food!  He picks up new commands with almost no effort at all. He is truly a joy to be around. He is easy to amp up and will settle down nicely also! He is the cutest chubby pup with a lovable mug! Huggy bear Hugo is a lover.. happy to snuggle alongside you belly up, mouth wide open grinning for joy!

description:
Banjo and Cayenne are terribly sweet Tibetan Terriers that would love a great home where they can stay together forever.  Banjo, a male 7 1/2 year old, and Cayenne, a female 4 1/2year old, were removed from a terrible situation where they were living in a car with an older dog, and abandoned on a hot summer day while their owner was in a bar cooling off.  Banjo and Cayenne were extremely matted and dirty and could not function properly due to their overgrown condition.  They were thrilled to be all cleaned up and to have all of their medical needs tended to.  The pair get along perfectly with one another but they were a bit rough on their old friend, Tara, so they may be selective of another dog that they let into their relationship.  They are incredibly sweet and positively adore people of all ages.  They can't get enough attention, they're well behaved and gentle, and they're goofy and playful too.  They would love to meet you, and have you take them off to the happy life that they deserve!  File#28327/28

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.

description: Look at Rosie's big beautiful brown eyes. So dazed and confused because in this photo Rosie is looking at you from behind a kennel door at a cold shelter where she was confined! Rosie is a gentle, elegant 45 pound approximately one year old pointer-hound mix.  She is meant to be a proud companion of some lucky person. She is the kind of dog who loves to cuddle as well as play or run about a fenced in backyard.  She finally made it to the foster and socializes fine with other dogs. When she arrived it was obvious that she was so overwhelmed having been in a shelter.  She really wants to tell her story â but alas she cannot because she canât talk.  She has however shown us that she is fine with cats.  She is just very mellow, gentle and kind. No wonder someone had named her Rosie. Rosie is also up to date on all her shots, spayed and ready to love you. To make your home happier for the holidays and for Rosie please fill out an adoption application at www.peace4paws.org.  As soon as it is processed we will arrange for a meet and greet.

Luckily she bloomed open with her 2 foster mommies Shea and Amanda . They did a wonderful job and Asvina is still timid but enjoys life now . Her ears straight up and she walks now normal .

Asvina is good with other dogs but not with cats . She lives together with Astro who is also for adoption .

Asvina would love to have now a family of her own where she can be the center of all the attention.

description:
Zoey is a two year old dachshund mix.
She is spayed, microchipped, housebroken and crate trained.
She weighs 17#.
Zoey has a very pleasing personality and is extremely observant.
Not much is missed by her big, bright eyes.
She loves to chase the laser pointer.
Zoey would prefer to be adopted into a home with women.
She is not aggressive around men but will simply not engage with them.
Zoe likes to be brushed.
She is heartworm negative and takes preventative the first day of each month.
When she was tested for heartworm she was also tested for Lyme disease and that was negative as well.
Zoey is up-to-date on her rabies, distemper combo and bordetella vaccinations.
She has been wormed.
High quality, dry dog chow is her main diet.
Zoey is trim and weighs 13#.
She will nibble at American rawhide and raw carrots.
Trader Joe's natural dog treats are one of her favorites.
Sometimes she gets herself  in trouble by taking too close a look at what some of the other dogs are enjoying.
Fortunately she is a quick learner.
Zoey is also able to find activities to amuse herself in between naps.
Her favorite toy is a small squeaky ball.
She is not a big barker and could not be considered yappy.
A visible, secure, fenced yard is required.
ADOPTION FEE: $300.00
INFO UPDATED: 12-28-18
www.apawpets.org

breeds: American Staffordshire Terrier, Pit Bull Terrier
description: We scooped up this handsome pupperoni from animal control. He was such a good boy that we were actually convinced he was someone's family pet that escaped. We weren't able to find his owners but we know he will be a perfect addition to any family. He is kid and dig friendly and basically perfect! Apply for Josh today!
