description:
Hi, Iâm Charlie D. Iâm a 3-month-old, 15 lb Black Lab mix puppy. I love to play with other dogs, but Iâm super gentle! Iâm also good with kids and I havenât been introduced to cats yet, but my current caretakers think Iâll get along just fine with them. Just like all puppies, Iâm still learning the ropes and need help with my training â Iâm doing well with potty-training by using pee pads and doing great with my leash training, but still working on a few kinks with my manners (what puppy isnât?!). Iâm pretty laidback so crate-training should be an easy learning curve. Iâm a puppy so just remember that Iâll require lot of attention, but I have a lot of love to give and canât wait to find my forever home. 

Want to adopt adorable Charlie D?  Fill out our online adoption application by visiting our website: http://www.friendswithfourpaws.org/adoption-form.html

**Please note that our dogs may be located in foster homes around NJ and the NYC area. It would be a great help to us if you can pick up your dog from transport, (which is located in Astoria) or foster home.**

**PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR INQUIRY** We put a lot of time and energy into processing our adoptions to find our babies the best fit home for them.  Please do not submit an inquiry if you are not serious about adopting.  We are so excited to work with you to find you a new forever friend, and appreciate you working with us.  For immediate consideration, please attach your application to the initial inquiry to help us expedite the process.

Our adoption fee is $475. This includes their spay/neuter surgery, full (age appropriate) vaccinations, microchip insertion and registration, deworming, heartworm testing and prevention, flea and tick prevention and travel expenses.

All of our dogs are rescued from local shelters and the general public. Each dog is then placed in a foster home where he/she is kept for a minimum of 2 weeks for quarantine, to ensure if the dog gets sick it can receive proper treatment. After the 2 week quarantine time they are spayed/neutered and fully vetted. They are then placed on the website. We have foster homes in the NJ/NY area waiting to receive their fosters. Once an animal has received an application or there's an adopter interested, we make arrangements with the waiting foster to pick the animal up from transport. If a dog is already in foster care in NYC/NJ, an adopter will be put in touch with the foster home once an application is being processed.

Thank you in advance for your patience with our process and for making adoption YOUR option!
name: Charlie -adoption pending

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Toby! Toby is a 2 year old Lab/Shepherd mix who weighs 45 pounds. He comes into rescue from Texas where he hasnât had a very good life. We are so glad that heâs a Rescue Dogs Rock boy now and we will make sure he has only the best life ever from here on out! Toby is a really adorable boy and is very friendly and sweet! He is wonderful around people of all ages and other dogs of all sizes! He is not one bit aggressive and is so very friendly towards kids and people in general. He is a big playful dog who loves to run around and play. He jumps on you with happiness and is a smart boy who almost has the hang of house training! He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. He cant wait to meet the special someone who can love and spoil him unconditionally for the rest of his days! He is going to make an amazing addition to the lucky one that gets to adopt him. If you would like to make Toby the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Toby

description:
Hello, I'm Lune.  My original name in Thai is "Lung" which means uncle.  I was born on the streets of North Thailand, where a mean man on a motorbike ran over my leg when I was a baby, so one of my legs looks a little funny, but I get around just fine.  I play, run, jump, and do everything that normal doggos do. 

I arrived in NYC at the end of September 2018, and now it's almost the middle of December, and still nobody wants me.  I think it's because my leg looks weird, but I wish people didn't judge me for that.  If you come and meet me, you'll see I'm a really nice boy and I love people. I live with a pack of dogs at a sitter right now and I play with them and sleep with them and I get along well with most dogs.  I love my food and treats and to lay on a soft dog bed.  I don't ask for much. 

Won't you come and meet me and see for yourself?  I promise my leg isn't a bad thing...I won't cause you any problems and will be a good boy.  

I can't wait to meet you!  

Lune: 
*35 lbs, 2 years old
*Gets along well with most dogs, needs a couple of days to get used to new ones, but lives in a pack now and all is well.  
*Old fracture in his leg causes him to hold his leg up--since arriving in NYC, he actually uses his leg while playing, as he is growing stronger and doesn't feel the need to hold it up all the time.  It doesn't slow him down AT ALL. 
*Good with cats, children, and all humans. 
*Very affectionate and grateful
*Email us at FurRealNYC@gmail.com for more info

Videos of Lune (and we have many more--just ask and we will share them with you):
https://www.amazon.com/photos/share/E3bmyyP5rsVfyp5i1QittBhDezbHzzcu0fLRvD9bzVT
name: Lune

description:
**This is a crosspost for another rescue. Perdido is not located at For the Love of Dogs Rescue. Please contact Nancy 203-249-8998 - nkoury@sbcglobal.net**

?Perdido, or affectionally known as Perdy for short!!  Is a super sweet and active heinz 57.. possibly boxer mix around 2 or 3 years old who absolutely loves swimming and spending time with doggies friends and neighbors! Just look at those eyes... they are so loving and soulful.. wanting for an endearing home to call his own!  Perdy has a beautiful fawn coat with black markings. Don't let his little grey muzzle fool you! Perdy is a young and fresh dog who loves the outdoors. Hikes, long walks or a trip to the pond.. whatever it is Perdy will follow you into any adventure. He craves partnership in both human and canine form!

Perdy has had quite a bit of moving around the past few years .. he was originally sent to a Connecticut shelter from Puerto Rico last year by an older woman who was dying and wanted to assure him a good life. After spending some time in the shelter, Perdy was then adopted by a well meaning family in August 2017. Life happened and the family unfortunately experienced a divorce which greatly changed the dynamic of of the household.

Currently, Perdy is living on a three hundred acre land trust but has been desperately lonely. His owner works long hours, and the children stay there less than ten days a month. Perdy spends hours alone on a tie out, as he has taken to running up the road and waiting quietly outside a neighbors home that has two dogs just to get some company. Perdy so deserves a more active and at home lifestyle with lots of love pouring all around him! The current owner has tried but feels he cannot give Perdy what he needs.

I believe Perdy would do great in a home with other dogs and a family that can really love, claim, and bond with him!
I, Nancy, am helping the owner find a home as I've logged in many hours with this sweet dog over the last year at the land trust. He does great with my dogs and stays with us whenever we are there. He just needs a pack home! We would love to take him but unfortunately our hands are full currently :( 

He's neutered and up on all his vaccinations, healthy with lots of sweet happy energy! I'm praying to find him a happy, forever home-his dying owners wish as well!!!

Contact Nancy to meet Perdy!! 203-249-8998 - nkoury@sbcglobal.net
name: Perdido - Crosspost

description:
I'm eligible for the SPCA of Westchester's Home for the Holidays foster program. Invite me to stay in your home this holiday season. Foster period begins on December 23rd!  Email shelter@spca914.org for more info. 

This 5 year old brindle beauty is an all-around fantastic girl. She's friendly and snuggly, playful and curious, and every now and then she lives up to her name and snorts like a pig :) Piggy is selective with her friends but does like some dogs. To learn more about Piggy, come meet her or e-mail shelter@spca194.org.

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.
name: Piggie - In Foster

description: This 8 year old girl is Dallas. Dallas was surrendered with another dog when her owners could no longer care for her. She is a good girl and since she is a bit older she is very laid back and calm. This senior cutie deserves her forever, a place and family to love.
name: Dallas

description:
Holly is a stunning, 6 year old Husky / Alaskan Malamute mix. This precious girl weighed only 54lbs when she arrived to NY and is now at a healthy weight of 75lbs.

Goofy and loving, it is hard not to instantly fall for this girl. With her amazing looks and thick, soft coat, Holly is just delicious to snuggle with. She ADORES her people and enjoys nothing more than getting and giving plenty of hugs and kisses to those she loves. Nighttime snuggles are Hollyâs absolute favorite, and she climbs onto her foster momâs bed and nuzzles her with her furry sweet face. Once snuggle time is over, Holly is content to hop onto her doggie bed and catch some zzzâs.

Holly is the ultimate walking/hiking companion and enjoys daily walks with her foster mom. This darling is a pleasure to walk and has wonderful leash walking skills. After a walk or hike, there is no better relaxation buddy than Holly, who will get belly rubs for a few minutes and then curl up near her foster mom while she works.

Eager to please, Holly is bright and a very quick learner. She is house trained, and knows âsitâ, âdownâ, âstayâ and how to give high-fives with one or both paws.

Although her foster family has been working on this, and Holly has improved greatly, she doesnât always love to share her toys and food, so she would do best in a home without young children. Holly would also do best with a family where she is the only dog in the home.

Holly was a wonderful mother to her nine beautiful babies, and it is now this girlâs turn to be someoneâs baby. This sweetheart promises to give you as much love as you give her, if not more!




Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (www.anewchancear.org).  We are an all volunteer group, so after submitting your application, if you don't hear back from us within a few days, please e-mail us at adoption@anewchancear.org.  Be sure to read about the adoption process (http://www.anewchancear.org/adoption_process.php) on our website, so you'll know what to expect and fill out all fields on the adoption application (http://www.anewchancear.org/adoption_application.html)or we won't be able to process it.

As you can imagine, we are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (http://www.anewchancear.org/faq.php) and resources for.  We do not have a shelter facility and we provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering, and microchipping before transporting our dogs.  Then, we provide whatever follow up care is necessary while they are in foster care.  All of this is very expensive and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you.  We do not receive funding from  private foundations or government sources, so if you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (http://www.anewchancear.org/donate.php).  It is only through your kindness and that of supporters like you that we are  "changing lives...one tail at a time" by providing our dogs with "A New Chance."  (www.anewchancear.org)

Thanks so much.
name: Holly

description:
Hi there, my name is Pluto. I was brought to the shelter after my mommy passed away. I'm a 5 year old (estimate) male Chihuahua. I would prefer a home without small kids. I get very attached to my adult humans and would love to be with someone who is home a lot. I walk great on leash and am just a very loving and affection boy. So what are you waiting for? Come adopt me!

Prospective Adopter, please complete an adoption application available on our website nbanimalrescue.org and email it to adopt@nbanimalrescue.org. Upon receipt, an Adoption Specialist will contact you to schedule an appointment. We are a volunteer organization, so an appointment to visit the rescue is a necessity.
name: Pluto

description:
Buck is a super handsome, super sweet Lab/Terrier mix around a year and a half old. Buck came to our rescue along with his sister, Goldie, who has since been adopted. Since then, heâs been a pretty timid pup and the kennel is a pretty scary place for him. Heâs far happier when heâs out walking with his best volunteer pals, but heâs still shy meeting new people. Perhaps heâd feel more secure with a doggie companion, but weâre sure he would benefit from a quieter environment and some one on one attention to help bolster his confidence.

If youâd like to give Buck a rest from the stresses of kennel life, and help mold him into the best doggie he can be, please consider fostering or adopting Buck. You can fill out an application at ehrdogs.org and be sure to mention his nameâ¦..BUCK LONESTAR!!!
name: Buck Lonestar

description:
Sweet and affectionate Gypsy

She's a fun lovin' gal...ready to start a new chapter in life with a forever family. Come meet sweet Gypsy today!

If you have children in the family, please bring them in for a visit --it's the best way see if the dog would be a good fit for your family. Adoption applications are only processed after you visit the shelter and meet the dog in person and speak with one of our adoption counselors. The shelter is open Wednesday thru Friday from 1 to 7pm and Saturday from noon to 5pm. Please visit www.faithfulfriends.us/ad
option-process for more information. Email adoptadog@faithfulfriends.us with any questions.
name: Gypsy

description: 18 Dec 2018: Francis was found chained to an abandoned trailer. This sweet guy is about 2 to 3 years old and is in need of some serious TLC. He is dog friendly and amazingly sweet. Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Francis

breeds: Black Labrador Retriever, Black and Tan Coonhound
description:
A very pregnant dog was found and brought to a vet's office where she gave birth to 8 beautiful puppies.  Their Mom is Sadie Grace who is also available for adoption.  They have all had excellent care and now it is time for everyone to leave the vet's office and find their new families.  There are 4 males (Bombay, Jameson, Marlin & Skittles)  and 4 females (Dahlia, Marigold, Noelle & Tulip).  They are all either black and tan or all black.  These siblings are just about 8 weeks old and 10-12 pounds.  Please help Bombay find the loving home he deserves.

***You must provide a current vet reference***

If you are interested in adopting, we encourage you to please submit an application on our website today so that we can try and process and pre-approve any potential adopters prior to our next adoption event.

PLEASE USE THIS LINK TO SUBMIT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION. WE ONLY ACCEPT ADOPTION APPLICATIONS THROUGH OUR WEBSITE. ANY OTHERS WILL NOT BE PROCESSED.
Application link here: http://www.oscaranimalrescue.org/oscar-1-application.html

Adoption Process:
1.Fill out an application
2.Meet & Greet
3.Adoption contract & adoption fee
Bombay's adoption fee is $400 each. For puppies that have not been fixed (due to being too young) we charge $400 with the condition that when they are fixed $50 is refunded. This covers all age-appropriate shots, vetting & microchipping.

**If you are coming to an adoption event to see a certain dog/cat, please email ahead of time to make sure that dog/cat will be there that day. Please email 1-2 days before the event, as some animals are placed during the week and our list is constantly changing.
For a list of upcoming pet adoption events go to: www.OscarAnimalRescue.org

One Step Closer Animal Rescue is a 501c3 non-profit organization. Donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE to the extent allowed by law. If you would like to make a donation to help us rescue more animals please send donations to PO Box 248, Sparta, NJ 07871. Please make your check payable to O.S.C.A.R.. Thank you for helping us save as many lives as we can.

Don't forget to "Like Us" on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/pages/One-Step-Closer-Animal-Rescue-OSCAR/462492563811538
name: Bombay - available 12/21

description:
This petite little girl is as sweet as they come. About a year to 2 old, loves nothing more than giving kisses. She's only about 12 pounds. No info on breed...looks like a chiweenie. Spayed, up to date on vaccines and microchipped.
Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Chloe

description:
Brady says âhiâ!

This is what Bradyâs foster family has to say about himâ¦.âBrady is a friendly, fun puppy who will give you puppy kisses.  He is playfulâ¦.he likes to chase balls and play with other dogs.  Brady will carry a big chew toy around and he is so proud of himself when he does! haha!  Brady also likes to be with you and will fall asleep on you.  He is so cute when  he runs, he actually leaps! When our cat hisses at him, he doesnât know what to do, so he lays down!!  Brady is super fun!â

Brady is about 12-14 weeks old.  He is a handsome pup with a rusty color coat with white on his chest and paws. Brady and his brothers, Bennie & Bernie were rescued from a high kill shelter in NC.  They are now in foster homes in NJ enjoying food, toys, treats and comfy beds.

We are sure when you meet Brady, he will steal your heart!If you have a furever home for this pet, please e-mail Furever Home Dog Rescue at FureverHomeDogRescue@gmail.com and request an adoption application. 

Please note we do not adopt puppies/dogs to homes where they will be alone all day. 

The breed and age of this pet is listed as is our best guess.  We have no background info on who the mom and dad are.

We do not have a shelter facility you can visit.  Our volunteers foster the dogs and pups in their homes once they have been vetted and transported here to NJ.

Please read our homepage www.fhdr.petfinder.com to read how the adoption process works. And, please visit Furever Home Dog Rescue's homepage www.FureverHomeDogRescue.com to see some of our many reviews.  Thank you!
name: Brady-Adopted

description:
NYC Area -- Rescued from South Korea, Beksul is a smart and friendly Poodle mix. At 4 years old and weighing approximately 12 pounds, Beksul is currently being fostered in NYC and is looking for her forever home! Please consider adopting her!

You can meet Beksul this SATURDAY or SUNDAY at our SANTA PAWS EVENTS
(If she is not adopted at Saturdayâs event, she will be there Sunday)

Saturday, Dec 22nd, 2018

BUSHWICK BARK
181 Irving Ave
Brooklyn, NY

12PM-4PM
-----------

Sunday, Dec 23rd, 2018

WESPAW PETS
44-05 Queens Blvd
Sunnyside, NY

12PM-4PM

PLEASE NOTE: You need to attend the OUTDOOR ADOPTION EVENT in order to meet this dog and bring your printed application. Please come to the event should you have any questions or email us at info@koreank9rescue.org. Thank you!

Fill out an online application here: http://bit.ly/2D6f5Zy
You must be 24 years of age or older to adopt.
**If this dog is listed here that means s/he is STILL available**

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING TO THE ADOPTION EVENT:
-a printed copy of your completed online application
-all human residents in your household
We require a completed application, reference check, & home check. An adoption fee applies. All dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, and microchipped. Due to the volume of emails received we are unable to answer specific questions via email. Thank you!

BE ADVISED: Korean K9 Rescue does local adoptions within a 30-mile radius of Brooklyn, New York. Beyond this distance, adoptions are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact us in advance to confirm if you are eligible/if the specific dog can be adopted outside of radius.

After selecting who we feel is the best fit for the dog, we notify the potential adopter to discuss the next steps for approval. That might be the same evening or in the days that follow the event. Thank you for your support and patience!

We believe people adopt rescue animals because even though there can be challenges, it is an extremely rewarding experience. As an adopter of a rescue animal, you are willing to accept the imperfections and baggage of an animalâs past and will work with them, train them, and love them for all that they are. Our adopted dogs who have gone to patient, loving families have had some incredible transformations, and we hope to provide each and every one of our rescues with this opportunity for a new life. We absolutely love seeing photos of our alums relaxed and smiling in their new adoptive homes, and we hope that you will consider adopting one of our pups and give them the opportunity to grow and find happiness with you.

Follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/KoreanK9Rescue/
Instagram: @koreank9rescue
For more information, please visit http://www.koreank9rescue.org
name: Beksul

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.
Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully. Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.

This adorable Pyr mix girl is Angel. She is a sweetheart who loves other dogs, is friendly with kids and her favorite thing to do is play in the kiddie pool with her dog pals! Angel is doing great in her foster home - she is learning housebreaking, and sleeps through the night in her crate. She loves to play, and then take big naps with her new friends. Her other favorite things are to chase squirrels and play 'bitey face' with her foster brother :) Angel walks well on a leash, and enjoys her walks whether with other dogs or by herself. Her foster mom says Angel is so very sweet and will grow up to be a really nice girl!
name: Angel in NJ

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption at ACCT Philly!!! DASH - A40304168 Dash is one of those adorable pups who just has sooo much energy - he doesn't know what to do with it all! Dash doesn't get along very well with other dogs, so he'll need a family committed to keeping him as their one and only, and helping him deal with his anxiety around dogs. Will you be the one to give Dash his forever home? Intake Type: Stray Weight: 43lbs Medical Observation: NSF, BAR Behavior Observation: (Per Finder 12/04) "Behavior 8. Finders opinion of animals behavior: Active 9. Describe any concerning behavior issues: None 10. Bitten a person or animal in the last 10 days (If yes, bite memo/hold and behavior template): Yes, bitten another dog 11. Has the animal ever bit anyone: Yes 12. How is dog on a leash: Pulls on a leash 13. Describe interactions with children (ages): Good with small children 14. Describe interaction with large/small dogs and cats: Fights other dogs" Dog Meets: https://youtu.be/L-6_RJCRbT4 This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Dash

description:
ZEPPLIN is so stinkin cute - we are loving him big time! 
He was adopted from us many many years ago when he was just a pup and he's back with us as his family could no longer care for him. ZEPPLIN is around 7 years young and he is trained / mellow / seems dog friendly from afar / eager for treats / loving / HANDSOME!!!!!!!

Come get him!!!!!!!!!!!!


All pets at this shelter are up-to-date on shots and will be altered and micro-chipped upon adoption.  Please visit our shelter to meet the many adorable orphans that are available for adoption.  When inquiring about a specific animal you saw on this website, please include the ID number associated with the animal. We are open 7 days a week from 12pm-5: 30pm Monday thru Friday and 12pm-5:00 Saturday & Sunday. For information and/or directions call 732-922-0100 or email TintonFallsahs@aol.com. There is an adoption fee required.  The Society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, and cash.

                               IMPORTANT
 As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency.  Homeowners must show proof of ownership; a valid lease that states "pets ok" is required for renters before an adoption can be approved. If you do not have a lease with your landlord you will need a notarized letter.
name: Zepplin

description: TUNDRA (aka JACKSON, fka KING ARTHUR), 2 years old, 90 lbs, Stroudsburg PA Tundra is available for adoption! Tundra is up to date on shots, neutered and microchipped. If you would like to meet this handsome boy, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414 or amsterdog@gmail.com. You can also fill out our online application to get the process started: http://amsterdog.org/adoptionfoster-application/ Comments from Tundraâs foster mom: Jackson AKA Tundra AKA Houdini. He is about a year old American Bulldog, male, neutered. He is a fantastic dog with very good manners, very good obedience, and walks perfectly on a leash. He is super lovable and very social. He would like to be the only dog in the house. He is a dog that would benefit from being with the person that could take him everywhere with them. He does not like to be left alone and has separation anxiety. We are working on that the best that we can. He loves to play with his toys and loves to go in the car. Basically he will love anything that a person will do with him. ACC volunteer writes: Hear ye, hear ye! You are now in the presence of legend. Not of the sword but of the wholesome heart, and more than worthy to wear the crown. Of course I'd heard the tale of this tail long before I met him. "A magnificent boy just arrived," "Have you met Mr. Gorgeous yet?" and, lastly, "OMG...did you walk King Arthur?" So, when I spotted a royally adorable face enjoying green grass and sun with a fellow volunteer, instantly I recognized greatness. Now, much like his namesake, our King isn't immediately aware of his power. He is bashful initially, meeting compliments with a duck of the head, and though unable to fight his love for the lap, he hesitates before climbing on. But of course destiny eventually overtakes him and our King's confidence slowly unfolds. Manifesting in ball chases and kisses, happy jumps and silly smiles, and manners that would hold up in Court. King Arthur is still more of a prince at just ca 2 years old, so might do best with an active, experienced, and patient family, one who'll be more than happy to dutifully serve and always remind him of his greatness. "Hear ye, hear ye!" You are now in the presence of legend. And if you're very lucky you'll earn a place at his table. Possibly round, and always forever. King Arthur is waiting for you to make him your own!
name: TUNDRA

description:
*** check out video of handsome Joey and his rescuer/foster dad! ***

Joey is an adorable 2-year old, tri-pod male who is neutered and weighs 16 pounds. 

Joey was brought in by the local police after been hit by a car on a busy road. He was underweight and in very bad shape. Upon veterinary examination it was found that the nerves to his right front leg were severed by the impact and he had no sensation nor movement in the leg. He stayed in the clinic for a month and a half. His leg was amputated and he recovered well. Don't tell Joey he only has three legs, he'll never know!  He's active with the other foster dogs in the home and most times runs faster than them!  (Go Joey!)   Joey gets along with all, canines and human - a real true sweetheart!   

Email Patricia at:  patricia.strayfromtheheart@gmail.com
name: Joey

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Precious Pongo is a 10 month old Pit mix who comes into rescue from Texas. Pongo found himself critically injured, alone and scared at a high kill shelter. His front left foot had been completely degloved. His bones were exposed and we donât know what happened to this poor sweet boy but we were not about to let him sit in the shelter for one more second. We got him immediately to our vet partner where he will now get all the urgent medical care he needs. Despite the trauma and suffering that Pongo has endured he is the sweetest boy. He is very friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. We would love to have a forever family waiting for Pongo when he is ready to travel North! He is a big ball of puppy love and will make a fabulous addition to any home. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make this adorable boy the newest member of your family, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Pongo

description:
Roo is a 3 year old Pit Bull mix, full of energy and love. Sheâs curious about everything and loves attention. She is very playful with her sister and absolutely loves giving kisses to any person or dog who wants them. I always joke around saying her ball is her pacifier because she has it with her the majority of the day and can be found sleeping with one in her mouth.

Roo is always looking for love by strangers and dogs when we are walking around the city. Although she loves interacting with dogs outside of the dog park she has no interest in playing with them at the park because of her ball obsession. She also loves sleeping on the bed and loves to cuddle! She loves to curl up and be held at night and is a big fan of covers but sheâs also okay if you leave her on the couch.

Roo has lived with a small Chihuahua as I fostered one for a month and Roo seems to know her size with other dogs. She really wants to interact with cats as well when we pass them in the bodegas in NYC. She even knows which bodegas have them and stops and wags her tail watching and hoping they will one day come say hi. Sheâs good with every person sheâs met and loves kids as well but does try to jump and give kisses when sheâs overly excited.

Roo is NOT with 11th Hour Rescue but we are helping her owner with the rehoming process. If you'd like to meet Roo, please contact Lauren by email at lauren.wise@compass.com or by phone at 917-699-2380 - Roo is currently located in New York City.
name: XP Roo - NYC

description:
Note: Animal listings are updated on a weekly basis as needed to reflect any changes in information.
*** Interested in meeting our adoptable pets?  Visit our facility located at 302 2nd Street Cliffside Park, NJ 07010 (corner of Walker & 2nd) during normal adoption hours:        Monday -Sunday 12-5pm***  Wednesdays 12 - 7pm
Please call us if you are unable to visit during our normal adoption hours.  (201) 945-0649.     We are a 501(c) 3 non-profit volunteer based organization.
name: Judy

description:
Meet Keke our newest puppy arriving from Egypt Nov 29!  This beautiful little boy is a Canaan clearly mixed w/ Black Lab as are many of the Egyptian street dogs although there they are known as Baladis.  Only about 5mos and full of mischief, he will need doggy friends to match his puppy energy.  Please put in an app (to be copied from our dog app page and pasted into the email).

Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly adoption event info posted here)
Instagram: zanisfurryfriends 
Twitter: zanisff 

Please fill out an application at http://zanisfurryfriends.org and return to 
dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org 

Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Sundays and sometimes on Saturdays--please ask by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application by Friday so that we can be sure to be there. Otherwise we decide based on other variables. Usually we are in our foster homes so this is a bit more stressful and a slightly artificial environment but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes too.

Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer, and you can always donate!
name: Keko Egyptian Baladi

description:
Mike & Molly are an easy going bonded pair, who need to be adopted together.  They are pad trained, well behaved and get along fine with other small dogs.  Both are 8 years old; Mike is 12 lbs, and Molly is 9 lbs.  Adoption fee for both is $425.

  Please visit our website www.sherrysplacerescue.org to submit an adoption application.
name: Mike & Molly

description: Krypto is a fun loving, active fellow. He would make a great all-around family dog. If interested,  please call or text Gizela at 201-655-5059 for more information. Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days. Please contact us  to see if a particular animal will be at one of our events or whether an appointment can be arranged. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping. Angels For Animals Network adopts to loving, indoor homes. We DO NOT adopt to anyone under 21.  Please note that we DO NOT ship animals, and only adopt to the Tri-State area and some parts of Pennsylvania.  We prefer to keep our adoptions local, and strive to find the best homes for our rescued friends.  Once we review your application, we can better assess if a specific animal is well-suited for your home environment and lifestyle.
name: Krypto

description: Joey is almost a year old dachshund mix. He is neutered, microchipped, and up to date on shots. We would like for him to go to a home with another dog.  To inquire and get an applicAtion, email haar13@aol.com
name: Joey

description:
Coach is an amazing guy....about 13 years old, he arrived from Louisiana on September 9th where he had been in a shelter prior to the flood. He came to NJ to make room so the LA folks could help more victims of the flood. Don't let his age fool you, he can dance like the best of them after doing his business. He's a sweet guy, low maintenance couch potato who loves nothing more than sitting with his peeps. He's about 13 1/2 pounds. This guy deserves a nice warm bed to place his head in his golden years, and loving arms to surround him.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Coach

description:
Martina is a very sweet and lovable dog who used to live in a family with kids too. However she is very sensitive to the presence of other animals and cannot live with any other animal. Martina needs a quiet environment, a loving family with a home on a quiet area and possibly with a fenced yard where she can play and enjoy her people company. She is beautiful and super smart, receptive to training and a quick learner.
She is an active dog who loves to spend time outdoor but she doesn't miss a chance for snuggle time. We recommend a family who has some experience with dogs.
name: MARTINA

description:
ERIKA  She is 3 years old  60 pounds  Mixed Breed Female  Spayed

ERIKA found herself at the Brooklyn NYACC as a stray.  Her time was up and she was placed on the euthanisa list.  An amazing person stepped up to save her life and now she's ready to embark on the next phase...adoption!


ERIKA is good with all people and Loves strangers to say hello to her.  She seems to like other big dogs, gets overly excited with small dogs, and wants to chase cats and Squirrels on the Street. Introduction to other dogs should be very slow.
She is housetrained and likes to go for walks about 3-4 times a day.  She pulls some on the leash when she first goes outside until she reaches her spot to relieve herself.   She is not paper trained, and u have never placed her in a crate. 

My wish for ERIKA is to be placed with a fun, Loving, and energetic family that will include her in their daily lives.  She Loves being with her human, and has been great since the second day that I had her.  She Loves sitting beside me and will follow me around my home.  An affectionate and loving family would be ideal as she loves giving and getting hugs, kisses, belly rubs, and having  under her chin rubbed. Patience and observation would be ideal as i believe she has much more to offer, and her past is still unknown.

Erika is extremely smart and knows many commands.  She knows Sit, down, Wait, give me your paw, high five, give me a kiss, and lie down.  She Loves to play ball daily for about 15 -20 minutes. She will retrieve the ball and bring it back to your lap waiting for you to say Drop It.  

Erika can open a door if not closed properly, and also open the refrigerator.  When left alone for too long she helped herself to chicken fingers,  hot dogs, and mozzarella cheese.  She has the most adorable putty face when she thinks she is in trouble.

She does not like loud noises or loud barking dogs.  She is very sensitive to loud noises.

I absolutely Love Erika and wish that I could keep her without hesitation.  I, unfortunately, have loud barking little dogs.

NO SMALL ANIMALS.
name: Erika

description:
BEYOND URGENT: Maggie will be surrendered to a shelter this weekend (12/13) if no one adopts her. She is staying with the owner's father but the landlord has served a legal notice that the dog MUST VACATE THE PREMISES immediately. PLEASE HELP if you can.

Maggie's owner is forced to surrender this sweet gal because her daughter's asthma makes it impossible for her to live with any pets - this is a very sad situation for the family & for Maggie, who they love dearly. They are hoping to find someone wonderful who will love Maggie & make her a part of their family.

Maggie is a 10 year old Boxer/Hound mix who is quiet as a mouse when in the house. This sweet girl simply wants to be around her family. She would ideally be the only pet in her new home. Maggie can walk for miles but also doesnât mind spending time lounging in the back yard and she will adjust to your speed as you walk together. Sheâs also a great running buddy (at least 3-4 miles) as long as the weather is not too hot. Maggie has been spayed & she is up to date on her vaccines.

Maggie is NOT with Eleventh Hour Rescue but we are helping her family with the rehoming process. She is currently living in Hamilton, NJ. If you would like to meet sweet Maggie, please contact Neil by email at gokhale.neil@gmail.com
name: XP Maggie - URGENT in Hamilton, NJ

description:
10/28/18


NEED FOSTER(S) 11/18!

CeeCee and Browny lived together in GA!! Their owner contacted us to help place them. They were clients of Dr Gibson in GA. When we ask for donation for hw and spay neuter and of course the lady said never mind I will put them on swap and shop. We were horrified!! We got them now and they are safe!! They are so sweet, we can't imagine the lady wanted to get rid of them. 
CeeCee is a 2 yrs old chihuahua she has had shots and worming and is heart worm positive. ( PINK COLLAR)

Browny is a 6 yrs old chihuahua male has had shots and worming and is heart worm negative. (BLACK COLLAR) 

Both are very sweet and loves everybody and gets along good with other dogs.
CeeCee is the first 2 pictures with pink collar and the smallest and Browny the last 2 pictures with black collar.

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: CeeCee Talbot-sweet baby!

description: Blizzard is such a sweet and calm, super loving dog. Blizzard is 4 to 6 years old and about 52 lbs of love. He is good with humans and dogs and cats. Such a gentle spirit, this boy is so much more handsome than in his photo and will steal your heart, for sure. A must meet. (Fostered in PA) (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there is clearly something wrong with your email!) Dog's Best Friend Adoption Center utilizes an adoption application and screening process. We require personal and vet references and a home check made prior to adopting one of our dogs. All of our dogs are companion animals that must be kept inside the house with the rest of the family members. All of our dogs are temperament tested, well mannered, and know some basic commands ~ they are worked with daily, as someone is always here with them. All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats. Adoption donations range from $250 to $450, depending on breed, age, size, vetting, and training of the dog (some pure bred and tiny dog fees are higher). This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care. Dog's Best Friend dogs truly make wonderful family pets. Please  email us for an application. (If you email us and do not hear back from us within 24 hours, please try again, as we most likely did not receive your email!) (Also note that many of our dogs are fostered just across the border into PA)
name: Blizzard (Sweet and Calm)

description:
Are you looking for a dog to have fun with? Meet Brando! Brando is a neutered 4 year old cattle dog mix. He has a striking speckled coat of white and chocolate and weighs about 60 pounds. He loves people and after a walk, jog, swim or hike he would be content to snuggle on the couch. He knows how to play and also likes to show affection. 

He was an absolute champion going through heartworm treatment and the vetâs office fell in love with the big goofball. He has been very tolerant of all vetting. He also is quick to jump in the bath tub and would probably enjoy a soak wherever he can find it. 

He is crate trained, house trained, enjoys the car, and LOVES toys!! Bones, squeak toys, puzzles...you name it he wants to play with it. 
 		
Brando would do best as an only pet and prefers the company of humans. No cats for Brando! His size and energy would be best in a house with older children and adults. He is eager to learn basic obedience with his new family. 

Brando is located in Perkasie, PA. For questions, please contact 		hannah.case@gmail.com 

Brando is up to date on vetting, micro-chipped, and ready to find his family. 

COMPLETE AN APPLICATION
http://www.acdra.org/#!adoption-application-/c21x6
name: Brando

description: This precious little girl will have you at hello. Her adorable face and sweet demeanor will leave you wanting more. Although she may be shy with introductions she pops right out of that shell if you give her a toy. If you want to see her eyes light up, just toss a tennis ball. Once you give her that ball, she is yours for life. Callie was found as a stray, therefore we don't know much about her history. However, we see a bright future ahead of her if she goes home to the right family. This 5 year old unforgettable Pittie will do well in a calmer household where it's not very overwhelming. Once she gets comfortable with her new family and home, Callie will be able to blossom and show her true colors. We always recommend gradual positive socialization with dogs like Callie. Even though she'll need the socialization, it should be on her terms and when she's ready. We have no doubt she'll amaze you so don't let Callie slip through your fingers.
name: Callie

description: This sweet girl had a terrible past where she was shot in the face and thrown over a fence in Georgia.  This girl now has a name, Asta, and she's only 32lbs at 2 years old. Shell be spayed, up to date on shots, and microchipped prior to adoption. This girl wants a fresh new start away from the life she once knew. Email haar13@aol.com for an application
name: Asta

description:
Champion is 12 years young and wound up at the shelter last month when his family lost their home and he in turn lost his. Heâs a big dog maybe 75 lbs.  he lived with children but was never socialized so he would need to be the only dog as he is not dog friendly. Heâs great with people easy to walk.  Loves treats and enjoys going out with volunteers. 
Heâs almost all white with a few medium brown patches on his back.  He would love to spend his golden years with a person looking for a companion for short walks and tv watching.
Here is what a volunteer had to say about Champion 
âPlease consider adopting Champion. He is such a NICE dog---I fell in love with him within seconds of meeting him because he is that lovable. Bonds easily with you--all you have to do is pet him and he's your best friend. He does NOT act like he is 12 years old (I thought for sure there was some miscommunication when they told me he was 12 because he seemed more like 6-7 years old). Champion is very active for a senior and I believe he has a good amount of quality years left to love someone.â
name: Champion

description: This mature lady is a winner! Hildegard is SO sweet, SO gentle, SO calm, and so easy on the leash. She was found stray in Burlington, and surely she was somebody's pet. No one has come to claim her though so she is ready to move on to the next phase of her life. Hildegard needs to lose a few pounds. That extra weight is tough on her mature hips. She has a growth on her right side that will need to be addressed as well. But, she is such a great girl, and she deserves to spend her golden years in a quiet, safe, loving home. Please ask to meet Hildegard when you visit the shelter. She will steal your heart!
name: Hildegard

description:
Everett is a young male Akita who has come into rescue after being picked up as a stray in horrid condition and taken to the Philadelphia Animal Control. Everett is a big handsome boy who is approximately 18 months old. He would do well in a home with an owner that is breed experienced and can be a leader in this young male's life. Everett takes time to bond and upon meeting him he will be aloof at first however once a trusting bond is formed he will be a great companion. It is possible Everett can go to a home with the right female dog after a successful meet and greet. 

Are you interested in Everett? Please go to www.bigeastakitarescue.org and put in an adoption application online for him!
name: Everett

description:
Charlotte is an adorable 6-years young Chi mix gal coming to us from a shelter in Georgia in search of her forever family. She is a tiny mite at only 4lbs and will be spayed once she arrives in NYC. Perfect pocket-sized girl with a big, lovable personality who is great with everyone and everything she meets!

Apply now for precious little Charlotte and get ready for non-stop fun and snuggles.

Charlotte is available for adoption through in Our Hands Rescue. If interested in meeting her, please fill out an application on inourhandsrescue.org. Please DO NOT send an email through Petfinder, your application will be processed before the following Saturday's event.
name: Charlotte

description:
UPDATE 9/2018: At the age of 6, Nancy has recently been diagnosed with glaucoma and she needs eyedrops on a daily basis to help control her condition. We would love for her to be in a foster (or forever) home where her condition could be best managed. Nancy would do best in an adult-only household. She can be a little picky about her doggie friends, but is okay with some dogs. EHR's wish is that someone would take Nancy into their home as foster or forever pup & help her keep what is left of her eyesight.

Nancy is a scruffy little girl with great big ears and a thirst for adventure! She is super easy on leash and loves going for walks and exploring the great outdoors. She takes treats gently and knows some basic commands. But like many terriers, she has a strong personality and would do best with an experienced owner.

Here's what one of her kennel buddies said about Nancy: She got in and rode extremely well in the car. On the walk itself, she was initially so excited to be out that she pulled in different directions, but because she is so light it was very easy to manage. She settled down quickly, however, and was great on the leash for the rest of the walk. She loves to stop and smell everything like a typical terrier but kept the pace and walked well.

Aside from barking at one random couple walking by, she was pretty non-reactive to people and other dogs. When we stopped for our break she took treats well and demonstrated that she knows "sit".

If youâd be interested in fostering or adopting Nancy, please fill out an application online and be sure to mention her nameâ¦.NANCY!!
name: Nancy Steele

description:
We rescued Cody and Andy from their home where they had been left behind after their dad died and their mom tried to commit suicide.  They had been unintentionally neglected for years due to physical and mental illness of their parents.  

Cody is 16.5 years old.  Andy is 17.5 years old.  They are pure breed Havanese.  

They must be adopted together.  We are open to a forever foster situation for these boys as well.  

Cody and Andy are so sweet and easy to care for.  They will need someone that understands senior dogs and loves them tremendously.  We would love for them to have a fenced in back yard so that they have the ability to enjoy the outdoors without having to be walked.  

The boys are in pretty good health given their age and what they have been through.  Cody has some hearing and visual impairment and Andy has arthritis.  

Metabolically they are in fine shape, and they eat like horses!  

Cody and Andy are wee wee pad trained and also do their business outside.  

To meet these adorable senior lads:

Phone: 917-864-2443
Email: fofdogrescue@yahoo.com
name: Cody

description:
Tammy is a very affectionate, pretty hound mix.  She is 7 years old and came into our rescue when her owner could no longer care for her. Tammy is spayed and up to date on her shots.  This sweetheart gets along well with the dogs and cats in her foster home.  She would enjoy a home with older kids. 

Tammy loves people, although she may take a little longer to warm up to men, She is housebroken and well past the chewing stage, Tammy loves to go for walks and can be squirrel crazy like a typical hound. She is a fun pup to cuddle up and hang out with.  Are you ready to share your life with a special girl? Tammy could be the one!

If you would like to meet TAMMY, or for more information, please email PetRescueOfMercer@gmail.com

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEB SITE to view our adoption policies and/or complete an online, non-binding adoption application. www.petrescueofmercer.org
name: TAMMY

description: Penny is a young gal who is just so sweet. Gets along with other dogs. She will be fixed, up to date on shots, and microchipped. Email haar13@aol.com to inquire
name: Penny

description:
Echo is a 4 year old Boston/Pitty mix. Echo is currently located in a foster home in South River N J.Â She is spayed, microchipped, housebroken, & fully vetted. She loves humans & is a great companion.Â  Loves sleeping close to someone on the couch or in bed at night cuddled with her guardian & is always by our side. But she is unpredictable with other dogs. She gets jealous of other dogs & does not control herself in situations that bring on excitement. So she really needs to be the only pet in a home. She also has separation anxiety which means she needs a place where she feels comfortable when left alone. A crate is too confining although she has learned to eat her meals calmly in one & she cannot be left locked in a room by herself. We have found that a large kennel type setting with her own doggie bed works for her. We have one set up in the basement for her when we go out & she is ok with that. We are willing to work with someone in all aspects of her transition who thinks they can give her the home she needs. Having to keep her muzzled all the time while around our other dogs is not what we want for her. A family or person who is home most of the time would be so much more fitting. Someone who understands her needs & is willing to give her the attention she craves would be far better for her. 

If you are interested in adopting this gorgeous baby, please fill out an application on the following link:  

www.carenj.com/adoption-application
name: Echo

description: Huguenot is a cool dude. He is a mellow guy but spontaneously likes to cut the rug at times too. He's kind of a goof ball. Happy to lay at your feet or take a nice stroll. He's just a good buddy to have around. He is a stunning blue and white and is about a year old.  Please come meet him today and cheer him up. He gets a bit depressed in the pound. Who wouldn't??  Come see the twinkle in his eye when he looks up and see's that he has company. He is adorable !! Please, please come meet him. He is still in the kennel and I have no idea why. He longs for a family and a home to call his own. He's been in lock down way too long and he did nothing wrong.
name: Hueguenot

description:
Mystic is between two and three years old and about 55 lbs.  sheâs always happy to have a visitor, especially if you bring her a stuffed toy to play with. Sheâs shy but friendly at the same time. 
She needs someone who has patience and can give her the love she deserves. She cringes when you go to pet her,leading us to believe her former owners were not so good with her. Please consider Mystic. She likes some other dogs but they have to meet first of course
name: Mystic

description:
Buddy is a friendly little guy who loves to be around people. He's been great with all of the fosters he's met and likes to play. Vets estimate Buddy to be about a year old. He's been neutered, microchipped and is up to date on vaccines.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Buddy

description:
Poppy is a 1.5 year old, female, Pit Mix that was found emaciated, playing on the train tracks with her sister, Penny. Poppy is shy at first, but becomes very outgoing quickly and is a force to be reckoned with as she throws herself at you for pets and 
attention. She is super lovey and melts into you when she cuddles.  

Poppy is house trained and crate trained. She is good with other dogs and learning to live with cats. She tries to play with cats, just like she plays with everything else!  She is spayed, microchipped, heartworm negative and up to date with vaccinations. 

If you would like to meet POPPY, or for more information, please email PetRescueOfMercer@gmail.com

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEB SITE to view our adoption policies and/or complete an online, non-binding adoption application. www.petrescueofmercer.org
name: POPPY

description: For more information about this animal or our adoption process please visit our website at SouthJerseyRegionalAnimalShelter.org/adopt
name: Dakota

description: These are the cutest pups! They will need homes at the first of the year, when they are 8 weeks old. All but the white faced one have short little stubby tails and they are all so sweet and friendly. Momma Jenny is a BC mix and just a wonderful young dog. These pups have shorter legs and rounder faces than mom and we think they will be in the 40 to 50 lb range, full grow (but are never sure). Just wonderful pups in need of wonderful homes. (Fostered in PA) (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there is clearly something wrong with your email!) Dog's Best Friend Adoption Center utilizes an adoption application and screening process. We require personal and vet references and a home check made prior to adopting one of our dogs. All of our dogs are companion animals that must be kept inside the house with the rest of the family members. All of our dogs are temperament tested, well mannered, and know some basic commands ~ they are worked with daily, as someone is always here with them. All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats. Adoption donations range from $250 to $450, depending on breed, age, size, vetting, and training of the dog (some pure bred and tiny dog fees are higher). This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care. Dog's Best Friend dogs truly make wonderful family pets. Please  email us for an application. (If you email us and do not hear back from us within 24 hours, please try again, as we most likely did not receive your email!) (Also note that many of our dogs are fostered just across the border into PA)
name: Jenny's Boys

description:
Alayka is a 2 year old beauty who was saved from San Antonio's highest kill shelter . We were just in time and brought her in safety at our vet .

This sweetheart was just skin over bones. She is still skinny but we are building her up slowly . She is already gorgeous . Can you imagine how she would look like in 3 months .

Alayka is very playful and likes other dogs. This baby needs a very welcoming home where they treat her for the precious gem she is .

You will receive lots of love in return.

Alayka is not cat tested yet .

This baby is located in Middle Island NY .

To become her new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application to find on our website www.a-teameliterecsuedogs.com or email us and we send you one
name: Alayka

description: Name: French Location: Albany NY Breed: Mixed Breed Approximate Age: 7 years Sex: Male Weight: 45 lbs Medical History: French is neutered, up to date on vaccines, up to date on heartworm meds and microchipped. ?Other Dogs: No ? ?Cats: Yes ? ?House-trained: Yes ? ?? Crate-trained: No ? ?Kids: Yes (14+ years old) ? Sweet French - NYC ACC survivor, has been with his loving foster since December 2017. Due to serious health issues, French's foster mom can no longer care for this sweet boy. She tells us he is an ABSOLUTE sweetheart and very intelligent, and it is her fervent wish that someone steps up to care for him, as she is increasingly unable to do. French is a very affectionate pup, has lots of energy, house trained, does not like to be crated. Does well when home alone. Knows commands - sit/down/come/leave it/get the ball/touch, working on heel, and a great leash walker. NOT dog reactive with proper distance when walking. French lives with multiple cats and is very gentle with them. Children 14 years and up. Frenchâs Videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c8Yc4SWf4mc&app=desktop https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWjMp27VK5E&app=desktop https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0-vqCeoS-X4&app=desktop https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L1Qy0rP2GdU&app=desktop https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ih_6EEAYr88&app=desktop If you would like to meet French and / or are interested in adopting / fostering him, please contact us at amsterdog@gmail.com or 917-689-8414. To get the process started, please also fill out our online application. Link to our Application: http://amsterdog.org/adoptionfoster-application/
name: FRENCH

description:
See description under the listing for Audi and Tesla vs this one listed as Tesla and Audi. 
Eve's Sanctuary does not have a public location to visit, although we do weekly adoption events in public locations on the UWS. If you are interested in a specific animal, please email info@evessanctuary.com with the name of the animal you are interested in written on the subject line. Please remember that ESAR requires a full complete application, an interview, and a home visit prior to final approval and placement of adopted animals. It may seem daunting at first, but to find true love its worth it, right? They aren't products on a shelf to buy, we love them like our own, and only want the best possible home for each and every one...thus the "hoops." Also, please trust our recommendations, we are skilled human furry freind matchmakers with many years of experience that has given us a unique and solid perspective. For these reasons we prefer adopters to be in NYC or the immediate area accessible by public transportation so we can work with you individually and educate you face to face!
Additionally, please understand that we are all volunteers, no salaries are paid, we have families and pets of our own, and we have full time jobs in addition to doing rescue work - so we may be (at times) slow-ish to get back to you. We promise we are doing our best as its in everyones best interest to place these darlings quickly, so we can save more. If you would like to expedite the process, and make us extra happy, please download our application from our website at: http://www.evessanctuary.org/Adoption.html , fill it out, and return it with your initial email inquiry. Be patient, be persistent, be polite, and we promise all will be well! ;-)
All animals come up to date on annual combo vaccs, rabies vaccs, heartworm tested negative, microchipped, and of course...spayed or neutered!
name: Tesla and Audi

description:
CONGRATULATIONS KATHLEEN!!! HOLLY will be coming home soon

HOLLY is a yorkie. Holly weighs 6.4 lbs and is 1yr old. Holly came from a deplorable hoarding situation with 12 other dogs. Holly is doing great now after several baths, worming, flea control and clean bedding, Holly wants to be in your lap and to share your bed. She is sweet and gives kisses. She is great with other dogs and cats. She is being pee pee pad trained and doing good. Holly is very appreciative of a loving lap and clean home. Holly is micro-chipped, spayed, wormed, current on vaccines, heartworm negative and on flea control. If you can continue to give her the life she deserves please go to our adoption application website below and complete the application. Holly is still in KY waiting for the next transport leaving Nov. 30 and arriving Dec 1st.

ADOPTION FEE $600 (Transport is included)

For adoption information and application please visit our website directly.

https://kindnessfork-9srescue.yolasite.com

Calling hours are Monday through Friday 9 am to 5 pm.  Closed Sunday & holiday's
name: HOLLY 6.4 LBS ADOPTED

description:
These are Daisy and Tommy, both about 8 years old. They have lived with each for about 6 years and love playing together in the house and in the yard. Other dogs sometimes visit them and they all get along fine.

Ideally, they should be adopted together, since they've lived with each other for years, but each could probably get along with any other dog if they were adopted separately.

They know plenty of commands and recently visited the vet, so they are up to date on all inoculations and are spayed and neutered. Daisy is microchipped.

They don't need long walks, so, if you like to just sit at home, they are fine. As long as they have a fenced-in back yard, they are happy. They are glad to wait for you at home while you are at work, too.

They both love rawhide and like to settle down for a good chew after eating their bowls of food.

Daisy is the larger one and is a mix of two Coonhound breeds (Redbone Coonhound and Black-and-Tan Coonhound). She's extremely friendly and loves everyone she meets. She loves food and will counter-surf if the opportunity presents itself. She virtually never barks--just part of her personality.

Tommy is a Treeing Walker Coonhound and loves running in the back yard and barking at whatever he sees, whether it's deer, wild turkeys, or cats walking through the yard.

They'd love to stay where they are, but their owner recently died, so they need new homes. They want to find a new family, because they miss their owner and need some people to love.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Daisy and Tommy

description: Meet Ricky! He is a 5 year old full bred chihuahua. He weighs about 5 pounds. We rescued him from a breeder recently where he lived most of his life in a crate. He will need time to warm up to his new people. Once he trusts you, he is very loving and just wants to cuddle. He will need some work with house training. He is great with other dogs and likes their companionship. Due to him being nervous, we recommend older children. He has never walked on a leash before, so a fenced in yard would probably be best for him. If you would like to meet him, fill out an online application at bcaaofnj.org
name: Ricky

description:
My name is Georgia Girl and I am a gold and white pure bred Shih Tzu.  I will be 11 years old on August 23 and weigh a modest 17.6 pounds.  I may be older but I am energetic and love to play.  I have spent my entire life with the same human and was her constant companion.  I need a home where I will be able to play and spend time with a new mom or dad.
Georgia Girl is very sweet and people friendly but is afraid of other animals, although she is currently fostering with three other dogs successfully.  She will need to be walked with a harness and not a collar because she does not like the pressure of a collar.  Georgia Girl is the pup for you if you want someone to love you and be your faithful companion.
name: Georgia Girl

description:
***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***

Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this. 

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Bridgette

description: 4 August 2018: Looking for a perfectly sweet girl to spend your days with? Then look no further!! Saylor is a stunning 2 year old girl. She is dog friendly and weighs about 45 to 50 pounds. She seems a little too interested in the kitties and so might do best in a home without cats. Saylor is currently in a foster home where she has found a BFF Samoyed at the dog park with whom she plays fetch happily and has a ball!! Her foster mom tells us she is the BEST dog she has met in a long long time. She is potty trained and lets her foster family know when she has to go by prancing a little and going to the door. Sheâs a well-mannered girl that enjoys learning every day, like âpawâ. She will âwaitâ at the top of a flight of steps so she doesnât pull her foster mom down them! Please apply to adopt Saylor
name: Saylor

description: Vincent is a senior dog that is house trained, super friendly, gets along with other dogs & loves children! He is so full of life and loves being around his people. If you're looking for a dog that is move in ready look no further than Vincent!
name: Vincent

description: Hello! My name is Ruby, and I recently just got here from Texas! I am so excited to find my forever family! I'm sure I've had a home before but now that I am 2 years old I think it is time to settle down with my forevers. I'd be a great walking companion because I am so good on the leash. I am also super friendly with people. Since I am so easy going, I am a candidate to go home with young kids! But we should all meet first to make sure everyone gets along. I'm really a cool gal so ask the staff member if you think you're ready to settle down with me!
name: Ruby

description:
Luc is a happy go lucky bichon who was raised in a loving home.  He is gentle and quiet, gets along well with other dogs, and enjoys spending time with his foster family.  Luc had a good check up with his vet; he is neutered, up to date on vaccinations, heartworm tested, and just had his teeth cleaned.  This sweet boy is ready to be your loyal companion.  Luc is 13 yrs old, weighs 15 lbs, and his adoption fee is $300. 
 Please visit www.sherrysplacerescue.org to submit an adoption application.
name: Luc

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption at ACCT Philly!!! Drago - A40288372 Intake Type: Found Stray 12/02. Weight: 45 lbs. Medical Observation: Resolving URI. Underweight. Hair loss on tail, pressure sores, and old wounds on back end. Behavior Observation: Very wiggly and active. Loves to play fetch, knows "ball" and responds to "drop it" occasionally. Knows "sit". Personality: This is Drago! According to a Lifesaving staff member he is her favorite baby boy! When he first arrived at our shelter he was a little nervous, and per the finder he was barking at everything that passed, but stopped barking when commanded by finder. The finder also said that Drago was fine with his new puppy in the car. Drago is super wiggly the second you walk up to his kennel, and is so excited to have someone visit and give him love. He pulls a little when on the leash, but he has been improving since arriving at our shelter. Drago does his business as soon he gets outside, so there is evidence of house training. He is eager to please and is very treat motivated! Drago's absolute favorite thing to do is play fetch, and would thrive in an active home. He is a little jumpy at times, so he would do best in a home without smaller children; he doesn't want to get too excited and accidentally knock them over. Drago is the sweetest baby boy, its unbelievable that he is still at our shelter! Will you give Drago is furever home? Additional Photos: https://www.flickr.com/photos/108183274@N07/sets/72157698677014100/ This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Drago

description: Bio coming soon!

description:
I'm Joker, and I've come a very long way to be the good boy I am now! I'd do best in a home with kids, BUT supervised. I am also good with other dogs, but I must be slowy introduced. I'm a little high energy, and I love a belly rub and a good treat! Will you please give me my forever home?

To adopt or to receive more information, please fill out an application on our website at www.libertyhumane.org/dogs. Please do NOT simply hit the Ask About button. 

Once you have filled out our application, we will be happy to contact you. Thank you!

description: This pretty girl is Chiba. Chiba is a boxer mix, she will be 2 in January & she still has all her puppy energy! Chiba could use some training on regular puppy things, like jumping. She loves people and some other dogs, so a meet and greet is a must if you have another dog. Chiba is not a fan of cats. Come by and meet this cutie!
name: Chiba

description:
FOSTERED IN MISSISSIPPI;I am 3 year old I am the sweetest, most loving dog. I was abandoned after I had pups. I was starved and sick. I searched for my pups but could not find them. I had to find food to eat for months before a kind person contacted Bless Their Hearts Animal Rescue. I came to the rescue and was still real thin. I always was easy going and loving. I get along with all the other foster dogs and pups and love everyone. I had heart worms and have been treated and now I am ready for a forever home.

I will travel to a stop near you after my adoption is completed. We do not have a facility in NJ to meet before adoption. We ask that you visit your local shelters/rescues first..

My adoption fee is $450.00 and includes the transport fees, up to date vaccines, spayed/neutered, de wormed, Micro Chip and on flea and heart worm prevention.

To apply to adopt go to http://app.form2pay.com/publish/publish_form/127823

Like us on Facebook.com/BTHAR2013
name: Lucy

description:
Sprocket is my name and I am the best boy in the world. I have been patiently waiting for a chance to prove it to my forever family. I have had some pretty rough experiences. These are the parts of my life that I have chosen to forget, but people see them all over my body. Good fortune came my way when Eleventh Hour Rescue saved me from the streets of Jersey City. They cleaned me up and made sure I was fully recovered.

  

 I am easy to take care of with a very short coat that needs occasional brushing mostly because I love it. I don't like to walk very far, but exercise is as important for my mind as it is for my body. I like to walk for about 15 minutes. I am built for comfort not for speed. I like to play with a jolly ball and to spend time outside sniffing around. I love to sit on a bench with a kissable human. I am a little shy with new people and I don't like loud noises. I will let you know I am unhappy about it by heading back indoors.

  

 A greeting from me means hoisting my "low to the ground" little body up as close as I can get and giving lots of kisses. When it is time for you to go I will head for my comfy bed and settle in with a toy and a Nylabone to chew. I learned to sleep in my crate, too. I may need a little time to get used to sleeping in a crate again after having a kennel run for a while, but I am a smart boy!

  

 Here are some obedience things I know: sit, down, stay, walking nicely on a leash with very little pulling.

  

 If you think we could be friends, even if you want to foster rather than adopt me, please fill out an application at www.ehrdogs.org & ask for me by name - SPROCKET!
name: Sprocket

I had to find food to eat for months before a kind person contacted Bless Their Hearts Animal Rescue. I came to the rescue and was still real thin. I always was easy going and loving. description:
My name is Luke and I am a very handsome and loving 7 year-old Bull Terrier Mix.  I was found as a stray by a caring volunteer and it was quickly discovered that I needed medical help.  I had a condition called entropion which caused my eyelids to turn in.  For Our Friends fixed up my eyes and provided me with a hopeful new life free of pain.  I weigh about 55 pounds, and I have a long and lean athletic type build, and probably the silliest and best ears ever!  I am goofy and playful, and I have been told that I am very charming too.  I really need a forever home.  I have been waiting a very long time.  Please come meet me!

Phone: 917-864-2443
Email: fofdogrescue@yahoo.com
name: Luke

description:
Husky, that's his name, is clearly not of that breed, though he sure seems comfortable in the snow. He's a handsome guy (look at those eyes) who handlers enjoy working with. He's friendly, smart and an easy going dog...but does prefer to live in a home without cats.
Please call the shelter 516-944-8220 during working hours (Mon. to Fri. 9AM-4PM; Sat. 10-4PM) for more information about Husky, the adoption process at the shelter and to confirm availability.  Please go to www.theshelterconnection.com or to the shelter page on Petfinder for more information about and directions to the shelter.
