description: March 18 2018: Mini is a petite girl, weighing in at just 40 pounds. She is about 2 years old and has a beautiful glossy black coat. She gets along well with male dogs her size and larger, but tends to chase the little ones. Mini is treat motivated and eager to learn. She will make a wonderful addition to any family. Please apply to adopt today!!
name: Mini II (Black)

description: Precious almost 6 week old baby Theodore (our little Teddy Bear) is a gentle, sweet, cuddle pie. Loves to hug and snuggle up. Looking for an awesome family to cherish him.
name: Baby Theodore (Teddy Bear)

description:
My name is PINKIE and I'm a sweetheart of a 2 yr F Tan/White Dachshund/Beagle/Pit X. I'm 25 lbs of PURE DARLING BUD.  I was found as a stray and my owner was never found. No one knows my past,  but I definitely was not treated well because I'm extremely hand shy and skittish when I first meet new people and I will back up when you try to touch me. Once I get to know you, I'm more trusting but you must go slow with me. I'm also nervous walking on a leash alone and zig zag, but I walk much better with another dog. I love other dogs and come alive when I'm with another dog so I MUST GO WITH ANOTHER DOG preferably a bigger dog to give me a sense of comfort and security. The playful puppy comes out in me when I'm in the company of dogs. I'm fine with cats too! Because I'm so hand shy, it's best if I go with older kids/teens ages 12 yrs+. I need someone/couple/family to give me the patience and compassionate support to make me more confident and secure and I will be a SPARKLING LIL' GEM in no time!! Pls come meet me today!!

For more info/app; pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Pinkie *URGT* NEEDS IMMED FOSTER

description:
11/29/18

Blanca H Wilson

Ever come across someone that just makes you happier to see them? That is Blanca to Wags Volunteers. This sweet little pittie/lab mix is tiny only 32 pounds at 2 years old. She had a sad life up until she ended up in a rural southern shelter, used for breeding, not the life any dog should suffer through.  Blancas luck changed when Hurricane Florence roared into town, her shelter needed people to take dogs that were housed in outdoor kennels. A local family stepped up to take Blanca and couldnât bare the thought of her returning to the shelter. Wags agreed with them and Blancas life changed forever.  This sweet girl is happy and playful. She doesnât care whether it is playing and loving on her foster mama or playing tug of war with her foster brother she is ready to enjoy life.  She constantly entertains her family with her zest for life, and interest in all things new (she even thinks her new friend roomba is great, although she is not sure why it doesnât want to play). Blanca is crate trained and house trained and has learned that a leash means going somewhere fun with her foster family.  Blanca has been heartworm treated and is ready for a family of her own, please contact her friends at Wags for more information.

Heartworm treated 

Must meet bully breed criteria 

Blanca is vetted and vaccinated as age 
appropriate, including spay, and available for adoption through Wags Rescue and Referral.

Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you
name: Blanca H Wilson

description:
Siri, Wega and Antari are shy but sweet pups, just under a year old. They were saved by a good samaritan who found them when they were just stray puppies running around the streets of Greece. This concerned citizen knew that the dogs didn't stand a chance once they were grown and became a problem for the hotel where they were living near, so she got them their doggy passports, and had them brought here! They are learning how to live like a loved family pet, could you be the forever family they so deserve?

Siri, Wega and Antari are currently in a foster home so they can get used to being the best behaved pups! Be the first of your friends to have a Greece pup in your life!

Please visit www.faithfulfriends.us/adoption-process for more information. Email taylor@faithfulfriends.us with any questions about Siri, Wega or Antari.
name: Wega

description:
Hi I'm Mixxie!
I LOVE humans and if you want a friend who will lay on the couch and watch tv with you, I'm your girl! Nothing makes me happier than to lay on my back and have you give me belly rubs. I will follow you all around and take nice walks with you. I've had a few litters of puppies but I got spayed about a month ago. I know how to sit, lay down, give paw, wait and go outside. I love to do zoomies when I'm happy.

New video: https://youtu.be/98Ufy0hYtUs
and 
https://youtu.be/6rprsyivo18
and 
https://youtu.be/e2hVcuNt1lI
and 
https://youtu.be/u_3i7v31_zk

From my foster:
Mixxie is a four-year old spayed girl from NYC Animal Care and Control. Her owner had to move into housing where they do not allow pets. I am currently fostering Mixxie in hopes that she will find her forever home. 

She is very people-centered and loves being near them. Mixxie would do best as an only dog at this time since she gets very excited with some dogs. I have one female dog she doesn't care about, but a hyper male dog that gets her very worked up.She feels the need to jump on them, therefore she is rated best right now as an only dog. She listens incredibly well and knows to go out to go the bathroom, lay, sit, shake... You can tell her to go in her crate and she will. She is a bit of a baby because she'd rather stay next to me than go into her crate. Mixxie walks nicely on a leash and her does her business on our walks. You can tell Mixxie has had some puppy litters but is now spayed. She is up-to-date on all her shots.

If you would like to meet Mixxie, please contact me, Susan at suzen451@yahoo.com or call or text me at (845) 657-9639. She is fostered near Kingston NY and her rescue group is Imagine Pet Rescue. imaginepetrescue.org

Once you have decided that Mixxie is a good fit, you will be asked to submit an application for adoption through Imagine Pet Rescue. 

Here are some comments from NYC: 
Gentle, loving, and beyond sweet, MIXXY has waited for a family to pick her. She looks up with her copper eyes full of hope as you pass her kennel, pleading in silence and patience for a walk, a touch, a hug. She adores flopping down at your feet, rolling on her side for belly rubs, then sprawling across your lap for cuddle. Will you toss her a lifeline now?

A volunteer writes: Mixxy is an absolute little mush! She's shy at first, but if you allow her to go at her own pace, she'll reveal her super-sweet, loving, gentle personality. When I approached her cage, she took a minute to come up to the door and did so in a submissive posture. Once outside, I crouched down and let her approach me as I spoke in a soft, friendly tone. She soon came up to me with her tail wagging, and I started to pet her. Within seconds, she was walking into my arms as if she wanted to be hugged. She continued leaning into me while slowly turning and lowering her body. I couldn't figure out what she was doing - that is, until she had wiggled herself onto the ground and placed herself in full belly-rub position! And oh my goodness, what utter delight she took in having her tummy rubbed; there she layed - on her back, with eyes half-closed, a big doggie smile, and body and mind in a blissful trance! It just melted my heart. Throughout our walk, Mixxy was happy and very responsive. Every time I stopped to pet her, she did her little belly-rub dance - knowing full well that I could never say no. When she got up, she rewarded me with lots of cuddles and kisses. It wasn't surprising to read that Mixxy's previous owner said she loves to be around people and would even follow family members around the house. She also knows commands such as "sit" and "give paw." Mixxy loves treats and playing with balls and Kong toys, and walks nicely on a leash. If you'd like to meet this little sweetheart, please come down the Brooklyn ACC shelter where she's awaiting her forever home....just be prepared to have your heartstrings tugged.

MIXXY, ID# 42831, @ 4 Yrs., 57 lbs.
Brooklyn Acc, Large Mixed Breed, White / Brown Brindle, Unaltered Female

I came into the shelter as a owner surrender on 29-Sep-2018, with the surrender reason stated as person circumstance- moving - no pets allowed.

Basic Information:: Mixxy is a 4 year old altered female Medium mix breed. She was given as a gift when she was a puppy. She appears healthy but does get ear infections and has allergies to grain food. She was surrendered due to owners moving to a place that doesn't accept pets.

Previously lived with:: 3 Adults and one toddler

How is this dog around strangers?: Around strangers Mixxy will bark at first but when adapt to them and become friendly. She is outgoing towards everyone in the household.

How is this dog around children?: Around the 2 year old in the home she is relax and playful.

How is this dog around other dogs?: Mixxy lived with a male dog her breed and she was playful and tolerant around him. Also with other dogs outdoors she is social.

How is this dog around cats?: Mixxy will bark and chase cats she sees in the backyard or on walks.

Resource guarding:: Mixxy does not resource guard her food toys and treats. If you try to take them away from her she will play bow or play tug.

Bite history:: Mixxy has never bitten or scratched anyone owner stated.

Housetrained:: Yes

Other Notes:: Mixxy isn't bothered when being restrained or being pulled off furniture. She runs away when she knows the water is on in the tub to take baths, however when in tub she is tolerant. She rather take baths outdoors in the yard with waterholes. She will bark when unfamiliar people approaches the house or family member. Mixxy will bark and whine in one spot when there's thunder storms or fireworks.

Has this dog ever had any medical issues?: Yes
Medical Notes: She appears healthy but does get ear infections and has allergies to grain food.

For a New Family to Know: Mixxy is trained to use the bathroom outdoors in the yard and if she goes on walks she will pull a bit on the leash. She eats dry food grain free twice a day. She loves to play with balls and kongs. Mixxy loves to be around people so she will follow owners around the house or be in the same room.She knows commands such as sit and give paw. Mixxy used to be crate trained when she was a puppy. Owner describes Mixxy as friendly, affectionate, playful, confident, pushy, independent, and anxious.

Behavior Assessment
Date of intake:: 9/29/2018

Spay/Neuter status:: yes

Means of surrender (length of time in previous home):: Owner surrender

Energy level/descriptors:: Mixxy is described as friendly, affectionate, playful, confident, pushy, excitable, independent, and anxious.

Summary:: Mixxy came into the assessment room nervous, she was timid and fearful towards the handlers with a slow approach. After some time she warms up to new people.

Summary (1):: According to Mixxy's previous owner, Mixxy is social around other dogs. Here at the Care Centers, Mixxy initially is nervous and avoident. After several sessions, Mixxy is slightly more confident and engages in social interactions. The Behavior Department recommends that Mixxy be placed in a home with resident dogs that are respectful and matches her calm demeanor.

10/2: When off leash at the Care Centers, Mixxy is avoident and spends the bulk of her session to herself. She is nervous around the novel male and quickly moves to another pen when he enters.

10/3: Mixxy is a bit more social today, briefly greeting the novel female dog then moving away to explore the yard. She checks in with her a few times, each time becoming a bit taller in her posture.

10/4-5: Mixxy was respectful and social with a novel male dog. She checks in with him, while exploring the yard.

Date of intake:: 9/29/2018

Summary:: Upon intake Mixxy was loose body and sat and gave paw for treats

Date of initial:: 10/1/2018

ENERGY LEVEL:: Mixxy displays a low to medium activity level in the care center.

BEHAVIOR DETERMINATION:: ADULT ONLY HOME

Behavior Asilomar: TM - Treatable-Manageable

Recommendations:: No children (under 13)

Recommendations comments:: No children: Due to how uncomfortable Mixxy is currently with touch and novel stimuli, we feel that an adult-only home would be most beneficial at this time.

Potential challenges: : Fearful

Potential challenges comments:: Fearful: Mixxy is timid with new people. She manages her stress well and has not escalated or shown any aggression, but she does need time to warm up to new people. She does best with a slow approach, and should be permitted to greet new people at her own pace and to initiate interaction (rather than being approached and pet immediately by a new person) so she has time to adjust and become comfortable before she is handled. She should be spoken to softly and gently.

My medical notes are...
Weight: 57 lbs

Vet Notes
L V T Notes
1/10/2018

DVM Intake Exam

Estimated age: 4 years
Microchip noted on Intake? positive 911002001308721
History : o/s. o reports grain allergy.
name: Mixxie - Courtesy posting

description:

He went to our good friends at Allied Dog Training and aced his training.
When his training was over we couldn't bear for him to go back to boarding.
We asked his Rescue if we could take him under our wing and they agreed!
Rescue is about the well being of the dog and in this case Achilles will continue to thrive while we search for his home!!!
Here is what our trainer says:
Achilles does well with a submissive not in your face dog.
He is not a fan of cats.
He is a wiggle butt and LOVES all people.
Respectful children 7 and up.
Achilles is approximately 5-6 years old and is located in Dutchess County NY.
He is neutered, UTD on shots and micro-chipped.
Applications: www.townandcountryk9resq.com under contact us.
Questions- please call / text Christine 914-772-0649
Please share this Handsome Hunk.
Together we can find him a home so we can make room for another in need.
name: Achilles

description: Nina is a super-sweet, two year-old Chihuahua mix rescued from Puerto Rico. She weighs approximately eight pounds. If interested,  please call or text Gizela at 201-655-5059. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Nina

description: Sharpshootin' Annie Oakley is looking to bring the Wild Wild West to Brooklyn! This southern broad could be your not-so-Little Miss Sure Shot for the holidays. At just about 1-year-old, Annie is the happiest great dane mix who loves playing with humans, people, toys, and anything else that will have her. At the end of the day, Annie enjoys getting her cuddle on and promises to keep you warm this winter. To foster or adopt, visit bit.ly/BadassApp
name: Annie Oakley

description:
Age: 12 years
Hello everyone! My name is Mia and I am a very sweet  âGolden Girl.â Unfortunately, my Miami retirement plans were botched when Hurricane Irma decided to barrel through the city. But luckily, I evacuated to New York City and am ready to live it up!
name: Mia

description: This is Golden Tate a Female Retriever Mix who is 2 years old. Sheâs utd with shots, spayed and heartworm negative. She is super friendly, great personality and would love a fenced in yard at her new home. Loves to go for walks, always up for playing and enjoys snuggling. She is a medium size dog at 40-45lbs. She is perfect for an active family.
name: Golden Tate

description:
Who couldn't use a little 'Doodlebug' in their life??  This adorable little girl is full of kisses and cuddles.  A little timid with new surroundings but at 5lbs, wouldn't we all be a little bit timid of our surroundings?

Great with all the other small dogs in foster, Doodlebug is just a delight!  Her tail never stops swishing and she never stops kissing.  

Uses wee pads indoors so Doodle is easy to have as a companion.  She is only about a year old and we are looking for a forever home so that this Doodlebug is never looking for another new home again.

Please keep in mind that we do not normally adopt out of a 50 mile radius and we will NOT ADOPT OUT AS A XMAS GIFT.

Thank you.
name: Doodlebug

description:
Mink is a wonderful companion and just wants to please.  

Mink and two other small dogs were living in a car with their owner, who fell on hard times.   Mink needed eye surgery to correct a very painful condition where her eyelashes curled into her eyes and restricted her vision.  

She was taken in by Delco Dawgs, surgery was performed leaving Mink pain free and with normal vision!  She was so happy to see again!!

Mink loves people, belly rubs, is not a chewer, and loves to give kisses.  

Mink is strong and would do best in a home with no children, as she may knock them down by accident.  Someone experienced with larger dogs who enjoys the outdoors would be a great fit.

Mink would probably do best as an only pet, since she has been an only dog through her recovery and foster.  Mink could play with other dogs, with a proper introduction, as she did live with other dogs in the past when very young.  She will chase cats and squirrels. 

Mink is a beautiful color with red highlights and is so loving.   She deserves a good home where she can feel the love of her very own family!!  

Please consider meeting Mink and see all she has to offer.
name: Mink

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.A-59Let's give a gentle hello to this sweet and timid boy Albie. Albie is one of the Texas-13 and his first 8 years he had little or no contact with humans, so he is leery of humans. Albie has no aggression, and he prefers his solitary life outside or in his crate. Albie is a watcher from afar. His foster mom is working on socializing him.
Albie has come a long way from his first days in foster care.
1. Albie was a little wild and needed a harness and 6 foot leash so he could be caught and brought in to the house. Today Albie's crate is open and he has free range to the house and dog door. Albie is housebroken going in the yard. Albie does not like leash walking so a fenced in yard is needed for this little man.
2. Albie eats well we have gone from feeding him outside, then inside the dog door to family room. Today Albie is eating in the kitchen with the other dogs. Any noise and Albie runs for his crate, but he is getting better at this.
3. Albie does not know any commands. This is a challenge since he will only takes treats in his crate. You must place the treat down then walk away and he will eat it.
4. Albie will come out of his crate for Albie time. His foster mom started getting him out of his crate for snuggle time, brushing and general human time. Albie resisted at first but now he will come out of his crate on his own to be picked up for couch time. Albie has been taken to bed to sleep with his foster mom and other dogs and he is sleeping all night in the bed.
If you are interested in adopting he is a work in progress. He is learning that having a family is a good thing. But you must earn his trust.
Albie is being fostered in Wilmington, DE. He's up-to-date on all his shots, he's neutered, and microchipped. He's ready for his happily ever after. Applications are welcome, but please remember he is a work in progress.
name: Albie

description:
Blaze is a big and happy boy of about 3 1/2 years old that is eager to go right back into a great home, where he belongs.  He had a home for his whole life but when the landlord said Blaze had to go, he found himself in a real predicament.  He's trying not to let it get him down though and is staying his good-natured, playful and bubbly self.  Blaze is a very big boy (about 103 lbs.) and although he is strong, he is very well behaved and had lots of training in his day.  He sits and lays down when asked and is gentle with taking treats too.  He grew up around young children and was just fine with them, but he will need a home with no cats.  He doesn't seem to mind larger dogs.  When he gets to know you, he is your absolute best friend that can't get enough attention.  He's a real sweetheart that hopes to win you over with his warm and loving smile!  File# 28377  7/27/18

If you cannot adopt but would like to help care for the many available pets that we have awaiting their forever homes, text ResQ to 501501 to make a $10.00 donation, or click here to donate to our Res-Q Fund: https://www.ahscares.org/ContentPage/2736

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.
name: Blaze

description:
Speckles is a five-year old, female, black tri Aussie. She weighed 36 pounds when first rescued, but has since put on some much-needed weight, and is currently working to put on a couple more pounds.

Speckles is very affectionate and loves people who she has had time to get to know, though she can be a little shy at first. She seems to pick one person to be especially attached to. She is very good with other dogs and loves a good play session with other dogs to help burn off some energy. She's still learning her boundaries, and when to stop bothering the other dogs in her foster home when they've had enough, which is understandable since it's all new to her. She has also caught on pretty quickly that the cats she shares her foster home with are the ones truly in charge!

Speckles doesn't seem to really enjoy car rides so far, but she tolerates them well enough. She walks well on leash but tends to constantly wrap around behind you to make sure everyone is following along. Speckles still needs to learn her basic commands, and has a tendency to try to counter surf when given the opportunity. She is house broken, but needs to be allowed to go out as soon as she is released from her crate/being separated in another room or she may pee in the house (we suspect her routine was to be let out of her crate/enclosure right to where she would go to the bathroom so that's just what she knows). 

?Speckles is relatively high energy when she wants to play and is only now beginning to figure out how to play with dog toys, but she does have an off switch and will settle right in with the other dogs in her foster home after she spends some time pacing around/looking for more food. She would do best in an active home, with a fenced yard â the bigger the better, but she seems to make do with the small yard in her foster home. She would love to be in a home with other dogs but would do fine with frequent play dates with other friendly dogs since it's her people that she cares about the most. 

Speckles is fostered in Haddon Township, NJ.
name: Speckles

description:
12/26/18

description:
PLEASE READ THIS WHOLE SECTION! ALL OF OUR DOGS ARE BEING FOSTERED IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI. They will be transported north after adoption process is complete and dogs/puppies are ready for travel. We currently adopt to NY, NJ, NH, CT, PA, MD, VA. 


This litter of puppies was born to a momma dog who has at least two litters a year on the road where one of our volunteers lives....She had to drive by them every day, and three days in a row she saw one hit and killed in the road. Finally, she stopped at the house and asked the owner if she could have the puppies. He agreed. He also agreed to let Project Paws spay the momma dog, as he wanted to keep her but said he couldn't afford to have her fixed. 

We took in the pups and never, ever, ever, in all our years of rescue, have we seen pups so covered in FLEAS. We treated them and a couple of hours later, you could literally sweep the fleas into an appreciable pile. Our vet said that in another day, the pups would have been so anemic from fleas and worms they likely would have died. But. Now they are all healthy and happy and NO FLEAS! They are all spayed and neutered and as sassy and cute as they can be! We just adore these babies! They are all ready for their new families, never to be mistreated again. Help them bust out of Mississippi and get on to a better life!

Please send an email to projectpawstippah@gmail.com for an application. We will respond within 24 hours. If you haven't received it, please check your spam folder. Our adoption fee is $450.00 is includes all age appropriate vetting, (puppy vaccines, rabies vaccine if old enough, spay/neuter, microchip, flea/tick/heartworm preventative, wormed) transport to city listed and health certificate.

We are a 501c3 non-profit rescue organization. 

You can also find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ProjectPawsMS
name: Morris-20 Pounds- *FLEAS ALMOST KILLED THEM

description: Joey is a very handsome 2 year old Boxer/Pit mix who came to Rbari after being surrendered by his owner. Joey is good with some (mostly) female dogs but can be reactive to other dogs when he is on a leash. He is a high energy boy who needs a confident person and a home that can provide guidance and structure in a loving manner as he is also a very affectionate boy.Joey has a condition called Steroid Responsive Meningitis (not transmittable to other animals or to humans). This means that at least for the time being and possibly long term, Joey requires daily medication and special attention to his medical needs.Shelter life is very stressful for Joey which negatively contributes to his condition. A foster or forever home could very well be "just what the doctor ordered" and might actually help him get into remission! Joey is not your average shelter dog and therefore we are looking for a unique and special adopter. Are you that exceptional person who wants to make a huge impact on a dog's life? Please consider giving Joey the chance he so desperately needs. Please note: Joey requires an adult-only home. Primary Color: Brown Secondary Color: White Weight: 45lbs Age: 4yrs 9mths 3wks Animal has been Neutered
name: Joey

description: Meet Oreo!  This handsome little man is an 8 month old male Lab Hound mix.  He is super friendly and loves just about everyone and everything he meets.  He loves to snuggle and wants to be with you at all times.  He never turns down a good belly rub.  He loves to play and is full of puppy energy.  He would make a great addition to a family with an active lifestyle!  He is currently located down South at our sister shelters and available for pre-adoption. We do transports to NJ once a month.  He can't wait to find his forever home!
name: Oreo

description:
Make A Difference in your Community - Adopt a Shelter Dog! Would you like to foster a shelter dog? For more information, visit us at www.ShelterSurvivors.com

This pretty girl is Maddie, who was found as a stray in in Manhattan.  Her finder told the shelter staff that she brought Maddie into her house for a few days in the hopes that she would find her family, but even though she hung posters and reached out to neighbors, no one claimed her. The finder had a three-year old son who Maddie adored, but sadly, no pets were allowed in their apartment, so they couldnât keep her.

Maddie is very loving, gentle and snuggly.  She is two years old, so she still has puppy energy to burn, but she has no problem relaxing after a long walk or playing in the yard with the other dogs in her foster home.  She loves other dogs, and in her foster home she frolics and plays with two smaller dogs and one bigger dog and gets along with them all.  She runs like a goofy deer, sometimes in leaps and bounds and sometimes tripping over her own feet.  She knows how to sit, and she is very smart, so teaching her new commands or tricks will be easy. 

Maddie is such a happy girl!  She loves playing with all kinds of toys and chewing on bones.  She is not a picky eater, and although she is about 50 pounds now, she is all muscle and when she fills out she will be even more beautiful.  Maddie sleeps with foster mom under the covers to keep herself (and her foster mom) warm.  She loves to snuggle, and if you let her she will lick your entire face.   She has stunning hazel eyes, and the speckles on her ears enhance the âPeteyâ patch on her left eye.  She is gorgeous!

Maddie is about two years old, and we think she is a Pitbull/American Bulldog mix.  She would love a home with another dog but would also be fine without a canine sibling.   She loves kids and adults alike and would be an excellent family dog.  She is very playful, but not hyper (she enjoys her down time as much as playing).  She is housebroken, spayed, up to date on all her shots, microchipped, heartworm negative, and crate trained.  She has two old scars on her back which you can see in some of her pictures, and they have healed nicely but her fur may never grow back in those areas.  She is one of the best and most loving dogs her foster family has ever met! 

To adopt Maddie, fill out our online dog application , or download our Microsoft Word dog application and return it to sheltersurvivors@live.com. It will help expedite the process.

Adoption fee- $250.00
name: Maddie PENDING

The shelter guesses that he is 8 or 9 years old, His fur is matted and sparse, but he did well on his evaluation and seems to be a sweet little dog.  He needs to be neutered, and will be ready to go as soon as that is done.

description:
14 Dec 2018: Gaia is a sweet senior rottie mix who came into the shelter with a mammary tumor. We couldnât stand to see her suffer and so pulled her and got her much needed medical attention. Gaia is now all healed up and ready for her forever home. 

Gaia is an extremely loving girl. She loves being near her people and will follow you around the house. Despite her size (70 pounds), she is very gentle. She does have arthritis in her hind legs which makes going up and down stairs a but difficult although she loves going on slow-paced walks. We are looking for an easy going, laid back home, where Gaia can live out her golden years. Gaia is good with other dogs and all people but should not be in a home with cats. Please apply to foster or adopt.
name: Gaia

description:
3/21/18

HI - my name is Belize.  I sure have had a rough start in life.  I found myself homeless, living on the streets.  Unfortunately, being a young pup, I did not know the dangers of the road.  I ended up hit by a car.  Lucky for me I was found by a kind person who got help for me.  I had a broken leg which was repaired and is in the process of healing.
I am still young and am working on my manners.  An experienced dog lover, who will put time into training me will really help me a lot.  I do have a lot of energy so an active person who can give me a lot of exercise as well as a fenced yard would be great.  Also, I can be scared of new situations and new people, as I am still learning to trust.  Therefore a home without children would be best - a  quieter household without too much activity inside the home would be great!
My foster mom says I am a super smart girl and that to know me is to love me.  If you desire a true companion and you have the patience to teach me to be the best that I can be, I may be your girl!
Please call Susan if you would like to meet me!  267-312-3372

Thank you for reading my story!
Belize
 


5/7/17

* BULLY BREED CRITERIA*


3/25/17

Belize was found in a ditch after being struck by a car.  Her leg has been repaired and she will be adoptable once she is vet cleared. 



Please call Colleen @ 267-238-7892 or Susan @ 267-312-3372. To begin the adoption process please, please fill out our online application. Go to wagsrescue.com and click on adoption form. After you complete the application, you will be taken to PayPal so you can submit the $25.00 application fee. Thank you!
name: Belize Society

description: Foster Update: Meet Franco! He's a curious, gentle, and fun-loving companion! He loves cuddling, learning new tricks, and sleeping on top of his crate (just like Snoopy!)! Franco is such a smart, adaptable pup, with tons of love to give! He'll be an amazing addition to his forever home! Franco is fully house trained, crate trained, and walks pretty well on his leash. He is generally medium energy since he loves to play, but also loves to chill with his humans. Apply to adopt this handsome boy today! Franco is a 3-year-old terrier mix who is 12lbs fully grown. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Franco

description:
Bliss is living with 3 other dogs and she loves playing with them however she can be a bit protective when sharing people and food around them. We suggest a home with a very easy going dog or not dogs. She can play with them but living and sharing is not her best skill. She is very sweet and intelligent and loves being outdoors.
Bliss would do better with older kids, she is not aggressive and we just believe that she is  bit too jumpy for smaller size kids.
Bliss got along with one of our cats but it really depends on the cat ability around dogs. She is a fast learner, a super well house trained dog and a real beauty with great marks on her coat.
She is a playful young dog who would make someone very happy.
name: Bliss

description:
Jubalee is just one year of age. She lived in a home with another dog and cats. The household was very chaotic and hectic... too much for a young shy dog. 
Jubalee is very affectionate and well mannered on the leash. She likes to run in the play yard but prefers to stay close to her handler. She is house trained and comfortable sleeping in her crate. 
A quiet adult household would be the best match for this sweet girl.
name: Jubalee

description: Utley is a six year-old Pomeranian/Chihuahua mix who prefers the company of adult humans. He is searching for a companion he can form a forever bond with. If interested in adopting, you must attend one of our Adoption Events to fill out an application.which are listed on our home page and Facebook. Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Utley

description: GiGi is currently being fostered in South Carolina (transport can be arranged). She is approximately 16 months old, weighs 45 lbs and is super dog friendly and loves kids of all ages. She is housetrained, loves sharing her toys with other dogs, enjoys car rides and has excellent leash skills. She does have a heart murmur but she lives life normally! She knows basic commands. In sum, she's absolutely perfect!
name: GiGi

description:
My name is JULIET and I'm a gorgeous 9/10 yr F Yellow Lab/Shep X. I'm a big boned 80 lbs of PURE GOLDEN GIRL!!! 
I was surrendered by my owners due to a pet conflict. I'm a sweet sassy girl and just full of SUGAR and SUNSHINE!  I bring smiles to everyone's face that meet me young and old. People can't believe my age and I just tell them I'm 10 yrs young and I've got great healthy genes and I'll be here for a while! I'm the perfect dog to go on leisurely walks or medium hikes or to hang out on the couch or lay by the fireplace. I do need to keep my rubenesque figure in check as I love to eat so daily exercise is a must. I am civil to dogs in passing, but in the home I'm a bit of an attention hound and must be the center of attention so that's why I need to be a SOLO DOG.  I'm not sure about cats. I'm fine with kids. I'm a lovely lovely GEM of a DOG! I need someone who will make me the "Apple of Their Eye" for the rest of my golden years and I will repay them with unlimited snuggles, licks and kisses. If you want to bask in my glow please come meet/adopt me today!!

For more info/app; pls email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG

Foster home thanks to DOGS ON THE FARM:
www.dogsonthefarm.com
name: Juliet

description:
Here comes sweet as pie Quartz! She's a gorgeous 12-month old, 35 lbs. Kelpie/Cattle Dog girl rescued from a shelter in the South and arriving in NYC on Saturday, December 8th ready to find her very own loving forever home. Quartz is super smart, playful and oh so loving... she's eager to learn new things and happy to show off her wiggle butt nature! She's also up to date on all medical and spayed too.

Apply for Quartz now and be enchanted with this beauty! 

Quartz is available for adoption through in Our Hands Rescue. If interested in meeting her, please fill out an application on inourhandsrescue.org. Please DO NOT send an email through Petfinder, your application will be processed before the following Saturday's event.
name: Quartz

breeds: American Staffordshire Terrier, Catahoula Leopard Dog
description:
Moose is a young and silly pupper - only about 9 months old. He has lots of playful energy and he's a Catahoula mix - needless to say we would really like to encourage active adopters with a big yard. 

We got Moose back in early August as a death row rescue with a very very bad virus. He spent a lot of time in the hospital and then quite some time in a quiet medical foster home. Since we've had him for several months, he has had a chance to live in a few different homes. From that, we have learned that he would do best in a home with another well-adjusted dog to help show him the ropes and give him companionship. We also do not think he will do well in a home where he is left by himself a lot. Moose has been working on his crate anxiety with a professional trainer. We hope that his adopter can continue to provide him stability, comfort, and training. If you can't stand to cuteness of this face and want to show this dog the good life, send us your app today!
name: Moose

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Cleopatra is the just the cutest Boxer mix pup! She was born in September 2018 and comes into rescue from Texas. She is so very sweet and she canât wait to meet the special someone that can give her the amazing forever home that sheâs been dreaming of! Cleopatra is a friendly and playful girl who is great with people of all ages (including kids) and other dogs! She does bark at the cats in her foster home but who can blame her for that! She is very smart and has been doing wonderful with house and leash training. She will be spayed and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. Little miss Cleo will bring so much joy and happiness to the lucky one that adopts her. If you are looking for an adorable, perfect little princess puppy to add to your family, then Cleopatra is the one for you! To adopt Cleopatra, please fill out an application for her here! Http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Cleopatra

description:
Mia is a 4 year old, 46-pound English shepherd mix. She was alleged to be a Rottweiler mix, but I am here to inform the world that a black dog with brown spots above its eyes does not mean the dog is a rottie.  So not rottie here. 

Mia is a very timid, sweet dog who practices sad looks to get more treats. She is a quiet girl, but she is all about the snuggle time. This is a dog that would like to be near you, with you, and occasionally, on you. She is easy going and friendly and she does well with all people past the screaming years (think 8 and up). Mia is also good with dogs and cats and she has good indoor manners.

Mia needs a laid back home with people who understand that shy dogs need time to blossom. This dog is never going to want to go with you to the ballpark to meet throngs of people, but she is going to be your sofa companion extraordinaire. She won't even judge you if you watch ten straight hours of America's Got Talent. Mia needs a home with a fenced yard and a dog companion to show her the ropes. 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please apply online, at http: https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/ and then email erika@bigfluffydogs.com. 

Our main website, www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the rescue process. NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE DO NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. All known information about an individual dog is provided in it's listing. We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. Homes considering adopting a puppy must be prepared for:1.) Flexible schedules for potty training. Puppies can only "hold it" for one hour per month of age (ex. a 4 month old puppy can only go 4 hours without a potty break).2.) Crate training until the puppy is at least one year old, to prevent chewing on inappropriate things when you can't supervise.3.) Socialization: The more positive and varying experiences as a puppy the better, both in and out of your home.4.) Puppy behavior and life stages are equivalent to a human toddler. It takes at least a full year to have a calmer, well adjusted dog. Patience is required and when your dog's behavior is a positive experience for you and those around you, your patience will be rewarded tenfold, for years to come.Please do not consider adopting a puppy if you have not thoroughly thought through the pros and cons of having one. So many people end up returning them after 3-5 months because they didn't realize the amount of work involved in raising a puppy.Patience, appropriate toys, socialization, and obedience training are all musts. All are time consuming, and can be expensive.All Dogs Require:Supervision with children and obedience training. Adopters that want to have good dogs must be prepared to put the time and effort into training a dog. Any dog requires work and effort, but a well trained, well socialized dog is more than worth the effort put in to get them there.
name: Mia

description:
Meet Harper!
Harper is a sweet and friendly baby girl who was born on April 6th. 
She is fostered with other dogs of all sizes and ages and is great with all! She would love to be adopted with her equally adorable brother Cecil, but sheâs also well adjusted and socialized and would be ok on her own as well!
She is an adorable mix of Australian Shepherd and Catahoula Leopard Dog, and is as sweet as she is cute!! 
If you are interested in this little cutie, we are accepting applications now at this link: https://www.newlifeanimalrescue.org/dog-application. 
Her adoption fee is $275 and includes a thorough veterinary exam, up to date vaccines and preventatives, deworming, spay, microchip, and 30 days of free pet insurance.
Please note: We do try to limit adoptions to within one hour of our southern NJ area so that we can conduct our own home visits and follow-up.
Thank you for considering adoption of a rescued pet!
***IMPORTANT - PLEASE NOTE***
PetFinder has been having issues with getting email inquiries to us.
If you are interested in adopting, 
*** PLEASE CONTACT US DIRECTLY at
NewLifeAnimalRescue@gmail.com  ***
Thank you!
name: Harper

description:
PLEASE READ THIS WHOLE SECTION! ALL OF OUR DOGS ARE BEING FOSTERED IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI. They will be transported north after adoption process is complete and dogs/puppies are ready for travel. We currently adopt to NY, NJ, PA, MD, VA.

Clayton was found by a Good Samaritan in the middle of the road on a cold morning the week of Thanksgiving...He'd been hit by a car, was unconscious, and we were unsure if he'd ever walk. But after some stabilization and good meds, he came around, and luckily all his injuries were superficial and he is perfectly sound now! And even better, he's perfectly sweet! He is going to make someone the perfect little buddy! He's all up on his vaccinations and is neutered and heartworm negative! He's just perfect!

Please send an email to his veterinarian, Dr. Smith, at vetelizabeth@yahoo.com for an application. We will respond within 24 hours. If you haven't received it, please check your spam folder. Our adoption fee is $450.00 is includes all age appropriate vetting, (puppy vaccines, rabies vaccine if old enough, spay/neuter, microchip, flea/tick/heartworm preventative, wormed) transport to city listed and health certificate.
name: Clayton **HIT BY A CAR AND LEFT TO DIE

description:
Theo is a shy boy who takes a little time to trust new people. He loves taking walks and hanging out in the play yard with his favorite people. Once this handsome guy warms up to you he loves you!  Theo also enjoys hanging out with his canine friends in play group. He would prefer a quiet home without children, who can blame him though for wanting all of the attention to himself! Theo is 4 yrs old. 

***To fill out an adoption application for this dog, please go to the following website: http://www.petsalive.com/adoptadog.html . We'll review your application and get back to you as soon as possible! ***


Please be patient with us as we take every application seriously and will review yours to make sure you are a good match with the dog you are choosing (although we usually will reply within 24-48 hours!) Please read our adoption page for more information in regards to this.

***If you have a YAHOO email address*** please check your spam folder if you have not received a response after a few days, as we usually respond to EVERY application within 24 hours and Yahoo sometimes blocks our responses!
name: Theo

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Gracie, a Plott Hound, and her brother Angelo were left outside a Georgia shelter in horrible condition. Born in early 2017, Gracie was extremely emaciated when she came into rescue: at only 16 pounds, she was only half of what her body weight should have been and in addition, she had an ulcerated eye, demodex mange, anemia, parasites, was dehydrated, and her two rear paws were swollen and infected with puncture wounds there and on her neck. After spending some time with our vet partner, Gracie is doing great medically. She was a very frightened girl for awhile there, but is doing wonderful in her foster home where she will continue working on building her confidence and learning to trust again. Her foster mom says that Gracie is so kind, gentle, and submissive, and her entire resident pack is totally in love with her! Gracie is still pretty skittish outside but enjoys having guidance from her foster fur sibling. She will be up to date on shots and spayed prior to placement in her forever home. She will probably be no bigger than 40 pounds at her healthy weight. If you would like to give this precious girl the amazing life she deserves, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Gracie

description: Robbie is a twelve week-old Terrier mix rescued from Puerto Rico along with his siblings. If interested in adopting, you must attend one of our Adoption Events, listed on our Home Page and Facebook, in order to fill out an application.  Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days. Adoption fees vary but include: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative and micro-chipping.
name: Robbie

description:
Please note, this is a courtesy listing for our sister rescue group, the SPCA of Westchester. This dog is located at the SPCA at 590 North State Road in Briarcliff Manor, NY 10510 (www.spca914.org). Please apply with the SPCA if you are interested in this dog, please read the details below!

This guy has perfected the art of getting whatever he wants with just one look... and what he wants is love! This 5 year old boy is a total mush; he adores people and just wants to be around them. His perfect home would be one where someone is home part time, and we think kids around 8 and up would be a good fit (it really depends on the kids, so it's best to talk to our trainers!) Crosby is a smart, well-trained guy -- he's earned his PhD, the highest level you can achieve in our Canine Life and Social Skills training program! He's also house trained! To learn more about Crosby, e-mail shelter@spca914.org 

When to Come:
Unless noted differently above, our hours are Monday-Saturday 10am-4pm and Sunday 1pm-4pm. Our adoptions are first come, first served based on the status of your application. 

What to Bring:
Please bring a copy of your current pet(s)â vaccination records (if you currently have a dog or cat or did within the last 2 years) and a copy of your lease (if you rent or own a condo/co-op/townhouse) in case we are unable to get hold of your veterinarian or landlord/management company on the day you come in. 

Adoption Process:
We do same day adoptions pending application approval/satisfactory reference checks, except in the case of dogs listed as Trainer Adoptions (on occasion, some Trainer Adoption dogs are able to go home same day). With all adoptions, every person living in the home where the dog will reside must come meet the dog, and any dogs already in the home must come for a meet and greet as well.

We do NOT hold animals, nor do we accept deposits in advance. If you have discussed coming in to meet an animal or have an approved application, this does not guarantee that you will get a particular puppy or dog. If you do not bring your dog(s) or all residents of your home to meet the dog, we cannot hold that dog for you.

Adoption Fees & Whatâs Included:
All dogs and puppies are spayed/neutered, microchipped, vaccinated (age appropriate), and come with a free veterinary visit from a participating vet within seven days of adoption. 

Adults dogs over 1 year of age: $225-$375
All Puppies: $375
Seniors and Lonely Hearts Club members: $85

Please visit: http://www.spca914.org/adoptanimal.htm to read our Adoption Policy and Procedures in full.
Feel free to e-mail shelter@spca914.org or call (914) 941-2896 ext. 11 with any questions or for more details on the dog(s) in which you are interested.

SPCA of Westchester
Briarcliff Manor, NY

Location Address
590 North State Road
Briarcliff Manor, NY 10510
Get directions
shelter@spca914.org
914-941-2896

name: Tasha

description:
SAANA is a very sweet 10 yr. old female American Hairless Terrier. She weighs just 9 lbs. Because her owner has become unable to care for her due to illness and work, Saana needs a new home as soon as possible. Saana loves to spend time with her family and becomes sad if she is left alone for long periods of time. Sheâs a real snuggle bug who loves to be held. Her favorite place is on your lap. When not on a lap, you can find Saana under a blanket or in front of the fireplace. During the summer, Saana likes to go on short walks in the park. Her paws are very soft and she needs booties on the sidewalk. During cold weather, she wears her down coat in order to keep warm. She has a shirt or 
pajamas on in the house.

Saana has some allergies, so she needs a special diet. Saana loves to eat fruits and vegetables. Her favorites are carrots, celery, cabbage, apples, and blueberries. She will also eat fish, eggs, and liver. As much as she is thrilled with her food, she never touches anything else around the house and never chews or destroys things. Saana prefers to go potty outside, but has gotten used to a pad at home. Now that she is older, she will get up during the night to go potty on her pad. She is very accurate and only goes in the pad area. 

Saana is very quiet unless she hears dogs barking outside or someone knocking at the door. She has lived in a condo her entire life and has done well. She will bark at visitors when they first come in. But after a while, she becomes used to them and settles down. Saana loves going for rides in the car and can sit in the front seat or in a soft sided crate in the back. 

Saana's right knee has a luxating patella. If she takes her inexpensive
supplements, she walks perfectly fine and there is no sign of any problems. The vet said she may need a surgery in the future, but she has done great and with care this should not become an issue. 

Saana is UTD on routine shots, spayed, and walks nicely on a leash. She will do best in a home without other animals.

*** THIS IS A COURTESY POST. SAANA IS NOT IN AMERICAN FOX TERRIER RESCUE. SHE IS LIVING WITH HER FAMILY IN MA. ***
 






ADOPTED!
 

SAANA
name: SAANA - MA

description:
Hazel is a 12-13 pound, 1-year old mix with a bit of Chihuahua in her, maybe. She was found as a stray in Los Angeles and was very scared. Our LA partner rescued her and found her to be playful and curious - she loves her toys and fetches, but plays well on her own too. She is weewee pad trained and will go outside. She is very shy at first so go slowly, but it does not take long (with the aid of a few treats) for her to warm up. She loves people and will want to be in the same room. We did not try crating her as she is new to us. She loves cuddles and tummy rubs! 

She is microchipped and will be spayed as part of adoption.

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:

Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.com

Fosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.com

PLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked "Adoption Pending" have an approved adoption application on file and are awaiting final approval. Please check back in a few days to see if they are still available!

We understand you may have questions but the fastest way to get answers is to fill out the application and the foster parent can answer any questions you may have!

Waggytail Rescue CAN NOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you.
name: Hazel!

description:
ADOPTION PENDING. You can see more of these beautiful dogs by going to  NGPR RESCUE DOGS at  https://nationalpyr.org/adoptable-dogs

NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Say hello to this gorgeous purebred Great Pyrenees boy, Ripken. Just turned 1 year old in November, Ripken is one of the friendliest, most lovable pups around. This big boy loves everyone, and if he can play every minute of the day, he probably would! Being young, despite his size, Ripken likes to chase his tail, which he can't quite seem to catch :) Ripken loves rolling around on his back, and truly enjoys getting his long, silky soft coat brushed to perfection. This smart pup already knows sit, lay down, and even come. With a family who is dedicated to his training, there is no doubt Ripken will mature into a pyrfect gentleman. We believe Ripken would thrive in a home with another playful sibling, preferably a big yard to run around, and most important of all, one where he can get as many belly rubs as he possibly can. Look no further, Pyr lovers, this big, fluffy goofball is bound to bring you endless joy and happiness!
name: Ripken in NJ - pending

description:
Meet the River Litter! This group of pups all named after Rivers are ready to find their forever homes here in New Jersey. They are 3-month-old Boston Terrier/Shepherd mixes. Some of this litter look more on the Boston Terrier side whereas others resemble Shepherds. These pups are as sweet as they come. They enjoy playing with each other, chewing on squeaky toys 3 times their size, and running around in their fosters backyard. They are working super hard on becoming house, leash, and crate trained. They are all getting better and better day by day. This wonderful group of puppies cannot wait to find individual forever families of their very own. 

The River Litter is spayed/neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, and microchipped. 

Home for Good Dog Rescue (HFGDR) is a 100 percent foster-based rescue located in Summit with offices in Berkeley Heights, NJ. All of our dogs live in loving local foster homes until they find forever families of their own. Our fosters begin basic training, housebreaking, and leash walking skills to help pair you with the perfect pup for life! 

In order to apply for adoption and set up an individual meet and greet with one of our dogs, please visit us at www.HomeforGoodDogs.org. 

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/HomeForGoodDogRescue.
name: Missouri

description: RIVER was found running loose on the canal path near the Scudders Falls bridge. RIVER has been in foster and is crate trained and housebroken. RIVER has mastered basic commands and walks well on a leash. RIVER is food-motivated and is very responsive. RIVER is a power-chewer and needs plenty of toys to keep him occupied. RIVER loves to snuggle and seeks affection. RIVER loves to play fetch but hasn't quite figured out how to give up his tennis balls yet. RIVER will make an awesome companion for an active family who can take him hiking/running. RIVER has excelled at adoption events and loves meeting new people. RIVER has met children of varying ages (Youngest was 7) and was gentle taking treats. Please come visit the animals at EASEL Animal Rescue League, behind the Ewing Municipal Building at 4 Jake Garzio Drive, Ewing. Adoption hours are every day from 12-3.

description:
This is Kody! He's a handsome little guy who looks amazing in his recent haircut and doesn't mind playing dress up in honor of the holiday season. Kody came to PAWS in rough shape- skin so itchy and painful he couldn't stop chewing himself and crying, and now with some TLC and special food he's feeling much better! Kody has allergies, so he will need a special diet and medicine to stay happy and healthy. He will also need regular trips to the groomer to keep his 'do looking great, but he also doesn't mind a good brushing, and obviously all the pets you can supply! Kody doesn't mind other polite dogs, and could potentially live with older, teenaged kids.

Age: 6-10 years

Adoption fees are as follows, plus tax: $150 for large adult dogs (older than 1 year); $250 for small dogs (under 25 lbs) and all puppies (under 1 year); $60 for adult cats (over 6 months of age), and $100 for kittens (under 6 months of age). When you adopt a pair of kittens together, the total adoption fee is $150.
PAWS, the Philadelphia Animal Welfare Society, is a 501(c)3 non-profit animal rescue organization dedicated to saving Philadelphia's homeless and at-risk animals. PAWS is the city's largest rescue partner and provider of low-cost, basic veterinary care. Through our adoption locations, special events, and network of foster homes, PAWS finds loving homes for thousands of animals every year. PAWS is working to make Philadelphia a no-kill city where every healthy and treatable pet is guaranteed a home. Please visit www.phillypaws.org for more information on adopting, fostering, volunteering, or donating.

description:
My name is GRIZZLY BEAR and I'm a 1yr M Black Lab/Pit X. I'm 70 lbs of PURE DELICIOUSNESS. Unfortunately my owner is now working 2 jobs and has NO TIME for me,  but he raised me to be a very well mannered, well behaved & balanced dog. I'm housebroken, crate trained, leash trained, know basic commands and am GOOD with DOGS, CATS & KIDS ages 8yrs +.  I'm friendly with all and good with strangers but I will alarm bark if someone is in the hall or knocks on the door. I'm used to living in an apt but would love to be able to run & play in the great outdoors. I'm very strong & play rough with my dad Cairo who is a pitbull, but I love dogs and can be pushy with other dogs but if they do not like to play rough, I will tone it down and I take social cues very well.  Like all puppies, I have lots of energy and could use further training/tweeking  but I am 75% of the way there.  I am an absolute LOVE of dog and like lots of attention,  so I would love to be with a family that is looking for that first time pit x. I need someone to continue the structured training/discipline and exercise that my owner has given me so that I can be on my way to being a PERFECT DOG and an AMBASSADOR for my BREED. I am A GOOD BOY and will make a wonderful LOYAL COMPANION and BFF!!. Come meet me today!

For more info/app; please email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Grizzly Bear

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption (w/ behavior waiver) at ACCT Philly and Available to Love Local Partners with ACCT Philly !!! $200 PLEDGED TOWARD RESCUE CARE Smiley - A39862153 Intake Type: Found stray 10/7 Behavior Observation: Pancaked and trembling at front of kennel. Entirely unresponsive when assessor solicits attention. Overwhelmed and declining in kennel environment. Personality: Meet Smiley! Smiley was found as a stray and brought to the shelter. Smiley is scared of her new, loud environment. When we visited her, she was resting in her kennel. She took treats from us nicely and began to warm up. Once outside of the shelter, her tail was out and wagging and she walked with minimal pulling on the leash. When we got to the dog run, she took time to explore. After a while she came over for some attention. She was definitely more interested in treats, but she didn't mind some pets. When we got back to the shelter, she was tense and nervous again. Smiley needs someone who can give her time to warm up and decompress outside of the shelter. If you can help Smiley, please reach out to Lifesaving! Dog Meet: Smiley and Alana: https://youtu.be/GnQBAccTdUY This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Smiley

description:
Onyx is a 2 year old shar pei that would love a great home of her own.  She came to us with a family of shar peis from our Newark facility when their owner could no longer care for them.  It's a good thing that Onyx was turned in, as she was suffering with severe entropion in both eyes, and had a skin infection.  We sent her for surgery to correct her eyes and she's all cleaned up now and healthy, and she looks and feels like a brand new pup!  Onyx has an air of aloofness about her, but please don't overlook her because of it.  She only needs a few minutes to check you out, then she'll be playing with you, leaning against you for attention, and jumping in circles with happiness when you toss a toy for her.  She is very well mannered, housebroken, and polite.  She gets along with some dogs, but needs time to get to know them.  She will need a home with older kids.  Onyx is such a darling that would be ecstatic to be welcomed into your family.  File#28446  8/24/18

If interested please visit our Forked River Shelter. We are open Mon. - Fri. from 
12:00 P. M. - 6:00 P. M.; and Sat. & Sun. 12:00 P. M. - 5:00 P. M. for directions call 609-693-1900. There is an adoption donation required. The society cannot accept personal checks but we do accept Visa, MC, AE, Discover and cash. As part of our adoption process, we must have proof of residency. Homeowners must show proof of ownership; landlord approval is required for renters before an adoption can be approved.And as always we thank you for your kindness in opening your heart & home to a Society orphan.
name: Onyx

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hello all, my name is Robin and I am looking for forever! I was found as a stray with an old injury to my knee. I have had surgery and am recovering wonderfully! My leg is as good as new, and I can move fast! I am a happy go lucky boy who would love to come home with you. I am fully vetted and play well with others. If you are looking for a new side kick, then look no farther! Go to www.allmuttsmatter.org and apply for me Robin!!

description:
Hi my name is Patty. I am also known as Pretty Patty due to my fabulous markings. I would do best in a home without young children as they are a little too silly for me.

I like to play, enjoy walks in the park and ride very well in the back seat of a car. I even know some commands - Sit, Stay, Crate, Potty and Come. I like other dogs and I even get along with cats. I have traveled so very far to find you, please take the time to come and meet me, I know you wonât be disappointed.

If you'd like to meet me, please fill out an application and be sure to mention my name - PATTY!
name: Patty Steele

description:
Adoptable little Mindy Moo enjoyed an outing with one of our volunteer ambassadors.

Mindy is a sweetheart and quite the leaner /cuddled. She's a very pretty gal with the most expressive brown eyes. Mindy Moo is ready to settle down with a forever family. If you have a canine companion, the shelter staff can help with intros to make sure the dogs are compatible.

If you have children in the family, please bring them in for a visit --it's the best way see if the dog would be a g
ood fit for your family.

Adoption applications are only processed after you visit the shelter and meet the dog in person and speak with one of our adoption counselors.

Please visit www.faithfulfriends.us/adoption-process for more information. Email adoptadog@faithfulfriends.us with any questions.

The shelter is open Wednesday thru Friday from 1 to 7pm and Saturday from noon to 5pm.
name: Mindy Moo Who

description:
Nugget is a rescue with a heart of gold! Energetic, intelligent, and social, Nugget loves playing with other dogs at the local dog daycare and has an A+ report card with every visit. Even though he came to his foster home with no training at all, he already knows how to sit, and he is getting much better on the leash. Nugget loves to play fetch with his Birmingham Barons baseball and stuffed toys. He shows no aggression towards cats or smaller dogs, only some enthusiasm that needs to be tamed a little. Nugget needs a home where he can get lots of attention and exercise--he might even like to have a doggie sibling, as long as they are big enough to love wrestling in the yard! Nugget has all his vaccinations, has been neutered, and tested negative for heartworms.  Nugget would love to be your faithful friend and playmate! He is about a year old.  (posted 3/18)

 

Special Adoption fee: $200 for adoption and transport  

*It is rare that we know with certainty the ages or mixes that make up our wonderful dogs, but we do our best to be as accurate as possible based upon our many years in rescue.**
name: Nugget  R - Lower Fee!

She gets along well with other dogs and would love a dog park family or long walks with her people. She is working on her housebreaking and doing very well. She would be a great addition to a loving family.

If you are interested in this dog, please submit an application directly to our website at www.ny-petrescue.org. Only applications submitted directly to Pet Rescue will be considered.

description: Harmony lost her home after her mom became very sick and could no longer care for her.  Harmony came into the shelter with another dog with whom she spent her entire life with, but that other dog was adopted and left Harmony all alone at the shelter.  She is very shy and frightened at the shelter and needs someone who will be patient, kind and give her the time to adjust to her new life.  She is between 9-10 years of age, lved with another dog and cat.  She would do best in a quiet home with no small children. If you are interested in meeting Harmony stop by the Cape May County Animal Welfare Society Tues-Sunday from 10am-1pm, email us @ cmcaws@yahoo.com or call 609-465-3403
name: Harmony

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption at ACCT Philly!!! Choco - A39903249 Intake Type: Stray Weight: 67lbs Meet our resident hunk Choco (A39903249). This big shepherd mix boy has stolen the hearts of volunteers and staff alike with his gentle demeanor. Chaco appears to be house trained, and relieves himself as soon as he gets outside. He is a calm fella, and enjoys walking around the shelter grounds with a volunteer buddy. Choco's not much of a kisser, but he does lean in to his friends and give a gentle nose bop--it's the cutest thing! And loves to receive pets as well! If Chaco sounds like he could be the right dog for you, head down to ACCT today and make it official! Bring along the family--furry and nonfurry members--to meet our gentle boy too! Medical Observation: Skin Issues: Dry Skin on Neck, tail. description:
Colorado is a 7 year old Lab mix who is up for adoption. He was adopted from us years ago. Born April 2011. He's 50lb and up to date on all shots. He is a shy dog, and needs proper introduction to strangers who enter the home as he can be nippy or bite. He is not good with any other dogs, and is good with cats. he would do best in a very quiet area, as loud noises frighten him. He knows tricks such as give paw, sit, down, stay, jump, roll on your belly. He loves his crate and is completely housetrained. Never ever barks or destroys any furniture. He's very low energy and mostly sleeps all day. 

Email harescue1@aol.com or haar13@aol.com to inquire.

He is also on fosterdogsnyc if you would like to inquire: http://fosterdogsnyc.com/meet-colorado-the-mellow-lab-mix/
name: Riley aka Colorado

description: Brody is a new addition to JSAC. His owner has a terminal illness and family was trying to get things in order. Sadly it seems that Brody was not treated so nicely as he appears fearful and cowers when approached. There were 2 other dogs in the home that family stepped up to take but no one had room for this guy. Brody is an extra large boy weighing in at over 100 lbs. He is a Lab/Shepherd mix about 1 1/2 years old. We are looking for a home that can give this boy the love and attention he needs. He has not had much training. We had Brody neutered and he is now ready for his forever home. Even though he lived with 2 dogs prior, we have not been able to find him a suitable playmate here. Best suited in a home that has dog experience. Brody is waiting for his second chance. *Per JSAC policy, puppies and kittens under 6 months will not be adopted to families with children under the age of 6 years.
name: Brody

description:
"Hi there!  I'm Mauricio, a big gentleman in search of a nice comfy couch where I can binge-watch all of Humphrey Bogart's movies. I'm about three years old and enjoy the company of other dogs, so much so that I needs to have at least one other doggy friend in my forever home. I can be a bit shy, and need to take things at my own pace to feel comfortable, but I promise that I really am a sweetheart once I warm up!  I'd love a home where I can sample the world's cheeses and charcuterie with a dog friend or two... doesn't that sound fun? I'm up to date on vaccines, neutered, and micro-chipped.  I weigh about 70 pounds and am currently waiting for my forever home to come find him and scoop him up!  I can't wait to move in with my very own perfect family and hope that family is adults only... I'm an old soul and do better with older people, ya know?  I'm waiting at Providence Animal Center for that perfect family to come get me and my friend Marissa is helping me to find the very best fit!  If you think I could be your guy, all you need to do is send a completed adoption application to her at mgiangiordano@providenceac.org!  She can schedule a time for you to come see me and fall in love!  I can't wait to meet you!  Love, Mauricio"

P.S. Here's the link to the adoption application!  I want to make this easy for you!  https://www.providenceac.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/PROV_Dog-Adoption-App_2017.pdf

Oh! I almost forgot!  Someone is so eager to help mefind his perfect home that they have sponsored my adoption fee!  I can go home with you today for free!

Providence Animal Center is funded solely by adoption fees and donations. Adoption fees vary per animal, please call the Adoption Center and reference this animal's ID number in order to obtain accurate fee information. The petfinder.com system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed blend for our dogs. We have chosen âMixed Breedâ as this predominant breed for our dogs. Around 75% of dogs in shelters are mixed breed dogs, meaning they have many different genes that make up their personality, the way they look and everything in between. Here at Providence Animal Center, weâve made the decision that we no longer want to speculate the dogâs breed. Why? Because visual breed identification has been proven to be extremely inaccurate. What we can tell you is the dogâs weight, approximate age and his or her personality traits. Many progressive shelters like ours are moving toward not adding a breed label â in an effort to be honest and transparent. To read more about our initiative to treat each dog as an individual, please read our note on our website: http://www.providenceac.org/removing-breed-labels-homeless-pets/

To foster or adopt this dog please call Providence Animal Center at 610-566-1370 during adoption hours. You may also email adoptions@providenceac.org. Can't foster or adopt? Donate to help our homeless pets, www.providenceac.org/donate.

Our adoption requirements and a printable application form may be found on our website. With your adoption fee you get a lot for FREE! All the pets adopted from Providence Animal Center are given wellness exams, are spayed/neutered, fully vaccinated, dewormed and microchipped. Additionally, dogs over 7 months old are heartworm tested and all felines are tested for FELV/FIV. Adopters may receive discounted wellness care from our adoptions health department, and also get a complimentary wellness visit at a participating private veterinary practice up to 30 days post-adoption and the pets are given personality evaluations. It doesn't stop there- a gift of one month of pet health insurance is included along with unlimited phone consultations and e-mail exchanges with our trained feline and canine behavior experts.

Not ready to adopt yet? You can still guarantee the safety and well-being of any of our dogs or puppies by temporarily fostering one or more right in your own home. Visit our foster page to learn about the program. Then, email your application along with any questions to foster@providenceac.org for immediate review.

Providence Animal Center 555 Sandy Bank Rd Media PA 19063 (610) 566-1370
Adoption fees are subject to change due to specials or variable pricing. If you are over 55 years old,  adopt any dog 5 years or older for only $55.50- included are free  vaccinations for the following year. For more information on monthly  specials, check our facebook page- Facebook.com/ProvidenceAnimalCenter. For more information on variable  pricing, ask our staff members.
name: Mauricio * Sponsored Fee *

description: Rosie is a 1 yr young female mixed breed pup approx 25 lbs.  She would love a home with another dog to play with.  Rosie is very sweet and gentle she loves to give kisses.  She has been an amazing mom to her 7 pups as well as a helper momma for several other litters who have passed through her foster home.  It's her turn to be loved and spoiled in a forever home! For more info and an application please contact kris at kobemnstr@hotmail.com
name: Rosie

description: Dino is the best! He loves everyone and all dogs. He is 2.5 years old and about 66 lbs of a laid back mush and love. Well mannered and eager to please, this boy will make a wonderful family dog. He still needs some training, as he is not great with commands - but he is really well mannered and loving, considering he had never been in a home until the last few months! A must meet, for he is so much more handsome in person and will steal your heart, for sure! Just a great dog! (Fostered in PA) (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there is clearly something wrong with your email!) Dog's Best Friend Adoption Center utilizes an adoption application and screening process. We require personal and vet references and a home check made prior to adopting one of our dogs. All of our dogs are companion animals that must be kept inside the house with the rest of the family members. All of our dogs are temperament tested, well mannered, and know some basic commands ~ they are worked with daily, as someone is always here with them. All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats. Adoption donations range from $250 to $450, depending on breed, age, size, vetting, and training of the dog (some pure bred and tiny dog fees are higher). This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care. Dog's Best Friend dogs truly make wonderful family pets. Please  email us for an application. (If you email us and do not hear back from us within 24 hours, please try again, as we most likely did not receive your email!) (Also note that many of our dogs are fostered just across the border into PA)
name: Dino (Great Dog/Laid Back)

description: Hi! My name is Hank Jr and I am a super playful, fun loving 1 year old hound mix. I love everyone and everything and my tail never stops wagging! I am always up for a game or an adventure. I would love to go hiking or play fetch or learn new tricks. Since I am a strong dog with a lot of energy I would do best with an active family. Would you like to make me a part of your family? Please ask the staff to meet me today!
name: Hank Jr.

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Brimmey was rescued from NYC ACC. She was born in mid-2015 and is 49 pounds.
