description:
Social media sensation Lele Pons is hoping youâll like her pictures! Lele is a 4.5-pound Chihuahua mix who is a little less than two years old. This tricolor, pointy-eared beauty is a sweet girl who already has some training â in fact, sheâs already housebroken on puppy pads. Lele has had a loving home before â she was partner in crime to an older gentleman who is now in a nursing home indefinitely. Now, Lele is looking forward to meeting her new family. You can probably tell from the pictures, but this dollface is the perfect size for a house or apartment.

Lele is spayed, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines. Email seespotrescued@gmail.com for an adoption application or fill it out online at seespotrescued.org. Check out more photos on Facebook.com/seespotrescued of all our adoptable pups!

description: !!! AVAILABLE for Adoption at ACCT Philly!!! JAY - A40156130 This adorable little pocket pitty is Jay. Her previous owner said that she gets playful sometimes, but is mainly a couch potato. She had a 2 year-old human sister and some doggy brothers in her past home that she absolutely adored! Jay is not so sure how she ended up in the shelter, but this sweet lady is ready to find her new furever family! Intake Type: Owner surrender on 12/04 due to no longer being able to care for Weight: 51 lbs. Medical Observation: Ear canals red due to overall excitement. Intact female. Behavior Observation: Per old owner: is playful and a couch potato, interacts well with 2 year old. Interacts well with male dogs. Interacted fine with female dog (Fancy), seemed uninterested but sniffed one another with lifesaving staff on 12/06. Does not interact well with cats per previous owner. Personality: This is Jay! She is an adorable little pocket pitty who is estimated to be 5 years old. She was surrendered to our shelter because her old owner is heavily pregnant and can no longer care for Jay. Per the old owner Jay is described as playful, but also a couch potato. She has interacted well with their 2 year old and male dogs, but per old owner does not get along with cats or female dogs. When Jay was taken out by lifesaving staff, she did interact with another female dog named Fancy, both were very uninterested in one another, but sniffs were exchanged and there were no issues with the interaction at all. Jay is a sweet lady that is ready to find with new furever family! Can you help make that dream become a reality? This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Jay

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Marcy and Miley! Marcy is an 8 month old female and Miley is a 3 month old male. They are Shepherd mixes who share the same mom, and they come into rescue from Texas. Marcy and Miley have only ever known a life of suffering and neglect and we vow to change that now that they are part of the Rescue Dogs Rock family! When they came to us they were both very anemic, had gashes all over their bodies, and were emaciated with hair loss and very infected skin. You could see that they were just so exhausted and worn out from scrounging for every meal and living on the streets. They are getting some much needed TLC and all the medical care they need with our vet partner and soon will be ready to begin their fabulous new lives! They are very bonded as all they have had is each other to survive, so we need to find an amazing forever home where they get to stay together. Two is always better especially with this adorable pair! They are very sweet and friendly and do well with people of all ages and other dogs. They will be spayed/neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in their forever home. If you are ready for double the puppy love and cuddles, and the joy of being able to finally show this dynamic duo what it finally means to live the good life, please fill out an adoption application for Marcy and Miley here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Marcy and Miley

description: Grit is a Flyers fan. Maybe they named their mascot after him? He is wearing his Flyers orange collar. He loves to watch the games with friends. He like snacks that come with these watch parties....chips, peanuts, and popcorn, yum! Grit is a low-key guy with great manners and droopy "Eyeore" ears.
name: Grit

description: Peyton has the cutest underbite ever!!! He walks well on a leash and likes to meet new people. After spending a few years in a home, he was returned recently to Eleventh Hour Rescue because he must be the only dog. If you have a quiet home that is looking for a furry companion, look no further, Peyton is the furkid for you.
name: Peyton Wilson

description:
Emma is a 3 year old, 5lb spayed female Chihuahua who came to NYC from Los Angeles. 

Emma is a cute lil firecracker, who takes a little time to warm up to people. Once she does, she is all hugs and kisses! Emma gets along with cats, but unfortunately doesn't seem to get along too much with dogs (especially females). Therefore she is looking to be the only dog. 

She walks well on a leash, great in a carrier and crate, and potty trained to go outside and pads. This little girl is even great with baths! Due to her nervousness and size, a household with small children is NOT recommend. If you are interested in Emma, please reach out to us.

Emma was rescued in LA as part of our Waggy West rescue mission to bring At Risk dogs, one by one to NYC for adoption! 

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application on the CONTACT US page. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to

Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.com

Fosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.com

PLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked "Adoption Pending" have an approved adoption application on file and are awaiting final approval. Please check back in a few days to see if they are still available!

We understand you may have questions but the fastest way to get answers is to fill out the application and the foster parent can answer any questions you may have!

Waggytail Rescue CAN NOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you!
name: Emma!

description: Hi there! I'm Rover and I am currently interviewing people to be part of my forever family! This is a very special position because whoever I choose will reap the benefits of a sweet, loving dog who is loyal and will love you forever! This person must enjoy strolls through the park and playtime. Those who bring me yummy treats will be instantly placed on the list of people I love. Please ask a staff member today if we can take some time to get to know one another!
name: Rover

description:
Available for adoption: Around August 2018
Penny has just recently joined our rescue. She was very stressed in the shelter and has been taking some time to get settled in. She is doing great so far! She is good with other dogs, cats, and kids. Penny is starting Heartworm treatment and will be up for adoption soon. Penny was formerly known as Verna.
Want to learn more about one of the dogs we have up for adoption? Fill out our adoption application!!

TRANSPORT AVAILABLE TO APPROVED HOMES! (Generally, within 1500 miles)

name: Penny (TX)

description: Bonnie is one of our cutest pups, with a very endearing personality to match. She is sweet mixture of a beagle and a pit bull dog and possesses all the goodness of both of those breeds. She is an especially intelligent girl who will fall very much in love with her family and be completely devoted to them.Bonnie will make you feel very special because she takes her time to get to know people. She is very intuitive and knows how to size people up to decide if they are worthy of her trust and friendship. That is probably because she was not treated with much kindness before she came to us but once she understood that people can be kind and the world can be good, her radiant smile showed us how grateful she is to have friends. And her huge loving hugs lets us know how important her friends are to her.You will make Bonnie's day when you let her know that she is coming along with you on any outing at all. She lights up when she knows that she is about to go for a walk or a car ride or even just some cuddle time, and will be the happiest dog in the world just to be with you. Even though she has had sadness in her life , with RBARI's guidance she has blossomed into beautiful, joyful dog. We want Bonnie's forever family to have loads of time and patience for her and continue to shower her with gentleness and love. Because she is our very special girl.Note: Bonnie requires an adult-only home. Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Brown Age: 4yrs 1mths 2wks Animal has been Spayed
name: Bonnie

description:
** Come and meet Olaf in person on Sunday, November 18th from 11 am until 2 pm at Pet Valu in Wayne, NJ**

Welcome to our Pathway family Olaf!Â 

Olaf is a gorgeous husky with beautiful blue eyes that will enchant you.Â 
He is a silly boy who does a little dance with his front paws when he is excited.Â Â 

He has the typical husky energy and intelligence. He loves going in the yard to play with his friends at daycare and has been great with all people he has met, adult, kids and dogs.Â 
He likes to exercise outside and run and play and then get hugs and kisses and snuggles from his people.Â 
He would make an amazingly handsome addition to your family!
name: Olaf

description:
MINNIE-MOO is a female 5 yo/8 lb black with tan & white Chihuahua who was used as a breeding dog as indicated by her notched ears. She has very dry skin which results in flaking and is treated with a "Head & Shoulders" type shampoo. She is extremely active as you can see in her videos. She also calms down and likes to sit or lay in your lap. She is very intelligent and loves to play with toys especially squeakers. Removing the squeakers is her main objective. Minnie-Moo would do well with an active older couple as an only dog. She gets along with the other small dogs here but is kind of a bully. Does not like medium or larger dogs. Not sure about cats.

There is an adoption process consisting of an application, home visit, contract and adoption fee. Wilma's Orphans is a 501c3 Not for Profit rescue organization. Any and all donations are tax deductible. If you are interested in this dog go to

www.wilmasorphans.com for the link to the adoption application.
12/7/18 4:25 PM
name: MINNIE-MOO

The adoption fee is $120 and includes spay/neuter surgery, rabies and booster shots, heart worm and Lyme disease tests. All adoption fees must be paid in cash or money order.
name: Bret

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Slater! Slater is a 2 year old Chihuahua mix, and is 10 pounds of absolute cuteness! He comes into rescue from Texas. Slater is currently with our Texas vet partner where he will need surgery on his leg. When Slater has recovered he would really like to have a forever family ready and waiting for him! He is not only the most handsome little guy, but is great with people of all ages and other dogs...he doesnât have a mean bone in his body! Slater is amazing at snuggles and has lots of sweet kisses to offer. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Slater the newest member of your family and love of your life, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application
name: Slater

description:
PLEASE FILL OUT OUR ONLINE APPLICATION BY COPYING THIS LINK INTO YOUR BROWSER: https://form.jotform.com/60475571571156. We adopt within a 30 minute drive of Glen Rock or Wayne, NJ. Other locations will be considered on a case-by-case basis depending on the availability of a home visit.

Oh by gosh by golly, this is one stunning pooch!  Dasher is one of our reindeer pups and he's ready to board the freedom sleigh and come up north to his FOREVER family. He is a 12 week old, 15 lb Lab mix (best guess!) with amazing green eyes and beautiful golden coloring. He's all about having fun with her people (big and small!) and enjoys a game of chase the pup with her siblings. 

Dasher is neutered, up to date on vaccines and micro chipped. Please understand when selecting an adopter for a puppy, we look for a home where someone will be home with the puppy the majority of the time. Puppies require constant attention to help them with house training and to learn other good dog behavior. He also REQUIRES a fenced in yard, non-electric, no exceptions for this litter.

Our dogs have an adoption fee that ranges from $375-$425. To ensure our pets go to the best possible homes, we are only able to adopt within a 30 minute drive from Wayne or Glen Rock, NJ unless we have a representative in your area to complete the home inspection.
name: Dasher

description: Mason is a sweetheart of a young boy, but is on the shy side, and comes off as a bit skittish with new people - but eagerly gives trust to a patient and kind person! Trust us, these are some of the most rewarding dogs to adopt!  He does like to chew but with toys and gentle correction on the "no chew" items he is making great progress.  We feel a home with a fenced-in yard and at least one other dog will be hugely beneficial to Mason's playful hound side, and will also aid in alleviating some of his anxieties with another pack dog to learn from! He is already housebroken so we spend all of our time working on breaking through his shell a bit, and it has been a joy to see him come as far as he has!
name: Mason

description: My name is BUSTER BROWN & I'm an adorabull 3yr M Brindle/White Staffie Bull Terrier/ English Bulldog X. I'm a a little compact guy but I'm a solid 70lbs of PURE WUGGIE LOVE!! I'm very strong but am well trained on the leash. I love to play with balls but once I get ahold of them it's hard to take them from me as I have that English Bulldog stubborness. I seem to be ok with other dogs running side by side in a fenced yard but haven't had much socialization with dogs off leash. Because of my strength and bully attitude, it's best if I were a "solo" dog and not be with young kids or cats. I need to be with someone who has had previous experience with my breed and can understand and appreciate me. Please come meet/adopt me today!!
name: Buster Brown

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Boston is a 5 year old male Chihuahua/Rat Terrier blend who comes to rescue from Texas. He is up to date on shots (age appropriate) and will be neutered prior to placement in his forever home. He is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. Precious little Boston doesn't look to have had the best of life up to this point, it appears he has a touch of untreated mange and secondary skin infections, but he is receiving treatment for that and will be ready in no time! Moving forward, he will definitely get only the best, and we know his forever family is out there looking for him. Is that you? Apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Boston

description:
To apply:
1.  You must reside within our adoptable states: NY, NJ, CT, RI, MA, VT, NH, PA, DE, MD, VA 
2. AND you MUST submit our online application, please visit http://www.nyabandonedangels.com/adopt-or-foster-application

Meet BOXER! This handsome and super friendly 20 pound, 18 month old Mini Pin mix is looking to spread some holiday cheer! Boxer was recently surrendered by his family due to lack of time. Boxer is great with everyone including children and other dogs, cats unknown. He has a lot of playful, puppy energy so a home with an active family would be ideal. He would make a good walking, jogging, hiking partner etc. and even just a happy spectator at kids games. Boxer is neutered, UTD on vaccines, HW negative. He will require further training in housebreaking, other then that, heâs the complete package. If you would to add some holiday Mini Pin magic to your life, please complete an application at www.nyabandonedangels.com to foster or adopt BOXER!
name: Boxer

description: Want to meet me? Come down to our Port Washington, NY Adoption Center.
name: Finley

breeds: Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
No need to say "smile!" when taking Gloria's photo -- she's always smiling! 
This 6 year old girl loves car rides, trips to the park, hikes, jogs, walks, playing with her wubba toy, and just being with her human BFFs. 
She's house trained and enjoys her overnights in our trainer's office. She doesn't like playing with other dogs (or living with them), but she's just fine walking around the shelter and wiggling at everyone she meets. 
If you're looking for a road dog, a runnin' buddy, the Thelma to your Louise -- come meet Gloria and let the adventures begin!
name: GLORIA - Courtesy post for the SPCA

description: !!! Located at ACCT Philly, 111 W Hunting Park Avenue, Philadelphia PA !!! This animal may be available through ACCT Phillys Adoption Program. As this pet goes through the shelter processes, medical and behavior information are updated here! They may become specially promoted for Events or our Adoptions Programs, or may require transfer through our Love Local Program as more information is known. We are the Animal Control facility for Philadelphia, and we are open for adoption, foster and rescue placement Monday through Friday from 1pm to 7pm, Weekends and Holidays from 10 am to 5pm. To view our list of adoptable animals, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/. To learn more about our Love Local Program, please visit http://www.acctphilly.org/programs/lovelocal/. Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Hulk

description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
6 years old.

Thank you for your interest in adopting a rescued Basset Hound! We ask all potential adopters to complete our application and approval process first so we can discuss the dogs that fit your home. We usually have 25 - 35 dogs available and the ages range from less than year old to ten plus years old. Once we receive your application you'll be contacted by an adoption representative to complete the application process. We look forward to speaking with you about our wonderful hounds waiting for forever homes!!!
name: BLACK JACK

description:
Brooklyn is an awesome, goofy girl! She is extremely friendly and affectionate. Brooklyn likes to walk and sometimes even looks like she is skipping. She pulls some on the leash and is still strong for her age. Brooklyn loves balls, especially balls that squeak and she likes to walk around with them in her mouth. She knows "sit" and is eager to please. Brooklyn is looking for a home without small children, but older children should be fine. Brooklyn is 8 years old and was surrendered because her owner was moving and the new landlord would not allow dogs.

Our adoption fee is $60 per pet with a discount available for adopting two animals together. All animals from the Franklin Township Animal Shelter are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and up-to-date on all age-appropriate shots prior to adoption. Dogs have also been tested for heartworm.

Please stop by the shelter Tuesday-Friday 12-3pm or Saturday 12-6pm and meet all of our animals.
name: Brooklyn

description: My name is Beauty, and as you can tell, they named me that because I am so beautiful! I am a 1 year old Mixed Breed who was brought the Brandywine Valley SPCA through the Second Chance Program. I am a super sweet girl who likes going on walks and playing in the play yard, especially if you have toys to toss around! I have been in play goups before but was a bit too dominant to play appropriately. I would probably need to be an only pet, but could be around other dogs, if given direction. I can be a bit jumpy so I am looking for a forever family who has patience and dedication to show me basic manners. I would need to meet all members of the family before going home with them and would be best with older children. I have so much love in my heart to give, please come meet me today and see how I can change your world but better yet, change mine!
name: Beauty

description:
*COURTESY POST* 

This is TITAN.. a handsome 6/7 yr M Tan/White Amstaff/Mastiff X. He's 70 lbs of PURE HUNK O' LOVE. He's a sugar sweet big boy and loves all humans and wonderful with kids. He's good with large calm dogs but not good with small dogs and cats. Unfortunately an incident occurred where a neighbors small dog got in Titan's face barking  aggressively and Titan grabbed it and due to the extent of the injury, it did not make it. As a result due to the city ordinances, Titan had to leave the area or be euthanized. It's unfortunate and tragic what happened and no one ever wants a pet to die but accidents happen and what's even more tragic is that another dog will lose it's life for nothing more than being a dog! Still, Titan is an AMAZINGLY SWEET LOVING BOY - and he deserves a second chance!!! PLS HELP this WUGGIE WOO see another day and live his life to the fullest!! 

For more info.. pls send your PH# via email to: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Titan

description: Primary Color: White Secondary Color: Black Age: 0yrs 9mths 1wks
name: Vicki

description:
Age: 9 months
Weight: 40 lbs
Hello! Iâm Sasha. Iâm an adolescent girl who thinks just about anything is fun! At first glance, people will notice what a slim girl I am. Iâm naturally skinny with long legs. Iâm still looking to learn some new tricks and people to meet. I will do best in a home with no other dogs.

Here is what Animal Havenâs trainer has to say about me: 

Sasha is a young, playful, active and affectionate girl.  She loves people and is very snuggly once she is properly exercised.  She would do best in an experienced, adult-only household as the only animal.  She is very easy to motivate and train, and with structure and consistency does quite well in a home.  She can be selective with dogs, which makes walking her a full-focus activity (no texting and walking!).  We have been training her to lessen her reactivity and sheâs made progress but will need someone who is committed to continuing her training plan and helping manage her environment on walks to help keep her feeling safe.  She would also benefit from someone who is very active â if youâre looking for a jogging partner, Sasha is your girl!  She loves to play tug and fetch and has learned âdrop itâ on command.  She also benefits greatly from daily mental enrichment, such as puzzle food toys, to keep her occupied and work her brain.  Donât worry â weâll give you plenty of trainer support and help with all these things.  In return, she will be an adventurous companion and people will stop you on the street to compliment how stunning and unique she is!


 
- See more at: https://www.animalhavenshelter.org/adopt/animals/sasha/#sthash.kDYjW1Yt.dpuf
name: Sasha

description: 6 Nov 2018: Our beautiful Calette is still looking for a home. She was dumped at a shelter and ended up on the kill list. We just couldn't let such a young, vibrant dog be put down for absolutely no good reason. Calette is a young staffie, about 2 years old, spayed, up to date on all her shots, and micro chipped . She is fine with other dogs with proper introductions. She is crate trained and house broken. She has no guarding issues. Our girl, loves belly rubs and snuggles on the couch--we think she is the whole package!! Calette has so much love to give, whoever adopts her will consider themselves extremely lucky to have found such a fun, sweet, loving ,and loyal dog. And who can resist those ears !!! Please fill out a application!!
name: Calette

description: If interested please call Gizela at 201-655-5059 for more information. Not all the animals posted come to our adoption days so call to see if the particular pet you are interested in will be at one of our locations or another time may be able to be arranged. Adoption fees apply and range but includes: clean bill of health, spay/neuter, vaccinations, heart worm testing, 1 year supply of heart worm preventative, micro-chipping & registration. Angels For Animals Network adopts to loving, indoor homes. We DO NOT adopt to anyone under 21 without parental consent. Please note that we DO NOT ship animals, and only adopt to the Tri-State area and some parts of Pennsylvania.  We prefer to keep our adoptions local, and strive to find the best homes for our rescued friends.  Once we review your application, we can better access if a specific animal is well-suited for your home environment and your lifestyle.   ***WE ALWAYS NEED FOSTER HOMES***
name: Kora

description:
Dani is a sweet little girl, currently in foster care in a home with children. She does great with people, children and other dogs. She is estimated to be around 7 years old and vets believe she is a shih tzu mix. Microchipped, up to date on vaccines and spayed. This gorgeous little girl is looking for a new lease on life.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Dani

description:
Declan was born January 8, 2018. Weighing in at only 35lbs, he is a subcompact fellow of the  beagle lab mix variety.  He loves to swim, hike, run and do anything his human is doing.  He is a fantastic cuddler who loves to snuggle up on the couch and cuddle up with you at night.  He prefers to be the only dog in his new home, however.  He has found that he really doesn't like sharing his people or his things with other canines.  It's just not his thing.  He does get along well with cats in his foster home, though he does play a little rough sometimes.  He is good with farm animals as well and is especially fond of the goats.  We recommend him in a home with older children since he has not lived with children as of yet.  If you are an outgoing, fun loving, outdoorsy, adventurous soul then Declan is the guy for you!

Declan is up to date on all of his vaccines, and has been neutered and microchipped and is on flea/tick/HW preventative.  His adoption fee is $325.

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING, PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS:

Do not use the Petfinder links to ask us about our adoptable dog listings - we do not always receive these messages! 

Instead, please visit our website at www.roadtriprescues.com to inquire about an adoptable pet, and to complete our online adoption application! You can also find us on Facebook (Road Trip Rescues) and send us a message!

PLEASE NOTE THAT ONLY APPROVED ADOPTERS WILL BE PERMITTED TO MEET OUR RESCUES - WE ARE A FOSTER BASED RESCUE AND ALL OF OUR DOGS LIVE WITH US AS FAMILY. 

Thanks for considering a rescue pup!
name: Declan

description:
Hi! Iâm Sake, I was found in a shelter in the mountains of TN.  My foster mom says Iâm a jewel because I have manners & Iâm house trained. I have that Tzu chill zen vibe she saysâ¦whatever that means. I like the kids here, the mister & their dog.  I have an adorable underbite that always makes me look like Iâm smiling. I enjoy a nice warm bath, doesnât everyone?  I would love to find my furever home where I can play and snuggle all the time.  I am a 16 lb Shih Tzu mix and am almost 7 years old.
Please visit our main site for more information or to apply to adopt.
name: Sake

description: This 3 year old Pit mix is Pixie. Pixie is friendly and extremely people focused. She loved the extra one on one attention she received during her evaluation. Pixie sat on command for a treat, which she accepted softly from our fingers. She had no issues sharing her toys or bone whenever asked. Pixie was relaxed with all handling as she ate from her food bowl. She was uncomfortable meeting the other dogs outside and would do best as the only pet in the household. Stop by and meet this gorgeous girl today.
name: PIXIE 29141

description:
Please share teddybear Amory ??????

Amory , look at that face ... you just want to kiss that face all over .

Another sweetheart that was ready to be killed in San Antonio's highest kill shelter .

No worries anymore for him because he came safe under our wings .

This very happy boy who behaves like a little puppy is 2 years old and is good with other dogs but not cats .

We would love to see this sweety in a new family where they will spoil him, play with him and love him for the rest of his life .

This pretty boy deserves only the best in life .

He is located in Middle Island NY

To become his new family please apply today by filling in the adoption application on our website www.a-teameliterescuedogs.com or email us and ask one
name: Amory

description:
Charwill Rescue in  Schuylkill County has multiple available dogs. Please contact them directly   at    www.charwillsgsdrescuekennels.com

Check their web site for additional info.  This is a courtesy post. We work with this rescue but have nothing to do with their adoptions. Please contact them directly
German Shepherd rescue of Southeastern PA works with this rescue but we are not part of their rescue and require different  paperwork. Her is their web address 
 www.charwillsgsdrescuekennels.com
name: Many GSD's available

description:
My name is EGYPT and I'm a darling 11 yr  M White/Black Jack Russell Terrier X. I'm 13 lbs of PURE SWEET OL' BOY. I was surrendered by my owner due to cost. But one person's discards are another one's treasure and I am a sweet senior gem of a dog.  I am shy and nervous when I first meet you but after I warm up I'm right by your side. I am very quiet, not a barker and not high energy like most JRTs. I am fine with dogs but don't like them when they are too playful/pushy,  so I'd prefer to be an only dog or to be with another quiet senior dog or cat as I'm fine with cats. I am also ok with older kids ages 10 yrs + as little kids are too energetic for me and I will stay away from them.  I'm perfectly content to sit by your side to watch TV or curl in my bed by your feet. I'm looking for an quiet home preferably with a retired person or couple that will make me the "apple of their eye" IF you fit the bill please come meet me today!

For more info/app; please email: CECE@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG
name: Egypt

description:
Blue was  born at the shelter 5 years ago!!! Unfortunately, due to a change in her former owners housing restrictions, Blue is back at her birthplace looking for another home. 

She is a 5 year old Blue Nose Pit Terrier, UTD on vaccines, spayed, dewormed, HW negative, and received flea and tick treatment. She is very people friendly, but doesnât seem to like most dogs. Because she lived as the only pet her whole life, she will do best in a home without dogs or cats.

Meet her during daily adoption hours Mon-Fri 2pm-5pm, Wed 2pm-6pm, Sat-Sun 1pm-5pm.
name: Blue

description:
Bio coming soon

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Samburu

description: Otis got sprung from his kennel for this picture. That is why he looks so happy. Otis is a sweet guy with some minor skin issue on his back.
name: Otis

description: Matt is a very sweet, well-behaved, loving senior Italian Greyhound. He is around 10 years old. He came in with his partner, Miss Kitty.  Matt and Miss Kitty are very bonded, so they MUST BE PLACED TOGETHER AS A PAIR. Please give this pair a chance at a forever home. They are so full of love!
name: Matt

description: Scully's the Mom and Mulder's the son.  They are both friendly, active pets who love each other's company. Mulder is the foxy, trusting one, while Scully is very curious. Ambassadors in the making, they  quickly learned basic manners and leash walking skills.
name: Mulder

description:
This handsome boy is Gene. Poor Gene was tied to a tree one night at PAHS after we closed. Can you imagine just watching your owner drive away?!? ? 
Gene is middle aged and could use some training. He is very willing to learn! He will do best with someone who has big dog experience and no small pets in the home. If you have bigger dogs you can bring them in to meet him. Come on down and meet this boy. We told him we will find him a family to love him and treat him like a valued family member.
name: Gene

description:
This pint-sized guy is Irwin who hails from Kentucky where he was found as a stray. He ended up being rescued & will soon make his way to NJ to find a forever home. He's a playful pup who is about 2 years old & weighs only 17 pounds - a great size for any situation!

Irwin is a fun-loving little dog and he gets along with other dogs as well as with people. If you'd like to meet him, please fill out an application and be sure to say you'd like to meet IRWIN KY!
name: Irwin KY

description: Cookie is a 2yr Lab mix girl. She was Rescued from a kill shelter in NC. She weighs about 45lbs. She is currently treating for a mild case of heartworm. She will be Spayed and Microchipped prior to Adoption. She loves to run and play with other dogs and is very affectionate with people. No Cats for her though. Cookie is a very sweet and loving girl, just waiting on a Family! Cookies Adoption fee is $300.  Applications are done by phone. 609-204-4138
name: Cookie

description:
Jasper : Majestic, stately, dignified, distinguished, solemn, magnificent, grand. All this describes this gorgeous Labrador blend. Jasper would be an excellent companion! He is loyal and dedicated to the people he loves. He is looking for an experienced owner that is patient and understanding. A little about him from his favorite volunteer:

Jasper is a 7 year young gentleman. He is good on a leash, takes treats softly, loves people and enjoys tender back scratches. His is generally mellow and patient, but always up for fun - his face lights up when it is his turn to go out. This devoted companion loves long brisk walks, calmly exploring along the way. He could benefit from regular exercise to lose a pound or two. He also enjoys just relaxing with his favorite people. If you would like to meet Jasper, please fill out our dog adoption application online at pawscrossedny.org

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.
name: Jasper

description:
Joryn is estimated to be about 8 months old, and weighed in at 10.4 pounds at her last vet visit. She is a happy little girl joining us on November 10th. All of our pups remain with us in foster care for at least 14 days, during this time we will be reviewing applications. Jordyn is up to date on vaccines, microchipped and will be spayed prior to adoption.

Interested in adopting me? To fill out an application visit 3 Hearts 4 Paws
name: Jordyn

description:
Sammy is a very friendly dog.  This sweet fellow is looking for a furever family who will shower him with TLC, make sure he is never hungry again and give him a warm bed to sleep in for the rest of his life.  Sammy tested positive for Ehrlichia, a common tick borne disease similar to Lyme's.  He has completed his course of antibiotic treatment and feeling great.  Sammy is 5 years old and 21 pounds. Please help Sammy find the loving home he deserves.

**We currently have 2 dogs with similar names.  Please refer to this dog as Sammy to avoid any delays in processing your application.

If you are interested in adopting, we encourage you to please submit an application on our website today so that we can try and process and pre-approve any potential adopters prior to our next adoption event.

PLEASE USE THIS LINK TO SUBMIT AN ADOPTION APPLICATION. WE ONLY ACCEPT ADOPTION APPLICATIONS THROUGH OUR WEBSITE. ANY OTHERS WILL NOT BE PROCESSED.
Application link here: http://www.oscaranimalrescue.org/oscar-1-application.html

Adoption Process:
1.Fill out an application
2.Meet & Greet
3.Adoption contract & adoption fee
Sammy's adoption fee is $325. This covers all age-appropriate shots, vetting & microchipping.

**If you are coming to an adoption event to see a certain dog/cat, please email ahead of time to make sure that dog/cat will be there that day. Please email 1-2 days before the event, as some animals are placed during the week and our list is constantly changing.
For a list of upcoming pet adoption events go to: www.OscarAnimalRescue.org

One Step Closer Animal Rescue is a 501c3 non-profit organization. Donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE to the extent allowed by law. If you would like to make a donation to help us rescue more animals please send donations to PO Box 248, Sparta, NJ 07871. Please make your check payable to O.S.C.A.R.. Thank you for helping us save as many lives as we can.

Don't forget to "Like Us" on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/pages/One-Step-Closer-Animal-Rescue-OSCAR/462492563811538
name: Sammy

description: Lola (white / black) and Chico (black / tan) are the sweetest little pair. Their owners suddenly passed away and now their sister is desperately trying to find them new homes. They left 4 dogs, and chico and lola are a bonded pair from them. They have been together their entire lives, and after losing their best friends we cannot separate them. Both Lola and Chico are chihuahua mixes and about 9 years old. They are extremely laid back and low maintenance dogs. They are happy to just lay around with their people all day. They are very sweet and loving. They will make a great companion for an older person who is not too active. If you would like to give Lola and Chico a home together, fill out an online application at bcaaofnj.org
name: Lola and Chico

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Belle is a stunning, ~5 yr. old., female, spayed, ~Pit Bull/ Pointer mix. (breeds were recently changed/updated) She was brought to an overcrowded, New Jersey shelter as a stray and Rescue Ridge stepped up to save her. Belle is affectionate, playful, loves to snuggle, and is housebroken. Belle has played with several other dogs and has walked well with them, too. She lived with a small dog and with a young child. She likes most dogs and we would need to see if your dog is a good match. Belle has helped some of the dogs at the rescue adjust to kennel life, including the timid ones. She is a loving, beautiful soul who has been dealt a rough deck and wants a person or family to love her forever. She takes toys, treats, and food gently and is very sweet. Belle walks nicely on a harness and weighs about 60 lbs. Belle would do best in an adult home or one with older children. She would also love a fenced in yard. Come see Belle and apply to adopt her at RescueRidge.com and then you can also text us at 732- 546- 8805 to meet Belle. Here is her latest video playing with Noodle: https://youtu.be/XWfzFhlheZM Here is Belle's recent video: https://youtu.be/gSTyDfb9aJQ Here is another of Belle's recent videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=loD6STkL7I4&feature=youtu.be Please watch Belle blossom in her previous video (breeds were changed recently) link https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9SKKTo1OlSEAnd, here is Belle's previous video link:https://youtu.be/BRm_g7cMVvs
name: Belle

description: Bella is sweet as pie and is ready to go exploring with a very active household. If you're looking to get in shape, then let this energetic young lady be your fitness coach. Bella was given to the shelter because the landlord wouldn't allow her, so she is now looking for a permanent family that won't let her slip through their fingers. At 3 years old, Bella still has so much life to live and love to give. Unfortunately, she doesn't present well in her kennel so potential adopters seem to be turning a blind eye to her. We guarantee she will melt your heart the instant she steps foot outside of those kennel walls. She's dying to come out and meet you so don't let a little barking get in the way of finding your one true love.
name: Bella

description: !!! Available for Adoption* & to Love Local Partners with ACCT Philly !!! *with behavior waiver Hi, Im Jamie (A40088385) and Im ready for an adventure buddy! I feel like Im at my best when Ive had a run in, and my volunteer friends think Id be a great trail runner since I like running in leaves and grass. Im so looking forward to my next adventure that I may have pretended I was part kangaroo and tried jump the fence in the play yard here (shh!), which means Ill need a patient family who doesnt just leave me by myself in their yard. Since I was found as a stray, the people here think Im around 2-3 years old and said I weigh 57 pounds. If youre an active person looking for an active buddy, please come to meet me - Jamie! xoxo Photos: https://flic.kr/s/aHsmxouzNF Jaime and Dick Greyson: https://youtu.be/diX4CyNxDUM P Baby, Jaime and Dick Greyson: https://youtu.be/eX81hMun-9I Jamie - A40088385 Intake Type: Stray Weight: 57lbs Behavior Observation: Dog has slip in cage that says "no runs - dog will jump fence." This animal is currently available through ACCT Phillys Adoptions Programs. We encourage you to visit our shelter during our adoption hours to view our complete selection of available animals. In preparation for you visit, please make sure to visit http://www.acctphilly.org/adopt/ to review our adoption requirements, hours of operation, upcoming events, and more! Is this your missing pet? If you believe so, please make sure to follow the instructions listed at http://www.acctphilly.org/lostpet/ so that we can make sure that you are reunited as soon as possible!
name: Jamie

description: Hi there, my name is Pete!  My foster mom calls me Sweet Pete.  I had a rough life before I came to Cold Nose Warm Heart.  I was found with an imbedded collar.  I needed a few surgeries to fix me up.  So as you can bet, I can be a little shy around new people.  My foster mom says I have come a long way in the 2 weeks that I have been with her.  I love to sleep on the couch or in my dog bed.  I love toys!  I didnât even know what they were before but now I think they are great fun.  I make a silly toothy grin when I get excited that will make you smile.  Iâm a very affectionate guy once I get to know you.  I get along with my canine foster brothers too!  I will react to new dogs when Iâm crated so I donât always show my best side when I go to events but give me a chance.   Iâm a big puppy â lots to learn.  Iâm working on house training and I almost got it!  I love my crate too.   Iâm about 2 years old and around 40 pounds.  Nobody knows what my breed mix is.  Spend a few minutes with me and Iâm pretty sure youâll fall in love.
name: Pete

description:
Jackie Davis Lonestar is a very beautiful, sweet-natured girl. She loves other dogs and is great with cats as well. She is a gentle soul who was rescued from euthanasia at an East Texas shelter shortly before her puppies were born. She was a great momma, and all of her "Veggie Garden" babies have been adopted. Jackie enjoys being indoors and outdoors. She loves to run and play outside with her doggie friends. Jackie had a significant hip injury when she was rescued (probably from being hit by a car), and she required an expensive hip surgery. It hasn't slowed her down at all--she still enjoys playing with other dogs and going for walks. She can be trusted to stay out in the house when her foster mom isn't home. She is house trained, and she is crate trained (although she really doesn't need one). Jackie is a special young dog hoping for a wonderful family to share her life with. Her foster mom describes her as "a treasure wrapped in fur"! Jackie will be ready for adoption in January 2019!

Apply to adopt JACKIE DAVIS LONESTAR at EHDOGS.ORG!
name: Jackie Davis Lonestar

description:
Norman was brought into the shelter as a stray and has quickly made his presence known through his happy personality.  He loves running in the yard and chasing toys, although he hasn't quite gotten the idea of returning them!

While on a walk, Norman surveys his surroundings with great interest and is learning good leash manners.  He already will sit when asked and performs several tricks for treats.

Norman needs a family that will give him some "tender loving care" and continue his training.
name: Norman

You could not ask for a more gentle, easy going, affectionate, housebroken, crate trained angel. Now, all she needs is for us to find her a loving, forever home. description:
Welcome to some real sweeties Praline came to us from Puerto Rico with her siblings Toffee and Carmel.

This little family was born on the streets near San Jaun. Their mother is an uncatchable stray who keeps having litters and evading capture! Fundacion AMAR wil continue to try to get her in.  Until then they keep capturing the pups they can and getting them fixed and into homes to end the cycling! Praline's 6 months old and a little on the shy side but with time and patience she's been slowly coming out of her shell. She wants to be friendly and playful but the move shook her up a bit.  Who can blame her? She's good with everyone and is great with other dogs. Doesn't pay to much attention to our cats. She's super sweet and just wants a place to call home. Will you be the one to open your heart and home to this little lady?


Our adoption process is so simple! We do a meet and if you initially like the pet we take a $100 trial fee and start an in- home trial! (nonrefundable but does trasnsfer to other pets if trial is unsuccessful and you'd like to try another) During home trial you will live with your pet and get to know them in the real world for a true window into what life with them will be like. If it's a perfect fit then we finalize!! We sign the contract and deposit the remaining $400 adoption fee balance. Your fee includes alter surgery, microchip with lifetime registration, and up to date Distemper and Rabies vaccinations. Deworming and fecal exam. This also covers the transport from the
Mid South, South, Puerto Rico, or any shelter or location to our facility, as well as any care we provided from intake till adoption!Â 
Please note out of state/ long distance adoptions require a 50% trial fee. In the case of multiple applicants for the same pet, or to pick from litters, first deposit down from qualified approved applicant gets first trial/pick.
name: Praline

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Bowie comes to rescue with his mom and 4 siblings. Bowie is 2 months old and 5 pounds, a Pit Bull Terrier mix. Bowie is currently with our veterinary partner being treated for a slight case of hydrocephalus. He is a small boy full of pep and life, energetic, happy to see you, and all around sweet. Bowie is up to date on shots (age appropriate) and will be altered when medically appropriate to do so and prior to placement in his forever home. He is great with people of all ages and with other dogs. If you would like to adopt Bowie, please put your application in here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Bowie

description: Delightful Diamond is a pretty girl who will be on your mind all the time once you meet her! This gorgeous approximately 1 year old Australian Cattle and Catahoula mix has a personality that shines as bright as her name! Diamond has a wealth of energy,and is looking for a home that can provide her need of constant play time and mental stimulation! Diamond would be the ideal candidate for hiking,running,swimming,you name it! Diamond can get a bit overstimulated with other dogs,so a dog with her same vibe,and a meet in greet,would be an absolute requirement! Meet Diamond today,and you'll go from rags to riches!
name: Diamond

description:
Capone was rescued from a backyard with his "sister" Ginger by rescuer Christine D back in June of 2012. They were left with no food and water in the scorching heat of the summer. They were so hot that they dug into the dirt to just get cooled off. Ginger has been adopted and now it is Capone's turn. Capone is about 5 years old now. He has a lot of energy, loves to play and go for walks. He would do best with someone athletic because he needs exercise and is very strong. Capone would make a great running partner because despite his size, he can really move! He is a big softy who loves to be pet behind his silly floppy ears. Capone is to be the only pet but you will want to spoil this cute meatball all day long. Capone will need training which will provide a stable environment for him and for you. He is always smiling and such a little porker. Please give him a chance.

Email harescue1@aol.com for an application.

The application can be found at http://fs30.formsite.com/HAARescue/AdoptionApplication/index.html
name: Capone

Playing, getting belly rubs and entertaining my human friends with my silly antics are some of my favorite things. Oh and walks and treats aren't bad either! I am housebroken, crate trained and have lived with little children before (i am GREAT with them!) . I can get pretty over excited when I see other dogs when I'm out on a walk but with a slow intro I am playful and friendly.  

Please email my rescue today for more information at SaramaRescue@gmail.com

description: Iâm sure you clicked on my picture because Iâm so cuteâ¦well let me tell you about myself.  You know how some dogs will do anything for a treat?  Well, Iâll do anything to snuggle with my friends.  Some of my favorite things to do are cuddle, go for walks and take a nice car ride and then cuddle some more. And, Iâm a cheap date!  Take me out for a stroll around the neighborhood and then letâs hang out, have some frozen yogurt and watch the world go by.  I have a lot of friends at the shelter who are helping me overcome my shyness with new people. I would absolutely love to go to a home where I can be the only pet and enjoy all of your attention.  One of my special buddies at the shelter would love to introduce me to you.  If you email csskalky@gmail.com my buddy will get back to you right away â or you can come right in to the shelter and ask one of the great adoptions counselors for a meet.

Say hello to Waldo!

He is a 2 year old Chihuahua/Terrier mix who was surrendered to us by his owners due to unforeseen personal problems.Â  This boy is now looking for a new home and someone to love him forever...

Waldo just loves a good walk with a special friend!Â  This wired-haired lover boy enjoys the company of other dogs.Â  He's also a lover of people, especially those who give him lots of attention!

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Pirate is a Pit/Pointer mix who came into rescue from Texas. Pirate was a victim of neglect at the hands of humans - left outside alone and forgotten. But all of that has changed and he is now doing wonderfully in his northern foster home! If you are looking for your new best friend than look no further! Pirate is the sweetest boy. Born in early 2017 and now weighing 40 pounds, he is ready to be your faithful best friend. Although Pirate suffered at the hands of his first "owners" he holds absolutely no grudges. He loves everyone he meets and greets them all equally with kisses and a wagging tail. Pirate enjoys playing outside and would do best with a fenced in yard. He is great with other dogs and kids. He is so easy going and happy, and his silly personality is contagious! Pirate would make a great addition to any home. Pirate is neutered and up to date on vaccines. If you would like to make Pirate the newest member of your family please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

description:
All Saved Me dogs and cats receive a wellness exam at our veterinarian and age-appropriate core vaccines. They are spayed or neutered before they go to their adoptive families.  Dogs over 7 months are tested for heartworm and all cats are tested for FeLV and FIV.

All animals are microchipped and are eligible for a complimentary 30-day pet health insurance policy from Shelter Care if you provide an e-mail address when you complete the adoption. 

We will ask you for a veterinary reference or three personal references,  proof that you are allowed to have pets where you live (lease or lease addendum or proof of home ownership),  and valid identification.  

Adoption fees are as follows: 
Puppies under seven months - $450.00
Dogs - $350.00
Senior dogs (8 years and over) - $225.00
Cats and Kittens - $75.00. 

You do not need an appointment to visit with our adoptable pets, but please call ahead or visit our automatically-updated website to confirm that the pet you want to meet is still available. 
215-240-1240
savedme.org/adopt
name: Ernest

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet Wella! Wella is a 1.5 year old Lab/Golden Retriever mix who weighs 50 pounds. She comes into Rescue from Texas. Wella is such a gorgeous girl who has been down on her luck for too long. Wella would love to have a home to call her own where she never has to worry about suffering through any type of neglect ever again. She is in true Golden fashion a very sweet girl who is wonderful with people of all ages and other dogs. She will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in her forever home. If you would like to be the lucky family that gets to give Wella her happy ever after, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application 1/28/18 8:45 AM

If you are interested in adopting Louie, please fill out an adoption application at EHRDOGS.ORG, and don't forget to mention his name, LOUIE BARNWELL!

description: ***GRADE 6 OF 6 HEART MURMUR*** Fletcher is a 10 year old male spaniel mix. He was found by a nice police officer who found him wandering on his own and his owners were never found. Fletcher was covered in so many fleas, had some hair loss from them, and he was so itchy and uncomfortable. We quickly got Fletcher all bathed, settled him in with a warm bed and now he is enjoying regular meals and love. Fletcher has tested well with other dogs and he is a very quiet boy who keeps to himself. He would love a home where he can be spoiled and loved for however many years he has. If you are interested in adopting, please submit an adoption application on our website www.justice-rescue.com
name: Fletcher

description:
Meet Kiki!

Kiki is about 8-10 months old, approx 37-39 pounds and she is beautiful! She has a short white coat with brown through out and those eye!!  One is blue and one is brown!  Her photos do not show how beautiful she is!

Kiki was rescued from an over-populated shelter in NC and she is now enjoying a foster home in NJ.  Her foster mom saysâ¦.âKiki is a very sweet pup!  She is affectionate and lovable.  Kiki likes following us around, sitting in our lap and she will even sit on top of us (see photo)!! haha!  Kiki loves, love, loves chasing balls and play with toys and she will go to the toy basket and take all her toys out. Itâs so cute!  Kiki already knows the commands "sit", "no" and "stay".  She sleeps through the night without having accidents and she is house trained.  Kiki is good with people, kids and other dogs.  And, she will give you puppy kisses and stay right next to you until you stop petting her. Kiki is curious and sweet and she has a tail that does not stop wagging!"

We are sure when you meet KiKi she will steal your heart!

If you have a furever home for this pet, please e-mail Furever Home Dog Rescue at FureverHomeDogRescue@gmail.com and request an adoption application. 

Please note we do not adopt puppies/dogs to homes where they will be alone all day. 

The breed and age of this pet is listed as is our best guess.  We have no background info on who the mom and dad are.

We do not have a shelter facility you can visit.  Our volunteers foster the dogs and pups in their homes once they have been vetted and transported here to NJ.

Please read our homepage www.fhdr.petfinder.com to read how the adoption process works. And, please visit Furever Home Dog Rescue's homepage www.FureverHomeDogRescue.com to see some of our many reviews.  Thank you!
name: KiKi-Adopted

description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.This stunning boy is Pete. Pete is a 2 year old Lab mix who comes into rescue from Texas. He found himself alone, scared, and in terrible shape at a high kill shelter. This poor boy had a bad case of mange, was missing an eye, and was so weak and emaciated. We absolutely had to give Pete a chance so we pulled him to safety and he has been recovering with our vet partner. Heâs had eye removal surgery, has been treated for his skin condition and has put on some good weight even though he could use some more. He has made an amazing transformation in just a few weeks and now this miraculous survivor is ready to experience the good life! Pete has suffered too much for too long and we canât wait to see him snuggled up in the arms of the person that can finally smother him with the unconditional love and happiness that he deserves! He is a very special boy and is going to make an amazing addition to any family. Pete is sweet and friendly with people of all ages and other dogs. He will be neutered and up to date on vaccines prior to placement in his forever home. If you would like to make Pete the newest member of your family and love of your life, please fill out an adoption application for him here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org
name: Pete

description:
NYS Registered Rescue # RR102
NGPR dogs are in foster homes throughout the U.S., NOT Beacon, NY.  View full listing, fee and online application at - www.nationalpyr.org/rescue-dogs (sorry, no phone submissions, but if you would like more information you can call 877-739-3582 or email us at renpyrgroup@yahoo.com).

Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed.
NGPR does not adopt dogs to homes with children under 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Female Great Pyrenees rarely cohabitate with other females successfully.  Our goal is for each adoption to be a permanent placement, therefore homes that already have a female dog are not eligible to adopt a female Pyr.

Clara is a beautiful, young, female Pyr/Akbash mix that likes to be busy ALL the time :) She would love to have kids to chase and play with (preferably bigger kids) or someone to run with. Clara also loves walks, car rides and toys...LOTS of toys! She is doing very well with her leash training - although anxious to get started, she begins with a very fast walk but will ease up when told (she knows the word 'no'). Clara loves to enthusiastically greet people so her foster has been working with her to not jump and she has greatly improved. Clara is a very smart girl that learns very quickly...she can open storm doors and will be happy to let herself out :) She goes and comes through the doggie door and goes to bed at night when told "it is bedtime". Clara does well with other dogs when properly/slowly introduced (she does not like a dog to come running toward her as she will get defensive). She can be protective of her treats with other dogs, so they are best to be given separately. Clara does well in the house, but if she can't go in and out on her own, she is happy if she can at least see outside, and have toys to play with. This sweet girl seeks approval and love from her people, and will give lots of love back in return!
name: Clara

description:
Meet Gilly!! This sweet 2 year old mama dog is a trim 45lbs and has such a striking look! She and her two puppies (Arya and Nettie) came up from Louisiana to find new homes. We're still getting to know Gilly, but so far she is very friendly with people and is definitely food motivated. She has tested positive for heartworm, and will be receiving treatment with us.

If you're interested in adopting her, please fill out an application with One Love Animal Rescue and someone will get in touch with you shortly. Thank you for choosing to adopt!To be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.
name: Gilly

breeds: Labrador Retriever, Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler
description:
Champie is awesome! While a little reserved and timid upon first meeting folks, he warms up quickly and is your best friend for life! He is 2 years old and 50 lbs and while he looks like a Shepard mix, the trainer who took him in and has worked with him for the past 5 months, saw his parents to be the Lab and Heeler. He is professionally trained and was not socialized and knew nothing, when he got to the trainers home several months ago. He is now more social and so well trained and LOVES other dogs and cats. He can be nervous in new situations, but again, warms up so very quickly. He is amazing and will make a great family dog. He loves kids. You cannot go wrong with Champie - he is so handsome in person and just wonderful.  (If you do not hear back from us within about 6 hours, send us your phone number, for there might be something wrong with your email!) 
Lovable Mutts Adoption Center is a private, in home, all breed rescue/adoption facility, specializing in all ages and sizes of dogs.  We exist only on the kindness of your donations and adoptions!  We pride ourselves on being an HOLISTIC center and feed only holistic grain free foods and give daily, various, vitamins and supplements to all of our dogs. 

Our dogs are well socialized, very friendly, well mannered, affectionate, and in wonderful health. While some might be timid or shy, we work with our adopters in any way we can, to help them to work with their new family member. We give training tips and behavioral tips and even board for a very reasonable fee. Our dogs are extremely well cared for - most even know how to use a dog door by the time they leave us, know basic commands, and are crate trained!  We stand by our pups/dogs, and give 10 days for a refund and almost always take our dogs back at any age of their lives (can sometimes depend on the dog)! 

Lovable Mutts Adoption Center has an application screening process.  All applicants are asked to provide vet references, personal references, and a home visit.  We pride ourselves in matching up the right dog with the right home.  Sometimes this happens quickly and sometimes it might take awhile.  We hope you understand and are willing to wait for the perfect pup for your situation. We reserve the right to turn applicants down and to change our mind about a suitable match, for we are only concerned about what is best for our dogs.  Also note that we arrange our visiting hours around your schedule, as this is a private, in home facility.  We respond to all inquiries promptly, so if you have any trouble sending us an email, or have not heard back from us within 24 hours, please, CONTACT US AGAIN and check your spam!  (We all know how emails can be at times!)

Our dogs are spayed or neutered (if old enough), up to date on vaccines, wormed, heartworm tested, and free of fleas and ticks.  We temperament test our  dogs and they are all suitable for many family situations. Our dogs are well mannered,  and are in our family/home situation at this time (not kept in kennels or crates), and are worked with daily.  All of our dogs do well with other dogs and many do well with cats, and we can cat test. Adoption donations vary with age, breed, vetting, and training of the dog, and range from $250 to $500. This donation helps to pay for shots, de-wormings, spays, neuters, flea protection, heartworm/Lyme testing, treatments, and other vetting/issues that might be needed, for dogs in our care.  (We do not tend to place puppies or small dogs with kids under 6 and reserve the right to match who WE feel would be the best homes for our dogs.)  
Please, come adopt one of our Lovable Mutts - you will be so glad you did!

(IF YOU DO NOT GET A REPLY EMAIL WITHIN 24 HOURS, CHECK YOUR SPAM BOX - WE REPLY EVERY FEW HOURS TO EMAILS)
name: Champie (Fully Trained/Very Gentle)

breeds: Chesapeake Bay Retriever, American Staffordshire Terrier
description:
Wonka came to the shelter as a stray a year ago. He was scared, skinny, and neglected. His Chesapeake retriever red coat now shines and he is a healthy 60 pounds.

 Wonka is a favorite of all who care for him because he is so affectionate and eager to learn new things. He has learned to walk nicely on the leash and play politely in the yard. He relaxes easily in a crate which facilitates the transition from shelter life to a home. When visiting the home of volunteers, he is calm, good with the children, very well mannered and appears to be house trained.  He is an excellent passenger in the car and falls asleep (big snores!!) almost immediately at the start of any excursion.

He would do well in an adult household or one with older kids. He enjoys the company of other dogs in playgroups at the shelter, but would probably do best as an only pet at the outset when transitioning from the shelter to a home.
name: Wonka
